text: Innovative types of donuts but a bit priceyy (~3 per donut) Moreover, I think they make a lot of donuts ahead of time to meet demand but I'm partial to warm donuts and I couldn't get one of those here..
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
I was only in town for three days, and everyone was like "YOU HAVE TO GET VOODOO DOUGHNUT". Well, apparently everyone else's friends told them the same thing because the first time I went, the line was literally two blocks long. I would have felt like such a fat kid if I waited in a two-block line for a doughnut.

So then I tried to go after the bars, as I had heard Voodoo is 24 hours. It was closed. The universe did not want me to have these legendary doughnuts.

As I was leaving town I finally got one, but the selection was so overwhelming that I freaked out and just picked the first one that spun past me on that little rotating doughnut display, a Tang doughnut. It was unique, a little dry, nothing particularly special, but I'm glad I got to experience it, and wish I could go back to give it another try. I think it really does all just depend on what you get, so next time I'd spring for a dozen to sample a few more.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: I'm not a huge doughnut fan but this place made me want to believe again that there are better doughnuts in the world... everything I tasted was wonderful... if you ever in Portland Oregon check this place out... the lines do not lie.. it's worth the wait!!
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: Overcrowded with tourists, doughnuts will be stale around 7pm... definitely a niche "Portland" Spot... doughnuts themselves are over sugared and mediocre at best
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch

text: Saw it on the food channel and was super excited to get a chance to stop by. Pricey by very good. I got a maple bacon and a pepto bismol.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: Voodoo is one of those infamous places where everyone in line is probably from out of town and the food is expensive but you'll probably go for the experience of it all. I gotta give credit to this chain for their creativity and weirdness. From the minute you walk by the pink brick wall, you can't help but gravitate towards the lineup to see what all the fuss is about with these pink boxes. I ended up trying the voodoo doll and the dirty old bastard. Both were mediocre at best but IMO worth the experience. 3 stars for keeping things weird.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: Excited to try two huge boxes of a variety.  Waited in line, spent a lot of money.  I'm just a classics woman; not a fan of weird, soggy cereals and icings, but had to try the experience.  The grape one was particularly bad, and for our crowd, lots of "bites" taken but nobody felt it an OMG experience.  I guess the mistake is not eating these drunk, high, and late at night.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: I made the obligatory and highly-anticipated stop at Voodoo (twice!) during my trip to Portland.  I got to sample quite a few varieties and thoroughly enjoyed all of them!  I'm a donut snob so I take this very seriously.  The line was fairly long on a Saturday afternoon but was much more manageable on a weekday morning, but my one-star deduction is simply because of the line.  It's fun to stand there with all of these other random people who are there for donuts just like you are, but if you really want one now, it can be a problem since you may have to wait for a while.  On the bright side, they're open 24/7, and since I continually rant that most of the donut shops in Denver close before dinner, this pleased me greatly.  Be aware that they are cash only, though there is an ATM inside the store.  The place itself is a riot, with all sorts of goofy posters and trinkets all over the tiny store.  But nobody should care that much about the setting; we all know why we're here.  The Portland cream is the "official donut" of the city and it was probably the best custard-filled donut I've had.  The voodoo donut was creative and also tasty, though I'm not much for raspberry filling.  I skipped the maple bacon bar, though they are very popular.  My favorite was the raised donut with chocolate icing and Oreo bits, drizzled with peanut butter.  There's about a ten-way tie after that, since I liked every one I tried.  Mmm... I can't wait to go back and visit again!
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
During my day trip in Portland, I knew that one necessity destination for me was going to have to be Voodoo Doughtnut.  Thankfully I chose a Monday afternoon to see the Beavers and do my touristy crap; when I got to Voodoo, there was less than a five minute wait for me.  Unfortunately, they happened to be out of Voodoo dolls, by that time of the day, so I "settled" for a Maple-Bacon doughnut.

Now I'm not a religious person, by any stretch of the imagination, but I'm pretty sure that I saw no less than four different religious deities after I was finished the Maple-Bacon.  Despite the fact that the Beavers are done after 2010, it's almost worth another trip to Portland for another Voodoo Doughnut.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: It's better than Kripsy Kreme but it's still doughnuts. This turned out to be a hipster place. Long line for doughnuts shows us that Oregon has health issues
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: Sorry VooDoo.  You have fallen prey to the tourists and Food Network/Travel Network fans.  You just are not worth the wait anymore.  I shall miss the Maple Bacon Bar, the Marshall Mathers, the Ol' Dirty Bastard, and Triple Chocolate Penetration.  Oh, how I have longed for some Triple Chocolate Penetration with a Maple Bacon happy ending.  Sorry VooDoo, the lines have reduced you to doo-doo.  I have no problem hopping down the block for a sweet/salty fix during the day now.  Rest in peace.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: Maple bacon bar was delicious. Bacon was cooked perfect for putting on the doughnut. Not too crunchy or chewy. The maple frosting was awesome. The doughnut itself was good as well. Also had the Portland cream doughnut and it was good. The chocolate frosting and cream filling were both good as was the doughnut.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: Not remotely worth waiting in line for an hour and a half. Go to the blue star donuts instead. Or go to Safeway or something, Nobody needs a donut in the shape of a cock. 2 stars
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch

text:
I got married here, so my opinion is clearly pretty high.

That said: amazing! delicious! try the mango tango! I've never had a bad Voodoo Doughnut experience.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: I'm not a fan of doughnuts, so this may not qualify. Voodoo's claim to fame are the funky shapes of their doughnuts. Otherwise they taste like any doughnut I've had at dunkins.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: This is more of an iconic tourist experience centered on novelty donuts. If you're looking for a quality, delicious donut, then this is not the place for you. The donuts are average and the lines are long--but the originality is out of this world. If you think of your experience as more like a visit to a donut museum you might enjoy it more.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
Bacon Maple Bar
O. M. Goodgolly. For real. You had me at Bacon Maple Bar.

You can even get married Voodoo Doughnut Style. I hear it's a hoot. As long as there are doughnuts. I would be fine.. I always like the variety of goodness. How I ever walk out of Voodoo is a mystery. I know I've wanted to crawl out a few times. Every doughnut was as good or better than the one I had before. The variety and coolness factor make it a standing tradition in Portlandia.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
Voodoo Doughnut is the essence of Portland, and people here know it. The line is always out the door, and you'll be lucky if it isn't around the whole effing block. Once inside, you'll immediately notice the lively atmosphere, and probably the overwhelming smell of delicious baked treats wafting through a crowd of drooling hipsters.

Voodoo's doughnuts are simply amazing. Their voodoo doll, stuffed with jelly "blood", is a must-have. My favorite is the Ol' Dirty Bastard, a cake doughnut covered in chocolate sauce and topped with crushed Oreos and peanut butter. Mmm, delicious. If you want something light, try the Maple Blazer Blunt, a fluffy doughnut topped with maple glaze and sprinkles.

There are a couple caveats. Stay away from the maple bacon bar. The maple bar itself is good, but the bacon is dry, chewy, and just tastes awful. Everyone seems to like it, but I don't understand why. Maybe the folks at Voodoo accidentally put Beggin' Strips on my doughnut or something? Also, skip the ones with fruity powder like grape or bubble gum or the Arnold Palmer, they just leave a weird taste in your mouth.

If you haven't been to Voodoo, you can hardly call yourself a Portlandian. They're open late, too, so you have no excuses.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
This place is in one of my food bucket list to go to. I've been waiting for a chance to go here, since I lived in California. This doughnut joint pops up in every food shows in TV, so it really has the hype. My girlfriend and I went straight here from the airport; It didn't disappoint and it lives up to its hype. The ambiance is weird and really took up the quote, "Keep Portland Weird" in its back. They have all kinds of decorations in the wall and the most iconic thing I remembered is the art window in front of the store, which is awesome and creative. The servers are friendly and they will literally accommodate you even if the line is long. Our server, Johnny is really helpful and have a great personality towards costumers, so say hello if ever you met him. Anyway..... donuts...

The donuts are extraordinary to say the least. They have the most imaginative donuts that I ever seen. I have a hard time eating my donuts because it is so artistic, that it belongs to a museum or something. My girlfriend and I ordered their classic voodoo donuts; chocolate glazed voodoo figure with raspberry blood in it.. yummmm! My girlfriend likes their double bubble donuts; it literally taste like a bazooka gum. I ordered their famous the diabetically evil Memphis Mafia; based on the taste it is an apple/ banana fritter with chocolate chip and peanut butter icing on the top. Damn it is so good, I would eat this for breakfast everyday in a week. They sell merchandises, too such as a t- shirt and a sweat

48 hours later.... We came back  here before going to the airport because we want to buy our family and friends these donuts. One of my close friend asked me if I can bring him a Chuckles donuts and a Pothole donuts. Of course, I ordered those to myself, too and wow that's why he is my friend because he has good taste. My girlfriend and I ordered 4 pink boxes for to go.. at least 6 donuts inside each boxes.. why not :) Overall, I would definitely go here again, no doubt about it! 

PS: They sell one day old bucket of donuts for just $10
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: If you go to PDX, go to Voodoo. Yes, it IS that good. Legendary doughnuts! Crazy mix of fun flavors. Expect to wait in line, but know it will be worth the wait. I don't even like doughnuts but I had 3 the day I went.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
5 stars for the experience. This place has been all over the food channels so we had to make a pit stop to check it out. The line was past the rope and wrapped around the building but we only waited about 30 minutes to get in the door and place our order. 

Get a dozen!! (At least). The donuts are huge but worth it. However, they aren't great the next day. We went a little overboard but couldn't eat it all. The next day the cereal was soggy and the donuts were a little hard. 

$18 bucks for a dozen.. not bad. A few people have told me that the "other" Portland location has a shorter line.

CASH ONLY.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: They were very nice and friendly. Atmosphere was so nice and welcoming. They had so many doughnuts to choose from it was overwhelming because they all look so great. Doughnuts were awesome!! I will be back to taste the other options I want.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: We came here to see what all the hype was about. Long line for pricey donuts? I don't have much of a sweet tooth, but after biting into the maple bacon bar, I was immediately in a voodoo trance. Such a great combination of flavors! I wish I could have brought some back to LA, but the place was closed on New Years day.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: Been here many times and this was no different. More a novelty than anything else. A stop on the Portland tour bucket list.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
Waited in line for 45 minutes during my brief trip to Portland while returning from a road trip. Honestly it wasn't worth it. To be fair, I don't have much of a sweet tooth but I still like the donuts at top pot in Seattle a lot more. 
The plain glazed was by far my favorite of the custom dozen that we picked. The portland cream was excellent as well albeit way too sweet for my taste. My wife really enjoyed it though. Some of the other flavors that were pretty good were the lemon powder and the voodo doll. All the others that we tried were just ok.
I'd recommend going here once just for the novelty experience but definitely not worth the wait twice.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: Tourist trap.  Some interesting and creative combinations, but the quality of the donut itself - average.  Have had much better donuts in places not trying to get fancy.  Def not worth a wait for more than 5 minutes.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: I don't care much for their doughnuts, but they have superb fritters!  Try the peanut butter banana one if you get a chance!  Cock N Balls is also a fun one if you prefer a doughnut.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: Very cool place but definitely overhyped. I'm pretty sure everyone has heard of Voodoo doughnuts and I was very excited to try it when visiting Portland. A group of us got there early on a Friday morning and didn't need to wait in line at all which is apparently unheard of! We got a box of a few different flavors so we could all try them. The assortment included the Captain Crunch, Chocolate Coco Puff donut, Maple Bacon, and a classic old fashion. While the donuts looked pretty and colorful, I didn't particularly think the flavor was all that amazing. They were SUPER sugary and sweet and it was hard to compare to Blue Star Donut which had fresher tasting ingredients. I definitely think it's worth going once for the experience but I don't feel the need to go again.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
Why go here if you really love good donuts when Portland has Blue Star? 
The line of tourists waiting to get in is a real deterrent, but the poor quality of the donuts is even more important a reason to avoid the place.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
I like the place, a friend of mine said it just donuts save time and skip it but I disagree. 

They make donuts a over the top event that is part entertainment, part excess & the comes with the allure of eating something we know we should not be! Captain Crunch on a overly sweet iced deep fried dough is excessive and also pretty freaking good. 

Also from my recollection they were putting Bacon on stuff before it was cool. And yes the Bacon Maple bar is my favorite if you are asking!

I like when it has a line, its kind of fun to wait and chat it up with the others waiting in line as well.

We have a voodoo in Denver but for some reason the doughnuts here in Portland seemed less expensive then when we have bought them in Denver so that's another positive.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
I'm not really a sweets fan but I'll have a donut here and there. My friends and I drove from Seattle to Portland and what better place to go other than the famous voodoo donuts I've heard about on tv.  

I got here around 10 so the line wasn't too long. There were a lot of people hanging around the shop outside. My friends and I got the bacon maple bar, cock and balls, and the Oreo one. 

I think if I were to eat everything I would've been on a sugar craze and get super hyper. I just tried a little bit of everything and frankly, they were just ok. Mind you I don't really like sweets that much 

The cock and balls are hugeeeeee and it just tastes like a regular chocolate glazed donut. The bacon maple bar was good with a mix of sweet and salty. The Oreo one was ok, it was kinda too sweet. 

I wouldn't care to come back since it's not the best donut I've ever had in my life. But at least I can say I've been there !!!

** btw I think it's CASH ONLY
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: What can I say about these amazing doughnuts.....loved the Miami Vice.  Interesting place with very clever names!  The doughnut world was boring and needed a change...this is it!!
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: Awesome place! The line was out the door (as usual), but the wait wasn't too bad. The doughnuts were def worth it! Though bring a friend or two since these doughnuts are pretty big and sugary.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
So hmmm I love the doughnuts and everything about this place except the wait! 
I will have to say the wait wasn't that bad. It is a great place to people watch!! 
Cash only, they have an ATM inside (it was down when we were there).
They have crazy flavors, some way to crazy for me to even think of trying. 
My favorites are Memphis mafia and the peach fritter! So good and worth the wait!! 
Their maple bar is not my favorite even with the added bacon (shocking I know right)!! 
It's worth the wait once to go and be a tourist but not an everyday doughnut fix!
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: Soooo Amazing !!! There was a line but it moved fast.  All the doughnuts I bought were soft and delish!!
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: Definitely something to try if you are in the Portland area. Unique donut options that taste delicious.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
These donuts are not really worth it, but at least somewhat for the photos. I was semi-nauseous all day after eating just the one "Ball" from the "Cock and Balls." This is basically a Bavarian Creme (Boston? I never get it right... but this one has the custard inside not the white creme) donut BLOWN up to the proportions of the size of my upper body and shaped into a penis and testicles. Probably not consistent from donut to donut, but I had to push through layers of dough with my fingers to see where the hidden treasure of custard was. At least the woman customized it for us and wrote a personalized message all over the front of that thing and then doused it in sprinkles. 

We also had the zombie donut (jelly and chocolate icing) and an oreo-peanut-butter one. All overly sweet and NOT the way to start your day, unless you're into self-torture. Then again, its the experience. The line, the ambiance, the over-the-topness. Despite all the excitement, remember to get some strong Stumptown coffee to wash it all down.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
Voodoo Doughnut is the Hot Topic of doughnuts. Takes itself way too seriously for a place that looks like an 8-year-old was let loose in the back to put all of his favorite cereals, candies and Tonka trucks on everything in sight.

Yeah - they put about every cereal imaginable (aside from anything by Kashi, but don't tempt them...) on their doughnuts. Crazy, right? There's also a litany of other totally wacky creations involving things like Dubble Bubble, Tang mix, and M&Ms. The kitsch MIGHT be charming if they didn't act as if James Joyce wrote "Ulysses" right there next to the case of Cock-N-Balls doughnuts. 

But aside from that, the doughnuts themselves are just average. That should be obvious by the fact that they feel the need to mask their often dry/stale doughnuts with Halloween candy. 

I feel absolutely no need to return and discover that they've started adorning their goods with game pieces from the family of Milton Bradley board games.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: Interesting place.  There were Cocoa Puffs on my doughnut. Pretty tasty. It's a good local flavor spot.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: Great selection of all types of doughnuts. They taste amazing but the line to the store is really long. We were waiting in line for a little bit over an hour. But if you aren't afraid of the waiting time then you will be able to get some great doughnuts.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
Let me start out by saying... Try the signature VooDoo doughnut. It was worth the experience.

I stopped by for a bag. This is an interesting place. It's in a rough area that was reminiscent of downtown LA- urine on the sidewalks, drunk/stoned hippies selling lemonade on a box with black marker scrawl across it that said, "Lemonade Stand," people pandering for change, and very high parking costs. 

If you can get past that, and find your way into the line, you will be waiting a while. But you can people watch (which is quite a show there), and listen to a DJ that is entertaining. Thus, I didn't mind the wait.

There is no inside eating, but they have tables outside with a security guy that is also the DJ. With all the hype and wait, I thought that I would be in heaven taking the first bite, but... The doughnuts were ok. However, their signature voodoo doughnut was pretty dang good. I'd be tempted to even replace the word dang with an expletive.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: Hip place to wait in line for hip donuts.  The donuts may be overly sweet but they are soooo cute.  Funny how the pretzel stick sticking the Voodoo doll donut looks more like a third leg than a needle.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: Almost all gimmick, very little substance. The donuts are fine at best, stale-ish at  worst. You probably will never hate anything you order, but you'll probably wish you had spent the calories elsewhere. The hours are pretty fantastic though, in a town where even the sidewalks shut down at 5 pm.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: What can I say that hasn't already been said??  This place is great... get ready to stand in line, atmosphere is super fun.   You can order one.... but be prepared to want a second, so you might as well just order 2 right off the bat!
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
First time to visit Voodoo Doughnuts.   The line was out the door so we know it had to be good.  People were waiting in the rain but nobody seemed to mind.

It was a bit overwhelming when you get in.  

Due to the line we felt we needed to order quickly and now wish we had slowed down and purchased some of the special donuts they made.  It was fun and if you are in Portland you need to check it out.

Well worth the time.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
Visiting this doughnut shop is super fun. The experience alone is worth it. I love the decorations and the atmosphere, it's energizing!

Their doughnuts are fluffy and delicious, made especially for people that like them sweet. My kids think these are the best doughnuts in the universe because they come topped with awesome things like fruit loops and oreos. They are seriously yummy. 

Personally crullers are my favorite type of doughnut and there are other shops that I like better for those which is the only reason I gave them 4 stars instead of 5. I've heard that the blueberry doughnuts are the best thing on the menu so I may change my opinion once I try those!
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: I was in Portland about a month ago for work and all my co-workers kept telling me about this place and how I had to go here if I was going to be in Portland.  Let me tell you they were not wrong.  I was in Portland for two nights and I went here 3 times (don't tell my wife).  I had the original Voodoo Doll first.  Of course had to go with the classic.  It did not disappoint.  Very well decorated with raspberry jelly on the inside and a little pretzel stake through it.  I also had the ODB and the No Name doughnut.  I must say I think the No Name was my favorite, can't go wrong with chocolate, peanut butter, and rice crispys.  And yes I was a good friend and brought back some for my co-workers and family.  I must say when you get on the plane with that bright pink box everyone becomes your friend.  I mean everyone, I thought the flight attendant was going to offer me a first class upgrade for one of these doughnuts.  Which I would have gladly taken.  Next time I am in Portland I will be going back.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: Waited more than 30 minutes in line, and the donuts were not worth the wait. Lacked flavor, tasted a bit dry, and were not nearly as creative as Blue Star. Would not recommend this spot.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch

text: The original and seems to be getting hated for the hype and fame.  I love 'em but not enough to wait in line more than 5 minutes.  I remember the days when this was only open from 10pm to the early morning through a hole in the wall.  Those were the days....

text:
Obviously a ton of reviews on this sugar dispensary, so will keep this short and quick. 24 hour donut place to satiate drunkards and tourists alike with crazy flavor options.

In the span of the weekend went here twice - one with a line (Friday night), and one without (Saturday late night). Each donut is $2ish and depending on your taste, has options ranging from cereal topped, filled, powdered, and gigantic. I really liked the peanut butter/chocolate donut with the cream filling the best. 

The donuts here are good, but the cake isn't as flavorful as others I've been to. Big props for an efficient line and staying open all the time however.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
Honestly, despite the rave reviews I've received from some friends, Voodoo doesn't make that good of doughnuts. Sure, as a novelty item, it's maybe a fun trip. 
The dough itself is rather dense and not fluffy and airy as a doughnut ought to be. This, coupled with stale toppings (this is what I've experienced personally, not saying it's the status quo) has left me wanting more. 
Finally, the prices are too high for what you get above. My final act of sacrilege is to state that Heavenly Doughnuts on Glisan has better donuts for the dollar; are they fancy? No, and that's the beauty. They don't pretend to be anything they aren't. 
Skip voodoo. There are better places.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: If in Portland you are told to go to Voodoo Donuts. A bit hyped up but you must experience it at least once. Donuts were average. Considering we bought a dozen, they stuffed them in a small box and put one on top of another and then a big with 2 donuts. When we took them back to our rental, the top donuts melted the bottom frosting. The too in the bag also melted as it was a hot day. For the price of each donut, they should have put then single layer in 2 boxes.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: Very good doughnuts! I love how unique they are and how they're a staple for when you go to Portland! No free parking near by, but my dad just parked somewhere and stayed in the car, and we were in and out in 10 minutes.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
Go in the afternoon when the lines have all but died, you can still order some fantastic creations without having to wait almost an hour.

If you don't have cash on hand, fear not! An ATM lies inside.

I'm used to Mighty-O vegan donuts which have a certain amount of hefty weight. The vegan donuts at Voodoo, however, are light and what I expect for (non-vegan) regular donuts. Don't think that the vegan donuts are a healthier alternative: I could feel my tooth enamel eroding as I took a bite of the raised donut with vanilla icing and topped with Fruit Loops.

The interior of the store is a bit on the dingy side, one only need look toward the chandelier to see dust and cobwebs. It would greatly behoove the store if the owners were to close for a day and scrub the place down.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: In the wacky city of Portland, a legendary doughnut shop lies on 22 3rd Avenue. With a line that has people backed up outside the shop, just for a few doughnuts. I will warn you: the pink box holding the doughnuts is well-known, and you may get mugged carrying one walking down the street. Voodoo Doughnuts may very well have the craziest, most exotic doughnut flavors you will ever encounter. I recommend the "Vicious Hibiscus" for a tangy, berry-like sort of taste. Also, the people working there are as sweet and colorful as the doughnuts. Unfortunately, these doughnuts are exclusive to Portland, so you'll have to catch a flight there to get that epic taste.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: Niiiiiiiiiiiiiiice, very nice though long lines because it's soooooo popular.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: I mean, when in Portland you definitely have to stop here. But let's be honest, the donuts themselves are not that great. They taste like your regular donut shop donut, but the different toppings are awesome. My family went on a Monday afternoon and the wait wasn't long at all (prob about 10 min). Cash only so just be prepared!
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
I tried 5 doughnuts and liked only 2 of them. So I guess I'll give this place 2 out of 5 stars.

The maple bacon and plain glazed are the only ones I would recommend. The maple bacon has a great balance of sweet and salty, and the plain glazed had a delicate flavor of a buttered croissant. 

The others I tried were overly sweet. Specifically, the voodoo doughnut was too sweet where there was no jelly, but too tart where jelly was. 

I went at 10pm and there was a line of about 40 people. There were also panhandlers outside the shop, but I'm not going to factor these into the star rating. 

This place is definitely overhyped, but it won't break the bank to try this place if you're very curious.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
Honestly, Voodoo is more of a novelty doughnut store than anything else. Now, before I get attacked by Voodoo enthusiasts, I AM a fan... the humor in the essence of their very existence is right up my alley. However, the quality of the doughnuts is not necessarily worth writing home about. 
The first time I went, I could hardly stand the anticipation of the beloved and infamous maple bacon bar. But sadly, I had to force myself to finish it because it was SO sweet I could hardly even taste the strips of bacon on top.
I would still recommend anyone who hasn't been to check it out, but in my opinion, it is not a place that needs frequent (if any) revisiting.

bad bad bad.

text: I missed out on eating a Prince Themed Doughnut after he passed! I really LOVE Voodoo Doughnuts' Doughnuts! I could eat one everyday! The front counter staff is friendly and knowledgeable. There was even a Photo Booth at the Downtown Voodoo Doughnuts for a while. I wonder if it's still there? Great place to visit, or take family and friends, if you don't mind a wait in a sometimes long line. There are usually PLENTY of different types to choose from when you arrive mid day, as well. And... the Bus and MAX lines are really close by! Yay! Don't forget to get a Milk when you're there. I even purchased a Mug with the Voodoo Donuts' slogan " The Magic is in the Hole! " I use it frequently at my house. It would make a great gift for your closer family members, maybe? I got the Black Mug. There is also a Pink Mug with a " Hole " built into it for a little more money. I look forward to coming back to get more Doughnuts again sooner than later!

text: The only donut I liked was the voodoo man donut... other than that this okay. If it weren't for its Colorful/artistic decors, funny donut names and the location this place is just meh.  Definitely a "do it for the gram" kind of spot
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
You wait in line, excited for donuts while simultaneously freaking out about the fact that the brick wall outside the place is shiny and covered in glitter. You slowly approach and look into the pepto bismal colored place with names on the board such as 'Miami vice'. You try to think about what you might order but are too distracted by the names of the donuts and the cases of spinning donuts inside - can you say visual stimuli?! When you finally enter you're bamboozled by the pink walls, loud punk rock music playing, men with beard nets at the front and the kooky designs everywhere. So when you get to the front you freeze and you shout to the guy with the Beard net that you and your friend just want like a dozen of their most popular donuts. Little did we know a dozen donuts is really like 2 dozen donuts since these are no ordinary donuts but huge mega donuts half the size of your face with cereal and cookie crumbs onto of them! You get the donuts and quickly leave to escape the pink and punk music. We sat outside and both ate one and a half donuts. They were delicious!! However, we didn't prepare for the donut-coma to come next. You eat the donuts then you need like a solid 30 mins before doing anything else cause these things will knock you out and make you feel like a full sleepy baby. We tried really hard to finish the donuts the next few days but had to share them with friends because it was too much. 

Overall, I probs wouldn't be back. It was great to check it out as someone who was visiting Portland for the first time. If you're visiting it seems like it's something you have to check out, just if you do go don't get bamboozled like I did and order a dozen...
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
Good thing I don't live in Portland. I would have to eat these donuts after every night of drinking.

I am a big fan of the rice crispys peanut butter combination...
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
Sorry for being a hater but this place is not worth the hype.... 

We waited in line for about 30 minutes which is fine. I've waited in longer lines for food.... However, when you get inside there's only 3 cashiers and 3 registers... with a line that long why not have someone take orders while the other person rings. Would be much faster... 

On top of that their customer service sucks. The guy we ordered from was too busy singing along with the music to worry about guest service. Also instead of bagging or boxing our doughnuts, brought each one and tossed them on the counter or on top of each other. 

In terms of the doughnuts we ordered 1 bacon. maple bar, 1 old dirty bastard, 1 voodoo man and 1 mango tango. They're nothing special as far as doughnuts go. They taste like regular doughnuts ... maybe a bit sweeter. The voodoo man is only filled half way with the raspberry filling which left a bunch of dough left over. The mango tango was a weird combination of tart and sweet filling. The only thing that's special about their doughnuts is they're shaped nice. They also do not last very long, they start getting stale the next day. 

Not worth it. would rather eat krispy kreme
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
In my opinion...I hate touristy things; Pats vs. Geno's, Modern Pastry or Mikes Pastry, Duckboat tours, Ben and Jerry Ice cream Factories...all of these having one unifying factor...they're actually kinda mediocre, but there's so much hype that not doing it when you're visiting the area that you are unofficially obligated to wait in line for something that's stands against all of my foodie natures.

So...for someone who doesn't eat donuts, I waited in line for 45 minutes at 10am, while harassed by ...not so talented street performers... to get a taste of donuts that do not inspire beyond their unique physical attributes. They tasted, at least to my simple tongue, the same as every dunkin' donut pastry that I've ever had. The only reason why this place didn't get 1 star is that their donuts are fairly cheap and not over priced, which they definitely could get away for. As a result, since Voodoo Doughnut is a Portland special and there are some unique flavors and shapes, it deserves 3 stars for recognition. But I strongly recommend Blue Star donut if you're actually into great tasting doughnuts.

Food: 2 stars
Price: 3 stars
Uniqueness: 3 stars
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
No trip to Portland is complete without a visit to Voodoo Doughnuts. And it's not just because of the doughnuts -- it's the whole "Voodoo" experience.

Don't let the line steer you away from the doughnutty fun. It's a long line, but it keeps moving, so unless you go to Voodoo on a really bad day, you will only have to wait half an hour to an hour or so. 

People-watching helps pass the time spent waiting in line. For instance, a man wearing a kilt and a darth vader mask rode around on his unicycle and played the Star Wars theme on his bagpipes for the folks waiting in line. Definitely entertaining. 

The shop itself is pretty small. Some of the employees are a little testy since they have to deal with tourists day in, day out, so don't get snappy with them.

So admire the glorious revolving doughnut displays instead as well as the quirky merchandise hanging from the walls. That giant doughnut? Go ahead, embrace your inner tourist and take a photo with it. But remember -- figure out what you want to order first because there is a lot to choose from and only so much time before you get to the counter.

We were pretty tame when it came to ordering. We decided to get the Voodoo Doll, the Dirty Snowball, the Bacon Maple Bar and the Grape Ape. It was raining by the time we got out, so we ran over to the nearest cafe to sample the sweets.

These doughnuts are not meant to be the most delicious doughnuts, but they certainly are one-of-a-kind (and still pretty tasty). The Voodoo Doll, for example, is filled with deliciously sinful raspberry jelly. The Bacon Maple Bar was not as fresh as it could have been, but the combination of crispy bacon atop sweet maple frosting was just too good.

My only regret, however, was that I did not do enough research on Voodoo doughnuts. I knew there were a bunch of doughnuts I wanted to try, but I had forgotten the names of them so I didn't get around to eating all of them. :(
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
Any Portland trip must contain the obligatory pilgrimage to Voodoo Doughnuts. Where else will you find wonderful pieces of fried dough bedazzled with every topping that you can possibly imagine?

Did I even mention that it's so cheap? There's nothing stopping you unless you're dating Jenny Craig.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
I will pretty much echo what Kim D. said a few days ago.  

Do I recommend tourists in Portland visit Voodoo?  Yes, but because it is a pretty cool experience, not because the doughnuts themselves are particularly remarkable.  It is worth it for the menu, the signs replete with sexual innuendo, and the rotating display of eclectic treats you get to choose from.  It is even more worth it if you visit at a time when you don't have to wait 30+ minutes to order.  Just by luck, I only had to wait about 5 minutes when I went during a mid-afternoon.

That being said, the doughnuts themselves really aren't that great.  For really, really good doughnuts in Portland, go to Blue Star.  Fewer choices, not quite as eclectic (although they also have a maple and bacon sometimes), but absolutely delicious.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
What we had:

Him: Maple Bacon Doughnut, "Captain my Captain," [Captain Crunch, vanilla frosting,] and I think, "Memphis Mafia," [basically ginormous thing, covered in all manner of chocolate chips, peanut butter, nuts, etc...]

Me: Maple Bacon Doughnut, "Old Dirty Bastard," [chocolate frosting, Oreos, and peanut butter,] and a plain glazed old fashioned cake doughnut.

Plus milks all around. And no we did not eat all of that in one sitting.

Love: 
* The doughnuts, all of mine were genuinely great doughnuts. I don't even like raised doughnuts. 
*The staff, we had a genuinely friendly person help us, asked if we'd been there before, steered us in the right direction, helped us very quickly, but without rushing us.

Not so love:
* There is ALWAYS a line.
* You have to stand outside in the line.
* We felt lucky we had only a 40 minute wait.

So why 3 stars? This is not a place I would spend 40+ minutes waiting for very often. But if you ever think to yourself, I'd like a doughnut in about an hour, and I just feel like standing around for the same amount time. This is a really great place to go! Plus you should try an icon like this at least once.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch

text: The first time I went to Voodoo, I was not impressed. All of our donuts were completely stale! I've decided to go back multiple times and the donuts have never been stale again. I general seem to go at a good hour where the line isn't wrapped around the corner (usually bar hopping at 12 am and need a donut for my drunk belly). My favorite is the Grape Ape. Its got some sweet and sour sugar on it that makes your tongue tingle! Must try! I once saw a girl get a huge bucket of donuts.. not sure how much she payed but seemed like a good deal for a ridiculous amount of donuts. I will go back again, but do prefer Blue Star! They never let me down!
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
Visited Portland last summer and was very excited to try one of the most famous doughnuts in the country...............and it was great ! I loved these doughnuts because they are not greasy ! It is so damn hard to find a nice fluffy, buttery doughnut. I had the Maple Bacon Bar and the Bubble Gun. The icing was nice and thick........and moist! The icing on the doughnuts I have had in the past have had a hard shell of frosting that tastes old. These doughnuts also taste very fresh compared to other places I have been too. I waited in line for at least half an hour at this location and had I known about that, I probably would have visited a different location, like the others in Portland or the one in Eugene while on my way back to California.
Food Quality 0-5:5
A nice fluffy doughnut that isn't greasy what more could you ask for :)
Cleanliness 0-5: ?????
It was to crowded for me to notice the cleanliness, honestly.
Customer Service 0-5: 3
She seemed rushed and I cant blame her, but you don't come here to get a chipper barista either.
I would recommend going to a different location or during a slow hour of the week day.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: Its good. Its not worth standing in line in the rain for hours but I would say, this is a PDX staple, and if you are visiting I can see the nostalgia of checking this place out.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
I was so excited to finally be able to get to Portland and try the donuts. It was well worth it. We went mid morning on a weekday so there was no wait. We had the Portland Cream and No Name. It was great. 

We ended up walking by it again on Saturday and saw the infamous long line. Great donuts but I would not wait that long for any donuts.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
Well damn. Another uber popular place that I was reluctant to try but wound up loving. These were more like the donuts I grew up with than Blue Star, and alot more whimsical. I had the guava coconut and my wife had the voodoo child donut. Both are super sweet, injected with jam. The novelty of all their donuts is impressive and it's hard to make a decision. Don't be fooled...unless you enjoy diabetic coma's, JUST GET ONE! your belly and ass will thank you later. 
there was a very short line at 3pm in the afternoon on a weekday, and it moved fast. The staff were very friendly despite people having plenty of time to choose and then not knowing what to get, or busy taking pictures...I guess their use to their infamy by now. 
Some outside seating, and lots of homeless people milling around asking for spare change. But don't let the hype deter you....I really enjoyed my sugary treat here. 
CASH ONLY!
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
The thing about Voodoo that gets it four stars is not the quality of the doughnuts themselves, but the creativity. I mean, the reality is that a bubble gum flavored frosting on a doughnut is not good no matter the fact that you stick a dubble bubble in the middle.

But, it made for a good box of goodies to bring back from Portland for the coworkers. I had the privilege of making some coworkers very fat and sassy.

So thanks Voodoo!
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: These are hands down the best donuts I've ever had. Sure, the wait was forever, but the donuts were worth it!! They're so light and fluffy and fresh. I wish we had one in Florida
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: OOHHH! Bacon and maple bar!! Fresh and delicious combination!
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
Overrated? Yeah. As a tourist to Portland was it worth the stop? Yeah!

We went in the middle of the day and lucky for us the line wasn't too long. Still we waited nearly 30 minutes until we were able to get out of the rain and order inside. Once inside, it was surprisingly small. A counter with 3 cash registers and 2 spiraling display cases full of all unique creations was basically all there was. There was plenty to look at on the walls. I felt like I was in a doughnut themed Amoeba record store. 

The cashiers are very friendly and surprisingly quite patient considering the line of anxious customers that is likely non-stop throughout their shifts. Prices of the doughnuts are not cheap considering they are doughnuts. The actual taste of the doughnuts was quite tasty and very fresh (almost too fresh because some of the chocolate frosting smeared on most of the other doughnuts) although the uniqueness of the doughnuts are merely cosmetic. Still you'll get a good chuckle out of some of their creations.

All things considered, as a tourist Voodoo Doughnuts was worth the visit. The price and the wait are some of the biggest deterrents to this Portland attraction. 

*Taste ~ 3.5 stars
*Value ~ 2 stars
*Novelty ~ 4 stars
*Customer Service ~ 4 stars
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: This place has a super long wait time. The donut names are clever and crazy, but donuts taste kind of stale.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: Lots of hype to visit Voodoo. What they offer is unquestionably unique! I personally like simple donuts, but I know my friends love their crazy ideas of what a donut can be. Definitely a place to bring friends who are visiting town here!
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: A little more expensive per donut but I believe they were worth it. Me and my friend has a variety of different ones and they were good for the most part. I didn't like the devil food one but that's my personal preference
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
Definitely a creative place and of course I had to check it out since we don't have Voodoo in Cali, but I was a tad disappointed in the actual product's taste and quality.

We waited in line for about 30 minutes.  The girl that helped us was overworked and not overly helpful.

We got a maple donut with creme filing, a fruit loop one, Oreo with peanut butter drizzle and cocoa puff one.  Hands down the maple one was the best, but none of them were the best donut I had ever had which is what I expected from all the hype.

I am glad I went, but I doubt I will ever go back.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: I really enjoyed going here. I took my friends here when they stopped in Portland and they loved it. We got a few gay agenda bars and old dirty bastards. Worth standing in line for.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: One word...overrated! I was looking forward to this place for years and sooooo disappointed. Donuts were not great, not warm and overall just bland. Save your time and effort
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
If you love Doughnuts and haven't been to Voodoo, you are missing out. 

Every single thing on their menu is so good. Cash only, so be prepared.

I love, love, love the Oreo cookies and creme doughnut. 

We always make sure to stop by when we are in town. So good!
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
Yes, it's a tourist trap, but they have the best vegan doughnut options I've come across! The cream doughnuts are stellar.

However, it's extremely intimidating to try to pick from their carousels of doughnuts that do not have names on them. You'll spend a decent amount of time frustrating the cashier as you ask- what's the one with the cookie topping and brown icing (etc)? I highly recommend going on their website first, analyzing what you want and making a list! They don't always have all doughnuts at any given time, but they usually have most options.

My foodie friends were in town and after getting Voodoo, I recommended they try Blue Star as a more gourmet doughnut. Guess which they liked better? Voodoo!
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
I was visiting some friends in Portland, and they said "we are going to get doughnuts, really good dougnnuts" I, of course, agreed. So we parked right in front, and I had seen it on one of those cooking shows! YUMMY! I had the No Name, sugar doughnut, covered in chocolate, peanut butter and rice crispies. I also tried the bacon maple bar, and a cock and balls, (use your imagination). 
Such yummy doughnuts, and I was really sad when our entire box was gone.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: I can see where the hype is about Voodoo Doughnut - their presentation is insane and they have a lot of cool choices. This is definitely a great place to check out. The donut itself tasted pretty underwhelming and the frosting was way too sweet.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
When this place starts getting cleaner, friendlier, and more consistent, I'll update this review.

Stood in line forever for something I could have easily gotten at Tonali's or any of the other Donut shops in PDX.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch

text: VOODOO!!!!! This is one of the must-see places to check out if you are visiting Portland. They have two locations and pretty much it's the experience of visiting the donut shop.  They have different names for all of their different concoctions of donuts. My favorite is the Maple-Bacon Bar! Yes I said it Maple and Bacon. It sounds kinda extreme but the salty and sweet  together is heavenly.  Apparently you can get married at the  place. Info on their website. The donut shop has been featured on the travel channel.  Overall, come here for the experience.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: There is always a line here but it is definitely worth waiting in! My boyfriend and I got half a dozen doughnuts: VooDoo doughnut that was absolutely amazing, Captain my Captain doughnut, Voodoo Bubble Doughnut,and the rapper's delight which are three doughnuts.  They were all amazing! my only regret is that i didn't try the mango one. I can't wait to come back here for more, everyone should definitely try this place at least once. throw your diet ot the window for one day, you won't regret it!
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: This place is a must for anyone new to Portland.  The bacon maple doughnut is my favorite here!  Although very unique, most are very rich (too rich for my taste), but an experience worth venturing.  This place only takes cash, but there is an ATM located inside.  Be prepared for a line due to the popularity of this place!
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: I like Voodoo. The variety is fun. I always go when I'm in Portland. What I have learned is that if you want a fresh doughnut go early, like when they open. I went in the later part of the afternoon and waited for about 20 min in line. When I got inside I felt as if I had to order fast and get out so that the next group of Voolovers could get their fix. I strongly recommend getting milk cause theres alot of doughnut going on.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: Get there early - there was a small line around 10AM - we came back later around 3PM and the line was triple the size.  The short line went really fast.  Not that expensive.  We tried 8 different doughnuts and what I like about these is they have a really good assortment and they actually taste great.  What I find interesting is many of the doughnuts have been updated with some of your other favorite breakfast items (Bacon, Tang, Cereal, etc), so you can have your doughnut and eat it too.  I had the Bacon Maple Bar - which looked better than it tasted - I'm a big fan of the Maple Bar, but the bacon was a little hard and didn't bring out the taste against the maple very much.  I also had the Voodoo Doll - really cute - no two look the same - nice Raspberry Jelly inside - it was a classic.  The fruit loop was covered in Fruit Loop cereals on a very tasty doughnut - I could only handle so much sugar in one sitting.  The real prize for me was the Fritter with Peaches...oh yeah...it's huge and covered in cream cheese frosting...oh yeah...that's probably going to get me to Type 2 Diabetes faster than I would want...oh yeah - orgasm on a fritter...but oh what a way to go.  Pace yourself, we did 2 one day and 2 the next and they were still fresh on day two.  Since we climbed all the way up Multnomah Falls, I think I may have worked it off...
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
Holy donut mojo Batman! Wow this place is an institution, the line was 30 minutes on a Monday night at  will give them a five star for creativity, my kids loved the dirt donut, buttermilk bar, apple fritter, and the Mc...something! The ODB was not our favorite.

If your in Portland you need to hit it up.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: The whole vibe of this place is fun, from the variety of donuts, their names, and uniqueness...to the long wait in line and getting the opportunity to people watch and await the sugary goodness... The first time I was ever here I didn't have a smartphone to check what kind of donuts they have to choose from, and I didn't like how we were rushed to make a decision (although I kind of ubderstand that they want the long line to move faster)... So I definitely recommend checking their donut menu online and making a note of which ones you want ahead of time... Must-tries in my opinion are the voodoo doll and maple bacon.... Too good! This is a place I hit up every time I visit Portland!
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
Totally worth the wait. Not overrated. Seriously. 

Okay, the line was not that long. We probably waited in line for like 15-20 minutes. If you want to complain about lines, I waited in like for 45 minutes for a bagel in NYC, that's ridiculous. 15 minutes for some amazing doughnuts, is completely justifiable. The line was out the door (and almost to the sketchy strip club/adult movie theater?) but went pretty quick. 

The menu posted inside the shop lists prices and doughnut names, but not much else. Spend the time you wait in line looking up the menu online for pictures and specific descriptions of every doughnut.

We ended up ordering the Old Dirty Bastard and the Memphis Mafia. Yes, it pained me a little to fork out $4 for one doughnut, but it was so worth it. The Memphis Mafia is a huge glazed banana fritter, covered in chocolate sauce, chocolate chips, peanut butter, and peanuts. OH MY GOD. Can you say amazing?

I'm pretty sure if you don't go, you'll regret it. You're not too good for a tourist trap. Go.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: They're dooughnuts. Plain and simple. Worth the wait? If you're into novelty-shaped doughnuts, sure.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
To be honest, I'm not much of a doughnut eater. It's not that I don't LIKE doughnuts, I just don't eat a lot of sweets. However, while visiting Portland for the MLS All-Star game, this was a "must stop" on our trip. 

We arrived at around 10:30am on a Wednesday (game day). There was a line of about 40-50 people that snaked out the doorway, however we were at the front of the line in no more than 20 minutes. I've actually been told that the line is shorter in the morning than it is a late-night, where it can be nearly an hour long. 

My friend and I decided to maximize our options and split a few different types of doughnuts. I ordered the Maple Bacon (after many recommendations) and the Fruit Loops, while my friend got the Blueberry Cake and Raspberry Filled. 

We enjoyed the nice weather and fun-filled patio environment as we ate our doughnuts. I was unable to finish 1/2 of all 4, but made sure to give each one a taste. They were ALL incredible. Can't actually say which is my favorite, because I would enjoy them all depending on my mood. The Maple Bacon is something that must be tried though. 

Overall, it's still just a doughnut, but with a selection of probably 30+ to choose from, it makes Voodoo Doughnut a doughnut-lovers paradise. I would definitely recommend you check them out.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
You go here once for the experience, but that's about it.  There are far better donuts elsewhere in town, and without the long line.  Skip them if you have any kind of dietary consideration.  While they do have vegan options, there is no ingredient segregation-- great if your dietary restrictions are a personal choice, not so great if you're trying to have a day out and one of your kids has an allergy.

They're a classic part of the Portland experience, and a tasty snack after Dante's Sinferno Cabaret lets out.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: Eh. Overrated. The ambience of this place is obviously super cool and so are all the combos of donuts you can get, but really the dough is not that great. The donuts don't feel super fresh and fluffy like I think they should. I've had way better simple donuts at hole in the wall joints. I think the dough is one of the most important parts of the donut! You gotta do it right and keep it fresh. Not only that, but all the toppings like chocolate and maple cracked when a piece of the donut was torn off. This to me screams old donut! It shouldn't be hardened. I'm glad I tried it out, but I would probably skip out next time. We tried 7 different ones and the hibiscus donut was definitely my favorite.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: Tourist spot with a long line. Some of the donuts are amazing, like the Old Dirty Bastard. Worth checking out if there's a short enough line. Fun experience. Don't forget to check out the underwear on the wall.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
Doughnuts. Donuts. No matter how you spell it, it spells Voodoo! 

While in Portland we tried three times to grab some doughnuts. We would drive by and see the insane line of people. In. The. Rain. Wow, these things must be greater than great. Finally, on our third pass, the line was relatively short and we were heading home to the Bay Area the next day, so it was now or never.

Stood in line, talked to some nice Portland-ites/Portlanders(?) Saw two transients get into a fight in front of the shop. I yelled to a cop across the street, 'Oye, 5-0 we got  situation here'. Police officer just stopped talking to some barely legal chick and sped off. Transients headed in the other direction after grumbling at each other.

Finally get inside, order the Voodoo Dozen and a couple of extra Voodoo Dolls for the ghouls, excuse me children, to impale repeatedly with the lil pretzel stick that sticks out of the doughnut. That was a bit creepy to see.

Our Dozen was okay. Some flavors were stellar, still others made it straight to the trash can with barely a bite taken from them.

Triple Chocolate Penetration, much bally-ho'd was nasty! Cocoa Crisp cereal on top was stale and chocolate glaze tasted off. Trash can.

Tangfastic, tangy and eaten post-haste.

Captain My Captain, in theory this should have been a home run. Instead it was merely a blooper hit to shallow right. We took bites this one ended up en la basura.

Voodoo Dolls, were fan-freakin' tastic! My 8 yo son actually said that and then shoved half of the doughnut in his mouth.  His ghoulish twin sister thought it was a hoot to pretend her doughnut was her brother and stab it repeatedly. Yes, therapy will be needed for both children.

Butterfingering, husband ate this one whole before I could even really get a good look at it. 'Nough said.

Buttermilk bar, was huge! Good tangy, buttermilky flavor.

Dirt Doughnut, good. How can you go wrong with a kid fave of Oreo cookies on top of a doughnut? You can't!

If we are ever back in Portland we'll pick up a dozen but they will be the ones withOUT the cereal on top.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
First time in the downtown Portland area for work, so I knew I wanted to make a visit to Voodoo Doughnuts. Came here on a Thursday around 7 pm with a co-worker and was surprised to see that the line was not out the door (though it grew a bit longer while we were inside).

I knew I wanted to try a creme filled doughnut, so I asked for a recommendation. The guy helping us was very friendly and suggested the McMinnville Cream, which had maple frosting and Bavarian creme filling. I was sold. I don't normally eat doughnuts, but it turned out to be amazing. Incredibly sweet and delicious. My co-worker ordered the buttermilk bar doughnut, so I tried a piece and it was also very enjoyable.

We ordered a dozen assorted doughnuts for our co-workers, and I was also able to try the double chocolate, which is simply a chocolate cake doughnut with chocolate frosting. I didn't think the doughnut itself was anything special; however, the frosting is what makes it so tasty. My favorite is definitely the McMinnville Cream! 

Vegan options available. Friendly service. Cash only.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
It would be totally ludicrous for you to think I planned a trip to Portland just so I could visit "VooDoo Doughnut." 

That would be insane.  Or, batty, bizarre, cracked, crazed, crazy, cuckoo, daft, demented, derailed, deranged, fatuous, frenzied, idiotic, impractical, irrational, irresponsible, loony, lunatic, mad, maniacal, mental, moonstruck, nuts, nutty, of unsound mind, off one's rocker, out of one's mind, paranoid, preposterous, psychopathic, psychotic, rabid, raging, raving, schizophrenic, screwy, senseless, touched, unhinged, unsettled, and/or wild. 

Color me NUTS.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: I understand why this place is so popular. Must try the maple bacon bar. It was so good! Luckily we came at a good time so the line wasn't too long.

text:
OMG.....Ultimate sugar fix!!  

I can't wait to go back....only 59 more days!!  :o)

Worth the wait!!
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
Before we even saw the sign we saw the line snaking out the door and down the sidewalk and knew it was going to be good.  The inside was tiny and quite dark & creepy, but the counterperson did not let the crowd affect his manners; he was kind and patient with everyone.

They had a handful of vegan options and I've heard that they rotate.  The apple fritter was soft, moist, and super-glazed.  The chick-o-stick was a completely different, but equally delicious concoction of cakey inside, crispy outside, covered with icing and a generous helping of crushed chick-o-stick.  

This is a must visit for vegans and non-vegans.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: Overpriced, stale, touristy. Go to a real doughnut shop if you care about quality. Anyone can put a piece of bacon on a maple bar.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
I did not eat here. Hence the neutral rating.

The line was worse than a new rollercoaster ride at Six Flags. 

But, helpful hint - did find Voodoo Doughnut Too across the river! Same donuts, no line, hehe suckers!
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
This place reminds me of Psycho Donuts in San Jose, although I'm sure Voodoo Donuts has been around much longer.

Each of the donuts is cleverly decorated and flavored. We had to try the Maple Bacon Bar, since they were known for that one. It was better than I expected, but we still only shared a couple bites each. We also, under the pressure of the long line, picked out two donuts quickly from the revolving display. We chose the Grape Ape, which I hated since I turn my nose up at anything with grape flavoring. We also had the No Name, which had the perfect combination of chocolate and cereal on top.

The place has stain glass windows shaped as their signature donuts and two people that I think might be their founders. Inside, the workers look pretty indie rock, and they try to shuffle you out fast since there is always a long line to order. 

I came back and got a souvenir shirt for my boyfriend. I would be back if I was in the area again, and didn't mind the calories.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
*********CASH ONLY************
Stopped here during my road trip to Washington around 6:00-7:00am on a Wednesday & let me say that is probably the perfect time to do it in order to avoid a long line. I am not a resident so I don't know how long this line can get but I have seen pictures and it doesn't seem to pleasant but let's say you do have to wait, is it worth it? YES! These little bewitched babies are not only aesthetically pleasing but they are tasty! I loved my strawberry icing one and the voodoo doll one, the icing is just sweet enough & their doughnuts are nice and fluffy. This doughnut place is very creative with their doughnuts & if I had high tolerance for sweets, I would've had way more. The only reason why I gave it four stars was for customer service & the high price, I believe we paid about $10 or above for 3. The young lady at the counter wasn't the friendliest & seemed to be rushing us when we were the only people in there. Doughnuts are great but people could be friendlier.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: The pink boxes being carried around town are not really a coincidence. If you are looking for a sugar rush or some night time munchies n dont mind waiting in a long line any given time of day...you oughta grab a spot on that line and try the wackiest donuts in world! Voodoo donuts is awesome...if ur in portland and haven't tried this you definitely should!
