name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: Ultimate freak show.  I fancy myself a donut expert.  My expectations were low but I was pleasantly surprised.  The donuts were unique and good.  Late night this location is surrounded by bums and bars.

text: Why do people go here? Dear Travel Channel or whatever made Voodoo popular, do a piece on Blue Star...just kidding...don't. It's not much of a secret as it is. Voodoo, it is not your fault. You just got too big and you jeopardized quality for kitsch. I'm sure you're just rolling in the...dough.

text: Finally was able to visit the famous Voodoo Doughnuts. Grabbed about a dozen or so for the family.  Very good doughnuts and can't beat the hours that they are open.  Staff was so-so but I have only been once so i know that it can vary.

name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
After an ample birthday dinner, and (more than) a few drinks, we decided we HAD TO HAVE voodoo donuts. We showed up at 2 am on a Sunday morning, and there we about 3 people ahead of us in line. Service was quick, and before you know it we had a maple bacon, captain crunch and old fashion in hand, with some milk to wash it down. 3 donuts + 1 milk = ~$5.50, not bad at all (CASH ONLY).

All 3 were good, but as expected, the maple bacon was the best. And I really don't think the previous alcohol consumption influenced that assessment at all.

It's definitely a fun place, and should be a stop on any Portland trip.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: went to this place for the hype and boy did it live up to our expectations. the place itself is fairly small, but the decor is awesome and unique. no matter what time of day, there will always be somewhat of a line. the donuts themselves are huge and very reasonably priced for what you're getting. definitely worth it if you want a portland classic!
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch

text: I like the concept, the crazy doughnuts, but they're not that tasty. The line is usually long because it's a touristy place but it does usually move fast. I do enjoy the maple bacon doughnut though! Definitely my fave.

text: I always have to stop by Voodoo donuts when I' m in town.  I can't go here by myself, I have to take my significant other or she will throw a fit.  This the only place I will buy a donut or two or a dozen for myself.  Any other times I get my fix when someone from work bring donuts from a mom and pops store.

text: This place has "TOURIST TRAP" written all over it. Before going here, you must ask yourself one question: "Do I really want to wait in line for 45 minutes for a sub-par doughnut?". Don't get me wrong, this place is a definite go-to for the typical Portland tourist. However, I wouldn't go here regularly because I would prefer getting my doughnuts and pastries from a local neighborhood bakery in North Portland. If you want to avoid the line, go here during the off-hours (~ 12am - 6am).
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
I think this place is wayyyyyy overrated!!!! its just doughnuts anyone can make looked like they came out of Susie homemaker kit. cereal on top was the most creative ha! the line is NOT worth the wait. The staff looked like trash like they just got out of bed, everyone had a miserable look on their face and had an attitude to match! no one was helpful or pleasant to talk with. Being it my first time it will definitely be my last! after i gave up trying to decide what to order because clearly the environment was unwelcoming nor did my cashier bother to suggest anything I gave her a $20 only to be accused on giving her a $5 becasue she was distracted by her friend/co worker in conversation. She responded rudely and argued with me saying she had "never been off of her register" i waited another thirty minutes to get my money that was rightfully due. The rude cashier Diana Prince never returned to apologize after such bold statements, another co worker apologized on her behalf but walked away from me before i could say anything... avoid this place your gonna get ripped off!


zero stars!
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
Found another HITW (hole in the wall) in Portland!  The slogan of Voodoo is 'The magic is in the hole' and their pink donut boxes are stamped with 'Good Things Come in a Pink Box'.

This is a must go when in Portland and anytime is good since they are almost a 24/7 operation!  

I bought a few of their more popular for a farewell luncheon and it was a hit!

I need to try the famous bacon maple bar next time since they were sold out.

They are legalized to perform weddings too from $25 to $4,500 depending on how crazy and the number of people.  They actually have a 700 ft chapel on site.

FUN place to check out!
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: It was delicious. If you want crazy, unique donuts, this is the place to go. Pictured here is old dirty basterd and fruit loop donuts
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: Went while on vacation. Got there at 6am, and there was NO line. AND they were selling buckets of donuts from the previous day for something like $7. BUCKETS! Their lemon donut was really yummy. You can tell the dough is homemade, it was soft and perfectly chewy. The Orangatang was also very tasty! And the Memphis Mafia was loved by many. It was HUGE!
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: Voodoo Doughnut is an awesome place to take out-of-towners and anyone who is open-minded. I LOVE this place for their selection of doughnuts (although decor is a bit wacky and out there). We had a big group and we ordered enough for everyone to sample a piece of the flavors (Although, I'm not sure if I like the Vegan one too much, I only tried one of them, and yuck). If I lived in town I think I'd return every week to try a new flavor... YUM. Oh, and they have a "Texas Sized Doughnut" that's bigger than your face.. if you can eat it under 80 seconds, you get it for free. Two of our group members had a good time trying to race these doughnuts.. and well.. it took a little under 5 minutes to complete.. Go figure! But yes, try this place out!
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: Always a fun stop in downtown Portland... as long as the line isn't crazy long. They're known for their crazy doughnuts; however, just their regular selection is very good. My kids love the Bubble Gum and Cookies N Cream doughnuts.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: The donuts are always cold. You'd think that they could serve a warm donut once in a while with their volume. But no. I only really find myself at this joint when I need to entertain an out of town guest that has heard about this place on the Travel Channel or Food Network. There's a certain level of novelty with this place because of the original doughnut creations and the whacked out space. For a decent donut there are some other places I frequent in town over this one, especially if I don't want a street kid or cracked out old guy asking me for leftover donuts or money. DO NOT GIVE THE STREET PEOPLE MONEY!!!!
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
Are you a toursit? If so I think you will love this place, its weird, and fun, you have to stand in line for a long time, and you have to pay in cash, but compared to most places out there it has a charm its own and you'll certainly find something worth sharing with all your *insert popular social media site* followers.

Locals on the large however adopt a 'been there done that' mentality - if it isn't your first time the line feels awfully long for a cheap treat and with so many good choices in the city stale cereal on an 'ok' doughnut just loses the wow factor.

text: Actually, I think the doughnut here are looks very fancy, but they all taste too much sweet to me as an Asian. However, still worth to have a try!

text:
2.5 star for the doughnut - not worth coming if you're expecting a donut better than the basic gas station donut. 
In California there's plenty of Mom and pop shops that have fresher donuts with a lighter consistency for the same or less price.
If you rarely get to eat donuts then I'm sure it will be a treat either way because it's sweet and deep fried. 
If you've had your fair share of delicious donuts from Sidecar, Blue Star, or any other well known places in NY and Chicago, then youll be disappointed.
They use the same base donut for every donut, meaning the batter is the same. (Excluding yeast vs. cake vs vegan) The donuts are not infused with their names-flavor. Just the basic icing on top has some of the flavor it's named after.
Nonetheless, glad I experienced it for $2 but I won't be back.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
So unique... So exotic... So yummy... So voodoo!!!  That is right! If you want all that, Voodoo Doughnut is the place to check out.

That place is freaken awesome...they got so much weird exotic Doughnut to choose from... c'mon... bacon Doughnut!!!... oreo!!!... fruit loop!!!!... You name it.. they probably have it.

The place gets busy... heck.. we where there in 6ish in the morning n they got tons of customer already.

One of most check out place if you ever visit Portland!

text:
Let me give you an idea of a perfect evening in my head.

Long hot bath with 3 drops of lavender oil, epson salt with candles lit and big fat apple fritter in both hands.

Sitting in my iJoy chair with my ipod blaring cool 80s tunes with an apple fritter in both hands.

Finally retiring to my comfy bed with my husband at my side with an apple fritter in both hands... and him covered in them.

I love apple fritters.  Yeah.  You're quick to pick up on that one.  The apple fritters at Voodoo are... how shall I say.... pure perfection.  Crisp enough that you know it was fried in fresh oil.  Fluffy enough to want to take a nap with your face in it.  Sweet enough to know that you are about to reach that sugar coma.

The maple bacon bar is quite delicious.  And don't give me shit that it sounds disgusting.  I know you dip your breakfast sausage in your maple syrup!  Same thing, asswipe!
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: I admit I'm one of the fools that lined up for donuts on a rainy Sunday morning. Once is enough just to say we visited this very popular Portland bakery...unless family really want to visit (likelihood is high) so I'll be waiting down the street at Sumptons (yum!).

text:
Maybe 2.5

Was it Portland over the weekend and heard the hubbub over this place, so we decided to go. It was an early Wednesday afternoon and there was about 8 people in line in front of us. Service is sloooooow. You can't see your choices until you get to the door and people hem and haw and take forever to decide. And the kid getting the donuts? He was putting them on the counter and then in the box, not sure why he didn't just put them straight in the box, but whatever.

As for the donuts themselves, meh. I had the voodoo donut which was just a regular jelly donut with a face and I've definitely had better. The same for the maple bacon one my sister got. There are definitely better donut places if you're going for actual taste and not visual effect.

text:
Hubby and I tried to find this place and saw a long line wrapped around the corner! We decided to try to go to the place again on our way back home but this time a lot earlier than we did. 7 am on a Sunday meant we were the first ones there and got ourselves our pink Voodoo doughnut box, which I happily carried out and took home :)

We had asked the guy to give us their best selling donuts and he even gave us a free donut. We got the bacon maple bar (yummy!), dirty doughnut (with vanilla frosting and oreos), the loop (with vanilla frosting and fruit loops), and a couple of glazed donuts. I loved the bacon maple bar; the bacon just did it for me! It was a good sized breakfast for me.

I will definitely come and visit here again if we're headed up north. Probably will stick to an early am visit!
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch

text: Voodoo is worth the novel thrill for tourists while still providing a fairly good donut.  This is their main location, so expect a line that will wrap to the street.  Benches reserved for Voodoo patrons line the exterior and serve as the sole official seating area for the place.  This time I got their no name and a cherry topped special whose name escapes me.  The cherry one was overly sweet and not my cup of tea, but the no name had just enough saltiness in it's toppings to ensure a better bite.  The staff has no time to really serve everyone's need as they juggle hundreds of orders in a short amount of time.  The interior is lined with voodoo-themed merch and other bits of memorabilia that'll bring a smile to everyone's face.  These aren't bad donuts.  They may be a tad overhyped, but it'll satisfy anyone who has this on a list of places to visit.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: The service was fast, there are 4 cashiers so it goes quick. The doughnuts weren't amazing but still tasted good, they just look amazing. Which is part of the appeal. They were also a lot cheaper than we expected.

text: Me & my husband are from California & we have never even heard of this place until we moved to Washington . We went to a basketball game at the Moda Center & on our way home we stopped my Voodoo Doughnuts for the first time the line wasn't too bad at all , everyone was in & out in a jiffy ! We ordered 2 captain crunch doughnuts , 1 cocoa puffs doughnut , a maple , a old fashioned doughnut , a regular chocolate doughnut , & an Oreo doughnut & let me just say AMAZING ! Even though after a couple bites half of one doughnut gave me a headache I do recommend trying this place at least once ! It was a great experience & apparently a pretty popular place . A must try :)

text:
My husband saw this spot on Man V Food so of course we had to come here. We made the two hour drive down from Olympia in the pouring rain. We arrived pretty early on Saturday and found that the line was already wrapped around the outside of the building. Obviously, in this part of the country you can't let standing in the rain for 30 minutes stop you. 

We used our line time to scan the menu online and choose our flavors. The longer we waited the larger our wish list grew. We settled on a dozen donuts for the two of us.

The Maple Bar was the best donut of the bunch. The Grape Ape and Mango Tango were good too. I liked the sugar crunch and the flavor of the powders with the icing and donut. Everything with cereal on top was a disappointment since all of the cereal tasted stale. Cereal on top of the donut sounds interesting, but just doesn't work.

Keep in mind that they only accept cash so make sure to hit the ATM before visiting. I want to say that there was an ATM on site, but I wouldn't count on that. At the time I visited there was also only one table inside because most of the space is used for the line. Plan to have somewhere else to enjoy your donuts.

These aren't the best donuts you'll ever have in your life, but the donuts and the shop are unique. Would you really want to visit Portland and miss the iconic Voodoo Donuts?
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: Tourist trap, with donuts that taste like stale cigarette smoke. Go to Blue Star or CoCo instead.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch

text: Oh My Lord these little nuggets rock! My favorite is the Portland cream, but my buddy digs the Dirty Old Bastard. Good stuff and the line always moves pretty fast and there's usually some entertaining street things going on. Good to take visiting friends/family to after the Saturday market.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
My girlfriend was ranting and raving about how awesome Voodoo donuts was while we were still in San Francisco, way before we even got on the plane to head to Portland. She said it was just something we had to try while we were on vacation. Overall, I'm glad we went.

The best thing about this place is the fact that it is open 24/7. A lot of complaints I read are about the massive lines and long waits, which is to be expected honestly since Voodoo donuts seems more like a novelty place for locals and a tourist trap. Being those things aren't bad, but of course you should expect a long line and wait. There are ways to get around that though, we decided to go at night around 9-10pm. When we arrived there were only 4 people ahead of us, but by the time we were leaving the line had somehow managed to extend out of the door.

The ambiance of Voodoo donuts is amazing, it's a cute little donut shop and has very attractive decorations. It's a clean place, with many treats to choose from. We got a bunch. My favourites were the Peach fritter with cream cheese frosting on top, the tang covered donut, the butterfinger covered one, and the Marshall Mathers. All of the donuts there are extremely sweet and choc-filled with candy toppings, frostings, and just a ton of sugar. So be aware. The staff are really helpful and always willing to recommend some favourites it seems. The price also isn't too bad.

The only thing I didn't like about Voodoo donuts and why it gets 4 stars instead of 5 is the fact that they are cash only. It's 2015, a lot of people like myself just don't always have cash on them. Though for those without cash, they have an atm inside of the donut shop where you can get cash. Unfortunately I'd rather not pay fees just to withdraw money. If they ever accept debit or credit, 5 stars. Overall, great donuts and a nice place to visit if you're a tourist and want to experience one of Portland's novelties.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: Tourist trap. Mediocre donuts. There are far better donut places in Portland.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch

text: Wow. I don't even like donuts and was dragged here by my girlfriend and ohh buddy, these things are the bomb. Thanks for starting my day off in Portland right! Yum city.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: I've been wanting to visit Voodoo Doughnut since I first heard about it probably 6 or 7 years ago. When I finally made my way to Portland for a visit recently, I knew I had to stop by. Lucky for me, my hotel was right across the street. The line was long almost every time we went by. On Saturday night we decided the line was probably about as short as it was gonna get and we waited. Even though it seemed long, it moved pretty fast so don't be discouraged! When we finally got inside, it was a bit bigger than I thought it was going to be. They had 3 registers, which is why the line moved fairly fast, and display cases with rotating doughnuts so you can see clearly what you want to order. I ended up getting myself 4 doughnuts: Maple Bacon, ODB, Voodoo Doll, and Sprinkles. They all lived up to my expectations! I ate the ODB that night while fresh, and it was amazing. That was probably my favorite, however it was ridiculously sweet and would probably make me sick if I ate it too often haha. The other 3 made the trip back home with me and I have to say they held up super well. Even after a day or two the donuts still tasted really good. Maple Bacon was a lot better than I thought it might be; it really is a good flavor combo. The Voodoo Doll was  yummy and I liked the raspberry jelly but it also was really sweet. The Sprinkles, which I got so I could try one of their more traditional donuts, was just as delicious and wonderful as the crazy concoctions they're famous for. I'm so glad I got to try Voodoo Doughnut and I can't wait to visit again next time I'm in Portland!
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: Good doughnuts.  There was a line, which seems to be the norm at such doughnuts places, but it moved quickly enough.  Surprisingly this place only takes cash but there is an ATM that is accessible from the line.  The doughnuts were reasonably priced, which justified the experience and would have me coming back.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
My only disappoint is that i don't live in Portland which robs me of the opportunity to strategically go down their vast menu of specialty donuts and try each one. When i say vast, I mean vast...  Super overwhelmed and confused as what to pick. Everything looks so darn good... 

I ended up picking two, I opted for a classic glazed donut and a Cap'n Crunch donut... Really Really Good Stuff. I'm no donut expert, but it was by far the best glazed donut i've ever had. It was soft, sweet... almost a donut/cake like texture.  My attempt at a description will do the donut a disservice. It was just GOOD, go get your hands sticky and grab one if you really want to know. The Cap'n Crunch donut was reflective of the glazed but with Cap'n crunch and Crunch Berries stuck to the top. Again, also really really good stuff... Straight sugar overload. 

The place is partly tourist attraction and local hotspot. You can't miss the paisley pink building with the long line of customers outside. You'll see tourist in the parking lot taking selfies with the building in the background and locals walking out with pink boxes of their favorite donuts. 

If you're from outta town you definitely have to stop here, and if you're from Portland and haven't been here... well then, you probably don't like donuts. 
Voodoo Doughnuts. Five Stars fa sure.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: Voodoo has an amazing atmosphere. They also have very clever names and boxes and clothing. The donuts are incredible. They all have their own radical flavors and concepts, and not one is the same as the other. From cream filled to jelly, old fashioned to cake...these donuts are great. Highly recommended, definitely worth battling the traffic to snack on!
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch

text: Wow. If you're in Portland, this is a must-stop spot. These donuts were not only delicious and well made, but so creative! The atmosphere is just Portland in a nutshell. Yes, the line can get long, but  it moves fast and it's totally worth it. We even came back for more!!

text:
I knew when I wanted to come to Voodoo, it was solely for the hype, and yes I definitely wasn't expecting much since I had been fully warned by my dear friends. But really? I didn't know someone could possible make donuts worse than Dunkin Donuts. And how do you even mess up a jelly donut exactly? 

Came here around 11pm on a Saturday night just so I can be a tourist and take a picture with the Voodoo Donut sign but thought "I might as well just stand in line too because how many times will I really come here." The wait was roughly around 30 minutes (which is still insane!) and I ordered the infamous voodoo, a jelly donut in the shape of a voodoo doll covered with chocolate. The donut was extremely heavy and the dough was not airy or fluffy at all. On top of that, it was extremely sweet and just not very different from that jelly donut from your local donut shop (and honestly that one may even be better). 

Majorly disappointed and I am shocked that people still stand in line for an insane amount of time for this basic donut. #basic
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
Yum! I absolutely love this place! 

I went back to Portland to visit with my boyfriend recently & I just HAD to take him here. 

Okay, as "weird" as it might sound but yes I tried the maple bar with bacon on top for the first time & I have to admit it was DELICIOUS! The sweet & salty taste just works so well in your mouth & the crisp of the bacon was perfect!

My boyfriend had gotten the cock & balls (chocolate doughnut with cream filling inside)... & let me tell you, I have NEVER seen a heterosexual ever get excited for ordering a penis shaped doughnut before. HAHA, lets just say my boyfriend got "wet" over it. ;] 

All in all, if you live in Portland or if you're every there to visit I do recommend you go to VooDoo. Best place ever & the service was GREAT!
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch

text: VooDoo Doughnuts is a Portland institution. I do like that they have crazy flavors and amazing names of doughnuts, but really $3+ for an alright doughnut? I've had better doughnuts at a grocery store. Unless you are looking for something in particular, I would recommend the VooDoo dozen where they pick out a dozen doughnuts for you, which saves you a good $12. I also like that they have Vegan doughnuts (GAY BAR!) but overall this place is only busy because of the tourists and TV exposure. Interestingly, I found this original location to have a limited selection of doughnuts compared to the other location in NE Portland. Parking is a bitch here since it is downtown, so I would highly recommend going to the other location for FREE parking and a better selection of the crazy doughnuts.

name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: About a 10 minute wait to get in, and it was worth it. However, my gf and I have eyes way bigger than our stomachs and ended up getting too many. Two of the donuts were very similar- standard donut with white frosting and a bunch of stuff on top of that (hers froot loop, mine oreos). We probably could have cut this down to one each instead of two and still been fine, as we felt gut-bombed afterwards. Overall though, this place is much more of a novelty than high-quality donuts. They were good but there was nothing that set me over the top. I would suggest blue star for the high-quality donuts and voodoo for the fun giant dicks (uh)

text:
I've already been to America's best doughnut shop, and that would be The Doughnut Plant in New York City's Lower East Side (review: http://bit.ly/2trzBAQ). It's true, or at least I've convinced myself it's true because if I didn't, I'd be devouring doughnuts with alarming frequency. But even I knew I had to try Voodoo Doughnut because the buzz had been deafening me for years. Even the late, great Anthony Bourdain took notice of them on his previous travel show, 'No Reservations'. So when Jamie W. and I were walking west from the waterfront, we saw young people scurrying about with their signature pink boxes and knew we were close by.

Sure enough there were people at their outdoor tables wolfing down doughnuts, and as luck would have it, the permanent line to get them had an unusual break which we seized. I already told Jamie what we would order since I had been schooled on the must-haves by Voodoo aficionados back home. First up was the $3 Voodoo Doll, a raised yeast doughnut filled with raspberry jelly and covered liberally with a sweet chocolate frosting. It looked like the progeny of Mr. Bill's evil twin and Patrick the Starfish, Spongebob's best bud. We both took one bite each. Definitely softer than I expected. Next was the $3.50 Maple Bacon Bar.

It was another raised yeast doughnut but slathered with a maple frosting and topped with crisped bacon strips. Concept was somewhat better than the execution, but who turns down bacon? Again one bite each. Next was The Loop for $1.95, yet another raised yeast doughnut but this one dipped heavily in a thick vanilla frosting and topped with what appeared to be a bowlful of Fruit Loops. Even though it was Portland Pride weekend and they offered a Gay Bar, the multiple colors raised our freak flag most suitably. This one was actually better than it looked probably because that was my favorite cereal as a child. Nice and sweetly crunchy.

Before you ask, yes, they do offer a Capt'n Crunch version as well. Despite our praise, we stuck to our guns and stayed with one bite each. Last one was a concession to Jamie, the $1.15 Blueberry Cake doughnut which came with a thin glaze. It was clearly the most nondescript of the quartet we ordered, but since it was the only cake of the bunch, it was ironically the most satisfying. But no matter, it was one bite each. Here they are in the box (photo: http://bit.ly/2lAJt77). After taking our somewhat disciplined approach, I asked Jamie rather facetiously, "That was enough, right?". He nodded his head, and we left the remains in the box on top of the trash bin. It can be done.

DOUGHNUTS - 4 stars...good quality overall though some were better than others...the less accessories on them, the better
AMBIANCE - 3.5 stars...forcibly kitschy, tries a bit too hard, seating limited
SERVICE - 4 stars...better than expected considering the necessary assembly line approach
TOTAL - 4 stars....if you really need a doughnut fix, this is it...unless you're closer to The Doughnut Plant!
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: Had to go to see what all the fuss was about.  I am not much of sweet fan and was put off by the fact this is only a cash only place (do not like to carry cash).  They do have an ATM inside the store.  I waited in line for about 10 minutes and the donut was good but I have done this and crossed it off the list and will not be back.

text: The wait was a little crazy - over an hour on a Monday afternoon!  Mostly tourists but what can I say, I am one too.  Next time I'll try the other location which I hear is bigger and less of a lineup.  I would definitely go back.  Delicious doughnuts with oreo cookies, peanut butter.  The voodoo doughnut was delicious as was the dirty old man and the el diablo!  All the ones we tried were good and reasonable.  Too bad they were out of the maple bacon bar when I got there :-(

text:
A Tourist Trap!! I heard about Voodoo Donuts from friends and decided to give it a go. I was a little overwhelmed by the plethora of donuts sitting on the rotating carousel. So many - cake, old-fashioned, speciality, where do I begin?

We decided to try the chocolate cream donut, maple old-fashioned, double chocolate cake, red blaming blunt, and blueberry cake donut. We should have just gotten one - the  Blueberry donut. It was sweet and tasty. We just took a few bites of the other donuts - they weren't worth the calories. The maple and double chocolate cake were both a bit dry. I like the bavarian cream in the chocolate cream donut, but it was nothing special. The red blaming donut is nothing more than a cinnamon donut with some sprinkles. The donuts are a notch above Dunkin' Donuts. The locals go to Blue Star - I can see why. 

The donuts aren't worth the wait. Luckily, the line wasn't too long when i was there at 10pm on Sunday. It's much longer during the day and in the evening. While waiting in line, be careful! The donut shop is in a shady area and plagued with homeless people. This guy came right up to my boyfriend in the parking lot and scared us as we were walking towards the donut shop. The parking lot across the street is very expensive, I recommend street parking a block away. No better way to wait in line than people asking you for money! It was so bad that we didn't even bother to sit down and nibbled on the donuts when we got to the car. 

If you're really curious about the donuts, I recommend going to the other location - Voodoo Donut 2 or not going to the Chinatown location at night. I think you'll be more impressed with Blue Star.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: If you're into hygiene and just the normal appearance of somewhat clean do not go to this VooDoo donuts, go to the one in Eugene Oregon. Before you even get to the line you have to fight your way through all kind of throw up on the floor, spit and loogies, piss and bubble gum on the floor, and like a video game you get to the end and fight the evil boss. Just before the evil boss their ends up being a barrage of bums in all shapes and sizes nationalities and different levels of smells, which none of them smell like donuts by the way. Once you get in the main boss is some short Asian lady with a shaved bald head with a very rude attitude that is playing loud obnoxious punk music way too loud as she's trying to take your order and every other word that she yells to you is huh, huh. The reason I gave them 2 stars is because the donuts is what saves them, some of the donuts seems like somebody that was high out of their mind created some of them and is just way too much. It's almost like they let a bunch of kindergartners go back there and go to town on some of these donuts. The almost normal ones and the normal ones are very good, but I must warn you before hand DO NOT USE THE REASTROOM. You might want to use it to wash your hands before you eat your donuts and drink your coffee because everything you touch has either gonorrhea, syphilis,or AIDS, but you're better off using some hand sanitizer. If the owner and the city of Portland took a pressure washer and pressure wash the whole area,sidewalk, street, walls benches, and anything you can lean up against this place wouldn't be so bad. At the end of the day if you want to have a good experience do not go to this one.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
When considering writing any review, you have to weigh the overall value against the product. And considering we spent an hour in line for these donuts, I would have to say they are definitely not worth it. All they are is a bunch of decent (not great) donuts, that someone threw cereal and other junk on top of. Its another level to the American obsession with all things gluttonous.

We arrived at 11am on a Sunday (yeah, our fault), and waited in line for an hour, then ordered a Voodoo Dozen, which lets them choose what goes in the box. We ended up with a maple donut, one with Coco Puffs on it, one with Oreos on it, a blueberry cake one... You get the gist. I personally ate the maple one, a toasted coconut one, and one with chocolate frosting, peanut buuter, and rice krispies. They were good, but not great, and certainly not worth an hour's wait.

Their overall schtick is cool, but honestly, I'll take Top Pot any day over this.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: Is it pretty commercialized at this point? Probably, but so what? You knew what you are getting into at this point. We stopped in on vacation, waited about 30 minutes in line, and ordered some fancy donuts with funny/suggestive names. I am not even really a donut guy, but I definitely thought they were great and worth the wait. For those trashing this place, lighten up and go to Krispy Kreme if you don't want the extra flair. :)
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
Standing in line at Voodoo Doughnuts, waiting to fill up a pink box of your own, is a tradition in Portland. We were not ones to buck tradition. 

We first stopped by on Sunday afternoon. The line was well out into the street and we didn't feel like waiting that long.  Our hotel was close enough to enjoy the 24/7 convenience so we came back around 8 p.m. 

After 20 minutes, and one encounter with a clever homeless man (his sign read "Spaceship low on fuel") we made our way up the the counter to make our selections. 

It's really impossible to choose just one donut, so we got a box of four. Even that really wasn't enough to satiate us. I don't think you can go wrong with anything they have to offer. We got the traditional Voodoo (chocolate with raspberry filling), one with white frosting and Fruit Loops on top, one glazed with raspberry filling and (the best) one with Rice Krispies, chocolate and peanut butter. Everything was good, even the next day. I couldn't leave the box alone. I had to be picking at it constantly. 

These are just good donuts. And props to Voodoo for keeping prices reasonable. We appreciated it.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
When I first visited here two years ago, I was like a little girl who got her first Barbie doll. But after maturing and seeing more of the "world" I realized that the taste and quality of their donuts were on par with that of Dunkin' Donuts and Krispy Kream. When it comes to taste, it was okay.

But I'm giving 4 stars for their creativity, the bohemian setting, 24 hours operation, and being so cool.

If you are new to Portland, try it because everybody is doing it.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch

text:
This place has an awesome sense of humor, and that fact alone would make me want to buy their doughnuts.  If "Keep Portland Weird" is your motto, then you will feel right at home (I did).  The kitch factor is off the charts, and the doughnuts--well, of course they are simply fresh, tasty, and utterly delicious.  I could eat one right now.  A hilarious, imaginative menu with doughnut names that will make you smile... heck, I have a cold right now, too bad they've banned the NyQuil doughnut...

Delectable Doughnut Sin, available day or night. As Homer would say, "Mmmm, ...doughnut'..."  What's not to love?  This place is a carbo craving dream.

I lucked out and had a box hand delivered to me tonight. After sampling one donut more than I probably should have I've made up my mind that if these bad boys can hold their own after an 8 hour car trip to CA, then they must be pretty kick ass fresh out of the oven.

One day I'll find an excuse to go to Portland...

text:
I was minding my own business, opened Yelp, and was greeted by "Your Next Review Awaits" and Voodoo Doughnut's name. What is this, calling me out on slacking as a Portlander? (Which is ironic, given how Portland is riddled with slackers, but then again, it's also riddled with irony.)

Voodoo Doughnut should be a nonissue for anyone in Portland. I consider myself remiss if I do not at least suggest it to out of town guests, assuming I don't take them there myself. That said, I only really go there when entertaining guests. Voodoo Donuts is also a crucial part of a local Zen Buddhist temple's "Feeding of the Hungry Ghosts" ceremony.

Two friends have complained that there are no gluten free donuts, but they admit donuts are a thing you focus your health concerns on.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch

text: You know this was on the list to hit up, When you're out here! The decor is beautiful, Staff are wonderful and Donuts are delish of course! The menu is out of this world but i love it! Out of all the donuts, My friend chooses C***and B**** lol... It was BIG! Voodoo Donuts is not stingy!
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
As a tourist​, one of the must go spots is Voodoo Doughnuts! They have so many creative designs and unique flavors ranging from sweet to savory. There were even funky flavors like NyQuil and pepto, which have since been discontinued. They do still come out with new seasonal flavors. The prices are very affordable; it came out to $9 something for four donuts.

As a chocolate lover, I decided to get two chocolate flavors. The first was the peanut doughnut which has chocolate frosting. The other was a chocolate base with chocolate frosting and chocolate toppings, yum! The Bacon Maple Bar is made with bacon and Maple syrup. It was very different from anything I've tried before. I must admit that the first bite was a bit weird because of the mix of sweet and savory sensations, but it quickly becomes addicting. And of course my final choice would be to try the famous Voodoo Doll. It is a giant donut with jelly filling, chocolate frosting, and a pretzel. Personally I felt that it was way too sweet, especially with all that frosting. My favorites would have to be between the double chocolate and the maple bacon. 

Also, be prepared for long lines! You may be waiting for an hour on average depending on when you go. There's another location with virtually no lines. Voodoo Doughnuts has so many interesting flavors I wanted to try but didn't get the chance to. I'll definitely check out some of them the next time I'm around!
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: Disappointed! We were expecting better donuts, being waiting in line for 15 minutes, but the donuts were cold and not as fresh. Just very ordinary donuts, don't understand why so many people recommend it.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
I realize this place got all hyped on Food Network, but that's not the only reason I went. I am a doughnut expert and I always end up at a doughnut shop in whatever city I'm in, because I LOVE DOUGHNUTS and these, well...I must say, are absurdly good! Apparently the place stays busy 24 hrs/day. We went at 8:30am on a Sunday morning and waited in line for about 20 mins, but I was so busy reading the menu and trying to decide what I wanted, that the line went by pretty quickly. I got the Portland Cream (all Boston cream doughnuts should aspire to be this good!), the Voodoo Doll (yummy berry filling inside and a LOT of it), Maple Bacon Bar (ridiculous!!!!!!!!!!), Tang Doughnut (has mango filling....what????....so good) and Old Dirty Bastard (cookies, chocolate, PB, and other stuff you can't go wrong with). All the chocolate is like a chocolate ganache, it's delicious! I was so sad when I had to throw away that pink box....This place was so good and I hope I get to come back to Portland in the future, cuz when I do, I am making a B-line for Voodoo doughnuts!!! 
Btw, they only accept cash, but there's an ATM machine like 20 feet away from the place!!
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: Ok so the line is long. The donuts are good, but they don't blow every other donut place out of the park. Still, a PDX staple so you sort of have to check it out if you come for a visit. Conveniently close to a lot of other PDX things like Stumptown and other great coffee. I suppose there is a reason you will see people bringing a big pink box of donuts onto their flight out from PDX, but you won't see me with one.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch

text: Enjoyed the experience.  It is definitely something to check out if you're visiting or new to the area.  It is SO Portlandia!  Donuts were good, unique, funky and something to experience but I can't see myself going back.  Definitely check it out.

text:
We went to Portland to eat around town for my birthday last year.  I am only reminded of this place because a new on in my area in California just opened up and my cousin was so excited.

There was a long line which is fine when a place is popular. When we got to the checker we had normal questions about flavors and what not. We got rolling eyes and no real answers. Whoever hired the rude staff that is the face of the business should be fired because multiple people working there could obviously not hold a job that cares about costumer service.

The donuts were not special. They were too thick and doughy. What a disappointment for an over hyped place. We threw about half of the leftovers away. Portland was pretty cool otherwise.

text: The line was crazy, absolutely insane. I stood in it for 5 minutes, wanted to play Rock Paper Scissors to make the call on whether we stay or go, but we just walked away donut-less. That line was not moving so we guesstimated about a 45-50 minute wait. I just can't wait that long for something that will probably shave a good year and a half off my life expectancy. Oh well, maybe next time when I'm in town... Because I might kinda need that captain crunch donut...

text:
Portland's most famous and popular Doughnut shop. Known for their extremely crazy and unique donuts.

When you hear about Portland, you often hear about Powell's bookstore, The Rose Garden, and especially Voodoo Donuts. Voodoo Doughnuts is Portland's biggest and most popular doughnut shop. Being so famous, I knew I had to visit it at least once. There are several Voodoo Doughnut locations but I visited the main Voodoo Doughnut location near Old Town/ChinaTown.

My friend and I visited Voodoo's at around 10:17am and boy was the line long. The sheer amount of people waiting for the line was so long, it could even rival Disneyland lines!

We ended up waiting around an hour until we got to the register. There is a giant menu outside the store and a variety of donuts inside, but I had my game plan for doughnuts ready. One thing that I really loved was the sheer amount of creativity and uniqueness 

My friend and I ordered:
Old Dirty Bastard (Oreos & Peanut Butter), Fruit Loops Doughnut, Voodoo Doughnut (A Chocolate Donut with frosting made to look like a Voodoo Doll and jam filling with a pretzel stick in the middle), and Maple Bacon. And a nice refreshing carton of milk to go with all the awesome donuts.

The Old Dirty Bastard was personally too much for me since I don't enjoy peanut butter. My friend who really likes peanut butter thought that this donut was good but not amazing.
The Fruit Loops Doughnut was so disappointing. The fruit loops on top were stale, and the doughnut itself was sort of plain.
The Voodoo Doughnut was arguably the best doughnut out of my box. The jam inside was a nice addition to the doughnut, and the shape of the doughnut made it fun to eat! I'm also just a giant fan of chocolate doughnuts.
Last but not least, the Maple Bacon. The Maple Bacon is a maple syrup with bacon doughnut. A sweet and salty experience. I personally thought the doughnut itself was good, but the bacon on top was too inconvenient to eat. It was just a giant piece of cold bacon that wouldn't break into pieces easily.

Overall, Voodoo Doughnut is Portland's most famous doughnut store. I think Voodoo's is easily the most unique and creative doughnut place around, but in terms of quality and time I spent waiting in line for these doughnuts, makes this place a visit once and done.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
Is it bad if I say Voodoo Doughnut was my favorite part of Portland??  

This was my first... and 5th... and last stop in Portland.  They were just TOO good.  I've been on a bit of a donut kick recently and Voodoo definitely fit the bill for what I was looking for.  

Though I didn't try their famous maple bacon bar, I don't eat bacon, I got a chance to try their Voodoo donut, the Chocolate Oreo and Peanut Butter donut (the old dirty bastard), and the Captain Crunch donut (captain my captain.)  All were delicious but the Chocolate Oreo Peanut Butter will seriously haunt me in my dreams.  So fresh, so fluffly, so peanutbuttery and chocolatey...........excuse me my stomach is growling. I'm almost thankful that I don't live in Portland because I can guarantee I'd be here standing in line everyday eating their donuts.  

If you're in town, just go.  Remember to bring cash though!
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: The line was long, but went really fast, so I don't see why anyone is complaining about the wait really.  We got the variety box and some of the voodoo doll doughnuts to try out.  All of us liked the voodoo dolls and my husband liked the maple bacon doughnut, the rest were just okay as far as flavor combinations for us.  I do want to point out our experience at the shop though; I am horribly allergic to maple to the point that I don't even trust places when they say the are using maple flavoring because I was told that somewhere before and had to use my epi-pen as my throat was closing up, that said; I asked the cashier who helped us if she wouldn't mind just taking the maple flavored doughnuts and just tossing them in a bag so that they were separate from the rest but so she wouldn't have to spend a lot of time accommodating my allergy so she could get to the rest of the line.  She said no problem, she didn't want to squish the doughnuts, so she took the time to box the maple ones in their own box.  As we were paying and I was thanking her profusely my husband mentioned to me that his back was starting to hurt from walking around downtown all day and the cashier asked him if he wanted some aspirin, he said yes, she went to the back gave him a cup of aspirin (so he would have more for later if he needed it) and also brought a glass of water to take them.  Honestly, she went way above and beyond what she needed to do as a cashier.  I would go back their anytime just based off the way we were treated.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: While Voodoo has done a great job marketing itself for tourists their product isn't the greatest. Yes they're fun and gimmicky but they don't make up for the long line and mediocre donut you end up with.

text:
Don't kill me, people... but this place was just ok. It's not that the donuts were not good. They were. They are just not standing-in-line-for-an-hour-must-go-out-of-my-way-to-get-them good. text:
The first thing we did when we got to Portland (after checking in to our hotel) was venture out in the rain to Voodoo Doughnut. Sure, it's kitschy, but the decor was adorable and the doughnuts were pretty yummy.

After waiting about 30 minutes in the short-but-still-kinda-long-for-doughnuts line, we decided to make our time worthwhile and pick out a half dozen, 3 each.

I got:
- Old dirty bastard: peanut butter and Oreos! Delicious. It was almost too sweet, but I loved the crushed Oreos too much to stop eating it.
- Voodoo doll: cute little VD classic. I'm not a huge fan of jelly filled doughnuts, but the raspberry jam here is pretty good.
- Maple bacon bar: like a regular maple bar, but topped with a generous fatty slice of bacon! And we all know bacon makes everything better.

MM played it safe with:
- Maple bar: like mine but without the bacon. I thought it was kinda lame by comparison, but he liked it.
- Old fashioned: a simple glazed cruller
- Portland creme: I guess it's like a Boston Creme Pie, but Portland?

All in all, they were a bit pricey, but they come in flavors that you just won't find in any ol' doughnut shop! And these survived the torrential rain, DBP (death by puddle), and sitting through a movie before we finally got them back to our hotel. Not bad at all!
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
Had to visit since I've heard so much about the place.  The line wasnt long when we got there which was nice.   Don't expect this though - I'm sure it's crazy long in the morning.   I love the donut options and the store itself was pretty cool!   I had the 'No-Name Donut' (with the rice krispies and peanut butter drizzle) which was yummy! I would have given a slightly higher rating, BUT, as we were taking pictures of the store, the girl at the register rudely said, "Don't take my picture..."  Ummmm noooo, we aren't trying to take your picture, we are trying to take a picture of the donuts - you just happen to be IN the way!!  I also used their restroom and it was filthy - smelled like an outside public bathroom rather than an inside one.   They also only take cash - this bugs me, as I'm not one to carry cash on me often.  

Aside from all that, still check this place out, even if it's just to get pics of the brightly-colored location.

text:
As a doughnut shop it's so-so. As case study for professional marketing it's a MUST. 

As others have mentioned, I'm not sure how fairly average doughnut shop has managed to become associated with the very fabric of Portland's being just by throwing some glitter on the wall and selling over-sized boxes.

They have one infamous cream doughnut that looks like a dong, but I think they missed the boat for that being shocking by a good 15-20 years. I'm pretty sure there are erotic bakeries in Chelsea (Manhattan in New York City for the West-Coast lifers) that have reached the point of willing to depict full hardcore pornography on an apple strudel if that's what you want...

Speaking of hard numbers: I waited 40 minutes in line to spend 28 dollars on 13 doughnuts.

As I typed that sentence I gradually became more and more disappointed with my life. 

And yet there were suckers who didn't beat rush-hour and had to wait way longer than I did. 

Spoiler Alert: it's not worth it.

Are the doughnuts bad? I wouldn't go that far. If you gave VDD one star for quality I'd love to read your reviews of a Dunkin Donuts. 

On the other hand, were they great? Not really. Definitely not good enough to go there regularly and deal with the winding line of tourists / adult-onset diabetes.

I do applaud them for being one of the only truly 24-hour businesses in PDX (maybe you can actually avoid the line at 2am?), but at the same time I boo at them for running a cash-only business. Seriously? You're crumbling up an Oreo onto a doughnut (God Bless America) for a 250% markup and I can't earn some frequent flier miles by swiping the plastic? 

You could say it would make the line worse, but no, what makes the line worse is people fumbling at the ATM who can't believe VDD has the same payment requirements as Lucky Devil Lounge. I guess to be fair, both are similar in that you'd be ashamed for your significant other to see the withdrawl statement if you'd gone without them...

At the end of the day though, the most shocking thing about VDD is the blandness. There's nothing magical, nothing that defines Portland, just OK doughnuts sprinkled with an amazing amount of hype and marketing.

See what I did there with the sprinkled reference? That was for you.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
I'd heard nothing but bad news about the new incarnation of this spot from its humble roots.  I was out in Portland for a wedding and some members of the party really wanted to stop by here.  

I'm not a huge fan of sweets in general, specifically not the over the top sugar rush of most of these doughnuts.  After having one doughnut I realized that the doughnut itself just isn't very good, or perhaps I just got a stale doughnut out of the revolving case. 

It reminds me a lot of the cupcake craze in DC, people waiting in 40 person deep lines for mediocrity.  

Ther service and the prices were actually not that bad but they are cash only, fyi.  I also like that they sell cartons of milk.  

The other obnoxious factor are the tourists, it takes even longer to get a doughnut due to the hordes of large groups taking pictures of anything and everything inside.  I also saw another dozen giant pink boxes at the airport on the way out of town.  The street kids next door and the ominpresent homeless scouring the line for change don't do anything to enhance the experience either.  

Kudos for the owners of this place who have rode the hype train to great profits, others in my party were really happy with their doughnuts but I still don't understand the draw.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
If you're a tourist doing touristy things and you're in Portland, you should find the time to go to Voodoo. Yes, it's true that there probably is a doughnut place right in your hometown that has better baked goods, but c'mon, this place has a doughnut shaped like a voodoo doll. What's more fun than that? And you get to stand in line with a crowd of like-minded folks all excited about the same thing. Sort of like back in the 1980s when you had to stand in line to get concert tickets for that group everybody was excited to see live, except that the Voodoo line moves faster. And none of the people in it are smoking weed.

It is true that they toss the doughnuts into those pretty pink boxes in a manner that causes the glaze to rub off onto the thin wax-paper they use to separate the doughnuts, as some other reviewers have noted. And that is a bummer because, as a tourist, you really wanted to instagram that voodoo doll back to all your friends at home. But it looks too unappetizing with half the glaze smeared off. So they lose a star for that.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: These are just OK donuts, and speaks more to Portlanders obsession with being trendy, or tragically hip - would make a great Portlandia episode! Try Coco Donuts for a much better donut w/o the the dbl lines and frantic hype!

text:
First off, CASH ONLY! However they have an ATM machine inside if you need.

Not much of a donut fan, but my mom is! So we waited in the line (that's always there!) and waits about 15-20 minutes so it wasn't too bad. We opted in for a box of 6. Haven't tried all the flavors we bought yet, but I do like the pina colada with guava jelly donut. It had coconut flakes on top and guava jelly inside - not too sweet so it was to my likings! The grape ape tasted good too l according to my boyfriend - had a strong grape flavor. Definitely recommend ordering from the top level's donut options on these rotating examples for you to see and choose from. The ones are the top are the fun flavors and much larger in size than he bottom layer ones. My favorite part of this place is the unique exterior and interior decor. Glittery brick walls with pink metal separaters for the line. Inside had a large fake donut on the ceiling with two very interestingly designed chandeliers to go with the theme of the shop. There's a lot of branded items you could always purchase with them too. Would recommend checking out if you're around the area!
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: We got  a dozen doughnuts at 1 am and about half were good and half were not so good. Worth a trip especially after a drunk night out. Loved the Miami vice, did not love the captain crunch bc the cereal was stale. I would go again to try a new one if I'm ever in Portland agin

text: I felt like I was going to see the soup Nazi. I waited in a line for about 30 minutes in the rain with homeless people begging for money to get...the Memphis Mafia. Cash only. text:
Overrated. 

If you walk on Burnside, you can smell pee mixed with the odor of fresh donuts. There are nineteen year old blonds in hotpants next to 60 year old, toothless drunks. Someone is screaming over at Dantes. This donut appeals to the clientele that prefers this scene, or else, can withstand it in exchange for a donut topped with bacon after a forty minute wait. 

Then, when you eat the donut, you think, so what? Someone paid six dollars for this? If you buy a box of donuts here, some spanger will ask you for a donut within five minutes. 

I went to Voodoo the first (and only) time with a wedding party, where the two evangelical kids tying the knot queued up happily, while I eventually lost interest and went home. The fact that church kids celebrate weddings here tells you a lot about culture in Portland at this moment, although just exactly what, I'd need more space to outline.

I am tired of seeing trendy teenyboppers, may of them from Idaho, with the pink boxes. Stop already, just stop. 
Stop.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: Amazing doughnuts. Couldn't decide, so got a dozen haha. So far all have been delicious. I love that they're always open! Best doughnuts ever and made the trip to Portland so worth it! Now excuse me while I have a sugar coma and look at the box for which one will be consumed next!!
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
If you're looking for a review of Voodoo, you know what you're looking for. 
But here's the take from a local, go to a Krispy Kreme. 
Sure you could wait in a long line for a doughnut, sure you could then overpay (CASH ONLY) for that pastry and sure then you could tell your friends when you were in Portland, you got Cheetos on a doughnut.
It's a pretty sad state too as I don't usually care about the food quality, but since the service is non existent, the food is all there is to comment on and at the very best, it stinks. 
Save your time, save your money, go to Freddies and buy a pack, then lie to all your friends. 
You have better things to waste your time with than waiting in line for 8 hour old doughnuts while you're here.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: This is definitely a place to try if you're visiting Portland. There are some times where the wait is longer but I'd just enjoy the experience. I think what makes the place are the weird combinations that make the doughnuts and maybe not the actual doughnut. I still enjoyed it and I would go back again if I were in Portland. Just a note, the doughnuts get stale the next day if you're planning to take some back home.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: Yes, you wait in long lines sometimes for a donut that is good, but certainly no better than other bakeries. It's just a fun, funky place to go. It's become a Portland tradition...why, I'm not sure. Sort of like the "Church of Elvis."

text: Lives up to the hype. The highest-quality doughnuts we've ever tasted, and inventive designs that make you sorry to eat them. Patrons actually pull out their phones to photograph the offerings.

text: Worth the hype, this place is amazing, some of the best donuts I've ever had in my life. A must stop in Portland, perfect munchie food after a night of bar hopping. I recommend the voodoo doll donut, the no name donut, and the bacon maple bar. Definitely deserving of a perfect 5 stars from Hit and Run Travel :)
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: Definitely the most decorated and biggest donut store I've ever been to! The line was about 20-25 minutes long and not as bad as the other Yelp reviews I've seen that had to wait over an hour! I can tell the other people in line were also tourists. When we got in there were so many donut options! They even had a lot of vegan options as well! I got the voodoo dolls, maple bacon bars, fruit loops, and vegan Oreos! The dough on these donuts were thick, good, and definitely fresh. I advise people to pick out which donuts they want before they get to the cashier so they don't hold up the line. My dozen came out to $27... Which is pricier than regular donut dozens but at least no tax! They are also CASH ONLY! It was a good experience to finally trying out these Voodoo Doughnuts here in Portland!
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
Voodoo Doughnuts didn't work its magic on me and I don't think it will - ever. We were greeted by the long lines that everyone keeps telling us about and when we reached the front of the line......well...

After 4 boxes (2 of which were filled with the ever-popular cock and balls) and 37 agonizing heat-filled minutes later I left as an unhappy camper. These doughnuts weren't as great, delicious, voodoo-ed out as most people claim they are. They were just....OK.

The reason I give VD 3 stars is because of the experience OUTSIDE of the doughnut shop, not what I experienced inside. We were sandwiched between a Seattle transplant and a couple were just got married and were traveling the 50 states in a just-about-to-die 1994 Ford Taurus- and their stories were sweet and admirable. Surely, if i wasn't for our ambitious adventure into Voodoo Doughnut-land we would not have met them.

I'm glad we had a chance to say "been there, done that"- but next time I'm going down to Portland it won't be because I'm dying and craving one of their unusually odd-named, bizarrely concocted doughnuts.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: This is the best place for doughnuts, but you should come here early if you want a dozen before the crowd comes. I love their doughnuts!

text:
This place is insanely cool! Love the decor and the crazy amounts of flavors. I thought the prices were pretty fair considering the donuts are made in house and the flavors are constantly rotating. 

Ordered their cream donut and a "Miami vice berry". The cream one was delicious, but the Miami vice berry had to be tossed. Even one bite was too sweet. It was just white vanilla icing with sugar coating, no berry taste :( my boyfriend got the jelly of the day, I think it was marionberry habanero. It was a lot spicier than expected!  He got another one with vanilla icing and Oreo topping and it was good but huuuuge. 

I'd say it's a hit or miss with half the flavors being bad. But I love it for being open 24/7, the novelty of the flavors and the service. A line forms but we only waited 10 minutes on a weekday morning.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: Was super drunk and got a voo doo donut After I left the bar on a Friday night line wasn't too long.... Yes it's a tourist trap but it's fun and different. Do they make 5 star donuts no... But what Is a 5 star donut anyways? They made unique donuts.... Funny and kitsch... my favorite was the "voo doo donut" or " old dirty bastard". We went twice on our little road trip to Portland. I saw it on TV on the food channel so I had to try it out. The guy that was helping us was super funny... Over 6 feet tall with pigtails... random!!!

text: Truly one of the must-visit places in Portland. They got put on the map with their untraditional donuts (NyQuil glazed, Cock n Balls, voodoo doll donut), but dang if they don't earn the hype. I had to go with the Maple Bacon and the Portland Cream (chocolate cream-filled donut). I've had maple bacon donuts from other places before, but this is by far the best. All of their ingredients and flavors just taste "REAL." You can really taste the maple in the maple icing, and the bacon strips are thin and crispy, just the right amount needed to counterbalance the maple. I think most other places tend to go crazy with the bacon, but there is such a thing as too much. The chocolate on the Portland Cream donut tasted like real chocolate, not just chocolate-flavored sugar, and the cream part had a nice dense consistency. Best of all, the "dough" part was soft and didn't taste greasy at all. The store is small but chock-full of all kinds of fun things to look at. My friend and I'd gotten there around 9am on a Saturday so there was no crowd--it was the perfect donut run :)
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: Great donuts!!! Variety is all over the place. The 2 donuts we had were fantastic. Great atmosphere as well.

text:
Great donuts with an edgy flair.  The "Memphis" is a favorite of mine and their bacon maple bars are really good since they throw on some good thick cut meat. 
Beware of the homeless people who are VERY aggressive to having you get them something. This location is really just in a bit of a rough part of town but it doesn't feel like it's unsafe in the least. Just dirty and run down neighborhood. 
The other location doesn't have this problem and actually has an indoor sitting area whereas this location does not.

text: there are 2 things to get: Bacon maple bar, or Apple fritter. They are both the best of the best. And the best time to get any of these is at MIDNIGHT! That's right, don't wait until the unwashed masses show up at 10am on Saturday or Sunday. Get them first, at night, right as they're making them! Rub elbows with drunks, prom queens, and regular people as the line winds around the store, out the door, and down the block. These doughnuts are good. And some of them are even vegan! Probably not the bacon maple bar, though.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
I am not a fan of donuts and Voodoo Doughnut was not on my list of places to visit in Portland but omg, we kept passing by it that we just had to stop by and check out the hype. There was a parking spot that was open right in front of the store so we pulled up and put in about an hour worth of metered parking.

The line was fairly long, wrapped around the railing and extended down the street...I think we waited almost an hour for it. I keep seeing people coming out with boxes on boxes of donuts but it was just me and my bff so we got 2 donuts and shared. We tried the Portland cream (too sweet to my liking) and the blueberry one (I think it was blueberry, and it was mediocre). The donuts itself were pretty expensive too considering the fact that I picked two of the less popular ones and it was still ~$4-5/donut...

I think it is only worth it if you have a big party and are willing to share all the crazy decorated donuts for a photo op. Other than that, the quality of the donuts is nothing close of spectacular and definitely not worth an hour wait. But, it is part of the tourist experience so if you have the time while exploring Portland (which I am sure you will since there isn't much to do around here..), then stop by and check it out. I believe it is cash only but there is an ATM machine nearby. And they are open 24/7 so if you don't wanna wait in line, go during non peak hours.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: Yum!  Love the maple bars with bacon.  They remind of Sunday morning pancake breakfasts when I was a kid.  When the bacon got into the syrup.  Nostalgic memories.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: It's fine, but if you want a really good doughnut, I prefer Blue Star.  Voodoo is more about the gimmick. The doughnuts are decent, and gimmicks are fine, but I just think the gimmick sometimes overshadows the doughnut itself.  That being said, I often choose the very plain doughnuts here, as I think they are way better than those that have so much theme to them.  Just my preference maybe.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
Great vibes, quirky store, and killer doughnut! The downside is this place is CASH ONLY. But they have ATMs available inside to help ya out. 
I had the GrapeApe flavor, and loved it! Sounds like it would be kind of gross, but it was actually amazing. And only $1.95! Not too shabby!

text:
Swung by Voodoo on the way to the Hair of the Dog Earth Day sale at 7am. Got a couple donuts (die die die) for myself including a bacon maple bar and then a bunch of you pickems for the party.

The donuts were a hit and I even made a second trip on my way out of town to pick some up for the ride home.

I just wish the place was easier to find. I spent a lot of time looking for it and was really close. Not sure why but I kinda expected a neon sign but I eventually found it right before I was going to give up.
