text:
Everybody told me to come however the person at the car rental place said to avoid it, that it wasn't worth the hype. 

My friends and I didn't listen and went anyways because as a tourist, you just have to do some things, no matter how overplayed. There was a line when we went in the mid-afternoon and it was lightly raining outside, it probably took about 15 minutes to finally get inside. The selection was great and they were reasonably priced ($1+ to $3 per donut). 

Looks wise, they are very aesthetically pleasing and worth the instagram photo. Cash only.
However, you do feel like you're being rushed to choose. 

IMO, you've gotta go at least once.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
Donuts are donuts no matter where you go, well most of the time. But when you go to Portland, you go to Voodoo, it's just a must! There is always a line out the door, no question. The first time I went, we picked up a mixed dozen...they lasted for days because there were so many and they were so sweet. They pick a random 12 too, so it's difficult to get what you want. We had to take the rest of the box back to San Diego, lol. 

This time around I decided I was just going to get one donut. I waited in line, took a lot longer. The register girl was sneezing and helping people...uhh gross. There was a picture of the actual voodoo donut next to a particular type of donut, can't remember the name. I ordered that particular type and then she came with it and I was mistaken...and i said Oh i thought that was the voodoo...and she was pissed cause she had to do it over. Well THANKS FOR YOUR HELP. Whatever, it's just a donut. I ate the top of the voodoo, and i enjoyed it until i realized it was jelly filled. Watch out for a gooey insides that may spill!
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
(November 18)

Line up.  Join the excitement.  Who doesn't like doughnuts?
This place is a little overwhelming and I'm a little bit OCD.  What flavors do they have, what are they sold out of?  How does this work?  How can you visit Portland and not check out Voodoo Doughnut?

While in line I coerced my companion to get a dozen so that we could keep them in the car in case we got stuck in bad weather.  After leaving Portland we headed to the falls, then to the coast, then to Seattle, then to Leavenworth, then to Tofino.  Those mountain passes can always be a little dicey in November and I just wanted to be prepared!

The line for voodoo snakes around the building.  As you get closer you can peep in the window to see the "back room", a few more steps in line and you can see inside the storefront.  Once you get past the threshold you are queued back and forth through a maze of stanchions.  I brought up the menu of flavors on my ipad.  http://voodoodoughnut.com/doughnuts.html I stressed and stressed.  I needed to pick 6/12.  I didn't want to choke when I got to the front.  I felt so much pressure.  I guess the only downfall is that you can't really tell what they have that day until you get to the front and view the spinning, tiered display of doughnuts.  Most people who go there don't have their act together and have no idea what they want or like.  

Bottom line:  I loved the doughnuts and I'm glad they are located across the country from me.  I really loved the Miami Vice Berry and Chocolate Coconut.  You really can't go wrong.  Cake doughnut, yeast doughnut, fritters, frostings, toppings, etc - they have truly inventive combinations and visiting is so much fun!
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
Mediocre doughnuts made with the same mass-produced ingredients that are supplied to Safeway.  But you get to wait in a line to get them.  They're a lose-lose proposition.  

Their one positive is that they keep the tourists away from the better shops (Blue Star) since they're now a Portland "institution".
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
Just my two cents, but if you're going to come by Voodoo for a donut, try to find something that you can appreciate more than just a regular donut topped with gobs of icing and candy/cereal. 

Mango Tango - 5/5. By far my favorite of the bunch! The mango jelly on the inside was delightful (though a bit sweet by my standards) and the tang sprinkled atop the icing/frosting was a unique twist. I'd recommend this to those who enjoy a fruity-flavored donut. 

Maple Bacon Bar - 4/5. Perhaps it's because I don't buy into the bacon trend that has swept the Sates or that I'm less inclined toward a sweet-savory combo, but IF I WERE - I'd say this was a great donut. It wasn't super sweet (much unlike the Voodoo Doll), but had a good balance between the maple icing and bacon strip.

Voodoo Doll - 3/5. Cutting into my Voodoo Doll, I was quite pleased to see it oozing out raspberry jelly from it's abdomen. Clever, really. Otherwise, I was a bit unimpressed because it was just too sweet. It really boiled down to a raspberry jelly-filled donut with extremities and lots of icing. Needless to say, I'm sure others who have more of a sweet tooth will enjoy this donut
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: Everyone said "go to voodoo doughnuts in Portland! It's the best doughnut ever!" We got a dozen doughnuts and let the staff pick them.  We were there at 5am there was no line yet. We were the first ones. We took out voodoo dozen back to the hotel and sampled each and every one. We could old take one bite out of each. The were the most dry doughnuts I had ever had. Put some stale cereal on top and its even worse. I don't understand the hype and really can't understand why people stand in line for hours for the crappiest doughnut. Seriously go to the grocery store, buy a glazed doughnut, put it in the microwave for a few seconds, sprinkle fresh cereal on top and I guarantee it will be 100 times better than voodoo.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
Without a doubt the best doughnuts in the Universe! Dirt Donut, Dirty Little Bastard, Bacon Maple Bar, and a variety of other doughnuts that one might only concocted during some altered state of mind!  

These guys are geniuses!

The place is a bit run down and the block that it's on may have a homeless person or two asking for money on it, but who cares!  Give them a buck or two, everyone can use a hand once in a while! 

Needless to say the doughnuts are worth it! They have great toppings, but they really nailed the dough. That's what makes them great!
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
I've never actually been here when I was sober so to me the Doughnuts have always tasted fantastic. They probably don't do much to help fight the hangover in the morning but who cares - its 2am and you want something sweet and this place will do the trick. 

There is a legend that they used to make doughnuts with Nyquil in them but stopped when they realized it was probably doing terrible things to all the drunks who show up there on weekends. 

Good place to take people from out of town to give them the Portland experience.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: It's a good doughnut, but despite being a local, I'm still not sure what all the fuss is about. They've certainly ridden a nice wave of publicity.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch

text: Ew. Felt like I was in line for the methadone clinic. Tweens and tweekers nervously twitching for a doughnut, made me want to curl up and hide. Despite the commonly held belief that Voodoo has the greatest donuts on Earth, these confections were heavily laced with hype. name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: This place i must say it's all about the hype. Nothing really special about this donut here. Just the names of the donuts and the shapes.. lol. The reason why I gave this place a 3 stars is because of their bacon maple donuts. Must try it! They make this perfectly! I wish they have more delicious donuts..
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: The doughnuts are good, but how wrong can you go with freshly fried cake batter?  I was expecting more from a place with such hype.  The shtick is 'clever doughnuts,' which somehow makes it OK for people who wouldn't usually eat doughnuts to do so.  But they weren't that clever.  Don't get me wrong, they taste good, but they are just doughnuts.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: Above average line. Below average clientele. Average doughnuts. Waited in queue with what appeared to be the millennial dregs of humanity. I shouldn't have. While waiting in line one can read their vulgar sexist advertisements like "good things come in a pink box". What an ingenious little pun. Wow. Certainly didn't "wet" my appetite. Or their other one "the magic is in the hole."  It's a very short walk from Powell's bookstore, but a very long distance.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: Always too long of a wait in line to get served but the doughnuts are not all that much to brag about other than the selection of varieties made.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
Overhyped. Overrated.

That is all I have to say.  Came here on a Friday night and it wasn't too crowded.  Remember, buy donuts that look like they will taste good.  Do Not buy donuts that look so dressed up because you will die from diabetes!! Foodies definitely buy food that look cool and will look amazing in a picture but that is all you will get, a cool looking picture with a toothache.  I bought a variety of donuts that look super crazy such as the captain crunch but oh man, once you take a bite into it, you will not want it.  The majority of the donuts that was purchased was just okay.  The plain ones are a lot better such as your glazed and chocolate donuts.  I hear Blue Star is way better but it was closed by the time we got there so we settled on the touristy spot for donuts.  Never coming back here.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: I was never a fan of doughnuts but this place broke me! I have to try and avoid it for the simple fact I'd blow up if I ate there every time I went into the city. Best Doughnuts I've ever eaten in my life. Very eclectic staff. Even took my 75 yr old parents and they loved it! I'd never seen my dad smile so big when they showed him his box of doughnuts. Definite must stop for anyone w/a sweet tooth or not...
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: We had to try Voodoo and see what the hype is about. Apparently there is always a super long line but I think we got lucky and there was no line. And they are open 24 hrs. Disclaimer, Im not a doughnut connoisseur by any means. The doughnuts were good but nothing special. It is cash only so make sure you bring cash we had $6 and he gave ha a free doughnut so that was super nice of him. We got to try the Voodoo Doughnut which is their famous dude shaped doughnut it had a raspberry filling. The triple chocolate was super good. And the last one was a fruit loop which was a miss.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
This place was very interesting. I don't know how to feel about it still, but a doughnut is a doughnut. The service was actually very good. The person behind the counter got us our doughnuts and even let us choose a few (they don't usually let people choose). So that was nice.

The doughnuts were just okay, though.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
When I think of my trip to Portland, I think of Voodoo doughnuts (no offense to my friend, Melissa, who I was visiting).  I was a little surprised at how small the place was, but I loved the dark and goth decor. 

I was a little overwhelmed at first because I had no idea what I wanted, but then I saw it in the glass case:  the OLD DIRTY BASTARD.  It's a yeast doughnut with chocolate frosting, crumbled oreos, and peanut butter drizzle.  MMMMMM...it was fantastic!

I also had the Captain My Captain, which is a yeast doughnut with frosting and captain crunch on top.  I LOVE cereal and I LOVE doughnuts, so this was a perfect combination.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
A very hip donut shop with a wide variety of tasty treats! Slighty spendy, but worth at least one visit.

I went with the Memphis Mafia, which is a giant banana fritter with nuts and drissled peanut butter and chocolate on top.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
A cool, hip and inexpensive doughnut shop. The line at the downtown location is always absurd, so fortunately they have multiple locations.

The doughnuts themselves are kind of crazy, ranging from the regular glazed to being topped with fruit loops or M&M's or cocoa puffs.

I DO NOT recommend the cereal covered doughnuts as the cereal is usually stale. My personal favorite is the Portland Cream.

If you're looking for a unique doughnut or want to bring a bit of joy to your coworkers at the office, head to one of the east side locations and grab a dozen.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: Average donut place. Don't really understand the hype except for the colorful toppings the taste is like any other decent donut joint!
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
Serious yum here.  I am a doughnut fan and finally made to Voodoo last time i visited Portland.  Had the maple bacon bar.  Pricey, but really it was a  whole meal...I was full for a few hours after scarfing down that sugary wonder.  

Yeah it was crowded, but how can it not be- the place is like 10'x10'    

CASH ONLY.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
I guess that if you are a tourist in Portland you may be required to visit this place. Don't get me wrong, the doughnuts are good but they're not exactly "voodoo" doughnuts, so, unless you are in the area you can skip the place, you won't miss out on anything.

Like i said, the doughnuts are good but in the average - average+ range. They do have some crazy creations and designs if you are into that... but even those are regular tasting.

If I may have a suggestion it is this: early in the morning, grab you doughnuts to go, walk south a block, grab a coffee from Stumptown roasters, then 2 more blocks to the south grab breakfast at Mother's Bistro and Bar. That right there should pretty much take care of eating for the day. :)
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: We love the dang bacon maple donuts. Good thing we live far away so we can't gave them often.  We also tried the Captain My Captain and we were not too impressed. We wanted to try the donuts covered in Butter Fingers but Portland was having a heat wave and, according to staff, the butterfingers melted. Bummer. Prepare for a long wait - up to an hour and a half.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: They are decent, but I think they are a little overrated.  It's a decent doughnut place, but not great.  I like their maple bacon doughnut, though!
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: The Mabel Maple and Bacon Maple Bars are awesome! Great experience and the line moved quickly. Especially loved carrying the big pink box back to where we were staying.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: Super touristy but super tasty! The line was incredibly long and the donuts are expensive for donuts, but you are paying for the name "VOODOO Donuts". The donuts were great! I recommend the Maple Bacon!!! YUMMY!
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: I'm not sure how to approach a review of Voodoo. Their donuts are just fine. You can get the same donut basically at any other place for 1/3 of the price. I suppose it's what you do when you come to Portland. Certianly interesting people watching and of course the status of a pink box. I guess a few of the donuts are memorable but it's really a tourist trap. I can think of 5 donut places in town with better donuts and less time waste to stand in line with annoying selfie taking humans. Go if you want to say you went but don't expect a great donut.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: I tried Voodoo Doughnuts because every time we visit Portland, we have excited questions like "Did you try it? Did you try it?" Now I can say I did. My triple chocolate treat was tasty, and I thought the staff was very friendly and cool. So yeah, I've tried it. My hubby tried the maple bacon treat and thought it was tasty. We have fulfilled our mission.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
I hate this place!!! I hope Zeus knocks it the fuck out with a big, fat, thunderbolt. 

Just kidding, just trying shorten my wait for that Ol' Dirty Bastard.

Try the new location on the east side too. 

And, keep your eyes peeled for the Hot Pink Doughnut Truck bouncing about town. Flag it down, proceed to stuff Cock and Balls in your mouth.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
i guess i have to be the bad guy and say that voodoo is NOT all that. my very first voodoo experience was in the form of the voodoo doughnut itself.   the namesake was given to me as a gift complete with my nemesis initial chicken-scratched on top. (an extra BUCK, mind you!) 

since then i have made the effort to return and try of course the famed bacon maple bar. i also got some other goodies, but funny nothing was so great about any of these doughnuts. i just don't get it. there was nothing spectacular about these doughnuts besides the fact that they are funky creative (hence the two stars, vs. one) but seriously, i've had doughnuts at smaller shops that are wayyy better. the doughnuts didn't melt in your mouth like some i've had. it almost tasted stale to be quite honest. 
it's funny how people get all excited over something that is remotely 'different.' maybe i'll start a new craze...rice with peanut butter or something...it'll be the next best thing. AND, i'll hand draw a stick figure on it for FREE.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: this place is , how i feel- always busy and poppin... ofcourse it id a tourist spot and it makes sense... i decided to try the dozen which gives voodoo donut absolute freedom to give as they choose. The donuts are delicious but.i hate to say... they arent that special. . I still give them  stars bc they are dense yet fluffy and still flavorful.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: The visit is worth the hype. Delicious Doughnuts!!! Glad that I did not have to wait in any queue! Must go when visiting Portland.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
Maple bacon bar.  Need I say more?

My only negative thought is that they are cash only.  They should accept credit cards and charge the consumer the fee (just like Arco gas stations do.)
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
Sorry guys... I'm not the biggest fan of this place...at all. The only thing this place has going for it is it's massive variety of donuts, but besides that I really, really, don't like this place. I can eat at the dingiest places, food carts, backyard restaurants, garages, basically anywhere, but I just find this place so dodgy feeling. I don't think they ever mop or wipe down tables. I didn't experience too bad of customer service, but it definitely could've been friendlier. My biggest complaint though has to be the overrated hype about the taste of the donuts here! We had a total of 6 or so donuts and each one had the same french-bread like consistency, some I swear they just slapped some sugared frosting on a loaf of stale...bread and called it a donut! Oh yeah, I hate beggars in shops.

Be careful your elbows might stick to the table and you'll never be able to leave this place!
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
Old Dirty Bastard and Voodoo Doll doughnuts were good. The quality of taste is not any better than donuts from a grocery store or an independent doughnut shop. 

Being there was more for the Portland experience as a visitor and for the creative decorations and combinations of ingredients on and inside the doughnuts.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
We went when there wasn't much of a line, and it still took thirty minutes. I've grown up here and always thought voodoo was overrated. This time my experience was better based on my choices.

If I have any advice I'd say to stick with the plain donuts, and don't get any fru fru ones. Although if you wait in line you do have to try a unique one. The maple bar was the best donut I have ever had. Yummy.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: Very much an awesome, fun, & delicious place. Can have long lines but worth It. Some events are so crazy!!
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
I was really excited to go to VDD and I'm sorry to say that I was a little disappointed. I got the cock n balls (yeast doughnut with chocolate icing and filled with cream but sorry folks, in the balls only), arnold palmer (cake doughnut with icing and powdered iced tea), the marshall something (cake doughnut with m&m's) and the maple bacon bar (yeast rectangle doughnut with maple icing and slabs of bacon on top). The most anticipated of these was the arnold palmer but it really didn't taste like iced tea. It was tangy for a second and then the taste went away and it was basically a vanilla doughnut. Sadly, I didn't get to taste the others because I handed them out, but everyone really liked the maple bacon bar. The cock n balls was pretty mediocre, but I did enjoy the texture of the doughnut. 

Definitely a must when in Portland, but next time I might stick with the more extreme versions like grape and fruit loops just because you can't be disappointed with something so creative. 

Beware that the line can be long (and it's rainy and chilly) and that there aren't any descriptions for the doughnuts. I would suggest going to the website and writing things down that you want then asking them to pick a surprise one. Also, they're pretty cheap. My items came out to $10.50.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: Good Doughnuts. They have anything you could think of putting on or in a doughnut. But if you like plain they have that too. It's in a shady part of town so don't go too late.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
Excellent donut spot in Downtown Portland. This is a cash only spot, so be prepared. The donuts are awesome looking! You most definitely would want to buy every single one.  Since I couldn't decide what to get, I had the cashier pick out a dozen for me. It ran me about $16.75. Not bad considering I got some regular and some super fancy ones. The donuts are fluffy and the perfect sweetness. 

This is a must stop when visiting Portland.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
Great experience for Portland visitors! 

Brought my brother here on his first visit to PDX- he thought it was magical. As we were waiting in line, the back door of the glitter wall opened and a fresh-baked, frosted swirly-techni-colored, warm donut appeared. The mysterious hand gave the donut to my brother, shot him a thumbs up, and then disappeared. He was floored and declared, "This is amazing! OMG- WHAT JUST HAPPENED!?" The donut was apricot filled and delicious, as well. 

Overall, Voodoo is a PDX landmark, a pastry-making icon and unique experience. Love bringing visitors here!
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: Fun experience. Our cashier didn't seem very excited to be there and wasn't the friendliest but we enjoyed the visit anyway. We purchased 6 donuts because let's face it, we probably won't be back. Of all the unique selections, our favorite was the Texass donut. Some of the other combinations are just too much but hey, you have to try them, right!?
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
This place is just as advertised, fun, eclectic, and totally different. After asking for recommendations I ended up trying the maple bar with bacon and another sprinkled with Oreos and drizzled with peanut butter. I'll admit that the donuts aren't the most amazing pastries I've ever had but I have to give this place 5 stars for it's unique creativity that has embodied my short visit to Portland. 

If I lived here, this wouldn't be a regular stop but for tourists and visitors, it's a total home run!
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
Another review of mine where I focus more on the experience than the food. There are definitely much better doughnut shops that I have been to but nothing as unique as Voodoo.

The vast array of choices and down to earth customer service makes the wait worthwhile. Make sure to get the maple bacon and the voodoo!

Tips: Go on a week day and if not possible, then earlier the better to beat tourists who leisurely stroll in around the afternoon.

Head down the street to stumptown coffee and pair with the very sweet but awesome doughnuts!
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: I don't understand all the hype! I do believe they are good but the prices are OUTLANDISH LIKE SERIOUSLY IT IS A joke some one is making way more money then they should be for a slightly above average DONUT and portlanders come running its sad!
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: Good donut, but don't see all the fuss and definitely wouldn't wait in a long line to get one of these. It's more of a novelty snack than anything else. They have a spot at Cartlandia and there's hardly ever a line, way better option than going directly to the store.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
Voodoo donuts is a PDX 'thing' that has become a tourist attraction.  The natives basically wait for the summer/holiday's to end and then partake in the unique flavor combinations.

Look folks, you eat Voodoo donuts because of their novelty (been accosted a few times by TSA when carrying the pink box with maple bacon bars through PDX or SEA security).   I have had Stan's Donuts (Westwood, CA), Randy's (off 405 Fwy, LA), Blue Star (PDX), as well as other's but none come close to the novelty combinations of Voodoo donuts.  They are all unique and everyone is unique (shape, flavor, combinations).  So a Voodoo donut is what you get when you want a real sugar fix and meet some 'interesting' folks . . . 

So if you are waiting in line for a Voodoo donut, you also probably also waited in line for an ice cream from Salt & Straw . .. need I say more.

Native's go the SE Davis location to avoid the long lines on SW 3rd (now I am in trouble).
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: Visited from Chicago and Voodoo definitely lived up to the hype for me. I bought several unique doughnuts to go and it was still delicious days later. There was one with blueberry glaze that I especially liked.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: Their donoughts are good, but there's better doughnuts, but they certainly get full points on creativity. Also, ask about their day old bucket of doughnuts. Keeps me coming back :) And the banana fritter is my favorite.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: too sweet   well they have a unique design and flavor.The  lines too long too but  for tourist it might be  interesting
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: Holy yum! This place was fantastic and I wish I could try each and every one of the doughnuts! My favorite was the No Name which reminded me slightly of puppy chow because of the rice Krispies, peanut butter, and chocolate. We got a dozen of them, but I was only able to eat a few before I was doughnut'ed out! Next time I want to get the bacon maple and the voodoo doll one!
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: Voodoo takes donuts to a completely different level. Anything goes at this hole in the wall establishment. From bacon maple to captain crunch flavored all the the way to cock and ball shaped donuts,  you're not going to find your average plain donut covered in sprinkles here. You'll also never encounter a stale donut as the deep fryers are on constantly during the 24 hours that this place is open. I'm really glad I live three hours away, otherwise, I'd definitely gain at least 15lbs from these delicious  pieces of deep fried dough.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
We went to Portland this pass weekend and went to this famous Voodoo Doughnut.  My kid has dairy allergies and cannot eat a lot of deserts because of the allergy issue but Voodoo Doughnut makes incredible delicious vegan doughnuts.  We ordered a bunch of different kinds of doughnuts for ourselves and the amazing thing is that the vegan one with cream inside was THE best.  At least per my personal taste.

I just want to say thank you to Voodoo Doughnuts for making such delicious vegan pastries and I sincerely hope that in the near future you create more variety of flavors in the vegan department.  There are thousands of people with dairy allergies and it is awesome to find things like this that we can eat for our loved ones that cannot eat dairy.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: Not sure what the big deal is with this place.  It's unique, to be sure, but the few times I've eaten here, the doughnuts were pretty stale and didn't taste fantastic.  Now I admit that I'm not a huge doughnut fan, but any fresh decent doughnut is at least on par, if not better, than these.  It's like a joke that's only funny the first time.  I guess most cities are so bland and boring that something different is cool, but this kind of thing is so common around here that I really don't get what the big deal is, and I'm certainly not willing to wait in that hellish line that usually forms when I go by.  I tried the location on Davis a couple times, hoping for a better experience, but it's just blah to me.  I've even seen people take limos to this place, strange.  But visitors seem to have fun so I'll still recommend it to outsiders.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: I got the bacon maple doughnut and it was amazing. line was long and you wait in the sun but if you go early it's short. Cute shop too.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: I'm not much of a donut person but these donuts are pretty delicious. What a great way to start your day. This bakery is so creative with their donuts they have bacon and cereal topping.  There display case even rotates. The line was pretty fast it was worth the wait.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: They're donuts with random stuff on it.  I don't understand the rave over it, just buy a normal donut and put what you want on it, haha.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
I don't know how they make the doughnuts so they're so fluffy and moist. Seriously, they did a good job researching and making quality dough.

And their doughnuts are fun, and cool, and some are gross but most are yummy. It's different, it's weird, but it's also really, really good. You gotta give it 5 stars because it makes itself memorable by both being kitzchy and delicious at the same time.

You need to know when and when not to go to avoid a line. And their doughnuts actually keep pretty well - they are still delicious about three days later.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
Honestly, I think this place is totally overrated.  I had seen this shop featured on the Food Network and I was super intrigued.  Bacon on a maple bar? Genius!!  My friends and I decided to come here around 8 p.m. and this place was bustling.  It was really hard to find parking in the nearby vicinity so we ended up paying $10 to park for about 30 minutes.  Ridiculous.  

When we arrived at the store, the line wrapped around the corner.  The line didn't take super long but I thought that it was kind of silly to wait in line of donuts.  I picked out the maple bar with bacon and a jelly filled donut.  Seriously, the donuts weren't all that spectacular, taste wise.  It was okay...  In fact, the inside of the store is kind of grungy and dirty looking.  Perhaps this is because so many people frequent this store.  I didn't think this donut store was all that special.  

However, the outside patio area was nice.  It was well lit and there were picnic benches where you could plant yourself while enjoying your donut.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: The actually donut is truly great. People working there are edgy and lines are long, but move fast. Knowing this, you'll be treated to great food. Bacon maple, captain crunch are amazing. Many imitations but these are the originals and best
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
Slightly overrated in my
Opinion but a must if you go to Portland. 

I love donuts just as much as the next guy so I was excited to finally try this place. The flavors are delightfully creative but the execution was not as good. This place is popular more for the hype rather than the product itself. To be honest I think that Bluestar donuts actually has better donuts. And the best part about Bluestar is that there are no lines unlike voodoo donuts. Even though I was not that impressed by this place compared to most people I must say, I have to give them credit because they are the ones that started this whole donut trend in the first place.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
I want to give a four star, but since I was there last they've expanded. Which I can understand as its a growing business, but seems doughnut quality has gone down with the need for quantity. Still a freak show of a doughnut selection and the gal helping me was very nice at 10pm, so I'll go 3.78 stars.  

Be prepared as there ALWAYS seems to be a line. Stop talking about what you might have, and get ready to order!! Standing at the till still 'thinking' irritates everyone!!  Just sayin'.....

text: So fun and so delicious!  We waited maybe 20 minutes tops to get in and out with our delicious donuts.  I got the Maple Bacon bar and a seasonal Pumpkin donut, then my hubby also got the Maple Bacon bar and a VooDoo Doll Donut. They were all spectacular. The bacon on the bar was cooked perfectly for donut consumption. I was afraid that it would fall apart or it would be difficult to chew and I'd end up not being able to bite off just one bit, but nope! It was perfect! My pumpkin donut was wonderful. It was a cake donut that was nice and dense :D The voodoo doll was adorable and the hubby let me have a bite. Also delicious!  We can't wait to come back and try everything else!

text: It was ehhhh ok, I would not stand in line again.  The maple bacon and grape ape were  good.  Double Bubble, dirty old bastard, Marshall Mathers, and vanilla sprinkle were nothing to write home about.  If you want some good people watching and in the area go for it.  Don't make a special trip.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
Voodoo is an experience.  It may not be for everybody, but I can get past the suggestive and naughty themes of some of their wares to judge their donuts on their own merits.  The true acid test, in my opinion, of any donut shop is to taste their raised, glazed variety.  Voodoo has this down pat!  Slightly firm and doughy, but very airy and soft at the same time.  The flavor is spot-on, and their size is definitely on the generous side.

How are their other varieties?  All of the raised varieties I've tasted, with rare exception, are excellent.  Voodoo is a VERY busy place, so they have a high turnaround, so you're almost guaranteed that what you're getting is EXTREMELY fresh.  Overall, Voodoo offers the best donuts I've had in Oregon.

Why only four stars, if their donuts are so good?  There are a few issues that detract from the perfect rating.

First, they only take cash.  This requires a trip to my credit union if I want to avoid the high charge for use of their ATM.

Second, you may not be able to get in when you want.  On my second visit, they had a "private" wedding going on, so we were not allowed to go in.  This irritated me enough to almost not want to come back again.

Third, you pay a BIG premium if you want to pick what donuts you get.  Seriously.  If you order a dozen (you can get a few different pricing tiers of dozens...ranging from about $13 for all cake donuts to $23 for a "signature" assortment), they pick all of the donuts.  You can get any variety you want, they just charge you per piece, and they're really overpriced.

Fourth, some of their donuts border on "ridiculous".  Any of them with oreo pieces, breakfast cereal, etc, results in the topping getting soggy from moisture encroachment from the frosting.

Overall, Voodoo is an EXCELLENT donut shop.  Their pretentious nature is offputting enough to miss the perfect mark, though.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
Tourist trap? Yes. Just OK donuts? I'd say so.

Just came back from Portland and finally tried the world famous Voodoo Donuts.  Surprisingly, there was pretty much no line at 9p on a Friday.  Maybe everyone is too busy at this time prepping to party, but I'm not complaining. Got in and out of there in 15 minutes with a few donuts.  Since I was stuffed from eating dinner, I opted to get one and eat one the next day.  We got a few donuts including the berry crunch, voodoo doll, maple bacon and neopolitian.

My girlfriend and I ate them all and we came to the conclusion that they were just alright.  There's nothing extremely special about them, although we cannot say they were bad donuts.  They were just.... OK.

The pricing isn't cheap, so be prepared to drop 2 to 3 bucks on a donut.  Go once to check it out but that's all you really need I'd say.  You know someone is going to ask you if you went anyways after you come back from Portland.  Don't be that asshole who didn't go cause you "wanted to live like a local" LOL.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
This place has over 300 reviews and a four stars average for a reason. Holy crap, kids-- VEGAN DOUGHNUTS!

Of course vegan doughnuts are only part of what Voodoo Doughnuts has to offer, but it's the most important part, damn it! I walked in not all that hungry and graciously let a vegan powdered jelly doughnut pass my lips, but a few minutes later I ran back for a chocolate covered doughnut in a panic. I mean, when am I going to be this close to a vegan doughnut again?! Three stars for the powdered doughnut that was a little firm and not squishy enough. Five stars for the orgasm inducing chocolate doughnut. It was totally worth the weird looks from my friends as let my eyes roll back into my head as the Voodoo spirit possessed me.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: Love the doughnuts at Voodoo!  I've been here many times and have to say that the Dirt Doughnut is my personal favorite!  The mixture of plump, pillowy soft cloud with the crisp, chocolaty Oreo fragments is del del!  I've crammed many in the cram-hole in my face and will hopefully cram many more.

text: Gooey gobs of cream filling, Bacon maple bars, coco puffs, oh my! Our family favorite since day one! We have often gone mid morning during the week, and surprisingly, find no line. Downside: the begging plethora of bums awaiting your departure with a bag full of sugary goodness. :/

text: Maple Bacon. That's all I have to say. No need for anything else for breakfast except for a cup of tea or coffee in the other hand. After watching Anthony Bourdain's episode of Portland I was craving a bite of that famous doughnut. We went on a Tuesday morning at 10am and there was still a line. Definitely expect to wait, but it's well worth it. And there's so many treats to taste. If you're one who needs to check out these freaky-sounding morning bites, there's a case to display them all so you can choose what you want. I'll take another trip to Portland just to go back to Voodoo.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: Most overrated donuts on earth. Stale crappy quality donuts that all the tourists fawn over because they have cereal on top or a slice of nasty, old bacon.

text: Average doughnuts, but I give them an extra star for creativity.  We went fairly early on a Saturday morning so we got good parking and there really wasn't a line.  Visiting from LA, we had to at least check it out, but it's definitely not a repeat destination if you have search for parking and wait in a long line.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
Really, the only thing we knew about Portland was Voodoo Doughnuts and the quirkiness shown in Portlandia. Sorry, we're from Chicago, but those were the only two things we even knew about Oregon in general. So when we got to Portland, the number one thing on the list was Voodoo Doughnuts. We knew it was a tourist trap going in, but I didn't expect it to be this bad.

The line was not tremendously long, but we did have to wait in the rain for about five minutes before we were allowed inside. That's understandable- it's hyped up, and there has to be some wait even on an early Sunday morning. When we got in, we saw what we had seen on the shows before: the decor, the atmosphere, and, of course, the doughnuts.

The service was nice, and we got out quickly despite the immense wait we saw. We didn't really know what we wanted, but we picked whatever we saw that looked appealing to some groggy travelers.

Fast forward to the hotel, where we started eating the donuts. The first thing that overcame our senses was staleness and loads of sugar. The shop is open 24/7, so the donuts were clearly about a couple days old. They had the texture of about a day old munchkin from Dunkin Donuts, not so hard as a rock but just hard enough to make anyone be like "woah, this is stale." The sugar was another big problem. One donut alone probably had all of the sugar recommended in a daily diet. The recipe must have called for one bag of sugar per donut. To top it off, the donuts gave me E-Coli, not a fun thing to have when you're driving down the 101 South through the redwoods.

So, I guess it boils down to "Would I come back if I was back in Portland?" And that answer is a definite no. Maybe I'm being a bit biased because of the fact I got sick from the batch of donuts I ate, but the donuts were NOT worth the hype or money spent on them. Their aesthetic is pleasing, and I can see why it got popular, but something went drastically wrong when we were there. Overall, I give a 1.5/5, but I rounded up to be nice!
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
Spent the weekend in Portland and had heard Voodoo Doughnut had all these crazy donuts, one of which was a bacon maple bar.  I had to see what all the rage was about.  I went on a Sunday late morning and there was a line snaking along the front.  After standing and waiting in line for about 20 min watching customer after customer come out of the store with a large pink box of doughnuts and smiles on their face I realized the signs that read CASH ONLY.  Seriously?  This was a surprise to many as they came close to entering.  Luckily there is an ATM, so you can eat the bank fees on top of your treats.  

Once inside, the cashier was simply not in the mood to be there. The doughnut options are spinning in displays but nothing to indicate what they are exactly.  Luckily there were a few floating menus out front, none of which made it to me, and an app online to read the selections beforehand.  The list is long, the options are so bizarre they require serious study, and frankly my memory is not THAT good.  I refuse to pay ATM fees and limited my order to whatever cash we had on hand the few doughnut options I was able to remember.  The price tag is appropriate for an over-sized popular novelty at the level of your run of the mill tourist trap.  

The result, good doughnut.  Seemed fresh from that morning, they were nice and doughy inside.  I'm glad I came, but I don't need to return.  I come to Portland often and this will not be a regular stop.  The parts that stuck with me the most: long line; poor customer service; high price tag; and a business more interested in avoiding taxes than offering the convenience of accepting credit cards to their customers.  I know for me, I would've bought way more than necessary and charged it rather than work within the limits of cash in my pocket.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
I brought a family member here during their visit to the NW- as it is of course an 'iconic' Portland establishment.  It was my first time trying Voodoo too.
Let's just say that the donuts were so sweet we both found them nearly inedible.

If you are having a donut craving, there are much better donut shops in town.  Try Blue Star donuts for starters.

text: I shared a bacon maple donut with my hubby and it was yummy! I would definitely recommend a stop if you don't mind waiting. The line was definitely long, but the neighborhood is very lively so was fun watching all of the people go by while we waited.

text: I wasn't sure about waiting in line for 45 minutes for a doughnut, and I thought it might just be a quirky tourist trap. My favorite was the Arnold Palmer which is made with lemonade powder. A little disappointed that they ran out of the bacon maple bars, but I will definitely go back next time I am in Portland.

text:
Came on Christmas Eve when it was lightly snowing and there was no line. Walked right in and got to order immediately.

The server was so rude. We just asked if he could make a recommendation but he told us just to get the mystery dozen and he would pick them. He wouldn't tell us what the donut prices were, and when I asked him to tell us what he put in the box, he just opened the box and asked us if that was good. I asked him again if he could tell us what each was (maybe I wasn't specific enough??) and he said that the donuts are what they look like. .... ok, jerk. Happy holidays to you too. 

The donuts are good but if I'm not in a position to learn about them because of dietary restrictions we have, I'm not comfortable coming back again.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch

text: Though I hardly have a sweet tooth, I wanted to order their donuts for the first time specifically because of their dessert idea and presentation. Even their exterior building had a unique and slight sinister appearance which made it somewhat enjoyable to look being the fact that the wait was ridiculously long. However, I don't think I would go there again as my first experience was ample and their donuts were adequate.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch

text: donuts are 5 stars....staff 1, maybe 2 stars.  They need to get over themselves and learn some customer service skills.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
What an overrated place. Other than our stop at Voodoo, we had a great time in Portland. The reason we stopped by was we were at the Saturday Market next block and my wife saw this big line. Both of us are Donut fans so without much thought we joined the big line.

Our first shocker came at how rude the serving lady was. She was the only rude person we met on our entire trip. I am personally very impressed by how fun and laid back Portland people are. My wife told her that this was her first time at Voodoo and asked what their most famous donuts were. The server just made a very fed up face as if she would rather be somewhere else before giving a very generic 'depends on what you like' response.

Anyways, after we bought the donuts, we were shocked to find them completely cold. Who goes to a donut shop to eat cold donuts?! Also, both the donuts we tried (Portland Cream and Raspberry Romeo) were absolute rubbish even though we were starving. 

We loved Portland and every other restaurant or food-cart we ate at. Voodoo was the only and surprising disappointment given the line. Maybe they were just having a bad day. But we are never going back. 

Sidenote - the best Doughnuts we have had were at Gourdough's Donuts in Austin, Tx
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
The donuts here are creative, delicious and becoming a city export...I have yet to visit the PDX airport without seeing at least 1 pink box!

My only complaint is that they're a little overpriced AND it's not any cheaper to order a dozen donuts of your own selection! It probably because the prices vary so much, but having a deal would be more incentive to purchase a lot of donuts at once!

My personal favorite is the Portland Cream Donut, it's got a custard-like filling that's very creamy and just the right amount of sweetness. They're fritters are good as well, and they're the size of a baseball glove!

If you're in Portland, it's definitely worth a visit!
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
The Dish: I might be a bit biased because I don't have the hugest sweet tooth, but the 1-hour wait was not worth it. I think the voodoo doll is worth it but the Voodoo dozen - no. First of all, don't be stupid like we were - don't try to split 13 donuts (dozen + voodoo doll) between 2 people. Also, if you are, be ready to eat them so you don't throw them all away after 4 days because you can't finish them. The flavors are interesting, but nothing that made me like donuts any more or less. My friend warned me that it wasn't anything special - I wish I believed her.

Ambience: It's really hip and hipster (just like the rest of Portland).
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: This was a must on our honeymoon checklist and we are so glad we went. We stopped in on a Monday evening and there was a short line. We got to see a couple challenges (to eat a giant donut in 1 min 20 secs) and all failed. The atmosphere was great though - everyone cheered the challengers on. We got a voodoo box - so the cashier picked our donuts except we ordered the maple bacon bar just to be sure! All of the donuts are amazing. The maple donut with custard filling has to be my favorite so far - the custard was light like no other custard I've had before.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch

text:
Overrated, overrated, and overrated.
Doughnuts are just doughnuts. They look colorful and unique but there's nothing special when it comes to flavor. 
One star is for their ghetto cashier. She was playing a game with her smartphone while we're paying.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch

text: Don't miss this place! It is worth the wait. BEST donuts ever! You will be drooling over them. Make sure to pick up a bacon maple. Friendly staff.

text: Umm delicious doughnuts! The line is usually quite long but definitely worth trying especially if you happen to be in Portland! The doughnuts are really sweet and delicious! Although I don't recommend eating a bunch of em at once since they are really sweet and has a lot of sugar. I'll definitely come back here in some time!
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
That was one fine chocolate cruller - which is one of my favorite kinds of doughnuts.

I wasn't actively seeking Voodoo. I was going to the Food Truck Mecca (FTM) on 3rd street. I parked and looked up and I was smack in front of Voodoo. This little stretch of street is amazing - Western clothes store, Stumptown Roasters Coffee, Bijou Cafe, strip club and about 1 dozen or more "permanent" food trucks - including lots of Asian, waffles and Italian cuisine. $1.60 per hour for parking - its like a foodie Disney Land.

Oh...the doughnuts. I have 23 left (I'm sharing), so I'll have a better idea if they stand up when I try one that's cake-based. I'm sure the cinnamon sugar or the chocolate frosted with a coco-puff coating will be great!

Note to self: go to places that are highly rated during really crappy weather - like today. No lines at all so you don't feel like a tourista.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: There's not much to say about Voodoo that hasn't been said before.  Get yourself there and if you don't want to wait in line for the SW version then jet over to the other side of the river for a less busy experience.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
I'm going to start this off by saying that maybe I just don't get it. I can't understand the hype surrounding Voodoo Doughnut for the life of me. I ordered a Old Dirty Bastard and well....it tasted old and dirty. The doughnut wasn't stale perse, but it certainly didn't taste fresh by any means. I grew up just outside of Chicago and maybe it's just because of what I've been exposed to, but nothing about Voodoo Doughnuts screams "HEY! Wait in line for over half an hour for a doughnut that probably won't come close to the greatest thing you've ever had". Voodoo is way too overhyped and it's sad how much people build up this place. Their doughnuts are mainly all unique and have clever names, but Voodoo Doughnut is nothing more than gimmicky crap. 

If you want to wait in a long line for a doughnut that is loaded with sugar, tastes subpar, and has a gimmicky name then be my guest.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
Great place to go if you have family in town. Their donuts are always delicious and the prices are so great for what you're getting. 

I personally prefer the one on the east side, just because the lines are way better, but the atmosphere is great at either one.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
I'm a definite fan of Voodoo Donuts, downtown, since 2004 when my daughter was one of the first people to get married under the huge glazed donut on the wall.  It was one of the best marriage ceremonies ever....one of great fun and cheer.

Expect a wait when you go.  Oh. And to give yourself time to find a parking space.  I really think that the wait is part of the charm of the place.  One gets to hear people talk about Voodoo Donuts:  what to expect, when they first heard about it, what they're going to choose and they look around and always find something that I've never seen before.

The counter attendants like to rush it a bit to accommodate the long line of people, often waiting in the rain or the snow.  It's good to know what you will order, but they will help you out, if you need it.

I usually order the Voodoo Dozen, now raised to $10.50, and a voodoo man (with jelly guts) and a Tex-Ass glazed donut.  The most famous donuts are the maple/bacon,  the cock and balls, the Memphis Mafia and the huge Tex-Ass.  Sometimes I order a Stumptown coffee, but at 12:00-1:00 a.m. they usually have a hard time keeping it hot in their thermoses.

You will usually find street kids begging for a donut as you walk to your car.  I always give them one, with no problem to it. 

This will be a wonderful Portland experience.  It's fun, colorful both in the donuts and the varying classes of street people.  It's safe and I always see people from other countries partaking in this little slice of Portland.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: While the texture of the donuts is chewy and wonderful, the frosting is straight-up Betty Crocker.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: Boring, just sugar no flavors, and out of towners who think its amazing.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
Who'd a thunk a business model centered around middle school  inuendo, cereal, peanut butter, bacon, the phallus, and feeding drunkards after midnight could be become a Portland institution. 

Oh wait. 

Much (too much?) talk has been paid to the signature bacon maple bar, while overlooking what is (IMHO) Voodoo's true gloire: The Apple Fritter. It's gigantic, it's decedant, it's um - apple-y?

Beyond being a dirty little gem, Voodoo rocks as a vendor. Their products are consistent, delivery drivers are on time and friendly, and the products sell.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
The line up outside on a Saturday before noon was half a block down. Thankfully it was dry in the morning compared to the raining cats and dogs weather the day before. This tiny shop is very colorful inside. Nothing matches. It's the kitsch that actually works! I first heard of this place on a Food Network show called "Strange Eats." I can't eat anything here due to certain dietary restrictions, however, it was still cool to stop into a donut shop that is a trademark in Portland. I did have a bit of the donut of the guy I am dating but not a full donut.

The Line up was an hour, however, the line was made faster 'cause we bumped into a guy named Jake from Alabama so we had a bit of a comedy hour between him and I about stereotypes that made most in line laugh.

The donuts are in a show case that spins like a high end jewelry show case....but better 'cause these rings can be eaten (or put on the finger). 

Each donut is uniquely decorated. It's all your favorite junk foods and things in your pantry on a donut. 

The magic is in the hole....they even have cream filled donuts where the real cream magic is in the hole (yes I totally went there).  

The guy I am dating was in heaven with his maple bacon donut...fit for a Canadian. 
The donuts themselves taste like any other donuts, however, you come here for the donut art and fun.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
We waited in line last Saturday at Voodoo Doughnut, home of the Bacon Maple Bar. We waited about 45 minutes to get to the head of the line. We thought about going to their other location, across the bridge and about 15 blocks away, but we were there so we waited. This is one of the places that Anthony Bourdain visited on his Portland trip ("maple and bacon, what's not to like?") It is unusual inside; one wall is covered in newspaper obituaries of various celebrities; the ATM is even decorated in theme.

The bar is a generic but good risen bar. The maple frosting is very thick, and forms a substantial layer between the bacon and bar. It's very sweet-complaints about excessive sweetness are somewhat justified, but it's a good kind of sweet.

The bacon was quite good, a little chewier than I liked for the application but still on the right side of the chewy-crisp boundary. The maple and bacon worked well together. I could see doing a cake this way, or maybe cupcakes.

Herself also got a plain raised chocolate, which she pronounced very good. I tried a thing called an Old Dirty Bastard, a raised cake donut with peanuts, peanut butter (I think), and melted chocolate on top and running (hardened, as around a candy) down the sides. Very good, very rich.

The Bacon Maple Bar was $2.25; the plain chocolate was $0.90.

Would we do it again? I might try the alternate location for a somewhat shorter line. I wouldn't try it late at night, when the line is reported to dip to only 15 minutes or so.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: oh quirky favorite, how do you come up with this crazy stuff?  I love everything about this place, except the line.   Voodoo Doll....Bacon Maple... love it.   Don't know if the NE store still has a patio of ridiculous chairs but it is always interesting.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
Voodoo doughnuts  is, acceptabove all,an experience.  I was there at 7 am )it's 24 hours) and there was a line of ten people.  At 12 noon the line was 50.  I loved the 7 am experience...a little coffee place was across the courtyard. I sat eating half a maple bar and half a voodoo guy, drinking my coffee and watching the show.  
Voodoo donuts might be slightly over rated.  The donuts are large and sweet and creative..but they are donuts.  Will they cure your cancer or have sex with you?  No,but I will say that walking in and seeing the amazing array of colorful dough products,filled with froot loops, or captain crunch,or bacon...It is like the Willy Wonka factory filled with fried goodies.
They only take cash...if   you want to avoid a panic,make your decsion while waiting at the door...
I would say go,but don't hang every expectation on it.  Take it in, look to the wall that says keep portland weird and realize you are keeping weird by being there.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
Very unique donuts... Like super bizarre. Lots of donuts with cereal on them. But we walked in and decided to get the voo doo dozen so we could try some. The guy at the counter was super fun and helpful. He told us about some of his favorite donuts. Like the tex-ass donuts that is huge and the cock-n-balls donuts that you can imagine the shape. 

My husband and I ate only one donut each so far. And they were both good. I recommend checking them out for a unique take on your average donut. :-)
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: Going to Voodoo Donuts was a neat experience but it doesn't live up to its name. However, I rated it 4 stars because although the donuts weren't warm, or even "good enough to write home about" taste-wise, they were good, they were a perfect balance of sweet, (where I didn't get a stomach ache or feel bad afterwards) and they were definitely fun to look at. The store was also super entertaining to look at, the music was fun, the service was good (even with them being super busy with customers all the time, they didn't make you wait more than a minute to buzz you into the bathroom) and even with the long lines, they were pretty speedy. Overall, it doesn't live up to the hype but besides the expectation, which can be silly to have anyways, it's definitely worth a stop! P.S The Portland Creme is very good!
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: We managed to hit this place when the line wasn't too long. Reminds me of the line at Molly Moo's in Seattle when it first opened. Mostly tourists here it seems, because the guy trying to find Oregon voters to sign his petition wasn't having much luck. There were some pretty interesting flavors, but in the end all I tried was plain cinnamon sugar cake donut because my wife doesn't go far the super sweet ones. That was tasty, nice and light. My kids gobbled their donuts very quickly and gave two thumbs up.

text: So, the doughnuts are amazing. But expect to be hounded by the hobo druggies that linger outside as you wait in line. This is definitely not an area of Portland that I would take my young kids, but my hubby and I visit quite a bit. The maple bacon will rock your socks! text:
I came around 2-3 PM on a Saturday and there was a long line outside, even with the rain. It took about 1/2 an hour to get in and out of Voodoo Doughnut.

We got a box of assorted donuts and it cost about $18 total. I was really disappointed that they ran out of the Maple Bacon doughnut and a lot of the other kinds of doughnuts we wanted were sold out too.

The donuts are definitely made for sharing because each one is big and really sweet so it's hard to finish in one sitting. I really liked all the donuts with the chocolate and peanut butter drizzled on top. There was an interesting pink bubble gum doughnut that actually tasted like bubble gum, swallowing it seemed a little wrong..

Bottom Line: I was disappointed since the store ran out of all the flavors I wanted to try. The doughnuts are too sweet in it's entirety, so share with a friend!

text:
Being a native to Portland all my life I never would have ventured into this place had it not been for the long lines. Surely something this demanded had to be of good quality? Wrong. I've had better (and fresher) doughnuts from a grocery store bakery. 

The only reason for two stars is because they have made bacon maple bars revolutionary to other spots that I enjoy much better.

If you're into waiting in line forever for the experience of being rushed out the door quickly by overwhelmed staff and novelty, then by all means, this is what you've been looking for. The only plus side of this place is the dozens of drunk tourists and gutter punks who like to give out free eats from day old 5 gallon buckets if you happen to be passing by at night and are hungry. 
In reality there's only two words that come to mind when I see this place- tourist trap.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
Lived up the HYPE! We were not disappointed! Being new to Portland we had to stop by for a bite, we walked from downtown waterfront to VooDoo. I know craziness but we wanted to explore Portland. Well worth the 45min + walking adventure. We stopped in on a Thursday afternoon around 2-3pm and on Friday 13th around 1-2 NO LINES! I was preparing myself to wait for hours but no lines out the door. 

First round we tried only one it was the ODB : Old Dirty Bastard Doughnut Raised yeast doughnut with chocolate frosting, Oreo's and peanut butter. Sounds crazy but it works so well together! I don't know how they come up with these flavors but please don't stop! It was 88 degrees outside but we devoured that donut before it even had time to melt outside.

Round two day two in Portland. We decided to order a few to go this time. It's Friday 13th we had to get their classic raspberry filled voodoo doll donut, Butterfingering Doughnut: Chocolate cake doughnut with vanilla frosting and Buttefinger crumbles, No Name Doughnut: Raised yeast doughnut with chocolate frosting, rice krispies and peanut butter!, and last but not least the Memphis Mafia Doughnut: Fried dough with banana chunks and cinnamon sugar covered in a glaze with chocolate frosting, peanut butter, peanuts and chocolate chips on top! I'm not a fritter fan but the mafia was amazing with the banana chunks. It's pretty messy but which donut isn't messy! We loved every donut!

I've bookmarked this location 3 times it was one of the highlights on our Portland trip!
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
OMG, AMAZING DOUGHNUTS. Such an awesome place. It's been so long since i've been here, but the last time was amazing.
You can't go wrong with any of the donuts here.
The only thing problem is the line for this place, it can get pretty long during different parts of the day.

text: Don't be intimidated by the lines; they move relatively quickly. And it's worth the wait once you take that first bite and the donut melts in your mouth. The design and decor are really cute!
