text:
I was blown away by the creativity and variety of selection, however the taste not so much. It meets the average doughnut expectation, but if your asking of the freshness of the quality, it just wasn't there. It really is all about the hype here at Voodoo. If you haven't eaten a doughnut here, you aren't missing out on much. You can simply go to your local grocery store, pick up a box of cereal, grab a glazed or chocolate doughnut from your local doughnut shop, and throw everything together. Thats just how i feel. Overall, it was a good experience visiting both locations. 

Hungry and don't want to pay for a doughnut? Do the Tex-ASS doughnut challenge. Six regular doughnuts formed into one big Ass glazed doughnut! you have 80 seconds to finish it otherwise you pay for it. Fortunately for me, I DID IT!
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
CASH ONLY CASH ONLY CASH ONLY
ATM inside but with a fee of course

I go to Voodoo probably once a week downtown, and once a week to their eastside location. 

If your not from Portland you'll be shell shocked when you go to the downtown location. It's great seeing the tourists but here's some advice.

Just get a VooDoo Dozen because you can then try 12-13 of their donuts instead of taking foreverrr to figure out what you want!

I love the TexAss but my new favorite thing is to get the "tip donut" (whatever they made up) at their eastside location. If you want to sit down, go to that one. If you want a Portland exp., go downtown. I think the Portland Walking Tours even goes there. 

Always gonna be a line so don't complain and please, please, please, if you're not from our city, don't gawk at the homeless and hippy crowds. They're awesome and usually provide a great conversation. Buy them a donut. KEEP PORTLAND WEIRD
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
I got a box of 8...unfortunately, despite the uniqueness of the media, packaging and flavor topping combos...the doughnuts were mostly stale and less vibrant with freshness, texture and flavor than their rival I tried the same morning: Blue Star (DO NOT SLEEP ON BLUE STAR!).
I had two Memphis Mafias (banana fritter with chocolate and pb topping), a bacon maple, PB Oreo, cream cheese peach fritter, mango guava jelly, lemon iced marionberry filled, and an "eclipsicle" doughnut (chocolate iced with orange cream filling). 

-Memphis Mafias (banana fritter with chocolate and pb topping: banana chunks weren't very detectable, at all, which was a let down. I'm thinking they wee mashed and blended into the batter but don't expect to have sweet banana chunks. The peanut butter overwhelms the rest of the fritter flavoring. Would not rebuy again.
-Bacon maple: strips of bacon were stale and dry. Maple was less than mediocre. Wouldn't rebuy and didn't even finish eating.
-PB Oreo: cookies were stale and soft--obviously the doughnut had been sitting for hours. Total let down. I've had better from chain doughnut shots and would not rebuy from Voodoo.
-Cream cheese peach fritter: fantastic peach chunks with the blend of slightly salty and tart cream cheese. This was a win.
-Mango guava jelly: fun salty tang on top paired with the unique guava jelly. Would rebuy and was a fun twist.
-Lemon iced marionberry filled:fun and tart topping but the filling was lackadaisical and bland. Definitely a lack of clean punch to tie it all together. Wouldn't necessarily rebuy...
-"eclipsicle" doughnut (chocolate iced with orange cream filling) this was a fun take, but the mixing of flavors could leave you feeling ill as there's an essence of medicine flavoring that I can't place.
Overall: fun tourist experience...don't wait too long, TAKE CASH ONLY, don't have high expectations, and follow up for a better experience at Blue Star!!
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: Blue Star is much better. Doughnuts with stale cereal on top and a maple bar with a piece of bacon on top, how creative.

text:
On fait un peu la queue, carrément meme,

un samedi soir de juillet.
(A la fois Portland c'est tellement cool que meme une queue pour un doughnut c'est d'la balle).

Après, il faut choisir! Des noms rocambolesques pas toujours compréhensibles pour des non natifs, vulgos et bien délires, quand on se fait expliquer, on regrette que la France ne soit pas plus audacieuse dans ses parfums et noms de beignets...

et là, tu manges ton doughnut, et juste le reste de la terre n'existe plus.

Tu prends l'équivalent de 10ans de graisse et de sucre, mais tu t'en fiches parce que ton doughnut érable bacon, et ta Voodoo Doll (une petite poupée au chocolat avec un stick en bretzel que si lui ouvres le bide elle saigne de la confiture) , ben ton doughtnut, là, il te restera en mémoire pour le reste de ta vie. Et une fois quitté Portland, tu veux juste faire aucun autre voyage que de retourner làbas. Et de manger ces putains de beignets.

La petite boite rose inoubliable. Un grand moment dans ma vie.
Et dans mes cuisses aussi !
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
over-rated. Good, but not oh-my-god-foodgasm good. I wouldn't go out of my way. Too sweet half the time and not any better than deli doughnuts any way.

I do appreciate that it has vegan options. Sure, they have some interesting combos and they are very delicious, but it's not worth the line, crowd, or smell of said crowd. It's a nice closer to a long night and definitely is at a section of downtown that is depressing. I've suffered to avoid using their restrooms. Do not get the day-old bucket. My prof inexplicably loves it...but...it's exactly as tasty as it sounds.

I prefer its other location that's more like a cafe where you can actually hang out with folks.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:

text:
I've tried these doughnut twice now. The first time was in CA and they were brought in to my work by a coworker who had them brought in from Portland that evening. They were alright, I thought maybe because of the travel time. 

The second (and final) time my husband, friends and I visited on a Saturday morning around 8am. The line hadn't started yet, so that was nice. I figured being there still fairly early they would be fresh. Not so much. We ordered the Captain Crunch, maple bacon, massive banana bear claw and a simple chocolate frosted one. Overall they were all very mediocre and tasted a little stale. They are definitely not worth the price for what you get. This place is way overrated and in my opinion isn't even worth it for the experience. Oh and they only accept cash. meh.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: I do think this is a tourist trap, the line was out the door in the morning but moved along fairly quickly.  The donuts were a little too crazy for me and if you're from SJ it'll be similar to Psycho Donuts.  Cool to visit plus the "keep portland weird" sign is outside.  I still had to check out what the hype was because Voodoo is such a Portland legend and now I can say I've been here.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: The line was wrapped around the block but it was worth it.  Such a great selection of fancy donuts - my peanut butter donut won my heart after one bite!
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch

text: I mean c'mon, it's Voodoo. This place is of course good. Never disapointed in the freshness or flavor. Jsut the line.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: Yes, it's worth the hype.  This isn't just a tourist trap - the doughnuts are damn good.  Emphasizing the "dough" in the name, the raised yeast doughnuts are thick and fluffy, you can actually "feel" the calories before you take your first bite.  We ordered a dozen and it took us about 4 days to eat them all.  My favorites are the Portland Cream (thick, tasty doughnut with real yellow cream filling, semi-sweet chocolate icing, and two simple little eyes staring back at me) and the Bacon Maple (thick slices of bacon atop a maple bar - I've had bacon maple donuts before, but Voodoo has perfected the taste combination, balancing salty and sweet at just the right levels).  I appreciate the inventiveness of the Captain My Captain and the Loop, but I'm not a fan of commercial cereal on top of a donut, so I let my family scarf those down.  Shout out to the Gay Bar for a perfect combination of cream and white icing (even with a few fruit loops on top) and the Voodoo Doll and its shockingly sweet raspberry filling.  This is a definite must-try in Portland, and I'll be back, as soon as my pancreas recovers...
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: This is a must stop when you're in portland. The donuts are amazing. You can smell them a mile away. I fell in love with these donuts so much I brought a box back to California with me. It doesn't matter which donut you get you won't be disappointed. The staff was very friendly. The lines are always long but it is well worth the wait. Definitely coming back here!
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
Voodoo, you are fun and I enjoyed you.

Your mouth just waters as you stand in line. They have an endless variety, and it's so hard to simply choose a few! I would say go in and buy dozens. It's worth it and they really hold up well the next day! Who doesn't love sweet surprises in pink boxes?!

The voodoo donut was so charming. He had a pretzel stick sticking into him, and oozed red jelly when you bit into him. The maple-bacon donut is YUM YUM YUM. Love everything here and wish I could try more!

The line though. It's worth it!
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
Not bad! I guess I was expecting worse seeing the amount of "this place is overrated" reviews/ The neighborhood it's located is a little run-down with packed street parking. We had to park right in front of a "lap dances on the 3rd floor!" Signs and homeless people which made me uneasy. 

There was no line considering it was a weekday afternoon and service was very quick.It annoyed me a little that there were no signs next to the doughnuts and only had a picture right as u got to the cashier so must research online the different fillings and flavors before going. 
Overall, taste wasn't bad. Someone compared it to Dunkin donuts but I thought I tasted much better than that! It was a great touristy thing to eat and would come back here if the lines were as short as they were. If it's as long as other people have said I wouldn't waste time unless it's your first time in Portland!
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: These doughnuts are good. They are not the best I have ever had as most trendy hipsters will tell you they are. If you can get in while the line is short they are worth a shot. Try the peach fritter.

text:
As an official doughnut lover, I had to see what all the hype was about.  The non stop talked about doughnut place in Portland.  As we approached the block, you can smell the warm sweet smell of doughnuts.  You'll then see a cute pink building with a long line.  Got in line on Saturday rainy morning.  Don't be intimated by the long wrap around line though, it goes by quickly.  
The have the doughnut flavors posted on a wall outside, which helps with all the overwhelming kinds and flavors they offer.  When it's finally your turn and you get inside and overwhelmed with happiness.  I felt like a kid going to Disneyland.  I giggled and clapped my hands and I contemplated on the tough choice of which doughnuts to get.  We ended up getting 6 for the two of us.  Of course we got the Voodoo doughnut -chocolate doughnut filled with Jelly, a seasonal sweet potato pie doughnut- was ok, not what I expected.  A blueberry old fashioned( YUM) a regular old fashioned, maple bacon and the blazed Blunt (my 2 faves.). All the doughnuts tasted great.  We ate them throughout the day to keep our sugar high going.  They have some crazy wild flavors, designs and sizes.  The worker was super friendly and gave us some recommendations on his favorites.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: They did make donuts a destination in Portland, so I give them that. But I'd rather go to Blue Star. This place is strange, which is the draw. I think the donuts are cheaply made and taste cheap. This place would do well in New Orleans next to a voodoo shop--which is also highly commercialized and tired. In Portland you can be a donut snob. You can do better, but VD works in a pinch.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch

text: While visiting from California I was told by many friends I had to visit Voodoo Doughnuts in Portland, OR. Give them a try if you never been. You won't regret it. ;)

text: Eh... I don't see the excitement of this place. We didn't even have to wait. We walked right in and there was one person in front of us. It was a Saturday at 10am in March. Their donuts are unique but don't have more flavor then a regular donut. The donut I got was massive and didn't need to be. I had about 1/3 of it and tossed the rest. text:
VooDoo is a fun place to visit...once.  It is usually very crowded and I have often received doughnuts that aren't all that fresh.  It can be hit or miss.  Sometimes, they are great.  At other times?  Meh.    

There are plenty of interesting flavors, but do doughnuts really need cereal and frosting on them?  Great novelty place, I suppose.  

The staff there always seems tired and a little annoyed, if you ask me.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
I've always heard about Voodoo Doughnuts while living in California, so I made it a point to come out here while I was visiting Portland for the first time. 

Food: I ordered a donut with white frosting and Oreos on top. The donut was okay, but tasted way too sugary for my liking. I would have rather just had a regular-frosted donut. They offer other donuts such as maple with bacon on top, and donuts with cereal such as Captain Crunch or Fruit Loops on top.

Price: The price was reasonable given how famous this place is. About $1.50-3.00 per donut, depending on the size you get. A dozen of Voodoo Doughnuts is about $11.

Service: I came on a Thursday during work hours, so I only waited about 15 minutes. The line went by pretty fast. The cashier wasn't all that friendly, but probably because this place is busy non-stop.

I think this place is only worth checking out to say that you've been here and experienced it, otherwise the donuts themselves are nothing to rave about in my opinion.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:

The best part of it was the decorations and different flavors or cereals they put on the donuts.  If you love donuts,  you gotta try it.. but once is enough.

text:
I'm extremely compelled to write a review about Voodoo Doughnuts because of the huge rave surrounding this place. We started off our visit arriving at the Skidmore stop along the blue MAX line. Advice, hold your children close. The alley where Voodoo is located is littered with homeless people. 

To start off our experience, the line wasn't that long. We waited about 5 minutes. The doughnuts are on another level as far as their names and toppings. We had the butter fingering donut and the marshal mathers donut with m&ms. Both were just extremely sweet. As far as the donut goes, they weren't anything memorable. 

The visit was definitely worth the experience. I recommend visiting during the day around 12-2 to avoid large lines. I will say that I will be back to give this place a second shot. I never like to turn a place down after one visit.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch

text: Not since Gibson's Donuts in Memphis have I found a destination doughnut shop worth going out of your way for. text:

The maple bar was good, the Arnold Palmer was alright, The Old Dirty Bastard was over the top and great, the Cock and Balls was disgusting both visually and texturally (not a fan of cream (but had to try vegan cream)) but we were drowning in cream while gagging on half of it, we hadn't even gotten to the balls yet! text:
For several years my husband and I had wanted to go to voodoo doughnut, but could never quite justify standing in that ridiculous line.  Recently we were downtown on a Saturday morning at around 9:30AM and the line was barely out the door.  So what the heck - we jumped in line!   To be honest, the tourist vibe was a bit off-putting.  While we were there, several people are slowing down the line, taking their cell-phone pictures in front of the bakery case.  This is a bakery, not a tourist destination people!!  

All the available donuts are out in a case for you to see.  Several of them were unmarked so you had no idea what they were.  A bunch were just frosted donuts with breakfast cereal on them.  C'mon, is that really a flavor?  I had the "voodoo doll."  It was delicious (and reasonably priced considering all the hype), but it wasn't something I'd stand in line more than about 5 minutes for.  I've had equally good donuts at grocery store bakeries (gasp!).  If I did go back I'd try something more offbeat (like a peach fritter or the mango tango).
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: Hell Yeah! My daughter waited for this trip to EAT SKME VOODOO DONUTS!! She loved em!! (Me too). They are fresh, open 24 hours, were in walking distance to our hotel and came in all flavors, shapes and sizes!  I gave in and got me a black voodoo mug!! Love!!
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: I'm going back and forth between a 3 and 4. I mean, it's a doughnut...it was good BUT would i stand in line again to have it? No.  If the line is short or non-existent and I'm walking by will I stop, sure, why not.  The line was long, it was cash only. I was visiting and wanted to look at the display but was rushed to order and keep it moving..and the cashier didn't want to hear that I wanted a good recommendation because I was visiting.  It was just OK. People were buying them by the dozens.  I'm not a huge ---but gummy worms and crumbled oreos on top of already sweet bread type of person, so that kind of turned me off a little. Some of the doughnuts were super busy -- just a lot going on. If you add bacon to anything it's bound to be delicious, I'm sure....I've had better is all I can say. Better doughnuts and better service and I've stood in longer lines before, so it wasn't just the line that was the problem.  I will wait and hour or more for good food, I don't mind. I'm a foodie, so it was worth the experience and being able to say that I've done it! :)  Now that I'm done writing I think a 3 is more representative than a 4.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
Cool...
Hip...
Donut joint...
d'oh

I went with their "No-Name" donut, which is a raised-glazed donut adorned with peanut-butter and chocolate, plus rice-krispies

It was my second-breakfast of that day.

Chalkboard boasted: "the magic is in the hole"

They have so many other creations.

I prefer Dynamo Donuts in SF, but when in Portland, 
these guys make some mean donuts.

High-five!
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: Not only are their doughnuts fun, their delicious!!! Whether there is a line or not, it is worth it. One of my favorites is the bacon bar maple doughnut. It's the maple icing on top of the doughnut, is not overly sweet and coats the doughnut with texture. On top of that is a piece of crispy bacon... never seen anything like that but it's your breakfast all in one doughnut. Another of my favorites is the voodoo doll. The chocolate coating and the Raspberry paste that squirts out when you bite into it, just calls for another bite. The pretzel that is stabbed into the doughnut is a good break from the huge doughnut, but once you eat it, you want to finish it. We usually ask them to pack a dozen doughnuts of their selection, but including the doll and bacon doughnuts. the 2 times we've done it, all the doughnuts turned out to be delicious. Just be ready to get in line, and don't forget CASH (although they do have a ATM... but better be safe than sorry). My father-in-law is a doughnut freak and he loves their doughnuts! You have to go at least once.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: I am so disappointed to see that Voodoo currently shows only 3.5 stars right now.  What's going on people?! Have you lost your minds???  I was one of the hesitant people that didn't want to like Voodoo, I really didn't.  With all of the hype and discussion about it being a tourist trap, I just assumed it would be a waste of time.  I am not even a doughnut person, although I have tried many.  Well, I am now.  One evening, when out with a good friend, we were in the area and saw a short line, so we went for it. She had lived Portland for a year, and me, less than two months at the time.  I figured I needed to check the box.  First of all, the doughnuts are complete eye candy.  For anybody impressed by funky designs and bold colors, they are a feast for the eyes.  There are so many to choose from as well, and it can be overwhelming, especially if you're hoping for a perfect match.  I settled on a cake doughnut covered with white icing, topped by crushed Oreos.  All I have to see it was heaven at first bite.  I couldn't believe it.  Before I could exhale, I was nearly finished.  I just couldn't help myself.  I went back another time with an out-of-town guest that was recently visiting.  I made myself try something entirely different.  It was a marshmallow-creme filled doughnut, topped with a chocolate frosting.  Again, I thought I died and went to Nirvana.  Every bite, every morsel was perfect.  I will go there again and again, proud Portlander that I am.  Now, if you are not the kind of person that likes your desserts incredibly sweet, this is not the place for you.  But in all seriousness, I have eaten many Krispy Kreme, many a Dunkin' Doughnut, as well as a few Blue Star Doughnuts (which are good in their own right), but nothing, and I mean NOTHING comes close to the epic doughnuts that come out of Voodoo, without question.  Oh, and it's affordable.  Not something you can say for many of the overpriced eateries in Portland.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: The donuts were pretty awesome, but all donuts are kind of awesome. We went at an off time so there were only a couple of people in line and it was worth it - not sure if I'd have waited in a line wrapped around the block. Also, customer service was completely non-existent which sucks for out-of-towners looking for a cool experience. The cashier vacantly stared out the window, never made eye contact, and could not have cared less that it was our first time there and we were looking for suggestions. None were offered, so we winged it. So bottom line, go check it out because donuts rule, but don't let it take up your whole day.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: Your donuts don't taste that different than most (except for the arnold palmer donut....oh so delicious), but b/c your donuts look as crazy as your store and workers...i am giving you 4 stars. I love the fact that you put bacon on some of your donuts...or captain crunch, or peanut butter for that matter....and that you have penis shaped donuts for those special occasions. hahaa.  Your late night hours are awesome...b/c that's when i crave you the most!  I was very disappointed when we stopped by your donut place one late night after drinking $2-5 dollar shots (portland, you go girl!) and you had a sign that said you were out of dough. YOU RAN OUT OF DOUGH?????? at a donut shop??? My drunk blood was boiling, but then i forgave you 5 minutes later, so no worries...you and I are still cool.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch

text: Try the bacon maple...I am not a doughnut fan at all but trying this one and this flavor made me a fan! A must if you visit or heck , if you love here!

text:
I thought I was the only one that would mix bacon with a maple doughnut, but apparently I am NOT alone!!!

The bacon maple doughnut was awesome!!! Sweet and salty!!! I also got a Voodoo dozen box of doughnuts - I had one other doughnut and it was goooooood! 

The line was out the door and down the sidewalk when we got there and when we came out it was around the corner. Get ready to wait in line, but it is SO worth it!

text:
Sadness. I had high expectations for this much-raved-about-sugary-goodness-joint. I even went back once more for a second chance at our relationship. I wanted to make sure it was ME and not THEM.

The donuts were unbearably sugary. Each bite sounded like a gnashing of sugar between my teeth, a future trip to the dentist. It was also a sugar rush that could go wrong. I tried their voodoo donut and maple bacon, and besides the cute smile on my donut doll, I was not too enchanted. I love them for their attempt at trying be innovative. 

I think the next I will give them another chance is when I'm drunk. But maybe not.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
You've never had donuts this way...be prepared to be put under a spell after visiting this space.

Expect a line, probably in the rain.  Expect to donuts to go, no seating inside.  Expect to blow your diet, because you will eat the entire large donut.  Expect to pay cash, they don't accept credit cards but there's a shady ATM inside.  Expect to pay $20 for a dozen, yet $20.  And expect to eat the BACON donut, it is like a whole breakfast (packages, syrup, bacon) in one bite.

Don't go to Portland without getting your Voodoo on!
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:

text: This place was so hyped that I had high expectations, but, sadly, it didn't deliver for me. It seems like it's in a sketchy neighborhood and there was a street person waiting outside the door asking everyone for change. The small shop was busy and takes cash only (that's a pain!). They do have a well-used looking ATM in the corner of the waiting area. They had run out of maple-bacon bars so my husband was disappointed, but we tried other donuts. I got a blue raspberry (gaggy sweet) and a Portland Cream (nice, but nothing different from a cream donut I've had other places). I was hoping the donuts would be warm, but they were not. All in all I was just not impressed. They do have a large variety, but you need to really like sweet toppings on top of an already sweet donut to appreciate this place. Kids might this it's fun for the designs/colors.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: I love Voodoo Doughnuts. So fun and delicious!
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: I frankly don't know what all the fuss is about. We were there in the afternoon when there was just a few customers about. The donuts are just doughnuts, priced quite a bit higher than what you will find elsewhere, with a few creative twists thrown in. We could tell that earlier there had been a massive crowd, rope line area lengthy and littered with paper coffee cups and napkins, pretty much a mess. If you need a doughnut and don't mind a little squaller, you can check it out and at least be able to say you've been there.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch

text:
Gimicks, Giicks, and more gimicks!  This place is not even a Portland original anymore. It is pretty much just a corporate chain!  They underpay and treat employees like crap (why do you think they are always so crabby), and they cater to tourists and not the local population.

This place used to be a cool portland staple, but has completely lost its soul.  The owners walk around like they are some sort of celebrities but really are just huge jerks. I don't know how many times I've seen Tres Shannon make an ass out of himself in public.  He is usually drunk or on cocaine or both.  I'm pretty sure Cat Daddy is a pedophile as well.  

Do Portland a favor and do not support this place and hopefully this eyesore will go out of business.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: The difference nuts were pretty good. They are dense and soft and very tasty. It's also a cool place to go and see just because of all the decorations. It's a fun tourist place but probably won't go there again just because it's so so so so expensive. I recommend going at least once because it is worth the experience.

text: There are so many good donuts in Portland, I just can't see why people come here. I do like the decorations and the cleverly named donuts but for a long line that is roughly 30 minutes long, I will pass. Grab coffee for the long wait. Cash only. If you are here on the weekend, it's nice to walk about the Saturday market afterwards.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: Voodoo Donuts has received a lot of national attention thanks to the likes of Food TV & Travel Channel. It's a novelty tourist stop while in Portland. The donuts are okay, but not worth standing in line that typically winds around the block. The over sized Texass donut is a treat if you want to spend your day in a sugar coma; the voodoo donut filled with raspberry jam is fun; and the glazed donut with orange Tang powder is indicative of the unusual toppings you wouldn't typically find at your local donut shop. Try it once and weigh in on whether or not "the magic is in the hole."
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
Bucket list, CHECK! I've been dying to come here for years and finally made it on my West Coast trip from LA to Portland. Went at midnight and the line was out the door and snaked up and down the sidewalk. Waited about 20-30 minutes to get in the door, but it was well worth the wait! 

The Maple Blazer Blunt was my favorite-- I'm a sucker for anything maple flavored. I recommend getting the "Rapper's Delight"-- you get an Old Dirty Bastard (Chocolate, Oreos & Peanut Butter Doughnut), Marshall Mathers (M&M doughnut) and Maple Blazer Blunt (Maple, Cinnamon Sugar, Sprinkles) for only $4.20 (lol at the price)! 

Side note: There are a lot of homeless people in the area accosting patrons for cash. Be smart! Voodoo Doughnut only accepts cash, so these people know you have some!
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: Just what you want! Yummy donuts shaped like weird things. Yes, they were sweet but it's donuts people!  Embrace the experience and prepare for a sugar high.

text:
Ok, so I know I'm the umpteenth Yelper to write about VD.

I'll keep it short and sweet.  A group of were out and about last Saturday night and at about 2:00am we thought that Voodoo Doughnuts sounded just right.  Even at this wee hour, the line was well out the door.  It moved swiftly however, and the lot of us were soon placing our orders.

I spied a pink glazed, Fruit Loop covered, orb of tastiness immediately and made my choice.  Oh, it was good.  My mouth loved every bit of it, my stomach did not.  (I had not had any real food since about 6pm the night before)  The following tummy ache was not awesome.

This does not deter me in the least from returning though; I will just remember to eat a bit beforehand.

text: Holy cow this place is overrated. Does Portland not have a krispy kreme? I mean the doughnuts are decent, but they are too sweet for my taste. text: If you're thinking, how good can a donut really get, you're kinda right. That said, these are some of the best donuts I've had. I think by this point, this place is a must-stop in Portland. The huge variety and the visual awe of the donuts here alone are worth the visit. They're so pretty and whimsical (oddly, the one I like the most might be the simple giant donut), and the spinning display cases make it look like a toy store. Other things I LOVED about this place were the super friendly staff and the authentic, almost grunge look of this place. It's not a sheeshee fancy pretentious place, just an awesome donut shop. And they never close! I came really early in the morning so was lucky to not have to stand in line. I had the bacon maple bar and it's really great. The hype aside, this is a shop worth your visit.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: Did someone say "novelty doughnuts"?  Holy sh*t!  This place is the best thing since regular doughnuts!  Vegan-friendly too!  And even if I don't eat the maple-bacon doughnut, I take great joy and comfort in knowing that its there...  One more reason to long for Portland, Oregon...
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
Before I say ANYTHING else about this place:
They have a doughnut with BACON, and I don't man bacon sprinkles or little bits of bacon or something.  No, the Bacon Maple Bar actually has a strip of bacon atop the maple icing.  (And their maple icing couldn't be more maple-y if it had actual pieces of a fresh maple tree in it!)

As for the rest of my review, I knew this place had to have some serious cred when I found myself standing in a 15 minute line at 10am on a Wednesday (903 Yelp reviews also lends some cred...).  There's a massive selection of gourmet bagels, my only gripe being that I didn't see many descriptions (did I miss a paper menu somewhere?).  Some of the displays had short description placards, though (including the Marshall Mathers, which had mini M&Ms and vanilla frosting).  This was a fun detour, though.  I'd recommend going with a few people, so you can get a few and pass 'em around, because I think most people would have a hard time eating more than one of these sugar-bombs in a sitting.  And while you wait your turn at the counter, once you've made your selection, enjoy the awesome decor.  It's as eclectic as their menu.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: i have a donut problem. i love them and probably couldn't give them up for the idea of healthier eating. the first time i had heard of voodoo doughnut it was from a picture of a maple bar with bacon on top. it looked equally delicious and bizarre, but i had to have one. finally, the last time i was in portland we made it down to voodoo doughnut, but sadly it was after a really big breakfast, so i wasn't really wanting a sweet, glazed, ball of fried dough. we bought the last three maple/bacon bars and a few others. the donuts at voodoo are over the top, some with captain crunch, coco puffs and trix cereals on top of their already sugary icing. the donut itself is actually pretty tasty, doughy, but still light. the donuts were almost too sweet for me, but that's ok it will limit me to only one.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch

text: I'm not by any means a doughnut person. After a bite, I'm normally good. I was in Portland and heard this is the must stop. The line gets pretty crazy even when you go at a strange time. The line is normally out the door since it can only house about 10 people inside the building. The line goes by pretty fast when you are trying to figure out what you want to get and checking out all the cool decor. I got the Portland Cream (since it is Portland's official doughnut) and the Project Lemonade. Their cream is very fresh tasting and smooth. The doughnut was not the softest, which I would prefer, but it was still very fluffy and with good texture. My hands were full already, so I couldn't carry back a pink box to bring home like you would see all over PDX. Although I'm not a doughnut person, I would go back to try the different flavors that they have to offer.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
If you're a doughnut connoisseur, then this place is for you. If you can take it or leave it, it's probably not worth waiting in line. 

It's a Portland institution, and a must-do if you're in town, but the line was long (and apparently always is) and it's CASH ONLY. I knew this going in, but I'm sure most people do not. The doughnuts are tasty and eccentric, and there's something about walking out with the coveted pink box that gets you excited. Now that I have been there, I may not go out of my way to stop in there the next time I'm in town.

text: A Portland "cult" classic so close to my house that when the wind is blowing the right way, I can smell the maple bacon bars. I particularly like the buckets of day old donuts I pick up from time to time for staff meetings!

text:
Bacon maple bar. It's the best damn thing ever and not just the salty crispy bacon, or the just sticky sweet enough glaze- the dough is tasty, too. 

Tech tip:  

Get some apple fritters (any of their varieties work).  More than you can eat.  Let 'em set until Sunday morning, then slice them an inch thick on the bias, soak briefly in a basic egg/ milk wash and make 'em into french toast. 

Yes, that's right.  Apple frickin fritter french toast. It's ridiculously delicious.  You are welcome.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: I love this place, but every time I have been here it has a huge line. So if you bring some friends or don't mind waiting on your own, visit for some of the most unique and tasty doughnuts around!

text:

name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
Everybody seems to be very critical of this place here, that's their right.

Personally,​ I appreciated buying two donuts, coffee and enjoyed it all while taking a stroll along the river. It's donuts, it's sugar. Just like I expected. Not an expert, but donuts are donuts, not Michelin-starred food. They have a lot of options, and the place is popular, so there was a 5-10 min wait (line to the door). Now Californian me will tell you the line could move faster if people knew what they wanted and there was less chitchat, but hey, you're buying donuts, not medicine for your sick loved ones. Slow down a bit, you're in Portland, keep your California habits in California, you're on vacation! If you want fast, go to the East Coast.

I excuse a cash-only policy for good old pop and mom stores, but VD, who wants to be modern and hip? Nope. Especially because they have an ATM inside. That actually makes it worse. Or maybe that's what hip is about?

Anyway, staff seems friendly, donuts tasted good. Good location I think. Would visit again.

Besides the cash-only/ATM policy, the other reason for not being able to rate it 5 stars is that they allow people to sit right in front of the entrance on the ground. These people are not customers.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: Voodoo doughnuts are simply a must try for any out of towner or true portlander, so yah , I guess you have to try them
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch

text:
CASH ONLY!

I've read and seen the pictures of long line and when I went there wasn't a line thankfully.  I was able to park at the lot across the street for about 10 minutes and go in and out of the store.

I bought the Ape Grape, Voodoo, Butterfingering and Maple beacon.  The Butterfingering was my favorite because it's the chocolate on top of the doughnut.  The grape was interesting because I can't recall having a grape flavored doughnut.  The Voodoo is their signature doughnut for show.  The cool part is how each voodoo is unique, but taste like a chocolate doughnut.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: Staff there were so awesome! Very friendly and helpful. Explained stuff and even with the crowd of people stayed relaxed and just focused on people being served. Needless to say how great the donuts taste.

name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
My friends kept telling me I had to go here, I had to go here. They wanted to get me a "cock-n-balls" and I didn't care what it was as long as it taste good lol. That sounded way too funny.."as long as it taste good" This place is so small and had people waiting outside. I wasn't one of the ones outside in the cold. But I was amaze of how many people wanted doughnuts from here. So when my turn came they ran out of the cock-n-balls oh too bad for me.. but I looked it up it has Bavarian cream inside topped w/chocolate frosting..boo hoo I didn't get to try it. But I did have there maple bacon doughnut yummy!! 
The decor is interesting there shirts lining the walls and the panties (how cute). But the inside smells so good. I wanted to stay and just savor everything and try everything.. but then again.. I wanted the doughnut my friends were raving about. So definitely another trip will have to be made.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
We were at Voodoo yesterday. We were waiting one hour in line with the transients constantly asking for change. There are signs inside the place that say 'do not give money or doughnuts to the transients.' Most people just ignored them.

It appeared the entire unique doughnut collection was available. I guess what makes this place different from others is it's wide range of doughnut styles: vegan, old fashioned, raised, cake, etc and the toppings: cereal, candy, peanut butter, marshmallows, etc. 

There really didn't appear to be anything special about the doughnut flavor but the selection is what is cool.

Count on waiting in line but once you get inside it is pretty exciting. The place looks really dirty with obituaries on the wall, but I guess that is part of the charm.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: It's world famous so you have to go! That said the donuts are donuts. While the flavors were good, you really need to check them out for their creative license in decorating and style, not to mention their flare for the  irreverent.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
This place was alright; it's kind of hard to live up to all the hype though. It's on like every Portland top things to do list. Sheesh! On a Monday morning, I waited in line for ~30-40 minutes for three donuts. The style of store is really fun with a pink interior ("Good things come in pink boxes"), and a sparkly gold brick exterior. There are so many choices, and so much time to think about it in line, that I kind of got overwhelmed when I finally reached the register. I got one of the vegan donuts (Diablos Rex, I think?) the Old Dirty Bastard (recommended from friend who used to work here), and the Orangatang. I was going to get their signature Voodoo Doll, but totally blew it!

Anyway, the prices aren't marked up for how much demand they have, which is awesome for them, and the donuts were pretty good. Definitely filling! 

Also, they can't be too bad if they collaborated with Rogue to do their Bacon Maple Ale :).

As much as I don't want to say this, Voodoo Donut should be on your to-do list when you visit Portland.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: This place has the most wild doughnuts I have seen. Someone suggested I visit this place when I went on my business trip to Portland. I didn't have much though into it before going. When I got there the line was super long! I had what felt like a million choice of doughnut to choose from. In my opinion it was just too much for a doughnut, but I can see why people rave about this place.

text: Voodoo is awesome.  Yes, it's touristy and hyped and the lines are usually ridiculous, but if you live in Portland you can go when it's not busy.  They're cash only, which can be annoying, but the donuts are amazing and sometimes they'll give you extras if business is super slow.  It's trendy to bash Voodoo these days, and yes, hype tends to sour most things.  But in my opinion they make exactly what I want in a donut.  If you want something more nostalgic and simple, go to Annie's (which is awesome).  If you want something more upscale go to Blue Star (which is not that good IMO).  If you want a completely fun indulgent experience, which is what a donut should be, check out Voodoo.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
You Know You Want to Decapitate a Donut!

The place is small, the line is long, and there was a rather aggresive person asking for money... but with all that said, Voodoo Donuts is among my favorite must-haves for Portland.

Everyone will tell you they have a serious selection. If you are someone who likes to know what you are ordering a head of time, I suggest looking at their website for the new limited time or classic options.

Since I was new to Voodoo we opted to have the staff pick out a dozen... I loved the cake donuts and the maple with cream inside.  But  it is really a fun time to sample these bizarre yet delicious treats.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch

text: Yummy donuts with better than average toppings. Bacon Maple Bars! Eclectic and dare I say, punk donuts that throw a whole lot more than the kitchen sink at their confections. They also have Vegan donuts that are good too.

text:

For such a popular spot it seems strange it is Cash Only, also their doughnuts are quite overpriced, but, hey- you are paying for the experience, right?

text: My sister and I were standing in line at Stumptown Coffee when I read from my Portland Guide that we should visit Voodoo Doughnut. That's when the woman ahead of us and the local in back of us said we definitely needed to stop  by Voodoo. We came and stood in line and all of the choices were tempting. My sis got a triple chocolate penetration (chocolate donut, chocolate frosting, cocoa puffs on top) and I got the tangtastic. Everything was sweet despite the x-rated names. Luckily, Portland is a great walking city so we burned off the donuts.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
Mark my words, donuts will be the next craze to sweep the country.  

First, it's cheaper than cupcakes.  With most options ranging between $1.25-$2.50, Voodoo is half the price of Sprinkles and Georgetown Cupcakes.  Second, it offers the opportunity for more complex toppings and flavors.  Cupcakeries are too conservative to offer a maple bacon cupcake?  Granted, should someone bake it, I shall eat that too.  Third, donuts offers a more balanced treat than cupcakes.  The unsweetened fried dough is a foil to its sugary toppings unlike the unadulterated sugar-on-sugar combination of cupcakes.

Tourist Trap or not, Voodoo Doughnut is one place you shouldn't miss.  Plus, it's open 24 hours so you can beat the crowds by coming in at 5am.  [Original Visit: December 18, 2010]

Death by PDX - An Extended Weekend of Eating #4.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
I've never been a fan of doughnuts (I rather have other sweets like cupcakes!) but I knew I had to try out Voodoo's maple bacon bar since it was the thing everyone raved about. It was conveniently located right across the street from our hotel so we decided to hit it up on the last day and it was packed with a long line wrapped around the corner. Waited in line for about an hour and ordered the following:

- 4 maple bacon bars
- 1 powdered raspberry filled 
- 1 captain captain
- 1 voodoo doll
- 1 orea covered

Overall I only ate one maple bacon which tasted delicious. Like I said I'm not a fan of doughnut but this was pretty good. The sweet and salty combo has always been a fav of mine. :) As for the others.. I've took a bite of the captain captain (never again) it tasted stale because of the stale cereal.. same goes for the Oreo... and as for the voodoo doll I ate part of his arm and it wasn't bad with raspberry jelly filling. Kinda too sweet. haha...

I don't know if I would wait in line again for an hour but maybe next time if it's shorter I will stop by..
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
I gave Voodoo Donut's a 3 star because the line was super long. The wait wasn't that bad, only because i had company. We bought the random dozen, which i think you should not do because we didn't get what we wanted. & in the random dozen there were a lot of cereal donuts, which the cereal was stale (was it supposed to be like that). 

It is a really cool place to visit, but it is really overrated.

& they only except cash.

The staff was nice. They guys helping us said that we were his longest customer, i think he was getting irritated with us, we did buy 4 shirts & 2 dozen donuts & a post card. Hey, we are supporting you.. But, if i'm ever in Portland again I don't think i will be coming back.

SORRY!!

text:
It is overwhelming the amount of options you have here. We came here one morning for breakfast and the wait actually wasn't too bad. Probably waited about 10-15 minutes tops.

Ordered a Bacon Maple Bar, Aint that a Peach Fritter, Triple Chocolate Penetration, and a Portland Cream between me and my husband. Personally, they were all pretty sweet to me, and that's saying a lot because I love my sugar, but my favorite and probably the one I would most likely be able to finish is the Bacon Maple Bar. That bar had just the right amount of maple glazing + the saltiness of the bacon and if you pair it with some coffee, there you have a winning combo. 

Now that I've been here once, I don't feel the need to come back again. We have a similar doughnut place in my town, so I guess I don't see the uniqueness of it. But then again, I'd choose waffles over donuts any day, so to each their own.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch

text:
If you come to Portland, you HAVE to come to Voodoo Doughnut. It doesn't matter if you don't like doughnuts because you've never had a doughnut like this. There is a flavor for everyone. Like breakfast cereal? There are doughnuts dipped in kids cereal(Coco Puffs, Captain Crunch, etc.). Like candy? There are doughnuts dipped in candy(M&Ms, Butterfinger, etc.). Like hilarious sexual references with your sweet treats? Some of the names include Cock and Balls(it's shaped like...well...you get the idea) and Triple Chocolate Penetration. DO YOU LIKE BACON?! THEY HAVE A GODDAMN MAPLE GLAZED DOUGHNUT WITH 2 STRIPS OF BACON ON TOP!! Come on! DOUGHNUT EUPHORIA! 

The only downside? This is a tourist trap. You will wait in line, but the line moves fast. And the outside of the building is covered with glitter, so you feel happy while you're waiting at least. Just make a trip here. You won't be sorry.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
Oh snap!  These doughnuts rock.  The maple bar was full of mapley goodness, fluffy and dense at the same time.  It defied physics.  If Stanford ran the fluffy-dense doughnut paradigm through the electron accelerator, I bet they could finally understand quantum physics and decide if the cat in the box died or not.  But until they requisition all the maple bars for their evil and nefarious experiments, I will enjoy the delight of the maple doughnut at Voodoo.  The Voodoo doughnut was ok; the pretzel was soft (blech) and there was too much red jelly, making it messy and too sweet.  Funny concept, "meh" on execution.  The store is small and crowded, definitely has character.

What I didn't like:
1.  Don't ignore me while I'm standing there trying to get my doughnut groove on, and don't have conversations with other people til you are finished helping me.  That's rude.
2.  Don't put my doughnuts in a bag and squish them.  Why not give me a bag for each?  Instead you put both in the same bag and my poor Voodoo man was squished and most of the frosting was rubbed off.  Uncool.
3.  For the love of all that is sacred and holy, PLEASE wear something other than low rise jeans and a half shirt, especially if you are a man.  There is something unappetizing about looking at your belly hair while you are serving me doughnuts.  Keep that glory trail to yourself and your loved ones.  I just want a doughnut.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: Great service and food! The maple bacon doughnut takes like breakfast. Do it!

text: The ambiance made it feel like it was all hyped up for people. Very touristy. A lot of people, which I understand there are better times to come when it's not so busy but that meant we had to wait in a line for our food. I felt like the doughnuts had too much sugar. I could barely finish one. It tasted like dumping a huge spoon of sugar in my mouth. I prefer Star Donuts. I give them props to great marketing skill though. The way they have their menu. The ambiance of their shop. They make you want to have their doughnuts but I feel it's just too much. The first time we came on a  Saturday afternoon after strolling through the Portland market there was a long line. I felt confused since it was in the afternoon. Why would there be a long line for doughnuts? We came back the second time on a weekday  & the line was much shorter but the doughnuts still had too much sugar. I thought it was just that batch on Saturday that had too much. The wait was around 15 minutes which I felt was a little long to wait for doughnuts. The staff was very fast. I give them credit for working as quick as they did. I guess it's because they have too many customers to try to answer our touristy questions. We were just curious why their shops vibes was for tourists and wanted to ask if their owner liked to travel.

text:
Being a tourist in Portland, it's pretty much a tacit experience to go to Voodoo Donuts. It's the kind of place you see on Food Network and hear by word of mouth by everyone who has ever been to Portland. And I know, not everything advertised heavily is automatically great. Being from Boston, I am used to hearing highly of places I wouldn't even look twice at. But I have to admit, Voodoo is worth the hype its given.

Granted, the line is very long. But if you don't mind waiting a bit (and it really is only a bit, since they have three cashiers at a time cycling through the line), then the pay off is rewarding. Once inside, you see an expansive menu of donuts, from something as simple as a "maple bar" to more "out there" varieties like the "gay bar" and "giant peach," both of which we sampled, as well as the "voodoo doll" that they are famous for--a chocolate glazed, ghost-shaped donut with a jelly center that is being stabbed by a pretzel stake. Awesome. Every donut listed shares space on rotating pedestals where they are showcased to the line, and from there you can see how different and complex some varieties are. Because the menu is so developed, these really help to narrow the options down. It also led me to choose the "Homer Simpson," a simple strawberry-frosted with sprinkles, a nostalgic novelty with great icing that tasted like Dunkin Donuts if they were still independently owned.

We only waited about 15 minutes or so and ordered smoothly, getting a really cute pink box with their logo and five delicious donuts inside. They all tasted fresh, taken from the array of racks in the back of the store, where employees were working on them behind the scenes. They had a homemade feel to them and didn't leave a sinking feeling in my stomach like some other donut shops have the capacity of doing. Overall, very pleased with the selection and flavor of this notorious shop.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: Got there at 8:30am on the long weekend. Waited about 1/2 hr in line before service. When we left, the line was twice as long. text:
First time to Portland and I had to try it.  The food junkie in me has to try the places they feature on the food and travel channels where ever we go. So, I made the half mile walk in the rain and tried it. 

Walked right in with no wait. The guy behind the counter stared at me like I had something growing out of my forehead, but whatever. The shop is pretty cool and the variety of doughnuts is intimidating. They all look so good! The perfectly cooked, salty, crunchy strips of bacon set on creamy maple icing was making my mouth water and the rest was history.

Worth the walk and I'd say worth the wait in line if there were one. I'll make one more stop before leaving.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
Wowwww...

Actually, the doughnut is not truly exceptional. However, the concept is unique and cool. Having so many different kind of things as topping for doughnut is one of a kind.
Having said that, I like the doughnut. Of course it is better than whatever doughnut you can find in some grocery store, but it is not a lot better than any other specialty doughnut store.

My favorite here is Oreo Doughnuts and Portland Cream.
The line will be crazy !!! So, if you are craving for this, just come around 9 PM or more and there is almost no line around this time. But close to midnight, the line will start piling again and again.

If you come to Portland, you have to try this so when people ask you "did you try Voodo Doughnut ?" you can answer "Of course"


go for it
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: Long line , good donut. Most of the other reviews are pretty spot on. The different donuts were visually pleasing. The experience is worth it but probably won't be back.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: Definitely try the Oreo doughnut and the Simpson donut. I think Krispy Kreme donuts are way better than this place. It's  touristy. The line wasn't so bad and it is cash only. I really like the interior, but I wish the donuts tasted better.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
This place is worth the wait, even when it's raining. The line moves quickly because the employees in the small interior keep things flowing. Just know what you want by the time you get up to the front! 

The interior is funky and fun! We ordered The Dirt, The Homer, Voodoo Dolls, the Portland Cream, and a Bacon Maple Bar. They were so soft and fresh and the frosting did not overpower the doughnuts. I normally don't love berry fillings but theirs is AMAZING. We will likely go back again before we leave Oregon despite the high volume of calories!
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: Ah, yes. Voodoo Doughnut was the first thing on my family's list of things to try. We went there yesterday morning, and let me tell you, my mom was surprised at how long the lines are, but me on the other hand? Not so much. It's obviously got curious travelers and locals coming back for more. Just the outside of it already seems intriguing with their sparkly brick walls and signature logo sign. So we waited about 20 minutes till we got inside, and it looks crazy in there. Lots of extravagant colors and the next thing you know it we were at the front. It's a bit overwhelming as there are such a variety of doughnuts to choose from. We happened to get the 3 of the Voodoo Doll Doughnuts, 1 Mango Tango Doughnut, and 2 Blueberry Cake Doughnuts. Let me tell you, they were all amazing! The Voodoo Doll Doughnut was a must-try for obvious signature reasons. It was not overbearing in chocolate, and there was a plentiful amount of raspberry fill which was great. The Mango Tango was also fairly decent and flavorful. As for the Blueberry Cake, THIS IS A MUST HAVE. They were so amazing! The cake just crumbles in your mouth and it's not too sweet or under sweet which had a perfect balance. Just a very light glaze which made it even better. This is definitely one of the best doughnuts I have had in my life. In addition, the creative store and flavors makes the experience so much more worthwhile, and I'm probably going to sneak back there later today, because this is definitely a must-try in Portland, Oregon!
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: Luckily when we went the line was a lot shorter because it had just rained.  I only waited about ten minutes so maybe if I had waited an hour I wouldn't have reviewed it so high?   The doughnuts were good though!   Unique and tasty though super rich.  I liked mine a lot.   The oreo one was probably my favorite.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch

text: Inhale, Exhale, I just got a Doughnut in the Mail!  No really, I did.  So I haven't actually been to Voodoo, but a friend of mine FedExd me an Old Dirty Bastard (ODB) today and wow ODB would roll over in his grave and then make his way to Voodoo to hit that Doughnut.  The ODB is truly amazing and I can't wait for the next time I'm in P-Town so I can get one hot off the press.  In short, I highly recommend this doughnout.  Chocolate, Oreos, and Peanut Butter.

text:
While the boyfriend and I were in Portland, we had to try Voodoo Doughnuts.

Sadly, I was disappointed.

Don't get me wrong - It was fried dough.  I was a fan.  But it wasn't anything special - I can get a better doughnut without the hassle of parking here in Puyallup.

I was very impressed with their selection and their prices, but overall, I think it's overrated and probably won't go back unless I'm in the area.

text: Doughnuts were pretty good, they looked amazing, but I didn't think they tasted that different. Huge selections of doughnuts that come in a funky pink box. The location was cool, not too big.

When you first walk up you have to literally walk through homeless people who stop you for money before you even get inside. The enployees seem like they dont want to be there vut have to be. text:
PORTLAND18 REVIEW #3

TL;DR: CASH ONLY, great doughnut variety, little under the hype

Ah yes, the Portland spot that almost everyone talks about. I couldn't ask anyone for suggestions without hearing about this donut place. Voodoo Doughnuts does have a lot of hype and the variety to back it up. However, I didn't find their doughnuts to be too out of the ordinary. Yes, I'm glad I went here, but I'm not sure it's something I'd go out of my way for.

I had the Portland Cream and the Viscous Hibiscus.

PORTLAND CREAM (4/5)
- Good filling, but not too filled
- Average chocolate doughnut taste
- Pretty good size for the price

VISCOUS HIBISCUS (3/5)
- Really sweet, but I don't know what else to expect
- Half sprinkles looks good, but kinda awkward to eat
- Huge doughnut!

I was a huge fan of the service! Even with the line, the cashier was really helpful and explained some of the doughnuts. We were able to order our doughnuts and get out of the store pretty quickly. We didn't know that this shop was Cash Only, but luckily, I had some cash on me. Important to know before you come. I think the novelty of this place is great, but I'm not sure I'd come back again. A good experience for a vacation, though!
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
I'm not entirely sure why this place is so popular and has such a long line. I feel the 2 hour wait usually turned me off, but their donuts were just so so too. My boyfriend and I were visiting portland for a week and decided to walk by here every time we were near the area and every time there was such a long wait. It wasn't until some random Monday night at maybe 11pm when there was no line that we were finally able to try it. I got the maple bacon and I don't remember what he got, but it wasn't particularly tasty. I understand donuts are supposed to be sweet, but it just felt like the whole thing was entirely sugar and overwhelmingly sweet. 

I definitely prefer blue star because I feel they have a much better balance of flavor and the dough to frosting ratio.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
Personally, I don't have a sweet tooth anymore. I think  all my sweet tooth learned their lessons at the age of ten, after visiting the dentist every month for cavities issues!  :,(

However, once and awhile, a donut can't harm anyone, especially ones as good as these! I love their creative ideas, but I am a stickler for plain crullers! I LOVE CRULLERS out of all the variety of donuts! They are so airy and luscious.

I think I found my favorite one here! Their glazed cruller, vanilla cruller, and strawberry cruller are to die for! 

Sadly....I don't live in Portland....so I cannot have them whenever I want. I'm kind of glad, cause I won't get any more cavities nor gain weight, I guess. LOL
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch

text: So, I Will not stand in line for  twenty minutes for a freaking donut , or a woman unless she is an insane redheaded actress..Wait, my the-rapist said go to Portland and taste a maple -bacon donut...and I did . It was pretty good but it would have been better if it had been filled with a touch of mayo..Nuf said I Live in Portland now...and there is a great titty bar just up the street....

text: As expected, there was a line, but it wasn't out the door. I had been on an eating binge all day, so I "only" ordered 3 doughnuts: plain glazed, glazed with raspberry filling and an apple fritter. I keep it simple when it comes to my beloved doughnuts -- DO NOT put a bunch of crap to deter the taste buds from the simple sugary goodness. They were all on-point! An unexpected fave turned out to be the apple fritter, which had the right amount of crisp on the outside and soft and giving on the inside.

text: For a taste experience, definitely over rated. For a cultural/artistic/creative experience, it's ok. The place is creative and fun... but the donuts themselves are not very good. My favorite is the McKinnleyville Cream (or something like that)  - it's filled with a maple-flavored cream so it's not dry. The  "old fashioned" and  the  "cake" donuts that we got were dry and tasted stale.  Personally, I'd take Dunkin' Donuts over these any day.

text:
I feel bad but...I don't get the hype.  Other than the fact that the donuts are beautiful, colorful, and huge....there isn't that much to like about them.  I tried 4 different donuts during my visit and all of them were terribly dry.  The Old Dirty Bastard and Butterfingering had great, delicious toppings...but the cake was just plain dry and/or bland.  The only one I tried that was relatively moist was a cherry fritter....which is not one of my favorite flavors.

Luckily, we didn't have to wait in much of a line so that doesn't really have an effect on my rating.  I'd be willing to try Voodoo again next time I'm in Portland, but I certainly wouldn't wait 30-60 minutes for what I think are subpar donuts.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: Has become a portland cliche, but their doughnuts are good. If I ever see the line short, I will stop in a for a dozen. But ya, lines can get crazy...but the maple bacon bar is to die for!!!

text:
The donuts here are good but a smidge overrated. The line was quick and efficient- they have a good system. 

We tried the homer donut and the captain crunch donut. The homer donut was way too sweet for my liking but I enjoyed the strawberry flavor of the frosting. The captain crunch donut was a lot better and the donut itself was squishy and pretty delicious. 

Update: went back the following day (my friends wanted to go) and got the glazed.  It was perfect. Not too sweet with the perfect texture. Made me bump this place up to 4 stars. If you go, buy the fun specialty donuts for the picture but buy the classics for the taste.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
Possibly one of the most over-rated places I have EVER been to..

I went here with my friends on a Sunday afternoon. The line was ridiculously long (30+ people) and I found it odd that a lot of people waiting in line had luggage with them. It seemed as if they were leaving town and they just HAD to get a box of voodoo donuts before they left town. This was very odd. 

I also noted that all the 5 star reviews of Voo Doo donuts originate from locals that live in the Portland area. As if they have all been collectively brainwashed to gravitate towards this place come rain or shine. 

We waiting for about 20 minutes to actually get up to the counter and as we were waiting we heard one of the employees tell a customer " I don't give a sh*t if you take an hour to select your donuts, these people can wait here forever for all I care" . Excellent, I thought! 

When we finally got to the register, we selected 8 of their most popular donuts including the one with bacon. The donuts were good but NOT worth standing in line for so long. And definitely not worth $2.50 a piece. 

Additionally, the bakery and premises were absolutely filthy. The employees were filthy. None of them were wearing hairnets or gloves. The girl who served us looked like she hadn't bathed in days.

No FDA food codes were posted. And they do not accept credit cards.

Additional scores: 

Donuts : 3/5

Customer Service : 1/5

Convenience: 1/5
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: Not worth the hype.  I ordered the voodoo dozen where they choose for you. The woman behind the counter was friendly and gave us a good variety of doughnuts including a few cereal ones. Unfortunately all the cereal was stale. I was expecting a lot more.

text:

The hype is basically for their fun and Portland weird concept of a donut shaped liked a voodoo with cute designs on them. They have a nice variety of top filled donuts- like cereal, coconuts and bacon on them. Sadly every donut shop does these toppings nowadays so I wanted to compare the dough and get newer toppings. The dough was thick but soft. The fillings were minimal did not goo out of my donut. So could use more filling. 

Love their fun concept and their fun atmosphere. Got my fill on this trip.

text:
The line to get VD wasn't long and/or painful as a few have mentioned when we happened to swing by. But we had to run to refill the meter since we underestimated the wait with all the wishy washy ordering that was going on up front. 

Cash only. Imagine how annoying it would be watching people bust out their debit card for $2.99. (BTW I love that there is no sales tax in this state but PDX sure is aggressive and strict with street parking)

They have a huge variety of donuts from the Froot Loop'd topped to the basic cruller. As far as the donuts we purchased, taste-wise, not bad but nothing special here.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
You know the hype and when in Portland, you got to go to Voodoo's. Honestly, people probably only go for the Instagram pictures because I was not impressed by anything here at Voodoo. The only reason we even STOPPED here was we were looking for Chinatown (which was a dud) and voodoo was right there in front of us. 

The line was short, so the Jen W. and I decided to beeline for it. Standing there, it reminded me of a chinese bakery where the fruitcakes just sit in the center of the store between the cashiers and spin in circles. The donuts were doing the exactly same thing, on a platter spinning and spinning. The decor was pink inside that screamed look at me and give yourself a headache. 

I was really thrown off by the LACK of service here. There were no signs as to what they offered, or what each of the donuts on display was. The girl helping us was in no mood to and we were just trying to find out what's good in the hood. We asked for their "famous" donut and she suggested the Maple Bacon- and so we did. Not impressed because I don't care for donuts like that, bacon was dried and fried to an ashy crisp, and the donut wasn't even fluffy on the inside. 

The hype lacked realness and it's really for the pictures. I mean they looked better than they tasted. I wouldn't waste my time through TSA to bring you back VD's. But there was a good amount of outdoor seating in this alley way right next to the store. Great for hanging out on a nice day. Good try Portland.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
I'm in love!
After a very long 11 hour drive from California my boyfriend and I decided we were gonna stop at Voodoo Doughnuts for our desert stop before we reach Washington. And it was well worth the drive! 

The doughnuts were very moist the frosting was not to overbearing and not extremely sweet which I hate! They also had very quirky doughnuts that would make a grown man blush. 

PS they sell VEGAN doughnuts!! 

I just wish they had a closer one to me
