text:
Lines out the door! This place is killer and delicious. I'd say doughnuts are either good or bad, they either taste good or not. This place is great and one of a kind.

My fave is the maple bacon one with the strip of bacon! When you get the doughnuts fresh they are soft and chewy, just how they should be. 

The outrageous-ness is totally a conversation piece...for example, chewing a warm glazed phallus in your mouth is the perfect way to walk into work. Don't spill your coffee on your ahem. That makes things more interesting.  

There's a second location outside of downtown that is less busy, but the line is worth it.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: Voodoo never disappoints. Whenever I get a chance while in Portland I always stop by here. Last night I went here with my man after dancing it up and thankfully there was only two people in front of us when we got there. (usually we have to wait a while) He got the Voodoo doughnut and I got the Cap'n crunch which we were both very happy with. The people working there were friendly and ready for the clubs to get out.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
My ONLY complaint with Voodoo Donuts is that I can only eat 2 before my heart explodes and my head caves in. It's as though my body is in a race with itself to die from pleasure: Will the sugar rush it into a diabetic coma before the butter/fat/etc. brings on the kind of spectacular coronary that struck my grandfather dead while mowing his lawn 8 years ago? Who cares! I'll still die happier and fuller than gramps did! Except for that third donut I'll never eat...

Voodoo had been so over-hyped to me by the time I got there that I was a little disappointed: Dingy homeless-chic decor, surly (*pre-caffienated?)hipster counterstaff, and the donuts look kinda... sorry, sad, malformed? but tasty? Nothing so slickly produced and attractively-manufactured looking as a Dunkin'-type. No, these little guys are delicious-looking special needs children made with lots of sloppy love - maybe ganja-fueled sloppy love? Now that I think of it, why doesn't Voodoo have a Mary Jane donut? That'd certainly start MY workday off right... Oh, damned laws!

I digress.

I echo all the donut-specific comments made before now - particularly the bacon-maple bar - so bacon-riffic it could test the will of the kosherest of the khosher.

Oh, Peaches loves Voodoo! She's right there on the wall. Any friend of Peaches is a friend of mine.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: I don't see what the big deal is about. When I went there, the doughnuts were not fresh. I think Krispy Kreme and Heavenly Dougnuts are way better and fresh.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: the doughnuts were decent but not worth waiting in a long line for (luckily we didn't). the oreo peanut butter was good but the blueberry cake doughnut tasted artificial. I'm glad we went but don't think we'd seek it out if we're ever in Portland again. in the Bay Area we have psycho donuts which I feel is comparable, if not better than voodoo.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: A must-visit attraction in Portland! The boyfriend and I beat the long line by coming here on a late Monday afternoon. We ordered the bacon maple bar donut because anything with bacon is a sure-win. At first I was a bit skeptical, but the salty, crunchiness of the bacon and the soft, sweet donut provided both textual and flavor contrast. Can't beat that!
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: Important stop if you're a tourist.  If you're in search of great baked goods, not.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: Best donuts in Portland! I tried blue star and pips. Hey don't even come close. These are true, decadent, fluffy donuts you crave. The voodoo doll was my favorite with the thick chocolate frosting and soft fluffy bread! It had a jelly filling but only a tiny bit which was good because I'm not a fan of filled donuts. The butterfinger and hibiscus were my second favorites. All the options are amazingly delicious and you can't go wrong! We tried 6 different ones and I was not disappointed with any! You have to have cash which made us have to leave and come back once because the ATM was not working inside! There was a long line but it moved really fast. Amazing donuts and the place is a lot of fun!!
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
Voodoo's is a fun experience with decent donuts. My wife and I went here on our way up the pacific coast. She had gone before in Denver and was excited to take me there. When we got there, there was a bit of a line, but it moved quickly and only took us 15 minutes to get to the counter. The variety to choose from is overwhelming and there are tons of crazy flavors to choose from, which was a lot of fun. We ended up getting the voodoo dozen, which is a dozen donuts selected for you by the employee. She gave us a really good spread--we got some coco puff and Oreo ones, as well as more traditional ones likes buttermilk. Our favorites were the butterfingers, Oreo, old fashioned buttermilk, and s'mores.

The donuts are not that fantastic--they weren't hot at all, which kind of kills it for me.  It's mostly just fun to get all the different kinds and try them. If you're looking for really quality donuts, head to Randy's in Los Angeles and get the wheat and honey right as they come out of the oven at 12:30 AM.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: We made the trip to Portland and had to visit. We're donut fans and these were good and creative, but hardly worth the hype. We still don't get it. We came in Friday morning at 9 and there was no line but the presentation was hard to select from, and we were still rushed by the server who was also in space. Why do people wait in line for an hour for this?
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: Late night drunk crowds and donuts. Hard to beat the atmosphere. We did find out this evening though that if you order something they are out of they will pull it out of the display case and give it to you for free!!
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: Short but to the point: you cannot (should not, must not) visit Portland without tasting the bacon maple donut, it is my absolutely favorite!!
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
Ive been here about 5 times.  The donuts are good but they are expensive and definitely not worth waiting in line for.  I always go on a weeknight where the line is no more than 5 mins long.  If you go on the weekend be prepared to wait hours. 

The donuts are good but they arent spectacular by any means.  Yes they have all kinds of creative names and toppings but the overall quality of the donut is not the best.  My favorite is the chocolate glazed one, topped with rice crispies, and laced wiht peanut butter. 

I like the combination of chocolate, peanut butter, and the crunchy texture of the rice crispies.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: Delicious, creative, cheap and delightful. No one does doughnuts better than Voodoo.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: Had to try this since it was on the food Chanel. I went late at night and it had a long line. It's a very eclectic place with a large selection of treats. I had the apple fritter the size of a plate and a bacon maple donut.  Just be prepared to pay cash. No credit cards accepted.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
-Five stars for the vegan donuts--vegan maple bar!

-NO STARS for the shitty service and piss-poor attitude of the staff (there was one time I had a nice cashier, every other time they seem like they want to strange you for even being there)

-NO STARS for the horrendous line . . .
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: Eh. They hype is just as high as the customers and the sugar in each donut.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: I Like their doughnuts, and their selections of odd but good combinations of toppings.  Sometimes I get heartburn afterwards.  I like their $5 buckets of doughnuts to get late at night.  I Love that the are 100% Portlandia!
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: So I know this place is a staple of Portland - but I really was not a super fan. After waiting in line for 10 - 15 minutes I chose a lemon lime donut with nerds sprinkled on top. Bad choice and it made me sick. It is a must to go if you are in Portland for the first time but I won't be back.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
Ummm... OPEN 24 HOURS???

I would have bypassed this establishment had it not been for the crowd of people munching on obscene-looking donuts on the streets of the Saturday Market on Sunday. I thought, but on Yelp the hours posted said until 2pm... I was wrong! Yelp was WRONG!

It's open 24 hours. Even on Sunday.

BTW: Maple Donut with Cream Filling is TO DIE FOR!
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
Nothing factual to add here that hasn't already been said, so I'll just give my $0.02 on the donuts themselves:

Penis one (don't remember the name): Huge with a Boston cream pie thing going on. You know what that means. It oozes white cream. Yum!

Voodoo Man: Tasty. Is it bad that I enjoy devouring a donut shaped like a screaming, helpless person?

Maple Bacon: As a Canadian, I know maple and I know bacon. They're great on their own and they work really well together. Example: this donut

Mango Tango: Very refreshing change from all the chocolates and creams. Mango-flavored on the outside, zesty orange on the inside

Cocoa Puff Chocolate: Looks cool but tastes like cardboard. The Cocoa Puffs were really dry and clearly not fresh anymore, and the actual donut was also dry and tasteless. Skip.

Plain cake donut with powdered sugar: A classic but a goodie

I just can't give more than 3 stars though because the service here sucks. They know they're famous, they know people will line up in droves at all hours of the day, they know tourists will pay money up the wahzoo to try all the flavors, and so they don't put any effort into being nice or friendly. The store is kitschy and quirky. But no amount of decor can make up for a shitty attitude after you just spent 45 minutes waiting under a 95-degree sun to pay inflated prices for a pastry you could easily fry yourself in less than 10 minutes.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
I was told I HAD to try Voodoo Doughnuts while I was on vacation in Oregon. Can you say AWESOME?! I loved the fact that ALL the doughnuts have their own theme! As a Simpsons lover I couldn't pass up the chance to order "the homer", I also ordered the captain crunch!! They even offered Vegan donuts! Very cool.
I did find it to be a bit strange that that restroom was not in the actual building.. but rather in a small "shed?" Like building in the parking lot...I didn't have to use it but I heard an employee tell a woman in front of me.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
Ok, so I am not a huge fan of donuts, but I love Voodoo donuts!!! Thank goodness I don't live in Portland or I would have a serious problem. I think what I like so much is the variety and how fresh the donuts are. 

My favorite is the Mexican chocolate donut. It is actually a bit spicy because of the chili powder on it. They actually don't make it everyday so it is hit or miss when you can get it. My husband loves the maple bar with, yes BACON on the top. Our son loves the glazed with sprinkles or fruitloops or any of a half dozen other interesting toppings on it. 

They also have an excellent Vegan selection. If you ever find yourself in Portland I recommend picking up a donut or two or a bucket, yes they sell the day old ones in a bucket!
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: OK so the place is pretty trendy but it sure was an experience. Not in the best neighborhood being in the older part of the city, but kinda fun waiting in line and heckling at all the people coming out of the store with their "stuff."  We waited about 30 minutes on a holiday, presidents day.  Some people in line said it was shorter than last time they were there when it was around the corner.  Yeah the doughnuts were tasty and worth the price I'd say.  We got a VooDoo dozen which is their pick of the somewhat fancier doughnuts.  It was $8.25.  The we each picked out our most desired flavor.  The best of the bunch was the old dirty bastard that had mounds of chocolate and peanut butter and.... oreos!  My son got the voodoo doll which had a ton of red jelly inside and was chocolate glazed with a pretzel stick to stab the doll, yum!  My niece got the fruit captain crunch with white glaze... meh...  I ate a choc. covered old fashion and it was delightful.  We were going to go back on our way through town but my kids were fighting so nope... too bad...  OH CASH ONLY!
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: A PDX classic. Gotta love The Loop, Bacon Maple Bar and Grape Ape. My top 3! Always a must stop when indulging in some late night libations.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: Love the donuts here and would go back at anytime.  Donuts are absolutely worth the wait that you have to get in the door.  I love the dynamic in the shop and the attitude of the staff is wonderful.  I really like to stop through whenever I can and will continue to do so!
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
Went for a midnight run to avoid the line. Doughnuts were as fresh as you can hope at 12 AM. Staff is super friendly. 
Must have before you leave Portland.
Cash only. Seriously.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
A Portland icon! I mean really, who thinks of the Portland food scene without thinking of Voodoo!? To be honest though, probably my favorite doughnuts around. They are some seriously good quality doughnuts.

Beyond the doughnut though, Voodoo is about the experience. You are downtown experiencing the city and ordering a Old Dirty Bastard? I mean who thought you would ever be politically correct by saying you want and OLD DIRTY BASTARD!? Well at Voodoo its the right thing to do. Enjoy the scenery and shop. There is no glam or glitter, just a bomb doughnut!

Bottom line-- I didn't put the Old Dirty Bastard in my review for fun, it's a must!
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
Let's just say that I've had better donuts.

After hearing about this place, watching this place on TV, and looking at other peoples' pictures, I decided that going to Voodoo doughnuts was the ONLY thing I absolutely had to do when I was in Portland.

Excited me got 3 donuts all for myself...couldn't even finish 1. Hah.
Captain crunch/fruit loops donut was overly sweet. The cereal was getting kind of stale when I ate my donut.
Maple bacon bar was okay. I guess if you're into sweet+salty you'd like this.
The roadkill was probably my favorite one out of all of the ones I tried. Oreos, creme filling, and chocolate glaze. Can't go wrong.

Their dough is pretty soft, but it was something about the frosting/glaze. I felt like I was developing cavities with every bite. The glaze was extremely thick and it was hard to taste everything else because it was so overpowering.

Go here for the experience.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: Number one: Expect long lines out the door always - no matter what time of day. Doughnuts are very eccentric as far as presentation. They taste as yummy as your best doughnut shop in your own town. I think the name is what makes it so popular. Just a fun thing to do in Portland - if you have the patience to wait in line.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
Fun donuts & walkable from our hotel - what's not to love?

I chose some raised donut with peanut butter & crushed chocolate cookies.  Decadent & delicious

Buddy got their Voodoo bar in the shape of a voodoo doll w/ raspberry filling.  Very fun & kitschy

Lucked into ZERO line so we got o to walk right on up - I definitely understand this is not the typical visit since there were barriers to guide the throngs of screaming tourists
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
Voodoo! The famous Portland Pink Box. 
My initial opinion? Overhyped as hell. But yesterday's experience was awesome. It's so unfortunate to see the pandemic and panhandling wear down this business and the surroundings. Voodoo is like the ONLY thing open and booming in the entire area. 

Standing in line (6 feet apart) from other patrons, I was accosted for money at least 20 times in 10 minutes. About 12 of those times were from the SAME lady. It was very annoying. I know it's reality of the current downtown but, it's such an eye sore. 

Went in, such friendly bubbly customer service. The usual nice display windows showing you their unique selections. Chose my voodoo dozen and was out. 

Stood outside for another 5 mins after purchase as my friend was inside picking out her goods. I was accosted 5+ more times by 5+ different people. One of the homeless men aggressively threw their coat down at the ground next to me and security rushed him. Gently pushing him down the street to "get away". Security came back apologizing. 

This is a public downtown street. Downtown is f$-"&d up. There's not much they can do. But they did everything they can. 

I'm from Seattle. I much prefer Krispy Kreme light airy donuts. Which is why I say voodoo is hyped. This dozen is going to folks back home. But their selection of flavors are creative and plentiful.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: Just to clarify things.  I am a Portland local myself and I do think their donuts are amazing.  I only rated it two stars because of the soup line depressed workers and the incredibly slow lines.  Those are the only problems with this place.  Go here and you'll likely be in line with a few hundred other tourists.  They're only aware of this place because they saw it on tv and that's why this place is always cramped.  Instead of going here, go to Voodoo Doughnut Too on NE Davis instead.  You have places to sit, the employees are much nicer, and there are rarely ever lines here.  In my opinion this is the best donut I have had in all 7 countries I've been to hands down.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: I was visiting from LA. Wanted to try these famous donuts. The bad reviews for this place are true. The donut are average for a high price it's at least $2.25 for a decent donut here. Thankfully the line was not bad on a Friday noon that's why it's getting 2 stars. The staff are not friendly. I personally like Krispy cream donuts a lot but this donut was overly sweet and not fluffy. Definitely not worth it. I'd find another donut shop if I were you. Unfortunately the other place I found (delicious donuts) was sold out at the time so I couldn't go.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
Expect to stand in a long line - at least half an hour and even longer on nicer days.  Your best bet at avoiding a line is to go when it's pouring out.  Expect people in line to be taking all kinds of pictures and the homeless to be vying for your attention (in case that phases you). 

Expect to make a rather quick decision once you do get inside.  There are tons of options and looking them up online just isn't the same.  I will be bold enough to say though that 75% of the patrons either get a mixed random dozen or the maple bacon donut.  Being a tiny vegetarian, I did not do either, so options were a lot harder for me to deal with.

Expect to get a tasty but not a mind blowing donut.  I opted for the maple cream filled, which was very heavy (as expected) but tasty.  It did leave me feeling a little sick afterwards, but I'm not used to consuming 1000 calorie complex carbohydrates in 15 seconds :-). 

Not worth the wait. Over-hyped. I'm glad I tried it at least ounce though.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: I was visiting Portland from North Dakota... you can't stay in Portland without checking out VooDoo doughnut!  We went to Voodoo mid-morning on a weekday and were able to walk right in and order.  They had a great selection of delicious looking doughnuts (they all looked so good I didn't know which ones to have!).  I finally chose the famous Voodoo doll doughnut and a blueberry doughnut.  I thought they both were delicious.  They have many types of doughnuts so you won't get bored going back there again and again... needless to say, I can't wait to go back!
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: Lines lines and lines. This place is so popular, get ready to wait in line for one of their crazy donuts. They were very quick with their service though when I think about it since most people were ordering up to boxes and boxes of donuts for the entire duration of their trip. I'm not a donut person. I don't particularly like them much at all but this place offered me a variety I couldn't refuse. I wish I had the ability to try them all but I just couldn't. So I went with what was called the memphis? Yummy banana fritter with chocolate and peanut butter drizzle topped with chocolate chips. It was crunchy on outside and super fluffy on inside. I had to take it down in three days because it was so sweet and huge. I really wish I had the ability to try more. Please visit this place. I highly recommend.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
Last week, my boyfriend and I were in Portland for vacation. I've been to Portland once before a few years ago, and I knew from that trip that I had to take him to Voodoo! We went on a Friday afternoon and the lines weren't bad at all. We just got a classic glazed doughnut and then of course a voodoo doll doughnut. Considering how popular this place is, we thought the doughnuts were really reasonably priced and totally worth the hype. They were delicious! 

The inside of the store is really cool as well, and the staff were super friendly. I'm sure I'll come here every time we go to Portland :)
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: Shockingly, we walked right in. There were only a few people in line. This was at 10 am on a Wednesday. The place is adorable, of course, with a huuuuuge selection of vegan donuts. The cashier could not have been friendlier or more cheerful. Donuts were fabulous. We need one in Philadelphia!
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: Delicious spot! The line is very long so be prepared to stand outside! We loved every single doughnut we got. The blueberry cake was probably our favorite one. The cock n balls doughnut caused a lot of laughs when we opened the box. It was even funnier because the "balls" were filled with a surprise cream. They have so many options which is great!
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: I was lucky when I hit this place up and found that there was NO line. seriously no one in line. interesting.... Thank goodness though. Had there been a line, I would've been super upset that I waited for these. Voodoo doughnuts are super overrated. WHAT ARE YOU GUYS THINKING!? Who can SERIOUSLY tell me they love these doughnuts? I had way higher expectations because of all the good reviews and from what I've heard via Word of Mouth, but I definitely wouldn't come back for these wayyyy too sweet, almost stale tasting doughnuts. yuck. Staff was friendly though. :/ That's where they get the extra star. But realistically it was more like a 1.5 star experience in my books.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: This place has a great fun atmosphere and offers a nice outdoor seating area! Depending on when you come, there may be a line. It moves pretty fast though. They have delicious donuts that don't break the bank. I got 2 donuts for around $4, one being the famous Voodoo Doll. Some of the donuts are huge! Our group tried the Voodoo Doll (choc icing with raspberry filling), Maple with real cream, Maple & Bacon, Coconut Mango, and Plain. All were really good!
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: Came to the DTP location with my girlfriend and could not/would not share!! The donuts are that good... you won't want to share  totally recommend and worth the wait. There will be a line out the door but I'm telling you it's worth it!
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: It was a cold night (32f) with long lines. That was the biggest negative waiting in the cold slowly moving line that was poorly lit. Once inside it went fairly fast. Such an array of donuts! It was fun and we walked out with 5 donuts. We can now say we have been there and yes we recommend the experience. The donuts tasted great by the way!
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
We saw this place as we were walking by to breakfast. There was a long line so we thought to return later for a snack. When we returned there was still a line. Must be good right? We went in and got a few doughnuts to give a try. The dough had a good taste. Light and fluffy so you bite into a cloud of fried dough. There were many different doughnuts to choose from in a case that spins near the register. They call you up and you give your order. They sot the doughnuts on wax paper right there on the counter so you see them. Some of the are huge! They have something for everyone here. 
Good doughnuts over all.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: I'll start by saying, I never really understood the Krispy Kreme craze ... Any doughnut will be amazing if it is piping hot out of the fryer.... But, these Voo Doo Doughnuts were still delicious hours later... I had a maple bar with a slice of bacon & a chocolate bar shaped like a ghoul from an old Betty Boop cartoon! Too delicious .. I also adored the pink pastry box with a skeletons and Voo Doo inspired artwork. Well done Voo Doo!, also fun to stand outside and see the Keep Portland Weird sign across the street ... I hoped the cast from Portlandia would come bouncing by and I would end up an extra in the background .. Alas, that didn't happen but, we enjoyed the rare Portland sunshine in March , city sounds and tasty doughnuts .
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: Long line which moved quickly.  We ordered an assortment of donuts, some were on the SUPER sweet side, but I liked how these donuts were more of the traditional flavors.  If you wanted lavender jalapeno pb&j, you'd have to go elsewhere. At one point, an older gentleman came out and started yelling at a panhandler standing in front of the shop, loudly. And it was totally disturbing.  The homeless guy hobbled away but I was left mortified at the conduct of this employee (manager? owner?). I'm sure they deal with homeless and transients constantly because there are a lot in the area but there are just better ways to deal with the situation than yelling in front of all your customers.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
TL;DR - Donuts are ok, but way overhyped.  Voodoo has fun toppings, but the donuts themselves are unremarkable.  Go to Blue Star if you actually want high quality donuts.

We ordered about 8 donuts to share the Old Dirty Bastard, Portland Cream, Captain my Captain, Double Chocolate, Glazed Old Fashioned, The Loop, and Bacon Maple Bar. 
-Old Dirty Bastard: Oreos themselves were stale.  Donut itself wasn't great. 
-Portland Cream: Good. Standard cream donut
-Captain, my Captain: Same issues as ODB.
-Double Chocolate: Little stale
-Glazed Old Fashioned: Good.  Only donut where the donut itself was good.
-The Loop: Same issues as ODB and Captain
-Bacon Maple Bar: Only good part was the bacon
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
The place is cool and the service is funny 
Donuts are Unique , taste good just like any other donut . It's about the experience
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: This place is over hyped.  The donuts even though creative are not fresh tasting and you could easily be left feeling nauseous after eating a sugar block of a donut.  As a visitor I don't enjoy smelling bums lying around outside on the sidewalks near a food establishment either.  This was a turn off.  The lines are expectedly long given that out of towners want to say "they've been there".  I can't foresee locals eating at this place.  There are far better donut shops in Portland.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
so..... you either like it or hate it!
definitely not as good as blue donuts or peeps, i call it  tourist trap. but thats me...

text: Classic tourist stop! We pulled into the shop completely empty around 5 in the morning on a Saturday. I asked the worker (I think his name is Will) what donut he would recommend filled. He recommended the David's star and I also ordered the mango tango. The David's star wasn't over bearing raspberry filled, good for an everyday order. The Mango Tango was filled with mango jelly, vanilla icing, and tangy sprinkle topping. The service was amazing, the store was clean, and the doughnuts were fantastic!
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
Don't see what the hype is about. Just about every donut I have ever had there has tasted dried out and little stale. If you get a donut with cereal on top, expect that to be really stale as well. I have been to two locations (about 8 times total) and both were the same. The people are usually really friendly though! I gave them an extra star for their creativity with their donuts - wow, some really interesting stuff there.  

I AM HAPPY that they have brought a lot of publicity to Portland (and our eccentricities)!
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
It's just one of those places you have to go to
I went twice. The first time I went there was like no one there so I walked right in. I was looking at the case of doughnuts to pick from (which is super cool because then you can see all the options) and this group of kids come in and surround the case and it was chaos so I left.
The second time I came was less stressful. 11pm on a Monday night is prime time to go I guess! Got the Oreo and peanutbutter one. Surprisingly really good. I didn't have high expectations but it was a good doughnut. My partner got the maple and bacon and he said the same thing. Very good! The dough is soft and delicate. 
Both times though the staff were less than enthused. Not friendly. And I felt rushed
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: For a donut place, who can't rate Voodoo one of the best.  They are soft, fluffy, and have style and a personality.  Always a line to get a donut.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
I mean, it's Voodoo. This place is a Portland institution, and at this point, it's basically a cultural icon. I personally think that Blue Star has a better dough thanks to its brioche recipe, but Voodoo's fun offerings are always a treat. I usually order the voodoo donut and a cock-n-balls; I've never been disappointed by either.

If you're visiting later in the day or on a weekend, brace yourself for a longish wait.

I recommend grabbing a seat on the picnic benches on the side of the building to enjoy your donuts in the great outdoors, then wandering around in the Old Town area.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: Not so impressed... live with a donut aficionado and we have experienced donuts around the world:  always going to the reclmended place. The vibe is great...Halloween all year round, buy, the donuts sre just ok. In Portland Maine there is a donut shop that would kick their ass. And I. Amherst Massachusetts whole donuts would leave them at the starting gate. Fresh is key and they do not have the fresher off the oven understanding.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
They now take card! 

This place is good, but not worth standing in the line it sometimes commands! Came late at night on a weekday (~9pm or so), and there weren't many people around. Waited for 2 people before to order (~5min) and then it was our turn. The store itself has an interesting vibe and decorations, with the signature donuts displayed in a revolving case. 

I tried the Hi-Tea donut - a seasonal special with Earl Gray flavored frosting, and a Passion Fruit drizzle. The donut itself was light and fluffy and wasn't to overwhelming to eat as a dessert. I found the frosting a bit sweet, but the combination of Earl Gray and Passion Fruit was really compelling. I'm not sure I would enjoy some of the other more frosting-laden flavors they have for this reason, but I would recommend trying the Hi-Tea!
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
When you ask people to give suggestions on places to check out in Portland, they will all tell you to check out Voodoo Doughnut. It's been featured on Food network and if you are a foodie you have to visit this iconic doughnut shop. 

The stars were aligned when my friends and I arrived because there were only a few people in line when we got there. We were able to order in a matter of a few minutes. As we grabbed our pink box to leave, the line had grown. It was out the door and around the corner. 

We ordered a mix of their traditional and crazy topping doughnuts. The buttermilk and cream filled ones were nothing out of the ordinary. They tasted good, but were not memorable. The other two that we got were the Captain Crunch and the famous bacon maple doughnut. The Captain Crunch one was topped with an incredibly sweet white frosting and Captain Crunch and berries cereal. The actual doughnut was soft and fluffy, but we could not finish it because of all the sugar. Talk about sugar high! The bacon maple doughnut was hands down our favorite of the bunch. The flavor of the maple frosting with the bacon were a perfect match and wasn't as sweet as the Captain Crunch one. 

I've had better tasting doughnuts, but this place has a cool vibe that comes with it. There are plenty of fun and playful options on the menu. The doughnuts are reasonably priced, but make sure you have cash because they don't take cards.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
Without a doubt, this is a pit stop for any out of towner. You'll for sure see one or two pink voodoo boxes in the airport. Frankly, I don't understand the craze. It's weird and quirky and has the Portland charm to the shops, but that's all that I can really say is going for the store. I've seen insane lines that go down the block, I must admit that I've been guilty of waiting in those lines.

The decorations are fun and they take donuts to the next level by adding all these cereals and cookies to them. It's whats underneath all that make up that counts.. I mean frosting. You can dress it up as much as you want but at the end of the day the donuts are dry and virtually flavorless. Yeah, the donuts taste like instant diabetes but thats all from whatever is covering the donut. I've never wanted to dunk a donut in milk, but I absolutely feel that it is necessary. I know some people actually enjoy their donuts but for me, I can't get passed how dry it is and dense. Portland cream, dirty donut, voodoo doll, and dirty old bastard are on top of my list when I'm here.

Be prepared for a long line and come with cash.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: Why do people bother! The donuts are overpriced and nothing special at all! Amazing how many people go there! Tourist trap only!  Try coco donuts!
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
So on my first trip to portland i insisted on visiting VooDoo Doughnuts because it is a touristy thing to do. So i did. My experience was relegated to horrible. 

The first thing you notice when walking in is that this place is old and dungy. It doesn't look clean and the lighting is horrible. The customer service there is horrendous. They yelled at our group for standing in front of the door. If they don't want people standing in front of the door of a cramped 
 and overcrowded area they should set up line barriers to prevent this from happening. Yelling at customers doesn't really make the experience enjoyable. 

When we were called up to make our order we were met by a guy that was dressed very funky and was tattooed all over. I mean on his face, arms, and anything that was visible. I honestly was intrigued by all his tattooes. He had these knuckles tattoos with a line in between each knuckle followed by dots between the other knuckles on each finger. I had never seen that before so i asked what it meant. He looked at me and said "you don't know!?" to which i shook my head to indicate that i did not. He then said very rudely, "if you don't know then you will never know!" and walked away in disgust. He said it with such anger i was left there staring at the ugly pink walls of the shop in disbelief of what just happened. It was an eerie feeling being there to begin with and now it was a bad experience that kept turning worse. 

Now, i was hoping the doughnuts would redeem the bad experience. I tried the bacon maple doughnut. The doughnut tasted old and the bacon was dry and lacked flavor. To top it all off it wasn't reasonably priced either. 

Then what sealed the deal was that our group decided to eat our doughnuts a block away from the shop standing on the sidewalk. While eating them,  there was a man in his late 20s or early 30s standing about 5 feet away from us. We didn't think anything of it. He tried to make small talk with us but we kept to ourselves. A minute later we see him shooting up some heroin right in front of us. This was in the late afternoon and in public. 

Overall, I would give this entire experience 0 stars if it were possible. I will never step foot inside a VooDoo Doughnut shop again. Bad customer service, bad product, and it's located in area with junkies.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: For taste, quality, and uniqueness...I give it a 5 star. The donuts were delicious!! But, I had two kids with me and I was very embarrassed of the inappropriate names, etc for the donuts and in the decor. Don't recommend bringing kids or grandma in there. VERY LONG LINE (at 11:00am) They accept CASH only!
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: My brother bought some Voodoo doughnuts back for me and I must say I am seriously not impressed....$27 for a box of donuts that I could easily get here for half the price and taste better....its all a hype, just because they were featured on tv  they jack up their prices. None of the donuts I had stood out or made an impression on me.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
My first review for 2014! 

A very popular small doughnut place owned by two guys named Kenneth Pogson & Tres Shannon. This place is open 24/7 except on major holidays. It currently has a total of 3 locations in Portland only.

We went here for a late snack around 2:00 am & the line was still long! They were trying to control the number of people coming in, so they let a few in first. There's also few merchandise (like t-shirts, sweatshirts, underwear, etc.) for sale. The interior is very colorful. You can see a lot of pink color (like their boxes) which I like. :) There's a big doughnut display hanging...so cute! Forget about the word "diet" when you come here haha! Everything's very sweet, rich & filling.

So far I had tried the following :

* Grape Ape Doughnut - w/ vanilla frosting, grape dust & lavender sprinkles. My fave so far!
* Old Dirty Bastard doughnut - w/ chocolate frosting, Oreos & peanut butter. My friends loved this one. Too rich for me though.
* Voodoo Bubble doughnut - w/ vanilla frosting, bubble gum dust & a piece of bubble gum on top! My second fave. 
* Old Fashioned doughnut - glazed cake doughnut. 
* Cock-N-Balls - w/ Bavarian cream topped w/ chocolate frosting. 
* Voodoo Doll doughnut - w/ raspberry jelly topped w/ chocolate frosting & a pretzel stake. This looked so cute & funny! But was yummy as well.
* Bacon Maple Bar doughnut - w/ maple frosting & bacon on top. 

Vegan options available! Now, everyone's happy. :)

Cons: cash only. There are ATMs nearby.

We went here for 2 consecutive days! Hope to come back again in the near future.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: First experienced Voodoo in Eugene Oregon as we passed through. Was happy to find them again in Portland as we walked the food truck areas of 2nd, 3rd and 5th. Such a fun place with such a unique atmosphere. I had never had a buttermilk bar before visiting the west coast and now I'm obsessed. Regardless of your feelings about donuts, this place is worth a visit just for the experience.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: Love the varied selection of donuts-- love the Apple the best.  Line is usually long, but I think it goes by fairly quickly.

text: Super cute area! Unique donuts. Always a line. A tourist attraction for sure. Worth a visit. Cake donuts are good but they're small. All the other donuts were big, light, and fluffy. Ambiance inside the restaurant is a hard rock mixed with Cajun/ New Orleans vibe.

text: I really loved voodoo doughnut. I didn't feel like it was in the best part of town but the doughnuts made up for it completely. text: I don't really understand the appeal. Granted I like sweets but not love them. This seems like a overloaded donut just to be able to make them unique. Great concept but I just think it's extreme amounts of sugar. We split the homer 3 ways and the staff said it's the first time she's heard anyone asking for a donut to be cut . Glad we did because I felt it was just too much. Our 12yo enjoyed it. I hear another establishment is a bit better with the variety and styles they have. But I haven't been. I guess it's a great social media picture place.

text: Their donuts are delicious. I would recommend you stop by and try one. There may be a line when you get there, but its worth the wait. Their creativity  with all the donuts leaves you a bit overwhelmed on what to get. Their glazed donut never disappoints.

text: Parking is awful in the area but the line inside goes fast. Fun donuts and good prices.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
Ah, this is a classy place with some great doughnuts. There's two sides to every overhyped place that's featured on Food Network and I had to see what the fuss was for myself. I didn't see a wedding, I didn't sit in a school chair, I didn't see anything weird, freaky or eyebrow raising worthy. 

What I did experience was an extremely short line, amazing and courteous staff members and giant fluffy donuts. There are so many varieties of creative doughnuts and traditional doughnuts, it takes up two full chalkboards of writing. The vibe doesn't disappoint and the carousel of donuts does a decent job giving you some insight into what your choices are. 

I chose a "Captain my Captain" (Dead Poet Society anyone?) and enjoyed a glazed vanilla donut with Captain Crunch and Fruit Loops at the same time. It's quite the novelty eating donuts and cereal at the same time and it proved to be too much for me. It was filling and sweet but by the time I got to the center of the city, I had no room for the exciting food carts. 

I've gotta say, I'm still in love with the people of Portland and Voodoo Doughnuts only made my experience that much better. I liked my doughnut so much that I went back in the afternoon for a box of a dozen more little friends to take back on the plane with me. This time around, I needed a souvenir and the nice guy behind the counter scrounged around to find the bumper sticker of my choice. He didn't have to but he made it a priority and surprised this jaded San Francisco resident for sure.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: There is too much hype in this place. Not the best donuts but cool voodoo designs. The line is way to long so come early but even then it's long
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: Seriously, Portlandia!!!!  Get real.  You are so hard up to be weird and novel that you forsake making even the lowly donut palatable!!!!  By Seattle standards these donuts are barely mediocre, particularly the simple, old fashion.  What's the attraction?  Boredom?  I could get better donuts from a sack in a dumpster.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
Voodoo doughnuts is definitely a must-try when in Portland, unfortunately there is often a wait time that takes 30 minutes or more especially during the weekends. If you're looking for interesting and unique doughnut shapes and flavors, this is the place for you; but there are certainly other amazing doughnut places scattered around Portland. The sheer selection can be a little overwhelming, but there's always something for everyone. I personally gravitate towards the fruitier flavors, and have never been disappointed by Grapve Ave, Mango Tango, Raspberry Romeo, or The Vice. However if you're there for a one-time deal, I would recommend trying their specialties like the Voodoo Doll or Maple blazer blunt. 

At the end of the day they are amazing doughnuts but the wait times often makes me question the worth of it all; as there are many other doughnut places. However if you go close enough to closing you can always pick up a bucket of doughnuts to bring back for your all your friends and family to enjoy
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: I recently moved to Oregon and I have been dreaming of these doughnuts since I arrived. I finally went yesterday and I was not disappointed. The doughnuts were fresh, moist and fluffy and the flavors were fantastic. There was a long line, but it moved quickly so don't let a line scare you away from the awesome doughnuts.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: I popped in around midnight on a Sunday and it was packed! It was worth the wait, though! They have the most interesting and fun donuts. My favorite was the Simpson's donut with pink frosting and sprinkles but their apple fritters are amazing, too! Got a huge box of donuts for only $17. I thought that was a great deal.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
A visit to Voodoo Doughnut is a must when in Portland! 

I arrived around 9:30 am on a Friday morning and fortunately didn't have to wait in line more than about 15 minutes. Things move pretty quickly and will move even faster if you check Yelp before walking inside to better help you make your doughnut selection. Donuts are super cheap, ranging from .95 to about $2.75. Unfortunately the biggest drawback is that there are no descriptions about the different doughnut flavors- just funny names, so again, check Yelp to help you navigate the menu. 

I chose the Miami Vice which is coated in blue raspberry frosting and pink sprinkles. It was a little bit sweeter than expected but delicious none the less. I washed it down with a 12oz drip coffee and couldnt have been happier. 

Tips:
- cash only 
- don't block the door
- yelp the menu! 

Don't listen to anyone who says it's overhyped, overrated - it's a fun experience that you should try at least once.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
If there's one thing that Portland and Voodoo Doughnut have in common it's that both their reputations exceed them. Rather than being known for its confectionary quality it is more known for its peculiarity. Nevertheless, these donuts will impress one way or another, so make sure you stop by. 

The establishment is located on the outskirts of the city with the homeless and peripatetics walking every which way. These unbecoming factors create an unwanted discomfit. The inside however is another story. The walls are covered in miscellaneous knick-knacks with two carousal display cases that feature their renowned confections. One of the sales associates was just as much a novelty as the bizarre things inside if not more so. 

Our sales associate was, quite frankly, a dick. He corralled us through the line with a persistent "NEXT"! His eye rolls and uncouth behavior tainted our visit most of all. Thank goodness the donuts left us on a high note with their generous size and comforting taste.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: It's been a couple years since my last visit and a group of friends wanted to go. We went at 10 pm on a Friday and didn't have to wait very long in line, which was nice. My pick was the worst, a maple old-fashioned. It was dry. I was surprised that the fritter and cocknballs were pretty good. The crumb had a good texture but were overly sweet. Moral of the story: skip the cake donuts!
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
The personnel could use a little pep. We went in at 7am on a Saturday and even after some prompting failed to get even half a smile out of the guy behind the counter who maintained his look of I don't want to be here flawlessly. Luckily the donuts made up for this and I'll cut him a little slack because that's "early" for a lot of people. 
I'm a sucker for pretty desserts so voodoo hits that right out of the park. I really love the hibiscus flavored donut and the variety of vegan options is a huge plus. As far as sweetness tone it down and you've got a five star donut.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: Exciting atmosphere! Located in the heart of downtown we were surrounded by tons of people who were having a good time during the late night hours on Saturday night.  Line went quick and the staff was badass! Couldn't help but grab up the phallic style, captain crunch and fruit loop donut. A must visit !
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: I can certainly understand the fun with the novelties around these dougnuts.  But when you get down to it, they tasted just OK.  I think of this place as an amped up Dunkin' Donuts.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
A bit overrated.  We went around 10am on a Saturday morning and there was hardly a line.  Got up and ordered the Oreo covered doughnut but it was stale.  All the Oreos tasted really old as I'm sure they make them in batches and leave them out.  Also, stumptown is just down the road so you could get a doughnut and have a coffee. 

Ended up walking by the place again later in the afternoon and the line was super long.  Not with it in my opinion.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
THERE IS SOME VOODOO MAGIC GOING ON AT VOODOO DOUGHNUTS... 

They really aren't that great, lines are always long, and the donuts are expensive. There is someone out there placing spells on everyone that visits Portland that makes us visit VooDoo Doughnuts -- we just don't want to believe it.

They do offer quirky donut designs, and unique flavors, but they may be overdoing it a bit. It's like when I go to to FroYo Shop, and majority of my FroYo is toppings vs actual FroYo. And what is up with all this blow-me, cock-n-ball, penis shaped donuts? It's like I am in a porn shop for donuts.

The service is a little lacking as well. The people behind the counter seemed bored and uninterested. I don't know if that's how people are in Portland (not my first occurrence), but for such a touristy spot... they should at least try to care. Be happy, and sell us donuts with pride! lol

The donuts are not terrible, but I don't think they are necessarily worth the 30+ minute wait and price. We have our own specialty donut place in San Diego called Donut Bar, and although they do not have voodoo and penis designs (thank goodness!), they do have unique flavors and designs as well. I think our donut joint taste better, is safe for all ages and we don't believe in all that voodoo magic stuff. lol.

TIPS
-- They are open 24/7, so don't stop by during the rush hour
-- Cash only. There are nearby ATMs.
-- If you buy any cereal donuts, don't wait too long before you eat it because they will get stale.
-- I read on someone else's Yelp that they offer a bucket of "Day Old Donuts" for $10. I may look into that if I ever stop by Voodoo Doughnuts again. I just hope they are all family-friendly items. I can't imagine bringing home a bucket of donut shaped wieners. lol.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: Very fun, very sugary the best things happen to doughnuts here.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: Awesome donuts! Guaranteed that the long lines are worth waiting through! Any time I pass through town on road trips it's a must stop location.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: I've finally made the pilgrimage-voodoo donuts. The place my friends and I used to fantasize about making a 15 hour road trip to back in high school. So, when ur girl had a 12 hour layover in PDX, what else is she to do but venture out of the terminal to trek out to this iconic place? It did not disappoint. I arrived on a cool Tuesday morning around 6:45am. There was NO ONE in line and only a couple of customers munching on goodies inside. GET THE VOODOO DOLL. It is iconic, and the jelly inside is magnificent-tastes like it's made from scratch raspberry filling complete with a few crunchy seeds. No jelly will ever compare. The raspberry paired well with the chocolate and it was incredibly filling. Go grab one and take a stroll along the nearby water (even if you have to risk missing your flight in doing so).
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: I honestly felt like voodoo was super overrated after hearing all the hype and standing in line for far too long. We bought three donuts and one of them was good----the grape flavor, strangely enough. If youre looking for a great donut, head towards blue star.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: Hype. hype. hype. Honestly, it's just a regular donut with candy/cereal/syrup on top. There's no unique flavors and no creative twists other than the names of the donuts. BUT, if you MUST get something, the maple bacon and the voodoo are the way to go. The line is absurdly long for what it is but at least there were some Portland homeless musicians to entertain us.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
My boyfriend and I patiently waited in a ridiculous line for 30 minutes at about 1:45 PM on a Friday afternoon because apparently you MUST GET Voodoo Donuts when in Oregon. I carefully decided which ones to get: the original voodoo doll, the giant phallic-looking one, old dirty bag, and a Portland cream. Since I was saving the donuts for later consumption, I regrettably didn't look inside the gaudy pink box. The lady who took my order only gave me 2 of the ones I asked for. I didn't even receive the voodoo doll which is the one I wanted most. ): She even charged me for it. I asked for 4 different donuts, but was charged for 3, and she totally didn't even give me one of the donuts she charge me for..

Sorry, Portland. Too hype for me.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: My friend traveled from Colorado Springs to try their vegan donuts. She wanted to make sure several times before leaving the shop up make sure her donuts were vegan, to get home to find bacon maple donuts all the way at the bottom of her box. She's now sick. I can't believe the carelessness in this matter, especially if this was an allergy or religious situation. The fact that she reiterated how important it was to get vegan donuts and to find them all the way at the bottom sounds fishy to me.

text:
There are way better doughnuts in Portland, go to Pips or Blue Star and save yourself a rough experience. The doughnuts aren't anything special and are often stale, the draw is the weird toppings and not the actual doughnut.

This location is in the WORST part of town and there is always sketch shenanigans happening outside. My most recent visit included a man throwing literal salad out of a bag while screaming at no one. I realize this isn't necessarily the fault of the business but I definitely think the voodoo tourism contributes to the area.

Also, just a side note but the cash only policy is beyond outdated. Any business of this scale that doesn't take card in 2019 doesn't deserve business.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch

text: Not the greatest donuts in the world but definitely a tourist spot. Fun donuts sometimes long wait times and cash only !!!  When in Portland try a voodoo doll.

text: While on a morning stroll, I decided why not start it off right with a donut or two.  There was a lot going on for choices but the maple bacon was an obvious move to be made.  The maple cream and a staff suggestion of sweet + savory (something with purple icing) finished the trio.  I swung by Stumptown and then back to the hotel to take part in the pleasure.  I can only describe it as what I imagine biting into a cloud must feel like. When you top it off with a perfect maple icing and crispy bacon, no other donut could compare. The only disappointment I suffered was not being able to eat the others as one was enough. I will say, I'm eagerly looking forward to my next breakfast or late night snack though :)
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text: A huge sugar ball wrapped up as a donut! The line wasn't too bad when we went. There about 5 groups in front of us on a weekday. Our order was taken quickly and efficiently by the employee. She was friendly. It's a must come place to say you've been there but I hear Blue Line Donuts is better for the actual taste of the donut. But for the craziness of the designs, Voodoo Donut is the place to be. Only downside is that it is located RIGHT next to a strip club. Try walking by really fast and explaining that one to the kids while waiting in line. This is the original one. There are the other Voodoo Donuts around the city.
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
Cold, sprinkly night and no lines at Voodoo Donuts? YAAAAAAAS! 

Seriously, we were driving, then bf pointed out Voodoo Donuts and I was like, "where?!?" Lol. DAFUQNOLINE?!

This place is CASH ONLY so don't be a tourist noob thinking they take cards and such. Prepare them bills!

Donuts were placed in a massive glass spinning cabinet to show them off. There were lots to choose from but in the end...We got:

The Blue Moon Pie - blue marshmallow filling with Chocolate and graham toppings.

The Pothole Doughnut - a raised yeast bar filled with Bavarian cream topped with chocolate frosting and crushed Oreo's with a vanilla road stripe down the middle.

Maple Bacon Bar - maple glazed donut with bacon on top.

Cock n balls - cream filled, penis shaped donut that will literally jizz in your mouth. Mmmmmmmm, it's truly a specialty. What's not to like about that?

We had a few bites of the donuts and do find them good but a little too sweet. I'm so glad my first experience here was a good one since there were no long lines, friendly cashier and not a lot of people during the time of our visit. Will definitely come back next time!
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
ITINERARY: SUNDAY late night (since Voodoo is open 24 hours!)

Why do people flock to Voodoo Doughnuts?

Must be whatever voodoo they sprinkle on their stuff.

Although it's a cute place with crazy looking donuts and a long line, the bottom line for me was that the donuts were not good.

Period.

It's a tourist attraction most definitely. 

Maybe pass by, buy a donut or two or take some photos but it baffles me why anybody would want to buy boxes and boxes of this stuff and take it home. The dough was rubbery and dry and the toppings like the chocolate and cream tasted old and overly sweet.

text:
"ITS THE PORTLAND THING TO DO!" is a common phrase you'll hear people describe Voodoo Donuts as. It's incredibly popular and you can be sure to always find a line outside of it.

The donuts here are appealing to look at and they make for a pretty picture. There are numerous flavors here and they all taste good. However, keep in mind that the quality of the donut itself is not at all that great. The cakey texture is comparable to a regular donut found in a supermarket. If you're looking for truly a one of a kind donut experience, then check out Blue Star Donuts.

- Bacon Maple Bar: each bite was exploding with a prominent maple flavor with the addition of a slight bacon flavor. 

- Old Dirty Bastard: a culmination of chocolate and peanut butter flavors. Crumbled Oreos over peanut butter and finished with a chocolate drizzle. Definitely enjoyable for anyone who loves peanut butter!

- Berry Hibiscus: a pretty donut with an artificial berry flavor

- Homer Simpson: if you're a Simpson's fan then you obviously gotta get this one time for Homer..

If you're looking for a donut shop with different and unique flavors, then check out Voodoo Donuts!
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town

text:
"How do you do that voodoo that you do so well?" About a dozen or so donut flavors you can't find anywhere else. My favorite: The dried Rice Krispies and peanut butter over chocolate one. They will have all your buttermilk, coconut, glazed, chocolate cake classics, too, so don't worry.

"Voodoo" started the revolutionary trend in artisan donuts in this country, but my vote for #1 is still "Do-Rite" in Chicago by my man, Jeff Mahin. But if you're in Portland, Oregon you can't miss this. Just realize that there's always a 30-60 minute wait. It's open 24 hours, so if you can manage to go at 5 a.m. you will have some luck. Like you'll be able to get up, right! #tubular
categories: Local Flavor, Food, Donuts, Wedding Chapels, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch
name: Voodoo Doughnut - Old Town
