Ah yes, screen door baby!  My friend from Portland took us out to eat brunch here during the weekend, and the anticipation of eating here was psyching me out a bit. Especially after having such a great meal out at Tasty N Sons after arriving in Portland.  This is one of those places that can probably be compared to Bills Cafe in SJ (which I still haven't had the luxury of eating at yet).  I'll have to see how Bills rates next to Screen Door soon.  Anyhow, the wait was pretty long but easy when you have three other friends to talk to.  The place had an outdoor patio eating area and was essentially packed.  

They had some pretty good free coffee inside for all patrons waiting (both decaf and regular I believe).  The interior was nicely trendy and slightly modern from what I can remember.  I was pretty decisive on ordering the fried oyster benedict and damn the portion was big.  I couldn't finish the whole thing, and had to box up like a third of it. The other food ordered looked f-ing delish which I had pictures of.  I don't usually take pics of food before eating but should think about carrying a point and shoot for that more often.  I remember seeing a guy next to us pull out a full sized Samsung Galaxy Tab, first time seeing someone use that in a restaurant... hehe.  

Anyway, I really liked the restaurant setup and the seemingly reasonable menu prices, quality food, and relatively fast service all around.  I'd have to admit that I have underestimated what Oregon has to offer for the true everyday foodie!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: The food was super delicious. Some of the best chicken and sausage gravy I have ever tasted. The only thing is that the wait is a little long, even after you are seated.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: This place is simply amazing and well worth the wait. I ended up getting shrimp and grits which had pesto sauce lining the grits simply amazing. Drinks were good and prices reasonable for quality of food.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: Holy yum. Beautiful restaurant, great service...and I always seem to luck out by getting seated right away. The mac & cheese is crispy, bubbly and cheesy all at the same time...in it's own little baking dish, a perfect compliment to the light & crumbly-coated fried catfish. Okay, so we were little piggies and also ordered fried okra (mmm...more please), hush-puppies (hot damn) and jambalaya (giggity)...and it all blew me away. I grew up in Oregon so I can't really say if Screen Door is "authentic" Southern cuisine or not, but who freakin' cares.  Everything I've eaten there has been an explosion of awesomeness in my mouth...and I absolutely love that their menu is ever-changing, takes advantage of fresh local ingredients and offers lots of options for veggies & carnies alike. Can't wait to try brunch, I've been told it's even better.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: I enjoyed my experienced at the Screen Door. My friend got the buttermilk fried chicken, which she loved. I got the braised pork shoulder. The pork was tender and came with beans, cole slaw and an amazing BBQ sauce. The only downside was that my beans were nice and warm, but the meat itself was only lukewarm. Not really sure what happened with that, but it wasn't a big deal, considering how yummy the food was. For dessert, we shared an Apple rhubarb crisp with ginger ice cream. Perfect way to end our meal! As far as service goes, Ryan was friendly and very attentive, especially for how busy it was. The rest of the staff was great too; we had multiple people check on us, give suggestions on food and refill our drinks. I will definitely be back and I can't wait to try the rest of the menu! :)
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: Wow! What to add to this many reviews. I have tried many a Portland restaurant and this one is one of my favorites. I really love all the local and seasonal dishes. Everything that I have ever had here is stellar. On top of that the restaurant is incredibly affordable. One note-portions are large so share with your dining companion if you can. My husband always insists I get my own : )
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: Fantastic southern fare, which will have you checking your waistline way after its too late. Please try the fried chicken and yams it's an experience!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: We had a wonderful experience here. The place is popular and we totally understand why. The food is delish, the servers are enthusiastic and attentive. Cool vibe. Love the menu and it's fun to be able to combine small plates or have an entree. Cocktails awesome too. We've already made the trip from Seattle to come back again. Crave-worthy!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: We got thereby 5:00pm, doors open at 5:30pm. We had to wait about 30-40 minutes for a table but were able to grab a drink from the bar while we waited. All of the food was really good and worth the wait. The liver, Mac and cheese, and gumbo were my personal favorites. The pecan pie was amazing and the Scarlet O'Hara (drink) was delish! The service was super friendly.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: Five of us had dinner at the Screen Door last week.  Two people in our group have serious food allergies.  The wait staff and kitchen were over-the-top friendly and helpful in accommodating their needs.  And of course, the food was yummy.  What more can I say?  Don't let the wait to be seated put you off.  It was worth it!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: Long wait to get in. Very cramped restaurant. As soon as you get your food, you forget all about that. The cuisine is spectacular.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: Since so many people recommended Screen Door as a place to try in PDX, we gave it a shot.  Pretty damn good food, if you ask me.  Stellar service, big portions, and fresh (real) lemonade --what more can you ask for?
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: Food is simply delicious! I think we went a great timing because we only had to wait about 10 min for a table for dinner. However food is what takes a while to come out. We were seated right next to the kitchen and I enjoyed it! You can see how it's run by the chef. They are clean and orderly. Waiter was great and constantly checks up on us. Portions were big. Would definitely come back again and recommend for any out of Towner's.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: Delicious chicken and waffles! Went there for weekday breakfast. I'm excited to eat there for brunch or dinner
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: Great food, great service, and kid friendly.  Plus, you meet nice people waiting in line for a table.  I had the Shrimp po' boy and it was super legit with beautiful J4/J5 sized shrimps.  They know how to flip tables so don't worry bout the wait.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: Yum yum yum! Best fried chicken around. Also the drinks are great, especially if you have wait in line to get a table....
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: Amazing food! Be prepared to wait but it is so worth it! The chicken and waffles are the best around.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
FOOD:
I've tried about everything on the menu and everything here is amazing! Big portions, big flavor! The one item that stand out the most to me though is the praline maple bacon! After a taste of this, it will forever change the way you look at bacon. It is caramelized, crunchy, sweet,  savory, and not too greasy at all. The thick cut bacon is and the maple syrup definitely makes you want to just keep eating and eating. 

SERVICE:
It is always amazing. Warm, welcoming, and very accommodating. If you have a big party larger than 6 or 7 you can call in ahead to put your group on the waitlist. They do not do reservations but this is better than nothing. All the servers are very attentive and make sure your experience and well spent.

AMBIANCE:
The space is a little small but the vibe is very cute and eclectic. Very southern home style. I do suggest getting their early because wait times, although worth it, can be very long due to their small space.

OVERALL:
Go to Screen Door you won't regret the wait!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: We've heard a lot about this place so we decided to try it since we were in town and because my gf loves fried chicken. People said the wait is usually very long with a line out the door but when we went Tuesday afternoon there was no line and we got a table right away. I ordered the hot link poboy and my gf ordered the chicken and waffles. The chicken was delicious. One of the best I've had. The sweet potato waffles was good too but I prefer regular waffles. The hot link sandwich was decent too but my favorite part of that plate was probably the roasted potatoes. but if I go back I would just order the chicken and waffles. Our waitress was very nice and attentive so it made the experience nice. Definitely recommend this place if you're a fan of chicken and waffles.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
Today was a great day
 Stopped for breakfast at about 10 am and were seated within 20 minutes in the shady patio alongside 23rd street. Our waiter was very attentive and friendly.  He asked if we were 1st timers and gave suggestions of his personal favorites as well as the most popular items with clues as to the portion sizes. I ordered the chicken and waffles. The sweet potato waffles were crispy outside and moist and tender inside. The chicken was soooooo good. It was not at all greasy. The coating was crunchy with a little lingering heat from cayenne and black pepper. Spouse had the praline bacon waffles. Lots of bacon in the batter with an extra rather on top just to gild the lily.  I had heard great thing about the mac and cheese, but we we a little early for the lunch menu so our waiter put in an order at 1030 just as lunch started. It was really creamy and the macaroni was still a little al dente which was perfect. The cheese blend for the sauce included a bleu which was a little overpowering even with a generous sprinkle of cheddar over the top. With this wonderful meal, I ordered a blueberry shrub that was mixed with a ginger beer. DELIGHTFUL! CANT WAIT TO GO BACK AGAIN! I can imagine that Screendoor's decision to not accept reservations could result in significant wait times on weekends, but on this weekday, it was not a burden.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
Stopped in for brunch after a failed attempt on Mother's Day (could not wait the estimated hour). We arrived about 5 or 10 minutes before they opened and we were a bit surprised by the length of the line. We just missed the cut off for a table inside but waited the 20 or 30 minutes to get seated outside on the patio. As we had our young daughter the patio was the ideal spot anyway. I really enjoyed having a cup of coffee as we waited, glad they allow customers to help themselves. 

We started with a Bloody Mary. While we are not big drinkers we both enjoy a good Bloody Mary from time to time. And as it was a holiday we indulged. Nice spice, not overly strong with a delicious pickled okra garnish. Next came the rhubarb turnovers, a nice treat to whet our appetites. The filling was well prepared with a touch of tartness. They vanished as fast as they arrived. 

My wife ordered the bananas foster french toast, simple but oh so good. Love the hint of orange, the soft but not mushy bread and the fact that the plate could have fed us all. After having look at the menu a few weeks back I had expected I would order a scramble. However, when we were waiting to be seated I spied plate after plate of chicken and waffles. Never having had to combination it seemed this would be the ideal circumstance to give it a try. And I was not disappointed one bit. The bird was crispy with a nice peppery finish, a prefect compliment to the bloody as well as the waffle. The sweet potato did not stand out but the waffle was still great. I have seen the light, we will be back for more!

I would suggest that it is worth the wait but that is a personal decision. We all had a great time, service was excellent and the food was wonderful. I would give the Screen Door four and a half stars if I could. There was nothing I would change about our meal, I'm just not one to give five stars too often.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
Amazing. Every single time. Amazing.
No matter what time you get through their doors, you are sure to have a face full of PERFECTION in food form!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: This place is amazing!!! Chicken and waffle is near perfect, ambiance is fantastic, and the bloody Mary is pretty darn good. There is always a wait, unless you have a group of 6 or more. Then you can use the call ahead service, which is convenient!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: I have been here three times, once for dinner, and twice for breakfast.  This place has amazing food and drinks.  It is very popular and you will have to wait no matter what time you go, but it is worth the wait.  The service is friendly and good, food is beyond amazing.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
Our favourite Southern restaurant for hearty comfort food.
Average wait time is 30-45mins, well worth it even with kids.
The crispy fried chicken with mash is our all time favourite, with collard greens on the side.
Staff are always pleasant and friendly, kids are occupied with crayons to colour.
Off street parking isn't too bad. We love sitting outside in the summer.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
I return to the Screen Door almost every time I visit Portland. I love the crispy fried buttermilk-battered chicken. The Mac & Cheese ROCKS!!!  Mashed potatoes good...hush puppies good...The pulled pork and bbq'd beef brisket are also really good. In fact, everyone I have gone there with has enjoyed everything they have ordered.

The only thing that would make it perfect for me is if the Sweet Tea were a bit sweeter.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
Decided to drop by The Screen Door for brunch on a Sunday. I ordered the chicken and waffles and it was delicious! I don't think that it was the best fried chicken I've ever had but it was pretty good, especially because of it's unique seasoning with hints of southern flavors. And yes, it was juicy. The serving is very large too. I had a lot leftover and packed it to go for a second meal. I also ordered a mimosa and that was great as well. My boyfriend ordered the oyster and eggs benedict with grits and we both though it was alright. It tasted like standard eggs benedict. 

We were seated outside. At first I didn't want to sit outside because we were there on a cold morning. But then to my amazement, they had heaters outside and that helped a lot. 

Our server was friendly and attentive. A+ for customer service!

Final Verdict: I can't wait to come back!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: Consistently good food and will never let you down.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: Well my review is simple.  If your that successful and your food is that good.  Why wouldnt you open at 6 or 7?  9am?  Really?  Guess I will never get to try it out.  Quit being cool and give the early birds an opportunity to be in and out.  FYCNWN.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
You have to wait for this place wither in line or after putting your name down, but it is so worth it! My Husband and I enjoyed brunch on a Saturday morning. 

My Husband got the bananas foster waffles with a side of bacon. He hasn't stopped talking about it all day! 

After looking over their menu I decided to make my own breakfast something that is easy at Screen Door and that I'm used to doing with my allergy to milk. I had called before going and received a very thorough response about their menu's milk content as well as recommended dairy free options! I choose an egg, roasted potatoes and chicken apple sausage. While that may sound boring boy was it good!! The potatoes were the best I've ever had and the three together were superb!! 

If you are in Portland, make time for this spot!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: Screen Door doesn't really need another positive review, but yeah, their fried chicken and waffles was a game changer for me. You could share this between 3 people, easy. Their fried oyster Benedict is an excellent runner-up, but they really need to work on their Bloody Mary - or this could just be a difference of tastes. Other than that, well worth the wait, the space is open and welcoming, and it's understandable why this place is Portland's most happening brunch spot. Oh, and get there early on Sunday to start the queue, unless you have a really good book.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: This is it for vegans looking for imaginative, fresh, local goods.  Veggies can be boring, I know, but not here. They have a 'screen door' plate with a lot of selections to choose from. We had most of them and they were all great. Excellent sauces, imaginative ingredients and combinations, and a relaxed atmosphere made it a fabulous experience.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
Long wait for sure. But the food is well worth it!

Best fried chicken northwest of the mason-dixie line - relatively thin layer of batter and SUPER FRESH AND JUICY chicken meat!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
During our short visit to Portland, my husband and I only have enough time for one brunch so we picked screen door. We showed up 20 minutes prior to openning time and was able to get one of the last tables available after openning. Crowded place and a bit tight. I'm not sure if service was a bit slow and unfriendly because they were so busy during their openning time but I was getting antsy waiting to get my orders in, drinks, and food. 

Maple Praline Bacon: bacon with maple and coat with nuts. It was good but I've had better and felt that the bacon can be a bit more crisp. 4/5

Waffle and Chicken: Giant pieces of chicken (3) on top of a waffle. It was quite intimidating when the plate arrived. Crispy chicken, however, it was a bit bland and dry.  The waffle was good but nothing special. 3/5

Farm Grits: warm and savory cheesy grits with poached eggs on top. I found the extra giant piece of ham in the plate a bit distracting. I think if it was a thicker ham chopped into smaller pieces would be easier to eat. I think the big piece of ham is a bit too much for the dish. 3/5

Bloody Mary: yum! 4/5

I think it was good enough food but not good enough to wait and definitely not a 4.5 stars.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
Food was very tasty.  My cousin and her husband shared the fried chicken and waffles with a side of the praline bacon.  They gave me a sampling and the fried chicken and Pbacon were moist and delicious.   I ordered the bananas foster french toast.  It included fresh homemade whipped cream, the kind that melts on your taste buds.  The flavors of their food are masterful, not overwhelming. I gave 4 stars because the french toast servings could add another slice of bread. 
I will be returning the next time I visit the area. 
Keep up the great quality and service Screen Door!!!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: We arrived at 5:40pm on a Tuesday.  There was already a line.  We waited for about 15 minutes and got one of the last tables.  Some of the people that was in line behind us were still waiting when we left almost an hour later.  If you go expect a long wait.  The food was okay.  Not true southern food.  We had the fried oysters and shrimp and grits.  The oysters were not good.  Very fishy tasting.  The shrimp and grits were okay, but not traditional.  If your looking for good southern style food I would go to Delta's or the Tin Shed.  And there's no bathroom so go easy on the drinks.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: Visiting from Los Angeles we couldn't have picked a better restaurant for dinner. Shrimp and Grits was amazing and the Crispy Fried Buttermilk Battered Chicken was so tender !  the coleslaw and smashed potatoes were on point. I can't stop thinking about it. We usually don't order dessert but the guy next to us had ordered what looked like a banana pie so we ordered one too. I thought I was full from dinner but not full enough for the Ban-offee pie !!!  I want to go back again for dinner tonight !!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: Screen Door never disappoints! Even when you drive by on the weekend, and there are a billion people outside, it still moves pretty quickly. The fried chicken and waffles are like none other.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
Great southern cooking in the heart of Portland! Best or among the best I have ever had of the following dishes...

1. Mac and cheese. Super cheesy with a nice toasted cheese layer on top. Most steakhouses can't do it this well.

2. Beef brisket. Best I have ever had. Tender enough to cut with a spoon.

3. Crusted fish. I just though the fish was ok. Maybe a higher quality fish would taste better. Great crust though.

4. Fried chicken. It's de-boned which usually means dry but it was super moist and Crispy on the outside. Really tasty and it might be the best chicken I have had. We loved it so much, my wife and I came back the second night for the same dish!

5. Banana cream pie. Holy c**p! Best banana dessert ever. 

Don't miss this place if you are in the Portland area! Long lines so get there early!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: Great food. I grew up in the South and this is an improvement on the cuisine in most (not all) ways. That being said, the brunch really isn't worth the wait.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
I was really excited for my return to Screen Door for dinner.  The first time I ate here was for brunch and I really wanted to try their Mac and cheese, which isn't available during brunch.  I got the screen door plate--which is a choice of any 3 sides. I had the Mac n cheese of course, the catfish (add an extra dollar), and the German potato salad. My bf got the fried chicken and my bro got the brisket.  

The Mac and cheese unfortunately did not deliver for me, only because I'm spoiled by Homeroom in Oakland, CA, which specializes in Mac and cheese entrees and is very good at it.  Screen Door's take on the Mac and cheese was a little bland and runny for me. I did like the top--a layer of baked cheesy goodness. As I write this I am feeling more and more remorseful for what I ate yesterday. I ran two miles this morning and that probably burned off 2 bites of what I had.  The beef brisket was good until we found a hair in it. They replaced the plate very quickly....

Anyway, the dinner was good but not amazing. I wish they still had the praline bacon, but that is only available during brunch. Nothing during dinner stood out for me the way that bacon did. ...Again I'm feeling like a fat ass talking about food like this.  But I hope at the very least this post helped you decide on your meal.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: Sorry, I just don't get the craze about Southern food. Too much fried, too much meat (I am vegetarian/vegan).
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: I has the shrimp and grits and thought they were fabulous! The wait wasn't too bad to get in, I got there around 1:15 p.m. on a week day. The staff was friendly. I had no problems with any of my service but the lady beside me thought that her food arrived to slowly and complained. The staff handled it wonderfully and comped part of her meal to make up for it. I will definitely go back next time I'm in Portland.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
This place is a must go when your in portland! Whether it be for brunch on the weekend or for dinner, they have the best fried chicken ever! If you go during brunch make sure atleast one person orders chicken and waffles, its the best chicken and waffles, well a close second. But if you do go for dinner, make sure to go a little later in the night or like 10-20 minutes before they open or you can be waiting up to an hour and half for a table. I guess that also counts for brunch, its literally busy all the time. Love the vibe from the place and honestly the best southern restaurant I have tried! Also make sure to try their mac and cheese and for desert get the banana cream pie (forgot what its called) but its the only banana related desert they have and its amazing. 
If your ever in portland, make sure to hit this place up!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: Consistently great food and service. The wait can be off putting but just plan for it. Lots of vegetarian options!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
Screen Door is a must go-to spot in Portland for brunch. My friend and I opted to visit in Tuesday morning hoping the wait wouldn't be long and we lucked out. We were able to be seated right away.

We ordered praline bacon, chicken and waffles, and a side one biscuit with sausage gravy. My friend ordered shrimp and grits. 

The praline bacon was so good. It was a delicious sticky, sweet, salty and nutty treat. A definite must try! 

The chicken and waffles were also great. The chicken was fried perfectly and had a little spice to it. The sweet potato waffle was amazing. 

The side of biscuit with sausage gravy was huge. Honestly that was a meal by itself. But it was also really really good and we managed to scarf it down. 

The service was great and as we left there was a good sized wait. The hype is real- screen door is legit!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
I once re-enacted that Portlandia episode where they wait for hours at a brunch spot before it opens for the day. I'm convinced that Screen Door inspired that episode. Luckily, it was well worth it.

Our first attempt to try this spot was at opening on Sunday morning. We arrived 10 minutes before opening to find the line was down the street already. I didn't want to make our friends wait for hours so I moved brunch to the Hunnymilk pop up (it was amazing too!). The second attempt was mid-morning on Monday and the line was shorter. We ended up waiting an hour and a half for breakfast. The restaurant has a bar behind the hostess stand where you can grab coffee, juice, and drinks to enjoy while you wait. I'd suggest this since your wait will most likely be a long one.

At long last we were seated at one of the picnic tables on the patio. I liked the outdoor seating and the patio was definitely less lively than the inside of the restaurant. By the time we were seated we had decided on our brunch feast options so we got to it.

I had the Pimento Cheese & Sausage Biscuit Sandwich. Ahhhhhmazing. The biscuit was piled high and was a fork and knife sandwich. The biscuit was very tasty, the sausage patty was thick, eggs perfectly prepared, and the pimento cheese was delicious. The ingredients sound standard, but the taste was far from standard. The Cheesy Grits on the side were yummy as well.

My husband had the Fried Oyster Breakfast Po-Boy. This is not a dainty sandwich, bring your appetite. He absolutely loved this and was happy to get his fried oyster fix in Portland. The roasted potatoes on the side were amazing.

For breakfast dessert we shared the Coconut Pancakes with Rhubarb Compote and orange whipped cream. The pancakes were fluffy and the coconut flavor was very nice. The orange whipped cream was really good and a nice touch. I loved the rhubarb compote on top and could have enjoyed at least twice as much.

I can see why this restaurant has a constant line. The food is definitely worth the wait. Next visit I'm coming in for dinner!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
This place lives up to the hype. Wait time I would say is normally 1 to 1.5 hours normally depending on your group size. I would get here early. Parking can be found on most streets, no dedicated lot.

Service was amazing, our waiter was entertaining. I would highly recommend the chicken and waffles and the pecan bacon.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: Awesome local veggie options. The brussel sprouts with squash was so flavorful I could not stop eating it. Mac and cheese was also great, as well as the parsnips and carrots. Definitely big portions, I ended up with leftovers despite eating so much of it-- the leftovers were still tasty as hell. Not too long of a wait either
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: The hipsters are right!!! This place will not disappoint. Even for me, a gluten free-er, I thoroughly enjoyed my meal. Worth the hour wait. Pecan bacon is recommended.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: Best breakfast place I've been to in Portland. Get there early and try to get in the first wave of pie people being seated. Otherwise, expect a wait and go grab a coffee.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: For many years I didn't think chicken & waffles go better than Roscoe's, but this place beats them hands down. You get three perfectly seasoned juicy fried chicken breasts on top of a hot sweet potato waffle. WOW! Heaven in your mouth. We also ordered one of their scramble breakfasts with a delicious bowl of local fresh fruits. If you live in Portland and you have not been here, GO! Scrumptious southern cookin' in the North West.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
This place was great.

I got a pulled pork sandwhich and my pal got the pick three sides deal. Also got some fried chicken.

My sandwhich was delicious.

Pulled pork was delicious. Fried chicken was perfect, though I wasn't quite as big a fan of the sauce as him. I couldn't stop eating it all and left no room for my ice cream desert later.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
Deserves a good review. Though this place is famous for its breakfast, i haven't been able to wait in the long queue for it. I had dinner there n liked vegan as well as chicken options available there. The craft beers were good too. 

Looking forward to having breakfast there soon!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
I love the Screen Door!

I took my boyfriend here last night for his birthday after hearing rave reviews from multiple friends. The Screen Door has a nice open and simple feel to it. It was pretty empty when we arrived, a little after opening. We were so involved in our delicious food, we didn't even notice how packed it got around us until we left. The staff were very attentive, helpful, and nice.

The food was amazing!! I had the fried chicken which I could not stop thinking about after we left. I was sitting at the Rose Garden, watching the Blazers spank our opponent saying "gosh that chicken was sooo good." If I am ever pregnant, I think this may be the food I will crave. The chicken was so moist and not terribly greasy for being fried. My BF got the Screen Door plate with catfish, mac n cheese, and coleslaw. I tried everything but the catfish and it was all very good! BF also said the catfish was very tasty and fresh. He was quite impressed with the food and kept saying "great choice!"
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: Had an excellent experience.  The outdoor seating was decent.  I had the Chicken and Waffles, which was probably enough food for 2.  The Pecan Pie was single-serving and was decent, not too sweet but not very exciting.  Looking forward to coming back.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: It's not a great place to go if you're on a diet but that being said, it's a great place for comfort food made extremely well.  Anyplace that serves the food stabbed through with a knife is my kinda place but honestly, it's like crack.  Pretty much everything you order is like crack.  It's done so well that it might scare you a little, and make you glad they're located clear across town and not nearby.  It's a little hipster but fun and the people who work here are awesome.  Great food, cool atmosphere and you will not leave hungry.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
My friend flew in and we decided to go to the screen door for a late lunch. There was a really long wait and we had the option of sitting inside or out, but the hostess ended up seating us inside because it was freezing outside. After being seated, our server was very prompt. We ordered the eggs sardou benedict and breakfast cornbread. The portions were big definitely needed to share. 

The benedict was really good. It had a poached egg on top with artichoke and spinach on top of a half muffin x 2. Perfect for sharing. It also came with a side of potatoes. The cornbread breakfast it was pretty sweet and a perfect compliment to the savory benedict. Good dessert to end off with.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
When it comes to comfort food, this is as good as it gets folks! Take it from me I've cut my chops on an endless pursuit (worldwide including 48 U.S. states) for the best chicken. Screen Door's chicken that accompanies their delectable cinnamon and *I don't even know* waffles are AMAZING!!! They come to your plate stack 3 high and as soon as you see that waiter/ waitress (gender inclusion is a must in 2018 ).. anyways lol.. but yeah you see her/ he with that plate and you immediately think...  "this is what I went to college and grad school for (Go Huskies!), to buy %&#* like this! The plate is massive! The chicken is golden and and you can visibly see the seasonings that will soon remind you why you have a hole under your nose. Upon that first bite you notice the all the usual seasonings.. salt, pepper, garlic, and onion powder and some that are of course proprietary (I wonder if I got into a serious relationship with one of the staff would I be able to get the recipe? ). YES IT'S THAT GOOD! I will be going back and making it a mainstay as this was one of the best breakfast Ive had in any state or city. 

FYI: The wait can be long, and when you drive you see people and wonder if its worth it. IT IS. There's a reason why half the city's there and willing wait too! You should do the same! 

Cheers.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
It was a December Monday before the 3 of us drove back to Vancouver, Canada and we really wanted some good breakfast before heading home. We got here and put our name down at 11:00am, and got our seat at 11:40am. By the time we have our seats, we already know what we want so we waited for the server to come back with water and coffee and ordered at 11:42am.

Atmosphere: very laid back, but busy little restaurant.

Customer service: The line was sort of efficient. We do notice a 4 seater was given to a couple. The server was smart in giving us sharing plates since we mentioned we are sharing our dishes. 

Kitchen service: ordered 1 biscuit and sausage gravy, 2 pc chicken and waffles, and St. Helen's Beef brisket hash (specials menu) at 11:42am. The orders arrived at 12:11pm.

Taste, portion, and price: Large portions, decent prices. The fried chicken is amazing. The waffle is baked with cinnamon and is so delicious. The gravy is nice and thick, with lots of sausage. 

Overall: if the wait didn't take so long this place will earn 5+ stars.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: Chicken and Waffles are AMAZING. The wait sucks. Be prepared to wait an hr plus on the weekend but it (Might) be worth it lol.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: Can't go wrong with the Screen Door plate - three 'sides'. Spring the extra $1 for catfish, its well worth it! Their veggie dishes are always rotating and use seasonal ingredients, tasty. Their brunch isn't my thing, no breakfast is worth a 90 minute wait, but to each their own I guess.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: Screen door is consistently delicious I love to take my friends they are from out of town and I can always count on the service to be great.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
So worth the wait. 

So be ready for the wait.

Fried chicken is so tasty
And the staff is made up exceptionally
real people. 
I will be returning again and again.

Oh Ya, 
If you can't wait,
Call ahead for a to go order.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: My roommate and I sat at the bar and had wonderful service. The stumptown coffee was delicious and the food was amazing. We shared one savory dish and one sweet dish for brunch. Screen door has an interesting menu that puts a new fresh spin on classic dishes. Well done Portland.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: I can't possibly imagine anyone giving this place anything less than 5 stars but it's clearly been done. Awesome food, GREAT staff, high energy and LARGE portions. The Mac and cheese matches up with pretty much any I've ever had. The fried chicken had exceptional crunch while still having moist meat beneath. The same goes for the catfish.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
Went to Screendoor at 9:30 pm on a Tuesday night and, along with friendly and fast service, enjoyed the BEST beef brisket I have ever tasted!
I was told the Screendoor is great for breakfast, but dinner was Awesome!

I had to come back to mention that the hush puppies were tasty and the sweet pepper sauce they give you to dip them in was the most wonderful of condiments !!!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
I came here on a rainy Saturday morning a half hour after opening.  I waited 5 minutes for a table for two, which was located outside on the covered patio.

The server was very gracious and attentive.  He made sure our coffee cups were filled and had no problem going over the menu and making recommendations.

The wait for our food, however, was pretty bad.  After ordering, we waited 40 minutes for our food.  I understand the kitchen was slammed, but that's still a long time to wait.

The food was worth the wait, though.

The chicken and biscuits were AWESOME.  Crispy  and moist, with a side of well made grits that complemented the saltiness of the meal perfectly.  A+!

The pancakes were also great--  I think they used ricotta cheese or something to make the insides extra moist and tasty.  A

Eat here!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
Good lord!  how are people in portland so fit and beautiful with this place slinging the best fried (boneless) chicken I've ever had, at such a great price?

The stars are obviously the deep fried birds, but the deep fried oysters are a close rival - probably your best bet is to order them both ;)
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
Oh my goodness, I can't say enough about Screen Door.

I'll leave it as a surprise. But I do have to say, it is well worth the wait.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: We went on a family trip and decided to stop here to eat. We waited in line for about 15 min. (Totally our fault, we did not have a reservation and on a Saturday evening, dinner time in Portland, we know better.) We waited another 30 minutes for a table. Once we were seated our food took about an hour to be served. This was only because there were two large parties of 14 that order before us. Which was fine. I had the fried chicken, mashed potatoes and Mac and cheese and it was amazing. My husband had the brisket, mashed potatoes and coleslaw with a side of corn bread. The sides were amazing, the brisket was good however the corn bread was very dense and gritty.  We ate one bite and sent it back. My kids had Mac and cheese, French fries and fried drum sticks. The sides were amazing the drum sticks were okay. I had the lemonade to drink and It was great and my husband had a Jack and coke. The odd thing is when the bill came they up charge him 50 cents for the coke in his drink. Which clearly was no big deal however it makes the restaurant look a little hard up when they do things like that. In all the food was good however it's a one time experience.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: This place is certainly delicious. It was an hour wait, but it delivered. Tried chicken and waffles for the first time here, which was a great place to tried this dish. It's really a mountain of chicken. My friends' dishes were all really good as well. I recommend the chicken sandwich biscuit and the eggs benedict. I had the breakfast cornbread for my "side" but the cornbread tasted a little lackluster; it definitely needed the honey and the berry/cream. We, of course, had leftovers and it still was delicious cold!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: We waited 2 hrs was told 1.5 hrs. Actually saw people who came after us get seated right away. (Must have been close personal friends or locals). We had breakfast which was plentiful but greasy. All in all 3 hr experience for just ok food. I'm from the south and lived in New Orleans for 10 yrs, I know what southern food should be and this is just a good try!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
I came down from Seattle to give this place a try.

The wait was expected during the weekend and the estimated time was a super accurate 2 hours 45 minutes starting around 10-ish.

I ordered the fried oysters eggs benedict. The benedict and fried oysters were fine, but nothing special in particular. The potatoes that came with it were awful though. Like rock hard and cold. I think they cooked them in a large batch and sat them stacked on the flat top if I had to guess. Not really acceptable since from ordering it seemed like we waited another 15-30 minutes. The outdoor sitting wasn't particularly comfortable either after the long wait. If you get a sore lower back you'll want to sit inside.

I also got to try the fried chicken. It seemed like a pounded flat thigh or breast that was then breaded and fried. The texture was more katsu like than KFC like. It was pretty good, but not memorable.

The wait staff were great and corrected a wrong order pretty quickly.

If you can get in without more than a 10 minute wait it would be worth it. Not worth it otherwise. Any other brunch place around would probably be on par.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: ABSOLUTELY DELICIOUS! Wasn't sure about the wait because my date got our table, I think he probably waited about 15-20 mins for a table for two. When I got there it was packed and we sat out on the patio. Started off with a Scarlet O'Hara no. 3 to drink which was absolutely amazing. It was iced tea vodka and something orange-y I believe. For dinner I had the fried chicken and mashed potatoes (only because they don't serve chicken and waffles for dinner and that's exactly what I wanted) I was pretty upset about that but settled. The chicken was delicious. It had a little bite from all of the pepper in it. The potatoes were creamy and the collard greens were actually really good! I will definitely be going back soon for the brunch to try the chicken and waffles!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: Oh this place is goooood. Nice atmosphere, perfect for hangovers, thank god :) Best part? The server was on the fucking ball! about filling my water glass so that I never ran out. Bravo, my friend, bravo. The food was a perfect hangover squasher. My only peeve has absolutely nothing to do with the restaurant. There was this women who was sitting next to me, she ordered a huge platter of food, gigantic potatoes, two eggs with spinich and hollandase sauce, something else that I can't remember and a side of the straight from HEAVEN Praline Bacon (can you believe it!?). She then proceeded to eat and egg and a half then she paid for her food and LEFT leaving an almost ungodly amount of food completely unthouched. If there is anything that is more distasteful to me on this earth it is the wasting of food. She could have gotten some togo boxes, but she decided to waste it. WTF is wrong with people? The rest of that food could have fed me for an entire day. I hope karma kicks you in your wasteful butt women who's name I don't know. Grrrr. Other then that I looooove this place, kick open the Screen asap! :)
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: chicken and waffles were pretty freakin' awesome. love that you get free coffee while you wait in line.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
Food was amazing. I had the fried chicken, which was recommended and I tried some of my friends brisket. They also have a hot sauce that they make themselves which is great. Everything was really good and the staff was extremely friendly and helpful. 

Not only was the food great but the drinks were awesome too. I had an old fashioned and also tried a couple of their other drinks. Everyone of them were great!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: Fried chicken that is to die for. Don't pass it by! I did the first time around and deeply regretted it!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: Excellent Southern specialties in Portland. Be prepared to wait, 'cause folks love this place. Fried chicken, shrimp & grits, jambalaya, and all kinds of good stuff. We had to wait about 45 minutes, but it was worth it.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
If heaven were a smell, it'd be Screen Door brunch. Especially in the winter, when it's crummy out & the windows are all steamed up with the goodness & breakfast here is likely to be the best thing that happens to you all day.

I've eaten here dozens of times & have never had a bad experience on any front: consistently awesome food for brunch or dinner, reliably friendly & prompt service across the board, and totally reasonable prices. 

Where dinner's concerned, there are many fine things, and I'm sure you'd enjoy any of them, but I can't stop ordering the Screen Door plate - any 3 sides from the menu (catfish strips are a side? I won't argue...) or the seasonal specials list (if there's any manner of savory bread pudding on there, and there usually is, don't even think, just get it). 

Breakfast, though, is where they shine brightest, and be warned: they have the line to prove it. But if anyplace is worth waiting for, this is it. It's the only place I've ever ordered extra breakfast entrees for the table. And you won't blame me: with choices like fried green tomato BLT or bananas foster french toast, the eternal sweet-or-savory breakfast conundrum is more than my morning brain can wrestle with.  Go, go, go here.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: Left Screen Door feeling oh-so-so-full. Ordered the Bananas Foster French Toast and Praline Bacon. The bacon I kept hearing raves about but was a tad dissapointed. It was not at all crispy and almost a big soggy and weighed down by the overdose of pralines. If I ordered again I'd probably ask it to be made super crispy if possible. But wow....the Bananas Foster french toast....now that was amazing. Definitely a nice little brunch spot! Plus the outdoor seating is nice!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: I came here for dinner and ordered crispy fried buttermilk-battered chicken, blackberry & peach salad, and gumbo. I shared the chicken entree; portion is huge! I was cutting the chicken breast into pieces and found the thicker side is undercooked. The waitress was quick to get me a new one and made sure it was extra cooked. Chicken was very crispy and delicious the first few bites. Then the pepper became a bit overpowering. The salad tasted refreshing and light. The flavors complimented each other. Gumbo also tasted good.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
Just got back into town.  Walt's doors are closed like they are going to tear down the building.  Where did he go?  I've been going to him for years.
Bill K
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: First of all the wait is long, second of all the food is not worth the wait. The staff was extraordinary - they took care of us and were very friendly throughout our meal. Unfortunately,  we could not say the same for the food. If you're looking for culinary adventure as we were, you won't find one here. After waiting in line for 45 minutes, we were finally able to sit down. We ordered the eggs Benedict, fried chicken sandwich, and the fried oyster sandwich. We won't really blown away by any of the dishes. In fact we were quite underwhelmed considering The anticipation that have been built up from the long wait in line. Both sandwiches didn't really offer anything extraordinary in flavor and The eggs Benedict turn out to be very heavy.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: You can't NOT visit Screen Door when you are in Portland. We got the message as well so we visited this famous restaurant one morning when we were there. We got lucky because it was snowing in Portland that weekend. In contract to the long wait people have been reporting, we got in right the way. The restaurant was very traditional, low key, and fairly crowded with tables all around you. It definitely set the vibe as Southern style. We jumped into the hot drinks quickly, hot coffee and hot chocolate. Unfortunately, I didn't like either of them. I was very disappointed with their coffee. For a place serving breakfast, you need to have good coffee!! It was sour, barely hot, and just poor flavor. I am NOT a coffee snob but seriously it needs to be better. The hot chocolate was so-so, very very sweet. Oh well, we were here for their food so we moved on quickly to two of their most famous dishes, CHICKEN AND WAFFLE and BISCUIT AND GRAVY. I am from Texas so Southern style food tastes like home to me. Overall, they have good food but it wasn't like the best that I've ever had. Started out with biscuit, great flaky kind, soft and fresh. Gravy excellent flavor with country style. It is very thick, which means it's authentic with lots of corn starch, fat, or butter some sort. The fried chicken was great!!! Excellent crispy breading outside, nice heavy flavor, and juicy and tender inside. To my memory, I can take a little bit stronger flavor. The grits was great! Thanks for not adding additional butter on top but the flavor and texture were great. I appreciate all the excellent reviews for four thousand something people; however, maybe all of the hypes makes me feel slightly disappointed. This is still a great restaurant and definitely is one of the must do in Portland.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: LOVE this place. The food is tasty and has so much flavor, has just the right amount of spice, and the portions are HUGE. The price is a bit high, but not out of line with other restaurants in the area. Overall, I'd definitely recommend screen door to anyone who is craving a good gormet southern comfort meal. Just be sure to share a meal!!

name: Screen Door

text: If you're here for your first time, I suggest getting the screendoor plate. Good taste of everything. I love the mac n cheese. The daily specials are usually fantastic.

text: Super long wait but definitely worth it! Some of the best chicken and waffles I've had in a long time & great service!

text:
This place is lights out!!!! Phenomenal food. 
Last week brought a business partner for dinner... simply stunned... I haven't had fried chicken literally in a year and the screen door has the best!!! 
one week later brought my wife! She loved it! It was cheat week but the burger was well worth it!
So money!!!

text:
Fried chicken waffle: MUST GET! Crispy on the outside and so tender inside. Very well marinated with great flavors and a hint of spiciness. Every bite was heavenly.

We also ordered the banana french toast and the smoked salmon eggs benedict with potato cake. The french toast was delicious as well. However, the eggs benedict was subpar. The hollandaise sauce lacked flavor and was a little too heavy.

The wait was about 1.5 hours but we put our name down and went for a some murals hunting nearby.

text:
Do I need to write a review that covers all the same stuff that the other reviewers already have? Probably not.

Do I want to let ALL MY FRIENDS KNOW THAT THIS IS THE BEST F-ING BREAKFAST EVER?

yes, yes I do.

If you are in Portland, go there. Do not mind the long wait, chat, drink coffee from the little place next door, and eat you some chicken and waffles and then some banana's foster french toast, and waddle out and enjoy the wonder that is Portland full on the best breakfast EVER.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food

text: Great fried chicken and excellent oysters. I still love KFC. Chicken was a bit spicy but very tender and juicy.

name: Screen Door

text: This place may have had a long wait but it's for good reason! The cheese grits and the vanilla bean french toast are mouth watering! My son had the maple praline waffle and wow! We will be back for sure!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
Im of the persuasion that to complain about a line at a great restaurant is ludicrous. Notwithstanding the line--Screen Door is a 100% winner! 

On several occasions I have taken visitors from out of town and every time I am completely impressed by the entire operation. The servers are quality--genuine and knowledgable; the cuisine is filling and fulfilling alike--and the drinks are poured the right way.

Five Star reviews are reserved for the "Top 5%" in my epicurean rubric--but in truth--I'd like to give Screen Door a sixth. 

The service industry is named the service industry for a reason...and so "refreshing" only begins to define the joy of walking into an eatery and feeling as though the establishment is "thankful" for the opportunity to share their passion with me.

Portland has changed so much in my 34-years; if you live here and haven't been--or are visiting and do not go--in the words of my much loved girlfriend..."Sorry for ya!"
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: One of the best Southern food restaurants in Portland. The food and service are great, but wished they took reservations. Standing in queue gets tiresome at times. I've done meals here from business to Just celebratory and the place just seems to adapt to my needs.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: Wish we could make it over here more often, because the food was fantastic!! Unfortunately my small boys won't let me enjoy restaurant food right now :/

text: I'm in love with this place!!! We can't leave Portland without eating here. The atmosphere is relaxing, the people are friendly and the food is amazing!! I love that specials are made from local ingredients. :)
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
We had breakfast here and it was the BEST MEAL we had during our stay in Portland. 

We arrived 30 mins before opening on Saturday and were able to get a table outside. My husband had the fried chicken and waffles, for a small up charge of $2 he was able to order a bacon praline waffle in place of a normal waffle. The dish had 3 large pieces of chicken, a praline bacon and was really enough food for 2 people. We ended up taking the chicken home and had it for lunch.

I had the Shrimp and cheesy grits. it was soooooo amazinnnnggggg. I was so happy eating that I swear I started to feel drunk...because I was so happy. It also came with 2 eggs, but I pretty much ignored them the whole time because the sauce in the grits was amazinnnnggggg. 

Our waitress wasn't the greatest, she took our drink order and NEVER brought out our coffees. We had to go inside to get it ourselves, plus she never apologized =/ whatever, that was dumb, but the food made everything better. The food did take a while to actually get after we ordered it. I want to say 30-45 mintues.

Our breakfast was so filling. I was stuffed the whole day! We walked around Portland and never got hungry. LOVE THE SCREEN DOOR EVERYONE SHOULD EAT HERE ONCE IN THEIR LIFE
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
Mmm Mmm Mmmm Mmm Mmmmmmm!  Helz yeeeeah.  Finally a breakfast joint that gets it RIGHT!  Yeah, you have to wait but I can finally say without hesitation, ITS WORTH IT!  Cotton-eye Joe would be Proud!

I quick glance at the menu should sell you immediately but if it doesn't (and I think you need psychiatric help)  Go inside, grab a free cup of stumptown goodness and re-read the menu.  

Goat cheese scramble - yum, Mushroom scramble - yum, Bananas Foster Waffles - yum, Cheddar grits - yum!  They even have their own version of what Pine State calls the Reggie exept is Bigger and Better!  No, for reals... WAY Bigger and Better.  To top it off, I experienced what I believe to be the best Bloody Mary in town.

The hostess was a bit of a seating nazi, and the waitress copped a little bit of a tude when we asked for separate checks (you would think she would ask when the group of seven of us sat down but I guess she didn't find it intuitive).  However, I can overlook all of that because the food (and the speed at which we go it) was spectacular.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
This establishment lives up to it's hype! When walking in it smelled like some good ol home cooking. I got the fried catfish, mac n cheese, gumbo, and cornbread. The flavorful, peppery, crispy batter on the fish sent my tastebuds to the moon and back. Melty mac n cheese with fresh cheese baked on it was a nice way to turn plain into something special. The gumbo was good and I thought the cornbread could have been better. The food was so rich that it kept me full for hours and I still had some to take home. 
It was packed as expected but worth the wait! The wait staff were very nice despite their constant busy days. The price is very reasonable and I would definitely recommend this place to anyone.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: It is as promised, very good southern style food.  Worth the wait? YES! But once you eat there you'll wanna go back more and more, so you might as well skip to hip ambiance and order pick-up.  Just get to the point! The food!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
Every time we come to Portland we eat at the Screen Door. 

Warning: No reservations and busy. All the time! And so worth it! So go early (dinner starts at 17:30) or mentally prepare to wait. You can stroll around the neighbourhood for fun. 

Everything we ate was great:
Apple salad
Green bean casserole with tasty friend onions on top
Mac and cheese
Fried catfish
Chicken tenders
And, for dessert the banana pie. Mmmmmm. 

Wines by the glass are reasonably priced too!

A true PDX experience in a very funky neighbourhood.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
My friend's have been raving about this place for quite sometime.  Finally, a few days ago, I  tried it with a few friend's for one of my friend's birthdays.  It was a Monday night.  There was a long wait, about 45 minutes, then more of a wait to order, and even more of a wait for our food.  There were 4 of us, finally 3 plates came out.  They said the other one would be up shortly.  Sadly, the plate we were waiting for was for the birthday girl.  And it wasn't up shortly, they forgot to put it in, it took about another 20 minutes.  They ever so graciously comped one of her beers.  ONE BEER!  Couldn't they have at least comped her meal?  Given her a free dessert?  Those were my complaints.

As far as the food goes, it was good, but didn't live up to the hype for me.  I think maybe the wait took away from it and the mess up.  Also, I have heard better things about their brunch, than their dinner.  I will be back for brunch, but not worth it to me for dinner.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
So very good!!
Me and my girlfriend just ate there tonight!
We showed up around 6pm and were seated by 6:20 which wasn't bad!

We first got cocktails. They were very strong!! A little too strong for my liking.

We both got the fried chicken! It was great!!
The mashed potatoes were also great with the gravy! And the collards were the ONLY collard greens that I actually liked!!!

text: Fried chicken, full house. Enough said my friends. This place makes me feel foolish when I order fried chicken other places and have the audacity to expect the same level of excellence. I'm hesitant to write this review because at the rate they're going, the line will stretch all the way to voodoo doughnuts (then I won't even know which hipster place I'm trying to Instagram). They had a wicked potato salad (I still dream about it), but they stopped making it. Even still, too hard to hark on them, they're on top of their game. They deserve their success.

text:
Decadent, in every sense of the word. Prepare your arterial and patience muscles: the famously long weekend brunch line is worth the wait, if the meal is primarily a social occasion. The space is gorgeously bustling on a Sunday morning, and surprisingly intimate with a smattering of late dinner customers during the week.

I've always been impressed by the efficiency and mechanics of the kitchen staff - watching from a table near the half-open kitchen, I love listening to the clockwork of sizzling bacon, frying chicken, servers barking table numbers and condiment names. Food never seems to take long to arrive, thankfully. 

A Portland classic, great bang for buck (as you may have leftovers for days), AND there are great alternatives for similar food elsewhere on the Eastside.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: Screen Door always delivers the ultimate in fried chicken and okra, and a real experience in hospitality.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: Came here at 10:30am with a few friends for brunch and didn't get seated till noon.  Definitely worth the 1.5 hr wait!!! We shared the chicken and waffles, praline bacon, roasted potatoes, biscuits and sausage gravy. The portion was freaking huge for the chicken and waffles!!!! 3 chicken breasts and waffles for $14....a steal! This was enough to share among 3 people which we did.  The seasoning was really good and it was fried to perfection. A moist chicken breast....How does that happen!?? Hands down one of the best candied bacon I ever had and I have eaten my fair share of bacon. The other items we got were alright. I enjoyed getting them but nothing too special about them. I'll just stick to the bacon and fried chicken
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: The fried chicken and collard greens I had were really good.... but I have to admit it's not worth the wait or the hype.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
Fun Breakfast/Brunch and hella popular (lines lines lines). 
Thankfully we arrived fairly early in the Breakfast Game and the wait was quoted accurately as 45 minutes. The Staff was extremely friendly, Service was surprisingly attentive given the crushing crowd and the food was picture worthy and southern style abundant (and of course it was carb coma inducing delicious). 
The yeasted waffle was light, crispy and not overly sweet, Breakfast Corndogs greatly exceeded my expectations-perfectly cooked crisp deep brown exterior and cane syrup "sauce". Praline Bacon-exactly as it sounds..greasy, sweet, and studded with nuts. Bisquits and gravy-enormous even as a single and loaded heavy with sausage.
Great food and Service.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: I like it here, but I avoid it because of the lines. Great service, food, drink, ambience, but the lines....

name: Screen Door

text: I love this place.  I have been a few times now and have not been disappointed during any of my visits.  Be prepared to wait, up to an hour if not more, but well worth it.  Their selection of southern food is simply mouthwatering.  I have had a number of items on the menu but seem to gravitate back to their chicken waffle which is not only delicious but more than any one human can eat, no really I dare you to try.  We have not meed let down with any of their dishes, they make a pretty darn good scramble as well.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
I have had this restaurant bookmarked for a really long time...For the life of me, I can't understand why it has taken me this long to try Screen Door...Well, that's not true, I do know why I haven't been there in the last 2 years - because I have a 4 & 6 year old who I am pretty certain would NOT enjoy (and being with them - neither would I!!!) the long wait.

Today was my mother's birthday.  THIS IS HOW WE CELEBRATED her 73rd year old life - eating food that you could die on and know that it was THE BEST meal you have ever had!!!  And not having 2 restless & demanding children with us!!!

We got to the restaurant early (1 hour before opening) and there were already 18 people in front of us at 4:35 PM.   We were seated at 5:35PM and there were 70+ people behind us!!!  By the time we had eaten and were leaving, there were still 30+ people waiting to be seated.

WE ordered the pork belly appetizer:  Slow roasted pork belly with a candied rhubarb glaze topped with frisee, asparagus and torn herbs.  The flavors were so delicious and completely complimented each other!  The pork was SO tender, you could cut it with your fork and it melted in your mouth!!!

PORK BELLY is THE PORN STAR of pork products...  It makes you feel giddy, dirty and guilty all at the same time!!!  And yet, you just can't help yourself!!!???!!!

My mom had the fried chicken, mashed potatoes and collard greens.  This was the best fried chicken - EVER!  Completely deboned, pounded and fried to crispy perfection.
I consumed most of the collard greens and I must saw  - YUMMMMMMMMMMMMMM!

I ordered the beef brisket platter.  It came with BBQ sauce, Cole slaw and baked beans.  I was only able to eat 1 (out of 4) slabs of brisket...The Cole slaw was super creamy and delicious and the beans were sweet & spicy good!!!

My mom & I both ordered dessert:  1 Creole Pecan Pie and 1 Lemon Layer Cake with homemade buttermilk ice cream.   BOTH WERE OUTSTANDING in portion size, flavor and presentation!!!

I have read previous reviews of persons saying the portions sizes were too small...SERIOUSLY?? You must either have had too much to drink - or-  you are person who consumes too much on a regular basis!!!???!!!  I saw many plates arrive at different tables - all the portions were massive and most people shared plates or had plenty of left-overs!!!  I was the latter...and my husband thanked me!!!

The service was stellar!  The food was the best southern food I have had!!!  The ambiance was great!!!  The only complaint I have is they don't provide you with a wheel barrel to haul you out after your meal!!!  2 hours later - I am still super stuffed...

I can't wait for my next visit to Screen Door...I am hoping it will be for brunch!!!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: It lives up to the hype. If you have heard how good Screen Door is, believe it. We've been there a handful of times and have always been impressed. Is there a wait....yes, is it worth it...YES.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: This place is perfect for a brunch spot. They have coffee ready and waiting for you as you walk in. The wait is a bit long, but well worth it. Looking forward to visiting again.

text: Rated #1 in yelp in oregon from a long time, this legacy restaurant has seen it all. You need to be at the place an hour early to book your seats(no phone reservation). The queue extends outside the restaurant most part of the day. Tried oyster Benedictine, fried chicken with waffles, biscuits with gravy and all of them were awesome. Food tasted fresh and great and I will be back there again to try few more items which I missed for sure

text: Updating this review, but no update needed. This place is still the shit and I presume a bad experience coincides with a bad patron.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
