text: I was visiting from out of town and stumbled into this awesome place. It's Louisiana style breakfast. Poboys, grits and egg type place but they also have lunch and dinner. The hot link sandwhich was amazing. Everything that came out of the kitchen was mouth watering. I  am considering driving back to Portland just for the food.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
I've seen a lot of good reviews and heard many fantastic comments about their chicken and waffle. My fiance and I agreed we haven't had any good ones since Roscoe's in Los Angeles, and Screen Door definitely beats Roscoe's. Skillet in Seattle is not bad, but I love when the waffles is just crispy at the edges and the inside is soft. If we weren't having a food crawl around Portland, we may have just ate our fill of chicken and waffles. 

The chicken was well seasoned, crispy on the outside and juice and tender on the inside. It comes out piping hot almost like it's just finishing in the box as it comes out. I wish I knew what seasoning they used because it was that good. I'm craving more just from writing about it. The waffles does come with maple syrup, but it's fluffy enough that no toppings are needed. We also ordered cornbread, but it didn't add much to the dish. It was dense, dry, and was not to my liking since I don't enjoy corn chunks in my cornbread.

If you go here, be sure to go early. We were planning to have lunch there, but the breakfast line is basically the lunch line. My friends and I called in our order and ate it outside. As sad for others as it was, it was enjoyable for us that we only waited 30-45 minutes instead of the over an hr wait. If you don't care about having a sit down table or eating while standing, I highly recommend calling it in.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
Expect a wait, we were mid line at 8:30a for brunch.
Micah, our waiter, plus his teammate coordinated very well to ensure our table was taken care of. Coffee and water were refilled throughout brunch.
We started with lemon ricotta hush puppies. There were 6 to a plate and it is delectable as an app. Hints of lemon in the pups and the dipping sauce was sweet too.
For entrees, we ordered the shrimp and grits with eggs, and the cat head chicken biscuit. Both we're good, but the cat head platter came with 2 super large biscuits encasing a ginormous piece of chicken topped with peppery gravy coupled with a side. A side of grits doesn't have much flavor, I recommend going for potatoes instead.
We also saw the behemoth dish with 3 chicken breasts on a sweet potato waffle. Goodness, that was beastly.
All in all, come with an empty stomach and expect a wait. Food is great, service is prompt (Micah was attentive through and through). Screen door is a superb place to grab a meal.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: While in Portland visiting family, found this place on yelp. Family had never been so we decided to try it out. In short, I will come here every time I'm in Portland! The shrimp and grits will give me something to daydream about when I go back to my normal life at home. I also tried the fried chicken from someone else's plate and it was FANTASTIC! There was not a single complaint from anyone at our table.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
Best food in Portland.  Chicken and waffles, Mac and cheese, chicken fried space. 

There is no better.  Make it happen.  You will thank me later...
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
Let me explain this restaurant simply. 

5 friends, my girlfriend, and myself drive 3 hours from Seattle every 6-8 weeks to be the first in line at 4:30 (1 hour before opening). Just for the chicken. We drive back that night. Roughly 6 hours driving. Just for the chicken. I have probably eaten close to my weight in chicken from Screen Door. Worth every penny. If I become rich enough I'm going to buy this place and move it to Seattle so I don't have to drive 3 hours for chicken. Sorry.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: Bacon is delicious start with that. I only give it 4 stars and not 5 because my banana foster french toast was a small portion size. I wish it was larger. Aside from that it's a great place and highly recommend it.

text:
That place serves the most intense and flavor packed breakfast. During our visit to Portland, we came here twice! Food is very heavy, so prepare for a food coma. 

My favorites were the Chicken and waffles and praline bacon. I also tried the a hot link sandwich,  grits, and poached eggs.

text:
Worth all the rage. Wonderful food. Service is simple with a smile. Interior is low key, doesn't pull from the food. Bathrooms are slightly sketchy. But we are talking about amazing southern food! 

Go. Stand in line. Eat your food. Take your time. Make others slightly annoyed because they are in line. Then go home and take a nap. Ta da.

name: Screen Door

text:
I came back all the way from Chicago just to eat here.

...

Okay, that's a bit of an exaggeration, but I was definitely looking forward to eating here during my visit to P-town.

Lines are usually there, but coffee-drinkers rejoice with coffee during the wait!

The food is expertly crafted. I had the Cajun shepard's pie special, which was pretty much to die for. My friends all enjoyed their meal as well, though we were scolded later for not getting the bacon.

Really, you can't go wrong here. Love it!

text: Great food and good portions. Biscuits and gravey were some of the best I've had.

text: Pulled pork and shrimp n grits!  Pimento cheese  and gumbo appetizer were great too! Staff was friendly and great with suggestions. Would love to come back to try their breakfasts!

text: I went here for breakfast and had fried chicken and waffles. It was delicious southern food. There were so many offerings on the menu. I can't wait to go again and try something else.

text: I've been here a few times and love their dinner menu. The weekend brunch wasn't as good. The potatoes were really hard and seemed like they died under a heat lamp. We asked for new ones and received more of the same. Disappointing.  I would recommend dinner though! Worth the wait for sure.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: A very buys place, but well worth the wait. The food was fresh, hot and some of the best in Portland.  Southern food with a twist.  We have been many times and have always had great food and service.  We love the Screen Door plate, a choice of 3 sides and cornbread.  It's a new combo each time we go.  It's also a must for brunch.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: Loved this amazing small Diamond in the rough restraunt.  You must try the boneless thigh and breast plate. Service was also impeccable.  If your ever in Portland, you must make a stop here...I wish we had been in town longer, I would've loved to try breakfast.  ;)
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
I generally have low expectations of anything Southern food related. Greasy, overcooked, with bits of ham hock thrown in? Sure. Whatever.

That is, until Screen Door changed my mind. The meal started with the hush puppies, which we ordered with a side of the remoulade. Those fried balls of goodness made my carb-starved heart smile. 

For my entree, I ordered the Screen Door Plate, which consists of your choice of three side dishes plus a piece of cornbread. First, the macaroni and cheese. Whoa. I don't know how they make it, or what crack they use in the sauce to make it so amazing, but I could live off the stuff. I could swim in it like Scrooge McDuck swims in his vault of gold coins. I also chose the fried pork chop, which was unlike any fried pork chop I've ever had. It had just the right amount of crispy fried coating: not greasy, with smoky spices. Rounding it out was my third side, the creole black eyed-peas and rice. It was quite spicy -- not the "hot" kind of spicy that makes your nose twitch (I'm looking at you, Sriracha), but a slow, smoky, cumin-y smolder that makes you want to listen to Percy Sledge on a rainy summer night. 

I wish I hadn't been too full for dessert. I'm definitely making my way back here the next time I'm in town. It'd be sacreligious not to.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: This place seriously has the best chicken and waffles. They have like 2-3 giant pieces of perfectly fried chicken atop a delicious sweet potato waffle. I've never had any better elsewhere. The line is very long when they open on Saturdays so we always go early, but even then we have to wait. The food is worth it though. They have two types of waffles, sweet potato and original. Both are good. Their bananas foster French toast is delectable. Also, don't forget the hot apple cider. YUM. I've never had an issue with service here despite how busy it is every time I'm here.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
All I can say is YUM.  Will be back here again.  For sure!
It is small so the tables are very close together, and the wait can be long, but the food is worth it!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
My hubby and I are newbies to Portland, and had been recommended Screen Door as a great place to go to for brunch.
This place must be uber trendy at the moment, we got there 15 mins before it opened and there was already a queue (line) from the door, around the corner & half way down the block.. hubby is not a patient person so this wasn't a good start, and the only reason why I am giving 4 stars.The $2.50 unlimited coffee kept us going until we got our food (an hour after we arrived in line).
I choose the Praline Bacon Waffle, which I'm happy to say had the maple syrup on the side and not drowning the waffle. Loved it :) Hubby had the Bananas Foster French Toast, which was a huge meal, if you have sweet tooth this will suit you.
Value for money I think was spot on for the size of the meals, we took home the leftovers.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
This is simply one of THE BEST restaurants in Portland. There is usually (okay, always) a massive wait on weekend mornings for breakfast/brunch. I think we waited around 90 minutes last time. And you can see why as soon as you get your food. It is well worth waiting for....

Especially amazing are their assortment of Eggs Benedict and the sinfully, shamefully delicious Bananas Foster French Toast. 

The staff always remains calm and friendly in the face of the hoards of people waiting to get in and the hoards inside eating. 

They also have a great heated outdoor patio for the cooler months.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: Screen Door is one of my favorite casual restaurants in Portland, and over the several years I've been coming here, it has never disappointed.  The consistency of quality and variety of food options is great.  I usually order a Screen Door plate with a couple of options from the seasonal menu - so delicious.  I usually avoid eating meat, but their fried chicken is one of the few dishes out there that entices me to break my rule.  It is the best that I've had!  If you have the time and don't mind the long wait, it's worth it!  Or, if you can convince a group of people to join you, I believe they allow reservations for large groups.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
$23 for a beer and the crispy fried chicken with mashed potatoes and collard greens was the best food I ate in Portland. The hype is real and the 50 minute wait was worth it because I was killing time with a beer in hand and chilling with my bestie.

My party of 2 arrived for dinner on Saturday before Memorial Day 2014 around 7 PM and got seated around 8. Since we were a small party, we got seated at the bar and noticed the bigger groups had to wait much longer for a table.

The food came out fairly quick and oh man, it was the best fried chicken I've ever had. The portion was huge too! They give you two large pieces of chicken and there were barely any bones! The mashed potatoes were perfection and the collard greens were flavorful and a little bit salty to my liking.

My friend and I couldn't finish our food and had to pack the rest to go and we ate in the next day for lunch and it was still yummy!

Neighborhood parking was fairly easy to find! The lighting was dimmed and quite romantic.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
The burger was realllllly good.
The salad was good too, but the portion was far from enough.
The dessert chocolate cheesecake was also delicious, but too sweet. We didn't finish it.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: You have togo !! Screen Door freaking good excellent chicken and waffles the best in the world Bloody Mary and sweet potato waffle end juicy chicken breast  mmmhmm!!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
Yes!!! Food here is indeed delicious. Service is great. Vegetarians and meat eaters will both find wonderful menu items. If that's all you need to know, stop reading now.

If you want strategy and my opinions, keep on, and I'll give some advice as I see it. 

Wait times are long so consider going with a party of 2 or have a wait plan with your big group. 

Some more detailed options:
Brunch
1. Go early (8:30am to wait in line for 9am open) for weekend brunch. 
2. Just suck it up and wait in line. This may mean 1 hour or more. (Plan for it. Go to a nearby bar for a drink. Or bring a book. Chat with your friends.)

Dinner
3. Go for dinner late night. I have been seated late on weeknights without waiting.
4. Go for dinner at opening. You'll have to arrive early to make sure you are in the first seating.
5. Go whenever and just plan to wait. 

About my favorites:
Catfish head is my regular brunch choice
Seasonal/special fresh veggies are always delish!
Fried chicken entree also great
Dessert - banoffee pie

Leftovers:
Portions are large and I always bring food home. But, I love that! Then I get to have 2 more meals! Don't want leftovers, share an entree with a friend. Or share some sides/seasonals.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
Okay, I know the hour wait can be long, but it's all worth it in the end. First, you get greeted with a small area, and a large waiting booth. After about 2 hours of staring at the boards, your phones, and Yelp, you finally get seated.

Immediately, look at the menu. My favorites include the Chicken and Waffles, Biscuits and Gravy, and the Banana Split! Just order whatever seems yummy, because it definitely is! But the top thing should be  the Chicken and Waffles; they are so darned delicious.

It's clean as well. I love this place. Worthy of its 4 stars.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food

text: Seriously. As good as it gets. Friend Chicken was the best I've ever had. Service was on point - loved every minute.

text:
Amazing food! My wife and I split the chicken and waffles and the biscuit sandwich with a side of cheddar grits. Some of the best fried chicken I've ever had and the waffle had an incredible flavor from the sweet potato and cinnamon. 

I've heard from friends and also read in reviews that this place has a terrible wait but did not experience this myself. We got there ten minutes after they opened and had lots of seating options. Our server was also very attentive and our food came out quickly. My suggestion with high demand breakfast restaurants such as this is get there early or don't bother. 

Remember the early bird gets the worm.

text: Very good breakfast, we has corn beef hash, and crab cake benedict.  Great service food was awesome.  I will return again.

text: Oh man, this spot had one of the best Shrimp and Grits I've ever had. Their chicken was the truth but their Catfish is where it's at! Wasn't a fan of the corn bread but who cares. Everything was on point!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
We went here in July of last year, we are from WA so we took the 2 hour trek down because of the reviews this place got! From reading the reviews it said we needed to be there before it opens because of the long lines which is true, the restaurant opens and 9 am and we arrived at about 8:40am and there was already a line to get in. Luckily in July it was a nice day so we didn't mind waiting outside.  We were about in the middle and as the minutes passed the line grew! We got in (phew)  and about 10 people/groups came in after us then the rest were cut off! 

I am a waffle addict so naturally I ordered the chicken and waffles which was DE-Lish! I could not believe how much food was there, one huge sweet potato waffle and 3 chicken breasts it was soo much food the chicken was soo yummy and juicy I don't even know how they get it to be soo juicy. With my waffle I had a mimosa.

My boyfriend ordered the fried oyster breakfast POBOY which he said was reallllly good, I didn't taste it but it looked really good! with the sammich he had a bloody mary.

Oh and we HAD to order the Praline Bacon which my boyfriend LOVED, he was trying to figure how they made it and wanted to try and make it at home. 

The food was hot and super tasty and I would LOVE to come back, we really had no complaints really good place for brunch in Portland!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
This place is killer! The migas were awesome, the chicken and waffles maybe the best I've ever had. Staff, coffee, and ambiance were great too.

The wait is long, but it's completely justified.

text: Had such a wonderful Breakfast with really great service.

text: This place, after waiting to get a table was amazing!!! Wow, chicken and waffles.  That's all I can say
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
This place is SO GOOD. 

Just accept the wait. Don't go if you can't wait, both for a table, service, and the food. Nothing is speedy at this restaurant. Also know that whatever time estimate they give you when your put your name down is likely to be underestimating the actual wait. When we go to Tasty N Alder and they tell us an hour and a half wait, we know it will probably be 45 minutes. When Screen Door says an hour and a half, we know it's more likely to be 2 hours. 

We've been twice for dinner so far -- once at 8:00pm on a Saturday night and we waited until 9:45pm until we were seated. Service and food was fairly prompt. We also went at 7pm on a Wednesday night. Wait was 25 minutes and the place wasn't very busy, but service was incredibly slow. After our order was dropped off, we only saw our server once more before we asked for the bill. We waited for our water to be refilled. When I asked for to go containers, he brought me 4 containers but only 3 lids. I needed 5 containers and 5 lids. He didn't bring me a bag. I asked 1) for the containers, 2) for an extra lid and an extra set of container + lids, and 3) for the bag. The last time, I got up and went over to the service area because I didn't want to wait 10 minutes for our server to meander back to our table and I got chastised a little for getting up. I don't know why he thought I'd want to carry 5 containers to my car without a bag to put them in. 

I'm trying to remember why I'm giving this place five stars. 

OH RIGHT, the food. Both the fried chicken and the chicken tenders are so freaking good. Juicy, lightly battered, well seasoned. Hot sauce on the table. I like the Screen Door plate which I get with mac and cheese (even good reheated), chicken tenders, and greens. With this, I get leftovers for another couple of meals. I also like the shrimp and grits, which are creamy and well seasoned. 

Go, but bring your patience.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
You absolutely CANNOT go wrong with brunch at Screen Door. 

The portions are huge, and the food is beyond delicious. You could seriously just close your eyes and point at anything on the menu, and be more than satisfied with your meal.

I have had the biscuits & gravy (sausage gravy, that is), and the banana foster french toast. Let me just say, I want to do terrible, terrible things to the biscuits and gravy. Just dirty, nasty things. And the banana foster french toast...I would like to take it out to an expensive meal, softly caress it's face and tell it how much it means to me. Really make sure it knows I don't know where I would be if it weren't in my life.

My boyfriend has had the famous fried chicken & waffles, and the po boy breakfast sandwich. Now, I'm not sure if you've heard already, but you get FOUR huge, fried chicken breasts stabbed through the waffle with a steak knife. Holy hell. I would highly recommend eating that with a buddy....unless your main goal in life is to clog your arteries. then go for it. The po boy is...it's...it's just sooooo goooood!!!! It's messy as hell to eat, but who freakin cares, it's deelish.

Other highlights: Breakfast Corndog, Praline Bacon, along with the Raspberry & Ricotta Blintz.

My only drawback, is the wait. They don't take reservations, and if you show up after 9:30, even if it's just for two people, you're going to be waiting at least a half hour, most likely closer to a full hour. However, if you can make it through that wait, you will be HANDSOMELY rewarded.

I have not been for dinner, but I have only heard mediocre reviews about it. Not going to lie, I'm curious though.

In conclusion, please, please, PLEASE go to Screen Door for breakfast/brunch. You will not be disappointed!!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
Who would think you can get amazing soul food  in Portland!? Well, you can. This place is sooo good. I'm  from the south and know good soul food and this is true lily a competitor for my favorite soul food!
I will definitely be coming back the next time I'm in Portland!

text: Fantastic food! A great Southern/Cajun experience. Great for taking the family out for a nice dinner. Service was also great. I will definitely return! I recommend the shrimp and grits to anyone!!

text: Simply amazing. Had the brisket hash and it was cooked to perfection. This was the best place we ate this week while we visited Portland. They are only opened for brunch so expect a line. But well worth it.

text: I came here for dinner with a group of friends during a stripper bar crawl. We ended up going back for breakfast the next day. I have since stopped by a few times while driving down 5. The food is always amazing. I highly recommend the praline bacon.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: Can't go wrong with a place that has Praline Bacon on the Menu.  My onlly complaint?  It is not open for breakfast during the week days ... and when I go on weekends - I've gotta get up early to beat the crowds.  Can I just go sit in the kitchen and eat?  I can't wait to go back.  Can you open a location in every city I visit?  I hate chain restaurants in general - but I'd love to walk through your door more often.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food

text: This place definitely lives up to its good ratings. The chicken and waffles was on point, I think the best I've had so far. I liked how the chicken was peppery and very crispy, and the waffles and syrup weren't too sweet. The buttermilk biscuit sandwich was also very good. The mac and cheese was a bit too cheesy for me, but I'm not a big cheese eater so I might be biased. Overall, I would definitely come back for the chicken mmmm
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
Crazy big fried chicken that is worth a try.

Screen Door is one of the most reviewed places in Portland. As per recommendations from several of my friends who have been to Portland before, the Screen Door's fried chicken is something not to be missed.

My friends and I came to the Screen Door at around 8pm. We waited around 30 minutes for a table for 4. When we came in, we decided to sit outside since the weather was still nice!

My friend and I split one dish, we got the Crispy Fried Buttermilk-battered chicken, which comes with fried breast and thigh with Tasso ham gravy, mashed potatoes and we chose collard greens as our side.

The food took awhile to come out, but since they make their fried chicken to order, it might have taken some time to get the dishes ready. While some might think it's crazy to split one dish, the portion size of the chicken at the Screen Door is insane. 

In my opinion the chicken was just alright. I thought the taste and texture of the breading was definitely good, but the chicken itself wasn't great. It was also strange to me that both the thigh and breast piece tasted exactly the same. I personally think frying with the bone gives the chicken a lot more flavor, and to me it made sense to why I've had better buttermilk-battered chicken elsewhere.
The mashed potatoes and gravy were just a classic, nothing special, but definitely good.
The collard greens however were very good. I really liked the amount of acidity in the greens, it really built my appetite and made me want to eat more of the dish.

Overall, this isn't the best fried chicken I've ever had, but definitely the dish overall was great, and the value of the meal is fairly decent as well.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
It was my first time in Portland, and I saw this restaurant was highly rated on yelp. I intended to dine here for breakfast but kept arriving too late. Finally got to try the food out -- the wife &  I had dinner there.

my first time trying some legit (to me) Louisiana cookin! I thought it was delicious! Ordered the Bbq brisket -- the meat was r super tender and not chewy at all. The sauce was the right amount of spice and sweetness, rather than other places where it's too overpowering. The onion strings were nice and crispy, so they didn't feel like they had been cooked and left out. The side dish was some kind of greens with bacon in it. And I was pleasantly surprised the "slaw" meant "potato salad" to this Californian (I thought it meant "coleslaw "

Wife had the Screen Door Plate: cornbread, Mac &  cheese, collard greens, and jambalaya. Loved everything but oddly wasn't a fan of the cornbread! I know -- I'm crazy. It's personal preference that's why I didn't ding the star ratings :)

If I ever find myself in Portland, I will definitely be back.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
Wonderful, kind, proficient service. I've waited tables my whole life so I notice what's what when out to eat - most of the time to my poor server's detriment.
Valerie at Screen Door was so great that I had to write a review just about her. Hope they know they have a real gem. 

Thank you for the wonderful meal and experience!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
Best brunch in Portland.  Any time a friends comes to visit I take them here.  

Good:
service, food, atmosphere, and cost

Bad:
the line can get a bit out of control and they only do brunch on Sat & Sun

The veggie biscuits and gravy are amazing.

text: Really great food! Worst service I've ever received, for real! My sister and I went to breakfast with my 2 yr old. Our waiter came to our table, once, to greet us, take our order and fill coffee/water. Then he came once more to deliver food, that was it, no drink refill or check on food or boxes or check delivery. I had to get up after waiting for about 15 min after finishing meal and ask a different waiter for a box and then get up again after more time passed to give waiter our cards to pay, which he screwed up and took an add'l 20 min!!! It should not take 35 min to check out of a restaurant! Especially when you have a toddler with you! I couldn't stay to speak with someone about service so I called and they don't have a manager on duty during the day...Screen Door, perhaps you should!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: I ordered the shrimp and grits and they were very runny. Also the Macaroni and Cheese was not great. I feel like a lot of non southerner's amp this restaurant up....As a true southern gal I was not impressed.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: Oh man... Absolutely delicious. Went to Portland with friends and the wife and had to hit up this place! Yes, we had to wait over an hour, and yes it was gloomy and cold out, but it was sooo worth the wait. Luckily with 7 people you can all order something different and have a taste of everything. Chicken and waffles were amazing, grits were amazing, red potatoes were amazing and freshly squeezed orange juice oh my goodness! Even just thinking about it is making my mouth water.  Great price, great food, great employees! Definitely worth waiting and taking your chances folks! You will not be disappointed!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: Just adding to the choir of those in love- Screen Door is fantastic. Though, the wait dissuades me from going more often.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: From Texas and just passing through....I gotta say this place is LEGIT! I had the pork shoulder and my gf had the fried chicken. Damn this food is great. Only down side was how long it takes the kitchen to prepare them. But in retrospect the food is well worth the wait. Some ice in their water wouldn't hurt either. They serve regular room temperature water when you sit down. Not sure if that's a Portland thing or not.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: One word... WOW!  Great experience, and great food!  I had the brisket dish, my partner had the fried chicken, and we shared a side of macaroni.  All three were fantastic choices, but the macaroni was to-die-for.  I can honestly say that this was the best macaroni I have ever had.  The service was also on point, our server Ariel made sure to check in with us often and took the time to give us some great trips about Portland.  I definitely recommend trying this place if you're in the Portland area.  It's worth waiting for.  I will certainly be heading back, next time i'm in Portland.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
so my screen door experience went something like this; waited for about an hour for our table, in the end I would've waited much longer. it's that good. (by the way, if you can score a spot to sit after putting your name on the list, you can sip on a cocktail or two, which makes waiting much smoother). 

through the course of the night at the screen door I sipped on two homemade lemonade cocktails, spiked with local portland vodka and muddled with fresh sage. amazing. not sweet, more sour. cocktail perfection. the restaurant was lowly lit, the kitchen out in the open, allowing patrons to watch the chefs sling fried chicken, glaze ribs, and plate food. we started with cocktails and the pimento cheese served with house made, paper thin, sesame crackers. divine. next up, a roasted beet, pickled onion, chevre and frisee salad. I'm a sucker for pulled pork sandwiches and the screen doors did not disappoint. the barbecue sauce on the sandwich? not a sauce, but a jus. it soaked the meat and the bottom of the burger in a decadent, rich, smoky juice. like nothing I've ever tasted. it was heaven. and just when I thought my life at the screen door could not get s lick better the mac and cheese arrived. creamy, gooey, crispy, with what I would a call a crispy baked cheese tortilla all over the top. 

if I had to describe my experience at the screen door in one word it would be this - religious. 

hallelujah!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
If you are going to Screen Door on Friday night (it opens on 5:30PM), make sure you leave work early to avoid waiting in a HUGE line. My girlfriend and I arrived maybe 20 minutes before the restaurant opens and there was a longgggg line already. Fortunately we were able to get a table by ourselves in a corner but I think if we got there little late, we would have had to wait for our seats. 

Lot of reviews for this place so I will keep it short:
1. Fried chicken was great. It was juicy and the seasoning was near perfect but I'm not sure if it's the best fried chicken i ever had. It was great but it didn't blow my mind away. Gravy and collard were amazing though.
2. If you are not a heavy eater, you may want to try screen door plate and choose three sides and/or local organics. My girl wanted to try different side dishes and it was a perfect choice for her. She had pork chops, jambalaya, and one of the local organics and every single one of them were great. 

It is a loud place so maybe not the best place for a date. But if you love southern comfort food, this IS the place to go.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: SUCH GOOD FOOD, average service.  I always feel rushed and as if I am bugging the wait staff.  I haven't been back just because the service is average.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
Was it worth waiting in 32-degree weather for 2 hours starting at 5:20 pm after having walked all the way from the Pearl District (and flown all the way from San Francisco)?

YES.

Two words: fried chicken.

Three more words: fried pork chops. 

Many more words: mac 'n cheese, fried oysters, fried catfish, pork shoulder

This is place is the real deal. The fried chicken was some of the juiciest fried chicken I have ever had... and it's white meat! Breast meat. Two large, juicy, fried breasts, from what must have been a very busty chicken.

Georgia Brown's in DC was my favorite upscale low country restaurant, but no longer. However many years it'll be until I eat at Screen Door again, I'll be eagerly waiting all that time to try the chicken and waffles.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: We were visiting for a few days and when asking locals where to go, they all said this place.  It was jammed so clearly it is a local favorite.  We had the fried okra, which brought back old memories of grama and they were delicious.  The beef brisket sandwich is to die for and it has a great, smoky flavor, brioche bun and crisp pickle slices.   We had to try the chicken, after all, they are famous for it.  While it was nice and crunchy, it was a bit bland and lacked salt - although very, very moist.  Drizzled honey must be the thing as it accompanied it and we were also at a pizza place who drizzled honey on their pies.   That food trend won't last.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
No wonder there is always a line outside this place!!  We went for brunch on a Tuesday, sat outside in a covered and heated "deck" in February and couldn't have asked for a better way to spend an unexpected meal with my Valentine. 
Service was prompt, efficient and funny. Coffee with orange something whipped cream - yummy!!  Low country shrimp and grits (a favorite of mine when I'm in low country), I now found a place I can get them when I am not. Hubby had a veggie egg miga (??) with cheese grits (oooohh yummm!) and he wiped the plate clean. 

A neighboring table had praline (??) encrusted bacon that I wanted to steal from them by causing a diversion, but I didn't have the nerve ;-)

I look forward to going back, but I will be honest, we most likely will never have dinner there as my hubby doesn't wait in line with any level of grace, so when we go back it will be, again, for a brunch.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: Can't go wrong with anything you order at Screen Door! Whether you're having brunch or dinner the food is exceptional, the drinks are free flowing and delicious and the service is helpful and friendly! The Hushpuppies and Fried Okra are to die for, not to mention the Lowcountry Shrimp and Grits. You'll think your Aunt Hattie Avalene was cooking in the back while listening to Flatt and Scruggs. Screen Door is known for their mouth-watering, slap you in the face good Fried Chicken, but my favorite is the Trout Orleans that is pan seared to perfection - not to mention the biscuit that puts other PDX biscuits to shame. The wait is long, yes, but once you're inside, you feel like you've been transported to the South, in the very best way possible. Grab a couple friends and break some bread together. You won't be disappointed.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
Oh. My. Gawd. This place, this food...all I can say is AMAZING!!! We came during the week and thankfully there wasn't too much of a wait. But really, any time spent waiting was totally worth it. This food is to die for! We ordered some hush puppies and praline bacon as our appetizer. One word: Fantastic!!! 
Next came the chicken and sweet potato waffles...man oh man was it good!! 
Great atmosphere, spectacular food. Do yourself a favor and eat here!!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: I had heard that Portland takes their brunch seriously but until I came to Screen Door, I didn't realize just how serious they were. My friend and I started with the pumpkin ricotta fritters (soooo goood!), then I ordered the sausage fennel scramble with side of cheese grits and my friend ordered the Monte Cristo. Both were mouth-watering good. We can't wait to go back and ordered everything off their menu! They do NOT scrimp on portion size either and is very well priced!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: HA Poor excuse for Southern food!  Everyone raved about it so being from Texas and missing my southern food I had to try it. It was TERRIBLE!!! So disappointed and we will not go back.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
Really enjoyed this rustic, laid back place--real jars of homemade canned vegetables decorating the dining room. I got the buttermilk chicken and the serving was HUGE! I think there were 3 chicken breasts! And it was very tasty! My husband got the BBQ beef brisket--it was a big serving too. We shared our meals, and as good as the chicken was, I think I liked the brisket better. 
For the sides, the BBQ beans were pretty spicy, mashed potatoes were very good, collard greens were sour.
I guess they were pretty busy, because we didn't get a lot of attention from our waiter.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
Went here for breakfast on a girls weekend in Portland.  MY BREAKFAST WAS AWESOME!

My friend had horrible luck, though... therefore the 3 stars.  Her chicken was served - first cut into it revealed a pink center.  The waitress brought back a new plate.  So far, so good - until she noticed a long brown hair sitting on top of the sauce.  My friend was briefly apologized to - being told that the "fry cook is new" - food was comped but was still charged for her coffee.  Pretty disappointing, considering how great the food was.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: Best fried chicken I've ever had, love the rest of the menu too. Tip: avoid the ever-present line- order to-go and waltz right in and pick up your meal. Tastes even better!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
I know people only skim over these reviews, so I will say the most import and information first. If you can, ONLY GO ON OFF HOURS! This place is the BEST and people know it. Monday, Tuesday or Wednesday at brunch time from  like 12 pm to 2 pm, is great times in my opinion. This place is so great that you may have to wait up to an hour and a half, so again, in my humble opinion, I recommend going on an off hour or your tummy will be growling. Especially if you are a Portlander, you have no need to eat there on a weekend. Mistake, I warn you.

The Chicken & Waffles is the best I've ever had. Totally worth the hype. 2 piece is enough for me. I don't need the 3, but I'd understand if you get it. You will have a hard time believing it until you try it. Also, I'm not even really a fan of Mac & Cheese, but theirs is so undeniably amazing, that it is impossible not to be a fan. It is hands down the best Mac & Cheese I have ever had. Words can not express. Order it just because.

Their Hot Chocolate, best ever too. I'm going to go ahead and say, everything you order here will be amazing. A place that truly thinks about their guests. The staff is great, but under high pressure when it's busy, so it can take time when they are slammed.

Just make a point to go here. You will leave with a smile on your face.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: Haven't been here in years as I've given up on long waits at Portland restaurants. But it was my friend's birthday and that's where he wanted to go. We were able to get a table for breakfast in about an hour after getting there about 9:30am. Service was good and we thoroughly enjoyed our food. You really do just go for the food because that is the most amazing part of the whole experience! Just be prepared to wait and know that it might not have the best service at times.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
Went here couple months ago so I am writing this from memory.

That fried oyster, oh my gosh that fried oyster. I need to get some back in my life. I have never had one that tasted anything like this before. SO FRESH! That batter did not make me feel like I just gained 5 lbs from eating it either. Lightly battered but with soo much flavor. I highly recommend trying it. 

We also tried the chicken and waffles. Please NOTE: this will feed about 2-3 girls!! Their portion is HUGE, i mean, geez now I know why people in the south are more....endowed. Chicken was tender and juicy, not at all dry. Yummy waffles.

The wait really is not that bad, it can look intimating but seemed to move pretty fast for us. Seeing as how it is one of the top rated restaurants in Portland for tourists, we were worried that getting a table for 8 ppl was going to be tough, as they do not do reservations. It did not take as long as what the host had told us. Funny because we actually went to get our nails done at the little nail shop down the street, and they called our name while we were doing our nails. We had to put our name back on the list but even then, it did not take long at all to get, yet another table lol....oops on us. 

Their service is great! Go try it!!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: Long wait too get in but the food is worth it seating is a little cramped and drinks, are expensive. But the food more than masks up for it. Fried okra is,a must have along with those hush puppys. That fried chicken is, to die for. Come in with an appetite, maybe skip the appetizers if your going for a full blown dinner. Very popular so come early if you can.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
This place has fantastic food that you can't complain about - generous portions, fantastic flavor with southern soul, and plenty of variety.

We started with the praline bacon which includes three thick pieces. I would suggest sharing this - or making it your meal. It was sweet and smokey with nice crunch. 

The coffee they serve is from Stumptown and is perfect for breakfast pairing.

I was super impressed with the fluffiness of my sweet potato waffle, as well as with the lightness of the batter on the fried chicken. My husband got the burger - it was perfectly cooked with a smoky sauce. 

The only thing that is keeping me from a five star review is that wait time - in a city with so much amazing food, waiting almost an hour seems perhaps unnecessary.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: Fantastic food. Great drinks. I've been here several times. I brunch in town a ton, one of my favorites. However, there is a 90 Min wait every weekend without fail for a table of 2 or more. I brunch too frequently to subject myself to that extreme of a wait time, but definitely one of the best brunches in town. (Hence the long lines)  If you have never gone you should definitely check it out.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: Delicious goodness! Can be a bit of a wait (line around the corner) at times but it's worth it. Huge portions won't disappoint you. Good for breakfast, lunch and dinner!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: Great and greasy and perfect fattening food for the gluttonous :)
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
So my boyfriend wanted to have dinner here for the buttermilk chicken. I looked over the menu and thought "MMM, southern cuisine... YUM!" The dining wasn't full but he and I were sat at their very small table for two. The waitress seemed pleasant... Until she noticed my brand new $450.00 dollar handbag was seated on a hair I pulled from another table. She told me I could not use that chair because they get very packed, and also that I could not block the isle. 

I kindly replied, informing her that I do not set my handbags on the ground and asked to be seated somewhere else with more room. She left to go and speak to her manager who had her pull another table and chair to turn our seating into a table for four which was nice of management to do, considering we were already seated with drinks. But I could tell the waitress felt slighted. I told my boyfriend to look at two other tables, which had been placed together for larger parties, which were blocking the isles too... I just thought she was creating a scene that wasn't needed. I remained polite nonetheless, but she seemed frustrated by the outcome. 

As for the food, NO!!!! I ordered their wings, which were over seasoned with black pepper and the flour coating was not good to me at all. The gumbo tasted like paste, it was disgusting also. I removed the gumbo from my "screen door platter" and sat it aside to eat my other choices, and my boyfriend had the gumbo replaced with mac'n cheese. It wasn't good either. They served it scorching hot and to me it seemed old like a huge pot of it had been cooked and then they reheated it or something, NO BUENO. I didn't like the food, my boyfriend enjoyed his. I mostly ate fries and one chicken wing, the best item were the fries. If you like really peppery and smoked chicken then you'll love this place. I will not go back. And the waitress didn't even ask us for refills on our alcoholic beverages, when she went to clear my food she took my boyfriends utensils and when he asked for another she asked had he dropped his other on the floor (lol). It's not a bad place, but staff can ruin an experience.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: Heard a lot of good things about this restaurant, so of course I had to try it. The wait is ridiculously long, luckily my friends and I stood in line half an hour before they opened up for dinner so we had no problem getting a table. However if we had tried coming right at 5:30, we would have probably waited at least half an hour considering the line was around the block. As for the food, I think it was good. I got a Screen Door Plate with pork chop, mac n cheese, and gumbo. Pork chop was done well, lightly battered and fried and the gumbo was yummy and filled my tummy. The mac n cheese was mehh, I've had better. My friends also got screen door plates with a variety of chicken wings, baked beans, collared greens, and sweet potato fries. I was not a huge fan of any of the items (and neither were my friends). I'm not really sure if we ordered the wrong dish (and had really high expectations), but I was expecting a lot more flavor from the food. The food was good but not the best that I've ever had. Luckily we didn't have to wait 30+ minutes in line or I would've been disappointed. However, I haven't given up, I will be back for breakfast/lunch in hopes that my opinion changes.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: My favorite food on the planet. This is where I go to eat the BEST FRIED CHICKEN EVER. And the service there is amazing!!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: The Screen Door is awesome. The trick there is they open at 9 and the line starts forming at 8. If we can't be there by 8:30, then the wait is too long. There, I get the Cathead Biscuit... which sounds weird but it's a biscuit with fried chicken, gravy and grits. They also have the best chicken and waffles in town
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: freaking fantastic. lives up to all the hype. worth the wait on the long line. not very vegan friendly. I'm a vegetarian and could find ample selections. great service.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: Surprised by the level of good dining during my stay in Portland.  Portland has perfected the indoor arts....restaurants, microbreweries, and strip clubs.  As far as my Screendoor experience goes, it was fabulous.  The molasses pork was ridiculous.  The pork literally melted in your mouth.  I decided to add on a Jambalaya and the pear salad.  I ate like a champ.  The jambalaya was pretty good but a bit dry.  The pear salad was off the charts good.  The blue cheese was sweet and creamy.  My only complaint about the pear salad is the pomegrante seeds.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: Food was yummy, and the portion was pretty large. It's a dog friendly place where you can let your pet buddy chill with you out in the outdoor patio.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: The food was delicious but it gets 2 stars because I immediately did not feel good at all after eating there for the first time yesterday. A few hours passed by and I realized I had the stomach flu. It's been a miserable day since then and it sucks. I had ordered a piece of fried chicken, an egg, and potatoes. I don't usually eat big meals in the morning so I figured my uneasy stomach was because of the large portion of food but I couldn't even finish the rest of my food. I'm pretty unhappy with how it made me feel, I don't think I'll be able to go there for a long time because this flu is killing me. :/
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: Probably my favorite restaurant in Portland. I have been here more than 20 times. I always get the same thing, fried chicken and mashed potatoes with ham gravy. Sometimes we will switch it up with different appetizers but I can not emphasize enough how amazing the chicken is to me. It's perfectly juicy on the inside and crispy on the outside. The house made hot sauce gives it the perfect kick. I don't know how they cook this chicken so well. Service is always great. One time our server was a little slow and the owner came over to apologize to us in person. I have had he chicken and waffles brunch and it was good, but the fried chicken dinner is where it's at.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
Okay, this place is good but not as spectacular as I had expected. We tried their chicken and waffles. The waffle was good but if no one had told me I wouldn't have guessed it was sweet potato. I couldn't enjoy the chicken cause it was way too peppery, but my husband, the black pepper lover that he is, loved it. I couldn't help but order their praline bacon and really regretted it. It wasn't very good.
I really can't say it was worth the long, long wait. The food was good but not spectacular. If I'm waiting 1 1/2 hours I expect spectacular food!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: Even better than I hoped! ! Short wait,  friendly service, amazing food!! We got two orders of chicken and waffles (sweet potato waffle balances the spice of the tender, juicy chicken), okra (very good, excellent flavor), Mac and cheese (yum), pancakes were sweet and fluffy! Everything came out piping hot and incredibly flavorful!!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: Absolutely fantastic grub. Comfort food at its finest. I will return! Calories be damned! Only negative might be finding a parking spot - but worst case you might just have to walk a block or two. Anyone marking this less than 5 stars is a pretension MoFo. "A bit too Heavy"?...go back to your tofu and granola.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
Not very often in Portland does a restaurant live up to the hype. Screen Door is the exception to that rule. It is worth every second of whatever kind of wait they have when you get there. Started with beers while we waited in line, ordered the Shrimp and Grits appetizer (Fantastic) and some cocktails. I had a true hurricane (Strong). 

entree was Fried chicken wings, gumbo, beans and corn bread. All of it was delicious. The chicken wings were the star of the menu. Perfectly crispy.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: Legit southern comfort food. Huge portions. My only issue with this place is that sometimes I keep eating their comfort food to the point where I am physically uncomfortable. Nice atmosphere. Good beers on tap. Easy to find parking.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: Really good food, just a little pricey for me to come every day. I still will be back!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
Super popular restaurant in the area. My friend who came before recommended that I come 30 min before they opened so the wait wouldn't be as long and I definitely would recommend the same to anyone else. Their dinner and brunch menu change so we unfortunately were not able to try their sweet potato waffles/other brunch items. On Yelp, it said that they do not take reservations but they do if the party is 6 or more. 

We ordered their fried chicken, hush puppies, and corn bread. The fried chicken was my favorite! I loved how it moist and juicy, although it did get too salty after a few bites. The hush puppies were delicious as well but what was disappointing was that it tasted EXACTLY like the corn bread, except fried instead of baked. It seemed like they took the "lazy way out" when it came to their hush puppy recipe. The corn bread was the least favorite because it was on the drier and more salty side, and I prefer my cornbread moist and sweet. 

TLDR: 
Good restaurant but probably would not come again because the wait can be a hassle. Don't really recommend the corn bread. Worth trying if in the area (and willing to wait) but there are other great places that are similar to this in Portland!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: THE BEST BRUNCH I'VE EVER HAD...!!!!! Even though we waited a little more than an hour and half it was well worth it and I would do it all over again!! The chicken and waffles and the pecan bacon was my fave.. AWESOME WAITER!!! Think his name was BEN
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: This is a solid, classic Portland brunch experience. The food is good if not revolutionary, the staff is friendly and it's welcoming to kiddos, and the ambiance is just fine. It's not where I'd go for the most inventive food or elegant experience, but if you want some good brunch and lunch eats, decent pricing and large portions, Screen Door is definitely a safe bet. Just be prepared for a wait!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: Yep seriously 5 stars. Best breakfast around. Bananas foster French toast, awesome biscuits and gravy, eggs beni, chicken and waffle, properly cooked bacon and solid coffee.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: I had the no reservation and wait outside 30 minutes before opening system they have here. So I hate to admit that this place is worth the wait! The hush puppies were a bit bland but all the rest was stunning! The crusted fish dishes are to die for.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: Amazing food, wonderful dim lighting and atmosphere is great. Staff is Portland vibe and the drinks are to die for. This place is worth the wait!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: This is a really good place for us to bring friends from out of town.  It's different from what they are used too.  The restaurant offers some really good breakfast items. My favorite is the fried chicken waffle.  Service is pretty good.  The only con is having to wait in line, sometimes in the rain and cold, for an open table.  Nonetheless, we'll be back.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: Fried Chicken.....Damm good stuff, Infused Vodka's go well in my Bloody M....Great place to take friends from out of town....
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: The food and drinks were really good, however it took forever to get it, probably our bad for going on a Sunday morning, they had a lovely selection of tea and coffee for the people waiting, but did not make it very clear that you would be charged for that, I think the idea of that was wonderful but the prices were a bit steep. However over all if was a good experience! I just won't go back on a weekend!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
Note : I am most likely going to give it 3.5 stars, but leaning more towards 3 stars just because I don't get the hype.

I am usually not a big fan of this cuisine, neither do I ever have the balls to try it. So, with that being said, I was pretty fast to judge the Southern cuisine as something I would never try.

I wish I had taken that back. 

This restaurant is located in the midst of a very quiet neighborhood, but the hustling and bustling of the place is quite amusing, especially on a Saturday night. Upon arrival, the place was obviously packed. People were waiting inside, people were waiting outside, people were waiting near the bar, people were desperately, patiently waiting to taste what the restaurant has to offer. My wait time for 2 people was estimated about 45 mins, but I'd say that I waited no more than half an hour.

Was the wait worth it? Not exactly.

The boyfriend and I shared the cripsy buttermilk fried chicken and the special of the night, which was the shrimp in New Orleans Sauce. Fat overload. I am pretty sure I'd gained 5 pounds after that dinner.

The fried chicken was good, however the sauce may be too peppery for my liking. It was deep fried (d-uh) with crispy layer of skin and the juicy chicken breast reveals itself. I did not finish my portion of the chicken. I, however, did love the mashed potatoes that was included. So soft and creamy.................

The shrimps were alright. I think we were too hungry, to the point that we devoured everything in 5. It was very buttery and loaded with a layer of oil. Bread was included for dipping into the sauce.

Overall, I feel that this place is rather overhyped. I would actually come again if I am craving for fried chicken, other than that, I'd skip it.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: Love the brisket and fried chicken. Huge, huge portion and good quality. Will come again.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: Finally at Screen Door. And yeah, the seriously incredible fried chicken and sweet potato waffles were worth the wait.  Creole Pecan Pie - 'nough said.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: We ordered the Chicken and Waffles, there were 3 of us, and it filled us up with left overs.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
Great food. Huge portions. Imaginative local and organic menu. Heaven for carnivores, yet awesome for vegetarians.

Long. Ass. Line. 

Yes, you know the line is long. You've read all the reviews, you're aware. It's a situation. But I don't think you know just how bad it is. Somehow, it's never pleasant weather when you're waiting at Screen Door. It always seems to be either raining hard or giving you a sunburn. Thankfully there is a coffee shop next door, which I always speculate must be getting about 95% of its business from waitlisted Screen Door patrons.

However, this place still gets 5 stars. The food is THAT good and the other diners waiting in line with you are always nice enough. Not too many kids screaming and running amok--I'm a parent, but it's nice when they are not too intrusive--and those who are there are rendered inoffensive by the general hubbub of the place. Great drinks, atmospheric decor, knowledgable (if somewhat curt at times) waitstaff, and a nice location.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
Yes. People stand in line for food. For a reason.
Especially yummy, delicious food. We arrived around 8:40am on Sunday in hopes of making the 9:00am opening and first seating. They seat slowly to give the staff time to absorb the influx of diners -- the good news is that our party of 5 was seated on the patio (has heaters) and it was game on for their weekend brunch.

Our waitress was friendly and on the spot with water, coffee and refills. The menu has SO MANY wonderful sounding dishes that we agreed to come back soon so we can eat our way through the menu.  Our group had the:

Pimiento Cheese & Sausage Biscuit Sandwich
freshly baked buttermilk biscuit layered w/ pimiento cheese, house breakfast pork sausage & over easy fried egg w/ your choice of grits, cheddar grits or roasted potatoes.

Huevos Rancheros
Roja braised natural beef brisket layered w/ crispy corn tortillas, pepper-jack cheese, two over medium eggs* & slow cooked black beans, cilantro crema & sauce ranchera.

Broccoli & Fennel Sausage Frittata
Broccoli, fennel sausage, onions, arugula salad with lemon vinaigrette and oven roasted potatoes

Grits Bowl with Cremini Mushrooms and Cheddar Cheddar Cheese

First the coffee is good (it better be. it's 2017 and this is Portland, Oregon.) Portions are large. You could consider sharing -- or take it home for later! I did.

The sauces on the Huervos Rancheros are savory, unexpected and complex. This dish has layers of flavor and is a must-try.

The frittata was the perfect blend of eggs veggies a touch of cheese. The salad with lemon on top made this a meal to enjoy before walking/exploring or tackling the day.

The grits bowl was rich and delicious.

The biscuit was large and the type you eat with a fork and knife. Rave reviews on the pimiento cheese and the biscuit.

Nit: Patio seating in mid-March on a cold morning.... brrrrr. The patio is lovely and the heaters were helpful but there is an inch of space between the bottom of the tarp-side walls and the ground. Brrr. Thank goodness for hot coffee, great company, good conversation and outstanding food.

Yes, stand in line for breakfast, lunch and dinner at this Portland gem.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
This place has set a new record in my brunch experiences, I'm not sure if any brunch restaurant could ever compare. There is a reason it has over 3,000 high reviews, it really is amazing. We've tried to come here numerous times and the lines have always been too long. While in town a few weeks ago, we stopped by for brunch to see what the wait was going to be like. The restaurant was packed, with only a few people waiting before us - we waited a short 20 minutes to be seated. 

The restaurant has a southern/creole theme and it is weaved into all the dishes. I ordered a lemon alcoholic drink that was super good. However, when I looked at the menu I couldn't decide what I wanted to eat so I ordered a few things. For starters, the Crispy Fried Okra $6.50 (cornmeal battered) the main dish I ended up getting was the seasonal veggie frittata $11.75 & a side biscuit sans gravy $5. The portions are pretty big, and I ended up taking home half of the frittata. 

The food is mainly made up of food that is local/organic tasted amazing. When I come back to visit, I'll definitely come back and try dinner.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
We went in around 5 on a Thursday and we're immediately sat down on the patio. Our server was really nice but veryyyyy slow. 
We had never been so maybe we were expecting too much but I just didn't find anything really that impressive. 
We tried the pimento cheese and hush puppies. The cheese was fine, nothing spectacular and the hush puppies tasted like whatever was in the oil (chicken,fish etc) making it nearly inedible for me. (Probably not going to be your fav spot if you're vegetarian) 
Anyway, I had an entree of Mac n cheese, salad and cauliflower. The mac n cheese looked amazing but was watery and didn't have a ton of flavor. Disappointed. The cauliflower/ mushroom dish was by far the most tasty but also the most salty! The salad was okay, too. Nothing special.  My friend boxed up her potatoes and chicken, she thought it was all pretty gross. We gave it to a homeless man outside. I ended up taking mine home to my partner who also found it disappointing and definitely not worth an hour wait. 

By the time we left about an hour and a half later there were about 30+ people waiting for a seat!!! What!!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
Reviews here say it all...incredible place. There is a line outside before the restaurant opens so you'll need to be there before 5:15pm to make sure you get seated in the first round, otherwise could be an hour wait. I was there early waiting for friends to show up. Didn't make it in the first seating but got a beer at the beer and waited patiently. Even with as many people stuffed close together in entry area, people were nice to each other and anxious to talk about their experiences here and around town. 

We were seated at 6:30 and started with some Hurricanes (which are some of the best I've had). Shared a few appetizers including the friend okra, crab cakes (special that night) and the shrimp and grits. The friend okra was done just right with big chunks of okra lightly battered and served with their remoulade sauce. The shrimp and grits were probably the table favorite. Perfectly creamy grits with a bacon, tomato, garlic and white wine sauce...incredibly good. The crab cakes were also very light and tasty. We all shared a few dinners including the friend chicken, pecan crusted trout, chicken strips and beef brisket. The portions are huge and we just about managed to finish everything. Ended the dinner with their banoffee pie. Wow! 

Looking forward to coming here for brunch one day.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: Great food and price, excellent service, YUM!!  if ever i get back to portland we will be back here for sure or would recommend to any friends and relatives.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: Amazing experience.  If you want to eat here, be prepared to wait. Food and service was great.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
From the positive reviews on Yelp as well as one of the A&E's pick in this year's Diner Guide of the top breakfast restaurants in town, I finally tried Screen Door and it far exceeded my expectations.  

As many have mentioned, arrive EARLY.  My father and I arrived at 8:40AM, 20 minutes before they opened and we were about #15 in line, of about 45 (and it was pouring down rain).  As we were eagerly awaiting the front doors to open, I realized that this place must be good as the line continued to grow and the rain continued to fall.

Once we were inside, we were promptly seated and served coffee and water.  With so many wonderfully tasting options, my dad and I did more of a family style when we ordered, so we could try more than one item.  I ordered the fried chicken and sweet potato waffle and he ordered the 'big breakfast' with 2 over easy eggs, potatoes, apple pork sausage, and substituted the toast for a biscuit.  We also ordered a side of the praline bacon.  

First, I tend to lean towards sausage over bacon, and wow, the praline bacon was some of the best bacon I have ever eaten in my life.  The combination of sweet and salty is perfect.  The bacon is also a bit thicker cut than normal and moist.  

Secondly, you must try the fried chicken, amazing!  Very crisp and flavorful on the outside and moist and chewy in the inside.  Add a piece of the sweet potato waffle and fresh maple syrup and you realize why you waited in the rain for breakfast.  

Thirdly, for your typical, eggs, some sort of meat, potatoes, and toast, the 'big breakfast' definitely will exceed your expectations.  The apple sausage links (2) were quite flavorful, the red potatoes were seasoned perfectly, and the eggs were just like my dad likes them.  I would say the only downfall of our entire meal was the biscuit.  It was a tad fluffy, cake-like for my liking.  It was like a biscuit angel food cake in the way it was prepared as far as looks and how it tasted (yet obviously not sweet like angel food cake).  I like my biscuit more flaky and creamy.

Our service was fabulous, as our water and coffee glasses were never empty.  The coffee beans are from Stumptown and did not disappoint.  

If you wake up on a Saturday or Sunday morning wanting a delicious breakfast that you will continue to talk about the entire day and keep you full for a while (as the portions are quite large, you will most likely have left overs) try Screen Door, it won't disappoint.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: Excellent food and service.  Loved their grits and fried chicken.  It's typically very busy there with a long line but it is definitely worth the wait.  I will be back!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: Literally the best chicken and waffles I've ever had!!! Yes I know that's a bold statement, but it's true for me. That's really all I have to saw other than the employees are super friendly.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: Pretty delicious food but damn the wait can be tough.  Chicken and waffles are delish.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: Phenominal.  We went early on a week day and only had a 10 minute wait for our table. So, just avoid peak times to save the wait. We decided to try this place out while visiting Portland when we saw the positive reviews on yelp.  We are so glad we did. The food was amazing.  Fried chicken was so good, and we tried the pork belly app which was delicous.  Mac & cheese was creamy and had an amazing baked cheese crust....can't say enough good things about this place. Next time we are in town we'll be back!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
