Not that they "needed" our business- but it will be important when that wait eventually slows down that those not helped will remember that!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: Fantastic food and service. Expect a wait anytime you go (we went on a MONDAY AT LUNCH and STILL waited 30 minutes for a table!) We had a variety of things from soup to sweet potato fries and not a single thing wasn't delicious. Hot chocolate, mac and cheese, chicken, burger... tried them all! Would order all again!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: I went to the Screen Door with friends this past Sunday and wasn't disappointed! Although I wasn't hungry enough to eat what they ordered (Bananas Foster French Toast and Chicken & Waffles), the food I had was great! The biscuit and the praline bacon were yummy. Get there early because the line is long. Oddly, they don't have espresso drinks but there is a place next door that serves those.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: The best Fried Chicken I have ever tasted! I would even fly from Los Angeles to Portland just to have dinner here!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
So I've been to the Screen Door three times now, which I think is well deserving of a review.

I didn't have much of an appetite during my first visit, but I was sure to have that fried chicken that everyone raves about during my second visit.  It is seriously some darn good fried chicken!  And the mashed potatoes are super yummy.  I love mashed potatoes and good textured mashed potatoes earn bonus points for me.

I've had a couple of the cocktails on the list, but none of them are as good as their bloody mary.  Holy yum!  It's thick and has lots of spices and taste.  I will most certainly judge a place by the quality of its bloody mary and Screen Door has a great one.

If you visit at the normal dinner times or on the weekend, there will most certainly be a wait.  I've been lucky to not have to wait very long on the times that I have dined here.

Definitely some good comfort food and lots of amazing fresh, local ingredients!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: Wow! Expect at least a 30 minute wait, but damn... it's worth it! Go for brunch and get the Chicken and Waffles! It's a huge serving of fried chicken and possibly the best waffle around, easily shared by 2 people!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
Food: 
We ordered the buttermilk chicken and the screen door plate.  I'm m not a big fan of fried chicken, but this was literally the beat fried chicken ive ever had.  The chicken is incredibly tender with a really crunchy, peppery crust.  The meat inside was so moist and tender.  So yummy!  Everything else from the okra to the mac and cheese were delicious, but the fried chicken is definitely this establishment's crown jewel!

Service: Service was friendly and fairly timely, given how busy they are!

Wait: Definitely reserve ahead of time, its popularity makes waiting almost a guarantee.  If you have less than 4 people, it'll probably be a bit easier.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
This place gets a top rating for good reasons.  We went to the Screen Door on Tuesday night and it was already packed to the gills.  We ordered a drink at the bar and were seated just as we were finishing our drinks.  

I ordered the fried chicken livers, which were perfectly authentic to my memories of fried utopia living in Georgia.  The chili sauce was delicious but was better used on the sweet potato fries.  My wife and I shared the fried chicken plate with coleslaw, mashed potatoes, and ham gravy.  It was good that we sat at the bar, because we demolished everything in front of us and the bartender was our only witness.
The chicken was cooked to perfection sans bones and the ham gravy was so good, I just spooned it directly into my mouth.

Both of us left so stuffed that we woke up still full this morning.  It was like having your southern mom cook you a home cooked meal when you come home from college.  I am still thinking about it.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: This has been on my wish list forever.  Finally waited outside on a chilly Portland morn, with a hot cup of coffee to try the recommended fair.  crispy Chicken and Sweet Potato Waffle, with a side of gravy filled us up quick.  Daily special Bacon Praline Pecan French Toast definitely satisfied my sweet tooth.  Our waitress was fantastic too.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: This is probably my favorite breakfast place in town. It is expensive so I only go there on special occasions their severs are very friendly and careful. They check in often so you don't have to wait to long. Their cooks are very speedy. Did I mention how good their food is?
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: The cathead biscuit and chicken was worth the wait. Would have been 5 stars had the home fries been hot on the plate with everything else. All in all, worth the wait to get in. I will be trying the bananas foster on the next visit.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: Screen Door was recommended by a friend so I decided to give it a try! Very glad I did! Had the Vegetable frittata and roasted potatoes! Worth a visit for breakfast or brunch!! Chicken and Waffles also looked amazing!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: Had the po boy and praline bacon. Omg it was so delicious especially the praline bacon it was soft and savory plus sweet. We did a take out since it was so busy and full but the food came out hot and fast.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
What can we say other than this place is bomb as hell. The biscuits. Get yourself one. 
The fried chicken. Yep. Ok point. Well cleaned and fried well. 
The rockfish Sammy. What! That fennel slaw is tasty af. 
The remoulade for the okra was some of the best idk since forever. I know that sounds silly but it it was super on point. And it's house made. 
Gumbo was deep and rich. That roux is no joke. 

Only thing I didn't like was the cornbread. They need to step that up. It was dense and dry. 

Go now. You'll love it.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: This LA girl was in Portland visiting a good friend when I was brought to Screen Door for brunch. MY GOODNESS!!!! This place had some of the best southern food I've ever tasted in my life. Their chicken and waffles was absolutely amazing. Mind you I'm from LA where we have the famous Roscoe's Chicken and Waffles and I hate to betray the restaurant native to my city but Screen Door kills Roscoe's. In fact I will probably will not visit Roscoe's ever again. My palete will never be the same. The chicken was crispy, succulent, and bursting with flavor. I had to pause and reflect on my life after eating here. I also tried my friend's oysters and I was brought down to my knees. This place is were a die hard foodie comes to get owned.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: Never reviewed this place before because I think it's a well-known fact it's a town favorite and staple. My favorite restaurant, so delicious. BUT I'm writing to say if you're short on time and can't do the line or take the chance of not making it inside, it now can be delivered to you on the app Postmates. Have done that twice now and it's been to my house within an hour. You're welcome ;-)
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
So we had been waiting to go here for a while but it's always so packed on the weekends. Had a chance to swing by on a Wednesday and we walked straight in. 

Service was friendly and prompt and the cocktail I got was great! We ordered the Texas migas scramble, hush puppies, praline bacon and a typical grand slam type build a breakfast. 

There were only two of us and the servings were huge so we had leftovers even though we stuffed our  faces with the delicious dishes. My favorite was the scramble, what really made it was the cilantro crema, I could probably drink that stuff. 

The hush puppies were also perfectly cooked with a simple cane sugar dipping sauce. I thought the praline bacon was a bit sweet but my girlfriend loved it. 

We will definitely be coming back!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: I'm not a hater. Let me explain the 3-star. The famous chicken and waffles... the waffle is wonderful. It is fluffy and has a nice cinnamon taste. The chicken is a full breast, with the perfect cook on the meat and crunchy coating. The problem is that the chicken batter is wayyyyyy to heavy on the black pepper. I love black pepper, and it was overwhelming. A complete misfire to the point where even drowning the meal in syrup did nothing to sooth sensory overload. Black pepper is not hot, it has this numbing quality that drowns out all other flavors. Not good. The other meal I had was the shrimp and grits. This was cute, but it was way too fishy tasting. It should be clean and oceanic, but it came out stale and swampy. Just a complete miss like the chicken batter. The portions are huge and the prices are fine - IF they can correct these important issues.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
I've been here twice; once for dinner with the husband and once for brunch with the husband. I don't recommend ever trying to go for a quick brunc,h as you will be waiting in line forever. We went there on a whim at about 2 PM got a table within five minutes.

I do not  eat pork, beef, or dairy so it was a bit of a challenge to find something on the menu but it was all extremely delicious. 

A bit loud, but isn't that the case with most restaurants? Service was fine for dinner, super slow for brunch. I'd love to have brunch their again if the line weren't miles long...
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: Excellent food at reasonable prices. Be prepared to wait for a while to get a table, but the food is absolutely worth it. I will say that once we got a table, our service was fairly quick (not super speedy, but not dragging either). I ordered the bananas foster French toast which was EXCELLENT and I would absolutely recommend to anyone who likes French toast and wants something a little different.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
Went on a Sunday at 11am and had a 2hr wait. 

I got the SHRIMP AND GRITS with a strong coffee to accompany my brunch. The shrimp stock they used was amazing! And it was on top of cheesy grits? Oh god.... Four hearty sized prawns, perfectly cooked were hiding in my bowl of goodness too. Let's not forget the buttery flakey fist sized biscuit with over easy eggs on the side too. Makes me crazy enough to wait another two hours to have it all again. If I had the right of mind I could just keep copying and pasting this paragraph to emphasize how good it was too.

I got the SHRIMP AND GRITS with a strong coffee to accompany my brunch. The shrimp stock they used was amazing! And it was on top of cheesy grits? Oh god.... Four hearty sized prawns, perfectly cooked were hiding in my bowl of goodness too. Let's not forget the buttery flakey fist sized biscuit with over easy eggs on the side too. Makes me crazy enough to wait another two hours to have it all again. If I had the right of mind I could just keep copying and pasting this paragraph to emphasize how good it was too.

I got the SHRIMP AND GRITS with a strong coffee to accompany my brunch. The shrimp stock they used was amazing! And it was on top of cheesy grits? Oh god.... Four hearty sized prawns, perfectly cooked were hiding in my bowl of goodness too. Let's not forget the buttery flakey fist sized biscuit with over easy eggs on the side too. Makes me crazy enough to wait another two hours to have it all again. If I had the right of mind I could just keep copying and pasting this paragraph to emphasize how good it was too.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: Shockingly good. I am still in awe. We waited for two hours because of all we had heard, but knowing what i now know would have gladly waited twice that. The Chicken & Waffles are what they are known for, but you can hardly go wrong. I made the gluttonous decision of eating the whole portion, however you can easily share this with a friend/partner and still be easily satisfied.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
This review is for a take out order of their fried chicken and cat fish.

Ranking by rate, this one seems to be the #1 restaurant in the entire Portland metro area. Hence, naturally it fell on our radar here after a day of serendipitous shopping trip. It opens at 5:30 but when I got there at 5:15, there were already a huge crowd of people lining up there. It ended up most of those people were able to get in in first round. But with limited waiter availability, it still took about 25 mins to seat those 1st round. That said, tip of the day, be there at 5:10 to secure a seat and the fried chicken will pay you back for your wait.

We decided to order take out due to shortage of time. We ordered the flagship fried chicken with catfish as side. Order was served faster than promised. Fried chicken was amazingly tender, juicy and flavorful especially with their gravy on top of it. Even our serious weight/calorie watcher finished half of the fried chicken plus catfish. I didn't enjoy the way they battered catfish never the less.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: Everything that came out of the kitchen here was amazing. The chicken and waffles, the shrimp and grits, the praline bacon, the sausage, the water. But seriously, this place is a must if you want great breakfast/brunch
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: I was quoted the wait is about 35 min but got seated within 20 min that's always a plus. My cup of water was never empty for long. After dining here I really have to be more conservative with my stars because the customer service alone deserve a 5 star. We start with some fried oysters and Peach salad which was not bad. I ordered some smoke beef brisket with bbq sauce. NOW THE GF FRIED CHICKEN WAS AMAZING IT WAS SO JUICY AND CRISPY. To sum everything up this is a must tried if you're in town!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: Trust the reviews! I'm a HUGE breakfast person and this place is officially my favorite breakfast place. The pancakes are SUPERB! I've been to so many breakfast joints in the northwest looking for a place like this. The wait is long, no doubt, but it was worth the 45 minutes I spent standing out in the cold! I LOVE THIS PLACE!!!!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: I ordered the chicken and waffles that was absolutely delicious! The portions are large and can easily be shared with another person. The house made hot sauce is so yummy. I asked for a side of it to take home with me!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: Went for dinner. Anticipated a little too much maybe.. Was one of the first 10 people in line but still took forever for food to come out. Service was blah and not very personable. I had the friend chicken, mashed potatoes and collard greens. The chicken was thin cut and not very juicy. Just a lot of peppery breading. Very disappointed with the fried chicken that is suppose to be their staple. Maybe I got a bad cut, but for $18 I expect thicker juicier chicken. The mashed potatoes were plain mash potatoes that look like my grandma made from a bag and reheated them. They give you one small cup of gravy to go with, but was barely enough. The collard greens surprisingly were the best part of the meal. I will possibly give screen door another chance, but like I said maybe it was just too hyped for me. My wifey cooks better southern food and she's never even stepped foot in the south. I was thoroughly unimpressed.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
Visiting from Seattle, I was super surprised to even witness a restaurant with over 5000+ reviews! Being said, I was extra excited to see what this hype was all about. My plus one and I arrived a little after 10am and after settling down and ordering, it took about an hour or so. We ordered the praline bacon, their famous chicken and waffles, biscuit and gravy, and lastly the spicy aioli cod sandwich. (It was more like a burger than a sandwich.)

Everything came out accordingly and the wait time was surprisingly not as long as I thought it would have been. The restaurant is crowded and I cant imagine how hard the kitchen crews have to work to meet the demands. Much props to them! 

My "sandwich" was flavorful and delicious! Chicken and waffle was also great. I don't eat chicken, but my boyfriend absolutely loved the chicken and complimented on how not dry it was! Praline bacon was unique and had a great balance between sweet and savory. 

Overall, great experience and I would love to visit again when in Portland. Wish they took reservations to reduce the wait time in the future!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: A little over-rated. They do have great food, and it's probably one of the better places in Portland but they have to cram so many chairs in there that it's not really an amazing experience. You end up waiting a long time to sit in a loud place. I expect this so that's not a huge problem, I just think that there are other places near by that deliver a great experience with the food.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: Not enough vegan options when I went! Please consider vegan options so I can also believe you are the best like most of portland! Xoxo
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
Let me start by saying, I am a picky bitch when it comes to breakfast, ESPECIALLY southern-style breakfast.  I grew up on a cattle ranch in Texas, and I was well trained in the fine art of biscuits and gravy, chicken fried steak, etc.  I never order it at a restaurant, because mine are so much superior.
No, I didn't have the biscuits and gravy here either, but what I did have was so damned good, I want to try them.
The fried oyster benedict is HEAVEN.  The best hollandaise sauce that has ever graced my lips. I would drink a bowl of it if I could get away with it.  Great to dip the fried potatoes on the side in.
Fiance had banana foster french toast, and raved about it. I'm teetotal and won't do rum, but I did swipe a spoonful of fresh whipped cream off his place. DELISH!
And, whatever you do, GET THE PRALINE BACON!  Thanks to the other 1200 previous reviews of this place, I noticed it was highly recommended by (almost) all of them. LISTEN!
Yeah, the wait is long.  There's a reason.  I'm trying to convince fiance to take me back again tomorrow
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: Second time in here and I really like all the food I order.  Try anything on the menu I assure that it will be a good.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: Love this place! You really can't beat the fried chicken. And actually everything on the menu is delicious, just close your eyes and point to anything! Yes the wait can be long but they do take reservations for large groups and the wait for two people isn't usually bad. Their desserts are top notch too. This place is a must!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: Banana Foster French toast.... Fried chicken and waffles.....Yes folks the line is well worth the wait at this Portland hotspot. They have one of the most amazing breakfast menus ever!! Bring your friends and your appetite.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
Excellent fried chicken. Biscuits are ok. I like mine a bit more sweet and a bit more moist, the way I like my women.

One of the many popular place so you'll get long wait times. It was a freezing night and the patio heat lamps helped a bit but everyone's legs were freezing. Opt for inside of its cold out.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: Amazing Chicken & Waffles! Little bit of a wait but great service once you get seated. I'll definitely be back.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: I'm from Texas visiting a friend in Portland and she suggested this place for brunch. It was packed but we'll worth the wait. I'm not a believer in chicken for breakfast but she ordered us the chicken and waffles with a side of fruit and I was on cloud 9. The chicken seasoning was phenomenal. Can't wait to try this place again- such a guilty pleasure and huge portions.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: Amazing chicken and waffles!!! Best I've ever had, maybe not worth the wait but definitely worth the price and to go again!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: Excellent breakfast choice.  Definitely be ready to wait to eat, but will fill you up with good portions.  Great service that matches the great taste of the food.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
Always tasty food. The parking is a nightmare and the wait is a
 bit of a pain. But the food and atmosphere are great.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: This place is great - great food and awesome service.  Staff remembered me on my second visit.  Right for the price!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
It feels like every soul food join is hype up and leave you a disappointing after taste. Even in the south you have to wait in line for that "it" soul food place but they are all average. 

Had their breaded fried chicken, feels like its just chicken fried steak. Gritz was more like potato soup. Chili was so sweet. Its was more their idea of southern food should be but doesn't taste southern to me. The food wasn't bad but i guess its not something to rave about.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
Trying to avoid a review that reiterates what every other yelper has diligently reported seems difficult. But in this case it might be easy.

If you are hungry and hungover on a weekend there may be better options, bear with me for a moment here. The lines are always long, the wait staff generally slow, and the food overpriced.  The place is always overcrowded inside as well. Now I know this could be construed as a positive, being that big crowds usually indicate fabulous food, service, and atmosphere, or all three. Well, in this case, only one of those three elements is completely there. It's the food. The food is good, but not worth the slow service, the long wait, and overcrowded cramped room.

Don't fool yourselves. This place isn't is as good as its cracked up to be. Although, if you get in here on a weekday, maybe it would be worth it- without the crowds and frustrated work staff  (funny at times).

With that being said, the menu does offer some interesting twists on northwestern brunch cuisine. Well done kitchen staff!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
Wow. Absolutely amazing. Great food at reasonable prices. I can understand now why people are willing to wait hours for this place. We were lucky enough to come for a Friday breakfast and were seated immediately. Our server was super helpful giving recommendations and we loved everything we ordered. My favorite was the chicken and waffles, husband's favorite was the berry bread pudding and the shrimp grits. Will definitely be visiting more in the future! 

- Fried Chicken and Waffle: by far best chicken and waffles I've ever had. The sweet potato waffle really makes this dish shine and is like no other. The fried chicken was also super crispy on the outside and juicy on the inside. I'm glad I got the 1 pc - it was the prefect size even though I was hungry. We saw some orders come out of the kitchen with 3 fried chickens and those platters were huge. Could easily feed a family. 
- Lowcountry Breakfast Shrimp Grits: every part of this dish was delicious and fresh from the shrimp to the grits to the biscuits to the eggs to the jam. If I had to eat one meal the rest of my life this would be it. Our waiter told us that their dinner version is even better. Not sure how that's even possible but I guess we'll have to come back for dinner. 
- Berry Bread Pudding: perfect blend of flavors and textures. My husband couldn't get enough of this stuff and would have ordered another if he wasn't so full.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: We will definitely be returning to Screen Door next time we're in Portland! For breakfast we had the chicken and waffles, the fried chicken biscuit sliders, and the French toast. The breading on the chicken was perfect, and the sweet potato waffle was really good. Also one of the best biscuits I've ever had. The lunch menu looked great also, so we look forward to coming back for that!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: The food is delicious, but not worth the wait. It seems that Portland natives have become accustomed to waiting 60-90 minutes to enjoy the great food at The Screen Door. Instead of the management team identifying better logistics like other restaurants have, they simply shrug when a guest seems to be appalled by the wait time. Many guests leave and walk around the neighborhood and come back when their time is up. Others laugh at the wait time and opt to dine somewhere else. I ordered the Chicken & Waffles with a side of grits. The portions were generous to say the least! Great value for the taste and amount of food. If you come on the weekend, be prepared to wait at least 60 minutes, even if you show up when the doors open. Enjoy!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: mu hubby's most fav place in town! loved the jambalayas and fried chicken , shrimp and other seafood were mostly very very fresh
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: I luv their grits! Great service- We waited over an hour to get our table for four during Sunday morning brunch- but it was worth it- next time, I am going to avoid coming at peak hours- what was great about the wait was that they let you drink coffee outside while you wait.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
Came here for dinner with my family because of all the great reviews on yelp and now i understand why people raved so much about this place. We had really great service and very kid friendly!  The hostess was so considerate and checked with us twice before seating.  She also helped our waitress deliver our food and offered to take 1 kids meal back because it looked like it would of been too much for the kids. Our waitress was very kind and friendly and always available when we needed her.  

I ordered the screen door assorted plate. I loved every single side dish i ordered. The beat salad which wasn't on the regular menu was my favorite. The fried chicken my husband ordered was phenomenal! My son's mac and cheese was so creamy and delicious!

If we are ever in Portland again, we will be back!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
This place can not be described. It must be experienced! The food is amazing! The huge portions of delicious comfort food will leave you needing a nap .
The wait to be seated was over and hour and well worth it. You'll have a hard time deciding what to order because everything looks so good but trust me,  it's all good!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: Stopped in here on a whim during a road trip and the wait was absolutely ridiculous. Waited for around 40 minutes to an hour because we were too lazy to go anywhere else and everything looked great. The servers were very sweet and more accomodating than expected of a restaurant with a high amount of people seemingly all the time. As for the food, the cheese grits were a bit bland but good texture-wise. The hollandaise sauce was a bit off and there was too much of it. The poached eggs were good and fresh for the most part (although just a few seconds overcooked). The creamed spinach was spot-on. Four stars for pretty decent food, great service and atmosphere, but extreme crowds and lengthy wait times.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
Great for breakfast/brunch! The wait is always super long though, expect anywhere from 45 minutes to an hour and a half. Luckily, we arrived around 1:30 pm, which is near the morning closing time, and we only waited about 10 minutes to be seated. 

Once seated, we ordered immediately as we already knew what we wanted. The wait for the food can be just as long. We waited at least 30 minutes for our food to arrive. 

We ordered their fried chicken & waffles and blueberry & lemon curd buttermilk pancakes. The chicken is crispy and delicious. We ordered just one piece (you can choose 1, 2, or 3 pieces with this), and that was definitely enough. The waffles are also tasty, but nothing special about them. The blueberry pancakes are very fluffy. I would definitely recommend both of these dishes. The portions are also huge and great for sharing!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
At last finally can say I have gone to "the" brunch spot in Portland, the ever so famous, fisherman's porch Portlandia inspiring Screen Door. The lines here are notorious, the past 2 times I attempted to come on a Saturday morning and gave up 30 minutes in (this place is notorious for having 2 hour waits at peak). Was able to come on a random Tuesday at 11AM with *only* a 45 minute wait.

There are two types of hyped restaurant, those that don't deserve and those do Screen Door certainly is in the latter. The theme is trendy southern brunch/comfort food, grits , po boys and of course their claim to fame: chicken and waffles . I had the Chicken and Waffles- its a crispy, not too salty and enjoyable to the last bite. It dosen't require much syrup (though that is good too). The waffle, which I think is often neglected is sweet and nice and compliments the chicken super well. Big southern portions, I had only 1 chicken and thought it was plenty. Its on par with what I had at Roscoes in LA. 

Drinks were quite good as well. The Bloody Mary was ranked  among the top in Portland. I thought it was unique with okra, though it was definitely on the spicy side ( I prefer more tomato). It was extra big and packed a good alcohol punch! Mimosa was standard. 

Despite being packed all the time- the service was impressive, they were attentive and gave great recommendations. Parking is street, lots of places around the block as its in a residential neighborhood. 

Overall- its great no doubt. Just sad that its impossible to get to as tourists and locals fight for a spot. Not sure if its really worth a 2+ hour wait (though I'm impatient, and this is common in places like SF). Go on an off day and enjoy the bliss of southern cooking in Portland, bring an empty stomach.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
Two words ... YUM YUM!!

After getting numerous suggestions to come here, we had to check it out on our last night in Portland. SO glad we did! We waited about 45-mins on a Saturday evening. It was worth the wait! Below are the dishes we tried ...

-Chicken tenders - Very moist and highly recommended.
-Ribeye with greens & cheesy potato - Cooked perfectly and sides really complimented it.
-Hazelnut custard pie - Rich and decadent! 

My partner and I shared everything and we had left overs. The drinks were also delicious which made the wait bearable.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: HOLY SHIT!!! Don't even know where to start. This place is soooooo good. On a road trip from LA to Seattle found this place on Yelp (thank you fellow yelpers)I was not disappointed by any means I have to come back when I'm in town. Thank you Portland!!!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
"I think my grandmother -- both of them -- made fried chicken just like this," said my husband. "I used to go buck hay for them all day, just to be able to have my grandma's fried chicken for lunch." 

Everything else was very tasty too, but the fried chicken is, well, DAYUM!

A few days later, The Spouse informs me, "We can NEVER EVER go back to Screen Door and have fried chicken. Never."

So pathetic. Trying to use reverse psychology on moi is like trying to convince a distressed bank that 11 billion dollars is chump change.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: Best fried chicken ever!  Moist and juicy instead with a perfectly season, crispy skin and batter outside.  Fried okra was so good too.  Kale salad was solid.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: After seeing the constant long lines and wait times for this place, I assumed the food would be far more impressive than it actually was - especially given the price. While the flavors were underwhelming, the service was absolutely wonderful.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
SUPER SIZED ME!  WOW!  It was a 90F day/night and we decided to step into the oven for what turned out to the be a week of B-day dinners for my wife.  It was our first time to SD after hearing fabulous reviews for months about the "to die for" fried chicken and brunch.

Hands down this was the best fried chicken I have had. First of all it was HUGE!  We had already attempted to consume a few appetizers - hushpuppies that were worthy of the visit alone - perfectly crispy cooked accompanied by this creoley mustard that we all fought over...and finally asked for a second cup of so we could all take turns trying to lick the last goodness out of it.  Butter lettuce for around $7 seemed a bit much until they backed the produce truck up to this platter sized dinner salad. It must have been at least two heads of perfectly fresh lettuce with yummy blue and bacon.  There is another meal unto itself.  Simple salad done way well.  Add some of the best shrimp & grits I have ever had and we were done & stuffed and way happy before the main meals even hit the table.

We all almost jumped back from the table when the fried chicken arrived.  It looked like an entire chicken on a plate it was massive - steaming hot, uber crispy and perfectly seasoned with secret herbs and spices.  YIKES!  We wanted to asked for a bucket right then and there!  

Did I mention it was 90F outside and ...maybe the same inside. HOT STUFF!  None of us could resist and had to start picking at these birds.  OMG! There has to be some sort of crack in these things, because we could not stop eating them even though every part of sanity and our waist lines were crying out like babies for us to stop the madness.  We had to keep going.  Thank god the server came by and asked us how things were going so we could beg him to take the fried chicken away...it is evil (good)....my precious.

Ate an entire other meal from the leftovers - and it was nearly as good cold the next day. I was sad when it all ran out...  must have more soon!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
Love the beef brisket and sides. Yummy sweet tea. 
The whole family loved the food. 
Generous portions so we could enjoy leftovers later on.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
This was where I started my love for biscuits and gravy!!! Despite having it a few days back, I wasn't too thrilled with it, but decided to give it a chance since so many people have recommended this place. My friend also got the fried chicken and waffle as well. We didn't have to wait that long since it was on a weekday, but there was already a wait when we left around noonish so I can't even imagine how long it would be on weekends. We sat outside, and our waitress was so nice and pretty funny! She accommodated us very well. 

Biscuits and Gravy with eggs sunny side up - the gravy was just very flavorful and they gave enough for the entire dish. My friend and I shared it and we both agreed it was the better biscuits and gravy compared to the ones we've tried beforehand. The biscuit was indeed fluffy and paired well with the gravy they had. Yummmm! 

Fried chicken and waffles - very interesting! I thought the fried chicken was pretty tasty and not too oily, however I was a bit confused with the waffle flavoring. Wasn't too sure about chicken and waffles eaten together, so I ended up eating them separately and they were pretty tasty. I definitely liked it, but my goto would be biscuits and gravy. 

Overall, I thoroughly enjoyed this place, especially since I found my love here despite eating it a few times throughout my trip already. That says alot, yay Screen Door!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
Love, love, love the fried chicken!!! 
The bloody mary was meh, with garnishes little to be desired for, but you must have the fried chicken. Period. Do not know why they even offer other foods on the menu. I've literally dreamt of the chicken before. I know, weird huh? But its just that frekin' good.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
Best Breakfast ever! 

I have been meaning to write a review about this place.  I ate here last year and the Screen Door STILL makes me yearn for the Vegetable Hash.  

The restaurant is a house, small in size but large enough to where you don't feel like you're sitting in the laps of the diners around you.  This place was packed when we went but the free coffee made the wait bearable. 
 
The Vegetable Hash was made up of butternut squash, brussel sprouts, onions and potatoes.  The vegetables were roasted then mixed together with a bit of seasoning.  The mixture of vegetables were heavenly!  My husband had a great dish of a biscuit with a piece of fried chicken and of course gravy.  Everyone that worked there was friendly and made sure we were doing alright.   I love the fact that they did not follow the "normal" breakfast.

A must try place when you visit Portland!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
Shut the front door and open up the screen door. I just want to get in here and eat. The food is out of this world and delivers a unique southern cuisine. 
Went on a Saturday afternoon for lunch. Took about 40 minutes for a seat and another 15 minutes for the food to arrive after ordering. Was that hour wait worth it to try the Screen Door? Simply, Yes.

The price is definitely higher than normal but you do get huge portions and people still come and eat. Service was superb; they came around filling water constantly. Open kitchen so you can look and see what they do. There is outdoor seating and a bar with six seats. There is one single use restroom for each gender, so there will be a line. 

The most highlighted and featured item at Screen Door is the Chicken+Waffles. Three crispy fried chicken on top of a warm waffle [$14.75]. This was huge, delicious, and filling. Words can not describe. Cutting into that chicken, it was so moist and glistened in the dimly lit restaurant. Perfect crispy batter and thick juicy pieces of meat. The waffle alone or paired was  fabulous. Crunchy exterior and fluffy goodness inside. It was made perfectly. The whole dish was in sync. 

Fried Oyster Breakfast Po Boy [$14.75]. This is big. Served with cheesy grits. They did not skimp in the oysters and each bite I definitely got the meatiness of the protein. Crispy onions was on point and the bread sealed the deal. Egg was cooked perfectly that the yolk just oozed out and smothered every delicious bite. 

One biscuit and gravy [$5.50] and Praline Bacon [$5.75] was oh so good. This is stuff you dream about. The biscuit was fluffy and complemented well with the pool of gravy. The Screen Door praline bacon came with three meaty pieces. Coated with the pecans and sweetened with the cayenne brown sugar. This combination works well and very unique added to an already all star bacon item. 

Come here early or if you got a bigger group, you can call in for a reservation. Look at the menu as you wait so you know what to order when you get your seat. Every item on the menu looks really good. Hope you enjoy their hearty food like I did. It does not compare to the screen door you have at home. Experience achieved. *door closes*
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
I waited at least an hour for a table for 2 for Sunday brunch. On top of that, it took a really long time (about 20-25 minutes) for our food to come out? I shared the fried chicken + waffle with my friend because we knew 2 orders would have been a lot of food for the both of us.

I was very satisfied with the fried chicken. It was super crispy and the chicken was tender, moist and still hot from the fryer. I'm thinking the food took awhile to come out because the fried chicken comes out super fresh...otherwise it just takes forever because there are so many people. Also, I really liked the sweet potato waffle that comes with the chicken. I would definitely recommend this dish to anyone who is a first timer to Screen Door.

Other than food, the atmosphere is a great spot. Service was attentive and they always made sure your water was full.

Overall: Tasty food, attentive service and great vibes. Try it out!

NOTE: MAC AND CHEESE IS ONLY SERVED DURING DINNER.  I was not aware of this and was totally disappointed, but the fried chicken was good enough. :)
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
THE BIG: Brunch in Portland is kind of a big deal. Always packed and parking is relegated to street.

THE BLACK AND WHITE: The roomie and I came here right before heading to Montelumah falls. Let me tell you, you can't miss this place. There's about 14 people consistently standing outside waiting for a seat. 

The wait time goes by fast. It took us around 30 minutes to get in and settled.
 
The menu is really big b-t-dubs. Fortunately I was gonna go pure chicken and waffles. The roomie got the oyster benedict. The chicken was pure bliss and the waffle...well was a waffle and it complimented the chicken well.

THE FINAL BAMBOO: The chicken and waffles hovered around $16. Highly, highly recommend and if that doesn't sell you, just ask the people waiting in line.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
The only thing that prevents this from being a five-star review is the fact that this is one of the noisiest restaurants in town. It's really quite difficult to carry on a conversation when the place is full, which is usually.

Their food is great (we usually go for the Screen Door Plate, which lets us choose three items from the Local/Organics menu and/or any of their many delicious sides). Their peppery, delicious fried chicken is one of my faves.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: Great food. Rude staff. There's always a wait and don't ask for how long because the staff won't know and they'll make you feel bad for asking. Gravy is better and just down the street.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
I visited The Screen Door with my husband last night, as we were visiting Portland. We walked down Burnside and "followed our noses" to the best smelling place.  The wait WAS atrocious.  30-45 minutes on the street as the place was packed.  However, it was totally worth it. 

I have Celiac Disease and can't eat anything with wheat. Usually I can get around it by smelling what everyone else is eating and having a nice salad without croutons or dressing.  As I was cruising the menu (and really taking a long time about it) they asked if I needed recommendations--I explained my situation, and they produced a detailed menu which had highlighted which items were already gluten-free, and which ones could be adapted. 

I selected an "adapted" menu item of catfish, but then noticed that the patrons around us were served first. Later, our meals arrived and the waiter/manager/bartender explained to us that my catfish was accidentally breaded with the standard breading--which contained wheat, and in their cross-checking procedure, they caught the error, so they remade both meals (so that my husband's would be hot when mine was).

The service here was TOP NOTCH, oh, and the bartender was great. Best mojito ever.  My advice--call early and get a reservation, or be prepared to wait, but it's totally worth it. Menu includes lots of vegetarian items also (the beet salad was divine).
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: The food at screen door is great, especially for vegetarians. I can't stand the wait though, it's pretty ridiculous. When I first started coming here it wasn't as bad, maybe a half hour wait on weekends if you got there early. Last time I went we had a "reservation" for when they opened and I waited an hour to be seated, not including a half hour wait in a line around the block (Still not sure why I had to wait twice). Then once we were seated it took 45 minutes to get any food. The group was about 8 people so not huge, and I think there should have been some food comped for the wait. If you haven't gone before, I suggest going for the experience. I wouldn't go on a weekend though unless you have nothing else better to do that day. Because it could take all day before you leave. The waffles are delicious and really good eggs.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: So, so good.  The staff is friendly and patient (they don't rush you).  The food...gotta say...pretty, flippin' unbelievable.  The wait is usually long, but it's worth it!  Skip it if you're on a diet...you'll never make it unless you have the best will power on the planet...but what's the point of going there without sinning a little?
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: The wait time for brunch was very long, but well worth it! Best grits west of the Mississippi! Service was great, and the gluten free menu was a big hit with the gf members of my group.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
This place is THE busiest and most efficient restaurant that I have ever visited...  it is nothing short of amazing! The place is jam packed with an hour long wait on a Friday morning at 10:30. Fortunately I was a party of one and they seated me immediately at the bar..   oddly enough, the staff is probably the biggest thing that made an impression.... everyone was going 120 mph... and not in a bad way... just highly efficient and in control... they had everything nailed... no wasted motion here and they covered for each other...  all had GREAT attitudes!!
The black bartender was amazing to watch... very impressive!!! Oh yeah... now to the food... I wanted to try the gumbo... I would say it was a 3 out of 5... had better... seemed way too tomatoeey... was not piping hot. I also tried the Mac and cheese.... I am very picky on this Dish... again, it was ok... 3 our of 5. The lady next to me ordered a buttermilk chicken Sandwich that had gravy on it with a side of cheesy grits.   That looked fantastic... I would come back just to check it out!!  Looks like the are open till 2, then reopen for dinner at 5. If you come, parking is tight in the area and plan on quite a wait... I am glad that I came to check out this treasure!!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: Of all of the places I have waited a ridiculously long time to have brunch in, this was my favorite. With apologies to all the neighbors who have to wade through the crowd to get through their weekend mornings, this place is worth it.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
The fiance and I were in Portland for two days. We needed to figure out where we wanted to eat for the two days we were there. Bernie's was the first choice for southern comfort food, but the 1250+ reviews (mostly positive) for Screen Door were undeniable. We showed upon a Monday night. Patiently waited for about 15 minutes (when we were told it would be about a 40 min wait). We grabbed some whiskey and beer and soon enough were seated in the main dining area. 

Screen Door is a small, quaint joint - but bursting with personality and amazing food. We both chose the 'screen door platter' that gave you an option to choose 3 dished from the side menu and was served with corn bread. The food was delicious and the service was terrific. 

Next time you are in the Portland area, go get yourself to Kern and visit Screen Door for some comfort food! Try the buttermilk fried chicken. I hear it's the best item on the menu! Prost!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: The wait is long however, with any good place in Portland you will wait. The fried chicken is the best in town, it is a fun atmosphere and the staff is friendly!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
Honestly, it's the best restaurant I've ever been to. The food is always unbelievable, the service is great, and the food and drinks come out super fast. I always get a fried chicken dish - it's a must have. The fried chicken seasoning is to die for, every bite leaves a spice on your tongue that makes you craving another bite. I think about it all day. The pork and brisket are also amazing in their own right and the dipping sauces they come with could be a meal by themselves. The mashed potatoes could also be a meal of their own, so insanely buttery and delicious, they melt in your mouth and the gravy is the best complement. 
I never go to Portland without going to Screen Door, and no matter how long the line is, we get seated in a timely matter. Sitting in the waiting room with one of their delicious drinks (or even just a beer) is a lovely experience in itself. 
My advice to anyone is to arrive hungry and, while the appetizers are delicious (the hush puppies come with a perfectly spicy jam dipping sauce), you'll want to save room for the rest of the meal. I always wish I could have just one more bite of the fried chicken or the brisket, and every time I leave I can't wait to go back.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
Screen Door is one of Portland's staples for eating brunch. (FYI: they're also known for their dinner, but get more of a wrap for brunch since it's only exclusive on weekends) This Southern-influenced restaurant knows what's up when it comes to feeding masses of hungry Portlanders and visitors.

Notorious for?
- FRIED CHICKEN AND WAFFLES: Do you love fried chicken? Do you love waffles? Well you can order this dish and end up having it last you for two meals. Or if you like to be nice, you can share. I just say this because your dish is monstrous. With that, you get three pieces of delightful fried chicken which is very MOIST if I may add. And the waffles? If you love sweet potato, they make their waffles a sweet potato version. And this compliments the dish in the whole Southern essence that it is. You can't go wrong ordering this dish at all!!!!!!

- BLOODY MARY: I've never really been a Bloody Mary drinker until I had Screen Doors! I love how peppery their drink is. So simple and garnished with an olive and okra (to give that Southern essence). One of my favorites in my book! It's just as notorious as Tasty N' Sons Bloody Mary. (Which one is better? Depends on your taste palette).

- OYSTER BENEDICT: If you are a fan of eggs benedict, try their oyster version because it's quite delish! Served with a side of hash and fresh fruit. The hollandaise sauce is so rich and the oyster adds a bit of salt. You get this rich dish that is quite heavy - in the end your taste buds are thanking you that you ordered this dish. The oyster comes in a scramble version if those of you don't like benedict. 

- BANANA FOSTER FRENCH TOAST: If you have a sweet tooth and you like your breakfast sweet, then you may like the french toast! Make that the Banana Foster version! You can totally taste the rum-caramelized within the bananas. The French toast come in 4 colossal sized pieces which is accompanied with fresh fruit as well. I couldn't finish this dish either so it'll be nice to share as well. Or have two meals if you want to be greedy. 

I've never had a disappointing brunch here. I've actually had ordered what they are notorious for and love every single dish! And the service is phenomenal. You are well taken care of over here. Place is hustling and bustling. One of these days I have to try out their dinner fare. 

FYI: they open for brunch at 9 AM. And people start lining up around 830 AM. Plan accordingly. (Or send one person to hold your place in line and sleep in a little more and get there when it's closer to 9.) And parking is located on the street or neighborhood streets.

Come to Screen Door and check out the definite "YUM" factor!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
Screen Door is a must if you're in Portland and like southern food. If you already know that fried chicken, collard greens, mashed potatoes, and banana-toffee pie isn't you're thing--Screen Door will likely cause you to reconsider.  With that said, this restaurant is a little infamous, with its lines out and around the block it's become a sort of tourist destination.  My suggestion, order take out.  Get your fried chicken plate to go.  Grab a sweet tea while you're paying and waiting for them to box it up for you.  Southern comfort food is no less southern and a lot more comfortable when you're not waiting upwards of two hours from arrival to receiving appetizers. 

If you're dining in, try their cocktails they are just as delicious as you imagine them to be.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: Wow, this place was good.  We arrived at opening time - 5:30PM on a Monday - to find a line of people down the block waiting to get in.  Luckily, we managed to be one of the last parties to get a table in the first seating.  My wife and I both had the Screen Door Plate, where you got to pick 3 sides.  I had the mac&cheese, the jumbalaya, and the catfish, all of which were excellent.  My wife had 3 vegetarian dishes, which she really enjoyed.  We were somewhat skeptical going in, since we usually associate southern food with things we don't really like (fried chicken, chicken fried steak, etc.).  We easily found things on the menu that sounded and tasted great.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
Ate here for dinner instead of busybusy brunch. HOLEYY MOLLEEEY friieeeeeeed chicken. I loved loved loved the fried chicken and the creamy mashed potatoes. The portion is HUGE. I could not finish the whole thing even though I really wanted to :( sadface. My sister got the beef brisket. It was good but a bit overwhelming and heavy. We also had to get the mac n' cheese. Wish I had a second stomach or that the hotel had a fridge so I can scarf it down the next day while sitting on the floor pathetically. We ended the meal with a pecan pie and a couple of delicious mixed drinks - I got some fresh blackberry drink. 

Service was meh. We sat outside since it was nice and warm, but it took so long to get our order in, our food, our drinks, our check! Gah! Oh, and I wish they served the chix and waffles during dinner too. booo. Guess we have to come back for brunch!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: Waited in line for an hour, waited 30 minutes to order, and waited another 30 minutes to get our food.  We were here for about 3 hours just to eat brunch.  I have no problem waiting, but the food was just okay.  Pancakes were kinda hard, fried oysters were too fried for my taste.  The only thing that I would order here again is the Fried Chicken minus the waffles.  Next time would skip breakfast and just go for dinner.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
Waited for about 30 minutes on a Friday during lunch time. We were seated at the bar. The service was super friendly!

Praline Bacon - AMAZING CANDIED BACON. I didn't know what to expect but this was so good. We devoured it within minutes. Definitely get this if you come here!
Fried Chicken & Waffle - We were ambitious and got 3 pieces, but the pieces were HUGE! The waffle was good and went really well with the fried chicken. The fried chicken was seasoned with amazing flavors. It was lightly battered and fried so it didn't seem too heavy or oily which was good. 
Shrimp and Grits - Super fresh and big shrimp. The grits were creamy and flavorful. 

Will definitely need to come back because everything was SO GOOD.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: seriously.....those chicken and waffles are freakin' incredible!!! if there is a line just wait patiently.....you'll thank me!!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: I was really excited to go here, but I felt like in the end it was overhyped. The waffles weren't the best and the Fried Chicken was all right but didn't blow me away.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
Get ready to wait...and be delighted you did!
As a true Southern woman, I miss home cooking (and especially fried okra!) more than words can say. Life in the Pacific NW is wonderful but it is really missing some great cooking...until now. The Screen Door is some of the best real southern cooking I have found in a long time.

Slap your mama and cuss your gramma 'cause this is the best Southern cooking you will find ANYWHERE!

I'm droolin' like a fool already!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
Received the recommendation from the valet at the hotel and was not disappointed.  Started with the fried oysters and hush puppies both large enough to share. The house specialty is friend chicken (not KFC) mouth watering and just the right amount of breading.  Around the table we also tried "brisket" and "shrimp and grits" that also got high marks.  

Ambience was a loud, but that's Portland.  

downside was the parking (-1 star) as the street parking is the only option and very limited.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: If you asked me my favorite restaurant in Portland, I'm not sure but the Screen Door is definitely high on the list.  It's one of the few places I return time and time again because it's so dang good!  The staff is great...are they all co-owners or something because they all seem so friendly and happy and proud of what they're accomplishing there.  The menu is small, but everything on it is delicious, and there are daily specials to choose from.  My favorite is to get the plate of sides..it's so hard to choose from the 20 or so sides they have, whether I want cajun rice and beans, delicious mac n cheese, greens, or maybe some froo froo organic local produce.  I went there for brunch and it was amazing as well.  I got some sort of mixed drink called a brandy milk punch which was the tastiest brunch cocktail I've ever had.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
Went in on a Saturday afternoon for brunch for 3. About a 45 min wait but it's chill and you can grab a cup of coffee inside while you wait. We got the Oyster Po Boy, Chicken & Waffles and the Oyster Eggs Benedict which came with the cheesy grits. 

Everything was really good! I loved that the fried chicken wasn't greasy and the Oyster Po Boy was seasoned great!

The Oyster Eggs Benedict I thought would have oysters incorporated into the Benedict but was just 4 fried oysters on the side.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: Came here with my hubby, sister and brother in law. Place was very busy, good ambiance going on. Drinks came right away, I tried the Scarlet O'Hara. The fried chicken was great with yummy mashed potatoes and banoffee pie were fantastic. The whipped cream and crust were delicious. I would definitely recommend it as a great place to eat
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: Great fried chicken and hush puppies and corn bread!  Brunch also great!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
Loud, long wait.
Long to get food but that's okay.
Waitress repeatedly walked by my empty iced tea glass and never offered to refill.

Didn't offer husband second drink.

His meal not good- steak special.

My food was great except for gravy.

Hush puppies amazing.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: Waffles and Fried Chicken - portion size HUGE, chicken tastes amazing! It's worth the wait even on a rainy day. The biscuits and gravy is also really good!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
The wait for brunch is long, but, worth it! I love that pecan crusted bacon on a waffle, and the chicken and waffles. The mimosas were the perfect potency. 

Service is great, it's not their fault it's a long wait! I blame the delicious brunch.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
Good lord almighty! I need more room in my tummy. 

I must have recently awaken from my food coma. It was a little bit overwhelming for me. 

The other reviews are dead on when they said that the fried chicken is the bomb. It definitely is. I ordered the fried chicken cat head biscuit with gravy and potatoes. 

I thought I did order for myself but it looks like I can share it with another person. 

Our battalion of 18 people came in prepped by coming in early and the staff was more than welcome to accommodate us. They were fast and efficient. I believe there was already a line even before it opens. 

It feels like a Black Friday morning but instead of shopping for socks and whatnot, we were getting our food on. Real, good, delicious food. 

If you are coming in for the dining experience, I would suggest coming in early or you need Moses to part the sea of people waiting.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
A bit out of my neighborhood, but was told to try, as there have been good reviews about this brunch spot.  Had the chicken & waffles. It was alright. There are better spots in my neighborhood to get a good brunch.  This place is ok, but not for me.
I'm NOT a "wait in line" guy, but the service was ok.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
Don't get me wrong, the food is really good and probably the best place for southern food in portland. Have been before many years ago and remember waiting in a line for a long time for the privilege of getting a table.  This time, went with a party of 8 as we were out for birthday celebrations for 2 of the people in the party. Another person in the party grew up in the south and was really excited for the food.  Apparently, they ALLOW you to make a reservation if you have a large party which is good because the whole "wait in line for over an hour" thing is not something I am willing to do anymore, even if the food, donuts, ice cream or whatever is being sold is amazing.  

The place is small...I get why they don't take reservations ( I guess, maybe?) and we were a large party but from the moment we sat down until the time we left I got the impression from our waiter that he was just annoyed with having to serve a larger table.  Maybe he was just having an "off" night, but we were almost treated with an air of disdain and annoyance and he was really
 dismissive when I asked him a simple question about the menu. If you don't want larger parties in your restaurant, why allow the reservation to be made in the first place?

The place is packed, small and loud and this was on a sunday night at 5:30.  With so many awesome restaurants in Portland, I think I will spend my money elsewhere.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: 90 minute wait to be seated (full disclaimer-host had told us it would be about an hour and the crowd out the front door confirmed we'd be cooling our heels for some time) and then another 50 minutes before food was served once we'd placed our orders. In a city of great brunch places, not even a spectacular thumbs on the food ... And the food IS very good ... warrants this investment of time. #halffoodiedaymisspent
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: The biscuits and gravy and service at the bar yesterday were excellent!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
I was totally aware of the long wait this place has but even though we went on a Friday night, there was no sign of a line as we were seated quickly as we arrived. The place was nice and hip as they had a classic look of a restaurant with the old wooden chairs accenting the tables. 

They don't have the option of eating chicken and waffles but I was not going to let that deter me from having the chicken to which I was blown away by. It was clearly just chicken and mashed potatoes and trust me, this was not a mere helping of the two elements. They give you a good helping of potatoes to go along with a medium piece of boneless chicken as well as the GIANT piece of chicken breast. I saw two people share this very dish that I am describing but for a big guy like me, I thought I could take it down myself......I failed.

I had a good portion of the big piece of chicken left which made for a good breakfast the next day. My girlfriend had the "build your own plate" with a fried pork chop, mac and cheese, and Brussel sprouts and a cheddar biscuit. She nearly finished her plate as well so the mac n cheese was a great touch to my leftovers. 

We also had the cauliflower pancakes which were good but now that I know of the size of the plates, I wouldn't recommend getting an appetizer. 

This isn't a complaint but a serious note for anyone new coming here. The Lemonade is great (both the regular and the blackberry) BUT do realize this: It's 4 bucks a pop and they will tell you that even if you want a second glass. I didn't care because this was a first trip but for those that dont get that from their waiter/waitress, you have been informed.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
This review is based on multiple group take-out experiences @ Screen Door. After we finally brave the crowds to experience brunch on the scene, then I'll reconsider and write again to determine whether or not this truly is "As good as it gets" 5 star.


First, I and my entire group absolutely love their catfish. And their pan-fried chicken. The pullet of course is SO hyped I thought a let-down was probable, if not inevitable. Alas we got a huge order of it, and it was devoured instantly, as were the creamy, buttery taters and chicken gravy. Damn, how is it that ANYONE south of the Mason Dixon line lives past the age of 35, eating such victuals, even occasionally? After multiple trips through the south, and long before I discovered the Screen Door, I came to recognize southern cooking not as regional cuisine or even "really, really good" regional cuisine, but a gift from the heavens, bestowed on humanity for the ages. Screen Door does a very nice job bringing we in the PNW a very reasonable interpretation of that divine gift...


If lovin' Screen Door's brisket is wrong, I don't never, ever wanna be right. Like crushed velour, it tickled the senses, tickled the palate, then tickles your fancy. This is precisely the sort of slow cooked mastery that enables you to savor the meal hours, and perhaps even days later. Take a nice hot shower, or steam sauna, and you'll experience the meal anew, erupting through your pores....


I also loved Screen Door's vinegary, spicy, ham-infused Collard Greens. I for one am someone who never tires of eating his greens! SD's dirty beans and rice are also top notch. The mac n cheese, while good and even note-worthy, suffers from the saturation in the market we now see; EVERYBODY has what they think is off-the-chain mac-n-cheese. Very hard for anyone to separate from the pack and distinguish themselves w/this dish--- though my personal favorite @ the moment remains Pepper Box, w/the chorizo. Lawd a-mussy!


Screen Door's pulled pork and deep-fried pork chops are odd dogs out on the menu. Didn't care at all for either.... there are natural human limits, vaguely understood and forever unseen, but known by all of us instinctively to protect us from certain lines that just should never be crossed.  Will I get much resistance, or flak, for stating outright that deep-fried pork chops are just NO... not just a skirmish on the frontier, but a flagrant violation. It's sort of reminiscent of recent, very disturbing news stories about how numerous other countries are fully immersed in experimentation, cloning human-animal hybrids. Some lines you just DON'T cross, capisce? It's like tampering in God's Domain.... allow me to step AWAY, so the coming thunderbolts don't deep-fry me, too!    ;p


Someday soon we'll be coming by for that unbelievable brunch I've heard and read so much about. In the mean time, thanks so much to the Screen Door. Gotta go out, now, Christine McVie style 'n' sh*t... b/c Screen Door, what's to say but that you make lovin' fun.....
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
Had lunch here a few months back with my girl friends. The wait was extremely long and crowded. It was hard to hear the conversations amongst ourselves. The ambiance is very bohemian and dim. The food was very good and we had a nice brunch. 
Because the line us long you do feel rush to eat and leave. 
Nothing in particular stood out, aside from the fact we had a lovely time eating and enjoying each other company.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: Awesome!  I'm sure this has been said a million times, get the chicken and waffles (for the love of God share it) and the praline bacon.  We waited for about an hour to get in on Sunday morning but it was definitely worth it.  Its heavy food, but nothing will cure a night of drinking like a bloody mary and chicken+waffles.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
arrived @ 12:45pm on a sunday and waited an hour to be seated. thankfully there were seats available so it wasnt too bad. good for people watching :)

the cornbread was dry, not sweet, and kinda horrible. BUT, everything else was fantastic! best fried chicken i've ever had.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: The food? Ridiculous (as in good). Um, whatever! Seriously good food and very reasonable prices. We went for brunch and everyone at my table had amazing food and good service.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door
