text:
Hi delicious food, please let me eat you.

This was my last meal after an extended awesome trip to Portland.

We took it out, which made my day because the lines were ridiculous (and I had a red-eye to catch). 

My friend and I had a variety of food but I especially loved the mac and cheese.

The chicken was good but every time I order fried chicken, I remember that maybe I just don't love it that much. However, once i pealed off the fried part, the chicken was super fresh and very well cooked.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
Fried chicken is a pure five without question. I couldn't stop stealing bites from my husband.

I got the pecan trout, which was nice. A little dry but decently healthy. 

The wait time is long but thankfully accurate. 

I can't wait to go again!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: Don't Buy car from him, I bought a a cargo van from him for $10250 end of spending $8100 for few problems and at end sold it $5400
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
Wow, the portions are huge here - we made the rookie mistake of ordering 1 dish/person, when we could have split the chicken and waffles and been more than satisfied. The hype is real, so I won't belabor you with descriptions of chicken and waffles; this is well executed and flavorful food. Skip it if you don't appreciate waiting for brunch because there is no getting around that. We arrived at 8:30am on Sunday, and we just missed the first seating.

Also - they only take $1.50 off if you get the chix & waffles with 2 instead of 3 pieces - seems like a ripoff.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: Yes, there's always a line and, yes, you should go and put your name in anyway.  Biscuits and gravy or biscuits and blueberries are great choices. There's just too much to chose from that is all rich, heavy, and delightful.  My biscuit with blueberry was light and filling.  Great service, fun atmosphere. Parking on the street all around or just be a Portlander and bike there!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: I've been here quite a few items their chicken and waffles are good but I think it's a little over rated it's just a massive portion. What really does it for me here is their oyster eggs benny. Love it best benny in town.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
How do you say something that hasn't been said in the previous 692 reviews? One of my new faves. Dad loved it, although it turns out he still doesn't like okra, even if it's deliciously fried and served with perfect remoulade. Turns out I love Screen Door's okra more than any other in town.  

Delish drinks. Get there close to opening time, or you'll be waiting.  Screen Door goes on my list of solid favorites.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: Really good Southern food (especially considering how far we are from the South) at a good price. I'll definitely be back.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
Gaaawd screen door, 808, and heart coffee are the main reasons I miss living off of E Burnside.. Being able to just walk here and get my name on the list before everyone else for brunch was amazing. I am not like most people who seem to enjoy waiting in line for food. BUT regardless of the wait for brunch it is worth the wait.

I am not a huge fan of the Chicken and waffles - well actually just the waffles sweet potato *yuck* but the chicken.. omg the chicken is life. Shrimp and grits are fire. Drinks are delicious. Staff is friendly. Service is overall fast if you minus the wait time for a table.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
Ok. I think the fact that I have eaten at the Screen Door 3 times in less than two weeks should say something about the variety and quality of the menu. Not only do they have an outstanding selection for meat and vegi eaters, but they also have a rotating seasonal menu that changes every week. 

Overall: what more can a girl ask for than a roasted vegetable soup and french fries?
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: Point blank - best breakfast in the city. Obviously there's reason people choose to wait in line for over an hour. I recommend waking up early and doing what I did - getting there at 7:55am. They open at 9 but I had a party of 10 and I wanted to be sure we got in. We did. We were first. Service was fantastic and the food was orgasmic. I had the chicken and waffles and we ordered biscuits and gravy, cathead sandwich, juevos ranchero, eggs benedict, praline bacon (), bananas foster french toast and pineapple and vodka. It was amazing. Whatever your strategy to get it, do it. It might be the best fried chicken I've ever had. So worth it.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
Screen Door definitely doesn't disappoint!! We ordered Chicken & Waffle and the Biscuits & Gravy among 5 ppl. All dishes were well seasoned and very flavorful!! All positive can be said about their food with the exception of the gravy a lil too thick for my liking BUT oh so delicious!! 

I've had my share of Chicken & Waffles and put the Screen Door slightly over the top than the other places.I've tried. There are no choices of dark or white meat for the chicken, it's only a boneless chicken breast. In most places chicken breast can be dry but here it so juicy and the batter isn't saturated. It's very light and just delicious!! BUG PROPS to Screen Door for their EXCELLENT food and GREAT & FRIENDLY service!!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
Yum!

If you visit Portland, you must eat at Screen Door. It's a small restaurant in the Burnside neighborhood. No matter what time you eat here, get early and be prepared to wait online, outside or inside. Yes, the food is that good.

My family and I ate Sunday brunch here. We arrived at 8:40 am waiting for the 9:00am opening. A long line wrapped around the building had already formed! Promptly at 9, the doors opened and we were seated in a booth on the left side of the restaurant.

I knew I wanted to try the sweet potato waffles (sans the fried chicken-I heard it was good though). My parents ordered Oyster Benedict, my sister had Shrimp 'n grits, and I happily ordered sweet potato waffles topped with banana slices. Our food came out quickly and our waitress was efficient.

Everyone was happy with their food. My waffles were beautifully arranged on a white plate. They were fluffy, sweet potatoey, and delicious.   They have something for everyone on their menu, from the pickiest eaters. They also have a full bar so you can enjoy a libation with your meal. 

I would totally return to this restaurant when I return to Portland!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: Was able to visit this restaurant. We were lucky that we had to wait just a few minutes before getting a seat. All the tables were full and people were eating, drinking, and talking away. The atmosphere seemed welcoming and warm...we had the beef brisket, shrimp and grits, and fried chicken. The beef brisket and fried chicken was tender and juicy...made just right? The shrimp and grits...omg!! I know why it's an entree too. It's is so tasty and warm. We also had the sweet potato fries to start with. Just enough crunch and salt. Yum. I topped it off with 2 Old fashions. The first one had too much ice. I requested to have less ice on the second Old Fashion. The second one was just perfect.  Thanks to The Screen Door staff. The food and service was excellent too!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
There's a reason why this place is so crowded and why people are willing to wait for a table.

We came on a Sunday and they were so packed that they were no longer accepting people on their wait list. We wanted to try their food, so we decided to do take out. After studying their menu for a while, I picked the chicken and waffles. The fried chicken was very moist and tender, and eaten with the waffle and dipped in syrup - it was pure satisfaction! They give you three huge pieces of fried chicken and the waffle had a pumpkin flavor in it. The pumpkin was a nice surprise as pumpkin is my favorite! 

We also tried their apricot corn bread, scrambled eggs, potatoes and a brisket hash. Even though it was take out it didn't affect the quality of the food. It was all fantastic! 

We'll have to come earlier next time!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: Delicious food that is worth the wait. They have gluten-free and vegetarian friendly options. The portions are huge and the service good.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
Arrived for dinner on a weekend before 6. 

Plus: Staff were really friendly, both hostess and server. Water was always refilled and checking in with us often. 

Minus: Wait was about 90 minutes. No pager. No texting. Just make sure to be there in a  crowded and loud waiting area. 

Plus: Food was good. Not phenomenal. Ordered the mac, greens, catfish, hush puppies, beet salad, cornbread.

Neutral: Once seated, food and drinks were fairly prompt. Not Chinese food restaurant fast, but I never felt impatient. 

Minus: It's so loud. Like you have to raise your voice loud. This could be a plus for some but not for me. 

Overall: Would I eat there again? Maybe. I'd be happy to visit once the normal Portland hype wears off a bit. Not the best southern food in Portland, so I felt a bit robbed after the 90 minute wait and overly excited patrons talking the food up outside the restaurant. It was like I was waiting to get into an exclusive dance club or something. My go-to spot is a 15 minute wait max and food I feel is better and made with a little more love and effort.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
Ok I am a huge fan. the 1.5 hour wait however, man, that is tough!

Despite the long wait, I go back because I am a glutton for punishment. There is little you can do to improve on the ginormous chicken and waffles. I have tried many of the other brunch items here (none of them disappoint) but I keep coming back to the C&W. There is nothing like it. Down a few spicy bloodies while you wait (hopefully it's a sunny day so you can drink on the side walk), then when you're good and drunk and hungry, go in for the kill. You can share the dish because it's seriously enough to feed 3 but then you wouldn't have the left overs for later. Besides, I don't share. If you want to eat what I am eating, then you should've ordered it, ya bastard!

I have yet to venture there for dinner because really, this type of heaviness after 3pm might kill a girl. But I think I might have a death wish soon to venture over for dindin.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
Honestly, not sure it's worth the wait?!

The food is delicious, the staff are all friendly and patient and the wait time from ordering to arriving is timely.  I would come again but be more strategic about making sure to eat snacks and planning to do something between putting in name and seat time.  The guy was very accurate about when we'd get seated so that is helpful and manages ones expectation.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
Amazingly moist chicken, piled high on perfect waffles.

But come EARLY. The line is no joke!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: What is there not to like besides the ridiculously long wait. There is NOTHING bad on the menu, but I highly recommend the fried chicken and greens. On a scale of 1-5 stars - 10 stars!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
Day two in Portland.  Screen Door came highly recommended.  For breakfast, I should add.  We planned to arrive promptly at 9am, we heard the line usually extends out the door & around the corner.

Arriving 20 minutes after our original target, (thank you road closures due to the Grand Floral Parade) the line was out the door, but we were quickly and cheerfully seated.  

Portions are large!  They know how to prepare a scramble.  No brown, overcooked eggs here.  My Sausage & Apple version had he right amount of seasonings, a bit of rosemary rounded out one of the best breakfast dishes I've ever eaten.  Roasted Potatoes on the side, and there was no way I could eat it all, but thoroughly enjoyed trying.  A few bites of the Traditional Eggs Benedict, then the Biscuits & Gravy of my breakfast mates, all good and we left with happy tummies.  

P.S.  good coffee too!  And our server was accommodating & with personality+ !
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: If you want to enjoy a good breakfast and good service This is the perfect place. I have visited it twice and I have always been very satisfied with the food the service and the prices.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: Great place for a filling brunch!  Be prepared to wait, but there is a reason the place is so popular.  A filling brunch for two was around 30 dollars with drinks, making this a reasonably priced meal.  Don't be turned off by sitting at the bar, it offers a great view of the kitchen and great service to boot.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: My friends and I had to wait an hour just to sit and eat, but I guess it was worth it. I chose the beef brisket and it was delicious. The meat was musky and ready for tearing and the rest was history. I can say I finally ate here.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
The service time is unreal.   My friend had time to raid two Pokémon gyms before our food came out.   

My experience started with a 40 minute wait.   That is ok considering how it was a busy lunch time.   After being seated and having out order taken it took a staggering hour for the food to come out.    This would be more reasonable if the food was something really special and extravagant, but for a small menu of pretty standard items it is ridiculous.   

The food tasted ok, but it wasn't anything I would write home about or tell a friend to go out of their way for.   I get that it is a neighborhood eatery with a small vibe, but it certainly left lots to be desired.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
This place is true to the hype. Visiting from la with my wife and we loved everything we had except the corn bread.

I had the fried chicken breast sammy, with the gumbo. 
 who knew I would come to Portland and get some of the best fried chicken I've ever had. Crispy, perfectly seasoned and while you're eating fried good, you still feel like it's clean because they clean the chicken well not leaving unnecessary fat all over it. 

Gumbo deep rich flavor.

My wife's rockfish sammy was great, spicy, perfectly cooked and moist. Cornbread was a little dry and dense. Coming back for another sammy before I head to the airport.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: First time here and it was incredible.  Best fried chicken.   Best fried green tomatoes with pork belly (appetizer special).  But what really sets this place apart is the staff.   Easily the most friendly and attentive staff I have had serve me in recent memory.   We will be back and often.  The wait was worth it but it might be time for a second location.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: Amazing service! Best Mac n cheese I've ever had! Authentic southern food! Great prices! Clean! Friendly! Neat environment! Street parking available!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
I've been here twice, both on a Friday evening. The first time I came to this Southern Style restaurant, it was around 8pm. There was a huge wait in the waiting area and it may have taken about 30-40 minutes to be seated. 

I ordered the fried chicken with mashed potatoes and collared greens. The fried chicken was a delight and the mashed potatoes were delicious. The collared greens were too bitter for my liking, i'm assuming the flavor is an acquired taste. One thing that it really unique to this restaurant is that they have an organic food menu that is changed weekly depending on what is available through the local growers. I ordered the sauteed broccoli with melted butter and cheese. OH MY GOD, this dish was AMAZING. I love broccoli, and am usually pretty picky as to how it's prepared. This tasted so great and flavorful.

The second time I came to the restaurant I opted to order for take out which was a great idea--didn't have to wait as long for tables to be available! I ordered the Catfish with mashed potatoes and macaroni & cheese. The catfish was fried so nicely and had very great flavor. The mashed potatoes were once again delicious and the macaroni & cheese had a unique flavor, as it wasn't the traditional cheddar cheese that was used. 

All in all, I would come here again. Depending if I was in a time crunch or not, I would either wait or order out. My recommendation to others who are inclined to try Screen Door is to be mindful of what time you go. I would recommend around 5 or 6pm on weekend evenings to get passed the weekend rush.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: This place is incredible!!!   Yes you will wait in line   And yes you will be amazed    I had chicken and waffles for the first time in my life here   I was blown away    Best breakfast in the city   Possibly best on earth!!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: Went when they first opened and were squeezed in at the bar (no wait yay!) very happy. One other time with a group that had made reservations Happy! Had not been back in a while since I don't like hanging around o the side walk for an hour! had a large party but it was last minute & could not call early enough for a reservation. They were very accomadating and the Host(ess) called me a couple of times to keep me in the loop. If you ever had to herd a group of 8-10 cats (my hungry friends) you can imagine the challenge. Every single person thanked me for taking the lead and picking the spot because the food was delish and the service friendly. We had to wait a bit when we arrived but that was due to the previous diners camping at the table forever. Our large party was served quickly and orderly with great fried chicken, steak, sides and the Jambalaya got raves too! well done!! Pleasing so many people is no easy task!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: Ridiculous.  Dinner and hungry family full satisfied with hush puppies, slaw, trout pecan, fried chicken, mashed and fingerling potatoes, Mac and cheese.  All southern perfect.  Wish we lived nearby instead of Minnesota!  And... I hear brunch is even better.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
I discovered Screen Door in June of 2011 shortly after arriving in Portland; my soon to be new home. It was love at first bite for me and this restaurant continues to be my very favorite eating establishment. Purely divine Southern comfort food. The place is always packed as is expected. One try and you'll be hooked too. This restaurant needs no favorable review from me for their awesome food. Everyone in town already knows how good it is. That's not why I'm writing this review. Six weeks after I arrived in Portland I met an amazing fella and of course I had to introduce him to Screen Door. He loved this place as much as me. He died two years and a month after we met and fell in love. I continued to go to Screen Door after he died.....alone. The owner David and ALL the staff were so extremely kind to me comping my entire dinner on many occasions. I went there again tonight and completely unexpectedly my dinner was again on the house. This place is not just a restaurant. Having lived in the South for 30 years, it epitomizes Southern hospitality with food and kindness. If you haven't been yet, you don't know what your missing.

A forever loyal customer; thank you so much,

Coleman Nagy
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: Good brunch! Love the country grits! They make an awesome leftover breakfast or lunch. The line is worth the wait!

text: LOVE this place!!!  The food is fantastic-breakfast and lunch. I honestly cannot say that I have ever had bad service here-which is almost unheard of!  Sat at the bar to eat breakfast on a Saturday morning and I'm telling you the bartender ROCKED IT!!  He was amazing to watch put out his orders of drinks as well as take food orders. The only drawback can be the lengthy wait time but like me, I know many other people like this place so it is to be expected.

text: Be prepared to wait - but the wait is worth it!  Great southern food :)  So many good things I wanted to try on the menu~  I had the fried green tomato BLT and my boyfriend had the fried chicken piled high on top of waffles (I can't remember the official name).  But both were oh-so-good!  Tons of people, great energy, and you leave with a happy stomace~  Only one criticism...for a southern restaurant their Sweet Tea is not that great~  Tasted like a Lipton to me :p

text: Screen Door is very good. Everyone loves it, and so it won't disappoint. Personally, I'm into what they're serving too, but it may never be worth the wait. text: Oh my God! The fried chicken is the best!!! Mike the host is great.  Great service, great restaurant.  So good you will think you are in the South.

text:
i really really want to give the screen door 4 stars, but after our recent dinner experience i cannot.
brunch/breakfast definitely gets 5 stars!! chicken n waffles, nothing better!! really, anything on the breakfast menu, you can't go wrong with.
dinner on the other hand, totally unimpressed. at the table we had the pulled pork sandwich, fried chicken, and a burger. the pulled pork was eh. the chicken was eh, and the burger average.
like many other people have stated, you will more than likely have to wait for a table. we have found, that if you arrive 45min-1hr after opening, you'll hit the first round of tables leaving, and get seated quite quickly. brunch or breakie on a weekend though...your bound to wait an hour easy.

text:
I figure it takes me a year to finally get in here for some fried chicken, whats another 20 minutes in line in the rain?

text:
Ate here last night...had to wait in line to get in.  Ordered the beef brisket, with a hush puppy appetizer.  The brisket was so tender, no knife was needed.  And the sauce very flavorful.  One person in our party had the shrimp and grits...loved it.  And another had fried chicken.  Also heard the collard greens were awesome.

We used to live in the south, and I would say that Screen Door had better southern food than most of the ones in the South.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
I've been going to the Screen Door for quite some time, patiently waiting in line and it's been enjoyable, with the exception of my recent visit. I was surprised by my brother who flew in from Dallas, TX and double surprised when I thought we were going to the store only to go to the Screen Door where my grandloves, daughters and their spouses were waiting. It was a surprise birthday dinner party only to be treated horribly by the hostess from hell!
When we arrived, my granddaughter who is 16 went in to say we are here. The horrible hostess yelled at her saying "We don't seat unless everyone is here and you will lose your reservation!" My family was finding parks and let out everyone while they parked, as there is no "real parking space" only neighborhood. We were a party of 13 but my husband was still finding park and horrible hostess said, "Either you take your reservation now or you lose it!" So we sat down thinking it should be no issue to add on two chairs. When my hubby found the park and he and my grandson came in, we asked to add a chair, but here comes horrible hostess on a mission to recite, "I said you all have to be here, I will see what I can do." The table next to us connected eyes with me and shook their head. Horrible hostess set up a table on the other side of the restaurant which my brother and grandson sat at so I could sit with my husband. There was a great couple behind me who suggested that they were willing to move to the table so we could be together. I thanked them and told our waiter (by the way the waiter, Matthew, was amazing and did his best to be very kind compared to the evil horrible hostess). Matthew told the horrible hostess that the couple were willing to move, and by her actions and look on her face, she was not having it! She came to the couple and told them they don't have to move, as if we asked them. The couple told her they want to move and she was so nice to them and accommodating like they were royalty. Then she immediately turns to me and said, "Now look, in the future, if you all are not here they are not going to be seated, you have to all be here!" I was stunned at her attitude and bit my tongue because at this point, I was fed up with her attitdue and my family and myself just felt she had issues with people of color. She was mean, rude and made our table a spectacal as each time this person went into her rage it drew attention. Shame of her and her nasty attitude. Thank goodness for our waiter as my children felt she did not destroy our joy....nasty nasty horrible hostess! My last visit as I can't patronize places with racist, mean and nasty people I'd rather spend my money where I feel welcome!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
Good Food. Pretty decent service. 
But like all the hip places in Portland, the wait is horrendous and filled with hipsters. Which I am becoming increasingly annoyed with.
Another typical trendy restaurant annoyance is the squeezed in seating... why not pull a few tables out? We're all waiting 1hr+ anyhow... I'd rather wait and sit comfortably than cramp into a crowded dining area. 
There are tons of booths though, which is cool. 
Bloody mary's are delicious and so are the eggs bene
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
Okay... I had to give it another chance. 

I tried the screen door plate again (choice of 3 sides and a piece of cornbread) with the chicken wings, summer squash + quinoa salad (special), and chicken + andouille gumbo.

4 PIECE CHICKEN WINGS: W o w. AMAZING. I don't even know what else to say. Four huge chicken wings perfectly juicy and crispy... my mouth is watering at the memory of it LOL. I can't remember what kind of rub was on it, but it was a dry spice rub that left the chicken looking almost black... but it was so flavorful and packed with punches of flavor!!! DEFINITELY RECOMMEND.

CHICKEN + ANDOUILLE GUMBO: It was tasty, but honestly forgettable. i remember it being tasting a little bland (but maybe that's because everything else on my plate was super super flavorful? idk). I probably wouldn't order this again. 

SUMMER SQUASH AND QUINOA SALAD: I don't know when they'll ever have this again because it was on their local/organics menu, but honestly it was SOOOO GOOD. All the veggies were super fresh and complemented well with each other but the cherry on top was the refreshing chili lime vinaigrette that it was dressed with. OMG. Amazing. I DEFINITELY recommend choosing from the local/organics menu if you end up ordering this plate because I think they update that menu pretty frequently and use the freshest ingredients!!! 

I came in a lil hangry after waiting almost 1.5 hours to get in... had super low expectations.... and I was dumbstruck at how delicious it all was. I dream about the food here now. Amazing.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
Good but not worth the wait.

A lot of vegetarian options.  I got 

Mac and cheese = okay
Broccoli au gratin= delicious
Sweet potato with burnt kale= good not great
Cornbread = okay
Beef brisquit = delicious.
Fried okra= good

Price was $50 for two ppl.

Servings were huge.  Service was friendly.  Ambiance was dark and sexy.  We sat on patio with heat lamps.

Overall, I'll come back if there's a30 min or less wait.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
In a nutshell....

The chicken and sweet potato waffles, DA BOMB!

Mac N Cheese, THE BEST!

Garden Grits, COOKED AND SEASONED TO ABSOLUTE PERFECTION!

Coffee while you WAAAIIITTTT, a pleasurable brew...strong and flavorful but not bitter which will be MUCH NEEDED with the ridiculous wait to be seated, but stick around because it's well worth it and if you're party isn't too large and you are flexible with your seating desires...inside, outside, bar seating...you will be feasting a little sooner than others. The wait staff is friendly, attentive, and prompt with the service which keeps the tables turning as they should. Truly the best southern cuisine in Portland!!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
Came here for brunch on a recent trip to Portland. Sure glad we got here early (before the restaurant opened) to avoid waiting too long. 

We ordered and friend chicken sandwich and the corned beef hash - OMG they were delicious!!!! I'm currently having trouble writing this review without salivating. Let's start with the chicken. I have had fried chicken from just about every city I've visited in the US...and so far...this has been the best. Prior to visiting Screen Door, I read Yelp reviews from other people making this same claim and I was skeptical, but now I'm a believer. The chicken is so moist, perfectly seasoned and really crispy. This "sandwich" consisted of a biscuit with fried chicken smothered in country gravy. Yum yum yum. Ok, on the the corned beef dish...consisted of fresh chunks of corned beef, potatoes, and red cabbage tossed in a creamy horseradish sauce. Again, soooo good. 

Service was also great. Come dive in to fried chicken heaven.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: This is always a must for us anytime we are in Portland! One thing to keep in mind- YES! There has always been wait each time we have gone (usually weekend brunch times) with that being said, it's weeelll worth the wait! You can usually get in quicker if you're okay with outside terrace. It's covered and heated!!! This place is so good that it is the ONLY place that my husband will eat any pork... the Praline Bacon, to die for! When I remind him it's pork. He tells me nope, this bacon is in a category of its own!! Chicken and waffles are uh-mazing! The portion sizes are large too!! I always come home with to go boxes!! If you haven't been yet. You must try!!!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
Whatever you do, please don't tell my husband how much I miss this place since we've moved out of Portland. I mean, he's southern...AND he's a great cook...but oh, how miss the Screen Door.

Their fried chicken is spectacular (and enough for a second meal to take home). The breakfast eggs benedict with spinach...ooohhhh....The Chicken and Waffle has got to be one of the most glorious visions of tasty food excess I've ever witnessed.

Definitely check the specials board for new and wonderful goodies. Once they had creamed spinach, and after having it, I always checked the board hoping it would return.

And there's nothing better to wash down a gluttonous southern feast than a hurricaine...or the classic, a SoCo and Coke.

So when's the next time I'll be returning to Portland for a visit? Sometime in July/August? (insert visual of sad tear running down my cheek here...)
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: Oh my god---- after the trek from having to park 12 miles away we made it! SO worth the walk/ short wait. The staff was amazing, food was delicious and really enjoyed our breakfast! We will definitely be back!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
I didn't understand how a brunch-specialty restaurant could have 4K reviews  at 4.5 stars on Yelp. But after I tried their Fried Chicken and Waffles, I'm a damn believer.

We were visiting Portland for MLK weekend and when you're traveling, you just want to eat at the best places you can in the shortest amount of time (aka stuff the shit out of yourself).

We were half-full when we arrived at Screen Door, so we tried not to order too much. We ordered the Fried Chicken and Waffles, and the Hush Puppies.

I've had a plethora of fried chicken from all over North America, and I am certain and 100% confident that Screen Door has the BEST fried chicken I've ever had. You can even see little specks of flavorful pepper and spices in the fried batter of their delicious juicy white meat chicken. Yea you heard right-- WHITE MEAT. 

I could go on with this review about the Chicken. It is best paired with their hot sauce (a non-labeled vermillion sauce on every table). Waffles were great too-- golden, crispy, and delectable after being drizzled with syrup

The hush puppies were alright-- they didn't stand out to me as much as the fried chicken did, but they were basically fried cornbread with syrup.

Overall, I would recommend this place to anyone. Locals, out-of-towners, fried chicken lovers, etc-- you're in for a freaking treat. 

Only regret is that I didn't try other dishes here :(
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: The food was fantastic! I had the chicken and waffles and the blood orange mimosa to accompany and I couldn't have been happier with my choice. My boyfriend had the beef brisket hash and that was even better than my breakfast, so I had a little food envy there. I'd love to give this place 5 stars, but the server is the reason I'm taking one away. From right when we sat down, he acted as though serving us was the biggest inconvenience. In which case, he should have given someone else the table. I still tipped 20% because I can't not, it's a flaw *shrugs* but I certainly wouldn't want him to be our server again. Overall, would recommend in the hopes that everyone else gets a more pleasant server than we did.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
Surprisingly impressed with the signature chicken and waffles for brunch, but shocked by the wait time on a weekend - even for Portland. I've never been a fan of chicken and waffles but decided to give it a try since that's what they are known for and it was delicious. I can't say I liked the waffle/chicken combination but they were both individually good and you avoid the decision of a savory or sweet brunch. The waffle was spiced with cinnamon and the chicken was fried to perfection.

I know brunch is busy in Portland and am used to waiting for ~1 hour for brunch but we had to wait almost 2 hours to be seated which was quite ridiculous. We were so ravenous by the time we were seated our eyes were bigger than our stomachs and we each got the 2 piece chicken and waffles. We were unable to finish all the chicken and were not hungry for the rest of the day. So, come early and come hungry!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: The bestest,most delicious breakfast I've had in a long time! Didn't know what to expect but when I saw the long lines and carefully watched the dishes being delivered to other tables I knew I was in for an amazing meal! Ordered the chicken & waffles (2 pieces) and soon discovered it was more than I needed! The chicken was moist the coating pertey crunchy but the waffle is what put it over the top-crisp,flavorful I could've ate 1more! We ordered a side of the bacon coated with praline-at first I was like what is this? But OMG its like crack sooooo good LOL staff was friendly and always attentive to making sure we were filled with coffee which I always appreciate
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: Amazing! The shrimp grits were especially good but we got the chicken, pork chops and steak all of which were delicious! Try to get a booth because the table in the middle are small/cramped and people were bumping us while walking through.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
They only have chicken and waffles for breakfast time. Was a little bummed, but didn't matter too much since we still got to order the fried chicken. Was good, crust wasn't too heavy and was well seasoned, but definitely overpriced for very mediocre food.
Our waitress was really rude and was low key disrespectful to us and knew it, and it's not like we did anything to warrant that kind of attitude/behavior. We just sat down and ordered our food like any of the other customers but she was full of sass. Wouldn't come back. Definitely overrated.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
We stopped by Screen Door for Sunday brunch and as expected, super busy. We waited about 1.5 hours for a table.. but very worth the wait.

A must: chicken and waffles.. appeared on everyone's table! Other dishes we shared were: Cathead Biscuit Sandwich, Asparagus Omelette, Blueberry & Lemon Curd Buttermilk Pancakes, Bananas Foster French Toast, and Lowcountry Breakfast Shrimp & Grits.

Everything was delicious! The gravy on the biscuit sandwich was bomb and the French toast pieces were huge and fluffy! The chicken and waffles is legit, and large portion too - so very shareable if you want to try other things. I'm not a huge pancakes person but the blueberry & lemon curd pancakes were quite good.

Definitely a good idea to try to go early if you don't want to wait as long as we did.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: Came here for breakfast with a group of people and had a great experience!! The drinks were great I tried the mimosa and then the heaven to Betsy and a sip of a friends Bloody Mary. I ended up ordering the Texas veggie migas and it was delicious!! A huge serving that ended up as leftovers for later in the day and still great after the microwave. My bf got the biscuits and gravy with the mushroom gravy it was great as well! Will definitely be back for some more
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: I wish I had another stomach. I'll keep this brief - get there early. We arrived at about 530pm and the place was almost full (they open at 5pm). By the time we left at 720pm the waiting area was packed and spilling onto the wet sidewalk. Let's talk about the food- Amazing smoked fried chicken wings. Crunchy and moist catfish. The cheesiest Mac and cheese with a crispy topping. A gumbo I could never believe existed - what is the base for this bowl of heaven??? (Recipe please?) not to forget the lovely crumbly garlic cheddar biscuit that came to my plate without asking. (We had ordered the Screen Door platter/plate $17 + some extra for the meats) I'll reserve commentary for the cauliflower au gratin since it was not the star of tonight but I still ate it all. And last thing to mention was the shrimp and cheesy grits- O. M. G.!!! We got this as an appetizer and I wish I could have licked the bowl - is that so wrong? I can't wait to come back. We didn't do the bourbon flights but for your enjoyment this is what was being poured tonight. It looked good and I don't even like bourbon. I tried to keep this short.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: Food is not really 100% southern not really impressed, it was good but not worth the hype.

text: I spent 6 years in the south and this is the first place I have found in Portland that rivals good southern/Louisiana-inspired cooking. SOOO good!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
This place always has a line out the door because the food is quite good and they don't take reservations. Depending on the weather and time of day, your time in line might be a breeze or a slog. I would say the food is probably worth it, but I've waited 35 minutes for a table, no joke. Service inside is usually very good. They do have order pickup and delivery services too.

However, the food is decadent and so very flavorful. For brunch try the praline bacon, biscuits & gravy, fried chicken & waffles, or shrimp & grits. There's no diet food within these walls and it's amazing. Few places in Portland do southern food justice, but Screen Door, with their variety of dishes, generous portions, and overall quality excels in this arena. The smoked chicken andouille gumbo, hushpuppies, and collard greens are all excellent starters/sides. BBQ is good but not the best in the city.

Carve out a chunk of time, wear comfortable shoes and pants, and enjoy the southern-ness.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
DEFINITELY WORTH!! This is my first time trying chicken and waffles and the hype is totally worth it. Every time I pass this place, there's always a lot of people waiting, so I wanted to try it out. Finally got the time to try this place out and it was beyond good! Though there was a wait, it was worth the wait for sure. 
My friend and I shared the chicken and waffles meals, and added on the sweet potato fries and praline bacon. The sweet potato fries were perfect and the praline bacon had the right amount of maple sweetness, smoked taste, and overall good flavoring. My friend and I enjoyed everything about the food.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food

text:
This was one of the places I was most looking forward to when visiting Portland. I read the reviews on how the line and wait can be pretty long, so I wanted to get there a little bit before opening (9am) in hopes that it wouldn't be too bad.

Given we were on vacation, and had done a quite a bit of bar hopping the night before, we didn't get there quite as early as we'd hoped but only about 5 mins prior to opening. When we drove up, the line was already around the corner. My husband, not a big fan of waiting in lines for ANYTHING, wanted to find another place to eat. I quickly pulled up a picture of their chicken and waffles, and he was all in. 

They opened promptly at 9 am and sat just about everyone in line, which was pretty cool. Tip: it may be hard to come with a larger group, and since it was just us two, we were able to get seated right away. 

Given that we were pretty far back in the line, it took awhile for our food to get to us. But waiting inside with a hot cup of coffee beats standing outside in the cold in November any day. 

My husband ordered the chicken and waffles, of course, and I opted for the shrimp and grits. 

Put me back in line - for however long. I'd wait for hours for brunch here any day.

By far, the BEST shrimp n grits I've ever had! And his chicken and waffles was simply perfection. The sweet potato waffle added a nice unique touch that I haven't seen with other chicken and waffle places. 

The portions are huge, the line is long, the staff is friendly, and the food is so damn good. 

Do it.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: Fans!  We've been in Portland about a month and have hit the Screen Door about 5x already.  Not sure we are huge fans of the breakfast (just way too much food!), but the dinners are excellent.  Our favorite is to do the Screen Door Plate which allows you to try several of their wonderful choices.  Big fans of: catfish, chicken, coleslaw, mashed potatoes, salads.  Pretty much can't go wrong!  There's always a wait though - so be prepared to exercise patience!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
Honestly, the best Chicken and Waffle I have ever eaten. The chicken is fried to perfection (crunchy skin and a chewy/tender meat beneath the skin). The waffles are very unique in the sense that they are made with sweet potatoes. I'm convinced that more restaurants should use a similar sweet potato mix ingredients in their waffle batters. Both times that I have come here, the servers have been super nice and friendly! 

The wait can be incredibly long, especially during brunch hours (even on weekdays). I have come right at opening both times, but by the time I am leaving, the amount of people waiting at the door has become to multiply.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: I was born and raised in North Carolina.  This is my go to place for authentic southern cooking.  In fact, I would say it's better than anything I ever had back east.  I usually order the Screen Door plate with the chicken drumsticks, mac and cheese, and mashed potatoes with gravy (comes with biscuit).  It's perfect comfort food.  It's pricey but it's also a LOT of food.  Always end up getting another meal out of it at home the next day.  There's no reservation system which stinks but if you get there about 10 minutes before it opens you can get a seat easily most days on the weekends.  During the week I've never had an issue getting seated almost immediately.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: Amazing. Affordable. Excellent service. Outstanding desserts. You must eat here. Worth the wait!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: Very good food. However we had to wait over 30 minutes to get it. People all around us were getting served. It was very frustrating that The waiter didn't realize this and we had to say something .
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: Super yummy southern fried chicken, grits, biscuits! Busy with locals you may have to wait but worth it. Hope to return next visit to Portland.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: So much black pepper!!!  It was pretty much the only flavor of all the different savory dishes our party of 5 tried.  The quality of the food seemed good and was plentiful, and the molasses sauce for the hush puppies was great...but holy black pepper!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: Food was bomb.  I didn't expect it to live up to the hype, but it 100% did.  I went for my birthday and my boyfriend was sweet enough to go wait in line while I was home getting ready so it was a totally awesome experience for me:)
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: I can see why this place is so popular- the food is delicious!!!! The fried oyster sandwich was so delicious,  though the roll is a bit overwhelming and I had to pull some of it off. The shrimp and grits were also yummy, but the star of the show was the praline bacon. Holy moly, is that one amazing recipe for bacon! 3 pieces in an order, and we shared it among 3 of us.  I would go back just for that, but would also want more fried oysters!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: This was a great find during our visit in Portland. They were pretty busy when we got there on a Sunday morning at 10AM with a line out the door and people waiting around outside. Their brunch was good and tasty. Since they were busy I was afraid the service would be bad and the food would not be as good but it was definitely worth the wait. I got the eggs sardou and a glass of their rosé. It was really good and I would definitely have it again and go back and eat there again.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: One of my top 5 restaurants in all of Portland.  The queue is long, always, but it is ABSOLUTELY worth the wait.  The food is incredible.  The wait staff are friendly, lovely, and original people.  When I say original, I mean that they are genuinely unique individuals who add so much character to this Portland institution.  The restaurant has rustic utilitarian interior with an open kitchen.  The food and wait staff make the sometimes chaotic atmosphere seem almost peaceful. This is comfort food at its finest.  Screen Door, please marry me.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: My wife and I had the opportunity to sit at the bar and watch the bartender M work like a machine to get all the beverages made and take the orders at the bar. Not only did the bartender take care of all the patrons, when a break finally came the bartender was also running dishes out from the kitchen and busing tables. All the food looked amazing on the menu and the recommendations from M were spot on. We had great  cocktails and great food. My wife had a sampler meal of the salads and side dishes compromising of the fried catfish, a beet and cherry salad, and gumbo. All were top notch! I had the brisket which was melt in your mouth good with two house made sauces. I would say the sauces are fantastic! Normally, we would not indulge in dessert, but tonight we did. The custard pie with berries and whipped cream. It was luck the plate good!  Highly recommended based on how hard everyone in the restaurant worked to get everyone served and to accommodate tables that were much larger than just us two!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
My Airbnb host highly recommended this place to us. And told us that this was a "must try" in Portland. The restaurant opened at 5:30pm on Friday for dinner. We arrived at around 5:45pm. And there was already a line. OMG

I had the shrimp and the grit. It must have been the best that I had ever had. The jumbo shrimps were sautéed with a tomato-based sauce. The shrimps were fresh and full of flavors. They were not fooling you when they said that the shrimps were jumbo ones. The shrimps were huuuuuuuge. And the grits simply tasted amazing with a creamy texture and a really "cheesy" flavor, literally lol. 

I wish my stomach had enough room to try their dessert menu. Everything looked fantastic.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
Screen Door blows any southern food I've had (in the PNW) out of the water! It was absolutely fantastic and i will be dreaming about my fried chicken and sausage gravy biscuit sandwich for at least a month. 

Be prepared to wait, especially on the weekend, because Screen Door doesn't take reservations. My friend and I arrived at 9:10am on Saturday (they open at 9) we waited for about 15 minutes and got seated in the first wave once they opened. Otherwise, be prepared to wait 30ish minutes, but breakfast tables turn over pretty quickly. 

There's ample street parking around the restaurant area you just might have to work a little to find it. It's well worth it, though! My fried chicken was not too breaded, well seasoned and perfectly crispy. The sausage gravy was think and delicious, and the biscuits were absolute heaven. The menu boasts the sandwich is the size of a cat's head and they were NOT lying. Plus it comes with cheddar grits so you won't leave hungry. My friend got the shrimp and grits which had a rich seafood flavor and I would also highly recommend. 

If you're craving southern food in the PNW give Screen Door a try! I will definitely be coming back.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
I am from out of town and this place was highly recommended by a friend. At 9:45 on an early October Friday morning, I got a table for two (ended up being at the bar) after 30 minutes of waiting. 

Another 30 minutes later I got my 1 piece chicken and waffles entree. The portion size was generous!

The sweet potato waffle was delicious and my wife agreed after taking more than a few bites (hands off woman! ). And the chicken...yooooooo...it was probably the best fried chicken breast I've ever had. The buttermilk batter was crunchy and the meat was flavorful! 

I'm going to say this dish beats Roscoe's famous Chicken and Waffle (I'm from Los Angeles) by a mile y'all!!!

Service at the bar was good too, bro behind the counter kept our glasses full the whole time.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: Best fried chicken ever! It's pretty loud inside but there is an outside patio if that bothers you. Great comfort food, great service!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: Big fatty meal. Really long line. Bacon.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: Amazing!! Such good food- awesome environment! Even during COVID the outside seating is great!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
This place does food right. I wanted to deduct a star for the dolt in the plaid shirt that seats people, wow what an idiot... But once you get past him and his buffoonery, you'll forget all about it when your food comes. I went with the fried chicken biscuit and gravy. Their fried chicken was out of this world, from how juicy and tender it is to the breading they use and the crispy perfection. Biscuits and gravy were on point, no complaints with either. Everything was very fresh and hot. My meal came with their cheesy grits, not a huge grits guy, but they were pretty good. My other half went with the fried chicken and waffles, I tried it and thought it too was delicious. We also ordered a side of their praline bacon. A lot of people raved about this, I was not a huge fan. I scraped off most of the praline coating and to me it tasted a lot better.

From the time we parked until we left the place took about two hours. I hate waiting anywhere and will usually complain, but if I can manage, then anyone can. The food was cheap for what you get and the overall quality of it. I'd definitely eat here again.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: Beyond the wait, unless you get there early enough, the food is decent. I feel like this is a place to be seen waiting in line vs just going for some good food. I don't feel like it's the best breakfast spot in town but it seems to be more of a fad and that is annoying. Good food overall. Just not that impressed. Our waiter was hardly at our table, small confined seating and very warm inside..
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: We were visiting Portland one week and my wife wanted to take me here. So thankful I was able to experience the deliciousness of Screen Door! First off, we arrived early in the morning and the place was already buzzing with people. Luckily the were able to sit us down within 5 minutes. I was eyeing people's plates the moment I walked in. Everything there looked like something I had to try. We decided to go with the praline bacon (strongly recommend), chicken & waffles (2 breasts but 1 is plenty) and the po boy. The chicken was seasoned perfectly. Not too dry and moist. It was cold outside so we got the caramel rum cider to warm us up. It's such a perfectly crafted drink! Valerie did a fantastic job as our server. She was so nice and even put a candle in my drink since it was my birthday haha. Coming back here the next time I visit Portland.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: The Mac and cheese here is to die for. I ate a bite and instantly started inhaling it. Sometimes I go here and only get the Mac and cheese. Clearly I have a problem. The fried chicken here is really good as well, but my only gripe with it is that it's really peppery for my taste. Not a big problem though at all. The pies are delicious as well. My favorite is the banana one they have/had!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: Yikes . $18 for 2 pieces of chicken on a dollop of less than stellar mashed potatoes.  Appetizer similarly underwhelming-something thrown together to use up last of Jamaican seasoning.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food

text: Overhyped and not worth the wait. If you're from the south, you would know what good fried chicken taste like. This isn't it.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: There's a reason they have  a line out the door. Five out of 5 every time i go.  Amazing food and great staff. This place is a must if your from out of town or a local I highly recommend you eat here. Yes it gets busy but is defiantly worth it.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
This place continues to be the premium brunch spot in the area. It's gotta be a mix of locals and tourist eating here. 

Parking: Street Parking

We ordered a trio of the most popular items on the menu. The Shrimp and Grits (creamy, flavorful, big shrimps), praline bacon (unique, peanuts, sweet glaze, delicious) and the 3 piece Fried Chicken and Waffles (dank). 

Everything was really tasty. The bacon especially. 

It is true. The coffee shop next door made for a good pit spot since we had to wait 50 mins for a table. 

Overall: Will return when in the area. I want to try the dinner menu again.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
Exceptionally delicious brunch food with an exceptionally long wait.  I have a big appetite and even the one piece chicken and waffles was super satisfying and satiating.  Prices and portions are both decent--not super expensive for the quality but definitely not on the cheaper side either.  I would not recommend coming here on a weekend because the wait is absurd.

No bottomless mimosas.  I haven't tried any drinks here but it seems like other people enjoy them.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
This place can back up the hype! We waited about 30 minutes to sit down on a Friday morning. We sat in the covered outside seating near the road. We started off with the Bloody Mary's, Praline Bacon, and the Sausage Gumbo.

BLOODY MARY - Great Flavor! It did not come very spicy so you might have to ask for a little extra kick! Or just pour down of their habanero sauce and mix that in. You get Okra, Lemon, and an olive. The best part was the flavored salt mixture they coated around the ring of the glass. Very tasty. 

PRALINE BACON - The bacon was a little too sweet for me. There was too much praline and maple sugar to truly enjoy the savory nature of the bacon. It comes with three prices of bacon but this was a dish I would have been okay having one bite of. 

SAUSAGE GUMBO - Well done. A scrumptious little cup of gumbo topped with white rice. It was a percent little starter to the rest of my meal.

Then we moved into the main courses. I had the screen door chicken basket. I have heard amazing things about their chicken and waffles but I don't personally like chicken and waffles (I know, don't shoot me!) Honestly the chicken and waffles looks phenomenal and one of the girls we came with was blown away. 

CHICKEN BASKET - There was the option of wings, drumsticks, or fried chicken strips. The waitress recommended the drumsticks but I was having wings later that day and decided to go with the fried chicken strips instead. I am glad I decided to try the chicken they are known for. It was superb! The fried breading around the chicken was light and flaky and the chicken melted in my mouth. It came with a buttermilk ranch (that was a little dill heavy), crystal hot sauce (goes great mixed with the ranch), and a homemade habanero sauce to add a little kick if you like it spicy. 

Shrimp Po Boy - My girlfriend got this and boy were we surprised! The portion was huge! We were so excited to eat that we forgot to take pictures at the beginning g of the meal. The pictures shown are our meals half eaten. She loved the Po' boy! There was so much shrimp and dressings in the sandwich she needed more sauce so we poured the ranch and crystal sauce on it... great decision. 

Overall an amazing experience 

CONS - I think this place could be getting a 5 star rating based off of dishes alone but there were a few things that threw me off. 

1. The French fries! All of the dishes looked amazing and did not disappoint... but the French fries were elementary at best. They did not have a lot of flavor and were a little soggy. They honestly reminded me of some fast food style French fry. Their only redeeming quality was the ketchup.

2. The bacon seemed like it was more sugar and praline than it was bacon. I would have liked a heartier flavor.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
#jenventure: Portland

My friend and I bookmarked this restaurant while planning our Portland trip, and every Portland local mentioned it as a must-try so how could we not visit?! 

We heard that there is usually a wait, but assuming we were visiting on a Tuesday morning, we hoped it wouldn't be too bad. We waited a bit for the hostess to greet us, but we were promptly seated outside once she got to us. Our waitress was also really sweet & attentive and made sure we were enjoying everything. 

| f o o d |
The menu was heavily influenced by Southern cuisine with grits, fried chicken, and biscuit options. We got 2 dishes to share! 

1. Fried Chicken & Waffles: you have the option of 1, 2, or 3 pieces of fried chicken, but I thought 1 piece was enough for us. I liked that the chicken wasn't greasy at all. It was so tender and crispy!! The sweet potato waffles were good and fluffy. There was a cinnamon/nutmeg taste to them, which I wasn't too fond of because I don't like those spices, but it wasn't overpowering so I didn't mind too much.
2. Buttermilk Biscuit With Gravy (w/ sunny side up eggs): OoOOO get an egg because it helps offset the heaviness of the biscuits. The sausage gravy was a good consistency, and the biscuits were thick but not too dense. 

These 2 dishes combined was enough to fill us up without having leftovers. 

| t l ; d r |
Definitely a Portland gem that you must visit! You really can't go wrong with some Southern comfort for breakfast/brunch. Food is delicious, and service is a plus!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: Yummmmmm!!!! ....need I say more?!?  But set some money aside for this meal because quality BBQ comes at a quality price! The Lamb is amazing and the ribs as well! And their potato salad was so good I took the leftovers. Will definitely be returning with my entire life savings to spend.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: Fried Green Tomato BLT was divine! Atmosphere is super homey. Worth searching for a parking spot!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: absolutely amazing food! Fried Chicken just like my mom's
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
There's nothing better than Portland brunch... 

And the last few times I've been to Screen Door, I did not have to suffer the customary wait that accompanies most good breakfast places!  What a relief to be able to walk right in, start sipping coffee and order  some grub.

The vegetarian biscuits and gravy were excellent and they had many appetizing scrambles to choose from.

(Many yelpers have noted the steep(er) prices of the Screen Door, but it seemed par for the course for breakfast prices).
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
Wonderful food. Creative cocktails and nice ambience.  First trip to Portland and can't complain about anything I ate there. The worst meal I had was "just good"...
However, Screen Door was one of my favorites. Had the scallops for dinner and a gentilly cocktail. Everything was amazing. Worth however long you may have to wait. Was in town for 5 days and ate dinner here twice, that's how good it was.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
5 OUT OF 5 FOR SERVICE AND FOOD! A must try if you're visiting Portland!

[WAIT TIME]
I've read reviews and there's always a long wait for this place! I decided to come 15 minutes before opening on a Saturday morning and my friends and I were already the third group in line. By the time the restaurant opened for us to be seated, there was a line wrapped around the corner.

[SERVICE]
You're greeted once you walk in and servers are incredibly friendly. Our server started us off with drinks and gave us time to decide what we wanted to order. She made sure to stop by to refill our waters, provided us with to go boxes, and gave us our check all promptly!

[FOOD]
-  Fried Chicken and Waffle (5/5) 
A sweet potato waffle topped with 3 massive pieces of fried chicken. Let me tell you, the waffle was INCREDIBLE! I've never had a sweet potato waffle that had the perfect balance of sweet. It was crispy on the outside, soft on the inside, and just so good. The fried chicken was also amazing. Boneless, light and crispy batter, and juicy chicken. The batter was peppery and gave it a kick of spice. I absolutely recommend this dish.

- Fried Oyster Benedict (4.5/5)
3 fried oysters with eggs benedict and a side. You have to get the potatoes as your side for this dish. The eggs benedict was good, like any average eggs benedict, but the fried oysters and potatoes are where it's at. The potatoes are seasoned so well and the oysters aren't overwhelmed by a ton of fried batter.


[TL;DR]
- Long wait times and no reservations
- Fried chicken and waffle is a must try
- Fried oyster benedict w/potatoes is a must try
- HUGE portions for great price
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
Food/drink:  The chicken and waffles would be difficult to beat, they were perfect. The Blood Mary was just OK (and over priced). 
Staff: pleasant, hard working, busy, timely considering how busy they were.
Atmosphere: busy, crowded, loud.
Overall: plan on parking a long ways away and waiting in line to get in, then being rewarded with delicious food.

Wait is long and expect 100% wait time of your food after you got seated so not recommended for tourist to wait couple of hours just on a brunch while there are tons of restaurants in the city can serve the same quality .. felt like this is overrated maybe of tourist effect..

text: Amazing brunch!  The craft cocktails (at dinner time) are lovely and delicious also.  The staff is friendly.  Fun atmosphere.

text: A great spot for brunch, chicken & waffles is a staple! The decor is charming and tables are close together. While slightly loud, it felt more cozy than unbearable. Be mindful about parking as there is no designated parking area but the surrounding neighborhood. Also consider when you go, anytime past 11:30am it tends to get busy. Waiter Thomas is very attentive and knowledgeable, was able to help give pointers on the menu. Seemed very genuine and set a great atmosphere. Stuck with the staple, and couldn't be more happy! Sweet potato waffles are tasty and not overpowering and the chicken on top was crispy on the outside and tender on the inside. I will say the spice in the chicken crust can be slightly overwhelming but I like it. I will warn newcomers that the 1 piece chicken and waffles will keep you satisfied, the 2 and 3 piece options are reserved for the hulk or a small village. Was entertaining to watch some displeased but slightly in awe customers as they saw the mountain of chicken. Regardless, this place is high on my recommendations list and will for sure be back to explore the menu! Thank you!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: Dinner menus are also great. I got fried chicken, and a combination of 3 sides(gumbo, mac n cheese, and asparagus).  Everything was really good. Two dishes are enough to share for two people.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: They steal employees tips. Also, you can get food just as good without the lines at plenty of places in the city. Screw this place.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
This review is long overdue for me.
Screen Door was one of the first restaurants I went to when I moved to PDX and it's been a staple ever since.
There is a reason you will see a line outside before opening every day, the food is that good! In fact, I've waited in line for well over an hour and it's still worth it.
As far as food recommendations- it's the best Mac and Cheese I've ever had. It's so rich and creamy and I have a hard time sharing when I order this.
Other favorites are the fried chicken, mashed potatoes, fried okra and pimento cheese. 

Their breakfast is phenomenal as well - from their biscuits and gravy to their pecan bacon....you just can't go wrong eating here whether for breakfast or dinner!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: Two words: praline bacon. So delicious, the perfect combination of sweet and savory. I wish I had the recipe! I had the bacon yesterday and I'm still thinking about it. All of our food and cocktails, even the coffee, were all delicious. We did have to wait about 30 minutes to get a table, but the service was excellent and our meal was as well. I highly recommend Screen Door for anyone looking for an awesome brunch spot!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
I only got to try one brunch place during my trip to portland and I am so glad it was this one!! We arrived on a sunday at 12pm so of course it was packed but we waited about 30 minutes for a party to 4 which wasn't too bad. The restaurant has a great southern authentic feel. The service was prompt and friendly. and now for the food, we all shared and the portions were HUGE so definietly recommending sharing. 

-Maple praline bacon-WOW THE MOST AMAZING THING I HAVE EVER TASTED. This was the perfect mixture of salty, sweet, crunchy, and savory all in one. I literally wish i could eat this all day, this is a must get!

-Hush Puppies-I normally don't love hush puppies but here is an exception. It was crispy yet soft, warm, and had a hint of cheese on the inside. I would get this if you need another appetizer option!

-Shrimp & Grits-This is the first time I've ever had grits and they definitely set the bar high! The grits were creamy and packed with shrimp flavor. it also came with a biscuit and eggs. All together it was the perfect combination! 

-Chicken & Waffles-what they are known for, definitely a must get ! The sweet potato waffle was the perfect pairing for crunchy, flavorful, tender fried chicken. Probably the best chicken & waffles I've ver had. 

I would highly recommend this place to tourists and locals alike! :)
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
This place has got to be one of the most popular breakfast, brunch, lunch and dinner place in Portland ! Came here on a Weekend for breakfast and even before it was opened, there was a huge line already forming ! By the time that there doors were opened, there had already been a huge line that had been formed outside waiting in the super cold weather ! More like freezing.. hence I had huge expectations for Screen Door!

We ordered, the fried chicken and waffles with three buttermilk battered fried chicken breasts over a sweet potato waffle, the praline bacon waffle with strip of praline bacon, whipped cream and toasted pecans, side of sunny side up eggs and fresh cut fruits! Everything that we ordered was amazing, especially the praline bacon and waffle! I would definitely come back here again if I can and there prices were decent with great customer service! Also if you are super hungry, the chicken and waffle would definitely fill you up! Yummy yummy praline bacon for a nonbacon lover lol
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: Forced gratuity for 1 person? I tip all the time, so I do not like required gratuity, it is like raising the price of the menu just before I order. The "Cajun" label is essentially false for the mealtime that I visited. Very few Cajun items on menu, more of a southern kitchen for the mealtime I saw. Prices were high, wait time long, food was average.
