categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
First stop on my Portland trip and was not disappointed! 
I shared the Big Breakfast with my boyfriend and I sampled a little bit of everyone's dishes. The grits were so cheesy, we all described it as an easy to chew mac & cheese. The chicken from the chicken and waffles wasn't dry and the sweet potato waffles had a strong cinnamon flavor which was really great combined with the chicken. The banana fosters french toast was soft and fluffy and the first bite was sweet but you get used to the sweetness. 
We came on a Thursday around 10am and only had to wait 15 minutes but the rest of my party wasn't here so we had to wait for another round or two tables (about 30 minutes) to get seated. Servers are quite busy since there are so many people they serve but they try to get to you as soon as they can. The food did take a while to arrive so we spent more time there than we wanted for brunch. 
All in all, I can definitely see why Screendoor is so highly recommended by locals and tourists all around.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
Best breakfast / brunch restaurant we've ever been to in our lives!! Screen Door was our first stop when we came to Portland and they did not disappoint!!

| p a r k i n g |
Boy parking was tough!! It's all street parking and it's located in an area with 10 other businesses.

| s e r v i c e |
Is it me or is everyone in Portland super nice?! We only waited about 15-20 minutes for a table. The gentleman in front updated us often on any delays or table that was about to open up. Our waiter was so nice. I wish I caught his name! He was very attentive and brought our food out pretty quick. 

| f o o d |
Everything we ate here was soo delicious!!

[ ++ ] Buttermilk Biscuit with Gravy: Best I've ever had in my life. Biscuit was fluffy and buttery. Gravy had chunks of sausage and seasoned perfectly. Packed with flavor.

[ ++ ] Huevos Rancheros: Wow wow wow. This is a must try. Everything about it was amazing. I'm usually not a fan of black beans but I couldn't get enough! Beef brisket was soft. Cilantro lime cream sauce was delicious!

[ + ] Hot Link Sausage Breakfast Po Boy: So yummy! The sausage had a hint of spiciness but it's not overly spicy. The onion straws was a nice touch to the sandwich. I personally wasn't a fan of the potatoes but everyone else at the table liked em. 

[ + ] Fried Chicken and Waffle: My hubby replaced his waffle for pancakes and they were so good. Fluffy and buttery. There were 2 huge pieces of chicken on top that were cooked perfectly. They were still nice and juicy. 

[ + ] Side of Wings: Never had wings like this before! Nicely seasoned and crisp. 

[ - ] Side of Mac and Cheese: I wasn't a fan of the mac and cheese. I felt like they could've seasoned it more. The pasta to cheese ratio was off. It was drowned in a bowl full of cheese.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
Honestly this is THE BEST breakfast place my boyfriend and I have ever eaten at! And this is coming from a bunch of breakfast haters. Of all the places we ate in Portland, this was our favorite by far. We came here in the morning as we were about to leave for a hike as we figured we needed all the fuel we could get. They had just opened and we were warmly greeted and seated. We ordered the:

Chicken and waffles - we had a choice of 1-3 pieces of chicken. Our waiter told us that a piece consists of a 6 oz chicken breast and that if we were ordering anything else (which we intended on doing) that 1 piece was plenty. He was right. The chicken breast was a huge piece of juicy tender well seasoned, well breaded, crispy piece of heaven. Omg. The waffles were made with sweet potatoes. The perfect combination of crispy and soft. Honestly you can't go wrong with ordering this.

Fried chicken and biscuit - for anyone who likes a savory and hearty breakfast this is perfect! The biscuits were soft yet flakey. The gravy was delicious and honestly I don't know how they get chicken breast to be so moist and not dry. This was my boyfriends favorite. Came with a side of cheesy grits. We don't eat grits so I can't say I'm thrilled by the texture but it wasn't bad!

Praline bacon - $7.50 for 3 pieces of bacon but I had to try. It seemed so intriguing. If you're a fan of salty and sweet this is perfect. But it was too sweet for the two of us. We ended scrapping off the praline and adding it to our sweet potato waffle and problem solved. Delicious.

Food was AMAZING. And service was top notch! Shout out to the guy from NYC and the guy with a ponytail. Favorite place to eat in Portland and one of the cheaper spots. Must come back. 100% recommend. Congratulations Screen Door. You officially converted some breakfast haters.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
This is not a negative review, it was just an experience that I want to share. As my family of 4 arrived, we waited for about 30 min for a table, which was expected on this busy Monday night, but we were psyched about trying this place.

Ambience: Totally packed on Monday night, hostess and server were friendly, but this place was so jam packed with people that my husband was scanning for emergency exits as we were placed in the tightest pocket of the place (we are usually not this anal, that it was just so busy and so many tables crammed together) oh and it was 90 degrees inside the restaurant, I had sweat beads down my back.

Food: Food was pretty tasty, I ordered the signature chicken and mashed potato plate and collard greens. It was delish, no dispute about that. Also tasted the shrimp and grits appetizer and the beet and arugula salad which again was very tasty. Jambalaya and Red Beans and Rice were excellent. Our problem with the food is that it took 50 min from the time we ordered to arrival to our table. With 2 kids and one that is a wacky autistic guy, all that waiting in the hot ass hotbox was too much, so we really ate in 8 minutes and had to bail, it was too much for our kids.
So that was our experience, maybe if it was another life , and we came without kids, and the temperature wasn't boiling inside the restaurant, we could have enjoyed ourselves a bit more.

In summation: Great food, great drinks, no air conditioning, don't come with kids, pray a fire never breaks out.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: Excellent breakfast place for a rainy weekend morning. Get there early though- the line was already 10 deep when we arrived 15 minutes early. Staff was very helpful with the menu and the kitsch interior made dining a fun experience.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
This is one of those Portland hot spots I'd say try once just to say you did, but never spend the effort to go again.

Don't get me wrong, the southern-style breakfast is great. Chicken and waffles, candied bacon, grits, you name it. But the line is just. Not. Worth. It. And I don't feel bad saying this because this place gets so much business and will keep getting it. 

If you're ever cruising down Burnside and a miracle strikes and you don't see a queue down the block, definitely swing a fast turn. But otherwise...
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
We were a little disappointed with this popular brunch spot in Portland. We came here at 9:30am on the Friday following the 4th of July, waited for about an hour to get seated. This wasn't too bad given how popular this place is. However, we waited for another 40minutes to get our food after we ordered. And the food were just so-so in our opinions.

We got the chicken and waffle, shrimp grits and biscuit, and the bacon. They all taste all right, but definitely not something that I'll keep thinking of in the future. Among the things we ordered, the shrimp grits was my favorite and beyond my expectations. My bf likes the fired chicken too. But we were not the fan of the waffle and biscuit. Bacon was a too sweet for us, too.

All in all, the food (and service) here may be 4 stars, but given the fact that we spent 1.5hrs+ to get our food, I personally do not think it is worth the wait.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
dear lord, this place is amazing! portland has so many good brunch spots, but the screen door was hands down the best brunch I've ever had in my life! if you ever get the chance to try, DO IT, even if you have to wait for a while! 

i've read so many things online about how this place has ridiculous long wait times, even up to two hours or more during the weekends, but we luckily had absolutely no wait when we came! we drove down from seattle and had a couple hours to kill before we could check into our airbnb, so we rolled up here on wednesday 10/24 around noon and were seated immediately. the service was great, both the host & the waitress were quick & friendly! 

i ended up ordering the lemon blueberry pancakes with a side of the breakfast potatoes, and my husband had the chicken & waffles. everything was SOOOOO good! the best was definitely the chicken, it was cooked to crispy, juicy perfection. i didn't really like to eat it with the waffle, my husband would just cut off little pieces for me that I'd either eat plain or drench in hot sauce. the portions were also HUGE and the prices were not too bad. it's such a shame we don't live in the area, cuz we would be here all the time if we were!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: Great place for breakfast. Kind service. A little crowded and a long wait. Coming from SF, I feel like I'm used to waiting in line but this one was exceptional. The food was great and lavish. I feel like how can you go wrong with a stack of fried chicken speared with a knife. Also the bacon was amazing if you are into the combination of sweet and savory (which you should be at a chicken and waffle place)
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
Excellent service

Ordered

Chicken & waffles
Blueberry & Lemon Curd Buttermilk Pancakes
Praline bacon

The fried chicken was amazing.  Seasoning and flaky batter was so good.  I'd pass on the waffles but I'd go with the waffle from "Roscoes Chicken & Waffle" to go with my fried chicken.

Next time I will get their Fried chicken & biscuits.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
If it was my last day on earth I would go to screen door. I came here on a busy Friday night with my family the wait time wasn't that bad roughly around 25-30 mins but we came at around 8:30. Our server was a sweet gal and since it was family's first time she kindly told us the house favorites. 
I got the fried chicken and mashed potatoes. My brother just got Mac and cheese and mashed potatoes. I was a little surprised that they stopped giving collard greens with the fried chicken but that's ok. I really loved the fried chicken but let me tell you about the Mac and cheese delicious. It was sooo creamy I couldn't stop asking my brother for a bite. It had a nice baked top and silky cheese. The fried chicken has a nice crunch and a peppered batter with just enough heat. If it's too spicy just eat it with the mashed potatoes :-)
My sister had a brisket sandwich she said it was good but too peppery. 
My mom enjoyed her shrimp and grits. I was a little worried that she wouldn't like it because she never had shrimp and grits before but she did. 
Overall my family had a good experience. Great staff and delicious food. 
Every time I'm in Portland I always gotta stop by screen door.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: It's an old portland staple! And I just went for the first time having lived here for about 18 years! It is good, but very heavy and filling. Definitely a go for brunch, and don't eat until the next day kind of place.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: Real southern food. The chicken and waffles are to die for and I love the hushpuppies with jalapeno jelly. One of the only places in the area to get good southern grown channel cat. There can be a line, so just ask for some sweet tea and you'll be fine. :)
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
OMG!! I cannot say enough good things about this place - holy moly! The BEST fried chicken, hands down, anywhere. AND it's chicken breast, notoriously difficult to fry without drying out.

5 of us had these, and were pretty full!
- Screen Door 3 piece chicken and waffle
- Large salad
- Pimiento cheese appetizer with crackers
- Oyster Po-Boy
- Praline Waffle

Start off by saying the wait is quite long, and it's crowded, but after eating here, now I know why - it's very good!

Ok, the chicken and waffle was a thing! The chicken was perfectly done: moist, flavorful, and seasoned with just salt and pepper, I think. Must've been brined, because it was tasty!

We saw the pimiento cheese and crackers on someone's table while we were waiting, and got that because it looked so good. And it was.

The Oyster Po Boy was delicious, and crispy, not oily.

The Praline Waffle was wow, very very good.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: The first I came years ago during dinner I wasn't that impressed some of my food was cold and mediocre.  I went here yesterday and had the chicken and waffles and OMG! It was soooooo good! Me and my friends lived all the food we got and the service was great!  Can't wait to go back again :)
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: I can't even begin to tell you how amazing Screen Door is. For starters, the staff was so nice and attentive. They all worked together even though we had one designated server. The space is super cute and well decorated. There is no parking lot but plenty of street parking. I visited on a late Saturday morning and the wait time was about 40 min to sit me and a friend but I promise you it was worth the wait. I would be willing to wait longer. The food had a great variety of meat and meatless options which is always a bonus. I ate the shortcake, pork shoulder scramble, praline bacon, cheese grits, chicken & waffles, and biscuits & gravy (was sharing with my friend don't judge) and everything was absolutely amazing. Every single bite. The textures, the seasoning, even the plate presentation. I wish I could give this place more stars. The only disappointment is that I can't eat here every day for the rest of my life. Do yourself a favor and eat here. And tip extra!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: This is my favorite breakfast spot in Portland! Even though the wait is torture, it is so worth it. Everyone needs to try their chicken and waffles! It's a great sweet and savory dish and will leave your stomach full and happy. The location is in a residential neighborhood, so parking isn't TOO terrible. I can't wait to come back again and try their other breakfast items!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: My GAWD I love the chicken and waffles here. Absolutely one of my favorite meals anywhere, anytime. Always crowded, always a wait for a table, but service is friendly and usually, the food comes pretty fast. Enjoy the non-pretentious vibe here as well, unlike many Portland places.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
Yeah, the hype is real! 

Fried Chicken- Yes Yes Yes!! I cant describe it, but its THAT good. 

Their locals/organics- I loved the beets salad that I got, it was fresh and the cheese was local!! How often do you dine at a restaurant that supports your local farms? It's rare! I definitely can respect that. 

I send all my out of town guests here to Screen Door, its my #1. You can't leave portland until you've tried Screen Door!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: My boyfriend and I are from Seattle and went to this restaurant based off two recommendations. We got street parking fairly close to the restaurant, and once arrived, the restaurant was packed. Luckily no wait time and got serviced fairly quickly. We shared the chicken and waffle plate, got two black coffees, and got three scrambled eggs. Chicken was very juicy yet crunchy which I believe is a key component to making good friend chicken. Waffle was standard nothing too fancy, but nothing too plain. Between the two of us, we almost couldn't finish it because there was so much! The atmosphere of the restaurant was very casual and social. Despite the busy environment, quality service was always available! Would definitely go again if in the area and would definitely recommend as well!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: Mmmm. So good. Sat on the enclosed heated patio. This is my second visit. Everything has always been wonderful
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: A bit to much pepper in the fried chicken for our taste! Desserts were great! Wait staff was excellent. The noise was overwhelming, everyone seemed to have to yell at each other. Next time we will try chops and get it to go!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: For a breakfast and brunch place this place was really good. Their chicken tenders with ranch dipping sauce was one of my favorites here. The spring and grits are okay. Def try the Mac and cheese.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
HOT DAMN!!!!!

I was doing the Great Pacific Northwest road trip and of course had to stop into Portland so I checked out fellow Yelpers had to say on great eats in this area and Screen Door came out on top so naturally of course I had to go check it out.

I came in at 10:30am and there was already a crazy line-up outside. I gave my name to the hostess and because it was just me, I was able to get a seat at the bar, but it was a good 40 minute wait. Not that I minded, I got to people watch and look over the menu. FYI: if you're looking to get a table for 2, waits are about 2 hours by 10:30am on a weekend.

When I was finally seated, I ordered up a Bloody Mary, it was spicy and tangy to perfection with a pickled okra to boot. The bartender who also took our orders does a stellar job. The people here work their asses off and it was easy to see why given the crowds. But the crowds are huge because of one thing only: the food.

Of course I ordered the fried chicken for my first time here. And some monstrous  piling tower of three large chicken breasts, perfectly spiced, breaded and fried with a giant knife pinning it together on top of a sweet potato waffle showed up. It was fried food heaven. There was no way I was ever going to finish off such a huge portion. This is dinner for a couple or a small family. Thankfully, there was another lone diner seated beside me at the bar and she was having their super-fluffy French Toast. We got chatting together and she said she was a regular and always has the fried chicken but wanted to try something else today and  so I proposed a trade, I gave her a piece of my chicken and I got to try that awesome French toast

This is definitely Southern cuisine done right. I saw omelets with oysters, Bourbon sauce bread pudding, and a ton of other stuff I wished i could have tried. If I lived in Portland, I'd be here all the time. Great food, good prices and amazing service. Try this place first before you go anywhere else.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
Screen Door in Portland
Their cornbread is perfection
Come eat everything

A haiku by Kathy D.

Okay, I made a mental note to write Screen Door a review because it was the best "Welcome to Portland" meal I could've asked for. After thinking about it long and hard for about a good week, I just couldn't find the right words and sentences to do this place justice, so I hope my poem helped convey that YOU MUST EAT HERE!!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: Visiting from AZ and I loved it!! There is quite a wait but I think it's worth it. Chicken and waffles were so delicious! Their specialty bacon is a must try! Overall, if I find myself in Portland again I will totally come back!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
If you look up on Yelp where to eat in Portland, this place is highly recommended, and for good reason!

There might be a line:
Most people recommend this place for brunch, so that's exactly when we went. My husband and I got to the restaurant right when it opened Sunday morning at 9am. There was literally already a line of at least 20 people deep waiting outside, so that must be a good sign right? We probably only waited in line about 30 minutes before being seated, which wasn't too bad. 

Parking isn't so bad:
We parked for free about 2 blocks away from the restaurant in a residential area. There's street parking all around the area and the restaurant is nustled in a quaint neighborhood but still on the main road, so you can't miss it (especially with the line of people waiting outside haha).

When you finally get inside:
It has southern country style and decor, as to be expected with the type of food they serve. We were surrounded by friendly staff left and right, from the hostess, to our waitress, and lastly the guy at the bar who kindly pointed me in the direction of the bathroom. They have benches inside to sit on while you wait for your table and self serve coffee to keep you warm and awake behind the hostess desk. Be fore warned though, if you pour yourself a cup of joe, you will have to pay for it, it's not free. 

The whole reason we came here:
I ordered the blood orange mimosa, which was just as delicious as a regular mimosa if not even better and my husband ordered this coffee liquor drink that I can't remember the name of but it's was still memorable! As for entrees, he got the Fried Oyster Breakfast Poboy, which had fried oysters, bacon, and over medium eggs and cheese grits on the side. Ugh, it was a gigantic mouthful but my husband devoured every last delicious bite. 

As for me, I ordered the Low Country Shrimp and Grits with eggs and a biscuit on the side. Hands down the best shrimp and grits I've ever had, the flavors were mind blowing! After taking the first bite, I was hooked. Truly, love at first bite. 

We didn't ordered this, but pretty much everyone else around us did and it was the praline bacon. It looked so good, kind of regret not getting it.

So, lessons learned: go early as possible, come with an empty stomach so you can eat as much as possible, and probably order the praline bacon. If you're in Portland, brunch here is a must!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: At first I was a bit skeptical about this place but my friends who saw this place had over 6,000 reviews said, "we must eat brunch here." Honestly, it was the best decision I have ever made. I ordered the Breakfast Burger with a side of sweet potato fries. I finished the whole plate. It's well worth that 30-45 minute wait.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: Portland takes their brunch seriously and Screen Door does not disappoint. If you're searching for a warm, southern meal this is the place to be. Do yourself a favor and get the praline bacon. It's not the kind of crispy bacon you maybe used to since it's crusted in pralines. Not overly sweet, not chewy. It's a party in your mouth. We couldn't leave here without trying their famous chicken and waffles. I'm not sure if the chickens name was Colin but it was another delivery from screen door. Perfectly moist and crispy paired with the homemade hot sauce. YUMMY. If you're here during the fall you have to try the spiced apple cider.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: This place had insane waiting but we had read that this place is a must try, so we waited out in the rain for about an hour. It'll usually take longer that what they tell you it would take. I got the gluten free fried chicken and you wouldn't be able to guess that it had no gluten. It was very flavorful. I got the screendoor platter, so had 2 sides to go with it. I got the potato salad which was good but the sweet potato fries were the bomb. Yes, I know, I got 2 potato sides, no judging. My husband got the shrimp and grits and was pretty happy with this food as well. My only complaint is the amount of time you need to set aside to try this place out. We waited an hour to get in and atleast 40 minutes for the food to come out. So go here with lots of time on hand. We had had a long day, tourist-ing around Portland and this wait seemed like an eternity.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
I haven't had a better meal in a very long time while dining out. I ordered their beef brisket and it came with crunchy onion straws and coleslaw. It was AMAZING! The beef was perfectly tender and moist. My gf ordered their mac and cheese and the chicken drumsticks. The Mac and cheese is quite large for being a side dish and so garlicky and delicious!! The drumsticks had a unique flavor that I couldn't get enough of. We almost didn't go bc they only have 8 entrees to choose from. I'm so glad we decided to go anyway. There is a reason this place has such good reviews. Do yourself a favor and try it out!

PS. I don't ever write reviews. I downloaded the YELP app just to give this restaurant a review. That says enough.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: This place is my favorite place to come for brunch. Hands down the best everrr.... chicken and waffles. The mimosas are also great, everything on their menu is great. Has to be my go to place in Portland.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
Firstly, be prepared to wait. We came for friday brunch and had to wait at least an hour to get seated. I can only imagine what it's like for saturday/sunday brunch. However, it was definitely worth the wait. 

There's a couple of great coffee spots nearby that are worth checking out while you wait. I ordered the fried chicken biscuit sandwich and a side of their praline bacon. 

The bacon was super rich to the point where I wasn't able to finish it. It's a wonderful combination of sweet and savory and salty. I'd recommend splitting this with a group. It doesn't look like a lot of food, but it's hard to eat a lot of, even if it's so delicious. 

The chicken biscuit sandwich was great. Awesome cheesy grits. Super succulent chicken. Nice flaky biscuit. And a sausage gravy worth dying for. 

What more can you ask?
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: Arrived when they opened to beat too much of a wait. Line gets long right off the bat. Chicken and waffles are as awesome as they're made out to be. Waffles are excellent sweet potato waffles.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: Line was super long but as usual they are pretty on point.  We got a table within 15 mins, ate within 45 and was out in 1hr 25mins, Screen Door never disappoints!!! Thank you thank you again for another full and happy belly!!! Til next time!!!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: The brisket is amazing. It was juicy and tender and the portioning was great. However, took much longer than expected. Service can improve a little.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
Parking: Neighborhood

Anyone visiting Portland should try this place. Not only is the service so great, but you can call in earlier to put your name down (why don't more places do this?). 

The food is just all around amazing. I had the griddle stack burger and it was just a large ooey gooey delicious burger. Probably one of the best I have ever had. The burger had some sort of tomato-y sauce, but upon inspection of their menu, it was likely a combination of the pimento cheese and smoked scallion mayo. Just a great combination of meat, cheese, sauce, etc. A slam dunk in my book. 

I also got to try the mac n cheese and that was all around solid. Friends had the fried chicken and couldn't stop raving about it. Everyone at our table was pleased with all their dishes, so all items may be a safe bet. 

One thing to note is that the portion sizes are very large. One meal could likely feed two people to a sufficient level or even to the brim. 

Definitely a place I will return to!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: On a sad day when Kobe Bryant passes away with his daughter this place was needed.  Loved the food and service. I'll be back from LA for sure
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: Run, don't walk to this amazing restaurant. This was recommended by a friend and it lived up to the hype. We had to wait but only 15 minutes and it was worth it. Came with the whole family and tried a variety of food from the Mac n cheese to the chicken and waffles. Seriously the best fried chicken I've ever had. The gumbo was amazing as well. This is a must eat if in Portland restaurant. And our waiter was friendly and gave us lots of sights to see while here. Can't wait to go back.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
The wait was about 90 minutes for a party of 8 on a Sunday morning at around 9:30am. They don't take your cell phone number to text you when you're table is ready so make sure you are paying attention for when they call your name. While they offer free coffee while you wait, I recommend going next door to the coffee shop Kofi to enjoy their delicious coffee. 

After we got seated, our waiter served us quickly and our food came out quick. We ordered the praline bacon, huevos rancheros, shrimp and grits, breakfast oyster po boy and the breakfast burger. Everything was fantastic except the huevos rancheros. The brisket in the huevos was too smoky and overpowered the whole meal. The shrimp and grits on the other hand was great! The oyster po boy was also terrific!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: This place came highly recommended as one of the best spots in the area! And that it was. Staff was super friendly upon the walk in and we waited just under 10 minutes. They closed at two so it was peak hours at about noon. Breakfast/brunch and lunch both available till close. I had the catfish po'boy which was fried to a golden brown and served with a seriously good cole slaw- not soggy at all. My coworkers loved their choices also, and especially raved about the hot chocolate. Generous portions! Everything was super fresh, definitely made to order as breakfast/brunch should be. And you can tell the staff has a good handle on the place as it likely is that busy everyday (it was just a Tuesday after all). Yet everything from arrival to wrapping food up to go was done swiftly.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: Delicious! We drove through Portland on our drive home from Seattle. Parking is scanty. But it's worth it. I promise. The staff was great! Super friendly! They greeted us and seated us immediately. Our waitress made sure to check up on us often. Topping off our coffee and water frequently. Our food was hot and fresh and perfect! I highly recommend it!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
Had brunch the other day, ordered fried chicken and waffle, french toast, and pecan bacon I really enjoyed. 

Mind you, they have decent portion in serving almost was not able to finish it.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: Best Mac and cheese I've EVER HAD! (Drool) I think the mix and match sampler option is genius because you can try so many good things on one plate!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
I decided to stop by Screen Door based of a rec from an Uber driver. It was heaven. 

Although the wait was super long (waited 2 hours from putting down our name to actually being seated and served on a Friday at noon before Labor Day weekend) it was worth it. 

During the wait, I grabbed some coffee and ice cream.

I ordered the 1 piece chicken and waffle along with their Mac and cheese to split with a friend. The fried chicken was well seasoned and crispy while the chicken was juicy and fried to perfection. The thickness of the chicken is key - too thin and it's dry and too thick it's a little too much chicken to chicken skin crunch ratio. The thickness of the chicken at Screen Door is perfect.

The sweet potato waffle is a great pairing as well. I personally love lathering the chicken and waffle combo with a hot sauce and syrup mixture.

The mac and cheese was baked with a crispy cheese layer. Good but overshadowed by the chicken and waffle.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: I've had breakfast and dinner here multiple times and it never disappoints. I LOVE the fried chicken.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
Came here for brunch on a Saturday while visiting Portland. I'm a big fan of Cajun food so I definitely wanted to check this place out during my short trip. Free street parking wasn't too bad to find around the neighborhood. This place gets really busy so try to get here early or come on a weekday if possible. Unfortunately I'm only visiting this weekend and came around 12pm on Saturday, probably one of the worst times to get there. My friend and I waited ~45 mins for our seats at the bar which was less than the 1 hour wait estimated by the hostess. However, we also probably waited about 45 mins to get our food after ordering which seemed abnormally long. 

I got the cathead sandwich which was a fried chicken breast sandwiched between a homemade  biscuit and covered in sausage gravy. I heard the fried chicken was amazing so I definitely wanted that, but not a big fan of waffles so this seemed like the best choice. I thought it was one of the juiciest fried chickens I've ever had, especially since it was white meat! The spices were really flavorful without being too salty and the meat was very tender. I probably missed out on some of the crispiness because it was drenched in gravy, but the gravy was good so not a big deal. I'd probably order it on the side next time. The biscuit was fluffy and delicious as well. It comes with a side of roasted potatoes or plain/cheesy grits. I got the cheesy grits, but these were mostly neglected since the chicken and biscuit/gravy were so good. This dish is enormous and I barely ate half, probably could have shared with another person and still been super full. 

My friend got an omelette with vegetarian sausage, tomatoes, and other veggies with roasted potatoes. He liked it, but I thought my dish was way better :P

Definitely try their unlabeled hot sauce! I also put some of their jam on my biscuit which was really good as well. Loved my food, but think it did take longer than usual to come out. I would definitely come back for more next time I'm in Portland!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: So happy my sons took me to Screen Door. They have been talking about it for months. I have to say they are right, the food was amazing, we hadd great service and the cocktails were on point!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
Wow, I forgot how amazing this place was. Highly recommend coming with a large group and ordering family style. Every dish is delicious! We got the chicken waffle (of course) and the chicken was well seasoned and juicy. The waffle had a tasty spice flavoring and was perfect for soaking up syrup. We also got the banana foster, blueberry pancakes, and big breakfast. Everything exceeded our expectations.

Bonus: restrooms are unisex
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: I don't get this place... yeah, the food is good, but to stand in line for over an hour  - really?... for over-priced grub...  of course I think Blue star doughnuts is also WAY overrated also...
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: I was really excited to try this place out because of their praline bacon. Unfortunately, this was my least favorite item! It was more soggy and greasy than I expected. I ordered their shrimp and grits ($15.25) while my boyfriend tried their brisket hash ($13.50). These items were pretty good and very well priced for the portions (ALSO... NO SALES TAX!). We came on a weekday morning and waited for about 10 minutes. I personally don't think it's worth the long waits on the weekends.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: Fried Chicken and sweat potatoe waffles are amazing! Add a little candied bacon on the top and I don't have to eat for the rest of the day. Actually everything was. The Biscuits and gravy are soo creaming and hardy. Definitely gets busy. VERY BUSY on weekend mornings. Either show up super early or call ahead.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
There aren't many places worth the wait that usually accompanies a trip to the Screen Door, but this is one of them.  The food is really second to none and any time I've had breakfast here, it made the whole day better afterward.

I've had the chicken and waffles and the cat's head sandwich (a piece of fried chicken "as big as a cat's head," sandiwched in a giant biscuit and slathered in decadent country gravy), both of which are spectacular.  The portions are enough to fill up on and although the prices can be a little bit above your average breakfast cafe, the food is so good you'll hardly notice.  The waffles and biscuits are thick and dense and filling and the chicken is perfectly crisped and spiced up with a little extra zip that complements either the gravy or the syrup well.  Even the grits served on the side with the cat's head sandwich were so amazing it took me a few bites to even realize they were grits.

Definitely at the top of my list of restaurants I've visited since moving to Portland.  It's a culinary monument; if you haven't tried it yet, you're missing out.  I'm excited to see what the fare is like during dinner service one of these days.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
They are insanely accurate with their wait times. I put my name in and was told 20 minutes. I thought "No way, there's a horde of people waiting" but 23 minutes later, I was called in.

Coffee had a very strong, earthy flavor. I couldn't handle it black, so I got a sidecar (Baileys and Kahlua). They do NOT skimp on the sidecar.

Chicken and waffles. Chicken was excellent, crispy and moist. It comes 2-4 pieces and 2 pieces was more than enough for a very large serving. However, I really didn't like the waffle. The spices they use it in make it taste like gingerbread.

Shrimp n grits. SO good. Generous portion of big, tender shrimp. The grits were AMAZING - slightly on the looser side, savory, and cheesy.

Praline bacon. No skimping on the praline part! This mostly sweet bacon was thick, slightly smoky, and made a great sidekick to a biscuit!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: I love going to Screen Door for dinner (although their brunch is amazing too). They have the best Mac-n-Cheese which is a high compliment coming from me because mac-n-cheese is my signature Thanksgiving dish. I have not tried anything from here that I didn't love.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
Three words - Fried. Oyster. Benedict. 

We were looking for a unique brunch place to hit up in Portland and lo and behold, Screen Door popped up on Yelp with nearly 7k reviews and 4.5 stars. Need I say more?

After reading about how the wait times can be upwards of 1-2hrs, we were sure to arrive early before they opened to avoid the crowd. We got there at around 8:40am on a Sunday morning and there were only about 10-15 people ahead of us, so we were seated straight away once they opened. 

I personally love any and all eggs benedict and the fried oyster benedict was a first for me. You get delicious crispy fried oysters, bacon, and a perfectly poached egg on top of a fluffy English muffin, topped with a rich and creamy hollandaise sauce. Oh so good. 

Since that obviously wasn't enough to eat (jk), we also got a side of the praline bacon which was like a dessert in itself. It is a sticky, sweet caramel confection topped with a ton of pecans.

Since that obviously wasn't enough to eat still (jk, jk), we also got a side of the blueberry lemon curd buttermilk pancake which was very fluffy and delectable. 

Don't forget to get a mimosa (or two) to go with the food!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
Shout out to our amazing server today, Samantha. She was professional and friendly, and it was mesmerizing to watch her bartending skills lol I almost ordered a cocktail although I cannot drink! 

Now, for food, this is one place that I can confidently say that it lives up to its fame. We ordered chicken&waffle and beef brisket hash, and both were perfect. The chicken was so tender and juicy on the inside, so crunchy with a little kick on the outside. The beef brisket hash, omg everyone should try this. Definitely will be coming again whenever I visit Portland.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
- Locale Destination - 
It's on E Burnside St and NE 24th Ave in Portland, OR. 

Neighborhoods: Northeast Portland, Kerns
It was very dim for the dinner time, so it was very hard to take pictures. Decor is sorta hippie and cozy. Open kitchen. They have a nice outside seating. Service is just OK. I was a bit annoyed because I wasn't acknowledged for a long while at the podium despite of the fact that it was very slow night and close to the closing time. You can't expect anything free here for your birthday event. It's awful, IMO. 
Street parking. 


- Gluttony Expedition - 
Entrees are around $15 +, appetizers are $5 ~10. Everything has a big portion, but a bit pricey for the quality (in terns of taste) compared with other good OR restaurants.

Screen Door's favorite: You can pick 3 sides. 
1) Fried catfish: Though the batter got spices, fish lacked in flavors. Bland.

2) Mac & cheese: Heavy cheese flavors, hot and cooked well. Not bad. 

3) Beet salad: Very light, flavorful and hearty. Good.

Corn bread: a bit dry side, full of corn flavors, not so sweet. Fancy version of corn bread.

Fried oysters: The appetizer comes with a lot of oysters for appetizer. The batter was very crunchy and lots of spices in it. Not bad, but nothing wow to me.

Desserts: Everything looked heavy - pies, pies, pies etc. 
Vanilla ice cream: It's good. I paid for it for my birthday friend despite I specifically mentioned my server about the "surprise" birthday thing... 


- Conqueror's Deduction - 
Over hyped. It's very light Southern-ish foods. I liked their hearty local ingredient specials but they aren't so much of "southern" foods. Carefully executed foods, but lacking in flavors. You can get better foods at breweries/bars in Oregon - Oregon restaurant /food scene has very very high standards. This is a "restaurant". 
Very Disappointed.


************* FYI *************
I don't know why but you see tons of "Southern Foods" in Oregon. What's up with that??? You see all kinds of cuisines in Oregon - even "American" (more contemporary) cuisine in Oregon is very creative and adventurous. Oregon is sort of a hidden foodie heaven....
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
I'm not gonna lie I wasn't blown away by this place. We were there Thursday morning so pretty much no wait which was solid. The food was very good. Grits delicious. Their special bacon was very underwhelming. The huevos rancheros were flavorful. Decently priced for how hyped this place is. Surprisingly very mediocre coffee options for how big a breakfast place this is.

If there's no wait for this spot, sure you'll have a solid meal for a pretty good price. If you have to wait I'd suggest going elsewhere.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: I appreciate that their portions are large and the food is always quality and tastes fresh. Portland is considered to be a foodie city, but I'm rarely impressed anymore. Too many pretentious restaurants relying on food art and a flashy dining room instead of a quality meal at an affordable price. Given the competition, Screen Door has remained consistent in their quality, portion sizes, and value. I've been going there for years and recently discovered that their burger is amazing! My favorite burger in town, hands down. I hope they stay true to their roots and keep doing things right unlike many old Portland establishments that have gone down hill as this city has fallen victim to gentrification. I highly recommend Screen Door.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
I'm from the Deep South and came here craving tastes of home. Their fried chicken plate is divine, although in Arkansas we would call this "chicken fried chicken" because it's fried fillets, not bone in.  It really hits the spot when I miss my granny's cooking. 

Their chicken sandwich lacks sweetness which makes it a little overly salty for me. They should add a sweet element to the base of the slaw, or honey to the breading of the chicken, to balance the flavor. Personal opinion--it ain't really fried chicken if it isn't at least a little spicy. A bit of vinegar based hot sauce in the buttermilk marinade or the batter would be downright lovely. I know you can add it yourself, but I just have to speak up on behalf of good fried chicken. 

Their fried green tomatoes are just like home, and I love their bourbon cocktails and sweet tea. Staff are so kind. I've eaten here alone at the bar and they made small talk with me when I was homesick. I've ordered takeout from them since covid and it was well-packaged, delicious, and still crispy when I got it home. Their beet salad was delicious, too.

After trying fried chicken at nearly every restaurant in Portland, this is my favorite, and the only one made in true Southern style. With a little more sweetness and spice to the chicken I'd call it as good as home's.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
Officially our first meal upon arriving PDX and we were welcomed with a big crowd waiting to be seated for Saturday brunch. It didn't take as long as I expected it to be and I have the help-yourself-Stumptown-coffee at the bar to thank for. Names were called and you either hear some clapping or an excited cheer from the party about to get seated, or crickets because the group had left. Since they close at 2PM (half hour later on weekends) and open again around 5ish, it does not give you much leeway if I say come at an off-peak time but maybe arriving half an hour before opening and closing would help. Maybe.

I went with the popular FRIED CHICKEN AND WAFFLE ($11.95) and opted for 1 glorious chicken breast vs the 3 pieces a regular order came with. Gotta leave room for the other restaurants we were planning on hitting up that day. Suffice it to say, I could have been fine with 2 pieces with my appetite. The buttermilk coating made for a nice crunch to the exterior and though the chicken was tasty, it wasn't the eye-rolling-moaning-kind-of-good. The sweet potato waffles on the other hand were made with divine intervention - light and airy with a subtle crisp. 

Now, the CHICKEN FRIED PORK SHOULDER ($14.50) was on a whole different level. Fried to a golden perfection, the tender and juicy pork screams flavor across the board with a hearty and delicious sausage gravy to top it all off. This was a far more memorable dish than the fried chicken, I tell you.

Both the service and vibe of this place was endearing and fun. To be handed a plate of CANDIED BACON by the table next to us so we can try a piece was such a random act of kindness that we couldn't refuse no matter how bizarre it was. When in Rome, right? Sweet, salty, and really rich - one bacon was sinfully plenty. 

Glad we got to try their brunch but I think next time I want to come for dinner.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: This is a must for anyone visiting Portland -There are many breakfast places for sure but this place is a standout -  Weekend there will be a wait - but they are very efficient at what they do -I watched them bus a table of eight in less than 5 mins - Food is amazing - we had the cat head biscuit and biscuits and gravy very yummy post nap worthy
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: Amazing food and super filling!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
If you are in Portland for a weekend, this is the place to go! Pro tip: go in 20 minutes before they open! We arrived about 5 minutes after they opened, and there were already a lot of people there. We ended up waiting about 15 minutes for a table of 2 on a Saturday morning.

My friend and I ordered the Chicken & Waffles, Hush Puppies, and Bread Pudding. The chicken & waffles was probably the best thing I had eaten in Portland - super crispy and flavorful chicken + amazing toasted waffle underneath. The hush puppies was just okay, I didn't really enjoy them after having the amazing chicken & waffles. The bread pudding wasn't too sweet, which I really enjoyed. The whipped cream on top was an amazing complement to the actual bread pudding.

Overall, I'd recommend sharing with a friend so you can try more dishes here! Definitely one of the best brunches I've ever had!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
Well...we were trying to get in here for the last 2 days! First attempt was Saturday night...go figure it was a long wait (all great Portland eateries do!). Was raining so moved on...but came back in Sunday night and waited about 15 min. (Around 8p). So if it wasn't apparent there is usually a wait to get into here.  Worth the wait!! Wife had chicken strips and collard greens. An app. and a side. Quite well done! I had the fried pork shoulder with butter beans!  Was AWESOME! Drinks were great as well...well made and surprisingly inexpensive ($20 for a rye Manhattan and a grey goose lemon drop). 
Will definitely be back!!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
We knew to expect a long wait for a table before coming here. Put our name on the list at 11am, got a table at about 1220ish.

As usual, I referred to yelp when trying to figure out what to order and went with the fried oyster benedict.  My friend ordered some kind of hash, not sure what exactly. 

Then we waited at least another 40 minutes after ordering.  Our server was super nice and apologetic about it.  He offered to bring us some fruit so that we had something to munch on while we waited.  We probably should have accepted because it was another 15-20 minutes before our food finally came out.

Everything was pretty good.  We enjoyed our meal and the excellent service we received, despite the wait.  

Do I think that the total wait was actually worth it? No way. It might be for you, just be sure not to wait until you're already starving to try this place out.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
Heard it through the grapevines that dinner is better than brunch, so we arrived and waited in line for 15min for a table. Got it our server was very sweet and attentive!

Get the CHICKEN AND WAFFLES! The fried chicken is to die foorr!
Braised Pork shoulder was good! Tender and juicy. Quite tasty!
Salads were super refreshing with a nice dressing!
Collard greens and coleslaw were good!
Mac & Cheese was ok.
Pass on the cornbread, it was a bit dry & bland, but had corn. Sad since I love cornbread.

Drinks:
Get the cocktail with muddled ginger- it's interesting if you like ginger.
Had a Mai Thai &it was too sweet. Pass.
Flight of whiskeys. It was ok. Pass.

Overall, service was great and food was good! I'd come back for the chicken &waffles and veggies!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: I've had so many different chicken-and-waffle dishes in my life, I thought I had tried it all. Then I tried Screen Door's chicken and waffles and O M G. First of all, where else are you going to find a SWEET POTATO WAFFLE?? I'm not even a huge fan of sweet potato but this just hit different. The chicken was crispy and crunchy, and the ratio of breading to meat was pretty good! I also got the brisket mac and cheese which was super flavorful--cheese, mac, brisket, and a buttload of jalapeños, what's not to love? I was sad they didn't have the praline bacon, but all in all, the hype for this place is well deserved!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
Fried okra was delicious. Fresh, hot, well seasoned, perfect amount of breading. Dipping sauce was decent but heavy on dill so make sure you are into that, but they are fine without the sauce too.

Fried smoked wings were great, smoky flavor but crispy on the outside and fresh and hot - highly recommended. Fried catfish was also good and freshly fried and not dry and breaded nicely (not too much and not too little) and uses the same dipping sauce as the okra.

Collard greens were alright, had decent flavor.

The raspberry front porch swing was really great, but I'm still uncertain if they actually put alcohol in there because you definitely couldn't taste it and I didn't even get a slight buzz. 

The gumbo was disappointing, I wouldn't order it again. It was just like a dark soup, slightly bitter beef stew. I lived in New Orleans so I know what good gumbo tastes like, and this tastes like it came out of a can and was simmered down too much.

Overall, I would definitely come back, but skip the gumbo.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: I got lucky when I went. There wasn't a line! The food portions were big and the atmosphere was clean and welcoming. The staff was also very friendly. I got the biscuits and gravy with scrambled eggs and ordered a side of potatoes. My buddies got the fried chicken and waffles and the poboy with cheese grits. Everything came out delicious!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: Was able to get a seat without waiting...which I've heard is hard to do unless you get there right when they open.  The tables are spaced pretty close together, but overall the food and staff are great!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: We came here for my birthday a few days ago and we were pretty disappointed. We all ordered the fried chicken (which is supposed to be the famous dish here) and it was really peppery and flat. I'm not usually the type of person who thinks pepper is spicy but the batter had such an overwhelming pepper flavor you couldn't even taste the chicken. No vegetables on the side, you have to order those separately which I think is weird especially since it's almost $20. The Mac and cheese was good, and if I come back I'll definitely just get that.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: I can't believe that it took me this long to check out Screen Door. OMG. I think I must've had the best fried chicken here. It took forever to prepare but was totally worth the wait. The batter was the right balance of thickness, crispness, and flavor. It complimented and made the chicken better, like Robin to Batman. Another delightful surprise was the Mac 'n Cheese. Again, hands down the best Mac that I've ever had for its orchestration of high-end cheesy flavors. I was tempted to ditch the spoon and eat out of the bowl like a trough. Make sure to arrive maybe 30 minutes before opening to get a good seat inside. There will be a line!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
Hands down our favorite meal while in Portland. We loved the atmosphere, our server was very attentive, and the food was nothing short of amazing. Our party of 6 waited about 45 minutes for our table on a Friday night, however we were able to order drinks at the bar while we wait. 

We alI came with empty stomachs not knowing what to expect, but the food did not disappoint. My boyfriend and I ordered the special of the night which was a 16 oz ribeye steak paired with brussels sprouts and a puff pastry (can't remember the name). Also ordered a side of the buttermilk fried chicken, fried oysters, as well as the macaroni and cheese. Everything was a hit, but the winners of the night were the fried oysters and macaroni and cheese. Oysters were full of juice and every bite had me wanting more. Trust me when I tell you, this mac and cheese is what you would call comfort food. The richness from the cheese and crunchy layer on top had you feeling like you went to heaven every bite. 

Our eyes were definitely bigger than our stomachs, and took home half of our steaks and a few pieces of chicken. To our surprise, the steak was still tender and juicy after reheating it the next morning and was the perfect meal to start the day. 

Overall, we had a pleasant experience here and would definitely return the next time we're in Portland.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
alright ya'll, after my second visit to the screen door & my third trip to portland, i can now say with confidence that the screen door serves up the best brunch in portland hands. down. like holy shit! portland has some real winners too, like cheryl's on 12th, bröder, & tasty n' daughters, but screen door is honestly worth trying above anything else, especially if you don't have much time to spend in portland! 

we came here for the first time last october, but most recently on wednesday 9/18 for brunch. we drove down from seaside & arrived here just a little past 1:00 pm. they do close at 2:00 pm on weekdays & re-open for dinner service at 5:00 pm. we waited about 5 minutes & were seated on the covered patio. last time i had the blueberry lemon pancakes but i ate a lot of my husbands chicken since he had the 3 piece chicken & waffle but was sick off a gross gas station coffee that he had on our drive down from seattle & didn't get to enjoy nearly as much as I did. this time i had the chicken biscuit sandwich & substituted my grits for potatoes. my husband had the two piece chicken & waffles. 

savory over sweet is the way to go here! the pancakes are good but their fried chicken is unreal, literally cooked to juicy, crispy perfection & is even better with the hot sauce! my meal was to die for! we both licked our plates clean! service is still impeccable! prices are cheap compared to the portions & quality of their food! if you're in portland i'm begging you to try the screen door!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
I LOVE Screen door! No chicken and waffles in the south-- we live in Alabama now -- is as good as that at the Screen Door. I'm not boasting.

The food is pricey, but not when you consider the huge portions. And there can be a long wait, so it's best to get here early.

This is a highly-rated restaurant and has been an award-winning staple of Portland food culture. With delicious Portland-flavored southern cuisine, comfortable and welcoming atmosphere, and generous portions, Screen Door definitely continues to earn that reputation.

The chicken and waffles is great -- and their signature breakfast dish -- and it is my wife's favorite. But, for my money, you gotta try the bananas foster french toast -- the ooey gooey brown sugar caramel sauce is to die for !!!

When you are in Portland, dont miss The Screen Door. But make sure you get in line early.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
WOW! This place lives up to the hype.

I'm from NYC, a place where they do chicken and waffles right! Screen Door does a spin on the classic. Sweet Potato Waffle with a large thin fried breaded chicken breasts. The flavor components hit high on all levels. Also the praline bacon was fantastic.

I don't think I need to say more simply 5 stars.

Go to this place, share with a party of two order a bunch of stuff from the menu. Leave out satisfied while paying an affordable price.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: Great food!  Come early if you want to have Saturday breakfast.  Otherwise, will have to wait in a long line (still worth it).
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: We were on a road trip from Seattle to Phoenix and our meal at the Screen Door ended up in our top 3 places that we visited! We were so overwhelmed by the line when we got there but it moved quickly and we were seated out on the side porch in no time. Portions were huge and we took the leftovers and enjoyed them for lunch. HIGHLY recommended!!!!!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: I finally got into this place for breakfast one day when i drove by and saw there was only a couple people waiting. The food was good, altho the portions were oversized, if you like that kind of thing. I don't. I honestly wasn't sure what all the rave about is and why there is always a line at the door. Guess it's not everyone's cup of tea.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: The shrimp and grits is outstanding. I daydream about it. The chicken and waffles wasn't the best and I wouldn't order them again, but I'm glad I tried it.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: If you want amazing Southern Food, this place is it! The fried chicken the best in Portland. Mac & Cheese is a must try. You can forget the corn bread. Not good at all.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
If you come to Portland and haven't tried Screen Door, can you really say you been to Portland??

This place is a perfect brunch place. I heard it's always packed but coming on a week day definitely helped. I am a big chicken and waffle kind of guy and I have tried many at different places all over. Screen doors chicken and rice was definitely on my top 3, but I'm quite not sure if it takes the #1 spot in my book. Definitely good though. I love the option of choosing how many chicken pieces you want. Their chicken was good but I want to talk about their waffles- the waffles were top tier. It was done just right- crunchy yet fluffy. Their shrimp & grits was the perfect comfort food. It's great especially if it's gloomy weather. 

It's a little pricey and parking is street only. It's definitely a place you gotta come at least once when you're in Portland. But given the long wait and its price, it's not a place I would probably come too often.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
Bursting with good food, positive vibes and happy people!

There was a wait, but like the maître d' said - patient people are awarded a booth!  And we were!   It was great too that if you were waiting by the door, they made sure that you still had an opportunity to get a drink.

Service was crisp and error-free from start to finish.  Loved the shrimp grits and the hush puppies appetizers.  Also got lots of pleasure from the Rogue Dead Guy Ale!  A bonus too that our plaid-shirted waitress asked if we wanted fresh glasses for our second round of ales.

As expected the signature fried chicken was perfect, which both JP and I ordered.  The smoky taste of the gravy that came with the mashed potatoes evoked in me an image of a crackling campfire.

The pecan pie was very good, but it came with a little dollop of whipped cream, not the vanilla bean ice cream advertised on the menu.

I do have one suggestion:  ditch the sickly sweet poppy seed dressing that comes with the hush puppies.  I was much happier using the shrimp grits as my dipping sauce.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: Everyone raves about their breakfast menu but I would definitely recommend trying this spot out for dinner! They have a great selection of cocktails and the fried chicken and house gumbo is incredible. Finding parking can be difficult in this area of town but definitely one of our favorite restaurants in Portland!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: I can only say everything was extraordinary, the short wait was worth it. We tried several breakfast dishes and everything was amazing.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
A friend of my love suggested that we come here as it is "life changing."  They opened at 9am on a Saturday and we got there ten minutes prior having to go to the end of the line that wrapped around the side of the building.  We were lucky to get seated in the patio area which was warm on such a cold day due to the heating lamps up above.  

I was torn between the chicken and waffles or the cat head chicken biscuit sandwich; it is called cat head because the chicken in the sandwich is as big as cat head.  I opted for the cat head chicken biscuit sandwich as I wanted to try something a different with a side of sweet potato waffle.  Immediately I was happy about my choice when my entrees were presented in front of me.  The biscuit had gravy that just covered the sandwich; it makes my mouth water just thinking about it.  I could not help but say, Mmmm, with every bite I took.  Don't get me started with the sweet potato waffle.  I saw bits of sweet potato when I cut into the waffle.  Our waiter brought us some kind of butter that made the waffle taste like a sweet potato pie!  We didn't even the gravy.  My love got the shrimp and grits.  That did not disappoint either.  Just when he thought he ate all of the shrimp, he was finding more pieces of shrimp throughout his dish.  I washed it all down with an ice cold sweet tea.  That drink was on point.  Best sweet tea I ever had.

The bill was not too bad.  In fact, I was expecting it to be more.  Great food and awesome service for such a good price.  Can't beat that!  As we were heading out, there was already a wait; people were waiting outside and inside to be seated.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: The chicken & sweet potato waffles were delicious.  Chicken was juicy & perfectly seasoned & the waffles were fluffy & you can tell they put sweet potatoes in the batter. Even though we came 20 minutes b/f closing, which we felt bad about the service was excellent. The place has a really comfortable feel to it too.  Will definitely come back.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: Start your review...Loved the Screen Door!  They know how to fry chicken. I'm from the South and I was impressed.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: These people are the Olympic champions of chicken and waffles. I have never had anything else there but why would I bother? Those chicken and waffles are perfect.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: As someone from the south it's good to have a place I can go to for real southern breakfast.  The chicken and waffles are bomb, hush puppies are delicious, perfect biscuits especially with some cane syrup and by far the best sweet tea in town all at Screen Door.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
