text: One of the best Southern, Cajun/creole in PDX.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: A MUST try if you are in the Portland area or even a local. Chicken and waffles are a must try and the Mac n cheese is amazing!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: One of my favorite spots for soul food in Portland. Definitely check out their fried chicken sandwich which is amazing! Right now there is no indoor seating but it's still a great place to eat and the neighborhood is nice too. I did a video review here: https://youtu.be/cUHkwaiEcKI
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: Fried chicken sandwich was exactly what I wanted! So good. Fries were standard shoestring but the Cajun seasoning was good. Biscuits- standard. Mac and cheese had great flavor but could have used a bit more cheese and a bit less flour/thickener. We were unimpressed with the hush puppies but the fried ricotta dumplings were to die for!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
Had to wait a little more than two full hours for Screen Door (partially in the rain), but it did not disappoint. The food is phenomenal! I would definitely recommend coming here before they open to avoid the ridiculous wait times on the weekend though.

FOOD: 10/10
AMBIANCE: 6/10
SERVICE: 6/10 

FOOD - 
+ Chicken & Waffles ($14.95): Best chicken and waffles I've ever had! And it was ENORMOUS. You get 4 giant pieces of chicken that are juicy, lightly battered and huge! I'm really picky about my fried chicken, and I absolutely loved it!! This is a MUST GET :) Every table in the restaurant had an order of this.

+ Fried Oyster Eggs Benedict (~$13): SO GOOD! If you love oysters and eggs benedict, you must get this dish as well. There's only 3 fried oysters, but they were all huge oysters and were so fresh and juicy as well. This dish was so unique, and I would highly, highly recommend it. The eggs benedict themselves tasted like they had a little bit of caramel in them. They weren't anything extraordinary, but the fried oysters made the dish. 

+ Mimosa ($4): Had to :) 

AMBIANCE - 
The atmosphere of the restaurant isn't anything too special. Nothing really stood out. There were just lots of people all the time.

SERVICE - 
Our server was nice but not very friendly. Not sure if that's a Portland thing or not? We had rather strange service at a plethora of different restaurants throughout Portland.

Overall, this is a must eat place in Portland for brunch! I would not skip out on this restaurant. Next time, I want to try the biscuits and gravy :)
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: We had an incredible experience at Piattino....the wait staff was attentive the food was incredible and the owner was absolutely engaging..... What an enjoyable evening!!!!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
I absolutely loved the chicken and waffles here. There are 3 big pieces of chicken and they were all so moist. I couldn't stop thinking about it since this was my first stop during this whole trip. The sweet potato waffles were also delightful. 

We also got the breakfast corn dogs which we couldn't get to. I wouldn't get that again just bc I'm not a fan but if you're into that, it wasn't bad. I just like the hot dog on a stick type of corn dog. Oh and be careful bc all this juice squirts out and it'll burn your lips/mouth!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
Yes.  The line was to the door.
Yes.  We waited well over 30 minutes.
Yes.  It was definitely worth it.
So yes.  Just go!

For once, the hype was all that and more!  So very glad I came regardless of the endless Yelp reviews of "long lines.... come early...be prepared to wait..."

Their fried chicken (juicy and crunchy) and waffle (light and crispy) were amazing!  Buttermilk battered over sweet potato waffle.  Seriously get this!  You wont regret it.  Yum! 5 stars.

Crispy fried catfish, oysters and okra with a side of fries.  Loved it!  Not greasy at all.  Light and crunchy.  Moist and fresh.  Delicious! 5 stars..

I simply adored my experience at Screen Door.  I loved the ambiance. I loved the food!  I loved the small town feel and yet probably half of the patrons have traveled from all over to come here.  The outside and inside decor of the restaurant were so simple and humbling.  They have the most friendly hostess and server I have ever encountered in my life.  So, the entire wait to be seated was well worth it.

And despite the fact we had to park two blocks away on a residential streets, was definitely worth it.  I loved walking through this neighborhood.  The heart and tummy left very satisfied.

See you soon Screen Door!

#iLovePortland
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
I waited an hour.  The table next to me was having a familial breakdown, involving a son on drugs, a mom's enabling ways, and a dad who "couldn't take it anymore."  And even with that the brunch I had was completely pleasant (as was the service) and this place is one I'd visit again.

The Fried Chicken Cathead Biscuit Sandwich was a nice choice on my part, although it looks incredibly daunting with all of the breading involved.  The key to finishing was to put a biscuit half to the side to take with me, and going easy on the breading.  The chicken was tender and juicy, the breading and gravy flavorful.  

The one letdown there was the grits.  They were cheese grits, and the cheddar completely dominated (not in the good way).  They were also a bit on the watery side.

Another note for you is to try the breakfast corn dog.  Instead of a hot dog it's a breakfast sausage.  It's a nice take on the corn dog, but get one to split, as it's definitely a bit intense with the amount of salt and grease.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
18/100 Yelp 2018 Review Challenge

Ended my trip to Portland at Screen Door and it was quite a satisfactory end to a delicious weekend. The lines were pretty long on a Sunday ~12 PM so I'd recommend trying to come earlier if you have a big party. (Pssst, there's a tasty little coffee shop right next door that's a good place to occupy your time while you wait.)

Ordered the praline bacon, shrimp and grits, and the chicken and waffles. I'm a savory over sweet breakfast person and this was just way too sweet. Interesting concept, but it was just way to sweet for my taste buds. The shrimp and grits were pretty good - wish it was a little more seasoned since I ended up using a lot of tobasco to brighten up the flavor. The chicken and waffles was what I was really there for and that did NOT disappoint. They give a lot of chicken and the crispy batter is just perfect with the fluffy waffle.

Definitely lived up to the hype and I would consider coming back the next time I'm in Portland!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
Screen Door was my first stop in Portland and it didn't disappoint. 

My fiancé and I ordered:
- Shrimp and grits: Love at first bite. So much flavor packed into this dish. I traded dishes to let my fiancé try and the grits were practically gone when he returned my plate. Not gonna lie, I was pretty upset. You would think 4 shrimp may not be enough, but the grits to shrimp ratio was just right. I had another shrimp leftover after my grits were gone. Not mad at that!
- Fried chicken and waffles: I loved the chicken seasoning - it tasted like french fry seasoning if that makes sense and I mean that in the best way possible. I liked that the sweet potato waffles had cinnamon/pumpkin notes. 
- Praline bacon: Just the right amount of sweetness. My shrimp and grits came with a biscuit, so my fiancé and I made mini praline bacon/scrambled egg biscuit sandwiches. Reminiscent of day after Thanksgiving ham sandwiches. So good. 
- Blueberry lemon curd buttermilk pancakes: Loved everything up until I tried these pancakes. They looked fluffy af but were dry and dense. Would skip these. 

I came on a Friday morning and waited about half an hour. It was so busy (as expected) but our server made every effort to make sure we were taken care of. I would definitely return next time I'm in Portland.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
Food is really good. 

They have no designated parking lot, so you're forced to go looking for parking out in the street which is hard to find or you're stuck parking far away. 

The wait time is ridiculous. You wait over 2 hours to get in and eat at an overly crowded place. 

Food is good, but it is not worth the time.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
Good ol southern fare here. Even with a growing crowd, our party of three was seated in 10 min. as there is a fair amount of seating. I know the northwest prides itself with coffee and the coffee I had here was great. I don't know if the quality of coffee has anything to do with this place but its certainly getting credit. It was good, just like that south hospitality they kept it full, which brings me to the staff who were all friendly and when our main server was tied up, another stepped in no problem. 

So what did I actually have? I had the Praline waffle with the strip of bacon. Definitely different from the run of the mill waffle and could almost be a dessert with its presentation, plenty of nuts and 4 nice swirls of whipped cream. It was very good, but it was a bit too Hard and crunchy like it was toasted too long. I know some people might like this so if you like it more soft in the middle like me, you may want to ask. Other than that this place was great and if I'm in Portland again would like to go again.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: Praline Bacon  is  !!! I want to try everything on the menu. Everyone I have taken there has been blown away.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: I had a great breakfast here and left happy. The portions were good. I eat a lot and I even had trouble finishing it.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: If you're gonna go, just go early. We got there about 15 minutes after they opened on a Monday and there were plenty of seats still available. Ordered the single waffle and two piece chicken to split, along with the praline encrusted bacon. Plenty of food for the two of us and we still couldn't finish it all. Just keep that in mind when ordering. Less is more especially considering the food is pretty rich and filing. Definitely one of the top breakfast spots in town!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: This is literally one of my favorite places in portland to eat out. Best chicken and waffles in town, but everything there is great!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
We stopped by Screen Door for our lunch around 12pm and everyone is already in line, but we can get in pretty quick and the staffs are pretty nice to set up a table for us. We visited here a few time  for dinner, but this was our first time for brunch. I love to seat outside to enjoy the weather.

Foods: we ordered a few dishes: fried oysters Benedict, special bacons, famous fried chicken waffles- 2 pieces, and the breakfast sandwiches (kinda too much). I love the their oysters, crispy outside and soft inside, so we finished 4 oyster quickly and move to the benedict. I love how they cooked the eggs, it's like sunny side up and melt in your mouth. For the famous fried chicken, I love the cripy part, but not the taste since it's  too salty to me. Waffles are crispy and you can easy finish it all. 

Environment: friendly and welcoming 

Price: fair to the foods 

Overall, I would love to come back here occasionally with my friends and family to enjoy the brunches.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
Went here on vacation, food was good.  ordered online, the food was not ready when they said it was to be.  

Daughter got the chicken strips, which turned out to be really spicy, landed up pulling off all the batter for her unfortunately.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
Fried chicken is killer.  Waffles are waffles, they're just a vessel. The biscuits and gravy are good, too-- heavy, dense biscuits with a lot of flavor. Worth the wait if you follow my tips:
Have a snack first, show up, put your name down, go for a coffee next door and try no to be grumpy-butt. You were warned there would be a wait and you still showed up, so be nice to the staff and enjoy your fried chicken!
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: Delicious. So glad we love close enough now to frequent more often. Always busy but always amazing food and service.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text: I can NOT wait to come back to try even more! We ordered the Griddlestack burger and switched the fries for hush puppies, and oh boy were those puppies fresh and delicious! The burger had seasonings on it I've never tasted before and they all blended together to create this fantastic savory flavor I'm drooling for again. We also ordered the fried buttermilk chicken with coleslaw. My oh my was that chicken fresh and juicy. Coleslaw had an overpowering amount of pepper in it for my own taste. Service was prompt and fun, and the restaurant itself was clean and had a more upscale feel to it.
categories: Caterers, Restaurants, Breakfast & Brunch, Southern, Event Planning & Services, Bakeries, Cajun/Creole, Food
name: Screen Door

text:
Mike's is an icon of the North End in Boston and if famous for it's cannolis due in part to President Clinton's visit when he was in office.

Mike's offers a HUGE variety of cannolis, along with other pastries.  

There's always a line for Mikes, especially on the weekends when the line can extend a couple of blocks.  Be sure to bring cash as they don't except credit cards.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: Seriously SUCH delicious and authentic italian cannolis. If you're in the North End do not hesitate to make stop here! There might be a line because this place is very popular with good reason to be. Plenty of cannoli options and other pastries and baked goods.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt

text: This is so overrated.  The shell was old.  The taste Ok.  I do not see what the hype is all about.  plus they only take cash.  I will not be going thee soon.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
The Cannoli are good, but the rum cakes are the real prize.  Cannoli this, cannoli that; there isn't a lot of brilliant science that goes into them.  But a rum cake?  There is art.  Keeping them from drying out, staying moist but maintaining good shape isn't easy.  Neither is creating one that has all that rummy deliciousness and sweetness that doesn't vere into construction materials density.

Ended up here not based on the quality of reviews, but the sheer volume; and I was not disappointed.  

If you're in Boston, go here.  Get a cannoli, but don't miss the rum cakes.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: Don't kill me... Food was very good, but not better than any other independent bakery. Waaaaaaay too crowded, and cash only? Come on.

text: This place rocks. I had the espresso cannoli and my only qualm was that it was so massive I barely got through half of it. Gelato is apparently delicious, too.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: With over 2700 reviews how could you not try it. Stopped by early In the afternoon and the line was out the door. Came back after eating brunch and walked right in. Then within a few minutes it was packed again. People come in waves and it's hard to judge when a good time is. Grabbed some pistachio macaroons, pistachio cannoli, and an Oreo cannoli. Service was very friendly despite how packed the place was. I was expecting staff to be rude and stressed out. We were in and out in five minutes. Overall, stuff was very good, but I've had better cannoli's. They do have way more variety of cannoli's I've ever seen. I'd go back when in the area.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
Delicious, I in fact feel like going there right now. But the lines are always huge and the waiting to get the food for 15-20 minutes kind of gets on your nerves if you just want a cannolli. There are plenty of places down the street which are great as well with smaller lines.

Staff is friendly.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
The place is packed, because their cannolis are sugary and creamy, fatty and fantastic. Not life-changing, and you'll have to deal with the line, but if you're a dessert person, Mike's is worth a shot. 

If you're not willing to wait a bit, hit the Harvard Square location. It gets much less traffic - for now!
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: HOLY CANNOLI! My first time ever trying a cannoli and just WOW! There is definitely a reason why this place gets over 3000 reviews and that is bc of the fast service, quality pastries, and cute "family-owned" environment vibe! I'll definitely make a trip back to Mike's if I'm in  the Boston area. Yummm!
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
Mike's is fabulous! Their pastries are so delicious, yet so cheap! I always get the Oreo Cake, and my boyfriend loves the tiramisu and cannolis.

They also sell two dozen flavors of gelato, which is a great summer treat and budget-friendly, and rock candy, which is just fun.

I also like their cookies, but I was disappointed by their black-and-whites. They were frosted with soft frosting, not a hard fondant icing like black-and-whites should have. (Ironically, Shaw's makes them properly.)

The line can be intimidating, but it moves fast so you don't wait long. You do have to be a bit pushy and willing to crouch/stand on your tiptoes to see the full selection, but it's totally worth the effort.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
Meh. It's a'ight.

Go to Bova's.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: The long lines here are a good indication that what's inside is a treat! I've been to Mikes pastry every time I've visited Boston. About 5 times now. I always get the pistachio cannoli and then a new cannoli to try. Chocolate dipped was delicious! Great cannoli texture and sweet but not overly sweet cream filling. These treats are pricey but I say they're worth it. Take a trip to Little Italy and try the best treat in the hood.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
CASH ONLY!
Overall Mikes is a big pastry shop on the main street of the north end, where you can get everything from a nice cake, to cookies, cannolis, and petzels. You can go in easily on a weekday around lunch yet during the spring, summer, and any weekend the place is mobbed. I won't judge them for doing a solid business but it would be nice if the staff was a bit friendlyer even during 'rush hour'. 

I grew up going to the North End as a child for St. Anthony's feast starting at 4 weeks old... its a family tradition and I've had my fair share of lobster tails, cannolis, petzels, and other italian favorites. Overall the canolies and other goodies are better than Modern (accross the street), the store is bigger to fit more customers and their wide selection yet I prefer mom and pop bakeries, less commercialized like BOVAS! Just a personal preference... I feel like if your looking for traditional italian and a sense of authentisity mikes is so-so... 

All-in-all the pastries are good but not worth waiting outside, down the block, especially in the  summer heat when you can walk a block or two to a smaller shop and get served within 2 minutes.

*The Yelp 100 Challenge
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: Mike's Pastry is definitely a North End staple. The line can get pretty long, but it moves fast. The chocolate chip cannolis and lobster tail pastries are to die for. The place gets pretty packed with tourists on the weekends, but I've found that during weekday afternoons it's pretty deserted. There aren't many tables in the actual bakery, you're better off walking down the street a few blocks and going to one of the many close by parks. Mike's is cash only so make sure you're prepared!
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: This is probably my favorite pastry shop. The one in Cambridge at Harvard square recently added card payments. Before it was just cash, but now they are being more inclusive to those without cash...hahaha. Love ya mikes! I just wish you could lower your prices, broke college students can't really afford you.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: Usually a long wait but its part of the experience...  Its a tourist spot for a good reason.  Everything I've had from here is delicious
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: I had the pleasure of visiting Boston six years ago and one of the places that we visited to have some desert was Mike's Pastry. Here they are famous for variety of the Italian treats called Cannoli. This past week several of my co-workers went to a business trip and remembered how I raved about this place and surprised me with two cannolis. The two flavor were the nutella and the amaretto, which were really good and sweet. The Shell was nice and crushy, while my personal favorite was the nutella. I strongly recommend Mike's to anyone who are planning a trip to Boston anytime soon.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
What can I say that 1000 previous reviewers haven't already said??  How about the fact that I met (and had my picture taken) with world reknown Irish Tenor Ronan Tynan!!  (We miss you @ Yankee Stadium)

We stopped in on a Sat. night to pick up some delicious pastry, the line was half way down the block but that didn't deter us.  Line moves very quickly so don't let it scare you.  DW got the Tiramisu, DD had a cookie and I went with a hazelnut cannoli.  One of the better that I've ever had.  Definitely worth the trip and the short wait in line.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt

text: Amazing treats with an interesting atmosphere. We got a little of everything and it was all phenomenal!
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
Why is everyone walking the Freedom Trail with these white boxes tied with string?  

After a two day conference, I had to find out, so I called a cab to the airport via Mike's.  I thought if the crowd is even close to the line on Sunday, the driver would be instructed to keep driving.  As luck would have it, a parking space smack dab in front opened up as we pulled up and no line at all!

Cannolli are the specialty and pick from around 15 flavors!  Since the meter was running....give me the six most popular gut busters...$22 out the door to catch my flight back to SFO.

TSA agents did not confiscate for their break time and i became the traveler with the white box tied with string.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: The desserts are to die for.  The lines can be long and the place gets crowded.  Advice-- get your dessert to go and head over to the waterfront- over by Joes Bar and Grill, eat your dessert outside.  Other than that, I just love this place.

text:
Mike's Pastry, located on Hanover Street is a North End institution. With famous patrons such as the United States Presidents, locals and tourists always frequent Mike's. I have taken items to go including birthday cakes, as well has had table service. The few front seats at the front of the store are for table service and they are always full.

Items I enjoy:

Cupcakes, cream puffs and lobster tail cream puffs

Italian cookies, chocolate chip cookies and marzipan

When sharing, I order a lobster trail, but to enjoy the decadence of a lobster tail by myself, I order a chocolate covered lobster puff. Cream puff, filled with light sweetened whip or ricotta cream covered in solidified chocolate

Chocolate chip covered cannoli
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
O M G TOTALLY the best in EVERYTHING but hugely known for the many flavors of cannoli. 

The creme brûlée is soooooo good along with the hard to get marzipan. Lordy just EVERYTHING. 

Don't let the cRaZy lines deter you from hoping into the fray, they do move quickly and so worth the wait. I've been there many times when the line is outside and down the block and I don't hesitate to grab a spot in line. 

It's so cute to see the white bakery boxes with Blue string being walked all around the North End and knowing so many people out there have such great taste :)
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
I've only had a cannoli and a slice of black forest cake here.  The cannoli was amazing and has ruined all other cannolis for me.  It was filled with super rich, vanilla-scented ricotta with chocolate chips.

The black forest cake was very flavorful, moist, and delicious, but it was overshadowed by the cannoli.  Sigh... will definitely return here the next time I'm in Boston.

text: YUM!  The chocolate ricotta are fantastic!  Have also had the lobster tail before. The best I ever had.

text: I cannot say that their cannolis were good. I tried 3 different types: chocolate chip, Pistachio and regular. None of them stood out, or had that "cannoli, Italian" taste to them that you would get in the NY/NJ ones. So I do not get the hoard of people who lineup on these disorganized lines to get them.

text:
Everyone said this was the best place in Boston for pastry. They were right.  They had a variety of cannoli flavors so you have to decide.  We tried the amaretto.  It was the most expense so we thought it had to be the best!  It had a definite almond taste but not too sweet.  

We walked by several times and there was a line, but got right in on Sunday morning about 10:00.

text: The line that snakes out of the building and around the corner tell you all you need to know.  This place is an institution!   I have never seen such a variety of cannoli.  I am old school, so I stuck with the traditional ricotta, YUM!  The cannoli shell is chock full of creamy, sweet filling which oozes out with every bite.  Also tried their cupcakes, which are not only beautiful, but very tasty and just the right size - not too large, not too small.  The biscoti were just OK.  Love their almond macaroons too.  This place is crazy busy, but don't fret when you see that long line.... it moves pretty quickly and the staff who wait on you are very efficient.  Oh, and this place is cash only!
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt

text: One can never visit Boston without a visit to Mike's Pastry's for the BEST cannolis on the planet.

text: This place gives the old look while still keeping it modern today. canollis here are so good and that big. Grab a lot of napkins because it is going to be messy and cream filling will drip all over the place. Lines can get pretty long sometimes out the door if it's nice out or on a friday/saturday evening. The best place to get canollis I'd recommend it.

text:
This place...what to say...is just amazing. Now yes it's retardedly hyped up, but it's actually deserving of the hype. I had actually sworn off cannolis ...like srsly I hated those things... but after getting numerous pokes from the boyfriend and a random couples insistent recommendation I decided to give this place a shot. 


The cannoli was SO damn good. I mean yes, I can't really do sweet things well in mass amounts so I couldn't finish it but still, so.good.


TLDR: just go. The line may seem long but there are actually like 8 lines inside so if u see a long add line outside just hustle on inside and pick the shortest one. Your welcome

text: I have heard you can't come to Boston and not go to Mike's. After tasting a Mike's cannoli first hand (get the florentine -- SO GOOD), I can vouch this is VERY TRUE! All the cannoli looked great. You can't really go wrong with anything they have available. The store is lined with cases of cannoli, cupcakes, cakes, pies, cookies, etc. Just remember to have cash on hand - it's cash only.

text: Just go there! You won't be disappointed, but be prepared to wait in line as Mike's is wildly popular.

text:

I tried both of them and they were quite decadent, I also tried my nephew's vanilla, it was a lighter version of the ones I have had and I am certainly coming back to try the rest of their stash

text:
How this place has anything but 5 stars is beyond me.  I got the cannoli dipped in chocolate.  It was bigger and heavier than a human baby.  I was able to put away about 2/3 of it before I had to give up.  

I have no problem declaring this the best cannoli and the best dessert food I have ever had.  If you go to Boston without going here, congratulations on your wasted trip.

text: Sometimes places get big marks because they're tourist traps, sometimes they're just damn good. Mike's is the latter.

text:
3.5 stars 

This is a good old fashioned pastry shop.  The line is chaos yet people tolerate it for the cannoli's.  They package your treats up in a box and tie it up with string that hangs from the ceiling.  It's a neat experience. We tried:

- chocolate dipped cannoli - standard
- espresso cannoli - the flavor was good although the texture of the filling was too grainy, even for ricotta cheese standards
- lemon cream - we tried this since my mom won't eat ricotta cheese - it was pretty tasty
- regular cannoli - standard

text: No line @8:30am... We passed Mike's last night around 9:30pm.  The shop was packed ( ? 30ppl) and the line outside the shop stretched out around the corner.  Is Mike's cannoli really better than others? Not really...it's just a hype. Mike's does offer different varieties of cannoli. I was surprised that the shell of pre-filled cannoli was still very crispy, but the filling was too rich for me. I still love the traditional cannoli not the fancy kind.  I would go back to Modern instead of Mike.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt

text: The place to go for desert......awesome cannoli and Italian cookies. The place always packed day or night. Limited seating and ONLY CASH!... Try my favorite pastry the lobster tail a custard filled pastry about the size of a baby's arm. Delicious!!! Leave the diet at home.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: As a Yelp elite in Chicago, I reached out to my fellow Yelpers for places to go in Beantown.  I had three responses for Mike's.  Since I love Canolis, I had to try Mike's.  The Canoli did not disappoint.  WOW!!! So Yummy!!!  My wife also ordered a few others things including an amazing pistachio cookie.  Mike's is definitely a must if you are in the North End.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
I really liked Mike's.  I ran in early on a Saturday morning (around 8:30) and the store was not crowded but there were a couple of people sitting at the tables reading and having coffee.  The staff was lovely!  So friendly, and helpful.  I went straight for the cannoli and picked out four -- florentine (the best one, hands down), peanut butter, pistachio, and chocolate ricotta.  Overall, the perfect cannoli -- delicious filling, nice crunchy outer shell -- they also have them available online so you can have them shipped to your house (which I suspect I'll be doing once I'm back in Philadelphia).
I also got coffee for my husband and a freshly prepared cappuccino for myself (it was perfect in every way!).  While I was waiting for my cappuccino to be made, they brought out chocolate covered strawberries and gave me two.  It was just a really fun experience, the whole thing.  

The biggest downside to my trip to Mike's is that we drove over and had no place whatsoever to park.  The streets around the store have  a lot of loading zones where you couldn't park -- the signage on every pole was ridiculous -- there seems to be a specific set of rules for every hour of the day.  When I asked in Mike's if I could park in one of those open loading areas they assured me that it was a terrible idea and that I would get a $55 ticket, so my husband had to stay out in the car and missed going in to pick out the cannoli.  If you can, public transportation/walking would be a better choice if you want to sit and eat in the store.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
You can't go wrong here, its the place where the tourists & the locals go. Cash only, but there's a Citizen's ATM across the street & a BOA ATM down the street. 

Their cookies are also good, as are their taramisu & lobster tail if you feel strong enough to venture beyond the cannoli. If you're a fan of nutella, the hazelnut one is good, but you can't really go wrong with even plain old chocolate chip. If you are new to the cannoli thing, check out Modern pastry too & have a taste test between Mikes & Modern.

Almost always crowded, except on rainy winter days. The most crowded you will see it is on summer days when there is a "feast" going on in the North End. (Google it if you don't know what it is). Even on those days your wait would be 20 minutes in-out tops.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: Variety is not always the spice of life, at least when it comes to cannolis. I will never again be wowed by the number of fillings and will instead patronize establishments  that fill their crispy shells to order. Whether a cannoli should be soggy or not is not an argument as has been suggestion elsewhere. A soggy cannoli is a bad cannoli.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
Loved this place! I tried this my first night in Boston, and the place was packed! They have such a wide variety of cannolis to choose from, as well as cupcakes and marzipan and other delicious treats! But almost everyone was there for the cannolis. We ended up getting a pistachio cannoli to split between the bf and I (we just came from dinner and didn't think we could fit a whole one each), and my brother a florentine cannoli, plus a chocolate chip one to take to a friend. While I don't know how my brother felt about his besides that it was a sugar overload, I liked the cannoli very much. I especially loved the dense ricotta filling and pistachio nuts at the ends, and the crispy shell. My bf didn't care for it as much, feeling that cannolis in general were too rich. I will admit it would have been good with a cup of tea or coffee, but I love my sweets so I loved the richness. 

If you are looking for cannolis with variety, Mike's is the place to go!
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
Mmm Lobster Tail.

No, they don't serve seafood.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: I am obsessed with this pastry shop! Every time I am in the north end I have to stop by here to grab a cannoli! No matter how full I am from all of the delicious Italian food in the area, I still find room for one of these. The cannoli's are huge so be prepared to share or to have left overs, but keep in mind the shell can get soft if kept too long (about 1/2) day. So far all of the flavors I have tried have been rich and delicious, especially their seasonal ones like pumpkin. There is always a crowd of people waiting, but the lines move fast, so spot one that looks like it moving quick and hop in! There are also very few tables so be prepared to eat this on the go or once you get your home/hotel.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: My friend and I were so lucky to get to Mike's Pastry on a rainy, cold day when no one was out, because we had heard the lines for this place get crazy! And rightfully so -- the cannoli here is just divine, and I'm not even the biggest fan of cannoli. but somehow, the creamy filling inside remains light and airy while the cannoli is crisp and beautifully fried. I ordered the espresso cannoli and it was a great balance of flavors. It's helpful to order quickly, because people are eager to order and the staff is eager to serve, so whoever is ready first will be served first. My experience with their cannoli and a latte on a rainy Boston day was a highlight of my trip. Please note they only accept cash, which is sort of a bummer if you don't know in advance, so come prepared!
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt

text: By far these are probably the best canolis I've ever had!!! Pretty interesting how you order them, just make sure you pay attention to where the lines are or else you will not get served. When I go back to MA, I am definitely hitting this place up again!!!
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: So happy I got to walk by and stop at Mike's. This place just exudes history and love. The pastry cases line half the store and there is less of a line and more of a free for all for one of the many friendly employees behind the counter. They have oodles and oodles of options so surely there is something for you to like here. Most notably they have about a million different types of canoli, it will surely be hard to pick just one or two of your favorites instead of splurging on them all (I know it was for me)!

text: Can't visit the North End and not stop by Mike's Pastry! The amaretto cannoli is the favorite but honestly, everything they serve is amazing.

text: Yum!!!! Need I say more! Go there every time we are in Boston! Discovered it when our daughter moved to Northborough, MA for Tufts Vet School.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: Great selection of pastries, especially cannoli. It's a pretty busy place but they get through the line quick. Not much space to eat there but they wrap it all to go. There are these cool round containers hanging from the ceiling that hold string to tie the boxes closed - pretty cool to see. They tie them really quickly.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
I am not a huge Cannoli fan, Though these were good, still not a fan. 
Was told by the GF's cousin to give this place a shot, so while in Boston, do as all the other tourist do, Hit up Mike's Pastry. Be ready for silly long lines and the staff telling you to keep moving forward and "Don't worry about cutting, You'll all get served". 
I don't care too much about gaining space when the person behind who has a serious Cannoli fetish shanks me in the back. 
You really need to know when you want by the time you get to the front and have your cash in hand. Watching them wrap up your box is kind of cool, they use string hanging down from the ceiling.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
As one reviewer said, "Put down your phone and just go."

I second that completely. Stop reading the reviews and just get over there, before five people get in front of you and you get frustrated. I know you, don't worry. ;)

If you're debating over whether to go to Mike's or Modern Pastry, just go to both. *shrugs* You're likely a tourist anyway, so don't worry if you need to treat yourself multiple times during your trip. :)

Honestly though, even if Mike's is the only place you end up going, you're not making a wrong choice. They have many options for your palate. I got the Pistachio Cannoli and my friend got the Florentine. Both options made a positive lasting impression. The cannoli was sprinkled with pistachios on the outside and mixed on the inside with ricotta/cream filling and more pistachios. What's not to love?

I love the inside of the building. The first thing that catches my eye is the simplicity of the cannoli drawings on the wall. I love it, it adds a cute touch to the place. It is pretty old looking and there aren't a lot of seats, but because it's so busy in there you probably don't want to stick around anyway. Take a left and head to the Paul Revere Park a few streets up. There are plenty of benches to plop down and gobble up your cannoli. 

Enjoy!
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: LOOOOVED IT! My family of 4 went into Mike's after eating dinner in Little Italy. I got a chocolate cupcake with chocolate fudge icicng, my fiance got chocolate cheesecake, and my daugher got red velvet cheesecake. They were all heavenly!!!  The icing was sweet, as some other reviewers have said. However, I like sweet icing and the flavor was decadent. PLEASE GO THERE...if you are a foodie, like I am, and, you also have a sweet tooth, you will be in pastry heaven at Mike's.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: Got the Amaretto canoli and it was one of the best cannoli's I've ever had.  The filling tasted fresh and the canoli was decorated beautifully.  Line was a little long, but they tried to get people through fast.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: We discovered Mikes around 11am on a Friday right after a belly-filling brunch.  The people behind the counter kept asking to help us as we stared wide-eyed at the glass trying to figure out what we'd gotten ourselves into. The pastries are HUGE.  From cannolis to cookies, there's so much to choose from it's overwhelming. I enjoyed a black and white cookie that was so light, fluffy and sweet I ate the whole thing, while dining partner fell in love with the Nutella-filled croissant. We saw so many people carrying boxes of these treats throughout the city the entire weekend. Next time we'll go without having just eaten and try the cannolis.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
In the mid 2000s I went all over the east coast on a hunt for the world's best cannoli. I thought I had found it in New York but when I tried Mike's Pastry, I never stepped food in the New York place again. 
This is a must for anybody visiting Boston.

Personal faves include cannolis, lobster tails, cheesecake and cookies.  They also make a mean hot chocolate.

text: We have heard all the good reviews of this place, so made trip there to give it a try. To be fair, the pastries were very complete and traditionally tasting. However, didn't find them"wow"! In fact, we tried the Cannoli  and Boston Creme Pie, and the pie was disappointing.  Just the taste and quality, I would rate it "3".  It is so unfortunate that service provided to us was poor -- the lady serving us was very rude, and the other associate didn't have the willingness to assist  (ie. I was only asking for forks and she very reluctantly went to get them for me despite  only few steps away...).  All together, they only deserve a "2"..
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: So after finally getting fed up of the Mike's Vs. Modern debate, I buckled down to do some cannoli science and sample two chocolate chip cannoli between the two embattled establishments. What I found seems to back the traditional findings: at Mike's you pay 50 cents more but it is proportionally bigger and has minutely better presentation (aside from the size and different shaped chocolate chips, they appear identical). As the Modern ones aren't pre-filled, their crust is crispier. Whether or not you prefer this is entirely a matter of taste, it really made no difference to me in my enjoyment of the cannoli's. For some reason Mike's seems more "fun" to be inside of though, as sometimes a gentle chaos is nice. Ultimately, both cannolis are five star worthy, the debate is pointless, and the superior establishment is whichever one has a shorter line when you arrive. I don't know how it happened, maybe some Boston travel book or something, but many tourists seem to think that locals prefer Modern over Mike's, and therefor is the "real", "authentic" choice. Maybe it is, and I totally encourage them to think this if it makes them feel better. However, you'll notice that many who have "done the science" will tell you they are equally great. In the end, I'm posting this same review under both establishments and can't recommend either of them enough.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:

text: I too don't understand what the hype is about.  I've been to Mike's several times over the years while visiting Boston.  The first cannolli was great because I had nothing to compare it to. The lines are ridiculous, the pastries are way way overpriced, the cannollis are chewy and the filling is equivalent to plaster (well said previous reviewers!), and the service isn't all that great.  I got that place checked off on my "places to go to before I die" list...yay me.

text:

text: I actually had not heard about Mike's Pastry before and stumbled upon it on our walk to look for a place to get a snack or dessert.  I hit jackpot when I saw a bunch of people ordering cannollis.  Ordered two cannolli's: 1) pistachio, and 2) chocolate creme.  The pistachio cannolli was fantastic and the filling was incredibly rich and delicious!  The chocolate creme wasn't bad but tasted a bit artificial.  The prices were very reasonable.  Wished they had more tables to seat their patrons.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt

text:
I'm from a family of bakers and this place is way awesome.  You'll have to fight your way through the crowd, but please have the "lobster tail"  It's a puff pastry filled with a mix of Ricotta, Custard, and white cream filling..so light and fluffy with just the right amount of sweetness. The pastry had a crunchy outside and a buttery inside PERFECTION!

We also had a Pistachio Macaroon that was out of this world!

The turnover here must be crazy. Everything was fresh and baked to a high standard as well as consistent.  What you see in the pictures on Yelp is what you will get.

Bring Cash, that's all they accept.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt

text:

2 Stars sums this place up perfect. Meh. I've experienced better.

text:
I'm not a cannoli expert by any means, but if it wasn't for the risk of diabetes and obesity I'd be willing to eat one from Mike's every day for the rest of my life.

text: Lines were CRAZY! Wrapped around the block, but definitely well worth it. Usually tourist traps like this are just that, but daggon' these cannolis were phenomenal. Worth the wait! Staff knows how to get it done and move people quickly. Don't be intimidated by the lines! It is definitely worth the wait. I love the chocolate covered cannoli...to die for! Quick tip...once you get in the door. GO LEFT! everyone naturally gathers to the right,  so go left for a quicker wait. Enjoy!
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
lol im going to quote something i saw that i thought was funny about mikes

"This place is for amateurs.
Betty Crocker
The Pillsbury Dough Boy
Aunt Jemima
and even that pirate hooker from Semi Homemade on the Food Network all hang their heads in shame knowing that y'all think these baked goods taste good."

That has to be the most accurate thing I have even seen about Mikes. 
Anyone who said they have good pastries is probably right because they have never had pastries anywhere else, because if they did they would realize that mikes pastry has enough sugar in their pastries to give you cavities with the first bite.

If anyone tries telling me the have Italian pastry you are dead wrong too. Italians would never ever ever ever put anywhere close to that much sugar or butter in their pastries. The closest you can come to an Italian pastry in the North end is Modern Pastry and a small caffe that imports them like caffe dello sport or the paradiso. 

By the way if you want a cannoli that was filled yesterday surrounded by a soggy shell, then yes this is your place, as well as the rats in their alley way playing around with their bags of sugar, thats always a sight for soar eyes. I saw that someone mentioned that there are always long lines and no prices, why is that? MARKETING they know how to con all of you! They advertise and commercialize themselves towards Americans that no offense, don't know a good pastry if it hit you in the face. So basically they get all these people who don't know any better telling people it's great. As well as the prices, well they can raise the price at will, and they make people that have never been there before stand in line without knowing the price so when you get to the counter you wont just walk away because you just stood in line for an hour and have to pay a good amount of money, I will say this though, they are not too expensive, although some people may think so, but you need to realize the cost of supplies have gone way up. 

Anyways don't go here please... there are sooo many better places
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: Holy Cannoli. Everyone carries around a box of these cannolis, and I see why. Stop in at Mikes if you have a chance.

text:
For one hot movie date, sneak in cannolis from Mike's.  I smuggled three in my purse thinking we'd save one.  Not so much.  I ordered two Florentine, and one chocolate dipped.  The Florentine has a less greasy flavor, and fits my liking a little bit more, but the classic with the chocolate dipped was delicious as well.  Ricotta goodness aplenty. 

The line can get crazy, but usually it moves pretty quickly, as the service is speedy.  There are pre-packaged treats and breads to grab and go if you need snacks in a hurry, but the cannolis are worth waiting for.

text: Cannoli was so good we had to go back for more.  Had the chocolate covered one and the Florentine. Highly recommend both. Tried the mint on return visit and didn't care for it as much.

OMG Canollie heavn 
But they don't take plastic

text:
Line Be Damned!
Just stick your head in there and get some.
Try the flips, like mom used to make, they are like pie crust
nipples wrapped around jammy jam. She threw in mine for
free. Sweet lady in the leopard print blouse...
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
