text:
Yum! Cannoli. So, I've only really had the cannoli here. And they're good. I get the ricotta with chocolate chips in the plain uhh... cannoli shell. The filling is thicker and more rich than Modern's, and the cannoli's are prolly 30% larger than Modern's. But the chocolate chips are bigger. 

I personally prefer Modern's, who has a creamier (not as thick), not as sugary and omg, death to arteries filling, and tiny chocolate chips so you taste more chocolate. But, BOTH are delicious! 

The line goes fast, in part b/c the tourists don't know how to line up and they mill around like ducks. So, if you know what you want, it's easy to find an empty counter and get your order fast. 

Bring cash too. It's an institution, so you've got to bring your touristy friends here.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: The chocolate mousse cannolli is to. die. for. So deliciuos! Of course, there's always a line at this place but it's so worth it! Make sure to bring cash because they only take cash as payment.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: A local friend recommended this spot to me.  They are world famous for their Canolis.  The best one in my opinion is the Choc Chip.  They get fancy with different flavors but the sweetness is too much after a few bites.  The portion size is fairly big so I would recommend sharing with someone.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
The location of this store is very convenient and although the lines can be long - the operations seem to be very efficient and the staff still had friendly smiles on their faces. However, on the product side - I could not taste anything special about the cannolis. The cream tasted blend and the crust was just hard. I cannot say that I am disappointed because I am not a cannoli fan to behind with and 3/5 stars is a fair rating for my experience. Not wow but "ok" experience. 

Prices: $4 to $4.50 per cannoli.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: Five stars because only they can make the best limoncello with pistachio bits canoli!  So glad they opened up at Assembly row where they accept card payments!
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: Overrated. Just go to modern, the pastries are better and the staff is a lot more friendly and a lot less racist.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
Crazy busy.   Staff not thrilled and seemingly impatient with guests (which surprised and disappointed my crew).   We were given little time (after waiting in a long line) to place an order that we were super excited about initially. 
Everyone of us ordered something different; lobster tail, multiple cannoli, biscotti, cookies. 
Lobster tail dense and not at all flaky and light (although large) / cream not very sweet; cannoli shells fried in oil that needed to be changed; biscotti heavy on nutmeg, and cookies fared the best overall.   
My advice would be to go across the street to Modern and enjoy the gracious employees, cannoli freshly made, and lobster tail three times flaker.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
Dear people who:

- Claim that Mike's cannoli are too rich/too big.
Please stop eating dessert - I'm not sure you really understand it.  There are plenty of places where you can get some nice, light frozen yogurt.  Or maybe a salad.  Why don't you go check those out?

- Complain that the cannoli here is "not fresh" because they don't fill the thing right in front of you.
First, just watch for 30 seconds or so and see how quick the turnover is for cannoli.  
Second, taste it.  See how it tastes extremely fresh?  It's fresh.  Now let the grown-ups talk.


I recently went back here after a 2-ish year hiatus, and it was even better than I remembered.  I've tried several of their cannoli and I'm pretty sure I've had the tiramisu and a few other things, but the chocolate covered cannoli with ricotta cream and chocolate chips is the only thing that matters.  In LIFE.  When I'm eating one of these, I literally can't process a single thought outside of, "HOLY CRAP THIS IS SO DECADENT."

If you're the kind of person who considers rich desserts an essential part of a happy life, then getting some cannoli here is an absolute must.  And make sure to get the ricotta filling, the others are good but not as rich.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: It gets crazy sometimes but Mike's is my favorite place in North End, I can't pass by without getting my Jimmy Rum Cake
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: A local staple. You must go. Prepare to wait in line. Get yourself an incredible cannoli.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
Only one thing can be said about this place..... Yum!

We got two type of cannoli and a Boston cream pie. All were fresh and tasted great.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: The wait was well worth it! The cheesecake was amazing as were the cannolis. The different flavored pastries were all delicious! Great selection and great service. Prices were good for the large portions. The employees were fun and friendly to the large crowd. We loved Mikes and would go back!!
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
So what was amazing about Mike's Pastry again? 

I'm sorry, but in retrospect, I REALLY don't see the hype. Looking back after a month or so, I think Mike's Pastry is just another pastry shop in the end. 

Yes, their canolis are okay, but I could have done without the chocolate chips. Their Boston cream pies are okay, albeit soggy. Their eclairs are really weird, in the sense that it was all-wet chocolate cream and all-dry pastry (very odd contrast for the palate). I'm glad I went here for the tourist gimmick, but I think I'll spend my money on somewhere else. It was a nice culinary booty call, though.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: Even though I usually avoid the super touristy places especially those with long lines, I couldn't leave Boston without seeing what all the fuss was about. I attempted to go 3 or 4 times and passed each time due to the long line. The joke was on me because each time the line was longer and longer! I finally waited around 30 minutes on a Saturday night around 7:30 pm. The appeal for me was the variety of cannolis. Most pastry shops in the area only offered the 3 or 4 fillings, with or without chocolate chips and dipped or covered in chocolate. Mike's has so many flavors to chose from. I ended up trying the pecan caramel, limoncello, and ricotta. The pecan caramel was my favorite! The ricotta is better at Modern pastry. These cannolis also seem larger than other places. Besides the cannolis the other pastries looked amazing but I can't speak for their taste. I would say it's worth going once and especially if there's no line. Also, we passed by Mike's while on another tour around 11 am on a Tuesday and it was completely empty. If you can go at the time do it!
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: So many tourists and mediocre desserts. The line is always out the door because all the tourists are staring in the cases unsure of what they want to order.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: I have been here a handful of times, I'm sure like lots of other people that visit Boston often. I have really enjoyed everything I have ever bought here.  BUT I found the one thing that I can now call my favorite and CANNOT wait to go back and have it again! LOBSTERTAIL!!!!
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: Mike's Pastry is an experience not to be missed. From the two old men sitting out front (who, I understand have been there for years and know everyone) to the madhouse inside as everyone rushes toward a counter to be helped to giant sized cannolis in more flavors than anyone ever imagined. A must stop in Boston.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
A trip to Boston is not complete without a stop in at Mike's Pastry.  I had heard that this place was THE place to go for the best cannoli.  I can't resist a good cannolo so we bought one of every kind that was there and they wrapped it up in a nice white box and tied it with some twine.  That's the way they do it at real bakeries.

Like many others have said, this place can get crazy, but don't let that deter you.  They don't mess around with stupid orderly lines here.  If you find yourself in the crowd, just push your way towards the front where a cashier is standing.  That's the way the roll at Mike's.

As far as the cannoli go, I suggest sticking with the classic, maybe with mini chocolate chips on the outside.  I didn't love the custard type ones as much as the traditional ricotta filled.  The best though, and I mean THE BEST one to try is the Florentine.  It's wicked good, with this incredible chocolatey, peanut buttery, caramely flavor.  Just trust me.  Mike's really does make the best.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: Okay If Your In Boston and miss this place..Dayum!! A must do. Hands down. Tiamissu , il canolo, cream puffs, Boston Cream Pie OMG good. And if your looking for the dinner. The Best Italian Food on the East Coast is just across the street toward Old Church. Just look for the line and get in it...its worth it.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
My first and last cannoli - not really a fan. Tried the ricotta with chocolate chips and hazelnut ones. Might've liked the other pastries/cakes from here, but the cannoli didn't really do it for me. So sad.

+ no line at 11am and there was even a free table!
+ my cappuccino was good, although I didn't like the cinnamon sprinkled on top
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
I have patronized Mike's pastry for over 30 years, starting when I was a law student in Boston. Mikes never disappoints. Although I live in California now, my family and I stop by, whenever our travels take us to Boston. 

Please open a branch in Los Angeles. I would be happy to provide you with the necessary legal services in exchange for product. You can pay us with cannoli. You would put everyone else out of business quickly.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
Mike's Pastry is insane.  Despite it being 9:00pm, there was a steady line out the door and down the block.  Do NOT be deterred!  It moves quick!  You are expected to know what you want as soon as you reach the counter, so be ready.  

There are quite a few flavors of cannoli to choose from.  I set my sites on the chocolate covered.  These cannoli are HUGE.  We went immediately after dinner, and when I sat down with the thing, I knew I wasn't going to finish it.  

For some reason, I expected a cannoli to be sweeter than it actually was.  Despite being light on sweetness, I still found it delicious.  It's large enough to split, though, and that's what I should have done.  

People here say Mike's Pastry is a tourist trap and not the best place for a cannoli.  Maybe that's true.  For a first-timer to Boston, it was place I felt I had to try, and ultimately, I wasn't disappointed.  

Just remember to bring cash!  They take no other form of payment.  Keeps the line moving though!
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: Mikes is about the cannolis and te experience. The line, the way they wrap it up in string in the box. I may have had a better cannoli at some point in my life. But if I have I would rather go to Mikes because you know what you're gonna get. And it's gonna be delicious.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: The lines are killer but.thats.because this is the biggest selction of the yumiest treats.  A must in.Boston or off the freedom trail..boston cream pie and eclaires wow
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
an array of cannolis, cookies, cakes, muffins, and pastries..  this is a serious sweets' haven!  

be prepared to step in line that may go past a few stores down, but they do move people in and out in a timely manner.  another tip: don't take your sweet old time ordering.  the people behind the counter want to move the line, and have no patience for you to decide whether you want a cannoli or chocolate covered lobster claw.

we kept seeing people walking down hanover with that infamous rope tied mike's box as we were eating dinner.  and although we were stuffed to the brim, we still trotted our fully bellies over there and purchased an insane amount of pastries.  looking at the assortment makes you greedy, and you end up buying tons of desserts you may not even finish!
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: Come in the morning when it's less busy, grab a cannoli & coffee, then meander over to Paul Revere Mall for a tranquil breakfast. Delicious pastries, we came twice in our 4 day trip in Boston. Cannolis are definitely the best though.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: This place is kind of a classic tourist trap in Little Italy in Boston, but it's good and it is worth it!! Most people rave about the cannoli, but I got basically the bigger version-a lobster tail and wow-for $6.50 you get large amount of delicious cream wrapped in a soft coating. The cream to pastry ratio was heavily on the cream side, but I'm not necessarily complaining. I can fit a large amount of food in my tummy, but as a dessert, I could not finish even half of this thing. It was good even the next day after time in the fridge, but I highly recommend eating it all at once when it's fresh. The line for this place also may be long, but it moves surprisingly fast and it takes only cash so be prepared.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: I absolutely will wait in the long line for a cannolli at Mike's! I think they are fantastic! We've enjoyed getting their pastries and heading near the waterfront to eat them after a nice dinner in the North End. Or you can just dig in as soon as your walking out of Mike's.....
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
Stopped in and got a few of the gluten free macaroons. 
They were out of this world!  The best we have ever had, gluten free or not!  
Crispy on the outside, delicate and moist on the inside. 
We also had the pistachio cookie. Equally wonderful. 
We turned around and went back in for a dozen more. 
Friendly service.  
If only they could ship across the country!
Mike's was a great find for us!
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
While in Boston for a 1 week vacation, my friend whom lives just outside Boston strongly suggested that we pay a visit to Mike's for their canolis. And so we did on 2 different occasions after eating at Fanueli Marketplace both times. 

My review is based only on the plain, chocolate chip, and chocolate covered canolis as I did not try any of their other pastries. I should remind you that this was my first time eating canoli's so perhaps you might disregard my review in that aspect. However, my mom said it was the best canoli she has ever had. Hype or not, the canoli filling isn't overly sweet and in my opinion just the perfect balance. Fast forward 2 months later...I had a canoli a few weeks ago from Cortina's Italian Market in Anaheim, and while good, is no match for Mike's canoli's. The filling here was much more sweeter.

If I ever return to Boston, I'm paying a visit to all of the pastry shops in little Italy that sell canoli's to see what is the best. Unfortunately online ordering is too expensive, so sadly I'll have to wait and wait to someday return. And so the waiting begins....

PS: The lobster tail for $5 is huge and looks delicious. And beware because this place is always packed.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
Line up down the street, boxes stacked on the plane there AND back from travelers and flight attendants - I had to go to this place.  

Didn't really like the cannolis - not going to lie.  Get the LOBSTER TAIL, much better and extremely good.  

We sat in for service and the waitress was really nice and very quick.  In fact, the entire staff was nice and I wish I could have brought back boxes of treats.  

Not only was this a must-eat but a must-see, too.  The North End is delightful to look at and walk through.  The perfect afternoon can be spent there with a final stop at Mike's.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
we got a cannoli and a lobster tail and the bill was $9.50. 

There are tons of different flavors - we chose the chocolate mousse. The filling was lightly chocolate in flavor with chocolate chips on the two ends of the cannoli. Shell was fresh and crunchy and it was delightful. 

The lobster tail was HUGE!!! it was bigger than my whole hand. I loved the crunchiness of the shell where it looked like the different sections of the lobster. The part that was in contact with the filling was more like cream puff softness. It was really quite good. I am usually not a fan of cream-filled products but this was delicious!!  

A bit of a sugar high after these two desserts though.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
I always get SO excited when someone mentions the "most popular eateries". The people that have recommend Mikes Pastry to me has already exceeded the number of fingers I can count with.  

I love cannolis and having been to Italy recently, I couldn't wait to get a decent, local, and delicious cannoli. ....especially being the extreme sweet tooth that I
am. Reading all these lovely reviews, I finally got the time to stop by one afternoon and try out the original Chocolate Chip Cannoli. 

I mean, usually you can't go wrong with their signature pastry right?

WRONG. What I got was an unflavorful, dry, doughy, and very pasty cannoli. The chocolate chips had no flavor, and it wasn't very sweet. It basically felt like everything that could go wrong in my mouth...went wrong. On one hand I can taste the doughy layer and then completely cannot chew the chocolate chips while having a no-taste cream in the midst of all of it. 

I see people everywhere carrying boxes of their pastries, so I'm very disheartened I didn't have a nice experience here. It's sad to say but I've had better cannolis at the not so great airport in Rome. I am however, totally down to give this place a second chance. 

Who knows, maybe I'll come to love this place next time.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: Mikes! No question. The Mikes vs Modern question is easy, Mikes! Simple and tasty and fast. It can look crowded and busy, but just jump in. You'll make your way to the front soon. Order a canoli, choc chips or not- soooo good! One important thing for tourists: CASH only!
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
Let me begin by saying..this place is packed !! So when it is your turn to order, you better know what you want.  

Everything looks amazing there are so many choices from cakes, tiramisus, to cookies and gelato.  I had a very difficult time choosing but I've heard so much about their cannoli. I got their hazelnut cannoli. Coming from an Italian family, I am very particular about cannoli and don't like many other than the ones my grandma made.  However, this one was to DIE for.  The ricotta was smooth as can be and had a slight covering of hazelnut.  The cannoli itself was huge too, definitely pleased with my pick.  My friend tried the peanut butter cannoli which I thought was going to outshine mine, but hers wasn't that fantastic.  The filling was a bit gritty and tasted like an odd combination with the peanut butter and ricotta. I'm sure the others are to die for though.  It might just be that the simple ones and originals are too good to even tweak with different flavors.  

It came in a really cute box too!  I loved it !
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
With only a weekend in Boston, I ended up coming here three times for the Cannolis! There is always a line but it goes by quick. It's definitely a good place to come to get a snack while waiting for Neptunes or a nearby Restaurant OR grab dessert after a meal!

I've had the Boston Cream Pie in which I didn't like very much. Nothing unique about the cake and I feel that it is just a waste on calories.

I recommend the Cannolis. What makes this place better than others is the many different types of Cannolis that is offered. I've ordered 6-8 different ones and I loved all of them! The Hazelnut and Pistachio has subtle flavors though. I liked the crunchy crust and the amazing light cream filling! Also, I would recommend eating this right away or within the same day. The crust becomes sort of soggy/soft.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: Delicious pastries and so many options! I have never seen so many different choices for cannoli filling, so bring your appetite. During my Saturday late morning visit, there was a minimal line that was contained to inside the store. Additionally, there is very limited, informal seating inside.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
I don't know who Mike is, but I want to thank him from the bottom of my heart (and stomach) for bringing the best cannoli shop to Boston.

Go hungry, bring cash and know that the line is well worth the wait!
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: Too much sugar! Waiting on the line for a long time and you expect something amazing. Cannoli was just good but the rest were below the average.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: The pasty is fine, it is cannoli and most cannoli is good. Is it worth the absurdly long lines? I'm going to say no. You can get decent pastry in plenty of other places and do something else with your hour.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
Cannoli Nirvana awaits in a light, crispy delicious shell, filled with your choice of sublime fillings, everything from the traditional chocolate chip, to pistachio and coffee. 
They also have full bakery choices, most of which I have not sampled due to my love of cannolis. I will own up to bogarting a piece of my daughter's M&M chocolate chip cookie and it was heavenly.
And here's a tip kids, that I know others have mentioned, but it's worth pointing out again. Do not wait on line, that's for tourists. Just slide on up to the counter like the locals do, where one of the nice folks will be happy to take your order, and leave with your blue and white box of treasures....
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: Their tiramisu was completely soaked in coffee!! The second you press down on the cake, coffee oozed out and the flavor was spectacular. Went in mid-day so no line. Also got the amaretto cannoli to-go. It was a great snack for later in the day. I got the cannoli with very light powdered sugar on top, which I believe is the right way to go. Def stop by and try if you're craving something sweet!
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
This is usually the place most people go when coming to the North End
I'll admit, delicious cannoli's and pastries for awesome prices. There's really no order to this place so if you're near a shelf you should give your order to the next employee you see.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: Great place for dessert. Convenient location in north end. Had their lobster tail...excellent. Only warning, the place was mobbed so have your order ready when you get there. Cash only!
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: Maybe I just don't like Italian desserts??  I'd heard nothing but incredible reviews for this place so was excited to select an assortment of most everything they had but just didn't care for almost anything we ordered.  We also went to Modern Bakery and I didn't love anything there either, so I'm pretty sure it is the genre of dessert rather than this place in particular.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: It's so famous that people are willing to spend hours for their pastry. I like their products too because they taste not as over sweet as most of American desserts. But to me, seems like there's little difference between everything in terms of taste and flavors...
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: The best cannoli, we try the pistachio and the Florentine with a cappuccino. Delicious, and great variety. You can't come to the North End, Boston without tasting these delicacies. We are from Miami, FL
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: Pastries are good, but personally I don't think it's worth the line.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: I am a huge fan of Boston mom and pop pastry places. Don't get me wrong, Mike's Pastry's is a great place but it's overrated now. It's become a tourist spot with lines out the door for good (not amazing) pastries with little seating. Will I return? Of course.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
Mike's Pastry is always a must-do when any of my family or friends visit me in Boston. The shear assortment of cannoli they have here and the speed at which they wrap all the deliciousness up is truly astounding! This time we went wild and tried the amaretto, peanut butter, and chocolate dipped. Definitely go for the chocolate dipped if you're a chocoholic like me! :D 

While these cannoli's aren't much like the real thing in Sicily, they are a great Boston twist on an iconic Italian desert.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
I somehow felt like I was tricked that this place was going to be the really good, when it was just mediocre. Once you walk in you notice that their is a ton of workers and all they seem to be doing is talking to each other. I rather be asked if I'm all set 10 times than to not be asked anything at all, to get asked anything we had to give them eye contact. I tried the Oreo cake, which was ok, but wasn't worth buying again. The chocolate chip cookie was pretty good, but even Burger King has a decent chocolate chip cookie.

Maybe the desserts would be better in the mornings instead of the time that we went, so I will go back here again in the future, but I will keep an eye out for other dessert places.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
Cannoli review:

I like the filling here better than modern's.  So smooth and creamy with the right balance of sweet. If you are in the area, i recommend the classic chocolate chip dipped  or pistachio cannoli.  Once before I ordered a neapolitan cannoli and it was overwhelmingly sweet.  Stay away from this one if you do not have a super sweet tooth.

The to-go 12 cannoli kit is awesome.  I got it before and the cannolis just taste better because they look so small and cute :)

I'll be back, Mikes!
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: Don't let the crowded store deter you. They are fast at getting people in and out. The cannolis are fresh and delicious. We also bought some pignoli cookies, which are almost as good as homemade.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: This place never fails to bring me back to when I was a little girl visiting the city with my father. I will forever love mikes pastries - always.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
Because you can not visit Boston especially, the North End without picking up a cannoli from Mike's Pastry. It is an old school style Italian bakery with plenty of Pastry offerings. So many choices you don't know where to begin. The prices start at about $4-$5 a pastry however, the portions are huge and meant to be shared. You will totally get your money's worth.  The cannoli is delicious & stuffed to the max, there are numerous to select from. I purchased the chocolate chip this time, & they do not skimp on the chips that's for sure. We also got a cannoli cupcake really good stuff & a zeppoli style cream puff simply delicious. 

So after a nice Italian dinner on the North End, grab some pastries to go. 

Location spacious
Selection plentiful 
Prices average considering the size you get a lot
Staff efficient, they don't smile much so, it's down to business. 
Clean & bright 
Super busy place, know what you want, pay and go. You have the option to stay, if you like there are a few tables but tend to be busy. 
Very good treats.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
The lineup here was much shorter then at Modern Pastry as the place is much bigger and had more staff taking orders.  The cannoli here is also bigger than the ones at Modern, but the price is also more which I think evens out on a value basis.  Mike's Pastry had an enormous variety of cannoli's to choose from as well as pie and ice cream at the side.  It's like they try to sell everything they can, which is not always a good thing.  The Whoopie Pie they had was not good, it tasted like a better version of a Joe Louie.  As for the cannoli itself, it was ok.  Not too much different than the ones at Modern.  

However, I should note that the ones at Modern hold up better in storage than Mike's by a few days as the pastry crust gets soggy much faster.  I think this is due to the quality of the pasty and the larger quantity of custard in the middle due to it's size.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: One of the premiere canoli places in Boston!  Some may even say the ONLY place to get canolis. Is it touristy? Yes. Are the locals also in line with them anyway? Yes. Is it always packed, regardless of the day or time of day? Yes! Have I ever actually sat there and eaten? Nope. This is a grab and go kind of place that can get chaotic at times, but it is so worth it!  They pound out these little cream filled slices of heaven at an alarming rate and they are consistently delicious and the line moves pretty quickly. I personally like chocolate chips on my canolis! They also offer more creative ones like pistachio, espresso, strawberry and hazelnut.  Be warned that they are cash only, which is why I give them 4 stars instead of 5. At leadt they give you ample warning before you get inside!  They have other baked goods but I've never tried them. Just give me a box of 24 canolis and I'm happy!
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: We have been to Mike's now three times... it never disappoints.  They have the best cannoli's I have ever eaten. Get the Lemoncello!  You will not be disappointed.  No matter the crowd or the line - WAIT... Do not walk by and grab a cannoli somewhere else.  I promise you, it's worth the wait.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: I know most people love it and that my review means nothing, but this place really really irks me. It stands out in a BAD way as one of the few places in the North End with both pre-filled cannolis AND neon colored gelato. Yuckk. Trust your eyes, gelato is not supposed to look like that.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
Although I love food, I did not expect myself to stand in a ridiculously long line just for a cannoli roll. However, my friend made me. According to her, dinner at North End would not be complete without cannoli from Mike's pastry. 
Surprisingly, the super long line moved very quickly. 
I have to say their cannoli rolls are def bigger than average. The shell was somewhat crunchy when it was fresh.
I got four flavors: Strawberry, Hazelnut, Espresso and Pistachio. Out of the four, Hazelnut and Espresso were my favorite - I liked the hint of the hazelnut aroma and the coffee bitterness. Everything else was very sweet. The sweetness was so strong and "blunt" that blinded me from noticing any other flavors or texture (that's why I don't even remember whether the shell was crunchy...). The taste was a little too straightforward and slightly boring for me. Since the size was big, I actually got tired of eating it towards the end (and I was sharing with 3 other friends). 
It was good, but not "Wow".
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: This is a tradition in Boston to come here for pastries and desserts.  Definitely get the cannolis!
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: It is an okay place to visit if you are touring Boston, but the quality of the cannolis leaves something to be desired. If I was going to chose some place to get desert, I would go elsewhere.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: We happened to have dinner in little Italy and decided to go get some pastries afterwards.  With all the boxes floating in people's hands heading in the opposite direction, we decided to give Mike's Pastry a try.  Agreed, it is a chaotic and the lines are long, but we were lucky.  No more than 2 minute wait to try their famous cannoli.  We got an espresso and amaretto flavored cannoli and ate it in the park not too far.  This was my first cannoli, so I don't have much to compare but they were delicious.  The staff was not particularly friendly or welcoming, probably given the chaos they see everyday.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: The plain cannoli is my favorite but we also got the chocolate ricotta and pistachio cannoli. All so good, cannot be disappointed.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: The line was huge so I was expecting to eat the best canole of my life.  I got a plain canole and, unfortunately, the canole was just 'ok'. It was pretty good, but nothing special, and not worth the fifteen minute line. There are plenty of other places to get canoles that are just as tasty with less wait time.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: The best butter croissant I have ever had.  The 'lobstertail' pastry was also nice. But the top of the chart had to be the cannolis.  It is a MUST DO in Boston.  I'm so glad we went there.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: Love the cannoli! The place is as busy as ever. I do appreciate their efficiency though. The line gets super long, but moves fast. I'd suggest going earlier in the day as more people go towards the end of the day on the weekends. My friend and I were planning to get a few each but ended up with getting just 1 each because they were huge!...and it's cash only XD. Definitely worth a try at least if lines aren't your thing!
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: Probably not much more I can add than has already been said.  I know people rave about the cannolis, but I've had better.  However they have a dessert called the lobster tail which is life changing......like best pastry I've had this year.  This should be ordered!!  You can thank me later.  Remember to bring your own napkins if you plan on eating there.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
Being only a lowly tourist, I've seen that there's some debate as to the best pastry place in the North End. That being said, I was impressed with this place. Yes, the lines where horrible, other customers pushy and rude, and the lady who helped me with my order didn't understand that I didn't want powered sugar on my order, but hey, good times anyways! 

I don't usually like cannoli, but this stuff was pretty darn good. Too bad I couldn't order a bunch more and take them back on the plane with me, but dang... good stuff! If it was warmer I'd grab some of the gelato (I'm a sucker for gelato after spending a few weeks in Italy some time back), but I think I will have to make another visit to Mike's when I visit Beantown again.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
It's a famous place in Boston, so of course, go at least once. But unfortunately I've had better cannolis from Little Italy in NYC, and even without that as a reference point, the cannolis are a bit mediocre and certainly not worth the wait or crowding involved to get one. The filling isn't spectacular and sometimes too much in volume/one-note, the shells are sometimes stale.

The gelato is pretty good, but again, there are so many other places nearby that do just as well without the line!
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: Had the most amazing dessert at Mike's last night.  Cannolis are amazing-- highlights were Pistachio, hazelnut and chocolate ricotta.  Oreo was just okay.  Peanut butter brownie was too decadent for us, but the best dessert was the Napoleon pastry (or maybe neopolitan?).  It was recommended to us by one of the workers and it was phenomenal.  It was a white pastry filled it custard and definitely the crowd favorite.  Overall, amazing desserts and well worth the wait!
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: Another place in the North End that  all the sheeple flock too.  Go to Marias or even Bovas for better cannoli...
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: The famous Mike's. I think I saw them on the travel channel at one point. Anyways, while in Boston for the weekend, I kept seeing Mike's Pastry boxes. And when my friend wanted to go, I could not pass this up. It was packed with tourists and had a huge line, but a lady came out of nowhere and started helping us. Amazing canoli. You should try one even if you don't usually like canolis. Everything about it was perfect and very authentic. The shell was crisp and flavorful and the textures of the shell and the cream filling were very complimentary. Their filling is divine and I could probably eat the filling on my own. Cupcakes were also had, also very good but of course their canolis are what they're known for. I will visit again next time I'm in this corner of the world. Bring cash :-)
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: Omg I absolutely loved every single thing I got and I got a lil of everything! Yes cannoli, yes tiramisu, yes gelato, yes boson creme puff, yes eclairs, oh my goodness it was soooo delicious! Stay in line the wait is worth the wait! Stay and remember cash only!
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: Jeez, oh my god, their cannolis. I mean, obviously, but god. Sooooo good.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: We were in Boston for the Thanksgiving holiday from Charlotte, NC . I needed to have some good tiramisu and cannoli's it was heaven, but was quickly reminded I was back in Boston the hospitality was none, and I couldn't understand in the 21st century a cash only business makes you wonder.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
Worth the wait! We tried three cannoli flavors, all of which were amazing. Unfortunately, we went at prime time so people were mostly respectful as they tried to push in front of us in line. Other than that I highly recommend this place!

PS - they are cash only!!
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: It was just okay. The cream was too dense. Other people in my party enjoyed their cheesecake over the cannoli.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: while ann was waiting in line for dinner at giacomo's, i stopped by mike's to pick up some sweets to tie us over during the 1+hr wait to get into giacomo's. i went to mike's, where there was also quite a long line, but i managed to be alert and skipped past about 10 people when the worker asked if anyone was ready to order. i ordered a florentine cannoli (golden almond covered chocolate chip variery), a chocolate chip cannoli, a lobster tail, and a peanut butter chocolate chip cookie. florentine cannoli is definitely better than the original chocolate chip version. that being said, the best pastry BY FAR has to be the lobster tail. i can only describe it as a croissant like pastry injected to the max with a hybrid riccota cheese and fresh cream filling. if i were super fat, i would eat a lobster tail every day for breakfast.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
Delicious and a staple tourist stop. I found the atmosphere and old-school cannoli shop feel of the place much more exciting than the cannolis themselves. We stopped by here after dinner, and it was packed.

I've probably only had cannolis one other time in my life, so can't really compare, but everything seemed very fresh and sizes were BIG! I would recommend getting 1-2 per person and then just grabbing a taste of each. By the end they all end up tasting a little bit the same haha. My favorite was the Pecan Praline, Amaretto, and Limoncello. 

Cash only!
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
We had the original cannoli - very good

It was worth the wait, it was not sweet at all, perfect flavor. We have had these in some pretty authentic Italian restaurants and this one was definitely one of the better ones.

The line could've managed a little bit more efficiently, once you get inside it switches from single file to a free-for-all
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
Any other place, I would look at the crowd of people and walk back out.  Mike's is worth it.  I'm not a cannoli fan (blasphemy!, I know), but the cakes (fudge, chocolate mousse, oreo) are all amazing.  I wasn't a fan of chocolate until I first visited Mike's, perhaps seven years ago, and tasted their offerings.  Their cakes are far too rich for me, but I'm pretty happy to eat half a slice and save the rest for later.

No credit cards?  Not a big deal, to me.  If I'm in the area, I make sure to hit the ATM machine beforehand.  And really, with how many customers they have, I'd worry about credit cards holding up the cash register.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: Holy cannoli (I bet that joke gets overused)! We drove by Mike's during the evening, but it was extremely packed. A good sign, but no thanks. We returned in the morning, maybe 20 minutes before opening hours, lingered outside while the employees got everything set up. A man walked over and opened the door, and asked us not to run because the floor was wet. Ok, first of all, it's just cannolis, I wasn't planning on running. As he walked away from us and back behind the counter, I saw him give an amused look to another employee, similar to an eye-roll. I didn't much appreciate that. ANYWAYS, moving on to the important part. I got a Florentine chocolate chip cannoli, and it was divine. The regular pastry cannolis are a bit too plain for me, but this was perfect. Eat them fast though, because they will get soggy. My sis ordered the pistachio macaron, which came highly recommended, and I thought it was gross and tasted extremely artificial. My sister disagreed wholeheartedly, she loved it, and I'm definitely in the minority with my opinion. If I pass by any of Mike's locations, I would be very tempted to stop in again, especially because there are also lots of delicious-looking cookie options behind the counter.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: Overrated nothing special, overpriced, staff are rude, paid $3 for coffee macchiato in a small cheap foam cup tasted disgusting. DON'T BE TRAPPED...
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: Mikes is great, when there's not a massive line out the door. But it's a Boston landmark. The only time I actually come here is when I have out-of towners visiting....they have to have it! The pastry is fabulous though, good luck getting a seat...!!!
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: Most people go here for the cannolis but I love their tiramisu cake! (never go on a weekend, the line is just not worth it)
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
On a day like today I really miss my friends LukChris and the other Asian. They're funny, goofy, a little competitive (Giant 0 - Asian 1) and overall down to Earth. As the giant kept saying, "No picture or words could ever replicate that moment," I really wish I could convey the memory of seeing those three sit on a bench at the Rose Fitzgerald Kennedy Greenway. They all had a Mike's Pastry in hand, were taking bites, and were in complete silence.

Mike's Pastry was so good it caused everyone to calm down and savour the moment. The giant got the classic tiramisu, Luke had a black and white cookie, and the child got the Boston Cream Puff. I chose the fruit tart and it was perfect in every way. The fruit glistened, the custard wasn't too sweet, and the crust held up nicely. 

All pastries that leave Mike's are wrapped up like presents. It just makes the pastries that much more special. While our tastes in pastries were varied we were all universal on our to go pastry.

One whole box of chocolate mousse cannolis for later! The cannoli was far better than the pastries we had at the park. There's a reason why the cannolis are famous at Mike's. It's not just a tourist trap. Sometimes I wish I could turn back time. I'd go back to that weekend with LukChris and the other Asian.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: Did not live up to the hype, but maybe I did not get the right pastry. The ricotta got boring halfway through the massive cannoli and left me thirsty. The tiramisu wasn't bad.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: Love their Italian pastries. As good and fresh as it gets. Just expect long lines on holidays and weekends. (They do try to staff for the crowds, tough.)
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
PISTACCHIO MACAROONS!  Only reason why I ventured out of my usual comfort zone for pastries to try the macaroon was because I obsess over my favorite color green.  It's unnaturally bright green colored covered in powdered sugar, but ZOMG tastes so good.  Everyone that I've introduced to this new found discovery has not disagreed.  

Also, go during off-peak hours (anytime besides after dinner or after lunch) if you like to be able to look around first before buying.  When it's crowded, good luck.  Service is fast but you better know what you want.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
best m and m cookie ever
be prepared to wait in line and the girls are rude but thats part of the deal. good canolli's go across the street to modern
but they rock in the m and m cookie category, of which I am always searching!
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt

text: I love this place. The people are great and the pastries are even better.  This place definitely deserves the reputation they have.  They are the best

text:
3.5 stars
Great cannolis; a must-try if you're in the area. Long lines but don't despair it moves quickly. Of the ones I have tried (amaretto, pistachio, & espresso), I liked espresso one the best. Cash only.

text: Their Boston Cream Pie is one of the very best! Service with a smile! I love Mike's Pastry. Everything is great except the lines....

text: Holy cannoli! I had the Amaretto cannoli which was delicious. I also ordered an eclair and a Boston creme puff for my daughter. Those were good too but the cremes were a little too rich for me. text:
UHMAZING.

Walking around the downtown Boston area, I saw a lot of people with boxes with blue lettering on them. I was definitely curious, but was at first deterred by the long line outside the shop. However, my friend and I had some time to kill, so we decided to go for it.

The line was long, but moved very quickly. Once you were in the actual store, it is pure craziness; there are people everywhere, shouting across the room and such. But it's the kind of chaos that you should expect to find at local but very popular establishment. Even when you get into the store, there are cashiers pretty much all around the perimeters of the store, so I waited less than 5 minutes to place my order.

I ordered two chocolate chip, a strawberry and a peanut butter cannoli. And every single one was amazing. 

Having been recently diagnosed with lactose intolerance, I knew it would be a bad idea to eat any of these. But I had to try them; people raved about them too much for me to resist. So I had a tiny bite of the chocolate chip.

And then another bite.

And then another.

Before I knew it, I was halfway done with it. I stopped myself, but boy, did I want to finish that cannoli. I did not care that I would most likely be dying later that night... it was worth every single bite.

Let it be known, these cannolis are divine. The filling is perfect: just the right amount of whatever flavor they claim to be (not overpowering any other flavors, but instead, blended in perfect harmony), not too rich, not too sweet... perfection. The shells were also crispy and delicious, as everything in the bakery itself is made fresh.  

I ended up taking the rest of the cannolis back to New York. They survived the trip back, and although obviously the shells weren't as crisp and perfect as they were in Boston, they were still very good. I had small bites of the strawberry and peanut butter, and hate myself for not being able to finish them off. I might just take a bunch of lactaid pills later and do exactly that.

If you are in the Boston area, I highly recommend getting your hands on these bad boys. And eat them. 

TIP: The best way to eat the chocolate chip cannoli, is to bite into the chocolate chip end first, and munch your way halfway through the shell. Then, finish the other half by starting with the chocolate chip end again. The chocolate flavor sits in your mouth and gives the rest of the cannoli a subtle chocolatey-goodness taste while you enjoy the rest of your uhmazing treat.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: Wow the hype on this place is overly abundant! We tried the chocolate chip and pecan caramel cannoli. Not overly sweet which I liked. They were pretty good. The line was long but moves quick. The customer service was very lacking and I'd give them a 2. We had a phone that was dead and a phone with 1% battery and my husband was using an outlet to charge while I was in line getting the pastries and he was told by a worker he could not stand there as that is where people get coffee. First of all he was standing by the window near and outlet totally out of way of the line and everyone else. Secondly the register was shut down and coffee wasn't even being served and NO one was even near there to get coffee even if it was open. She was very rude. We managed to find a Starbucks that didn't even blink an eye when we sat down there to charge our phone so we could get home. We saved the pastries for when we got home as to not be rude at Starbucks but that left a bad image of mikes.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
Man o man! Our trip to Boston wouldn't have been complete without a trip (or two) to Mike's. We visited Boston at the end of July 2013 and found ourselves at Mike's twice! During our visits we sampled the original, chocolate, pistachio, hazelnut and limoncello cannolis... WOW! Pistachio was my favorite and my wife's as well, but they were all amazingly decadent, filling and delicious! 

A few things to keep in mind... this place is crowded!! This is an all the time occurrence from what i've heard! The line tends to move pretty quickly so don't be too turned off by the mob of people. They are CASH ONLY so make sure you have cash on you before you wait in the epic line.

text:
I came, I saw, I waited in line, I cannoli'd.
Worth the wait, walking through the North End and smelling garlic and scallops and pasta, the jaunt alone was worth it!  This was at the end of my long weekend in Boston, and I had walked my feet to the brink of writhing pain.  I just had to get a box of cannolis!  My friend suggested getting these at the end so I could bring some home to Eric R. (aren't I the sweetest) so I did.  I got 3 flavors for me (ricotta, limoncello, amaretto) and 2 for him (strawberry, pecan caramel).

I loved the ricotta and amaretto - yum!  They needed no powdered sugar for me - already sweet enough!  Mangia!

text:
First time in Boston, we were told by locals and other travelers that Mike's Pastry was a Must Go on our trip. So we drove up to the North End, illegally parked and found it. There was a decent line but it wasn't a terrible wait. There were so many choices but we had to make our minds up quick because the line had grown much longer behind us. We picked up 2 cannoli - peanut butter and Oreo, a tiramisu cup & a dozen assorted macaroons, and made it back to the car before it got ticketed or towed! It was a good day despite getting lost multiple times.

Back at the hotel, I wasn't expecting this but I did not care for the rich cannoli. My husband loved his & was more than happy to have mine. The macaroons however were heavenly; crunchy on the outside with a soft chewy middle. They're truly the BEST MACAROONS I've ever had. The tiramisu cup disappeared sometime in the night so I have absolutely no idea how it tasted!
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: This is the best cannoli you can find anywhere. Hands down. I just get plain to enjoy the flavor the most.

Service was very good, helpful and friendly. We got a huge lobster claw which is a cannoli type treat in a cone shaped crust, this is a cannoli on steroids. text: Awesome cannoli up in the north end. We got in around 1:30p and there wasn't really a crowd. No problem ordering. $5 and we got a huge Florentino (I think that's the name) cannoli.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt

text: I would have given Mike's five stars 20 years ago...but I do still love it.  It's gotten way too touristy over the years.  The canolis just aren't as good as they use to be.  They now have about 20 flavors which might be why.  When you get to the counter know what you want...especially when the place is packed.  They get a little grumpy if you make them wait.  I actually love this....that's the true old school Mike's experience.  I wouldn't plan on trying to park to get your pastries.  Unless you get lucky the North End is infamous for this.  Take the T, walk, or make someone circle while you run in.  Prices have gone up significantly and do not reflect the decrease in quality.  I'm not saying it's awful...just not as good as it was.  There are many yummy and beautiful pastries that you should totally try.  In my opinion Bova's is more authentic now-a-days but you do you!
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: We came to Boston for just a few days and were advised that this should be on our to do list. We went on a week night so there were people but no wait time. We bought a variety of items from cannolis , lobster tail, cookies, cream puffs, brownies etc. Sorry to say nothing was outstanding. There are several other local bakeries at home that are just as good if not better. Good solid bakery. Definitely nothing to wait for. Lots of staff though not particularly friendly.  My kids though our server was annoyed with the amount of items we ordered which makes no sense, but she may have been.   Lots of other bakeries around.  Short on time, this overpriced bakery is a skip.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt

text: Cannolis: huge, yes, but just meh. There are better cannolis in the North End. Mike's has all sorts of every kind of pastry you can think of, with a line out the door to match the selection. But, it's not really worthwhile to wait in that line when there are better baked goods a short walk away (may I suggest Bova's instead?)
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
Chaotic, overstuffed, shiny... Both the food and ambience of Mike's are like "Disney Italia - Now On Steroids!!!!!(!!)" You feel like you're on a whirlwind carousel of debauched cultural caricature. At least, that's how it feels on weekend afternoons, when the North End is alive with activity - and Mike's is its frenzied center.

The cannolis are HUGE. They are crunchy, super-sweet, tasty messes - each bite sending a cascade of powdered sugar down your front. The cappuccino is fine (nothing to write home about), and the rest of the desserts look uninspired - even cafeteria-y. But the diversity of cannoli options, the sheer hedonism of it, coupled with the very shiny, mirror-plated walls, and the Boston-accented staff, it's definitely a fun, energetic way to spend an afternoon. 

If you want a milder, calmer experience, head next door to the Caffe Vittoria, which has steampunky, Garibaldian espresso machines (all brass spouts and such), similar cannoli (but only one variety), better coffee, and a little peace and quiet!
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
Oh boy, this was a hidden gem that I didn't know it was there until I happend to take a stroll around the North End when I was in town.  

It was a Wednesday or Thursday afternoon and I have happened to have seen the pastry shop and I thought what was with the line there?   Then I thought, if there is a line either it is hyped or it is really really good.

As someoe who is not a true cannoli fan, but when in Rome (I mean Bean-town), you just got to try it.  So I thought why not, I was only in town for a few days why not give it a try?

The second time that I have encountered Mike's Pastries, the line wasn't as bad as I thought.  

Definitely so many selections of cannolis to choose from.  I got the cannolis with the chocolate chips.  The cream filling wasn't as sweet as I thought it be, which is a good thing because I don't like things that are too sweet that only after one bite I felt that I needed dentures the next day.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: Rivals my hometown cannoli King in Philly Termini Brothers.  We tried a few different cannoli- ricotta, chocolate dipped, chocolate mousse and hazelnut.  The traditional ricotta was my favorite and so good.  I think I ate it in about 15 seconds flat and licked my fingers afterward.  It's cash only and you have to pay attention because there's a lot of lines and people taking orders so if you're not ready, you might get passed over.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: The long lines at this place say it all.  Deadly delicious. I go there any time I am anywhere nearby. Love the cannolis, napoleons, etc.  Apart from your waistline, you can't go wrong.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
This place is a destination in an of itself!  People who saw my bag from Mike's Pastry were asking me where they could find the store and I saw other visitors all over Boston with a bag or box of treats from there.

I love cannoli.  Yep, I do.  I stopped in to pick up a ricotta filled cannolo with chocolate chips.  It wasn't overly sweet, the filling was creamy and the shell retained it's crispness, even the following day.  The cannoli are big so they are easy to share to allow for sampling many different varieties.  I also sampled the Lobster Tail.  That pastry is as big as my head.  Huge!  It's a crispy Italian pastry filled with whipped cream and shaped like a lobster's tail.

The cases are mostly filled with the cannoli and other pastries.  Their cookies are on the shelf behind the counter.

The place is crowded and a bit chaotic but the lines move fast and service is quick.  Don't be deterred by the crowds but do know what you want when it's your turn to order.  There are a few tables inside but most people took their treats to the nearby park and ate it there.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
The Florentine cannoli is hands down the best item in the shop. Different from the rest of the cannoli, the shell is extra crispy, full of nuts, and darker in color. The ricotta cheese filling is a medium paste, not too sweet and quite savory. The chocolate chips on both ends just add extra depth to the flavors. So yummy!

Second runner up, the pistachio cannoli, has a crispy and flakey shell and a wonderful pistachio filling.

We also tried hazelnut and lemoncello flavors which lack distinctive flavors and just cannot compare to the Florentine and pistachio cannoli.

Other items tried:
Boston cream pie: a decent pie containing chocolate and vanilla layers, with a moose-like consistency.
Biscotti: crispy and full of almonds, a decent Italian traditional desert
Pistachio macaroon: had a intense green color and artificial pistachio flavoring. Too sweet and not a fan of this item.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: Great cannolis.  Their other desserts are ok but not on the same level as cannolis.  I enjoy that they have a ton of options that allow me to try something new each time I come here.  It's frustrating to have to fight through this tourist draw, but it's still worth it to fight through the crowd.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt

text: We tried limonceli and hazelnut. Both were delicious but way too big for my taste. I would be more happy with only half the size. They had many more other things which looked great so we will definitely come again.
