text: The cannoli's are to die for. I got the Florentine cannoli and my boyfriend got the Nutella cannoli. Although the wait is awhile, it is definitely worth it. Each bite is savory and very flavorful. This is my favorite place to go for cannolis. It's the best around.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
HOLY CANOLI! It'd be a sin to be in Boston and not try one of these...

I spent last NYE in boston with a friend... My first time in Boston And trying a Canoli!  Crazy right?! Mikes pastry popped my Canoli cherry and my oh my, was it gooood! Hahaha..

And to make things funnier my friend and I passed by this place one night, attracted to it by the smell and massive amount of ppl inside. Then the next night we go on the hunt to find this pastry place... To our surprise, Low and behold... It's the same place!!! Lol..

Inside you'll find such a wide variety of parties! Cookies, Canolis, cake, bread etc. Anything that requires flour, water and eggs I'm sure.  We tried their chocolate chip Canoli. It was quite good! Great taste and texture, With the perfect combo of the mascarpone cheese and the sweetness from the chocolate chips to balance everything.

Check this pastry shop out, you'll probably  buy some to bring home like we did!
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: Pretty much the best cannoli I've ever had. I hemmed and hawed about what flavor to get but eventually decided on the chocolate-dipped and I did not regret my decision. The shell was perfectly crisp, the ricotta inside lightly sweetened, and the chocolate the perfect touch. The whole thing was so balanced and not overly sweet or chalky in the slightest like some of the bad cannolis I've had in my lifetime. The store itself is worth going to if only for the insanity of a hundred people packed into a store all trying to order cannolis from the lightning-fast workers. Jostle your way up to the front, tell the cashier what you want, and you're on your way.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: What can I say, it's a Boston classic. The cannoli are great. Cash only. One cannoli is good enough for two people unless you are really hungry. And this place is busy. You basically have to fight for attention to get your order in!
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
What else can I say other than holy cannoli? When 50 customers are in a brightly lit pastry shop at 10:00 on a Wednesday night ordering pastries, you have to think the place is doing something right.
Walking in to the well lit shop off a dark street and being confronted with hoards of pictures of cannoli and cake varieties and cases of baked goods was a bit of a shock. I felt like a deer caught in the headlights.
On the recommendation of the lady who brought me to Mike's I had the chocolate dipped cannoli. In retrospect I wish I had tried the pistachio one, because I'm a bit of a pistachio kind of gal, but the dipped one was great, covered with tiny dark chocolate chips. The cannoli was at least twice the size of any I've seen before.  The standout for me was that the freshness of the cream used in the filling seemed very apparent.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
The tiramisu and cannoli are very good. I have tried a couple of different cakes/pastries over the years but those two are particularly delicious! 

I have been to the Harvard square and the north end locations. The Harvard square one is less crowded but barely has any seating...might have some stools by the window.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: A huge selection of slightly overpriced Marzipan cookies (in really cool shapes that don't reflect their flavor) as well as other goodies.  The place was packed, but they have tons of staff so the wait wasn't too long.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
*goes to a cannoli place, doesn't get the cannoli* 

I was only in town for four days, but somehow I found my way back to Mike's twice on my trip. 

My best friend and I had decided to indulge in slices of Boston Cream Pie and had read that this was a good place to go to get it - but I was immediately overwhelmed by all the options in the counters. (Kid in a candy store = Adult in a pastry shop) 

The Boston Cream Pie was sheer perfection. 

For my second trip, I picked out a hunk of chocolate chip cheesecake. It was absolutely incredible, I refuse to think about how many calories were hiding in there, and I'd do it all over again if I could. 

Seating looked limited, and it was a cold day, so we took our treats to go. (The envious looks of other people on the T let us know that we'd made the right call.)
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
ABSOLUTELY INCREDIBLE!!! Visited Mike's a few years ago our first trip to Boston and couldn't wait to get back there. Their cannolis and lobster tail are to die for! If it's your first time, get an original (or chocolate chip which is an original with chocolate chips) and definitely try the lobster tail which is filled with an amazing concoction of whipped cream, ricotta, and vanilla mousse. 

I tried Modern Pastry and Bova which are two other local institutions and they weren't nearly as good. Modern is less sweet and flavorful, and Bova's filling was completely different, more custardy than creamy, just not my taste. I want to clear up that this is not a "touristy place" it is a wonderful pastry shop which has become a tourist destination because of the outstanding quality of their desserts.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

hype is real

text: A divine little bakery that is sure to please. Try one of their cannolis that range in flavored from Oreo, to Peanut Butter and Espresso. Wide selection of goodies that is sure to keep you wanting more. I'd defiantly become a regular if I lived nearby.

text:
Everyone has their own opinions about Mike's. It's a tourist destination and you have to expect that.  

Despite the long lines, and gouging prices, there is always a reason to go back to Mike's! I always go back for the almond flavored connoli's.  When ever I make a visit to Hampton Roads, I have to grab the most chocolate filled cannoli for a friend who still remembers where that idea is placed on their menu months later.  That's the thing about Mike's, you remember the lines, the smells and the picture menu that greets you. It's always on my to-do list for tourists. 

Don't forget to try other connoli's in the area, it's always fun to figure out which pastry place you like modern or Mike's.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
If this place has the best pastries on the North End, that is pretty sad! I thought it was mediocre, at best... well, maybe mediocre for people who have never had a cannoli in Sicily or had pizzelles or any other Italian dessert they attempt to make. 

I'll admit, seeing all the other tourists walking with boxes should have made me steer clear, but I always like to try cannolis to see if they hold up to my favorites from Sicily. So we went in. It was a madhouse, even on a Sunday at like 9:30 PM. The line is so disorganized, so we just pushed our way to the front and just ordered. 

We got 3 things and it was only $4, which I thought was very reasonable. I just wish they actually tasted good! Most of it went into the trash, sadly. I wouldn't recommend anyone go here.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt

text: I had the Oreo cannoli and it didn't taste anything like Oreo. Granted yes the product in general is a delicious, good large shell, even though the filling tasted nothing like Oreo I did still enjoy it. Will definitely be back next time I'm in Boston to try some more flavors.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt

text:
What has NOT been said about Mike's Pastry? I don't care, I'm gonna say it again. BEST CANNOLIS EVER! Especially the one with chocolate chips. Just so yummy...perfect crispness, and perfect amount of sweetness on the inside. The dusted powdered sugar just makes it that much more special. 

Almost everywhere I've been to and seen a cannoli, I would try it to compare with Mike's, as it was at Mike's Pastry that I had my FIRST cannoli ever. Seriously, no other place compares. I have yet to encounter a better one. Was in Italy last year, but oddly didn't encounter one. Going back again this year, so we will see!

This place is CROWDED all the times I've been here. So be warned. They service you at the counter, and it's a little chaotic, but you can try to find the shortest line and stand there. This place is not for the meek and gentle, because people will cut in front of you shamelessly, so be assertive. Their service is fast, so even if it's crowded, you'll get your cannoli in no time. There are some tables here, but when it's crowded you will be tableless, so my suggestion and what I always do (haha) is go next door to Caffe Vittoria and enjoy a nice cappuccino with your newly acquired goods from Mike's and sit...and relax. ENJOY ONE OF THE BEST DESSERT PAIRINGS in my opinion...read my review for Caffe Vittoria and you'll know what I mean. :)

I went for the chocolate chip cannoli, which was so much bigger than the small cannoli's I usually have. It was good, but I have had better cannoli's in Italian Market in Philly. 

Time of day probably impacted my overall experience though. 

It's definitely worth checking out and I'd totally give it another try next time back in Boston.

categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
I visited Boston for a weekend, and wound up going to Mike's a total of four times ... three for pastries, and once for some morning tea/cappuccino. There was a line a few times we were there (try getting there earlier in the day, especially if you're able to go during a weekday, if you want some more time to browse the display case and place your order), but the multiple clerks behind the counter kept things moving. 

The prices were *extremely* reasonable ... two large cannolis and a cupcake were about six dollars ... and most of the clerks were very quick in getting the items and packaging them. I'm not normally a fan of cannolis because I don't care for the filling, but Mike's cannolis were very creamy and delicious, and the cannoli shell was light and flaky instead of heavy and greasy-tasting. We also had a brownie, a chocolate cupcake with white frosting, a slice of Oreo cheesecake and a sfogliatelle/lobster tail, all of which were delicious. 

My only complaint was that one clerk was a little slow in getting my order, at a time when nobody else was in the store. I also asked for a cup of tea to go, and she didn't put any milk in it (sugar is available in packets on the far side of the counter), so I asked another clerk to give me a splash of milk and the second clerk seemed visibly annoyed at the first because the first didn't take care of this for me. But to be fair, the clerk that served me seemed to be new, and I didn't originally ask for anything in my tea (although she also didn't ask how I took it). Not a big deal, nothing worth getting upset over. Also, if you want table service, be prepared to wait (both for a table and a waitress ... we had other people served before us and had to wait over 5 minutes for a waitress to come over, but there was one waitress serving about 7 full tables on a busy day). 

Mike's is absolutely worth a visit if you're in Boston. Skip the desserts at the North End restaurants and just come here instead. It'll probably be cheaper and more delicious than anything in a restaurant.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:

However, after trying Caffe Paradiso's cannoli, this place doesn't deserve more than 3 stars. Don't get me wrong, their cannoli's are good, but just not as good as Caffe Paradiso's. I've also tried their Lobster Tails... the pastry part was kinda stale so my guess is that its was sitting there for quite a while before I ate it. It was also pretty big... couldn't finish it.
Overall, not a  bad place to get a cannoli quickly. But if you have time to sit and relax, Caffe Paradiso it is!

text:
The cannoli was $3.50 as well as the Boston cream pie slice. Bottle of water was $1. 

The cannoli definitely lived up to its hype. Hubby and I were quite full from eating over at Neptune Oysters. So rich and they truly filled the entire cannoli. I abhor places that just fill the ends and when you get to the middle...it's completely empty. Booooo! Hiss! Hiss! I think the sugar rush is getting to me. 

They have homemade gelatos  also. It's $3.50. If we could eat more, we would have ordered that just to try. Fellow Yelpers, let me know if it's good. Thanks! :)

text:
My first time here and I got the strawberry cannoli and the black & white cookie. The cream in the cannoli is really light and has a faint strawberry flavor. The shell is too flaky. Maybe I just didn't get the greatest flavor. Luckily, there are plenty more flavors so I'd be happy to come back to try others. Same goes for the cookie - the cream is really light. I can barely taste the white flavor (vanilla, I assume). The black (chocolate) is light but pretty decent. The texture is softer than I expected, which I really liked. It's almost like a cookie-cupcake hybrid. In comparison between the cannoli and cookie, I prefer the cookie and would get it again. There are other pastries as well, like eclairs, cakes, brownies, etc. 

It gets pretty busy in here but service is fast. They wrap the boxes in an interesting way and I was fascinated when I saw it. 

In spite of my first time being less than satisfying, I'd still come back because of the variety. I'm bound to get it right at some point, right?
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
I GET SOMETHING DIFFERENT EVERY TIME - GOTTA TRY THEM ALL!

Let me say that I LOVE SWEETS. I can wake up in the morning and eat a candy bar - that's what kind of sweet-lover I am. I'm temporarily living in the North End and am so excited because I am near all the pastry goodness. I've tried a bunch of goodies from Mike's so here's what I have to say:

- Oreo cheesecake / Red velvet cheesecake ($4.25): I've had a few of these and have come to the conclusion that I am NOT A FAN of their cheesecakes. I don't know what it is exactly, but the cheesecake is NOT SPECIAL, if anything, kind of bland and generic. I've had better frozen cheesecakes with more flavor. But if you are going to get a cheesecake, I would recommend the Oreo cheesecake because there's more flavor with the Oreo mixed in.

- Red Velvet cake ($3.25?): After trying the red velvet cheesecake I decided to go for red velvet straight up. It was just OK. I was expecting more flavor in the cream cheese frosting but it didn't live up to my expectations.

- Chocolate & Red velvet whoopie pies ($3?): This was okay for what it is. Not spectacular but I'd give it a try. Something you can buy your young kid.

- Lobster tail ($5): I bought this not knowing what a lobster tail was. Boy was I pleasantly surprised to bite into the crispy brown Sfogliatelle and taste that creamy goodness. This is also a pretty dang LARGE treat so it took me a few days to eat it. I've tried the lobster tail at Bova's ($4 for their large which is a little smaller) and for the price/size I'd go with Mike's.

- Cannolis (vanilla, chocolate chip, chocolate, regular) ($3.25?): I'm from CA and had never had a cannoli before. When I discovered what this delicious treat was, I went a little overboard. These cannoli's pre-made are a PRETTY DECENT SIZE. They will ask you if you want powdered sugar on it. One weekend I went out and bought 4..ate them all at once because I have no self control like that and have never eaten a cannoli since. (This was about 3 yrs ago). Since Mike's has been remodeled, they have a lot more cannoli options - which makes me want to try it again.

* Check out the pictures I posted! *

BOTTOM LINE: If you're a tourist/stopping by the area, I would RECOMMEND this place. You have to try it once and see for yourself. Like the lobster tail, don't recommend the cheesecakes so much.

** SECRET tip: Depending on when you go here, it's packed with people (weekends, nights, some afternoons). With much experience frequenting the shop, I've learned to go in the doors and head to the left end of the counter. I find that people usually stand in the middle foyer of the store figuring out what they want/standing in a line that isn't moving and I am usually ordering my goods and out the door without dealing with that mess.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
Located in Little Italy, Mike's Pastry is expected to always have a line out the door.  Luckily when we got there, the line was okay.....howevvvvver, the line is a bit chaotic since you don't know where it even starts, who's waiting to order, or who's just standing there.  There are multiple people behind the counters and you line up to them.  I recommend going to whoever is open and waiting, which is what we did.

I wish we were able to taste more, but the pastries are a good size each.  I recommend sharing so you get to try everything.  Pastries were delish.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: Tourist trap....YES.  Tasty.....YES!!!!!  Okay, so this is a busy touristy bakery. Still, if you are lucky enough to be there when the goodies are hot, it is heaven!  Try the pistachio macaroons. Yes, they are dyed to a blistering bright green, but the flavor is perfection!  It is a must visit!!
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: This is a tourist trap dream. No locals ever go here this is just a stop for people who aren't from the area. It's a very stressful process, people are yelling for your order but it's so packed you can't really look and see what they have to offer you already waited about an hour in line. Just go right across the street to Moderne bakery where you'll be in and out in no time with pastries that are way tastier than Mike's. I always laugh when I see people with the Mike's boxes because I know their Tourist that don't know any better but I tend to feel a little sad for them because they don't know that there's a great little placeRight across the street.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
I'm a local and I love this place. Don't listen to anyone who says this place is overrated. I love desserts and pastries and this place is one of my go-to spots. What I love most about this place is their huge selection of cannolis. I've tried a lot of their other pastries like the lobster tail, cream puffs, and assortment of cakes (they're all great) but the cannolis are the main reason I always come back. My favorite are the Florentine and the Pecan Caramel.

A few tips.. 
1. Avoid going on weekends/tourist peak times. I've never experienced the really busy hours so I don't know how bad it gets but even when there is a small crowd inside, it's a little hard to see all the pastries available.
2. It's cash only.
3. There's really no "line" system. People tend to crowd on one side of the counter (usually the right side) when there's ladies waiting to help along the whooooole counter. So if you somehow manage to get to the front, go for it. Don't be timid once you're up front or someone behind you might yell out their order and not care that you were first.
4. Although the location in Cambridge is less busy, the selection isn't as extensive and the workers aren't as nice. Some of the prices were higher at the Cambridge location as well.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
I was told this was the place to visit on my trip to Boston and it did not disappoint! I visited around 9:00 PM on a Thursday night and it was still poppin with a big line to try these tasty treats. Things to remember about this place: 

1. Its CASH ONLY! I didnt know this at first, but luckily there was an ATM across the street to my rescue . 

2. Parking can be a bit of a hassle because of the location but with a little patience we found something near by. 

3. Lines are long!!!! BUT the staff at the front counter are pretty damn efficient, so dont ne intimidated. The line will move along quicker than you think. So if you are ever in the area, try this place out. You will not be disappointed! 

They have a ton of options and choices but I tried a chocolate chip cannoli and the regular cannoli. Let me just say, Holy Cannoli  It was SO good!
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: This place has the best cannoli and lobster tails I've had.  When you get there, you wait in a long line that spans the counter (don't pile up in one line!) and the energy is great because we're all drooling and looking around waiting for the same thing.  Watching the Italian women pull the string from the ceiling to tie the boxes is like a scene from the Godfather that got deleted - very old-world!
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: People are right when they say you have to go to Mike's Pastry when you visit Boston.  The line out the door for Mike's Pastry that you'll certainly see is for good reason. Cannolis here are bomb. I came here after visiting Paul Revere's house, which is just a short walk away. The line was long when we came here late afternoon, but don't worry! The line moves very quickly. My girlfriend and I shared a single amaretto cannoli and as a person who dislikes cream filled desserts, I was shocked at how delicious the cannoli was. Next time I'm getting my own :) I didn't get a chance to try the other pastries that Mike's offered, but everything here looked delicious and I've only heard good things. I would 100% recommend coming here if you're visiting Boston.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
Tried the original and hazelnut cannolis, and pistachio cookie.

+ Pastries are delicious (repeating what 1700+ others have said).  Cream not too sweet and not too thick- just right.
+ The staff are friendly and smile even when a crowd of people are passively aggressively waiting.

- Took 30 seconds of hassle to remove the string from the box.
- No restrooms (customers will need to relieve their bladder from the long wait)
- Limited seating (4 x 3-person tables)

Tips
* Cash Only
* Long wait (10 minutes on Wed. afternoon)
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
Oh MY GOD!!!

My friend and I got lucky and when we stopped by Mike's there was barely a line... I even had time to chat with the woman behind the counter who was admiring my tattoos. Mike's Pastry is not a place to go for the faint of heart however... one look at all the wonderful cream, biscotti, and other non-Doctor approved food and likely you'll have to see the good Doc if you over-indulge.

Which would be easy, trust me... The cannoli is AMAZING, I immediately thought of The Godfather III, where Connie is watching from the Opera box? But even that thought could not deter me from ordering the chocolate cannoli, and when I go back tomorrow I'm going to try more, maybe with ricotta cheese... hhhhmmm. Wish it was open now.

Also had the strawberry lobster tail, and amazing confection of cream, strawberry jam and flaky pastry. Oh God, can deserts really be this good?
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
Amazing cannoli. My favorite is the chocolate dipped. Plain vanilla also great. 

Huge lines but they move quickly. Usually have a lot of product left even to closing time. 

Boston creme pie is a favorite here too. 

Amazing selection of cookies that are all extremely large. 

Limited seating inside. Most people get pastries and leave.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: Mike's pastries is a must do. Tourists go here, because the locals have told them about it, because even they go here. It's got black and white cookies, scrap varieties of canolli, and several other pastry options. They are all delicious! Do it. Now. Oh and bring cash!
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
(score 1-100) - 70.  

FACT:  The reason people like Mikes is because the Cannoli are HUGE.  Twice the size on your typical cannoli.  You can definitely share just one between two people.  The Eclairs are huge as well...OMG!  Why do you think you see those Mike's Pastries Boxes everywhere?  Nobody can finish there own, everybody brings a portion home!  Ohh, my stomach.  

FACT:  There are 9 pastry shops in the North End and Mikes is 5th best in my subjective little world.  I buy pastries almost everyday....yes I have a family member going through PA (Pastry Anonymous).  I get brow beaten about how it's really all about the cream, the quality.  

FACT:  You go here if you are a tourist or maybe you like standing in lines (yes did we mention the long lines?!)

TIP: skip the cannoli and go for the eclair... its way better for you!  No really it's baked!
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: Excellent cannolis and lobster tails. A wonderful place to go on a summer night or anytime.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: Oh gawd, leave the tourist-packed line to the New Yorkers and New Jersey families with their noisy, sticky and rambunctious kids and head over to Modern or Bovas. #Sheesh.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
Before my long weekend trip to Boston, nearly everyone I asked for recommendations from told me to check out Mike's Pastry. After trying two cannolis, I can see what all of the hype is about! 

We tried the chocolate chip and the espresso cannolis, both were decadent and delicious. No complaints! Wish we could've also tried some of the other flavors (Oreo, peanut butter) but they were sold out by the time we arrived on Saturday night. 

A few things to note: they only take cash, and the line can get really long. I was warned about this. Thankfully, it moved pretty quickly, but the line was a little disorganized. Most people were just pushing to the front until they found someone to take their order.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: really, you need to ask?  Tell them cousin Vito sent you and cut to the front of the line...
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
Joining the choir of four stars simply because the mob style ordering could be much more effective if they followed the take a number system.  I prefered buying cannolli from the new location in Cambridge because its lines are shorter and less chaotic.

Enjoyed the chocolate chip (the most popular) and limoncello cannolli on my first visit. I don't recommend trying to eat more than one per sitting, and the fruity one was not as good.  Tried the espresso and hazelnut at the other location and I liked those flavors better.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
No trip to Boston - hell, all of New England - is complete without going to Mike's.

The line to heaven is well worth it. An old college friend took me here and it was a raging mob craving cannoli rammed down their throats, and you just have to shuffle your way to the front. You cannot be passive or you'll never get anything. But don't be aggressive either or the cannolo freak next to you will deck you.

Why oh why can't they open locations nationwide? Their brownies sent my eyes on a trip to the back of my head, and their cheesecakes staked out territory in my ever-growing belly. I took the T from Cambridge for the sole purpose of buying desserts the next time I came into town. There aren't any individual prices labeled on anything, so I pointed and pointed and pointed at what I wanted and then before you know it, $16. Um. Worth every damn dime.

This is why every time I come to Boston I gain like ten pounds. Boo hoo. Now give me my cannoli.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
Lines out of the hoo-ha here all the time. Everyone rants and raves about their cannolis.  It's pretty crazy how many flavors they have. Ricotta, chocolate, chocolate dipped, chocolate chip, peanut butter, pistachio, oreo, double chocolate, cappuccino,  and a quite a few others I can't even remember.  I mean, they're good  - don't get me wrong - but they're just not TO DIE FOR.  Maybe it's just been over-hyped.  If you're a tourist, definitely come for the experience, but you probably won't be coming back unless you're bringing someone else to try it or just in the area.

I'm sad it's cash only too. :(
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: The cannolis are spot on. The BEST thing Mike's Pastry has to offer. My absolute favorite are the chocolate chip cannolis. The lobster tail is also a MUST. If you love whipped cream, then you'd definitely love their lobster tails. The only complaint I have about Mikes Pastry is that sometimes their pastries can be stale.  I got a cream puff and it looked incredibly good but the shell was hard as a rock :( However their great cannolis make up for it.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: The best cannolis around, never go anywhere else! i recommend to everyone!! staff is always friendly and atmosphere is great.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: Best Cannolis EVER!  If it wasn't for the long lines (although they do move fast) I would eat cannolis every day!  If you have the time, get one and enjoy1
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: Why is Mike's Pastry my favorite place for cannolis?  Because the ricotta filling is not too sweet and still resembles the ricotta that is needed to make it (a little grainy and on the lighter side, not super smooth and not dense).  The cannolis are giant and come in a variety of flavors - my favorites being the amaretto, ricotta (plain), and chocolate chip.  Even though the line runs down the street it goes pretty fast.  I wish I could buy one of everything in that pastry shop.  I have yet to try their other desserts.  Cash only and know what you want before you get to the counter!  The staff at the counter are very nice.  The last time I went I only ordered 3 items and slowly uttered "that's it" as my eyes wandered to all the other sweets...and the guy behind the counter could probably sense my hesitation and asked "are you sure?"  I will be back!
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
If you really need a review to get you to go here, you're crazy. There's a reason its busy  -- it's real good.

Cannoli's run the gamut from plain ricotta to chocolate mousse but they're all good. Cupcakes though are especially yummy.  

No matter if you're a tourist or local, service is quick considering the lines. Just go with the flow and go.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
I love Mike's!

I completely lose my self-control after walking in the door, and want to buy everything in sight! 

My favorite is their ricotta pie, but you can't go wrong with any of their goodies!
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: Rip off tourist trap. Much better off going where the locals go - Modern Pastry further down Hanover Street towards downtown. That is where the locals all go for fresh pastries. So when in Rome....
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
Mike's has a large selection of Italian delicacies. I highly recommend the chocolate Mousse Cannolis and the Italian wedding cookies. 

There is always a crowd at Mike's. You need to push your way through because you can't really tell where the line starts or stops. There are a few tables inside, but the are rarely empty. Once you start to see people pack up, go stand next to the table and be ready to pounce once they get up.

They are open late until about 11pm.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: I think Mike's is overrated...it's all about the cannoli, baby and frankly this one isn't very good.  Modern, across the street from Mike's, is better.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
So many choices!! Everything looked good. I ended up get way too much. 
I found it to be normal in terms of taste. I didn't see what the hype was about. It was also very pricey.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: I am so not a fan of this place. They have so many different flavors of cannolis that are just ridiculous. They also are not fresh, they sit in the case day after day. It's a complete tourist trap & there are way better places than Mike's. No point in waiting in line, it's not that good.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: Best Cannoli I have ever had! Probably s good thing not in my area! Pistachio wow! Not bad price either, crunchy light shell.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: Holy cannoli, the cannolis here are huge, tasty, and legit. Worth every penny and the wait. They are literally the size of a hot dog, filled with delicious sweet cream (not too sweet), wrapped in a crunchy fried shell, and topped with whatever topping you ordered. OMG, why didn't I buy more? Goes on the list of a touristy place that is actually worth the hype. GET SOME.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: This place is alright don't believe the hype I bought 6 canolis 1 chocolate chip 2 moose 1 amaretto 1 oreo 1 hazel nut & I just think it has way too much cream in them and to top things off when she handed us the hot chocalate the lid wasn't put on properly and it spilt over my hand and she didn't even offer napkins never returning !!!!
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
CASH ONLY. (ATM across the street)

I've been going here since I was born. It's a staple of the north end and a boston tradition.

The cannoli and ricotta pies are amazing. People sometimes come in and get cupcakes - they're looked at strangely because this is an Italian bakery and come on people. Try a cannoli, be prepared for a line and push up to be heard else you'll be waiting for 20 minutes.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: This is over hyped. I was pretty disappointed with most of the desserts I had. The lobster tail was the most disappointing with the overly sweet filling and the pastry being way too dense and not crisp. It also was a bit too moist. The cannoli had a good shell and filling. The Boston cream puff custard was too thick and gluey. The chocolate mousse cake was actually pretty fluffy and good. Go to Bova's instead. Less wait and far better baking.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
This is a NORTH END - ITALIAN experience!
I tell all my all my friends - bring cash and just walk it...  it is often packed, 3 separate full counters to serve you.   They have every kind of cannoli... even ones for people who don't love cannolis!  I have had the lobster tails, cheesecake and definitely cannolis... I'll be back with more friends to enjoy the chaos and cannolis!
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: The best patries ever! Cash only and crazy busy always. Always a north end visit.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: I LOVE Mikes Pastry Shop. The only thing that I get for this shop is their cupcakes because they are just piled high with frosting and the cupcake itself is so moist.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
Quick tip: Cash only. 

The chocolate chip cannoli is my go-to on a bad day when I just need to have a win. Delicious, sweet, and not too chocolatey (but still quite pleasant). Wonderful prices, and a very dedicated staff to handle the ridiculous lines as quickly as they do. The wait to order is entirely manageable, and the people behind the counter are extremely nice. 

The food is less Italian authentic and more americanized. It, therefore, is a huge tourist spot and is packed most times of the day (though I've managed to come in the morning when it was less crowded before).

Moreover, if anything tells you how great this place is, its the number of people you see that have a Mikes Pastry box on virtually any random street in Boston. Mikes is truly a symbol of Boston.

Definitely worth visiting, whether you live in Boston or are just passing through!

P.S. They also make extremely good pies! Especially apple, though its been a while since I've seen one available.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: This place is absolutely overrated... Sorry people, you definitely need to explore more, eat at different places and also travel. The pastries here are mediocre at best!
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: Another place in Boston that was so crowded with lines it was worth it! Perfect dessert after eating at Regina's Pizzeria! We had the pistachio, espresso, and amaretto cannolis! All were so delicious and the sizes of these cannolis were huge!! Absolutely delicious! The pistachio & amaretto were tied for my favorite! They've also got very delicious pistachio gelato!
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
I don't have a horse in this whole "Best Italian Pastry in Boston" race, so I can say that without even touching that controversial issue, Mike's serves a damn good cannolo.  I would venture to say that cannoli here are more celebrated than at Modern and if I were an adventurous North End-visitor, I would recommend the following: go to Mike's for a cannolo (I really liked the limoncello and the chocolate mint) and then to Modern for cookies after. 

Hey. Calories are 90% mental anyways, right?
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: Best lobster tails in the world...they a huge..big enough for 4...long lines but worth the wait for all their pastry
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: Not sure what the hype about this place is...To be fair, I am not a fan of cannolis in the first place. I'm not sure what a standard size for a cannoli is, but I thought the ones here were quite massive. In my opinion, the cannolis had way too much filling that was overly sweet. However, I did enjoy eating the crispy, flaky shell. I saw that this place was super popular on Yelp so I wanted to check it out, but this will probably be the last cannoli I eat.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: Holy freaking yum!!! Kids loved the gelato. I haven't had chocolate chip  cheesecake like that since Italy. Cannoli's are fabulous!!!!!!
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: Some locals told us that this was the "tourist" pastry shop, but we also found it to be the best one that we visited while in Boston.  I have no patience with waiting in lines, so we went right when they opened on a Sunday (so we got in and out very quickly).  We ordered some macaroons and other cookies along with an expresso cannoli.  All of the cookies were delicious.  Unfortunately, we carried the cannoli around all day before eating it, and it got a little soggy (learn from us and don't make this mistake - eat it right away!)  This is definitely the place to go if you like cannolis.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
Mike's is the place! I come here every time I go to Boston. Lines are long and spill over the sidewalk, but don't fear: the line moves quickly, because the people behind the counters are flat-out pros. 

There's also some yelling, so don't be turned off. Just yell back! Plain? Shout it out. With chocolate chips? Louder! But seriously, make sure you're ready to order when you get three or four people out. 

If you're getting something to go, the box and twine is adorable. Don't pretend it's not.

Also, fair warning: the canoli's are huge. It's also what Mike's does best. I'm sure their other stuff is great, too, but I couldn't tell you.

The good: delicious. 
The bad: can get a bit jostle-y inside because there are like 10 lines separating out from 2.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: This place is old school Boston and a Must go to stop when your in Little Italy.  Amazingly good, consistent, and the service is quick even though the lines are out the door.  My fave is the Cannoli.   Make sure you get two because they are that good.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: So decided to stop by here after the recommendation of our beantown trolley driver. I was skeptical since I've tried cannolis in Florence and little Italy in San Diego and found them extremely sweet. But fortunately it started to drizzle after we visited Paul Revere's house and Mike's seemed like a nice, cozy place to get coffee and try the cannolis. What a delicious surprise, my husband, mother in law and I  had the pistachio and lobster cannoli and some capuccinos, and it didn't disappoint!!! They were flaky, creamy, not overly sweet, heavenly pieces of pastry.  Also, the young ladies behind the pastry counter were nice and patient. A must try for dessert, when you're in the area, they also had gelato and other pastries which we didn't try but for sure, order the cannolis!!
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: THE BEST cannoli of all time. So good I looked online when we got back home to see if they shipped to NYC (they do!)...highly recommend the chocolate chip.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
I may have only had a cannoli once before in my life. However, when we saw the long lines and the numerous people on the streets with Mike's Pastry boxes we knew we had to try it.  

I ordered the oreo cannoli and since there was nowhere to sit I carried it longingly all the way to our hotel on the subway.  Riding on the T I normally hold tightly on to my wallet.  On this ride I held on tighter to the cannoli.  But when I got back and opened the box, the deep fried smell repelled me.  I took one bite and I knew that the cannoli was no for me.  It tastes and smells like a cross between fat and heartburn.  I didn't eat more than a bite.  

I give it three stars because maybe I just don't like cannoli but I do love all kinds of baked goods and usually they're not acquired tastes.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: Til this day , I still don't understand why mikes pastry still in business. i know its harsh, but that's how i feel. i try it out one day and , my gosh it feels like you eating a bag of sugar. the pastry is over sized to the point it looks kinda overwhelming.  no wonder why america has high obesity rate.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt

text: Delicious. Best cannoli I had. We had the pistachio, amaretto and mint chocolate chip. They were all good but personally I love the pistachio the most. I am glad we stop by this pastry shop before leaving Boston. Love it love it love it

text: Wow there are so many options to choose from here!  I went with the chocolate dipped one and the amaretto.  The amaretto was very powerful and overly sweet for me so I couldn't finish that one.  The chocolate dipped was fantastic!  If you love chocolate you will love this one.  ALSO THEY ARE CASH ONLY!!!

text:
Kids say:
- "Great!"
- "Awesome!"
- "I love all their cannoli's"
- "Better than Market Basket!"
We go every time we're in BOS. Pistachio and chocolate chip are perennial favorites.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
Adding another 5 star review seems redundant but we stumbled upon Mike's our 1st night in  town last week and chose to wait in the line that wrapped to the corner (it moves fast).  Oh my god.  I don't do cannoli but I do cookies so while my husband and friends got cannoli, I opted for fig cookies, an apricot sandwich cookie and an almond macaroon.   

We sat in the living room and took our respective bites and were so happy we got emotional!  The fig cookie was one of two things in my life that I loved so much I didn't want to eat the rest because then it would be gone... and then there's sadness.   

But there's a solution - we went back everyday for the rest of the week and then we bought a box full to come home!   Fig and chocolate sandwich ended up being my favs.  Oh and again here on the North End - cash only.  And don't mind the homeless fellow waiting at the door, he offers instruction on which line to get into once you cross the threshold.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: Seconding the recommendation of the travel video maker who raved about the cannoli here, continuing down the freedom trail on the power of the sugar high.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: There's nothing better in Boston! If you are here, you must come to MIke's. The line in long, always, but it moves fast, cash only. No parking, but where in Boston is there parking? Never tried something that wasn't great.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt

text: Canolis aren't my favorite, but Mike's is definitely worth the trip in order to make one's Boston experience complete.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt

text: All of them look good at first sight. However, they taste like 100% sugar. I tried 5 different selections , no good. Absolutely not fine pastry compared to what you get in Europe. So the advice to people who are not into sugar bombs: do not go to this place.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: This is the place I miss the most in Boston!  Every time I've been it is packed.  Don't give up.  It is worth the wait.  Act like a local and wiggle your way up to the front of the line.  If you don't see it in the case, just ask for it; It's probably in the back.  The cannoli with pistachios is my all time favorite, but I love them all.  Oh, don't even try to park on Hanover Street.  Just have someone drop you off and have them circle the block.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
Yep. Just do it. Eat whatever tickles your fancy. Everything is delicious. 

A local recommended Bova but after stopping there we were back at Mike's. I will go to Bova tomorrow for their sandwiches and leave a review also. But for italian pastries you have to go to Mike's Pastry. 

It can get crazy busy so just be cool. There's plenty for everyone. Cash only so visit the atm beforehand.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
I know Mikes Pastry is famous for their Cannoli and yes they are amazing!!!
But for every dough lover on this planet ... The brownies are a must!!!! I'm not joking ... Best brownies I ever had!!! 
My favorite is the pecan caramel one ... First pastry in my life that I couldn't finish in one try (chocolate overload!!!)
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
A good place to go in the evenings because you know it'll be busy.  There's ALWAYS a crowd each time I've passed by.  Great selection of pastries.

It's name is also its biggest downfalls.  It's not a place where you go to sit and chat with friends.  The place is CROWDED and you would be lucky to find a table at times.  Also extremely noisy.  The service can also be a bit rude because they are trying to get to everyone.  

I think I prefer to try the smaller pastry shops, but it is very nice to be able to go look at Mike's selection.  Worth a visit occasionally.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
"Mike's Pastry" "Mike's Pastry" "Mike's pastry" is all I heard when the topic of Boston came up. So I did what any intelligent, hot-blooded, foodie would do and made my way on over to the North Side, a.k.a "Little Italy". 

I knew this was definitely THE place to be when I turned the corner and saw the line. It was tempting to skip out and go to either of places adjoining Mike's but I used my quick powers of deduction and stayed put. 3 cannoli places in a row, 2 empty, 1 extra packed. I was in it for the long haul. They have that theme-park-line situation going on. You expect to be rewarded with pastry once you reach the door but you're only greeted with... more line. Fortunately the long haul didn't turn out to be so long. I'd say I was in and out in 20 minutes.

Although they have around 1,000 cannoli variations, I stuck with the classic. How am I supposed to compare this one with actual Sicilian cannoli if I go with a completely different flavor? They looked pretty big but I had just waited in line for a while so I was going for a double. Again, I stuck with the classic because if the first one I eat is as good as people say, I'm not about to mess with perfection and risk getting a crappy flavor. 

We walk out with the signature box that basically everyone is the city seems to carry in their hands. We had just eaten and although I was more than able to have a go at it right away, I thought this could be something worth savoring. 

They say you never forget your first time. I was on my hotel bed, snuggled up under the covers. I'll never forget the way it made my body feel. I'm not going to lie, it did get messy but it was definitely worth waiting for. Although I wanted to pace myself, I went straight for round 2 . Oh Mike, how will any other cannoli ever compare to yours?
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
Ah, Mike's Pastry. What a chaotic thing the line becomes, out the door! The reality? There are no designated lines, folks. You fight your way to the nearest open register at the counter and order. This is the sort of situation where being petite can come in handy, and have your order in mind and cash ready! 

Friends who've been to Boston agreed I must try Mike's Pastry. The guidebook my coworker lent me said I must try it. My California-native Boston transplants, now-locals even shared the sentiment. I had never been, but a very kind friend brought a cannoli all the way back to the West Coast for me a few years ago. It was definitely still delicious and, that memory intact, this time I was looking forward to trying it super fresh. 

I decided on the Pistachio.  Il cannolo was as yummy as I expected, totally worth the wait in line, and a great way to end the night. The other flavor we tried was the Chocolate Dipped (when in reality we asked for Chocolate Chip, but no complaints there). The ricotta creamy cheese filling was the perfect texture for the Pistachio trimmings, crunchy crispy deep-fried shell, and powdered sugar. If I were to come back, I'd definitely also try the cream-filled lobstertail Italian pastry. 

The best part is triumphantly walking out of the place with your signature white box and finding the best place to sit down and enjoy the indulgence.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: Never had a cannoli. Didn't even know what a connoli was. Only heard of them on TV. My beautiful woman told me before we ate dinner that she wanted to come here afterward. This place was slam packed. Never been to a pastry shop like this. I felt like the luckiest man in the world holding my woman's hand and leading us through the crowd to the front so she could order. She ordered, I didn't want anything because I'm usually not the sweets guy and I was full from dinner. We walked outside and she told me to take a bite and that was the most delicious pastry I had ever tasted. I love that my lady shows me some of the awesome things in life that she knows about. It makes me love her so much more. Mike's Pastry you deserve 5 stars from me because my woman is awesome and she let me taste the most amazing pastry I have ever tasted.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: Never had a cannoli and have nothing to compare Mike's to but ours were delicious! Store was empty, staff was pleasant, eager to help us and share their opinions. Not arguing on the prices as a mini cupcake around the corner was $2.50, price here is reasonable!
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
My girlfriend went over while I waited in line at Giacomo's Ristorante. She chose the lobster tail, expresso, chocolate chip, and traditional cannoli. I've tried cannolis often as I have a real bad case of sweet tooth and I admit that these pastries are incredibly delicious. Unfortunately I can not make a comparison between this and Modern, Bova, or Maria's but hopefully I will in the near future.

First, it is incredibly crowded and the line is long. Fret not however, the numerous staff ensures that the line is moving at a fast pace so you don't have to worry about being stuck in a time freeze in a crowded line.

Second, my girlfriend and I agree that chocolate chip cannolis were the best tasting cannolis there. Others were still good however.

Third, my girlfriend warns that the pastries overall are extremely sweet so it may not be as scrumptious for those who can't bear excessively sweet food. I, on the other hand, loved it.

Fourth, it is cash only and it is a bit more expensive than other bakeries so make sure to prepare that in advance. There are Bank of America and Citizen Bank atms nearby on the same street.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: The treats are awesome. But the  staff really rushes you. I wanted to look at desserts and choose.. They just about at you like as if I had a line behind me. There wasn't anyine for like 10 minutes behind me.  I was shocked I was alone for a few. Any who.. They were ok.  And over priced
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
I had the Amaretto Cannoli. It was very good. The pastry could have been a bit flakier, but it was still delicious. I also ordered a fruit tart, which I thought was better than the cannoli. There a perfect amount of custard and the crust wasn't soggy, which has been the case in other places. 

There were two older women in the shop who clearly come all the time and they were chatting away in Italian with the wait-staff. It was nice to see locals in a tourist destination.

I would not stop the world for one of their cannoli, but it was good. I would recommend people to go here if it is their first time in Boston, but a man inside the shop told us to go to Modern Pastry instead. Which I will try the next time I am in the mood for cannoli.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: simply amazing, it was my third time eating pastries from Mikes this time and it has been great all three times. their cannolis are obviously the best and have never failed me, my family agrees.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt

text:
Horrible parking - but a must stop destination whenever we cycle into the northend.  

Perfect place to get your sugar fix

text: this places hellish sinful creations will sending you running for the gym...but omg are they delicious
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
2009 bin ich hier mit Freunden das erste Mal gewesen. Seitdem gehört zu jedem Besuch in Boston auch ein Besuch bei Mike's Pastry.  Mit den Cannolis geht es bei gutem Wetter dann zum Greenway an der Cross St. 

Cannolis sind frittierte knusprige Teigrollen, gefüllt mit einer Ricottacreme. Bei Mike's Pastry gibt es allerlei Variationen, wie mit Pistazien oder gefüllt mit einer Zitronencreme. Ein Cannolo kostet so $4-5 und ist jeden Cent wert. 

Der Laden ist immer voll und gerade bei gutem Wetter geht die Schlange auch bis vor die Tür. Im Geschäft selbst gibt es nicht viele Sitzmöglichkeiten. 

Neben Cannolis gibt es auch noch Eiscreme, Kuchen (spezielle auf Vorbestellung), Cookies und viele andere Gebäckwaren.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
The tiramisu is indescribably delicious. I try to get it every time I'm in Boston, and fantasize about it year-round. It is perfection. 

The cappucino is the perfect accompaniment to the tiramisu. The prices are shockingly reasonable. This place is worth all the hype (and the wait).
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt

text:
I grew up eating Scandinavian pastries so it took me a while to get on the Italian pastry train.
Well, this place got me on the train and now I have a hard time getting off!
My brother used to live down the street and after trekking down there and fighting the parking wars,  I'd make this more my main attraction than visiting him.
The place is always packed, and for good reason. 
WARNING...
They only take cash and you gottah wait in a line and it's hard to keep their items in stalk. 
BEST ITEM has to be the rum cake. I swear I can eat 10 pounds of the stuff!
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
I don't know what I can say that 1000+ people haven't already said, besides the fact that the desserts are FREAKIN' AMAZING.

Got a lobster tail--a huge lobster tail shaped pastry jam packed with pastry cream; the pastry cream dreams are made of.  Smooth and light, with just the right amount of vanilla and magic.  Yes.  I believe magic is an ingredient.

The hazelnut cannoli was full of hazelnutty goodness, but subtly enough that the I could still taste how delicious their filling was on its own.  

I should probably never go in again or I'll have to be forcibly removed for pastry consumption.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: I knew absolutely nothing about Mike's Pastry when I first laid eyes on the place.  All I saw was a huge line of people, and many a passerby walking with one of their boxes in tow.  Just like that, I was drawn in, trying my best to narrow down which cannoli I wanted to order.  It was chocolate.  And it was every sugar tooth's dream come true.  Don't be daunted by the line though, it moves quite fast.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt

text: This place definitely deserves the fame it has. The cannoli are the best around, and their chocolate cake slices are heavenly. Try to get here at an odd time to avoid extremely long lines, such as early on a weekday (maybe 11:00 A.M.) or later at night.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: First thing to note is that this place is a cash only place so go prepared! This place is one of my favorite (if not my favorite) cannoli/dessert bakeries in the Boston area. They have a big variety of cannolis (and other pastries and desserts) to choose from. The only downside is that they pre-pipe their cannolis and may not immediately have the flavor you want if they are sold out. But a must try if you love cannolis! The chocolate-ricotta filling is to die for and I love that it is not too sweet. Can't wait to try all of the flavors!
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: It's cool, and the cannoli's are yum.  Protip: Don't wait in the long line, just go up to the counter and order.  The line is for the tourists!
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: Everyone said we had to go to Mike's bakery when we were in Boston. I've had some really wonderful canolis. I lived in the NYC area growing up, which has some fantastic Italian bakeries. Maybe Boston only has Mike's? While it is good, I really don't know what all the fuss is about, or  if there is no other bakery without the long lines. You should try it, and see for yourself....and then, when people ask if you've been to Mike's, which seems to be an institution, you can say yes.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
What a disappointment. 

I LOVE cannoli, but Mike's seems to offer a more supermarket-style variety of pastry. Way way way too sweet. I was so excited to get one, but I wish I hadn't. Maybe it didn't ruin my day, but it certainly ruined that hour. So sad.

I should have known when I was waiting in line... I had a bad feeling because I saw the cakes in the cases, and their frosting was stark white with brightly colored accents... What this means is that they don't use real butter. If you make real buttercream, it'll always be just almost-white and when you add food-coloring you'll be able to get pastel colors. If you want white and bright colors, you have to use vegetable shortening (ahem, Crisco). This is all fine, but it's not what you expect from an Italian bakery. Come on guys, you have enough business that you can spend a little more on ingredients, can't you? Am I just a snob?

But back to the cannoli. So sweet. Inedibly so. I think most cannoli recipes have you put vanilla or lemon rind in the ricotta cream to give it a bit more depth, but these just seemed to be straight-up sweetened ricotta. And THEN they put more sugar on top. I should have known to say I didn't want it, but oh well.

I love dessert. I love cannoli, and I, like so many others, was excited to try this place out. Yelp readers, don't be fooled by the crowds and the pictures with celebrities/presidents on the walls... You don't want to eat these.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
LOVE. LOVE. LOVE! 

My brother and I stumbled across this in our search for Boston Cream Pie during our brief visit from LA && boy am I thankful for Yelp reviews that I found this amazing spot for cannoli's. 

We walked almost 2 miles from Newburry to visit this place post-Juno blizzard && every step was worth the treck in the cold. Upon arrival, there behind the counter are a group of women ready to serve you... quite intimidating, but I'd rather have that vs. than no service at all. 

We ordered the chocolate chip cannoli and a slice of Boston cream pie to start. All I have to say is that cannoli filling is TO. DIE. FOR. YUM YUM YUM! The crispness and not too flaky shell was perfectly paired with that filling. I had to really stop myself from eating another. We bought two more to take home and I am so looking forward to having that in the morning. The custard in the cream pie was mouthwatering... I just wish the cake was moist rather than dry. 

Although, I am sure I will never have this again, at least any time soon... This has definitely become a place to visit if I ever come back to Boston. This is definitely evidence that yelp does the belly and sweet tooth good!
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
Their Canollis and Strawberry Cheesecake are the best!

I saw people carry their boxes on the street for a long time and I decided to check in yesterday. Their Canollis are amazing, delicious. The cream inside tastes great, not too much. Shells not oily, looks hard but will melt in your mouth. I love hazelnut and I also want to try all of them in the future. Strawberry Cheesecake is also very good, you should have a try. I believe the majority of their desserts will bring your mouth into the haven.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:

Cannoli's are unreal. The best by far is the Florentine. Get 2 or maybe 5. Amazing. 

Would stop by if in the area for a nice sugar fix!

text: Cannolis were average, to be honest. The line was ridiculously long, so maybe that amped up my expectations, but I've had way better in New York. text: I don't like cannoli. But I do like Mike's Pastry's cannoli. Seriously an amazing place... The prices are good, the desserts are amazing, and the staff are so efficient. text: Wow. Unbelievably delicious! The Nutella Cannoli is worth every delicious calorie!!! Don't miss this tasty treat when you are walking the Freedom Trail!

text:
Cannoli Heaven. So many choices!. I went with the traditional cannoli. Was not disappointed. The shell perfectly crunchy, the cream tasty, creamy and the right amount of ricotta. 
The hot chocolate I had was the star. Honestly the best I have ever had.
