text: Always fresh, which is the secret to good tasting pastries, since there's always a long line of customers. Other bakeries, sadly, too often try to pass off and sell their stale or almost stale, goodies. Thus, don't be put off by their long lines, because it means you'll be getting something fresh, right out of the oven!
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: Arguably the best cannolis in Boston's North End. I didn't try the other hoppin' one though. But, it was the best cannoli I've had outside of Italy and I've tried a few : ) Make sure to get the Florentine: caramelized dough with choco chips on the sides. I also really enjoyed the Hazelnut cannoli mmmmm
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: I was interested in trying Mike's Pastry because it was one of the top places to go on Pinterest. Furthermore, I had never tried a cannoli before and it was definitely a pleasant surprise. I got the pistachio cannoli and my only complaint would be I wish the filling would have contained more pistachio instead of just the ends. In addition, it was extremely crowded but the line moved very fast. Make sure you have cash because that is the only thing they take!
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
sorry, it reminds me of van wilder whenever this type of pastry comes around.

But we did in fact try both this and Modern and although Modern offers the friendlier atmosphere and small shop setting, perfect for a date or something, Mike's got some pretty bad ass chocolate chip conolli.  It reminds me of the Pepperidge Farm Brussels and then wrap that around cream cheese and chocolate...mmm.  And after 1 bite, I'm already full.

But the interesting story is how we came across this little pastry shop, as perhaps 40% of the people that were in there as well.  As we were walking around Hanover, we noticed smal white boxes, but wondered what everyone was carrying.  It was like each block had 3 boxes.  So as we got a closer look, we found Mike Pastrys.....and then our curiosity got the best of us.  We searched our phones, read the reviews and followed the 4 people in front of us claiming they know where Mike's Pastry's was...and there we found it.  A large shop with hundreds of pastries and long stretches of lines.  True, it isn't as friendly and face to face with the customers as Modern is, but they do pump out them mean conollis like hot cakes.  

We ended up spending $28 there for the 3 of us....WHAT normal person spends $28 on pastries for a presnack to dinner?  (shakes head)
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
I didn't like cannolis until I went to Mike's Pastry. There is always a line out the door, and no, sorry the line does not move quickly. The line usually divides up into random lines within the store, into about 4 lines, and you should try to pick the line that moves fastest. The wait is worth it.
There are many flavors of cannolis. I have tried the strawberry (delicious), peanut butter (amazing and rich) as well as chocolate chip. I really want to try the nutella one. Since it is called Mike's Patry and not Mike's Cannoli, they do have other things such as lobster tail (a giant pastry shell filled with cream), assorted cupcakes and pieces of cake. 
Each canoli will set you back by $4, and its cash only. There is a bank across the street if you need an atm. The cannolis are quite big and worth the $4. I wish they would make mini cannolis so that I can try more flavors!
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
Mike's Pastry really does live up to the hype. Yes it's touristy, and if you unwisely visit after dinnertime on a weekend there will be an insanely long line. Stick with a cannoli, any variety (though we also liked the other pastries). I used to think I hated cannolis until I came to Mike's and I finally learned the beauty of a fresh cannoli. I know you want to buy some to save for later, but you've got to eat it right away. There's nothing better.
Do yourself a favor and come off-peak like we did, an early breakfast stop after strolling out of our nearby B&B. No line and you can actually get a table. The iced coffee was good, the service is charming, all the ladies behind the counter coo at your baby, and everyone's in a great mood because they're all eating cannolis for breakfast. I happily tried to eavesdrop (with my 6 months of Italian class skills) as one of the ladies switched out of her Boston drawl to hold a conversation in fluent Italian with a tourist from Italy. What a North End moment.
Just a few two-seater tables packed into one corner, but there was table service during breakfast, which surprised me. I don't recall if this is the case at all hours. And despite the disposable plates & utensils, they also bus tables.
There's a reason why you see tourists and locals alike all over the city, holding little blue and white Mike's Pastry boxes tied with string.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
Yes, Mike's is famous.  Yes, many people will tell you that Mike's sells the best cannolis in Boston.  No, most of those people don't actually live in Boston.  This is a place for the tourists.  Tourists LOVE it.  Don't believe me?  Ask any of the 30 or so waiting in line at any given moment.  

Don't get me wrong.  The cannolis are good.  Mike's was actually the first cannoli I ever tasted, as part of a purely selfless cannoli tasting experiment I undertook on behalf of my friends.  With no basis of comparison, I loved it.  However, the cannolis at Modern Pastry (down the street a little) or at Maria's (around the block) are much better.  Mike's pre-fills the cannolis, so they aren't fresh.  You really can taste the difference.  The cannolis are also more expensive at Mike's.  It's true that they're also a little bit bigger, but I find that the smaller cannolis actually have a much more pleasing filling-to-shell ratio.  The filling is very sweet, which is good, but it's not as ricotta-y as I might hope a ricotta cannoli will be.

The other pastries are also very good, and here is where Mike's deserves credit.  The selection is amazing - far better than any of the other pastry shops I've been to.  They have everything, including many different varieties of cannoli.  Now, I'm a purist (ricotta filling in plain shell, maybe some chocolate chips on the end), but if you want a peanut shell or something else fancy, Mike's is the place to get it.

But, overall, it's over-crowded, it's not as good as everyone says it is, it's complete chaos inside (it's not really a line, so much as a screaming cluster of people waving cash - much like I imagine the trading floor on Wall Street used to be), and I believe they still only take cash.  If you want a cannoli, do yourself a favor and go to Maria's.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
I love sweets and so of course I love Mike's pastry!! 

When my friend was visiting she had heard that we should definitely go here for dessert. We stopped in when we were in the North End and were totally overwhelmed with their amazing selection. We finally decided we had to split a cannoli with chocolate chips and each get gelato too! They had so many flavors it took a while to choose.  She got coconut which was amazing and I got pistachio and hazelnut. Everything was delicious! 

Whenever I'm in the area I will for sure be back.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
Didn't think I liked cannolis until I tried Mike's cannolis. I got the espresso cannoli, which was filled on the spot and topped with a layer of powdered sugar. The filling was rich but light and melted in your mouth. The shell was crunchy and delicious. I got a bit greedy and despite being extremely full from dinner in the North End got a second pistachio cannoli to go. Unfortunately after leaving it in the fridge overnight the texture wasn't at all the same (as expected) and left the inner part of the shell soggy. 

Wanted to go back last time I was in the area but the line was out the door. People line up for a reason!
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
If you are EVER in Boston, this is a MUST. See the capitalizations?

I had the chance visit my friend this past year and she told me about this place that has a crazy good cannoli. Being the tourist I am, I went for it and yup, she was right.

At first glance, it can be pretty overwhelming with the number of selections and what not. Almost everyone inside knows what their doing so you have to somewhat force yourself to the front of the counter. Once you get the golden ticket to the counter, I would suggest ordering at least two because you'll most likely regret your decision if you pick one, trust me. I personally really liked the chocolate chip and the pistachio, but have your pick. 

tl;dr - Stuff your face with a cannoli or two!
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: I totally went here to fulfill the tourist in me but I'm so glad I did... the sizes of these cannolis were insane and the cost is so affordable! Totally worth it!
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: As far as pastries go, these are bottom of the barrel.  The cannolis taste fine but the portions are huge, nothing special here.   The other pastries look like what you'd find sitting around in a New Jersey diner, way too big and lacking any flavor.  This place is always mobbed- good luck even ordering.  And the staff is extremely rude- I realize there's a line out the door, but that's no reason to treat your customers like unruly children.  Head to Maria's if you want to experience what a real Italian pastry tastes like
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: Mike's is OK but there are so many options in Boston that are so much better!  Modern Pastry, Bova's on Prince/Salem, Cafe VIttoria all are better service and quality.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: One of the most amazing pastry shops I've ever been to. The line is always out the door and down the block, but don't be intimidated by it. The line actually moves pretty quickly. I would go back to Boston just to visit Mike's Pastry.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt

text:
With over 4000 reviews, it should be clear to anyone why this place rocks! 

TIP TIP If you don't like cannolis then don't order them!!  This place is called Mikes pastry, not Mikes cannolis!!! They offer multiple dessert options from cookies, moonpies ( I so wish they had these out West),and other delicious cupcakes.   Mike's is located on Hanover, not too far from Fanueil Hall and other tourist havens.  

We got a few cannolis, red velvet moonpies, and various cupcakes for the minions, to which ALL were amazing! 

As a kid I used to LOVE coming here before my move out to Cali, and it's cool to take the fam here to enjoy such a gem in da Bean! 

TIP They are Cash only so leave the plastic in your wallet!!!!

82/2016
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt

text: First time trying an Espresso cannoli from the famous Mikey's Pastry in Boston. So creamy and so good, the perfect end to a night of endless food. Would definitely recommend as a treat or a dessert after dinner!
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
Just ok. Seemed like there was always a line but moves pretty fast. CASH only. The food was mediocre I think. It's just the thought of having that many selections of cannoli is what makes it different from other bakeries. Though I have to add there are many other bakeries here in the North End that has many flavor cannoli. We tried this one coz it had the most review. More of a hype than for the taste. 

We tried the pistachio cannoli which was too sweet I can hardly taste pistachio. The chocolate mousse cannoli was pretty good. The pistachio macaroons I liked but my family didn't so that's a toss up. It had that marzipan taste which they didn't care for but I appreciated. The gelato ice cream my kids had was quite disappointing -- chocolate and Oreo flavors. Though they didn't seem to mind being kids they just want ice cream. But even this was subpar to ice cream. It had more of a consistency of a sorbet or Italian ice. 

Glad we were able to try this place to check out the four star reviews but I'll probably try some other place next time.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: Some places that are well known are over rated and tourist traps, not Mike's.  It deserves all the praise, fantastic pastries especially the generously filled great tasting cannoli's.   Awesome
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
How many different ways do you think you can make a cannoli?  Have you ever wanted to have the best cannoli on Earth?  What about any other type of moist-baked pastry on Earth?  Mike's will help you with all of these dilemmas. AS LONG AS YOU HAVE CASH.

When visiting Boston, one of the parts of town that I wanted to hit was the famous North End.  This side of the city is so rich in Italian culture, it really is little Italy.  So it's no surprise that an authentic pastry shop such as Mike's would be dishing out the sweet goods on a unmatched level.  Luckily for me, we were in the North End for my birthday, so that meant a little guilt-free indulgence in the form of compleanno cannoli(s)!  I went with the Amaretto variety and a nice cup of Italian espresso.  This dessert was simply magnificent;  These things are literally the size of a brat wurst...

If you're in Boston and have a sweet-tooth (like me), you gotta hit Mike's.  It's a must.  And remember: BRING CASH.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: Mike's is pretty legit if you love cannolis. The wait is huge, but it's worth sharing with someone because it's huge. Cream is thick and sweet, and it's worth a first visit.

text: Mike's Pastry is one of those places with a reputation so glorious that nothing could really meet it. As an undergraduate at Brandeis, I remember kosher-observant people sneaking in a cannoli here and there. (And why not--it's close enough, right?) So when I came here a couple weeks ago during a visit to Boston, I found myself underwhelmed. It's not that the cannoli wasn't good--it was. It's just that it wasn't mind-blowing. There were plenty of other desserts I'd rather be having. Such as, well, pretty much everything at LA Burdick. Or an ice cream from Cristina's. Or a pie from Petsy. Or, well, you get the idea. Sure, I'd come back. It's a bit of nostalgia from all the way back. But it's not actually that amazing, IMO.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: On a recent trip to Boston, our friend really recommended we buy something from Mike's Pastry. On two different occasions there were huge lines and so I thought this place must be amazing. My friends ordered pistachio macaroons among other things and I tried them all. There was really nothing that special about anything that I had that made me say wow this is amazing I must go to back to Boston to buy more pastries to bring back to New York unlike my friends who would. The only cool thing I saw inside the shop was the little system they developed to tie the boxes. The wiring came from overhead and under the ceiling where the spool was on a shelf. (little things I notice)
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt

text:
Came here after dinner and friend said the pastries here are to die for! I can see why, as a tourists, seeing the crowded bakery plastered with people when the streets were empty...I was like a moth to a flame.

I don't know if it's a Boston thing, but the pastries are huge! Cannolis are a must try and I had a hazelnut flavored one. Very good and creamy and not too sweet. I would definitely come back here if I ever visit Boston again.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
I have a very soft spot for sweets. While I'm not the biggest fan of breaded Italian pastries, I'm perhaps the biggest sucker for fruity desserts. 

I couldn't leave Boston without bringing home some pastries--I really wanted to get my hands on the lobster tail. By now, I was a little sick of anything that had to do with seafood (names, looks, taste), and my stomach did growl by the time I was going to get a "LOBSTER tail." Originally, that was the only pastry I intended on getting, but 4 pastries later, I walked out guilty, but happy as hell. 

8 hours later...I was munching on the desserts with my family back home in New York. I'm not the biggest fan of cannolis, but man, were they fried and sweetened to the max. The Limoncello lemon cream was too sweet; I was excited to try this, thinking it would be tart in the slightest, but it was very sweet. The Pecan and Caramel Cannoli was actually much better, and the cream was pretty smooth. I also got a Cream Puff for my mother, who is a huge fan of them, but didn't really enjoy. Finally, the Lobster Tail...I don't get the hype. Maybe it was because my pastries were kept shut in a box for 8 hours in a car, but the cream had a tangy taste to it. It's just a huge breaded pastry with lots of cream. I didn't enjoy it, but I didn't hate it either; there was nothing special about it. 

Pastries were pretty pricey and the environment was very fast-paced. It was pretty overwhelming to be inside, but the ladies seemed very patient.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
Cash only- be prepared!
Canollis are $2.50 and decadent. My favorite is the lemoncelli but the espresso is actually a close second. Ordering is a little crazy- you might have to be a little agressive and just go up to the glass displays to order- lots of people just stand around in the middle of the store unsure where to go or what to choose it seems.

text: You can't  beat the cannoli! Unless your mother makes them. We made 4 visits in a week... mmmmmm so good!

text:
Great place for the tourist crowd. Mike's is a quintessential Boston Italian cannoli shop. It has made its way into every guidebook in every language for the quality of its deserts. They have some 30+ different varieties and also provide a myriad of other deserts, almost always made to perfection.

It's Cash only and extremely crowded, so be prepared to wait and pay for the privilege.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt

text: Awesome place, worth the wait. Really crowded in the summer time. Chocolate Cream Is the best!
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt

text: A MUST go and indulge in amazing Italian desserts!!!  Don't miss all the authentic treats.  Wish I got more.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
What can I say, it's a legend.  Fantastic fresh-made cannoli, in more varieties than I've ever seen.  Always delicious, and always a line (well, more of a jostling crowd), though it moves pretty quickly.  You just need to be assertive, and figure out what you want by the time you reach the counter.  I keep meaning to try the rest of their pastries (they're supposed to be stellar as well), but never seem to be able to make myself pass up on a cannoli.  My only downsides to this place is that the crowds are often very large, and they only have a few tables, so I've almost never been able to grab a seat.  That and they only take cash (though come to think of it, given the crowds, taking cash is probably better for speeding things along).  

Mike's, I hope you never change.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
I never liked Cannoli, but Mike made me a believer. Very crispy outside and a mosh pit of flavor on the inside. I couldn't eat the whole thing. Just too much, so you can split it with a friend. The night we went it was raining, so the inside was a total mess but I can't blame them. Most of the streets were snowed in and they had just gotten hit by the worst snow storm of the year.

Nice place to hangout. I wish they had more tables.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt

text: So I've been to Mikes 2 times and the first time I wasn't a fan but the 2nd time around I fell in love with the peanut butter cannoli. Definitely recommend it!
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: Came to Boston for a weekend business conference and was told by a co-worker, who formerly lived in the area, that if there was one place to visit in the city it was Mike's Pastry!  It is a local institution.  Open late, I was excited to discover that it was a mere two blocks away from our dinner location one evening!  I told my dining compatriots about Mike's and we agreed to skip dessert at the restaurant (an excellent Italian place called Antico Forno) and go to Mike's for cannoli!  As we approached Mike's we saw smiling person after person carrying a bright white and blue to go box.  Entering, even late on a Saturday night, the place was packed.  Lining up, we made our way up to the counter and got our respective desserts.  I got the strawberry cannoli, while my colleagues ordered a lemon and chocolate.  Going our separate ways, we all later joined a group text from our respective hotel rooms as we indulged in our selections!  My strawberry cannoli was delectable.  Each bite resulted in pastry crumbles falling to the side and strawberry cream oozing out the back.  It was a pleasure to use my fingers pick up the pieces and scoop up the filling for extra bites.  It was amazing!  If you are in Boston you must visit Mike's Pastry!
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
I don't like cannolis--this was an amazing cannoli. The girl recommended the florentine--more 
 like PHENOMENALTINE. Cannot vouch for other pastries. Bring cash. Eat well. Good luck.

The boston cream pie was mind blowing to say the least! The greman turtle cake was amazing too. Im not a big fan of cannoli so i didnt care much for them but the choco mousse was definitely worth a mention! Anyone visiting Boston should definitely make a trip to mikes!

text:
Mike's Pastry, perhaps a mandatory stop for all tourists in the city of Boston. The string tied boxes are immediately recognizable as a rite of passage. On the weekends or during peak tourist season, the line at the original North End location is out the door, down the street and around the block. Getting this coveted cannoli can be an endurance trial spanning well over an hour.

But on this September Wednesday I was able to stroll in and stroll out in under a minute. No line, no waste of my time.

Got the plain ricotta cannoli with powder sugar dusting. Rich, creamy, with a milky taste. Very dense and thick mouthfeel here. Light sweetness.

Shell has a nice crunch. Hard and sturdy, no leakage, no soggyness. Holds form exceptionally well. Some nice flakiness on the outer layer of the shell. Clean and sweet flavor, no oily aftertaste.

Simple but done right. A Boston classic for good reason.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
I don't like cannolis, never have. I never understood why everyone liked them so much, and I still don't understand why they like them so much if they don't come from Mike's.  These cannolis are cream of the crop, pun intended. I'm sure they have other good stuff too but when you look around at the constant crowd of people filling the store, you can know at least 80% of them are there for one thing, a cannoli. Not getting one from Mike's would be like not getting a taco when you go to Mexico.
Don't be put off by the tourist trap like look this place has. This is one of the few places in Boston that tourists will flood, and they're actually making a good decision (as opposed to anything Fanieul Hall has to offer).
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: Just like almost any other review you will read on here I must admit that the the cannolis are exquisite! We luckily stumbled in during a lull in the nearly constant crowd and were served pretty quickly. Everything else looked absolutely divine and I will be definitely returning when I go back to Boston to sample some more.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: This place is chaos at its best. They have sooo many sweets to choose from and not just cannolis. Unfortunately, because of the insanity of the crowd, there is no possible way to see all the different options. I've never been a huge cannoli fan so I'm probably not the best judge for this, but I will say these cannolis were quite good. The fudge cake is nothing special and their cheesecakes are only decent. They have about a billion different Italian cookies to choose from and we just asked for them to fill a box and surprise us. This way we got to try a ton of different ones; however, none of them really stood out. I'd say stick with the cannolis.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
Always a line out the door, but it's a pretty painless wait.

Cannoli's are GIGANTIC - very worth the price. I've only ordered cannolis from them so I can only speak to that, but they are a very light type of sweet, not too overwhelming. 

I would recommend to anyone who has a sweet tooth and a budget
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
The cannolis are incredible! I just googled cannoli to check the spelling, and Mike's is the 2nd thing that comes up on the search. That speaks for itself.

But it's not just one kind of cannoli. There are 5 or 6, so you can choose your chocolate amount (chocolate dipped? chocolate on the ends?), and other excitement.

The cookies are tasty, especially the macaroons (the almond macaroons are my favorite). 

And prices can't be beat. You'd think that for the best pastries in the North End you'd have to pay an arm and a leg, but it's actually very reasonably priced. I walked out with 2 cannolis and 8 cookies for only $14. And they package it up so nicely with string!

Lastly, don't be scared away by the crowd. If there's a long line, it's totally worth waiting. It moves pretty fast. But if you get there before the post-dinner crowd, it's totally manageable.

PS--Cash only.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
The cannolis- AMAZING! We didn't go here until Saturday night, but all day Friday we saw so many people walking around with Mike's pastry. After seeing everyone walking around and also getting recommendations from friends to check this place out, we finally walked past the place and the line was wrapped around the corner! Luckily we came back later and the line was just out the door. It was about a 15 min wait and it was worth every minute. 

We also tried their Lobster Tail which is a fried pastry filled with white cream filling. It reminded me of eating frosted flakes. The outer shell is crispy and holds the cream very well. It doesn't get soggy at all. It's a bite of heaven. The boston cream pie is also very good. For the cannolis, we ordered the amaretto, pistachio, plain, chocolate mousse, and the lemoncello. I don't think there is anything at this place that tastes bad. Worth the wait!

Make sure you bring cash because they don't accept credit cards.

text:
When I told my coworker I was visiting Boston, he told me that I HAD to try Mike's cannolis. I ran it by Ligaya and she said it was touristy and there were other nearby pastry shops that were excellent and more "local". When we got to Hanover Street, we decided to try a cannoli from Mike's and one from Modern Pastry just down the street so we could compare them.

The line at Modern Pastry was so long we decided to split up and I braved the much longer Mike's line. I was scared it'd take a long time, but the one line out the door split into three and once you got to the front counter, you could order from any of the many employees scrambling to fill little paper boxes with delish pastries as fast as they could. If you go to the right, you can order gelato, ice cream or marzipans from the counter there before you even reach the front. The marzipans looked absolutely wonderful. Shiny, miniature fruits that looked real and really yummy.

There were many kinds of cannoli to choose from, the tiramisu looked tempting and I wish I had more time to sample the various cookies and cakes they had on display. I was dedicated to my task, however, got my plain cannoli and managed to get out in pretty good time. There are also tables at Mike's where you can eat your pastry and also get coffee drinks. Even with a long line out the door, there were plenty of tables available, but I couldn't tell if there was table service or not.

By comparison, the Mike's cannoli far outshined the Modern Pastry one. Granted, I'd never had cannoli before but I could easily tell which was better - so this isn't about how good Mike's is in the whole wide world of cannoli, but if these are the two best Boston has to offer, Mike's your guy. The Mike's cannoli pastry was thicker, flakier and more buttery and the filling was slightly sweeter and had a lighter texture than the Modern Pastry. That one's pastry was thinner, not flaky at all and the filling was a little more bland and had the texture of cheesecake rather than pastry filling. You might like that better, but I think Mike's is the way to go on the cannoli. Can't wait to go back and try their other offerings.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

name: Mike's Pastry

text:
The North End is beginning to make me gag.  This really makes me sadder than Buffalo Bill's puppy upon skin skeleton completion.

Why?  Well because I've been touting The North End as the sole trophy winner as far as Italian Neighborhoods in America are concerned, and based purely on urban history and it's current aesthetic, it is.  However, the tacky Italian-American loiterers, the touristy main artery that is Hanover and places like Mike's Pastry are beginning to churn my insides to the bubbly equivalent of Mt. Doom.

Let's see: Mike's Pastry.  Long Lines...always packed...Italian Pastries and Gelatto.  We had a Pistachio Cannoli guaranteed as being freshly made.  Let's think about this here for a minute Ted, why would anybody put a guarantee on a box.  Hey, the way I see it, a guy puts a fancy guarantee on a box cause he wants ya to feel all warm and toasty inside am I right Ted?  Hey, you want me to take a dump in a box and mark it a CANNOLI, I will...I've been to Mike's Pastry!

Two things (modified Tommy Boy monologues aside): 1-Fresh Cannoli's can be determined by the fact that the creme filling is inserted upon ordering, right before consumed....these were not.  2-Fresh Cannoli's usually have a fresh dough (Fresh: warm crispy and chewy and baked goodness flavor)...these were not.

Rather they were stale and poorly made.  I won't even mention the specifics of the cannolis I have had in Italy, but lets just say there are much better ones to be had Italy and US.  

The Gelatto, and I don't even know why I'm doing this, was maybe the worst I've had.  The Lemon was blocks of ice....I was like those frozen lemonades that you get at theme parks that come in the cardboard cups with the wooden tongue dispenser spoons.  We also asked for Cantaloupe and they gave us Watermelon which didn't taste like Watermelon at all and was perhaps the exact opposite texture as the Lemon...instead of blocks of ice...it was basically melted upon arrival.

As I always say, people love to be a part of something....the trouble is, sometime it matters not to people whether that something is good or not.  A friend once made fun of me for wearing a pair of Crocs.  As sickening as the epidempic of the human race to be a part of something en vogue is, when something is good value + good function + good quality, who cares?  Mike's isn't.  It's just that place where THEY ALL fall in line and respond the mindless reaction of the masses.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: The go to place for cannolis in Boston. There's a huge selection and there's always a giant line. I have never gone wrong with anything on their menu. I would recommend it to anyone who likes desserts and want to check out Boston's North End.

text:
Someone told me this place was a tourist trap. I have to say, I couldn't agree more. I came here with high expectations after exiting Modern Pastry Shop. I made sure to order a famous cannolli (I picked the amaretto one) as well as the lobster tail. 

I was waiting for the lobster tail to impress me beyond belief. I held the precious $10 Mike's pastry box with only two pastries in it and excitedly headed back to enjoy. The lobster tail was fried and extremely hard. IT was filled with cream that was neither sweet nor flavorful. It was not life changing, so whoever review that I don't know what you would consider life changing ...

The cannolli, maybe I just don't like hard pastries but honestly the shell was hard, the insides were filled with the same bland cream as the lobster tail and the amaretto was barely in existent after the first bite. It's like a smaller version of the lobster tail with some almonds stuck on the side. I wasn't too impressed ... oh well!
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: this place is immensely popular, there's long lines inside, and it seems to be crowded at all hours of the day. its also very touristy - lots of people walking around little italy in boston were looking for this place. what i have to say is, i think i got more hype than satisfaction? i had the cannoli. granted it was HUGE, but the cream inside was WAY too sweet. the shell was good. my friends had the tiramisu, again generous portion. i would definitely give this place more chances, but overall impression wasn't terribly impressed.
