name: Mike's Pastry

text:
Clearly a total touristy trap but happily, I was touristing it up (well, kinda.. in town on bizness) and my pal had us pop in here after a crappy Italian meal nearby.
Crowded joint, no specific line, cash-only. 

I only had eyes for the gold cupcake - I LOOOOVE would MARRRRYYY chocolate frosting on yellow cake (except I'm already married) and was excited to see they had this kind of cupcake. I completely skipped the cannoli, cookies, pastries, blah blah blah and ordered a cupcake, which I carried lovingly back to my hotel and ate sandwich style on my bed. SO GOOD! The cake was moist, the chocolate frosting sweet but not cloying and that thing made me happy, I cannot lie! 

I was obsessed all the next day -  planning my return for that evening. I ordered two golds (fat girls rule) and one florentine cannoli just to, order a cannoli, I guess (even though I don't really like them). 

The cupcakes, again, were fabulous. Perfect frosting-cupcake ratio. The cannoli was yucky - that's an opinion thing (well, duh) because I just don't like cannoli but I was interested in the florentine cookie part. I tossed the whole thing.

Next time in beantown I will absolutely stop by for more chocolate and gold nomness.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: Mikes is the best. They've got good frickin gooood conollies with ricotta. This place has huge selection of good things so don't go hungry you'll wind up getting more than you can eat. Parking is bad always a crowd and they only take cash, but always good.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: I've never heard of cannolis until I went to Boston and people recommended that I hit up this joint.  It's tucked away in the midst of a billion Italian restaurants in the North End.  The cannolis were good but a little bit too sweet for my taste.  Actually, I remember thinking, these calories are not worth the taste.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
This place is just an institution. I feel like if you're just visiting and even though it is completely touristy, you still got to go.

The cannolis here always come in a nice hard shell and ohh they have so many fillings. I think they added new fillings over the years than the standard Italian fare. 

I got the chocolate mousse cannoli, which surprisingly wasn't too sweet for me. Usually I'm not a fan of the filling, but it was a nice balance to the crispy hard shell. My friend got a lobster tail. I thought it was good, but not as good as my cannoli.

Since I was flying back the next day, I got a few more to take home. They transported ok. I think if I need to refrigerate that I will stick to the Florentine one. 
 
One helpful tip is once you get inside the store, there are just multiple lines. I like to queue up in the far left ones since everyone seems to just want to mull around the right. Also if you're not big into the line a good alternative is to hit up Modern Pastry, which is a little further down Hanover St.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: Everything you hear about Mike's is true. The cannolis are so amazing and the prices are great. There's not much I can say that hasn't been said. But just a reminder they only accept cash although there is a ATM across the street.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: Best cannoli I've ever had, hands down. My grandmother was Italian. I plan to go back ASAP for a Boston Creme Pie.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
I like Mike's Pastry...but I don't "love it,"
because the pastries are good, but they're not "great."
In the Boston Battle of Mike's versus Modern, I'm a Modern Girl.

PASTRY:  Cookies can be a bit too dry for my taste, 
but the cannoli cream is authentic and their best seller.

WAIT TIME: Can be beyond annoying, subjecting yourself
to LONG LINES of tourists only there via a paid guidebook ad.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
These damn cannolis should be a controlled substance!
You'll want everything that's on the display case! The oreo cookie cannolis, chocolate covered, hazelnut, ricotta.... 
Those are some of my favorites.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
I just moved to Boston and everywhere especially around North End I saw these people carrying "Mike's Pastry" boxes so I thought there must be something good inside and I should try it. 

When I arrived there on a Saturday there was an enormous queue in front of the shop but I had nothing better to do with my time and I really wanted to try those cannoli therefore I joined the queue. It went surprisingly fast, I think I didn't wait longer than 10 minutes max. The reason for that is that you should decide really quickly what to order when you finally reached the person behind the counter. 

As the cannoli looked quite small to me and I wanted to try different flavours I took four of them in total, pistacchio, limoncello, chocolate chip, and pecan caramel. Later I realized that they are so heavy that one of them practically replaces a full meal. But even two days later when I ate the last one, it still tasted good (I kept them in the fridge though). I think each one was around 4 USD and they all were good, but I liked the pistacchio most. Cash only.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: Not impressed at all! Everyone recommends this place for desserts and that is why the lines are wrapped around the building and you wait an hour to place your order. But is it worth it? Absolutely not! We ordered a few things to try - caramel cheesecake , Oreo  cheesecake, pumpkin cupcake , and the lobster tail( I think that was the name but basically a cream filled pastry ) all were very bland and way under expectations from the way you hear people talk about this place. I wish I would've skipped this on my recent trip to Boston
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: Overrated is the word to describe it. Not worth the wait, the price and the "meh" feeling you get from eating their produce. The cannoli is tasteless and just not worth. The other pies and sweets also come across as you could do better at home or by eating at Cheese Cake Factory with a comfortable seat and better service.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
So good!!!

I went crazy my first visit, bought $25 worth of pastries totally disregarding the fact that I had to carry the box the rest of the day, but i didnt care, nothing stops me when it comes to cakes and pastries (internal fat kid alert)!  mMm.  Out of all of my selections, my faves were the ricotta chocolate chip and the original ricotta.  Tiramisu was also good as well as the ricotta pie.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: This place is just to die! Best cannoli's I've ever had! Oh & cheesecake! I've always gone to Modern Pastry but those days are over. Crazy lines but not a bad wait & so worth it!! Cash only!
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: Pretty damn good! I'd give it five stars, but it's too expensive and takes waaaay to long to ever get anything. Worth it to occasionally spring for though.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
The canolis here are seriously out of this world. I have never tried a cannoli I liked- even in Italy- but this place is different. We tried the regular ricotta, hazelnut, and caramel pecan. There were all great, but the plain one was my favorite. Someone wrote in the reviews that there is another bakery around the area that has better cannolis- not true! We tried the "other place" and there is absolutely no comparison. Don't let the line scare you- it actually goes pretty quickly. Cash only. 

I'll miss you, cannoli. Til next time, which will be faster because you exist. Tell the city of Boston to thank you.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
If you're in line - hang tight! It's totally worth it. As a Jewish girl, I've had a lot of black and white cookies, but never as good as the one from Mike's! I've actually had dreams about it since going. I just want more!! I also got a vanilla cupcake with chocolate frosting and the most decadent chocolate brownie with walnut and caramel on top. I can't wait to return. 

Pro-Tip: Cash only
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
Dubious amounts of baked goods??? This place takes the cake!!! (no pun intended)

Cannoli's are my favorite, and they come in every flavor imaginable, but everything I have tried has been delicious. 

Prices are reasonable, but beware, no debit cards. This is a cash only establishment.  Not to worry, there's an atm right across the street! 

Not much more to say about Mike's other than, go there, buy cannoli's and bear claws, or you are a dingbat!
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: Holy canoli! I had a chocolate one, and it was fantastic. The dough wrapping was out of this world. I also brought home a German chocolate brownie, which was superb. The cappuccino people were sipping at the tables looked picture perfect. A place to go out of your way for.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
Well, this place is an experience.  We noticed this place on our way to our dinner restaurant and wanted to come back to see why there were a hundred people lined up waiting to get in!  Well, it took about 15 minutes of waiting and jostling and yelling at people trying to cut into our line to finally get our moment at the counter.  We were greeted with a smile which I wouldn't have expected given the overall situation!  We ordered 3 cannolis, the Espresso w/chocolate chips, the Strawberry and the Chocolate cream.  We now saw why everyone help their Mike's Pastry box with it's baker's string held proudly high in the air.  Getting the box after the wait and battle to get to order was an achievement.

Overall the cannolis were good, I've had better but these were good.  I give it a 4 as it's worth the adventure to say you waited in line and scored a cannoli.  Be warned, this is cash only and note there is more than one line so size it up before committing to one.  We made the mistake of picking the longest one before we realized there were 4 other lines all of which were shorter.  Oh well, it was still fun.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: I was so excited I did my research and found out about this place because it lived up to the hype. The lobster tail was so delicious! Our Oreo cannoli was good. And the white cherry macaroons were to die for! This place is a must when your visiting Boston. I also liked that it was not to far away from the freedom trail, it was nice not to have to make a special trip across town to get to this place, but if you aren't doing the tourist stuff than you need to get across town to here because you will not be disappointed! I heard about the lines being out the door but we got there on a week day around 10 and we were very lucky they did not have a line and they had everything we wanted. I can not wait to go back!
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: I went to the place twice on two separate visits to Boston. This place is a tourist trap but with that being said its still good. I get the Oreos pastry every time!
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: Black and white cookies are great!!! Prices could be better! They still have that same Bill Clinton photo hanging up now for over 20 years!!
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: My review is for their Florentine cannoli. The best cannoli out there. I've had 6 or 7 others, but nothing compares to the shell of the Florentine. I've also tried their Boston Cream Pie. But just get the Florentine.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
Their pastries and cakes are good, but they're no better than any of the other places.

It's their cappucino that sets them apart.  Their cappucino IS better than Modern's or any of the other shops.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
Wow, simply a great job.  If you're a fan of pastries, especially cannolis, this is your place.  It's simply a wonderful place to get your sweet fix.

Place gets jammed full of people, and the organization doesn't seem to be there, yet it all somehow comes together.  Take that time while you're waiting to really be sure of what you want, as there is a vast variety of flavors and options.

As for those cannolis, those should be eaten the same day they're purchased--while the shell is still firm and the filling still soft.  The next day, the discrepancy between those textures is diminished, and while still tasty, the spirit is lost.
The other pastries are obviously best the same day, but they seem to last better a few days out if you'd rather grab a box and take it with you.

This is a place to which I'd return on any subsequent trip to Boston.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: I think everything that should have been said has been said and I am not one to preach to the choir. Be sure, in the madness, to peruse the adorable fake fruits and such on the right. Also, don't be a fool - buy a cannoli.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
All I can say is Cannoli done right!

Okay, I'll say a little more...
It's usually crowded but the line always moves fast.
They have a wide selection of cannolis and some other desserts, but they're most famous for their cannolis, soooooo please do NOT waste your calories on other desserts, get a cannoli. Don't like chocolate, get a pistachio or a limoncello cannoli.
The shell is so crispy and the cream filling is not too sweet, it all melts in your mouth.

A must visit if you're in the neighborhood or actually even if you're in the city.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: All you need to know is that this is one of the best places to have a sweet treat in the WORLD! Best in New England, Best in Boston, Best in the North End! Come enjoy!
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: I love this place.  All the positive reviews are spot on.  The cannoli is just fantastic.  It's worth the wait. I don't even get fancy and the plain cannoli is perfect.  So don't get overwhelmed by choices just take it one cannoli or cookie at a time.  They have plenty to offer.  So try it all. Plus the people who work there are really nice even through all the crazy crowds.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: I've had delicious hot chocolate here before and fun touristy atmosphere.... But some things like the custard filled creme puff tasted not that fresh or homemade... More like what you'd expect from grocery bakery...
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: Probably the best cannolis and Italian pastries in all of Boston. We recently visited and got  chocolate mousse (with chocolate chips) and oreo cannolis. Both were delicious with such a creamy inner filling. We also got the caramel pecan brownie, which was very rich and moist, along with rainbow cookies. They were all reasonably priced (under $3.50 for very generous sizes). Anything you get from Mike's will not disappoint you; however, it is always a packed tourist spot. The lines out the door on any morning, afternoon, or evening can be frustrating, but the pastries make up for it.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: There was a lot of hype going into this experience. I only got the almond canoli so take it for what it is. I thought the shell was overall bland and didn't have much of a unique taste and the filling while good had a "grainy" texture. Just didn't think it was anything special or worth to wait in line for.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
I actually jumped out of a moving car to go to Mike's and get a cannoli.  True story.  

Granted I was drunk and I saw the sign and my DD wouldn't pull over... but still.  That's how good Mike's cannoli's are.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: You know, I used to think Mike's Pastry was good. And I still maintain that the tiramisu is quite good. But everything else I've tried here has been subpar. I'm not a big fan of their cannoli and the gelato they serve there is absolutely disgusting. Inedible, I'd say. Given that this place is on Hanover, you can walk less than a block and find better pastry or gelato. I'll pass.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: Mike's is good, but definately a touristy place.  They have the biggest selection of pastries, but the women behind the counter are like grouchy high school lunch ladies
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
We did a comparison of Modern vs Mike's in terms of both food and overall atmosphere. A snippet from the review is here: Mike's cannoli is significantly larger in size than Modern's, and has more cream inside the shell, but the appeal factor was more for Modern's. Modern's cannoli looks more rustic and homemade, and is crispier than Mike's. While presentation does matter when it comes to food, it all comes down to what it tastes like! Both cannolis were extremely fresh, but the cream in Modern's was softer, creamier, and sweeter. It didn't take us long to determine that Modern has the superior cannoli. Perfect crispy shell stuffed with creamy ricotta. Simply delicious!

For our whole review check out our blog - http://eatinginthebean.wordpress.com/2014/04/14/canoli-war-mikes-vs-modern-who-is-better/
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: Woah. Just woah. Amazing. My family flew up here from Georgia and I had to take them there. The line may be long but only because what's inside is perfection!
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: Go here early! Best Cannoli on Hanover St! A must when you are going to the north end of Boston. Thanks!
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
Though the service was less than great - I came to this conclusion when the person waiting on us told us that the yellow filling was the same as the white ricotta (clearly it isn't) - it was worth the wait. And the wait is fast.

Cannoli's are all about size, crispiness of crust, the way the crust breaks in your mouth, and yes, of course, the filling.

Those criteria in mind. 

Mind was...perfect. 

May I please have another?
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: First time I had a cannoli an it was delicious. I tried the amaretto one and it was cold and creamy and tasty. Yumm
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: Really loved the cannolis' I had the original with chocolate chip on the ends and the lemon one. Delicious! Cash only though so be prepared for that
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
Delicious!

Good quality ingredients that combine to create flavorful, mouthwatering pastries. I've never really liked cannolis (...I know, I know...), but they truly are delicious here. While I haven't tried everything on the menu (yet), it's always on my radar when I'm in the area. They've hit the right balance of sugar and butter, nothing is too sweet or heavy.

An added bonus is the quick service and friendly staff.

A bit of advice for the weekend: go early! Lines get long pretty quick.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
DELICIOUS!!!!
Cant get enough of it.
Every single day while we were in Boston we stopped in every chance we got! The cannolis were to die for!! Best ever!!! the lobster tail was amazing!! it was just freakin amazing. it look like a croissant on the out side (literally shape almost like a lobster tail) had the most mouth watering creamy filling on the inside.  but unfortunately the cream puff wasnt what i was looking for :( but then again heck everyone was there for the Lobster tail and cannolis lol. :)  

***if ur ever in boston u have got to catch the "T-train over there! 

Mike's Pastry- 300 Hanover!! :)
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: What can I say to add to +800 reviews. Bigger than Modern, but I'm going to go out on a limb and say the taste is equal. Store is larger and the lines may seem long and intimidating but they move fast. They're delicious and have tons of different flavors. It was worth eating out in the cold rain, and for me, that's saying a lot. I'm like a cat - I hate being out in the rain and getting wet, but for this canolli, I'll suck it up.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
In my experience a line out the door is a good sign and Mike's does not disappoint! Hands down best cannoli I've ever had and worth the wait...

Protip: According to the locals there is no line, you really just have to push your way forward.

Also, they didn't take kindly to us ordering our food at the counter and then sitting down at the in-house tables...apparently there is waiter service for the tables. Just FYI.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
Did you really go to Boston/North End without trying Mike's cannoli? There is always a line, and the people working at the counter are incredibly nice and efficient. The cannolis are huge, probably shareable between 2 people if you're not that hungry. 

The hazelnut one was pretty good, I really like the chocolate dipped portion. It was a little too sweet for me but good nonetheless!
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: I really like the cannoli and rainbow cookies here! Minus one star because the line is always absolutely RIDICULOUS and unbelievably long. It's almost unacceptable. They are SO lucky the pastries are worth it.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
If you're in the North End, you must stop by this place and pick up a cannoli. There is no question about it -- it's a MUST.

I used to not like cannolis. Every time I had it at other places in the past, the filling was just toooo rich and toooo sweet, and the shell wasn't anything impressive. Enter a fresh cannoli from Mike's Pastry (my favorite is the chocolate chip cannoli) and this view all changed.

It's no wonder that when you google "cannoli," Mike's Pastry is usually listed within the top first or second pages of results.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
great when you are in the N. end of boston

its always crowded and they have a great product

If you have room after wolfing down a lobster from neptune oyster around the corner, them come here for dessert n cafe

mo likes the reg cannoli and I like the florentine cannoli [sweeter glaze]

the choc chip one is great too.  get a blk coffee to offset the sweetness
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
Probably one of the most popular pastry shops in Boston. Everyone knows Mike's, and everyone that I've heard talk about it enjoys it. Unfortunately, it's pretty tough to get in unless you go at the right time; the line is often out the door and around the corner. While it is delicious, I wouldn't wait an hour in line. Last time I went was on a Wednesday at 4:30 and only waited about 10 minutes.

The cannolis are fantastic. They're also huge; I usually only eat half at a time. They have a bunch of different flavors, so plenty of reasons to come back; I personally enjoy the chocolate dipped. I also really liked their fudge cupcake. Can't go wrong with anything you get here, and the prices are decent considering how big their servings are.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: A REQUIRED trip when I'm in the North End or when I have visitors.  You can't go wrong with any of the cannolis!!  The florentine and tiramisu are my favorite!  There's always a line for a reason but the line moves quite quickly! The only bad thing about Mike's is that the prices are not displayed anywhere in the shop and they only take cash.  Each cannoli is about 3.00-3.75/4.00 depending on what you get.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
Does this place really need another review?  Nooooooo, but I'm going to do it anyway.

Holy crap!!!!  The chocolate mousse cannoli I purchased was flippin' awesome!!!!  Awesome, I say.  Nothing new to add about the cannoli, not overly sweet, light filling. . . .it was perfect for me.  The bottom was coated in chocolate, the shell was light and crisp and SOOOOOOO good.

Everything else looked SUPER SPECTACULAR.   The cheesecake, whoa!!! That is next on my list.

If you find yourself in Boston and enjoy indulging in calorie laden luscious treats, march yourself down to Hanover St and double time it to Mike's for some yummy goodness.  Hitting Mike's was truly the pinnacle of my Boston experience.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
Every delicious cannoli flavor you can think of is here at Mikes.  From old school Ricotta to Oreo to Limoncello to Amaretto to many more.  They are big and crisp and sweet and creamy and I ordered a few because well, how could I order just one? My favorite was the Florentine cannoli.  Filled with the typical marscapone filling - which is fantastic by the way, the shell is a crisp, crunchy and buttery Florentine cookie!!!  Mind blown, sweet tooth happy!!  The lines are long but move fast.  They have cupcakes and other pastries but really??  Have a cannoli!!
It is a Cash Only business, minimal seating and I didn't see coffee but totally worth it.  YUM!!!
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: My favorite Cannolli in the North End- that is the North End of America...ha.  From the super busy counter, to the lady's with attitude,  to the cute boxes with string, to the chocolate chip cannolli- holy cannolli!  I also dig the fig pastrys, and I've always wanted to try the pound cake- it looks a little too good.  I will say their gelato isn't so great, but I donna go there for the gelato.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: Some of the best cannoli I've ever had.  Tons of variety.  The wait can be long but worth it.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: Expected a huge explosion in my mouth or something but I've tried a few things and I'm just underwhelmed. There are better bakeries out there, for sure.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: Ok, Mike's Pastry has made my list of places I want to eat my last day alive.  The lobster tail pastry is an absolute must (wow, I want another just thinking about it).  The outside was light and flaky but with a hard crunch, filled with a ricotta based cream, that was not too sweet (probably bad because it allowed me to completely over eat).  The cannoli were undoubtedly some the best I have had (and hey I'm Italian!).  I can't even remember how much I paid I was so excited when I enter the store.  If you are in Boston you have to try this place....or better just go to Boston to try this place.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
This is a great place to have a cannoli. I got the chocolate chip cannoli (the lady at the counter said it's the best and most popular) she was right. It was delicious! Not overly sweet. My boyfriend got the limoncello cannoli he thought it was good but not the best. 

This is a very busy place. Seating is very limited. Cash only
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: A long line greeted me at the doorway to Mike's on a recent Saturday night in Beantown, but I soldiered on, hoping to be rewarded with a pastry that exceeded my wildest expectations. Sadly, it was not to be. After waiting nearly 40 minutes on the sidewalk and inside the crowded shop, I came away with a cannoli that was just OK. The rich, creamy filling was lacking a bit in flavor, and the pastry crust seemed a bit stale. While Mike's has a reputation for serving the best desserts in Boston, I'd recommend looking around before subjecting yourself to a long wait here. You'll find better rewards elsewhere.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
I'm not a huge cannoli fan, but Mike's Pastry was pretty decent and probably amazing if you're into cannolis. We hopped off the trail and stopped by this busy place for a snack - be prepared for decently long lines and a ton of tourists. 

Mike's offers a ton of different flavors, we opted for the chocolate covered and espresso. Definitely recommend a flavored cream like the espresso if you're not a huge fan of cannolis. 

PS. Cash only!
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
Authentic italian deserts.  I enjoyed 3 different types of canoli along with a good old fashioned cheesecake.

We walked up and took it in a to-go box, but the wait for a table was only about 5 minutes.  This was a Saturday night too.  It depends on your group size certainly, but with 2-4 people, it is a lot easier as the tables are very small and fractionalized.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
I've had countless cannolis from places masquerading as Italian pastry shops in Little Italy in NYC. And I've always wondered what the hoop-la was about. Cannolis suck.

Or at least, those were my thoughts before these heavenly morsels touched my lips.

Oh... my... GOD. It's a travesty what other pastry shops are selling as cannolis. 

These were heavenly. Just the right amount of crunch. Enough powdered sugar to cover the entire front of my black jacket. Creamy filling. So good I devoured it while walking out and almost went back for another when I was halfway down the street.

Amazing.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: Judging solely on the Boston Cream Pie (and I've been to several different spots to check it out) .. it was quite disappointing. Maybe they're known for other goodies but the cream pie fell short. It was a bit too sweet for my taste and the cake was not spongy or soft. There are better places to check out.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
With a weekend trip to Boston planned - we weren't sure what we were going to do! With it being my first time to the area we took the Duck Tour, great fun. But was told on this tour to go try Mike's Pastry and that it is all delicious! Since we were in the North End we made sure that our lunch was light enough where we could go try the lobster tail...well holy moly batman! That was the smartest thing we did all weekend! We got two because we thought we would be sharing it with family when we got back - I got to eat a quarter of 1 because everyone else started devouring them! It was perfect, light, sweet and the only regret was not getting more :( 

Will certainly be back if I am in the area
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: Delicious! Very long lines, but very quick service. Must come here at least once while you're in boston, and get a bunch of stuff so you can save stuff for later. I recommend the  Boston creme pie or the chocolate chip cannoli
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: Gotta love this Boston staple! If you are visiting check this out. Modern is more authentic though.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: They have the biggest selection of cakes, cannolis, cookies and pastries I have ever seen.  The fudge cake was to die for!  Don't be scared off by the long line.  It moves fast!
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: Yep, it lives up to everything I've heard. Was worth the traffic getting there. I'll be back.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
It is almost always super crowded, but the lines move very quickly!
I am really impressed with how efficient the workers are in both processing payments and wrapping up pastries for you. 

Of course, the pastries themselves are to die for, if you can take the extra calories :)
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
While Mike's is no Baldi's in NYC (which no longer exists - so sad!), it came in a close second.  Their cannoli are very good.  I remember Mike's before it was featured on Food Network and its claim to fame.  I think it used to be better back in the day, to be honest, and that's why it gets only a 4-star review.  Their pignoli, sesame and rainbow cookies aren't as good as I remembered them being a long time ago - I think the quality of their goods has declined as the years go on.

Don't let me deter you from this place because it's definitely worth the visit.  I just have strong expectations for Italian pastries and deserts because I grew up on them and personally make them myself.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: Mike's truly deserves the hype it receives. Amazing pastries, a huge selection, quick service, and friendly people. Nestled into the heart of the North End, it's definitely a must-stop if you're in the area. There's really not a bad option there, but definitely be sure to at least try the cannolis - which come in a handful of different flavors. There's almost always a line out the door (for obvious reasons), but it's definitely worth the wait!
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: Delicious and worth the walk over. It's always chaotic, expect a wait. The cannoli are a little on the expensive side, but it's become a Boston tradition to visit Mikes when we are in town.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
Mike's Pastry or Bust! 

When telling some friends from Boston that I would be visiting/staying in the North End of town (Little Italy), they made sure that I checked out Mike's Pastry, a small bakery shop specializing in cannolis. I did just that. Here is my story.

It was a Wednesday night. The wife and I had just ate at Maurizio's which was conveniently located just a block away from Mike's Pastry. It was about 10pm when we got to MP. I was shocked to see the crowds of people piling in and out of this pastry shop. 

First things first, Mike's Pasty is cash only. Also there is no real order as to how they service people. If you think you're standing in a line, you probably aren't. It's simply a crowd of people waiting to be noticed by one of the ladies behind the counter. I'd recommend being aggressive and trying to catch their attention at one of the side counters. 

Mike's Pasty is a must if you're in the North End of town. Brave the lines and have yourself a treat. It'll be one of the $4 you've ever spent. Also, the Oreo cannoli is life changing.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: Such a great place. I used to work on Hanover street almost a decade ago. This place has gotten bigger and better. We came here on labor day at night and this place was packed out the door. The service was very fast, friendly, and the food was great. I could not believe how low priced everything was, especially for what you get. I ordered the expresso cannoli and it was pretty good. You can walk down the street to view the city on the tables and chairs near by to enjoy the deliciousness that is Mike's pastry. Lots of beautiful Bostonian women can be found frequenting this place, or just Hanover street in general.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
Hands down the best cannoli I have ever had. There are a bunch of flavors that are mouth watering, but what sets this place apart is the crisp, in-house shells. Ours were fresh and given the amount of volume they turn out, I have to imagine they are never old or soggy.

A good value given the size, as well. (~$4)
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: I demanded a cannoli and gelato from the North end of Boston on our trip. We chose mikes because they had both. We had the cookies and cream gelato that was good ( but I like the gelato I get from the fruit market back at home better) and a cannoli. The cannoli was only ok. Nothing to write home about unfortunately. There is a shop at home in MI that has the best cannoli Ive ever had. I was expecting the north end of Boston to knock in out of the park but mikes didn't make that happen, while it was good, like I said it was nothing to write home about.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: Saw the reviews for this place and it was not a disappointment. I normally am not a fan of cannoli's but these were different and amazing. The crowd was crazy but we were served within a minute of walking in. Very good and a definite recommendation for anyone looking for a delicious dessert.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
This place is famous and a must-see in Boston for good reason. The cannolis are to die for.

I usually like to try a different cannoli each time I'm in Boston. I got the caramel pecan this time, but I also like the Oreo, the ricotta, and the pistachio a lot. The shells are perfectly thick and crispy and don't fall apart super easily. They stuff the cannolis chock full of the good stuff (ricotta for daaaays)! My brother loves the lobster tail pastry, also for good reason. It's absolutely full to the brim with this sweet cream/ricotta mix that's so decadent. The flaky crust is amazing. It's easily a shareable pastry. 

Though it gets crowded, the lines move very quickly. You essentially just have to find the next available person and walk right up to them, so in a sense sometimes it's more of a free-for-all set up. Cash only!
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: The cannolis come in at least two dozen flavors -- all with photos lined up on the wall. I ordered the hazelnut and the service was extremely prompt -- no line on a Sunday afternoon (Memorial Day weekend). The cannolis were also pretty filling, at least amongst other cannolis I've had. Each are $4, cash only.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: Line was long moved fast, ppl sneak into lines, espresso was good.choc chip.was ok.others r really ok. They all taste the same just with different toppings..more like a tourist touch and go kinda place..
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
Chocolate chip cannoli.

That's basically the only thing I ever order. Yes I have tried quite a few items and they were great, but I always come back to the cannoli. In the 7 years I've lived in Boston I have never seen Mike's without a line. Granted it's out the door and around the corner more around dinner time and weekends but even weekdays there are always at least a few people in there. The tourists all stand around thinking there's a line. HA! This is Boston people! If you want a slice of heaven you have to fight your way to the front, pick up the iconic box wrapped with string and walk out while you resist the urge to eat your pastry right there.

Remember to hit the ATM before coming here since it's cash only
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
Star rating: 4 stars

The cannoli is second to none.  The tiramisu and coffee are great.  I can do without the macroon from here.  Be warned that the servicer can become a little short with you when the crowd grows.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: If you're ever in North End, you will most likely see hordes and hordes of tourists and locals carrying around these little boxes tied with string from Mike's Pastry. This place is pretty popular, and it is almost always packed. Decided to try the famous cannoli (amaretto flavored). It was good, but I found the cannoli to be too large and the filling too sweet and grainy. The amaretto flavor was nice though. It's not bad, but I probably wouldn't come back again.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: I adore this place! It's straight out of an old Italian mobster film. It is generally always packed, so plan what you are going to get before you get up to the counter. It's also cash only as a few people have said before, so do remember this before you go there! Every time I am down in Boston, I make it a point to stop in the North End specifically for their sweet treats. They have incredible and crunchy cannolis and pastries as far as the eye can see.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: Well worth the wait. Cannoli is my favorite dessert of all time and this place delivered. So many options! I recommend the chocolate dipped cannoli. It was so good that I came back two days later for another one. Tip: go during the work day and you will wait in little to no line.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
Really fatty and sugary. Both me and my girlfriend have no desire to return. 

Selection is impressive and service is OK.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: This place is a tourist trap. Save your money. Went here yesterday because my friends family wanted to go and I got a cannoli and the shell was stale, the filling was ok. Also got some type of peanut butter cookie and you could taste that it was sitting there for a couple days and they slapped on some fudge on top to mask the taste. I will not go here again. I am sticking with Modern Pastry across the street.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
Oh my good God - that was THE BEST Cannoli I've ever eaten in my life. 

I didn't even know what I was walking into when I sort of fell into the line for this pastry shop. All I knew was that everyone in the North End was carrying around Mike's Pastry boxes so I better follow their leads and partake in the festivities. After following my nose (or the herd of people), I landed right smack in the middle of a long but fast-moving line. "What's in there???" I asked my husband to go investigate. He came back saying it looked like a zoo but all he could see were cannoli. As soon as we came around the corner and landed in the shop I was aggressively moving my way up in line toward the cannoli counter. The pics above made me drool and also made it difficult to decide - but I got the chocolate dipped - when the server asked me if I wanted powdered sugar on it my eyes got HUGE. YES OF COURSE I DO! The cannoli wasn't just dipped in chocolate, it was freshly dipped in hardening chocolate. It really was one of the best things I've ever eaten before in my life. My husband agreed. In fact, we both woke up this morning thinking about it. When a couple dreams about cannoli on their honeymoon, you know it's a special and magical kind of cannoli.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: Great pastries, cookies, canolis, etc.. Would have gone with 5 stars, but the gelato was only average and overpriced. CASH ONLY!
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: I saw the huge line to get pastries and I had to try these "amazing" pastries, right? Wrong! We tried 4 different ones and I'm sorry to say, i didn't like any of them.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: I'm a North End resident. I find myself rolling my eyes every time I see a line forming all the way down Hanover Street. It's on the "must do" list for tourists when they come to Boston. I get it. Have I been to better bakeries in the US? Absolutely. Is it even the best pastry shop in the North End? No. Couple other better ones. Do I come here? Yes, once in a while but never when there is a line. What they do right: they have the service component down. Tons of people to help behind the counter and the line moves quick. I also like how many different cannoli types they have. Sometimes if you are bringing cannoli's to a party, you want a little variety. You can't find that kind of variety at Modern or Parziales. I've tried just about everything they offer. Everything is average to below average. But the cannoli's are good. I'd stick with that.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: I honestly don't know what the fuss is all about. The cannoli were just average, but the real tragedy was the sfogliatelle. They were inedible. The pastry, which is supposed to be thin crispy layers that actually crunch when you touch them, was thick and rubbery. We threw them away. I'll bet there are better Italian bakeries than this in Boston.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: Overrated tourist trap. Some pastries are absolutely incredible while the others are mediocre at best. Cash only. I think that this place is def. worth checking out once to see what everyone is raving about.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
A must try when in Boston! This little pastry shop can sure crank out alot of different things. From their famous cannoli to cakes to cookies to gelato, Mike's Pastry has it all! Be prepared to work for your sweets though, there will always be a full house. The line moves quickly though. They package it so fast, using rope from the hanging decorative balls. 

There's a variety of flavors for the famous cannoli. They range from pistachio, strawberry, pecan caramel, espresso, yellow cream, oreo, limoncello, florentine and many more. The inside is light, fluffy and not super sweet. Each flavor is unique and true to taste. 

I had the pecan caramel. It was nutty and light. The flaky crunchy center is made in house and is delicious! The espresso had chocolate chips on both ends and the cream was a decadent coffee taste. 

We also tried a slice of Boston cream pie as well. When in Boston! It was very tall and quite a large piece so definitely share. It was sweet and creamy but not overbearing.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
Best ricotta cannoli's ever (I prefer the ones with chocolate chips), and I've done the leg work.  Better then Modern down the street, and always worth the ridiculous lines at all hours of the day.

Remember to bring cash because Mike's does not take credit cards.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
The only reason this does not have five starts is probably because Yelp is charging them and they know they don't need to pay to have a good reputation.

The lines out the door should be a good indication of how tasty the desserts are. I came from the West Coast, but grew up on the east, so was in the mood for tasty Italian desserts. This place is the best both with their wide variety of cannoli's and wide variety of other like-tasty desserts.

I would recommend to anyone in the greater-Puritan area.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
I must say that the cannoli and Boston Creme Pie that I had were fantastic. The long line not so much, and the what seemed to me to be an arbitrary price yelled out to each person around me was strange. I know that I was overcharged, but good luck having 2 seconds to realize it and bring it to someone's attention.

Being that I am quite unimpressed with the quality of food in Boston, I will say that this place stands out, but it's not something I could or would want to eat every day.

I'll need to try the other 30 pastry shops right next door to give a true opinion of the taste, but as for now... Being rushed through like cattle and overcharged at the end took away a couple of stars.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
Visited Boston during Valentine's Weekend and happened to see a WHOLE bunch of people walking around with Mike's Pastry boxes. So I definitely needed to make a trip down there. Not a big place and not much seating available but definitely has a big selection of pastry to choose from. Line really doesn't have a start so basically had to just work my way up there. Behind the counter customer service is great but literally had 3 different workers asking me if we were ready to order.
Despite all that it was worth the walk. Had the chocolate chip cannoli and kind of regretted not ordering more afterwards. Next time will try some of the other pastries they have there.
Please note: NO CREDIT/DEBIT CARDS ACCEPTED! CASH ONLY!
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
Seems to be hit or miss here. Mocha rasberry was very good. Marshmallow choc cupcake was good except the choc topping was a hard shell. Would have been better as just frosting. My friend and I tried the oreo cheesecake, disgusting!! Tasted like black licorice and nothing like oreo. I have no idea what they were thinking with that. Inedible
Went a couple months ago also. Cannolis were just ok, strawberry cheesecake and gelato were good, red velvet cupcakes tasted nothing like red velvet. 3 of us agreed they were not good.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
Yummy~ 

I'm not really experienced with cannolis but I like these. I kinda like them better soggy so I liked this one over modern. So creamy and delicious 

I guess Bostonians sometimes are like MIKE'S IS A TOURIST TRAP and it's like yeah well duh lol. Yo entire city is a tourist trap bruh. But I went and did my own comparison and I liked these better than modern but they're so close that it don't matter.

I was lucky to go when it wasn't busy :D the wait can be pretty bad tho.

text: I don't like cannolis in general, but I got a vanilla pudding cannoli here and it was really good! I also have gotten the tiramisu, which is the best I've ever had; the cream puffs - huge and delicious; and a chocolate dipped peanut butter cookie. I'm a sucker for peanut butter cookies, so I was attracted to how huge it was here. But this peanut butter cookie did not taste like peanut butter. Sad and disappointing. But I suppose peanut butter cookies are not considered Italian pastries.  So don't come here for the peanut butter cookies. Everything else is worth trying!
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: Long lines and overrated. Dont get me wrong its not bad but I was expecting to be wowed. Many places have better cannoli's. People come here more as a tourist attraction than for the food.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
The only thing I have ever tried at this place is the Cannoli's. Jesus Christ, they're amazing! 

Pistachio, Hazelnut, and Florentine are my favorite. You will not be disappointed. I'm an out of towner and every time I come to Boston, I cannot leave without coming and getting cannolis from this place. Sometimes I'll stop in the day of my flight to pick some up to take home with me. They're that good.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: Long lines, no time to choose or look at what they have, there is one line outside and just mess inside. People behind the counter are not friendly, you are selling deserts not stocks. Be nice to people, relax, smile and calm, it's busy, but it's deserts, not cure for cancer. We can wait, if you smile. Cannoli are good, not great to deal with whole experience.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: This place was recommended to me by my old supervisor who went to grad school in Boston.  I am so glad I went.  I've gone there like 4 times now, in the 2 trips I've taken to Boston.  I also told my coworkers about it, and they've all been going too.  The women boxing up the pastries are super quick, so if you need to decide what you're getting first and THEN step to the counter.  I highly recommend their different macaroons, which taste like almond perfection.  It is much different from the typical coconut macaroon you buy at the store.  I particularly like the pistachio macaroons.  I also tried out their cannolis which were decent, but I heard that a few doors down they make them to order, so they are fresh and crisp, while mine was a little soggy.  Definitely get the macaroons!  Whenever my coworkers head out to Boston, they always bring back the macaroons.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: I bought the strawberry cannoli. It was okay. Cash only, but there is an ATM across the street. So just be aware they accept cash only. Oh, and when you finally come to this place, order from the side. The employees were pleasant. You have a variety of tasty treats.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt

text: Delicious Italian pastries. They have an amazing array of cannolis that are all to die for. And huge!! Do not be intimidated by the long lines, it goes fairly quickly. Also note they only accept cash. A must if you're in little Italy of Boston.

text:
700++ ratings!!
I'll be short...

I've had a better cannoli, then here.

but only a few.

This place is number two, in a very long list of cannolis I have eaten in my 30 years.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
Like where I'm from in NYC, there are a lot of overhyped tourist trap places that a lot of tourists seem to flock to because they're well...hyped. Here in Boston, it is no different. I was very eager to try out the desserts and pastries here since there are decent reviews here on Yelp and the photos of the food here looked delectable. 

Like every hyped venue, my party and I were greeted with a long line out the door. It took about 10 minutes just to order. I settled for several cannolis and a lobster tail since these seem to be the hot-sellers here. Upon first bite, I noticed that the cannoli tasted a bit stale. Maybe I received a bad batch of cannolis or they all just taste stale here. Who knows? I wasn't a big fan of the cannolis here.

I did however look forward to trying out the lobster tail because it was humongous and filled with cream. Overall, it was slightly better than the cannoli in my opinion, but it still didn't justify the 10 minute wait. The lobster tail was a bit on the hard side as I had quite a difficult time eating it. I do suggest if you're planning on ordering the lobster tail, split it with someone as it is large in size. 

I probably will not be returning here since there are way better bakeries that offer pastries where I'm from. I'd say try out this place if you haven't been here before just to say that you've tried this "Boston staple", but I would not highly recommend it.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: Amazing cannolis, endless choices, and even though it was packed the line went by fast. Recommend it to everyone out there!
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: You will wait in line, but it will be worth it. Know what you want before you get to the counter to help the line go fast. There is a little bit of seating but you might as well get it to go so you can get out in beautiful Boston and enjoy your pastry and the city together.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
Absolute best cannoli in the city! I tried all of them around Little Italy and keep coming back to Mike's. Chocolate chip and plan are timeless classics, but lemon cream also proved tasty one time, as did oreo filling. The rest of their cakes are good - not amazing, but not below average either. Cannoli, however, are mindblowing. 

Note: If you are buying cannoli to eat over more than 2 days, you should probably come back rather than stocking up. They are still tasty but the crunchiness of the shell is lost, which is kind of the best part. Fresh ones are well worth the trek!
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: Most crowded dessert place i've ever been to but once you get your turn you'll go crazy for all the selections. I've been there so many times and was never disappointed. definitely worth the wait.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
I don't believe I have ever walked out of an establishment simply based on the rudeness of its staff. But that was the decision I made, with my sister, niece, and nephew in tow. 

I will never return here and strongly suggest others avoid this complete tourist trap of garbage.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
Which is better, Mike's or modern Pastry? They're both incredible. Every now and then I overhear someone say "no true Bostonian would go to Mike's" These people are almost always not from Boston. This Bostonian, born and raised, prefers Mike's. It's a matter of taste and many do prefer Modern, but when the quality is at this level the truth is you can't go wrong either way. Cash only here at Mike's. Get the cannoli with chocolate chips and a cappuccino, eat it right then and there,  and you will be a happy person indeed.
I shall return.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
I thought I would love Mike's cannolis before going to Boston.   

After waiting in line, soaking wet from the sudden down pour, and getting cramped inside the can of sardines that is known as Mike's Pastry, I almost bought all 19 varieties of cannolis.  Having waited for that extended period, I thought how could I go wrong with 19 cannolis? 

After being talked down to only getting 9, we left with 2 boxes full of canolis -- strawberry, chocolate creme, chocolate chip, yellow cream, hazelnut... and the list goes on.  

After the novelty wore off, I don't think I quite understand the appeal of these giant pastries.  They're kinda hard on the outside and really fatty on the inside.  I thought they would be more flavorful.  Ultimately, I think I'm happy eating normal sized cannolis that do not require a wait.   

When all was said and done, apparently I only mildly like Mike's cannolis.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: Best cookies ever!!!!!! Every time were in Boston, we stop in and fill up. The canollis are great too. This place is always packed. Before you head down, make sure you know this:  parking sucks and they only take cash.

We ordered chocolate cheesecake, NY cheesecake, tiramisu, chocolate peanut butter brownie, profiterol, and the espresso cannoli. 2 forks, a coffee and tea (they don't serve bottled water!!) text:
I could not believe that the line was out the door (at about 10 o'clock at night) and I was quite skeptical of my two hosts for suggesting such a place. But when I took one bite of the florentine cannoli (that we had to ask for special b/c it wasn't on the shelves) let's just say every bite was worth the wait.

There was no seating when we were there as well so we headed back home to enjoy this fine delicacy. I do not suggest eating it while walking - you will trip.

text:
Hands down the BEST cannolis I have ever had! The shell is fresh and crispy while the cannoli cream is super smooth and delicious. They are also jumbo size so one is more than enough for one person. They have a variety of flavors to choose from but I always end up going with their Chocolate Chip Cannoli because their plain cannoli cream filling is just that good!

You'll be intimidated by the line (or mob rather) at first, especially on weekends, however, every time I have been there the line has moved quite quickly (probably no more than 10 mins). It is definitely worth the wait! The hectic environment is part of the experience.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt

text:
This place is a shit show when you show up and I was overwhelmed by the millions of flavors they seem to have but don't worry, they're all delicious. The line looks long but it's fast.

The goods here are so fresh and fluffy and not so overwhelmingly sweet as other yelpers may say. I got the pistachio and almond amaretto cannoli. SO f*ckin' good. Pistachio was super flavorful and there were generous amounts of nuts at both ends of their respective cannoli. 

I love desserts and this is the first place I go to when visiting Boston (yes I left the airport JUST to come here, YOLO). My only regret is that I didn't order more!! Mike's, I will return again and again, take my money from me!!!
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt

text: Lobster tail is so good. It is much bigger than I thought lol , but I still finish it by myself lol All the desserts are looks so good and I will try all of them.
