text: Honestly I was super disappointed. Not a cannoli fan so I tried the Rum Cake. The whip cream was bland. The cake was a mushy mess, lots of layers of bland...I don't even know what.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
So so good. So good. 

After eating dinner across the street from this place, we watched as the line grew and shrunk the whole time. At least our dinner wasn't super filling so we had room to try these delicious pastries. Yes we had to wait in line and it's a little hectic, but it moves fast. Beware they only take cash.

We got one chocolate mousse cannoli, one chocolate chip cannoli, and two sandwich cookies. 

We waited until we got back to our hotel to try the cannolis. Holy cannoli! The cream wasn't overly sweet and the shell wasn't oily. It was the perfect ratio of cream to shell and I wish we had tried other flavors as well since these two didn't disappoint.

We didn't eat the cookies until the next day and these were just as good. They weren't overly crunchy and the filling (one chocolate one raspberry) matched the cookies flavor perfectly. The only thing I would have changed is the frosting on one side of the cookie.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
Let's settle the debate: Mike's has the better cannoli. 

When you arrive, every person working the counter has their own queue. Don't stand in the long line that forms at the door; move left and find a shorter line. Grab a cannoli for now (don't even put it in a box, you're going to eat it on the sidewalk anyways) and a lobster tail to take home.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
WORTH THE HYPE!!!

As an avid foodie, this place has been on my list for a while. When I was visiting my friend this weekend in Southie, I got my chance!!

As you walk towards the North End of Boston (aka the "Little Italy" of the city, but don't try to call it that), you are greeted with the intoxicating aroma of starch - what I can only assume is homemade pasta in the making. Mike's Pastry is on the left side of the street, right past Modern Pastry on the right (also on my list...maybe next time). 

Both places had lines out the door. Although I cannot speak for Modern, Mike's line moved pretty quickly. Once we were inside, pictures of each of their cannolis and their names were on the wall, giving me more time to debate which one to choose from before reaching the counter. 

There were many employees behind the counter, making it easy to make my way through the throng of people to find someone. The staff is you classic Italian family  - the woman who got my cannolis cracked me up as she was telling me about her daughters (who also work there) and their boy problems. It reminded me of my own family!

I ordered the Amaretto cannoli for myself and took home three for my family: the peanut butter, the espresso, and the chocolate chip. I got them all with powdered sugar (sugar on top of sugar? I think YES!!).

The Amaretto barely made it out of the store. As soon as I got outside, I began to devour. The cannoli was HUGE and LOADED with ricotta. The filling in this one tasted like it was infused with amaretto, giving it a nutty and distinct taste that I found delicious. The shell was soft and crunchy at the same time, and I loved the hint of chocolate from the drizzle. 

My friend likes their lobster claws, which are apparently pretty popular here. I tried some of hers (which was also GIGANTIC), and it reminded me of a cream puff - flaky, doughy pastry with a sweet cream filling. Verrrry delicious and light!

Mike's definitely lived up to my expectations, which were pretty high. The friendly staff, the efficiency of the ordering process, and the heavenly desserts made my trip to Boston just a little sweeter!
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: Meh. Overrated place tourists go. Pastries are fine but nothing special. Certainly not worth waiting in the long line of definitely-not-Italian people who come in from the suburbs because someone also from the suburbs told them Mike's is the best. I would go to Caffe Vittoria's next door instead any day of the week. Better quality and you can actually sit down and enjoy your dessert with coffee.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
People say it's for tourists but I don't care I truly think they have a delicious selection of treats. I love the North End and Mike's is a staple of the community. It always smells divine and every time I visit it seems there is a line (or should I say an unorganized crowd) coming out. Thankfully I don't live locally or I would not be able to keep away. You would find a bear claw growing out of my thighs.

It's a quick moving "tell me what you want" and pay type of transaction. You can tell it is not to be rude but to get you in and out so they can get to the next. I'm always surprised at how low some selections can be then all of a sudden it's filled again. I think those little Keebler Elves are hanging around out back.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
When in Boston had to check off our list of getting a cannoli from Mike's Pastry! Throughout the day the line was out the door for the shop. We actually came back after dinner and the line wasn't too bad. 

There were many cannoli flavor options as well as other pastry items for sale. We went with the Pistachio, Oreo and Nutella cannolis. The cannolis were all fresh and a pretty decent size. We enjoyed tasting all of them. They all had the familiar cannoli crunch of the shell with the inside creamy goodness.  A definite must try when in Boston. 

Tip:  Mike's Pastry only takes cash.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: Mikes makes a really good cannoli but modern bakery was just a little bit better. But you can't go wrong at either place.

text: Honestly, I don't know what the hype is about. You stay in line for twenty minutes and all you get is a flat tasting pastry! Will not come again :(

text: Must have Italian dessert! Canoli was one of the best I've tasted. The wait in line was worth it. After a delicious dinner at Giocomo's, Mike's pastry is a few feet away to complete your Italian cravings.

text: Had a fantastic and fresh tasting cannoli here after a dinner with my sister  with little wait in line we got chocolate chip! Seems to be the original and it was delicious! Will definitely be back.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
On my first trip to Boston from Ca. a women on the plane who lived in Boston told me of this place. ''Oh My Gawd'' she said ''you HAVE to go to Mike's and get a Cannoli'' I assured her we would. We found it pretty easy, you just look for the crowd of people standing at the store front with their faces smashed against the window. All I could say after eating the Cannoli was Oh My Gawd! So amazingly good that there is no way I would be anywhere near the east coast without getting to Mikes. 

Everything we tried was so delicious make sure you get a to go box filled with these decadent pastries. Your jeans will be tighter no doubt, but you will defiantly not be sorry you stopped here.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
Mike's might just be the MOST touristy locale in all of Boston. It is rare to walk by this place without seeing tourists and locals alike spilling out of its doors...especially during the post-dinner rush. Once you've tried one of their cannolis ($3-5), you'll know why. Pick from one of the many flavor combinations and get ready to be wowed. The pastry is flakey and the filling is rich and delicious. I had an espresso cannoli yesterday and I fell in love. 

If cannolis aren't your thing, there are tons of options, from cupcakes to whoopie pies and everything in between. This joint is CASH ONLY. 

Pro-tip: make sure you know what you want before you go to the front to order: the staff mean business.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: My first cannoli ever and it was great -- just the right combination of crunch and sweetness. However, if you're seeking out some Boston Creme Pie I would suggest Modern Pastry over Mike's!
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: I waited in line today for the pastries here for about 20 mins.  I've heard you can wait up to an hour or so. I had a hard time picking out something for the family. So many delicious items but they are famous for a reason.  It's worth the wait, but I would suggest visiting the shop at an odd time to avoid the crowds and tourists.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: I've only had their espresso cannoli and oreo cheesecake. The cannoli was absolutely out of this world. It was huge and so satisfying. The ricotta filling was just the perfect amount of sweetness and the shell so crispy! However, the oreo cheesecake tasted nothing like cheesecake. I didn't taste any cream cheese and it is not the typical dense American cheesecake. It was definitely on the fluffier side, like a cheap version of a Japanese cheesecake. The service was also not fantastic, they only accept cash, which confuses me -- especially during a pandemic. I would say go for the cannolis but think twice before you order other pastries.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: Great amazing delicious pastries that is just a subway stop away.     Amazing cannolis

text: Went here last year, pastries to die for, and the gelato?  Yummy!  I cannot wait for them to open their new location in Harvard Square.  The closer the better for me!

text: I like this place, but I don't get the hype. They have a variety of flavors and the cannolis are really big, but I don't feel like they're much better than the average cannoli.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt

text:
Had a fantastic and fresh tasting cannoli here on a Wednesday with little wait in line! 

I got chocolate chip! Seems to be the original and it was delicious! Will definitely be back.

I also love the music and little tables set up inside
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt

text: Good bakery but there are others in the area that are way better.  We got there early on a Sat. morning and walked right in.  We enjoyed our pastries but I doubt I would ever wait in line at this place which seems to be a daily occurrence.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: A must experience when in Boston! I was amazed at the selection of cannolis (not to mention other various yummy treats). The pistachio and amaretto were my favorites, but I enjoyed the original as well (don't forget the powdered sugar). After you have enjoyed a delicious Italian meal in the North End, walk yourself over to Mike's, get a cannoli (or 5) and thank me later.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
First of all *** It's CASH ONLY ***, so make sure you've got your cash ready.  Mike's pastry has great cannolis and other pastries too, but cannolis  is what they're known for and they have so many options to choose from -They're all up on the wall for you to see.   The shop itself is an experience, it's all ver fast paced, you walk in and there's ladies taking orders everywhere behind the counter,  there are no lines, no numbers you just walk up and kind of wait behind someone till you end up closer to the counter, they take your order box it up and pull on some if the twine above their heads they quickly wrap it around your box charge you, and your on your way. 

There's a few tables there to sit and eat, but I think mostly people get their orders to go.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
You cannot go wrong visiting this bakery.  It is located on the North End of Boston and they are known for their cannolis.  These are not just cannolis, they are literally to die for, I mean really that good.  They have a huge selection ranging from Nutella to Pistachio, to Mint Chocolate Chip.  Although cannolis are their specialty, they have many other goodies such as cheesecake, lemon bars, woo-pie pies, and gelato.  Don't worry if the line may be long, I promise you it is very well worth the wait.  A tip would be to bring cash.  They do not take any plastic.  

I can honestly say that these are the best cannolis I have ever had.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: lobster tail is delicious!!!!!!!!!!!!!
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: It's good! I'm not a fan of cannoli, but of the ones I've had these are definitely top teir. If you're going for cannoli I feel like the more extravagant the better. The presentation and the sheer size of them is definitely part of the experience. I've had several different flavors and I think my favorite is still the hazelnut. Overall I think it's certainly a Boston experience that you should have at least once, but don't expect anything mind blowing.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: Everyone loves this place i see! There was a huge line. I did a foodie thing and visited the near by cannoli spots in this area and i made sure to taste the differences. I will say It wasn't my favorite cannoli out of all the shops. If you like a very big cream cheese biter flavor, then go to mikes. We had a chocolate dipped one. However, i prefer the sweeter tastes as I'm going to make sure if I'm eating sweets, it's sweet. BUT i did have a lobster tail and that thing is HUGE! If you like creamy deliciousness with a crunchy outer texture, try It. It was so big, between 2 people we didn't finish It. The shop is not a big deal. It reminds me of a Cuban bakery in Miami, they have some tables and it's super packed.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
Can you say that you've been to Boston without visiting the OG Mike's Pastry location? You've heard about it, you've see everyone holding their boxes in the streets and in the T. It's all part of the experience, waiting in one of the many lines that extend out the door at all times of the year. 

Simply choose a line and make your way into the shop while you decide on the flavor of cannoli you are in the mood for that day. I've heard the saying that the tourists go to Mike's and the locals go to Modern (down the street). However, I think that everyone should go to at least one of the few Mike's pastry that are around the Boston area now. You really can't go wrong with any of them if you enjoy eating cannolis.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: This place's desserts all look good, but are god awful. The service is miserable, they have minimum wage workers that are super mean. Their deserts are alright priced, but I wouldn't pay for them. I'm always super optimistic on reviews, but this place was absolute trash. Do yourself a favor, and seek an alternate place that isn't full of 1000Grams of sugar per cannoli. I had the cannoli, chocolate cake, and Oreo cupcake.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
Pastries and cannolis and cakes you say?!  Oh my!

Wait cookies, peanut butter cookies dipped in chocolate you say?!  Oh my!

Apple turnovers and everything under sun to make your day the best ever?!  Oh my! 

Oreo cheesecake and ice cream too?!  ...oh... oh my!  HOW DO I CHOOSE??

I had a feeling I would love this place and I totally did!  It is as amazing as the reviews say it is on yelp and it is as beautiful as the pictures look too.  I stopped in here at about 9am in the morning and there was no line at all!  It was a little overwhelming with all the glorious options, but somehow I forced myself to make a decision.  I had the most amazing oreo cheesecake and an apple turnover!  The oreo cheesecake was rich, but so deliciously worth every bite!  The apple turnover was perfect as well!  The husband had a chocolate chip cannoli, which blew his mind! 

If you come to Boston make a trip to the North End and hit up this spot!  It is worth it!
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: Amazingly delicious!!  Words cannot describe how huge & delicious their cannolis are!  They are so smooth and full of flavor!  There is always a line, especially in the evening, but it moves very quickly and is absolutely worth the wait.  We come here every time we are in the area!
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: The line is very big at summer time but believe me is worth it! Cannolis are amazing! I tried chocolate chip and cheese! Very excited to try more! See you guys next saturday!
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt

text: The pastries are decently good for the price. They have a great selection which I love in order to try something different when I come in. Their red velvet cupcake is not my favorite. Their cream cheese frosting is hard and does not taste like cream cheese. My favorite are the pistachio macarons. They have pieces of pistachios and have a chewy texture which compliments the crunchiness. The service has always been helpful.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
I'm no cannoli expert but this was the best cannoli I've ever had. To the point where it makes me question if the cannolis I've had before were even real cannolis. Or is this one the god-tier that's hard to reach?

Anyways, if you're looking for big, fresh, creamy but light cannolis with extremely fast service look no further. You can get your sugar fix in and out of the store within 5 minutes. Definitely worth checking out if you're visiting Boston!
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: Tried the pistachio, hazelnut, and florentine - the pistachio is AMAZING. The filling is not too cloyingly sweet, even though there's a lot of it. Creamy, but not overwhelming. The others were kind of underwhelming in comparison. Cash only, but I think that's what makes the line move super fast and efficiently, which I appreciated. Definitely want to go back to try the lobster tail.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
Get the Florentine cannoli.  Imagine a lacy cookie wrapped into a tube shape and then filled with cream.

Yes, like everyone else has mentioned, this place has a long line, but it moves quickly.  It's still puzzling they accept only cash - it's not really a speed issue; good payment processors can handle credit card transactions just as quickly as cash and it's easier for bookkeeping later.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: Stopped by for a first visit to Mike's Pastry in Boston last Friday night and was very pleased with the desserts we bought. The place was packed full of people waiting to indulge with no organized line so at first it seemed a little stressful but once you get in there and grab the attention of one of the staff members it was smooth sailing. None of the staff showed any signs of stress. The cannolis are out of this world! Will definitely be going back next visit to Boston.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
First time going to Boston and I just had to try a cannoli! I looked up multiple places and decided to try this place!

There was a lot of desserts besides cannolis, such as cookies and cakes. I decided to get a strawberry and a Oreo cannoli. They were chilling in the fridge, so they weren't freshly piped, but it was still good! After awhile though, it was a little too much so I shared it with my boyfriend.

The service was quick! There was a few seats on the side.

Overall the cannolis were pretty good and I wouldn't mind trying their other flavors!
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: Cupcakes are sooo good and very sweet and I must say this place gets packed very quickly but the staff works very fast and pleasant.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
We visited Boston for less than 26 hours for a wedding. To kill time my friend asked me if I like cannoli in which I said, "nah not my type of dessert." I have tried cannolis in various restaurants and even homemade ones and still I am I always ." It's alright". My friend insisted I try Mikes pastry. I gave in since the wedding wasn't until a few more hours. We walked around Little Italy and as we enter the store my friend asks me if I have cash because she doesn't... I was like why?... yup you guessed it, it's a cash only bakery. The line was almost out the door and seats were very limited but the line goes by fast. There were so many  different flavor... too many choices equals a confused child. We decided on getting four different flavors: original, pistachio, lemon, amaretto with nuts.

Hands down THE best I ever eaten. I loved the original and amaretto... pistachio came in close or almost tied with the original and my least favorite was the lemon filling. They were not too sweet, full of flavor and they are huge! After a few bites I was craving for more but I was already full. I brought my leftovers to California.. hand carried it through tsa, layovers and connections, I had a lot of comments, some even tried to ask them from me.   When I got home it was time to see if the cannolis withstood the trials of travel... The shell was still crunchy after 24 hours and the filling was just as delicious as it came out from the bakery. Will I want to try other cannolis now that I found one that I really like? Maybe not.. I think I'll just share with someone unless it's up to this standards.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: I came in to grab some desserts but was unsure of what I wanted. The servers seemed rude when asking what I wanted so I just chose from what I could see in front of me. If I hadn't ordered yet, I would have walked out because I noticed they weren't wearing masks or gloves while serving customers during Covid 19 and they were pretty rude and this wasn't the first time I experienced the rudeness. From now on I think I'll stick to Modern Pastry across the street from them.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: I'll give this a place five stars just for the experience. The location is great - right in the middle of the charming authentic Italian restaurants in the north end. There is usually a line out the door, but that's part of the fun. They have so much variety and you can get a few different flavors to try. The staff make you feel like you're right in Italy. While it can be overrated to go to all the time, it's a must try at some point if you're in Boston.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: Mike's is a classic for dessert in the North End. I've been a few times and the whole experience is worth while. Be wary that the line does get quite long on weekend nights and will stretch outside of the door but the line goes fairly fast for how long it seems. I've never waited more than 15-20 minutes before getting to the counter. The selection they have for cannolis is great and I've been able to try a new one every time I go. The cannolis are very good and I would recommend the expresso or mousse flavors. Besides cannolis, they have a giant selection of other baked items in the displays underneath the counters but it is quite hard to see all of it if it's busy(which it almost always is). The only downside is it gets quite hectic and they only take cash so make sure you have cash before you get to the front of the line.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: If you're looking for a really good cannoli, this is the place to go. Even if you're someone who doesn't like cannolis - like me - you will definitely find a flavor you can indulge on and thoroughly enjoy. The huge variety of cannoli flavors will satisfy anyone and everyone. Like previously stated, I'm not a big cannoli person at all, but I got the mousse cannoli, which had chocolate mousse inside instead of the typical cannoli filling, but still had the chocolate chips on the ends and a chocolate drizzle over the pastry part, and I absolutely loved it. The cannolis are nice and big and just ate absolutely delicious. Loved my mousse cannoli.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: Not a lot to write about Mike's pastries after it has been featured in the Food channel and it has been an staple of Boston for decades. Cannolis are fresh every day, the line to get to the counter is long (yes, always!) and they only take cash. After that its only heaven! all kinds of cannolis, among other pastries. An absolute Have To if you are in town!
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: If you will go to Harvard, they have a Mike's there as well. It's not worth the wait at this store. Cash only (so are many other stores in Little Italy). I tried original ricotta cannoli at three places. Mike's has a stronger ricotta taste, Modern Pastry's is sweeter, Galateria's is creamier (it's filled to order like a Gelato! Not "pumped into" like Modren P and Mike's. It's kinda special).

text: It is cash only, however, they have a ton of options. I would only get the cannolis when I go back. I felt like the cannolis were their "bread and butta" so I will stick to that. Maybe they have other options that are good but they have too many options. It is impossible to try all their dessert in one day!!

text: Best Cannoli's in town! Personal favorite, chocolate chip.  Always recommend for anyone who comes to visit Boston.  Just don't forget cash$$$

text: This is a place I keep coming back to every time I visit Boston. Their pastries and cannolis are consistently amazing. I love that I recognized the staff, who have been there for ages. We shared a pistachio cannoli (because they're massive), but ended up buying another one because why not. Next time I'll try something that isn't a cannoli!

text: Cannoli heaven ... OMG! I am still dreaming about these cannolis! Came here while visiting Boston New Years Eve weekend. What a treat! The line was absolutely worth the wait. FYI - cash only! Im sad that I didn't get to stop here again before going back home but I will def be back soon!!
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
Mike's Pastry continues to attracts huge crowds at all hours of the day after all these years because the cannoli really is *that* good. 

There are so many to choose from, whether the pecan caramel or the Nutella. And they're just right on a taste, quality, and value perspective. The shells are fried just right - crispy and crunchy on the outside, thick enough on the inside, and, overall, not disintegrating into millions of crumbs when you bite into them. The ricotta fillings are just the right balance among creamy, sweet, and savory, and the whole equation is sprinkled and coated with just the right amount of sugar and chocolate chips. 

In addition to the cannoli, there are plenty of other sweet treats like macaroons, cookies, and lobster tails. Moreover, this outlet is well-staffed and well-stocked for the constant onslaught of customers and fans. Definitely worth a visit for the cannoli alone.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: This place is usually packed, but rightfully so. Lines move quickly and the pastries are wonderful! Definitely worth the wait
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: We went here to try the famous cannolis. While they looked very good the taste doesn't compare to the true Sicilian cannolis.

text:

text: AMAZING CANNOLI. PERIOD. Got an insider tip to get the Florentine cannoli, and it was to die for! I also got the Boston cream pie as any tourist does in Boston, and it was a hearty slice of a classic take on the dessert. Will definitely be coming back whenever I'm in town!
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
Nearly all the travel websites and blogs about Boston will mention Mike's Pastry so I absolutely had to check this place out.  Upon arrival I wasn't sure if I would be able to purchase the cannolis because there were so many people outside and I didn't have much time to wait. Thankfully the crowd outside wasn't the actual line to get in. Once inside it was quite a scene in there. There wasn't an obvious system for ordering so there were lines here and there, but no one seemed ready to order when the staff would holler out "next".  Once you made your way to the counter you quickly needed to respond to "next" and rattle off the types of cannolis you wanted.  Given the sheer number of people in the shop, you want to get your cannolis and then get out of the way. Don't bother with credit cards or Apple Pay. Mike's accepts cask only. 

I'm generally not a fan of cannolis, but Mike's has changed my opinion of them. Of the three that I purchased, the Florentine was my fave. Followed by the ricotta. Then espresso. 

If you are in Boston, be sure to follow the recommendation by the travel websites & blogs, and go to Mike's Pastry.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: Line moves quickly and employees are pleasant. The cannoli and lobster tail were good. Also had the Boston cream pie which was great. I'd definitely go back to visit this place!
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: This was surprisingly my first time trying a cannoli and I'm so glad it was from here. There were plenty of friendly employees ready to help when I was there a little before noon on a weekday. I picked the regular chocolate chip cannoli ($4, cash only) and it was absolutely delicious. The filling was rich and creamy yet not too heavy, and the shell had just the right amount of crunch. I was so tempted to buy a bunch of the other pastries like the lobster tail but was low on cash.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: Looking for a real deal Italian Pastry shop? Head down to the North End, Mike's Pastry is the REALS!! They offer a plethora of amazing sweet and delicious treats.  Mike's is a must visit if you're in Bean Town!!  Expect it to be crowded because the hype is real.  They offer so many different kinds of  cannolis, just make sure to try one.  We went with a Lobster Tail which was the size of a small loaf of bread, one of my favorites!  We also had to try a regular cannoli and one of their cupcakes.  Everything was mouth watering, don't think twice about coming here, so worth it!  BRING CASH, CASH ONLY!
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: No matter how full we are after dinner each time, we still find ourselves making a stop at Mike's, for those amazing pastries to bring home and enjoy a bit later. A trip to North End wouldn't be complete without a visit here! Since moving to the Boston area three months ago, we have tried lots of good cannolis, including from Modern Pastry Shop which is only a few doors away, but hands down, Mike's is the best around! There are so many flavors to choose from, like the chocolate moose or the amaretto, both of which are delicious, but none can compare with the wonderfully simple chocolate chip cannoli! Make sure to ask for the powdered sugar on top.  I like this one most, probably because you are still able to taste the full flavor of the cream and the sweetness of the shell, unlike with that of others which often over power the main ricotta filling.. Also, according to my family, the chocolate fudge brownie and assorted bakery cookies are pretty yummy,despite hearing that Modern actually wins with all desserts, excluding cannolis of course. Pastries run about $4 apiece, but keep in mind it's cash only.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: The cannoli are delicious. They're the most authentic ones I've found in Boston. The place is very crowded because the pastries are good.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: Staple of the north end. Known for their cannolis. Everything is made fresh. Can't go wrong with anything off of their menu. Cupcakes are great too . A must when you're in Boston. Add this place to your to do list !!!
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: I think Mike's deserves a little more than my original review. Their cannolis are truly the greatest of all time. There are so many kinds to choose from. The filling isn't too sweet and you can easily eat the whole thing even though they are huge. I've never considered myself a cannoli person unless they are Mike's cannolis. I also love their carrot cake, cheesecakes and rainbow cookies. The cash only thing is a pain, but it makes it feel more authentic.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
Came here around 2:00pm on a Saturday and it was surprisingly not busy... I was prepared for a really long wait based on all the reviews and recommendations I got from friends but I guess I got luck because when I came there was only about 20 people ! Everyone was being served rather quickly and I actually needed more time to think about which canoli I would get .. they have so many options ! But I settled on their amoretto 

If this is a real canolli then I have no idea what the 'canollis' I've eaten in the past would be considered ... This canoli could have eaten four canolis ! It's massive ! But incredibly delicious and fresh. The crunch in the outside is perfect... I'll have to come back next time I'm in Boston to try another one (:
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: Holy Canoliiiii !!! This place was everything and more. Unfortunately I live a plane ride away otherwise this would be my frequent stop. It was my first time having a cannoli and the experience couldn't of been better. Highly recommend. Til next time Mike's Pastry!
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
Don't be intimidated by the crowded store - there are usually several lines that run in parallel, so the wait time isn't too long. Also, be sure to bring cash.

Mike's offers a variety of pastries, but the cannoli are what I go for. There's a variety of cannoli flavors to choose from, but I usually go for the regular one with chocolate chips at the ends. The cannoli are quite large, so consider going with a friend and splitting one if you're not the biggest fan of sweets.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: Cannolis aren't my favorite dessert, but the ones here are delicious! I tried the regular one and amaretto. Both were perfectly sweet (not too sweet and definitely not bland) and I loved the cannoli shell. It's always crowded but line moves super quick. It's definitely the place to go for pastries in Boston.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: Soooo delicious. Go in the morning, at night you'll wait in line. So many different flavors of cannolis, and different deserts.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: Another North End icon - always seems to have a line, and it's worth the wait. The espresso cannoli is heavenly - I can't leave there without one. Traditional ricotta cannoli is delicious as well. Lobster tail is another great choice, but can feed 4 - very rich. I've only ever been disappointed at Mike's when I've shown up and they were already closed - this place stays open late, especially on the weekends.  Warning - they are cash only, so be prepared.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
There is a reason why there is always a line here.  The cakes and pastries are amazing, of course! 
But, their cookies are TO DIE FOR - simply the Best Italian cookies anywhere.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: This place was recommended by many, but I found it to be just OK. Got a piece of Boston cream pie, tiramisu, and a Nutella cannoli. The Boston cream pie was the best of all 3, but nothing spectacular. The tiramisu was very dense- I like mine more light & airy. Very disappointed given this bakery is a staple of "little Italy". The cannoli was bland- I didn't taste any hazelnut flavor. These were eaten the day after I purchased them, so maybe that affected the flavor? They were kept refrigerated though. All three were left unfinished by both my husband and I. Would not recommend. Saw many other bakeries around town that I should have stopped at instead.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: Get the BOSTON CREAM PIE CAKE SLICE!!!!!!! Ahhhhhhmazing!!! Add a tiny bit of powdered sugar and enjoy! It's the best dessert EVER!!
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
Coffee cannoli - highly recommended. The chocolate chips are added bliss.  The chocolate cupcake was great especially the frosting!

They still accept Cash only, even during COVID times so be prepared before you go.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: You know how you read Yelp reviews and you wonder if anything could possibly live up to what people have written? Well guess what - Mikes DOES and even more!! Those cannolis are amazing. I went back three times. Wow. Thanks, Mikes!
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
Locals say this place is a must go. Be prepared to wait in line because the lines are always out the door. Cash only. 

I got three cannolis for variation - chocolate chip, amaretto and pistachio. 

I don't know what it was but I did not like any of them. Not even the pistachio and I usually love anything pistachio. 

I tried the cannolis at Modern Pastry the next day and they are far much better. I went back for seconds!
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
This place is cash only!! Wish I had read that before heading in because I was only able to try one thing because of it.

When in Boston, they are a tourist must! I've never had a cannoli I liked, but the hazelnut one is amazing. It's light and crispy, not overly sweet and MASSIVE. The place was packed on a Friday afternoon but there are so many lines that is moved fairly quickly. 

Our Uber driver did tell us that locals love the place across the street more but I really enjoyed Mike's.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
This is a Boston destination stop.  Don't skip it.  Also, don't be discouraged by the line going down the street.  It moves quite fast as you order at the counter, get your goodies boxed up, and if you go.  


For your first visit, you MUST get a lobster tail.  The cream is plentiful and SOOOO good.  Not so sweet that you split your forehead open in the table from your sugar induced coma.  Just right!!!  Also snag a few cannoli.  TONS to choose from.

*** If you go in the morning on a weekday, there is virtual.  As the day goes on, so does the line.

*** They only accept cash.  Make sure to have a few extra dollars for a tip.  These ladies bust a move all day long to serve hundreds of people.  They deserve it!
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: Left with a mint chip cannoli, pistachio cannoli, and a slice of tiramisu. All of which I would highly recommend. I don't think you can go wrong with any of the pastries at Mike's. Don't forget to bring as that is the only form of payment they accept. The lines are long but move fast.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
Mike's is where all the tourists go for cannoli in Beantown. While I prefer the Modern a couple of blocks up, I had to pay visit to this institution. 

I step in here and I feel like I'm back in the 80's, this place is in dire need of an update. But maybe they want to keep things ... traditional. 

Which they do. 

There are a few tables around but will most likely be taken up by many others who've gone here to get their cannoli treats. I took mine to go but I asked for a FRESH filled ricotta one because the cannolis on the display case (despite being refrigerated) look like they've been sitting there all day.

The shell is unremarkable, but the ricotta has a nice tang and creamy texture to it. Good cannoli at $3.50 each. Cash only.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: YUMMM!  The cannolis are wonderful!   Have never had anything from Mike's that I didn't love.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
These cannolis are legit!

Pros:
+ We got super lucky - ok, generally the line is particularly long. However, we didn't end up waiting too long for a place.
+ Amazing variety in cannolis - We ended up getting a box of these amazing ones. My favorite by far was the chocolate hazelnut one
+ Great/Efficient Service - they are well staffed and the lines move quickly

Cons:
- Cash only
- Crowded
- Limited seating
- Pricey - each cannoli is about $4-5
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
At closing it's urgent to ensure the staff leaves on time.  Hopefully this isn't the normal operating mode.  Questions seemed to be an anomaly reserved for the faint of heart.

On the other side the product speaks for itself.  Who can argue with the success of this enterprise.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
Massive Lines, OK Pastries, Too Over Celebrated... 

So you go to Boston and everyone says "You've got to go to Mikes for Pastries" so why not. We arrived and spent approx 45 minutes in line to get cannelloni and some tiramisu for our snacking delight. 

The tiramisu was really good, I give it 4.5 stars! 

The cannelloni was not bad, I would give it 3.8 stars

The people working here were scrambling to manage the insane crowds so they get 5 stars for being as friendly as they can be in the circumstances except the one woman who is probably the owners daughter judging by appearances who understandably is short with customers who at times seemed to deserve it. Either way, it was funny to watch. 

3 stars because who in the world wants to stand in line for nearly an hour for a snack. Not worth the wait. 

If they are always this busy they should hire more people to manage the herd.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
Established in 1946. 

Go to for cannolis. Don't be scared of the long line as they have lots of people working behind the counter and the line moves fast. 

You will be had pressed to select one (most likely a few) of the 15 flavor fillings.  Favorites: Florentine, pecan-caramel, espresso and chocolate dipped plain. 

Why only 3 stars?  Lobster claw was as hard as Gronk's helmet and inedible. Sfogliatella was passable and I wasn't impressed with the filling. Pistachio cookies were simply ok.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
I had high hop for some yummy Boston cream pie. But it wasn't that great. It was sugar on top of sugar and lacks dimension. Maybe this is called old school pastry but it there's nothing special about them. 

The lobster tail was slightly better. It's puff pastry with regular whipped cream. I would recommend that over Boston cream pie for sure. 

** cash only **
Touristy
Long line 
You better know what you are ordering like you are in a deli in NYC or the staff would not look too happy with you
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
Holy Cannoli! If you love, heck even just like cannoli's, then Mikes Pastry Shop is a must experience. The cannoli are HUGE and the assortment they offer is wicked awesome. Almost 20 different varieties! In my wildest dreams i never believed a place like this actually existed. I tried the Florentine but you really cant go wrong with just the classic cannoli. Service was fast, friendly and efficient. 
They also offered various pastries and some Italian cookies. However, i did not see the cookies I was seeking so my bakery hunt continued on...
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: Probably the best cannoli we have had in a long time. The classic chocolate chip was just that ... classic! The chocolate dipped was great, too. We also decided to try Nutella even though we usually stick to the more traditional filling. We were surprised to find that you could still taste the delicious ricotta with the chocolate and hazelnut base. The wait in line was so worth it. Very filling so we might have saved our leftovers to have for breakfast the next morning!!!
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: As a northern girl living in the south, Mike's Pastry filled the cannoli-sized hole in my heart. Don't let the lines intimidate you, it moves pretty quickly and just know what you want when you get to the counter. We went back several times to try different kinds of cannolis, and also had the chocolate mousse cake that was very good.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: They're known for their cannolis and this place gets packed with tourists wanting to get their share. Not much of a uniform line so just walk straight up to the counter and order their *pistachio cannoli* and get yourself a *black and white cookie* too. That's a classic from New York so why not try it.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
When i first moved to Boston, my roommate took me to the North End for lunch and said we just *had* to check out Mike's.
There's always- i repeat, always- a line out the door for this place.
When you get in there, there's no order. People are just screaming their orders out and shaking their money toward the clerks behind the counters.
It reminds me so, so, SO much of all those 80s movies you see of stockbrokers screaming in the bull pen. 
Back to Mike's-
there's this really neat pulley system built into the cieling that feeds the clerks string so they can wrap the boxes. Seriously, I'm blown away every time- their hands move at sonic speeds, you guys.
The pastries themselves were pretty good, SUPER sweet cannolis, good biscotti, and I'm in love with their giant selection of marzipan goodies. The puffy pastry thing- is it called a lobster tail?- was divine and made with real, heavy whipped cream. I love few things more than getting a few goodies and sitting on a bench with friends and wasting an hour or two people watching.
Definitely worth checking out if you're in Boston.
And be sure to hit an ATM- it's cash only.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
Mike's Pastry lived up to the high expectations I had! Of course I had heard all about their cannoli but I didn't realize that they had so many flavors. Off the top of my head, I can remember oreo cookie (see pic below), chocolate peanut butter, one with chocolate chips, and almond. I want to say there were at least 10 flavors. And of course you can just get original! The cannolis are huge. They also have many other desserts (I saw one massive peanut butter cookie and an equally massive MnM cookie).

There is no seating in the North End location, so plan to get your dessert and eat at a nearby park or the Boston public market. They are cash only. All in all, definitely worth a stop for both tourists and locals.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: If you're looking for the best cannoli of your life- look no further!  So glad we stopped in here during our trip to Boston and can't wait to come back and try more delicious sweets! Highly recommend!
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: Hard to say anything that hasn't already been said about this place. I am not sure if they have the BEST cannoli around, but they definitely have one that is hard to pass up if I am ever walking by. I bring friends here whenever they visit Boston for the first time. The cannoli are giant, so I usually like to split one with a friend. I am also lactose intolerant, but it's still worth.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
CASH ONLY! Sorry, had to get that out of the way since some of you will only read the first sentence. 

Aside from that, I have to give this place five stars. The variety of desserts (and the variety of cannolis alone) is insane and the staff is efficient AF. Seriously, have you seen them take orders, box, tie, and check guests out? It's crazy impressive. 

Mike's is a neighborhood staple. Anytime friends are visiting, I take them here (and okay, maybe I also take my friends to another dessert place that happens to be across the street so we can do cannoli taste tests). I absolutely love the cannolis here. The shell - perfect. The filling - perfect. I'm drooling. 

Don't be discouraged by the line, I promise it moves fast/is worth the wait. The atmosphere can be kinda intense with the amount of people and all the excitement, but chill, take a deep breath, and enjoy your pastries!
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
Now this place has extremely long lines but they move fairly quickly so yes, it's worth the wait. I have an obsession with cannoli's so what better place to try than this?! I am quite fortunate to have an understanding BF who gives in to my dessert cravings 24/7. 

So they have endless cannoli's and so many flavors. We tried the chocolate chip, espresso and florentine. Honestly, they all tasted the same but they were all great. I liked the chocolate chip cannoli because it was simple and so yummy. The shell is crunchy but not too crunchy and the filling is not too sweet. They are kind of big so eating more than one is way too much much. I would definitely go back there and try other things. Their cupcakes seemed pretty popular and so did their cheesecakes.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: Holy cannoli this place is amazing. I decided to check it out based on recommendations from locals and it was the best decision I had ever made. The worst mistake I made was trying my first cannoli here (I know, they'll never be the same anywhere else). It was delicious and had a great authentic Italian feel. The place is not fancy but it felt super local, which is what I like when I travel. I love a local authentic feel!
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
Great products, very busy

My wife and I went on Sunday after dinner to get dessert cannolis. We waited in a chaotic line for about 10-15 minutes before we were able to purchase.

The cannolis were great, though the look of disdain from the woman who served me (probably due to a small order) was unnecessary.

Go earlier in the day. The food is worth it.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: What a great place! So many options but don't worry that doesn't take away from how amazing everything is. Only thing I would mention is they only take Cash we weren't prepared for that so my husband had to leave and find a ATM so we could pay. Beside that though I got he Oreo Cannoli and it was top 3 I have ever had. Can't wait to come back to Boston to try more flavors!!!
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: Make sure you have some cash with you! Don't worry, the line moves quickly.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
I'll be real: Overhyped.
I mean quality cannoli, trash customer service.
I understand efficiency, but when there's only 5 other people in the restaurant..there's no need to cut me off mid sentence to ask for the 3rd time what I want. As I already said, it's my first time and my group needs a second. One cannoli is $5 other patties range to $10
+Large cannolis 
+Variety of pastries
-Terrible Customer service
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: Best pastry shop in the Northend. The service and vibe were high energy and the pastries....of, the pastries!! Absolutely mouth watering. The cream was so light and airy and the pastry themselves were so flaky and light.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
Since I was in Boston I was on a mission to find a good Boston cream pie. Mike's pastry is definitely a well-known institution offering a great variety of treats. Pricing is fair, staff is very friendly, and it's located in a great area. When we came it wasn't too busy so after a few minutes of reviewing the menu easily got our order in. I've heard rumors that there can be lines around the block though on different days.

Everything we had was tasty and I would definitely stop by when I'm in the mood for something sweet.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: Insanely good cannolis. Could not believe the crowd on Friday night. Outside the door and jammed packed inside. Happily waited for our box of treats. Did not disappoint.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
The shop is busy. There were a lot of people at the counters ordering pastries. Everything in the counters looked really nice and inviting. One of the staff members was a little rude because she thought I was next in line, so I told her that I was with my boyfriend who was ordering and she gave me a look like I was wasting her time. 


We purchased a cannoli with chocolate chips to go and we asked for it in a box. Not knowing that people have to pay for bags in Boston, we asked the staff member who gave me a look earlier, because she happened to be free, if we could get a bag. She sounded annoyed that we didn't know we would have to pay 10cents for a bag and she got the bag for us and tossed it over the counter at us when I handed her the dime. Not sure if she was having a bad day or if that's just how her customer service is.

The cannoli is larger than most. It tastes decent but it was nothing special. The large size makes it better for sharing but even then we had a hard time finishing it.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
Best Northend has to offer 
Best of all the rest
Best  cannoli 
Best lobster tails
Best pies
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: ABS TRASH!!! First of all I am local and the level of disrespect is crazy. I asked for a Ricotta Pie and she gave me a slice. I then asked two 4 ricotta cannolis and she only gave me 1. When I asked for 1 more she rolled her eyes at me. I am shocked. My grandparents got their wedding cake and we have always come here. The ricotta pie I got is not the same had the same texture as cottage cheese. I will never be back here.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: We picked Mike's on a quest for the perfect Boston cream pie and boy did they deliver! My wife and I shared a slice because the slices are generous but then we needed two slices to take with us . They get the cake and the chocolate ganache light and just right and let the custard be the star it was always born to be! This little treat will live in my dreams for a while!
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: I rarely give 5 stars, but this pastry shop BLEW ME AWAY! The shop was packed when we went, which happened to be later in the evening. When we entered, the smell of sweets overpowered my nose ... in the best way! We were greeted and got our order in very quickly. I would recommend: the chocolate chip cannolis, the Italian wedding cookie, and my all time favorite - the carrot cake. While waiting for our sweets, we had a wonderful conversation with the family who owns the shop, which only made our experience more genuine and fun! When we sat down to eat, the carrot cake was the first to go - the frosting was a little sweet for my liking, but overall it was the BEST carrot cake I have ever had. The Italian wedding cookies we sweet and perfect to pop in your mouth! Don't miss out on this amazing shop!
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: Don't get me wrong, the cannolis are AMAZING, but the service is seriously lacking. It's a super popular place so I naturally it was crowded, so by the time we ordered it was about 10 minutes from closing. My friends and I each ordered 2 cannolis and took a seat at a table inside to enjoy them. We were immediately asked to leave because they were closing. As a server myself I understand how frustrating it is to have people in a restaurant at closing time, but I never would ask paying customers to leave. It was extremely rude, and we weren't planning on staying and hanging out, just finishing the cannolis we had paid for. I loved the cannolis, but I didn't like the way they treated paying customers. Maybe it was a stressful night, so I'd give them another chance, but I definitely think it's something that management should address to avoid tUrning a lot of people off.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
I had some time to kill while I was waiting for my friend. So what better thing to do then to do a cannoli tour :) I went to Mikes, Modern, and Bova's and got a cannoli plus more at each. 

Note: Please do not be crazy like me and attempt this as a solo traveler. My stomach felt bad afterwards due to sugar overload (but #yolo)

For Mike's, I saw many reviews saying to get the Florentine since it has a different shell so I got it. I think the regular shell would've been better because the Florentine was just too sweet for me. The chocolate chips on the Florentine was also too much for me. But that's an easy fix since you can scrap it off. However, I'd suggest just ordering a different cannoli. 

Comparing the cannoli filling with Modern, they were similar in taste and sweetness level. But the one that I prefer the best is Modern simply because they have the option for mini cannolis and you can customize your topping/filling. And since it's mini, you can have more than one cannoli! Also, if you're worried about it being too cheesey, it's not! Personally, I am not that big of a cheese fan so I was worried that the filling would be too much so I played it safe with one custard cannoli but the ricotta was fine!! (It's more like a thick cream taste than something strong like cream cheese.) 

I also got a sfgotille at Mike's and I would recommend skipping this one. I'm not sure how the pastry should be but the outer pastry was hard and not flaky/crispy like I was expecting. Filling was also meh. I took a couple bites and just tossed it. Also if you are wondering between the difference between the sfogliatelle and the lobster tail, the sfogliatelle is smaller and has a baked filling. The lobster tail has a cream+ricotta filling says the employee. 

At Bova's, I got a mini lobster roll as well and it also had a hard outside so I'm not sure if that's just how it's suppose to be. I got a cappuccino cannoli at Bova's and the ricotta filling itself was too sweet so I'd just stick with Mike's or Modern. But I do prefer Modern slightly more since you are able to customize there and get a smaller size.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: Terrific cannoli! This little place in the North End doesn't get the lines that a few of the better known places in the area get, but man, are their pastries good! You might want to split them with your friends so you can try more flavers.

text: I just salivate thinking of their cannolis. The fillings are generous and flavourful, and the shell is just a perfectly made pastry. text: Three letters... O.M.G!!! You most certainly have to have a sweet tooth to step in this doors of mikes pastry. And boy, I'm glad that I do. I'm also glad I limited my purchasing or I would go broke! I got the chocolate cream puff, chocolate mousse cannoli, peanut butter chocolate cannoli and lastly a piece of strawberry cheese cake. They didn't last longer than 24 hours. I had to limit myself but I savored every single bite! If you're on the North Shore of Boston hitting up a game at TD Garden or any events in the area... by all means ... make this pit stop! I may even become your best friend! Their staple dessert is the lobster tail which appears to be like an extra large croissant filled with tons of cream- every single time I get this, it takes me days to finish it! I opted for a simple cannoli this time and it was absolutely delicious. Hard to get seating here, and it is always very crowded! Very well known as a Boston staple.

text:
It's obvious from the line that can form outside and all the yelp reviews that this place has a buzz. Unfortunately I was not impressed and it did not change my life like most people claim. Now don't get me wrong it was not bad but it was just ok. 

This place is located in North End smack in the middle of Little Italy. It has all kinds of pastries, cookies, sweets, cofee etc... They have a solid wrap around counter that probably has about 8 ladies taking orders at one time. This is a pretty big pastry shop. Maybe it was just me but the ladies behind the counter weren't all that nice.

Of course I ordered a cannoli ;) I was adventurous and got their cannoli florentine...I wish I could take it back, it was way too sweet. The shell was so sweet I could not have more then two bites of it, I ate the filling with a spoon. The filling itself was nothing special but good.

We also ordered a Sfogliatella  which was baked that day so it was fresh. They did a great job baking this it wasn't overly hard on the outside and nice and soft on the inside.

We also ordered coffee which was standard.
Overall for me it was just a normal pastry shop, nothing special and nothing I ate would make me go back especially when you have so many other pastry shops around the corner.

I know this place is known as having some of the best cannoli's in Boston but I have to disagree my favorite was from Modern Bakery.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:

Tip: MAKE SURE TO BRING CASH, they are a CASH ONLY establishment.

categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
Five stars, hands down. My sister, who lives in the area, and Yelp both suggested Mike's Pastry as a place worth paying a visit.  I'm not big on many pastries, but I succumbed. I felt that I just couldn't be in the North End of Boston without sampling some of the famous pastries. When we walked in, we were overwhelmed. There were people taking pictures of the vast selection of pastries. There were tourists getting their pictures taken in front of the vast selection of pastries. I may or may not have given in and done the same. It wasn't terribly crowded at 6 PM on a Saturday, which surprised me; I was expecting a long line.

The way it's set up is you walk up to any of the many people behind the counter. You say what you want. You give them cash (it's cash only). They package up your sweet goodness into a box and use string/twine from these globes hanging from the ceiling to securely wrap up your delicious pastry present. After some hemming and hawing, I decided on the mint chocolate chip cannoli based on my sister's recommendation. She decided to get the chocolate cheesecake. 

Mint chocolate chip cannoli. Omg. It was heavenly. Also, it was really quite large! It is easy to share (that's what my sister and I ended up doing). The crust is flaky and the filling is what made it really stand out to me. Mint perfection with a very liberal amount of mini chocolate chips smushed onto both ends of the pastry. I felt genuinely sad when I finished eating it. This was the best cannoli I have ever had! On my last day in Boston, I almost took a bus and a train all the way back here just to get more.

Cheesecake. It was really big, which was exciting. However, I was a little bit underwhelmed by the taste. It definitely wasn't bad at all--just average. Maybe I was expecting something outrageously delicious after having had the mint chocolate chip cannoli. 

So, despite the slightly disappointing cheesecake and the fact that it's cash only, the amazing cannoli I had keeps this place at five stars. If I ever find a better cannoli, maybe I'll update this review. Until then, Mike's Pastry is crowned cannoli king.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: This review is mostly based on customer service from my own personal experience and somewhat based on the quality of the food. I should start by saying that we came here because my friends were visiting from out of town and heard that the cannolis were fantastic. I could not eat any myself because I practice a vegan diet, but they said that it was delicious. The shell was crispy and flakey, and the filling was creamy and not overwhelmingly sweet. I had asked a woman at the front if there were any vegan options (out of curiosity, I had a feeling that the answer would be no but I thought it was worth a sho!) she said no but then proceeded to go on a tirade of why veganism is flawed and began berating me about my diet and that I must be sick, etc etc. I felt very uncomfortable and stepped out so avoid any conflict.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt

text:
I think the other reviews over promised, over hyped this place! It's the most reviewed place in Boston and we expected something spectacular.

We tried their cannoli and tiramisu and both are not that great. Their cannoli is good but very rich. They are big, so it may justify the price. Plus cannoli is always on the expensive side.

Their tiramisu is a little bit of a let down. It's not real tiramisu. It's layer cake tiramisu, if that makes sense. And the taste itself isn't that much better than any other tiramisu we've tried. Go to Giacomo the Italian restaurant and they have way better tiramisu!

Price is on the pricier side. Maybe because it's a touristy and popular place. Make sure to bring cash because it's cash only.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text:
Although the bakery is filled to the rim with cakes, macaroons, and all other types of tarts and sweet goodies, we came for the cannolis and that's all I got. 

The place is large with displays in an L shape around the shop. The other wall has a giant refrigerator filled with cakes, and the area near the door has small tables to sit. They come and take your drink orders and you can enjoy a fresh cannoli with it. 

We ordered a chocolate chip cannoli and a pistachio cannoli. Both were flaky and crunchy on the outside, and creamy on the inside. The inside is actually a cheese...I think ricotta and something else. They are quite large, so we only got 2 to split between 4 people. 

The only difference between the two is the flavor chips on the end. I personally prefer the pistachio over the chocolate chip, and with tea or coffee, it's the perfect pair.
categories: Candy Stores, Gelato, Food, Coffee & Tea, Restaurants, Desserts, Patisserie/Cake Shop, Specialty Food, Bakeries, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
name: Mike's Pastry

text: Always busy and over priced (though delicious), I'd much rather Bova's Bakery around the corner. #3 in the North End for pastry

text: OMG! OMG!  So much goodness! I darted into grab desserts for my daughters roommates. They arrived during Covid, and all work at MGH so none of them have tried Mike's. The woman behind the counter, Maria, was super helpful and grabbed us their 6 most popular flavors. Cannoli overload. Try them! Amazing. We had a chocolate covered lobster, the hazelnut cannoli was amazing!
