If I hadn't had a dinner companion with me I would have taken home the bones, and placed them in a lighted, sealed case on a gold platter, next to my bed.  So that before I closed my eyes at night and when I opened them in the morning I would be gently reminded of the true heaven which is Pok Pok chicken wings.

A couple of very minor complaints: the giganto gas-furnace-heater-thing mounted in the middle of our outside table.  What a beast.  There's gotta be a better way to accomplish outdoor heat. And two: confusion and weird layout.  What's the Whiskey Lounge?  The inside part?  The upstairs part?  And which part is Pok Pok?  Then the website calls one area "Shack".  Huh?  And they have different menus?  Not sure what the hell's going on with all this, but back to the wings.......
categories: Restaurants, Asian Fusion, Pan Asian, Thai, Filipino, Chicken Wings, Vietnamese
name: Pok Pok

text: I had high expectations coming to this place given all the reviews. I honestly think this place is overrated and over priced because it has no other competition. The fried chicken wings was good but sorry not that good for 6 full wings for $14.50. I found the food salty and had to asked for extra veggies which cost $2.50 to turn the fried chicken wing dish into a fried chicken veggie wrap which was delicious. The pork belly was again good but not for $14.50 for 3-4 small pieces in a claypot consisting of mostly fat. I guess I have been spoiled by big or urban city food that is not only delicious but larger in portion and lower price point. Service was good and decor was cute and cozy.
categories: Restaurants, Asian Fusion, Pan Asian, Thai, Filipino, Chicken Wings, Vietnamese
name: Pok Pok

text: Ike's wings!! Need I say more? The best wings on the planet. Maybe in the universe. I enjoy fire on the mountain, but for a completely different and unique flavor..... Pok pok takes the cake. Pok pok noi is just as good as is the location in Brooklyn. The wings and papaya salad are always a sure home run!!!
categories: Restaurants, Asian Fusion, Pan Asian, Thai, Filipino, Chicken Wings, Vietnamese
name: Pok Pok

text: I really don't get the hype about this place. It is really overpriced for food that is good but not great. Also, there is always a long wait.
categories: Restaurants, Asian Fusion, Pan Asian, Thai, Filipino, Chicken Wings, Vietnamese
name: Pok Pok

text: Wings did not disappoint.  Kaeng Hang Leh with the sauce on rice was great.  Would totally come here again next time in Portland.  Will try going up to one of the LA ones soon.

text:
I want to give more stars!!!! I absolutely loved this experience. My wife and I have travelled extensively in SE Asia, and the flavours, and smells, just brought us back. We were lucky enough to be seated outside, with only a 30 minute wait. The waiter was very knowledgeable, recommended some amazing dishes (and even pushed back that we had ordered too much).

The beef collar with sticky rice will bring me back anytime I am in Portland.
categories: Restaurants, Asian Fusion, Pan Asian, Thai, Filipino, Chicken Wings, Vietnamese
name: Pok Pok

text:
I'm gonna echo everyone else and tell you this: if you order only one thing, get the wings. I'm not kidding, these wings blow all other wings out of the water. In fact, get several orders since you will not want to stop eating them. 

Since there were 3 of us, we also ordered the kai yaang (whole bird), muu paa kham waan (boar collar), and khao soi (curry soup). Everything was delicious by itself, but the wings were still the best part. If you don't get the wings, you should just sit down and cry because you fail at life.
categories: Restaurants, Asian Fusion, Pan Asian, Thai, Filipino, Chicken Wings, Vietnamese
name: Pok Pok

text: l just love that orange chicken. i always go for girls night!
categories: Restaurants, Asian Fusion, Pan Asian, Thai, Filipino, Chicken Wings, Vietnamese
name: Pok Pok

text: Food speaks for itself, 4 stars because I basically dinned in a plastic surrounded shack. I'll be back many times, its that good.
categories: Restaurants, Asian Fusion, Pan Asian, Thai, Filipino, Chicken Wings, Vietnamese
name: Pok Pok

text:
Went there this evening. This was my second visit. I  came for the Chicken Wings (see my earlier review) but I allowed the waiter to talk me into trying the Muu Paa Kham Waan and I am glad he did. This was the most amazing and unique dish I have ever eaten and for $12.00 it is a deal.  

The dish is Boar collar meat rubbed with garlic, coriander root and black pepper, glazed with soy and sugar, grilled over charcoal and served with chilled mustard greens and a spicy chili-lime-garlic sauce. I ordered it with some sticky rice and a limeade, which was a perfect combination. 

This is a little hot, but for fans of chicken wings it is a no-brainer. The heat is a savory sweet heat that lingers. The lime and garlic are very present as is the taste of charcoal. The portion was small, but, you won't care, you will be satisfied.

The flavor lingered for almost an hour and I was very grateful that it did. I actually sat in the restaurant afterwards, soaking it in, letting it sit with me (something that I usually never do, I eat and leave). I am considering a move to Portland simply to eat here more often; if you are wise you will buy your plane ticket immediately; enough said.
categories: Restaurants, Asian Fusion, Pan Asian, Thai, Filipino, Chicken Wings, Vietnamese
name: Pok Pok

text:
I LOVE Thai food. 

I can't remember what the dishes are, but I had a steak salad and brussels sprouts. Both were delicious.

My companion had the spicy fish wings which were a MUST for anyone to try.
categories: Restaurants, Asian Fusion, Pan Asian, Thai, Filipino, Chicken Wings, Vietnamese
name: Pok Pok

text: Besides having a most hilarious name for a restaurant, this place this DOPE!!  Must not be too many Filipinos in Portland because Pok Pok is a "lighter" side term for prostitute in Filipino.  Just think poke poke.  Anyways, loved the food here.  I'm from SF and have traveled to Thailand several times but this was truly some different style Thai food.  None of the Thai food staples I'm used to and the presentation & portions were more towards the high end.  Cheers to you guys, killer food and creativity! Every time I wear my Pok Pok shirt, i get funny looks from my peeps!
categories: Restaurants, Asian Fusion, Pan Asian, Thai, Filipino, Chicken Wings, Vietnamese
name: Pok Pok

text:
Every time I eat here--and it's been about 20 over the last three years--it's great.  I even like the jasmine water now (at first it tasted like tortilla chips soaked in water--I've adapted).

So yes, you must try the wings--go for the spicy; it's not that intense.  Hate lines?  Go for lunch or an early dinner.  Get the green papaya salad--it may change your life more than the wings.  Have a gin and tonic--they're better here.  I don't even care why, just trust on this.

The service is always on point with friendly, informative staff.  They work hard and move fast, but I've  never felt rushed; this place is varsity on all fronts.

Finally, go with people who will let you sample their food.  I really like everything here; hard not to dream about those glorious wings.
categories: Restaurants, Asian Fusion, Pan Asian, Thai, Filipino, Chicken Wings, Vietnamese
name: Pok Pok

text: It's savory and delicious. The portions are adequate. Great place to take a date.
categories: Restaurants, Asian Fusion, Pan Asian, Thai, Filipino, Chicken Wings, Vietnamese
name: Pok Pok

text:
We came in from out of town and this is the first place we decided to eat. 

1) Crowded as hell. There was only a 10 min wait, however, we were seated at what appeared to be a table for 4. But we were surprised to find another party of 2 seated exactly 6 inches from us. They sat with us reluctantly after we exchanged awkward glances at the situation. When we asked to be seated elsewhere, we were told we would need to wait another 20-30mins for another table to open up. When we spotted a nice table and asked if we could be seated there, we were told it was for a table of 4 only. Not sure if it's a cultural thing or what, but in Texas, making the customer comfortable is valued more over cramming as many people into a place as humanly possible for the sake of profitability. 

2) Food- AMAZZZZING. Even the water itself was fantastically, subtly infused with a delicious plant something or other. The wings are to die for. The ribs and the sauces that came with it were also great, but not much meat on them for the price. 

3) Wait staff- Oak (our server) was personable and attentive, and was nice enough to chat with us about local recommendations. Poor guy probably thought we were going to stiff him due to the seating situations. 

All in all, not really worth it unless you're willing to sacrifice personal space and half of your savings.
categories: Restaurants, Asian Fusion, Pan Asian, Thai, Filipino, Chicken Wings, Vietnamese
name: Pok Pok

text: Unbelievable meal......Simply one of the top 5 meals I've ever had.  If you're looking for something that rivals a Morton's Steakhouse dinner, you're not barking up the right tree.  This place is in an old house on Division Street, not much in the way of ambiance.  But the food and flavors blew us away!!  Wings with Fish Sauce, fried catfish & noodles, boar collar (lean pork shoulder) in the most amazing citrus/celantro flavors, pork loin with peanut satay.  I'll stop rambling........amazing food and flavors.  A must for all foodie adventurers.
categories: Restaurants, Asian Fusion, Pan Asian, Thai, Filipino, Chicken Wings, Vietnamese
name: Pok Pok

text:
Pok Pok is the ultimate Portland Experience: pretentious street food, with elitist servers. It's kind of an experience, but I am not sure the food would have been worth a 2 hour wait.  

If you are used to eating "Thai food" don't expect to recognize anything on the menu. The menu is modeled after northern thai street food. If you ask about your old favorites, expect to get some attitude. Come on people, Pok Pok  is classy Thai street food, they are waaaaay too good to just make a curry. 

We ate at the bar to avoid a 2 hour wait for 2 people. The bartender was mortally offended when we ordered the satay (the only thing we recognized), but warmed up a little when we asked for suggestions. He steered us to: Khao soi & Muu Paa Kham Waan and the spicy wings. 

Both of us don't like wings in real life, so these were better than expected. 

The Khai soi with chicken was delicious, sweet and had a lot of flavor. It is served with a dish to add extra spice. I added a bunch to mine to give it some kick. 

The Muu Paa Kham was a surprise. The boar meat was delicious and spicy. We ate it with sticky rice. I love that it is served with chilled greens to offset the spice and to complete the taste in your mouth. 

The water tastes like rice water, its weird at first but tastes really good with the food. 

Tip: Eat at the bar to skip some of the wait.
categories: Restaurants, Asian Fusion, Pan Asian, Thai, Filipino, Chicken Wings, Vietnamese
name: Pok Pok

text: AMAZING FOOD/WINGS/ATMOSPHERE - one of my favorite places we went for our honeymoon. Some of the best Asian food we found in Portland. The food was so delicious. Can't wait to visit again.
categories: Restaurants, Asian Fusion, Pan Asian, Thai, Filipino, Chicken Wings, Vietnamese
name: Pok Pok

text:
Wow...

That's really all I have to say. I've been to Thailand several times and have eaten at more than 20 Thai restaurants in Portland and the food here is by far the BEST I have ever had.

We had the Chicken Wings to start and then shared the Kaeng Hang Leh and another dish with shrimp and glass noodles.

AMAZING!
categories: Restaurants, Asian Fusion, Pan Asian, Thai, Filipino, Chicken Wings, Vietnamese
name: Pok Pok

text: Pok Pok was worth the hype! We were visiting Portland for the day and decided to give this place a try based on recommendations from friends. I was a bit nervous after reading some of the mixed reviews, but I'm glad I didn't let that keep me away! I have visited Northern Thailand and Burma, where many of the dishes get inspiration from, and I was quite impressed! Don't expect basic Pad Thai here! We ordered the chicken wings, the pork salad, and the half chicken with dipping sauces. Food is served family style and meant to be shared. My husband said the wings were "the best wings I've had in my life" which is saying a lot since he is not usually not as into Thai style food as I am! The cocktails were also on point, although expensive. Plan to get there early because there is almost always a wait, but if you have time to spare, wonder down to the nearby Whiskey Soda lounge or nearby bars/coffee shops, and they will text you when your table is ready! The atmosphere is intimate, minimalistic, and made me feel like I was back in Thailand. I will definitely be back!
categories: Restaurants, Asian Fusion, Pan Asian, Thai, Filipino, Chicken Wings, Vietnamese
name: Pok Pok

text: I wanted to love it.  Maybe it was over-hyped. It fell flat. The famous Ike's wings were soggy and not that flavorful. Sticky rice which was recommended with most dishes wasn't that exciting and a super small portion. The highlights were the boar's collar and Da Choms laap.  Grilled spare ribs, pork loin skewers were bland and dry even with their respective sauces.  I hope that we caught them on a bad night and my experience was an extreme rarity for pok pok's kitchen.   Lots of servers helping out. Our waiter was helpful and efficient. Service was good.
categories: Restaurants, Asian Fusion, Pan Asian, Thai, Filipino, Chicken Wings, Vietnamese
name: Pok Pok

text:
Went to this place after hearing lots of recommendations from friends. Unfortunately found the wings to be far too sweet and salty for me to a point that you could barely taste the fish sauce and ginger. On the other hand, my SO really liked them, but she is into very salty and sweet foods so I guess YMMV. 

We also had the curry noodle soup which I found too sweet and not very spicy (they give you some chili paste on the side, but it's not the same). The beef cubes that came in the soup were very tender though, so that's a plus.

Nevertheless, the staff were very attentive and the place was nice. Despite the disappointment I may give them another try since some of the dishes that other tables had looked good.

Also, they don't seem to take reservations and have very long waiting periods so I'd suggest going doen the street for a beer of coffee while you wait. They'll text you and give you 10 mins to show up.
categories: Restaurants, Asian Fusion, Pan Asian, Thai, Filipino, Chicken Wings, Vietnamese
name: Pok Pok

text:
One of the best thai food I have experienced!!! And too bad it is in portland!!! The chicken wings were simply amazing.
Service was excellent.
Street parking available
It was my first time here with friends and I already miss it.
categories: Restaurants, Asian Fusion, Pan Asian, Thai, Filipino, Chicken Wings, Vietnamese
name: Pok Pok

text: Great food but really pricey. And the Togo order was really small. So small for 14$ papaya salad! After I paid I felt like I was getting jip out of food.
categories: Restaurants, Asian Fusion, Pan Asian, Thai, Filipino, Chicken Wings, Vietnamese
name: Pok Pok

text:
We arrived here around 7 and were able to get a table at 7:30, but hrs well worth the wait.Very authentic food using really  fresh ingredients! Khao Soi is one of the highlights in the restaurant.  Staffs here are super friendly as well. Little pricy with not-so-well-decor environment, but def worth 85% of the money you are gonna spend here. 
Def will be back!
categories: Restaurants, Asian Fusion, Pan Asian, Thai, Filipino, Chicken Wings, Vietnamese
name: Pok Pok

text:
Chicken is a bit overrated. I've had my fair share of chicken, having lived in NY and Seoul, Korea. That being said, the chicken wasn't bad, but it was just too salty for my taste. Perhaps I'd change my mind if it were served with a bowl of rice, and I'd need a BIG bowl to get through those salty wings.
 
  The price had me nervous, but now I know not to go back there.
categories: Restaurants, Asian Fusion, Pan Asian, Thai, Filipino, Chicken Wings, Vietnamese
name: Pok Pok

text: The girls at check in are graduates of ISIS. Bitter, non smiling and duplicitous. Our party was treated w distain and complete air of arrogance and "why are you here" attitude. They made us needlessly wait over 1 hour although we arrived at 5 pm w most tables empty. I cannot recommend unless you are willing to bite your tongue
categories: Restaurants, Asian Fusion, Pan Asian, Thai, Filipino, Chicken Wings, Vietnamese
name: Pok Pok

text:
I know it's Saturday night but two hours for a table for two really? We ordered the chicken wings, forest mushroom salad, curry noodle soup and brussel sprouts. All very good, fresh and flavorful. But worth the wait? Not really. Next time will bring 3 other people with us so we can make the 5 person minimum for a reservation.

Have to say the food was really amazing.  I'm not a big fan of waiting so long for a table in a trendy "hot spot" but will definitely return (although NOT on a Saturday night)
categories: Restaurants, Asian Fusion, Pan Asian, Thai, Filipino, Chicken Wings, Vietnamese
name: Pok Pok

text: We were in Portland for our anniversary over Superbowl weekend and were thrilled to get in with out a wait. The food was excellent, we had the green papaya salad, boar collar dish, and steak salad. Prices were reasonable and dishes were plenty spicy without overpowering the flavor. We will definitely be going back!
categories: Restaurants, Asian Fusion, Pan Asian, Thai, Filipino, Chicken Wings, Vietnamese
name: Pok Pok

text:
oh sweet pok pok you are so fun to say! my handsome as hell date and i just kept chirping pok pok and dancing a little happy dance over and over until we arrived.

we got seated and i took a swig of the water and immediately stage hollered "TASTE THE WATER IT'S WEIRD" because i thought maybe like PCP or some shit. apparently, it's laced with nothing more than palm leaves (but are they an aphrodisiac? because i felt a little something in my bathing suit area).

prithee tell me why the hell the wait staff looked like honky hipsters but acted like secret service people with their cb radios on their shoulders saying things like "10-4 good buddy" (okay i added the good buddy). it was enough to make me wonder idly, while sipping my psychedelic palm water and enjoying the twinkly lights, if they were also going to belly crawl our food to us with a gun strapped to their back. of course we wouldn't see them coming as they would be wearing camouflage. of course.

date and i ordered the fish sauce wings which we slurped off of the bones like they were unattended babies and we were starving chupacabra. they were so ridiculous. i mean how the hell did they get so good? what is wrong in the world that i have gone my whole life without these delicious little darlings? why don't they just have a conveyor belt that runs into my house and onto my table?

we also ordered the roasted game hen rubbed with lemongrass, garlic, pepper and cilantro. it was all kinds of falling off of the bone and into dipping sauce with sticky rice and into our throat holes. 

everyone was very sweet at ye olde pok, great service and our server didn't freak when i asked him if a dyke had ever fallen in love with him because of his spock tattoos (psst willy dee. CALL ME. luv u).
categories: Restaurants, Asian Fusion, Pan Asian, Thai, Filipino, Chicken Wings, Vietnamese
name: Pok Pok

text: We ordered pok pok fish sauce wings with noodle dish.  This wings were drenched in fish sauce and was so salty you couldn't taste the chicken.  If pok pok chef's secret sauce is the fish sauce, he must be buying gallons from Asian market.  Very disappointed in the dish.  Papaya salad was also drenched in fish sauce as well.
categories: Restaurants, Asian Fusion, Pan Asian, Thai, Filipino, Chicken Wings, Vietnamese
name: Pok Pok

text:
Can someone help me figure this one out?  I just don't get the praise heaped on this place.  I got the ribs, he got the curry.  Both entrees seemed incredibly small for the price, but they looked alright.

Curry was pretty yummy...but nothing special.  Ribs were dried out and tiny.  Literally, they had to be forcefully ripped off the bone with your teeth to tear off the super hard, tiny chunks of dried-out meat clinging to them.  I've had better ribs from grocery store delis...

Beyond the mediocre/bad food...even having just finished 2 full entrees, we were both starving.  First time I have ever left a restaurant after eating an entire entree to go to a second one and purchase a second entree because I was starving.

Can anyone tell me what I did wrong?  After hearing about this place for years, I just left really confused and disappointed.
categories: Restaurants, Asian Fusion, Pan Asian, Thai, Filipino, Chicken Wings, Vietnamese
name: Pok Pok

text:
I was a little bit disappointed by food and drinks.  Chicken was salty and chunk of sauce was here and there.  Papaya salad was authentic but dry shrimp was too little to taste and peanuts were added as whole. Kao soi had a good flavor but crispy noodle wasn't crispy enough.  Also wide noodle was chunky.  Pok pok bloody Mary had a strong unique flavor that I couldn't handle.  

I think this may a good Thai restaurant but not in the top league. Don't drive only for this restaurant.
categories: Restaurants, Asian Fusion, Pan Asian, Thai, Filipino, Chicken Wings, Vietnamese
name: Pok Pok

text: WORST ever!!! The waiting time was 1.5 hours and the place did not look busy. We finally get seated and I ordered a Pepsi. I did not get my Pepsi until the salad and the rest of the food came out. Remind the waitress twice. There was no warning of how spicy the food was. Usually at Thai restaurants they give you option even though it says spicy.  I was told it was authentic but not so much. The papaya salad was disgusting! This is one of my favorite dish and it failed! Too salty and the crabs added on to it was still in there crushed and very hard to chew! My friend almost spit it out. It was salty and no flavor to it. Then we get our chicken noodle curry soup... The chicken was good but the soup was so bland! The waiters was not so friendly either. Food took forever and we were starving. My overall experience for an AUTHENTIC Thai restaurant it SUCK!
categories: Restaurants, Asian Fusion, Pan Asian, Thai, Filipino, Chicken Wings, Vietnamese
name: Pok Pok

text:
After a long Saturday of ripping down drywall and catatonically browsing Home Depot aisles, I took a best girlfriend here to celebrate her new home. 

Pok pok was a whirly-gig evening of fun and relaxation. She fell in love with our cute host while we waited and we both swooned for the menu options. I know why Pok Pok's reputation has skyrocketed. Casual, yet special -- Wow. 

Go in the early evening to grab an outdoor seat. And plan for a slow, delightful meal. Though the service is quick, Pok Pok's offerings ought not be rushed.
categories: Restaurants, Asian Fusion, Pan Asian, Thai, Filipino, Chicken Wings, Vietnamese
name: Pok Pok

text:
Seriously, this was one of the top ten meals I've eaten--EVER, in any country.  You have to be looking for Thai street food (as opposed to typical sit-down restaurants that serve things like Swimming Rama and Phad Thai) and be good with spice, but if you go in knowing that, you will not leave disappointed.  The fish sauce wings are insane.  So freaking good.  Please order them.

Know that you will have to wait in line to get in, but it's so worth it.  Seriously.  Go.
categories: Restaurants, Asian Fusion, Pan Asian, Thai, Filipino, Chicken Wings, Vietnamese
name: Pok Pok

text: yummy every time!  worth the wait - go on off hours if you don't like to wait and try the specials!
categories: Restaurants, Asian Fusion, Pan Asian, Thai, Filipino, Chicken Wings, Vietnamese
name: Pok Pok

text: After hearing how amazeballs this place was for years, I finally tried this place out in 2009 for a friend's birthday party. It was small, and the wait was ages even though we had a reservation. My dish came out way too spicy, and I asked for it medium. My lips were tingling non-stop, which felt cool at first, and then they turned numb and it felt similar to a trip to the dentist! hahaha. I'll give it another go sometime, but it's definitely not my first choice for Thai food in Portland.
categories: Restaurants, Asian Fusion, Pan Asian, Thai, Filipino, Chicken Wings, Vietnamese
name: Pok Pok

text: About 3.5 stars. Yummy, but I don't think I would stand in line for a long time for it. Everyone screams about the wings, but I think we're spoiled from California, where Thai, Korean, Chinese, Viet chicken wings are all the rage and there's much to choose from. These got a little syrupy for my husband after about the 3rd one. The boar collar dish was much more interesting and unique as we can't get that too often back home. I enjoyed the iced mustard greens a lot with all the spices. They brew their own thai iced tea, but I've had better at the houses of my thai friends. Certainly a good eatery, but for the lines, I don't know. Maybe my expectations were too high after all the hype!
categories: Restaurants, Asian Fusion, Pan Asian, Thai, Filipino, Chicken Wings, Vietnamese
name: Pok Pok

text:
Terrible.
My girlfriend and I were visiting Portland and this restaurant had popped up on the list of "best Portland food" because of their wings. So naturally, we had to try it.
We came in on a Monday evening, and apparently the wait was an hour for four people even though the hostess serving us was giving 15-20 minute wait times for other customers. My girlfriend and I decided to walk to Buffalo Exchange a mile away and my brother and sister-in-law stayed behind to wait for the table. When our table was ready, my brother and sister-in-law claimed it but the hostess was giving them a hard time because not everyone in the party was there, even though she didn't say "make sure everyone is here when the table is ready."
When we had sat down, we got our menus and my brother had already ordered the chicken wings (which were incredibly salty and average) and the skewers (which were also incredibly average and expensive).
When we had ordered the beef "salad," it came out and it was REALLY small for a $15 dish. We asked if the waiter could take it back because there was no way on Earth were we going to eat something like that, that's absurd. When we got the check, the waiter gave us a hard time and charged us for a jasmine rice bowl that we didn't even eat.
I don't think we'll ever come back since the food is expensive, it's not "family style," it tastes extremely average, and it isn't authentic Thai food.
Please save your money and try something elsewhere.
categories: Restaurants, Asian Fusion, Pan Asian, Thai, Filipino, Chicken Wings, Vietnamese
name: Pok Pok

text: We heard this is a must try place. The food was delicious,  but on the spicy side.  They served the free water with Pandan leaves. It tasted like coconut water.  We had papaya salad and fish sauce chicken wings for appetizers. Salad was spicy but good. The chicken wings were really good and flavorful. It's must have if you come here. I saw it on every table.  We also had khaki soi chicken and a wun san with shrimp and pork belly. Khaki soi chicken is curry soup noodle, we liked it a lot. But Wun San was ok. The clear noodles were too dry and not enough sauce.  Over all it's a good.  The service was good and the food came out fast.
categories: Restaurants, Asian Fusion, Pan Asian, Thai, Filipino, Chicken Wings, Vietnamese
name: Pok Pok

text:
The food at Pok Pok is as authentic and delicious as I could hope for. I LOVE Thai and Vietnamese food, and I am honestly in heaven when at Pok Pok.

Yes, Ike's Vietnamese Fish Sauce Wings are as good as everyone says, definitely try those. The Yam Makheua Yao (grilled eggplant) is also a delight - the eggplant was tender and succulent.

On my most recent visit, we tried one of the specials - Grilled Corn on the Cob with a coconut milk glaze. Who thought of that? They deserve an award. Seriously.
categories: Restaurants, Asian Fusion, Pan Asian, Thai, Filipino, Chicken Wings, Vietnamese
name: Pok Pok

text: Pok Pok is a great place to go and experience authentic Thai street food from Northern Thailand. Plus, the Vietnamese fish sauce wings are one of Pok Pok's best and most popular dishes. The Whiskey Soda Lounge serves more drinks and Thai happy hour food.
categories: Restaurants, Asian Fusion, Pan Asian, Thai, Filipino, Chicken Wings, Vietnamese
name: Pok Pok

text:
ME:  That was just a lovely dinner.  

MYSELF:  You mean, once we got in the door?

ME:  Now don't be cranky, we were warned about the wait.

MYSELF:  When I've been deprived of food for more than 60 minutes I'm allowed to be cranky.

ME:  But it was worth the wait, wasn't it?

I:  The food was delicious, and nicely spicy.  That papaya salad was amazing.  And the space was very interesting.

MYSELF:  We waited until almost closing time to be seated.  On a Tuesday.

ME:  You just dislike waiting.

I:  It was a bit long, even for really good food.

MYSELF:  And after all that, you wouldn't let me get the wings.

ME:  Now I really know why you're cranky.
categories: Restaurants, Asian Fusion, Pan Asian, Thai, Filipino, Chicken Wings, Vietnamese
name: Pok Pok

text: Best chicken wings I've ever had.  Got the spicy version which was very tasty and not too hot.  I also ordered the boar shoulder which was covered in garlic and chilies.  Great Bourbon selection haven't been many places that have four roses.  Prices are a bit steep at $14 a plate but the quality is worth it.
categories: Restaurants, Asian Fusion, Pan Asian, Thai, Filipino, Chicken Wings, Vietnamese
name: Pok Pok

text: Ordered a Vietnamese coffee here for $5. It's not worth it. Taste nothing like Vietnamese coffee way to milky and watered down no flavor. It even came out half filled shown in picture.
categories: Restaurants, Asian Fusion, Pan Asian, Thai, Filipino, Chicken Wings, Vietnamese
name: Pok Pok

text: Omg, truly the best wings I have ever had in my entire life! Soooo spicy and delicious, plus they are thoughtful enough to bring you a wet wipe to clean up after you go to town :) I also tried the mango alexander and loved it- perfect spring/summer cocktail. The papaya and pork salad was excellent as well, not too intense and a great blend of flavors. Worth the wait!!
categories: Restaurants, Asian Fusion, Pan Asian, Thai, Filipino, Chicken Wings, Vietnamese
name: Pok Pok

text:
Can I give you 10 stars?! Oh Pok Pok I dream of thee...why are you so far away from this California girl?! This is the #1 thing I always need to do when visiting my boyfriend's family in Portland. Always always worth the wait, we usually sit inside downstairs and love the cozy ambiance. So we have only been a few times but here are some of our favorites.
*#1 MUST MUST Try is the fish sauce wings and go spicy! I could eat these morning noon and night but I'd double my weight. Perfect for two to share if they're hungry and ordering a few other dishes. If you do not order these you will stare in vain as they walk by your seat and serve to everyone else.
*Kung Op Wun Sen - which is shrimp and pork belly over glass noodles. I have had many glass noodle dishes in my day but wow there is some great depth of flavor in that sauce! 
*Yam Makheua Yao - if you like smoky flavored eggplant than this is your dish! It gives you an intense (in a good way) smoke straight to your taste buds but then the egg, shrimp and fish sauce quickly take your taste buds to a whole other world. we really liked this dish, taste like nothing I've ever had before.
*Hoi Thawt - basically a omelet with mussels but this is one of my favorites too. Great flavor!

Enjoy!
categories: Restaurants, Asian Fusion, Pan Asian, Thai, Filipino, Chicken Wings, Vietnamese
name: Pok Pok

text:
THAI & VIETNAMESE FUSION at this outdoor tiki bar-like restaurant (although they offer indoor seating as well)

Pok Pok serves one of the TOP 2 WINGS i've had to date!!
---fish sauce wings: each wing comes w/ 3 segments.. crusty, STICKY, & flavorful like wings should be. definitely order them SPICY& pair them w/ a side of sticky rice!
---khao soi kai: curry noodle soup that's yummy! I also enjoyed eating the left over soup with our side of coconut rice. you can choose your meat but we opted for beef 
---Rotisserie hen. Nothing special but seems popular since they limited our ordering to a half hen instead of a whole due to limited quantities
---papaya salad. not as spicy as in Thailand but refreshing!

if you don't like plain water, you're in luck because they serve Pandan flavored water

NOTE:  Max of 3 credit cards per bill before they start charging a fee
categories: Restaurants, Asian Fusion, Pan Asian, Thai, Filipino, Chicken Wings, Vietnamese
name: Pok Pok

text:
Adding a review to the many, many reviews this place already has. 
AMAZING. SO GOOD. [Add a bunch of excited adjective about how good this place is.] 
A friend told me that Pok Pok was the best meal in his life. After eating the wings, I agreed with him. The wings are an experience. Get them. Get them. Get them. (!) 
Although I have been only once, I am pretty sure everything on the menu is excellent. 
It's a little pricey, with most things on the menu being in the $12 - $20 range. But man, it's worth it.
categories: Restaurants, Asian Fusion, Pan Asian, Thai, Filipino, Chicken Wings, Vietnamese
name: Pok Pok

text: I paid $18 for a bowl of almost no noodles and mostly curry sauce. Way overpriced. Food had no flavor until I added the hot peppers, which made it too oily to eat. Left the restaurant feeling poor and bloated. Would not recommend to anyone.
categories: Restaurants, Asian Fusion, Pan Asian, Thai, Filipino, Chicken Wings, Vietnamese
name: Pok Pok

text: While Pok Pok is decent, they are not the best Thai option in town.  I recommend kicking back at their own Whiskey Soda Lounge (WSL) across the street where you can enjoy excellent drinks and a sampling of what Pok Pok has to offer, namely their famous wings.  When your table is ready at Pok Pok, give it up and stay put at WSL.  Pok Pok main dining room has yet to impress me.
categories: Restaurants, Asian Fusion, Pan Asian, Thai, Filipino, Chicken Wings, Vietnamese
name: Pok Pok

text:
Way too salty. 

We ordered the "famous" chicken wings and some beef dish. I cannot even finished the wings because they are too salty. 

Really confused about the high rating and long wait line...I think this is my first Yelp review in many many years and I just wanted to say: DO NOT GO.
categories: Restaurants, Asian Fusion, Pan Asian, Thai, Filipino, Chicken Wings, Vietnamese
name: Pok Pok

text: We went here during a training day at the nearby Stumptown Coffee roasting building.  The food had great flavor and the drinking vinegars were an experience definitely worth trying!
categories: Restaurants, Asian Fusion, Pan Asian, Thai, Filipino, Chicken Wings, Vietnamese
name: Pok Pok

text:
Best Restaurant in Portland?  

Service was good.  Tables too close together.  

- Wings - WAY salty
- Rice and glass noodles - Too spicy but pretty decent.
- Flank Steak - dry.

The Hunny cocktail was really good as was the bamboo water served at the table.  I would not wait for a table for this food though.
categories: Restaurants, Asian Fusion, Pan Asian, Thai, Filipino, Chicken Wings, Vietnamese
name: Pok Pok

text:
Making a reservation here was a hassle.  They do NOT answer their phone; the automated answering system just refers you to their website.  So, if you are confused, or have a question, you are out of luck.  We made a reservation over their website, but something went wrong with the request, and our reservation did not go through.  We decided to risk going without a reservation, and showed up at 5pm on a Saturday.  To our surprise, they were able to seat our party of 6 within 5 minutes or so.

They have a good beer selection.  The cocktails are very good, but on the spendy side; $10 seems kinda steep for a gin and tonic.

The food is excellent.  I had the baby back ribs and sticky rice.  The ribs were very tender and flavorful.  The dipping sauces for the ribs were also excellent.  I'm not sure why they chose to cut the ribs into 1-inch pieces, rather than serving them whole, but perhaps that is the traditional preparation for the dish.  Portions weren't as large as I'm used to, but I got full, and didn't feel cheated.  Prices for food were perfectly reasonable.

The restrooms are inconveniently placed in the building; they are in a very high-traffic area for the waitstaff.  The servers constantly have to ask customers who are in line for the 2 single-person restrooms to get out of the way.

So, admin and technical issues notwithstanding, I enthusiastically recommend that you try PokPok out.  The food and drinks are delicious.  And you don't need to spend a huge amount of money on your meal, especially if you stick to beer.
categories: Restaurants, Asian Fusion, Pan Asian, Thai, Filipino, Chicken Wings, Vietnamese
name: Pok Pok

text: Ok yelpers, you have disappointed me again. I have never felt so emmbarassed after taking my friends out for lunch before. Thanks to pok pok, now i know what wasting money means.  I went here after reading so many good reviews about this place. My friends and I ordered Khao Soi, Stewed Pork in curry sauce, and papaya salad with gai yang chicken. Everything tasted mediorce. In fact, i can confidently say that I had better papaya salad with gai yang chicken and khao soi at some lunch carts in downtown portland. Thank god i did not order the chicken wings, or else i would have been pissed. Maybe the wings could have saved me from embarassement. But I can't afford something like that.
categories: Restaurants, Asian Fusion, Pan Asian, Thai, Filipino, Chicken Wings, Vietnamese
name: Pok Pok

text: It was awesome.  The service was excellent and our server helped us out by suggesting things and not being overbearing when we told him we had never been there.  The food was super fresh and in a great atmosphere (old house).  Who would have thought that you use screaming fresh ingredients paired in a simple manner and you come out with a winner!?  I am looking forward to trying other dishes here and understand now why Andy has the fame he does.  You should come eat here if you love Thai food but want to try something different other than the usual Thai offerings.  Careful though, this place is crazy busy early in the night.  I came at about 9pm and we got right in.
categories: Restaurants, Asian Fusion, Pan Asian, Thai, Filipino, Chicken Wings, Vietnamese
name: Pok Pok

text: Hands down the best wings ive tried anywhere. I have dreamt, traveled, and flown for these wings. Don't miss these!
categories: Restaurants, Asian Fusion, Pan Asian, Thai, Filipino, Chicken Wings, Vietnamese
name: Pok Pok

text:
So disappointed!
First, the dining room is so crowded (tables are way to close to each other) you may as well be dining with your neighbors.  
We ordered the namesake, pok pok,  it had very little flavor other than hot.  
Also ordered the brined bird.  It was ok, nothing special and they put the non edible "stuff" from the cavity of the bird on the plate as a garnish?!  Yuck!.
One other note to mention... the menu, may as well be written in Thai, I find that most Thai restaurants menus are little confusing until you get to know the foods you like, but this menu is SO over the top.
This place is way over-rated and the portion sizes are tiny, but you don't really care because you just want out...
The one thing I did love is the drinking vinegars.
categories: Restaurants, Asian Fusion, Pan Asian, Thai, Filipino, Chicken Wings, Vietnamese
name: Pok Pok

text:
I will start out by saying the fish sauce wings are DELICIOUS. 

But, 6 wings for $15 dollars?? I ordered two orders to go and was floored that i spent $30 for two appetizers. 

When I went with family for my birthday, I was not really impressed with anything other than the wings. Tip: Go to Whiskey Soda Lounge across the street and order wings from there to escape the crowds.
categories: Restaurants, Asian Fusion, Pan Asian, Thai, Filipino, Chicken Wings, Vietnamese
name: Pok Pok

text: Everyone raves about the wings but the roast chicken at SE Division location is the true winner that makes this place superb.
categories: Restaurants, Asian Fusion, Pan Asian, Thai, Filipino, Chicken Wings, Vietnamese
name: Pok Pok

text: You must like thai food and invest a few bucks to have a great meal but this is the real deal. Anyone that doesn't like Pok Pok doesn't like thai food. There are strong flavors of vinegars and fish sauce as well as spices you have probably never tried. Dive into an experience, there will be some things so good you will forget to share and some that you hate but that's because your palate might not be ready for reality. Try it you just might like it you will see... could you would you with some spice?
categories: Restaurants, Asian Fusion, Pan Asian, Thai, Filipino, Chicken Wings, Vietnamese
name: Pok Pok

text:
people that slag off this place are seriously just those super "authentico" types that feel like in order to have the most authentic and delicious (insert ethnic food here) grub if must come from a small shack in a secret hidden place only THEY know about.

So what that the head chef here is not from thailand, the place serves some of the most delicious and inspired thai food I've ever had. No more boring pad thai and simple curries. 

I've never been to thailand so I can't say whether it's "authentic" or not, but it's utterly to die for delicious,...so much so that anytime a friend of mine visits portland I IMMEDIATELY instruct them to come here. Especially for lunch for that killer caramelized pork. 

Ugh, i'm wishing I lived in portland again (a common occurrence)

don't listen to the bitter bitches who complain about this place, it's totally affordable and great.
categories: Restaurants, Asian Fusion, Pan Asian, Thai, Filipino, Chicken Wings, Vietnamese
name: Pok Pok

text:
So, so overrated! My friends and I were disappointed. Maybe because we're from LA and there are great thai resteraunts here but we all found the food bland. The chicken wings were not even that good! They tasted over-fried, overly sugared. Tasting kitchen in LA has the best chicken wings :) 
The whiskey soda lounge was not even that cool, although I do give them props for the house-made soda vinegars. The staff were not friendly or efficient, which made matters worse. I just don't get it!
categories: Restaurants, Asian Fusion, Pan Asian, Thai, Filipino, Chicken Wings, Vietnamese
name: Pok Pok

text: What can I say about this place that hasn't already been said.  Service is great.  Food is wonderful. The whole vibe is right on.  You just have to try it. It is so good. One of my favorite places ever!
categories: Restaurants, Asian Fusion, Pan Asian, Thai, Filipino, Chicken Wings, Vietnamese
name: Pok Pok

text: Wow! So good. Had to wait about 45 minutes, but it is a popular place on a Saturday night, so it was to be expected. We went to their satellite restaurant "whiskey and soda", across the street, and got a delicious drink. I highly recommend the "Khing and I" if you like a twist on a mule. Had a delicious dinner, the wings were hands down the best I have ever had, and are the most popular dish on the menu. We also got the house special chicken ,which was good, tasted like a slightly Thai version of a Costco rotisserie chicken. It was very good, but not amazing. We also got a prawns noodle dish that was very flavorful! Only thing i did not like was the water, they flavor their tap water with rice, which was a cool thing to do, but wasn't my favorite. Overall, I can't wait to go back!
categories: Restaurants, Asian Fusion, Pan Asian, Thai, Filipino, Chicken Wings, Vietnamese
name: Pok Pok

text:
The chicken wings had some heat to them as did some of the other dishes
Muu paa kham waan was interesting
The kaeng hung le was probably what the table found spicest 
sii khrong muu yaang was probable one of my favorites out of the bunch.

of all the dishes, I didn't really think " I would love to come back to order this again" but on the other hand nothing that i had that night was necessarily bad. 

the meats for the most part were neither over or undercooked--the part that seemed to have gotten me was the flavor profiles.

the servers were very helpful i determining portions and helped with selections as they were very well informed (instead of the usual "everything's good here")
categories: Restaurants, Asian Fusion, Pan Asian, Thai, Filipino, Chicken Wings, Vietnamese
name: Pok Pok

text:
Wings wings wings.... Everyone knows it. There's no secret about these wings. They are some of the best I have ever eaten and I eat wings all the time. 

The boar collar sauce was so flavorful, I could dunk the hole boar.
categories: Restaurants, Asian Fusion, Pan Asian, Thai, Filipino, Chicken Wings, Vietnamese
name: Pok Pok

text:
I think everyone should go here... well not really, I don't want it to be even busier than it already is. Damn this place is good. They have a mixture of vietnamese and thai, and it makes me smile just thinking that these flavors could be in my mouth all at one time!!!

chicken wings, and bean thread noodles and yumminess all at one time! ahhhhhhh portland you are so lucky!!!!!!
categories: Restaurants, Asian Fusion, Pan Asian, Thai, Filipino, Chicken Wings, Vietnamese
name: Pok Pok

text:
I had heard a lot about Pok Pok and decided to go there with a group of friends. 

It's a very busy place, and is you have to wait for seating, they will send you to a separate bar across the street for a cocktail. 

I love Thai food, and this place was quite a bit different that what I'm used to, but different in a good way. It's not your typical thai fare. It's a much more "high end" style of thai food. It's like comparing to a top notch steak house to Elmer's. 

The food is very good. We tried all kinds of dishes, but our favorite by far was the chicken wings! They were divine! 

So if you're looking for more than the typical pad thai, then Pok Pok is worth the trip.
categories: Restaurants, Asian Fusion, Pan Asian, Thai, Filipino, Chicken Wings, Vietnamese
name: Pok Pok

text:
Absolutely delicious. 

In a world of every Thai restaurant basically offering the same exact menu and nearly the exact same eats, Pok Pok is a breath of fresh air. At most Thai restaurants, you know exactly what to expect. Here at Pok Pok, you're guaranteed to be treated to some tastes that you probably haven't had before.

The food itself isn't exactly just Thai. There's lots of other influences there as well, such as Laos and Vietnamese. But it all comes together so well that you kinda just forget what kind of food you're eaten and just enjoy the food for what it is. Only the best restaurants seem to have that level of appeal, and Pok Pok is right up there with the best.

You gotta have the Fish Sauce Wings here. It's their signature dish for a reason. This is where it gets hard to review food for me, because the taste was so unique that it's almost impossible to describe. The flavor comes at you from almost every angle with these wings. They're sweet and savory and spicy and bitter and sour all at the same time. I don't know how they managed that level of culinary perfection, but mark me a believer in these wings. 

We also ordered the Neua Naam Tok which is pretty much a spicy steak salad with fish sauce. They warn of an intense spice here but even my delicate tongue was able to easily handle it. Lastly we ordered the Muu Paa Kham Waan, and the boar meat just seemed to melt in your mouth. So damn good. My mouth is honestly watering just from writing these past few sentences.

Really my only complaint about the meal is something that these guys have no control over. I wasn't a fan of the Beer Lao. Really did not have a good taste to it at all. I basically just ordered it to say I've tried it, and it'll honestly be the first and last time I ever order it. Not good beer at all.

Service was very attentive and nice and we were able to be seated pretty quickly. Price wasn't bad at all either, especially with the high quality of food we were served. Definitely my favorite meal from Portland, and I'm glad I was able to eat here.
categories: Restaurants, Asian Fusion, Pan Asian, Thai, Filipino, Chicken Wings, Vietnamese
name: Pok Pok

text: I'm not sure what to say that hasn't already been said.  Our meal was great and, although, we didn't venture from the waiters (and many of the reviewers) recommendations, we enjoyed every morsel!!  We had the wings, the Papaya Pok Pok with shredded pork and coconut rice, and the hen with sticky rice.  I also tried a pineapple drinking vinegar (I'd never even heard of them until this adventure) and that was good, not too sweet, but refreshing and cool against the hot of our wings.  My husband and I both have had Thai food many times, but this was a new experience and lots of new tastes! To get there we had to get a loner car and navigate our way across Portland (there are a few screwy roads and highways!), while our car was being serviced on the last day of a road trip.  I'm so glad we had to have our car serviced in Portland, It was well worth the grief of getting the loner to enjoy new food and drink!
categories: Restaurants, Asian Fusion, Pan Asian, Thai, Filipino, Chicken Wings, Vietnamese
name: Pok Pok

text: Don't be fooled just because they treat you like they're too good for you and give you food that tastes different doesn't make it better.
categories: Restaurants, Asian Fusion, Pan Asian, Thai, Filipino, Chicken Wings, Vietnamese
name: Pok Pok

text: Pretty good stuff! They had a deep fried whole tilapia on special which was AMAZING! It was served on a bed of tomato chilli sauce and it tasted similar to chicken wings. I liked having to pick through the fish to find morsels of meaty treasure. We also had two salads which tasted fresh and had a complex flavour. Would not get the papaya pok pok next time though, it was our least favourite of the two. The catfish dish on vermicelli noodles was solid and would order that again. The spice level on the food was on point! Bold, yet bearable. Would return. I hope they put the tilapia on their regular menu. Yummmm.
categories: Restaurants, Asian Fusion, Pan Asian, Thai, Filipino, Chicken Wings, Vietnamese
name: Pok Pok

text: I'm a big Pok Pok fan.  The lines can be a little crazy, but the staff are experts at making you feel at home. This is the restaurant that introduced so many of us to real Thai food, and it hasn't lost a step, even after many years and several expansions. Pok Pok deserves its reputation.
categories: Restaurants, Asian Fusion, Pan Asian, Thai, Filipino, Chicken Wings, Vietnamese
name: Pok Pok

text:
We were travelling last month and actually went here on the way down to California AND on the way back up, so clearly it was amazing food!

Loved the chicken wings (pretty sure they were thighs but not complaining!), the papaya salad, the boar...such interesting and flavourful food, what a unique experience.  I love the thai food I get normally but so refreshing to have something new and different!

the CONs - on the way down we sat inside - it is LOUD in there, and tiny, and we really felt crammed and uncomfortable.  The staff were also less than attentive, and it was not busy at the time of day we came in.  They were nice, just not around as much as I would have liked for water, or maybe ordering another menu item or two that I had my eye on!

We had 2 kids with us, who are great in restaurants and adventurous eaters, but maybe they were put off by them, as this doesn't really seem like it's meant to be a kid friendly place.  This may be a PRO for many of you :)

On the way back up, we ordered from the takeout window - they were awesome, friendly and AMAZINGLY fast - it was slammed busy when we arrived and the food was ready in probably 7 minutes.

All in all, delicious, different and not to be missed.
categories: Restaurants, Asian Fusion, Pan Asian, Thai, Filipino, Chicken Wings, Vietnamese
name: Pok Pok

text:
Get the wings.  I don't care if you do not like chicken, hate wings or are a vegetarian.  If you are going to go to Pok Pok you have to get the wings.  These things are absolutely out of this world.  Just amazing.  Get them.  You should probably stop reading and do it now.

We have eaten Pok Pok a few times.  Though we have only eaten in the restaurant once.   As everyone has mentioned, the wings are absolutely amazing.  They balance sweet and spice in ways that I did not even know were possible.  But do not be fooled and order the 'spicy' variety of wings.  The house version balances everything perfectly.  The spicy version is good.  In fact, they are very good.  But they are not the best wings you have ever had.  That honor goes to the regular Pok Pok fish sauce wings.  As soon as you try them.

The Boar Collar is another dish that should not be missed here.  When it first came out I was initially disappointed in the serving size.  However, this little dish packs a whole whallop of flavor.  Mix it with some good sticky rice and you are good to go.

The only dish that I did not really care for was the Pok Pok salad.  I just could not taste any flavor through the dense layer of spice.

Pok Pok also makes a mean cocktail.  They have, hands down, the best whiskey sour I have ever had the pleasure of enjoying.  Their whiskey selection is impressive to say the least.   They also have a variety of drinking vinegars for those that do not drink or may happen to be pregnant.  These drinks are so good they almost make up for one not being able to drink alcohol and, therefore, those delicious whiskey sours.  I have never actually seen or heard of drinking vinegars in any other venue.  They were an absolute delight and come highly recommended.

There is really only one thing holding Pok Pok back from getting a 5 star rating.  And that is the wait.  The wait here on a weekend is legendary and absolutely terrible.  Kudos to them for opening the Whiskey Soda Lounge to hold the masses while they are waiting 1 hour + for their table.  But, last time I was in there I realized that the Soda Lounge has all of the best parts of Pok Pok - WITH OUT THE WAIT!  They have the epic wings, full whiskey selection and drinking vinegars.  And, really, i do not need anything else.

One final note - Pok Pok does have a to go window.  You can get your wings on the road in under 10 minutes.  But be careful.  You may find yourself driving around town sucking down chicken bones because you could not wait.
categories: Restaurants, Asian Fusion, Pan Asian, Thai, Filipino, Chicken Wings, Vietnamese
name: Pok Pok

text: My favorite place to go for lunch when we go to Portland.    The chicken wings and vinegar waters are fantastic!    If you have never been, go!!!
categories: Restaurants, Asian Fusion, Pan Asian, Thai, Filipino, Chicken Wings, Vietnamese
name: Pok Pok

text:
SO MUCH HYPE but Pok Pok definitely exceeded my expectations.

Unfortunately, a 2 hour wait was far too long for me and my friends so we opted to order to-go and found a random outdoor table down the street where we devoured our meal in the cold December air! 

Where to begin...those Fish Sauce Wingssssssss!!! Sticky, spicy, savory, perfectly cooked wings. I wish I had some more with me right now. SO. GOOD. A definite must if you find yourself at Pok Pok. 

Other highlights of our meal included the Boar Collar (that spicy chili/lime/garlic sauce was pure heaven), Papaya Salad (great balance between tart and spice), and the Northern Thai Curry with Chicken (coconut flavor was not overpowering)! The Thai Iced Tea also hit the spot, despite being cold enough to cause all of us the shiver as we ate outside.

I'll have to make it to the NY location of Pok Pok so I can get my hands dirty with those wings again. Sigh, I could just eat them and some fluffy rice and be completely content with my life. Believe all the other reviews and try those wings for yourself! Or not because then there will be more for me ;)
categories: Restaurants, Asian Fusion, Pan Asian, Thai, Filipino, Chicken Wings, Vietnamese
name: Pok Pok

text:
It was not busy when I came here for dinner with some friends so we were seated right away.

We ordered the Kai Yaang (roasted game hen), Ike's wings (duh), Kaeng Hang Leh (pork belly and shoulder curry) and Sunny's Yam Wun Sen (spicy and sour glass noodle salad), as well as an order of sticky rice and jasmine rice.

The wings had great flavour (maybe a bit too much fish sauce). The game hen was probably the weakest dish, really nothing special there. The curry was excellent but there sure isn't a lot of meat in that dish. A surprise hit was the noodle salad, which my friend did not expect to impress her as much as it did.

I was really thrown off by the water, which is flavoured with Pandanus leaves. Not my favourite.
categories: Restaurants, Asian Fusion, Pan Asian, Thai, Filipino, Chicken Wings, Vietnamese
name: Pok Pok

text: Just read the other reviews. Ike's wings and hot twat are the best.
categories: Restaurants, Asian Fusion, Pan Asian, Thai, Filipino, Chicken Wings, Vietnamese
name: Pok Pok

text:
Last summer the owner of a restaurant in Tupelo, MS we stopped told us we must come here when we got to Portland.  We didn't make it last year but tonight since we were in town thought we would come by since EVERYONE raves about this place.  

So we sit down i order salted plum Collins and they were out.  Ordered  a hunny which was ok and a couple vinegars again another which they were out of.  

Fish wings were just ok honestly - seriously nothing special and they were dry.  The picked veggies were limp. My hubs ordered chicken special and i the boar collar.  His chicken comes out cold and obviously left over.  We NEVER send food back but we wanted to give the benefit of doubt here and did.  Server brought back out few minutes later to say she watched him take this out and check temp.  This is where they lose cred - this chicken was like warm and the skin was soggy and obviously reheated chicken.  She may have seen him pull left over chicken but this was absolutely not a fresh dish.  

The boar collar was tasty and super hot but you get a nice plate of mustard greens on ice to help.  Also ordered sticky rice which was the driest hardest sticky rice I've ever had - again i think microwaved in a bag.  I love sticky rice - have had it many many places and again just disappointing.

$85 basically for a terrible dinner overall.  Maybe this is an off night but based on this i won't be back.
categories: Restaurants, Asian Fusion, Pan Asian, Thai, Filipino, Chicken Wings, Vietnamese
name: Pok Pok

text: I visited this place while coming to Portland for the Dragon boat race. We had a large group of about 25 people and we got the private room patio which was awesome. The food was spicy, and different. There where dishes that tasted better at the food trucks in Portland like the Pad See Ew but other dishes looked and tasted good like the chicken wings.
categories: Restaurants, Asian Fusion, Pan Asian, Thai, Filipino, Chicken Wings, Vietnamese
name: Pok Pok

text:
A big old MEH from this diner. 

I was very excited to go here, and perhaps we came on an off-night...but I was not impressed at all.  Is it different than any other Thai restaurant I've been to?  Yes.  Does that make it good.  No. 

We had to send our BBQ'ed Prawns back 3 times, and finally just gave-up because they had been overly cooked or were just horrible, they were all mushy. 

The signature dish Full BBQ chicken was decent, but again, had somewhat frighteningly undercooked pieces in it, and was rather flavorless.  

Their chicken stay was WAY overcooked and the sauces pedestrian. 

Service was good, drinks were good.  

Would not recommend nor return.
categories: Restaurants, Asian Fusion, Pan Asian, Thai, Filipino, Chicken Wings, Vietnamese
name: Pok Pok

text: Bleck. Worst food I have had in a LONG time in Portland (actually really anywhere). Granted we did not order their most praised items so maybe it was our fault - but really you should have better food than just wings...if you're going to go there just stick to their most known items otherwise you are going to be severely disappointed.
categories: Restaurants, Asian Fusion, Pan Asian, Thai, Filipino, Chicken Wings, Vietnamese
name: Pok Pok

text: I just moved to Portland, and everyone was telling me how I had to go check this restaurant out because it was supposed to be so incredible. I was beyond disappointed with my experience there. Not only did we have a ridiculously long wait (over an hour), the service was slow, the proportions were tiny, and the food was way overpriced. My friend and I were so bummed, and still starving by the time it was all over, that we ended up going somewhere else afterwards to get some real food. Needless to say I'm not going to recommend this place to people in the future, and I'm definitely not going to waste my time or money there again.
categories: Restaurants, Asian Fusion, Pan Asian, Thai, Filipino, Chicken Wings, Vietnamese
name: Pok Pok

text:
Over-hyped and over-priced. 
$18 for a catfish "salad" and you can't even throw in a free bowl of rice with it. 
The Khao Sai was bland af. 
And is that a menu or a fucking essay sheesh!
Go to your local Thai place instead for better tasting food (and get your money's worth).
categories: Restaurants, Asian Fusion, Pan Asian, Thai, Filipino, Chicken Wings, Vietnamese
name: Pok Pok

text:
Of all the things I needed to do in Portland, besides Voodoo Donuts, my Oregonian friend, told me I had to come to this place. We got here around 8:45 PM and was told that the wait was going to be two hours. Two hours! I've never had to wait that long for food, but since I was in Oregon and this place is highly reviewed, I decided to suck it up and wait. The nice thing was that they have a sister lounge across the street that you can hang out at while you wait. After much discussion about what we wanted to do for two hours, we ended up at Whiskey Soda Lounge. 

At WSL you can actually order some of the menu items from pok pok. We got some drinks and ordered their famous fish sauce wings. When the wings came out, I couldn't help but dig in. They are like heaven on a bone. It was so nice that WSL serves this dish because it was a nice thing to enjoy before you get to eat at Pok pok. The wings were in this amazing sauce that is sweet and spicy. There is this crunch bits in the sauce that give the wings a nice crunch. These wings are like everyone says, purely AMAZING! 

So after we devoured our wings, and emptied our drinks, waited for a another hour, the waitress at WSL told us that they were ready for us at pok pok. We were finally seated at pok pok at 10:30 PM. This has been the longest I've ever waited for food, but It was very much worth it. Once we were seated my boyfriend and I, noobs to Portland and pok pok, didn't know what to order, also, the menu is a bit overwhelming because the dishes are in thai and you have to read the descriptions of the food to know what you are ordering. My friend who lives in OR ordered what he knew was good. If you have a friend in OR, then have them help you because it can get overwhelming. The wings were very filling and BIG, so we only ordered two dishes and a side of sticky rice. We got the Neua Naam Tok and Muu Paa Kham Waan. The Neua Naam Tok was this flank steak salad that was amazing. It was in seasonings with fish sauce. The meat was perfectly seasoned and super tender and juicy. The Muu Paa kham Waa was very good. I don't like spicy food, and this dish is very spicy, but I enjoyed it tremendously. The flavors complement very well!

Two hours of wait time is totally worth the amazingness that is pok pok! I hate waiting for food (and that is why i give it a 4), but this was very much worth it and I can't wait to come back to try more things. This place has a wait for a reason, it is, THAT good!
categories: Restaurants, Asian Fusion, Pan Asian, Thai, Filipino, Chicken Wings, Vietnamese
name: Pok Pok

text: Great atmosphere,delicious food and they have the best drink that I've ever had. I can't remember what it was called but It was a coconut mango drink. Friendly staff and reasonable prices.
categories: Restaurants, Asian Fusion, Pan Asian, Thai, Filipino, Chicken Wings, Vietnamese
name: Pok Pok

text:
My boyfriend and I were visiting Portland so of course we had to try Pok Pok, as so many friends had raved about their wings. We got there relatively early for a Saturday night, around 5:15 and there was already a line. We had to wait for about an hour but we headed over to the oyster bar across the street for happy hour (half off oysters!). It went by quickly and we were seated around 6:30. 

We ordered the wings and the cat fish noodle salad. Nothing particularly special about the salad, the noodles had a bit of a strange texture but the flavor was decent. I also got their Bloody Mary that was really really good. It has a very different albeit unique flavor than what you're typically used to because they used different Thai seasonings and spices - so yummy. Also disclaimer: I am usually not one to jump on the bandwagon when everyone is raving about some new food place (not that Pok Pok is that new anymore) but damn, my boyfriend and I really liked their wings. Like so much that we ordered another one to go. It was kind of ridiculous how much they cost, $15 for 6 wings and it's considered an appetizer but I seriously can't stop thinking about how yummy they were. I know some people said they were kinda salty and I could see why they thought that but the flavor was just so spot on that I didn't really think it was a problem. Plus I prefer my food to be a little saltier than too bland. Anyways, only tried those two food items so can't say much for the rest of the menu but I would definitely recommend the wings!
categories: Restaurants, Asian Fusion, Pan Asian, Thai, Filipino, Chicken Wings, Vietnamese
name: Pok Pok

text: Appetizer sized portions with entree pricing. Food was ok but really nothing special.. there are many Thai restaurants with better food and larger portions for less money. If you like to impress your friends and look cool then this is your place, but if you're looking for a good Thai place, there are better choices.
categories: Restaurants, Asian Fusion, Pan Asian, Thai, Filipino, Chicken Wings, Vietnamese
name: Pok Pok

text: This is the place to go for delicious spicy Thai food.  The chicken wings are all the rage.  My favorite dish, at lunch, was roasted pork, pork belly with sticky rice and greens.  Service was spot on and more than one server was able to describe and recommend dishes from the menu.  This is now on my must eat list for Portland.
categories: Restaurants, Asian Fusion, Pan Asian, Thai, Filipino, Chicken Wings, Vietnamese
name: Pok Pok

text: I'll be dreaming about this food for a long time. It's the best Thai food I've had outside of Thailand. Everything tastes fresh and the flavors and textures are complex. I only had the vegetarian dishes but friends who had the wings and a prawn-pork clay pot were also really pleased (especially with the prawn dish).  I could surely eat this food every night. The service was great, and the place is cute and comfortable. We were a little scared of trying to get a table for 4 on a Friday night, given all the high-profile reviews of this place (e.g. Saveur last month), but we only had a 10 minute wait. All good.
categories: Restaurants, Asian Fusion, Pan Asian, Thai, Filipino, Chicken Wings, Vietnamese
name: Pok Pok

text: This place has 815 reviews right now, so I'm not sure what I can add to it, except that we had a great meal here.  We had the veggie dishes: curry noodles (good, not too salty and nice texture), green papaya salad (the best we've ever had) and the mushroom salad (oh...my...God...SO good).  And the best part?  Nothing had a trace of fish sauce.  That's our biggest gripe about Thai restaurants - even when we ask, and they insist, that there is no fish sauce in a particular dish or that they are leaving it out for us, some always sneaks it's way into our food.  Being vegetarian, if we detect this we won't go back.  But we'll go back to Pok Pok, gladly!
categories: Restaurants, Asian Fusion, Pan Asian, Thai, Filipino, Chicken Wings, Vietnamese
name: Pok Pok

text:
I've given Pok Pok 2 try's, and I am just not a fan. 
The service is good.
The drinks are fairly unique and tasty.
The food is totally over hyped in my opinion. I find the dishes to be overly spiced, and the frog soup was nearly in edible. There was some sort of spice that resembled and had the texture of a twig, and besides the frog legs that were greasy with vey little meat, the onions were about the only thing that seemed digestible.
categories: Restaurants, Asian Fusion, Pan Asian, Thai, Filipino, Chicken Wings, Vietnamese
name: Pok Pok

text: After being seated in a strange place and promised that my server would be with me in a moment, I then waited 10 minutes without seeing anyone.  I started wandering around, looking for answers, found someone else, who seated me again, in a place where there were actually people dining and being served.  They only charged me $5 for my meal, which made the experience acceptable.  This place has ok food, but it is vastly overpriced and under-portioned, and their staff is poorly trained.  I did enjoy the wings.
categories: Restaurants, Asian Fusion, Pan Asian, Thai, Filipino, Chicken Wings, Vietnamese
name: Pok Pok

text:
I've been waiting a few years to try the "best Thai food in Portland" and was not impressed with Pok Pok at all.  My boyfriend and I can't believe we waited over an hour to sit in a cramped little corner in what felt like a garage, at a card table with uncomfortable folding chairs with an electric heater burning the tops of our heads. But honestly, if the food would have knocked our socks off like I thought it was going to, the atmosphere wouldn't have mattered. 

Service was mediocre at best.  Our server, though friendly enough, nearly forgot we were there as he focused all his attention on a larger party. The menu had more pork dishes than anything else.  Definitely not enough variety for those that don't eat pig.  Maybe pork is a staple in Northern Thailand, but in Portland it would be nice to see more seafood and vegetarian dishes on the menu. The few choices we were left with just weren't that good.   Small portions and large prices. They charge for steamed rice.  Really?!  And for soda refills. Are you kidding me? Our rice noodle/catfish dish was overcooked and oily, and the lemongrass stuffed cornish hen was flavorless.  We left disappointed and probably won't be back.  There are many other Thai restaurants in Portland that offer a better atmosphere and value.  This place is overrated.
categories: Restaurants, Asian Fusion, Pan Asian, Thai, Filipino, Chicken Wings, Vietnamese
name: Pok Pok

text:
you go to Pok Pok for one thing and one thing only....and that's the chicken wings. Everything else on the menu is delicious, but once you've had the chicken wings and moved on to some other dish, you'll wish you'd known what you now know and that you'd ordered several more plates of wings!

If you have to put your name down for a table, consider an ice cream appetizer at Salt and Straw down the street. 

Otherwise, you'll enjoy everything on Pok Pok's menu as long as you're not a picky eater. 

visit our food website to check out photos of the wings and some of the other dishes we ordered. 

http://eatsporkjew.com/recipes/dinner/pok-pok-portland/
categories: Restaurants, Asian Fusion, Pan Asian, Thai, Filipino, Chicken Wings, Vietnamese
name: Pok Pok

text:
It was pouring rain last week. Somehow rain did not deter me from trekking out to Pok Pok to try their food.
I'm glad I did.

The best thing I ate at Pok Pok were:
Pok Pok's house wings - hot and fresh from the kitchen. These wings have an amazing depth of flavor with savory and a hint of sweet. These wings are plump, juicy and a bit of a mess. Awesome wings!

Strangely enough, the other item I liked best was the ice cream sandwich dessert ($7). In a brioche bun that looked like a lobster roll bun, three tiny scoops of coconut ice cream lie atop some jackfruit shavings along with a sprinkling of peanuts. The slight savoriness of the bun and the delicate coconut tasting ice cream was wonderful.

A miss were:
Ribs with dipping sauce ($14). Nothing particularly out of the ordinary about these Asian-style riblets - except there was a small portion and the ribs were cut up in pieces.

Curry noodle soup ( Khao soi) was meh. The soup was lukewarm and there were that many noodles. For our choice of meat, we chose chicken and got a drumstick and a thigh thrown in as if we were eating at a tribal meal in Thailand - sort of rough looking meat.

Obviously there are probably items we'll have to come back and try. But I found Pok Pok to be fun - the shackiness of the surroundings was very different and the Division/Clinton area is up-and-coming for sure.
categories: Restaurants, Asian Fusion, Pan Asian, Thai, Filipino, Chicken Wings, Vietnamese
name: Pok Pok

text:
I came here in a party of three and ordered four dishes: Kung op wun seng (rice vermicelli in clay pot), Pet pha lo (duck leg stew), Kaeng hung leh (pork belly/shoulder curry), and Muu paa kham waan (boar collar). Although we can't comment too much on the authenticity of the food, our experience was spoiled by several factors:

1. We asked for a bottled beer (the Full Sail lager from Mt. Hood), and when it was brought to us we noticed it had expired almost two months ago. We demanded for another one in exchange and were brought another one, but it was not a good start for us.

2. The duck leg stew we ordered supposedly came with a duck egg, but we are pretty certain that the one we had was a regular chicken egg, and it was pretty bland and tasteless to boot.

3. This isn't a major thing as this happens everywhere, but the serving sizes are a bit on the small size for the money. 

Of the four items we ordered, we only really enjoyed the boar collar. Even though it's a bit expensive for the small serving size, the meat is jam-packed with flavor that I had expected from Pok Pok. The other three dishes were quite meh and were not the same as the sweet, sour, and spicy that we expected with Thai food (we've been to Bangkok before) and were a bit on the salty side. It could be that we simply did not order the right dishes, but we were not impressed with our trip to Pok Pok.
categories: Restaurants, Asian Fusion, Pan Asian, Thai, Filipino, Chicken Wings, Vietnamese
name: Pok Pok

text: Flavor explosions every time I'm here! Portland is a culinary Mecca and there are a few places that put Portland on the map for food. Pok Pok is one of them. When I'm in the mood for a ton of flavor and great food, this is one of my go to places. The wings are always incredible. The papaya salad is one of my favorites. Actually, when I think about it, I haven't had anything that wasn't one of my favorites! Pok Pok always has my vote!!!
categories: Restaurants, Asian Fusion, Pan Asian, Thai, Filipino, Chicken Wings, Vietnamese
name: Pok Pok

text:
Came on a Saturday evening. Ordered the wings,  pok pok special and boar collar. The chicken was flavorful, papaya salad had a bit of a kick. Sticky rice was a little dry, maybe because it was served in a plastic bag instead of in the bamboo basket (What's the point of bagging it and then putting in the box afterwards anyways?)  Wings were good, but if you've had korean fried chicken like bonchon or kyochon, it won't knock your socks off. Boar collar was the star entree, would definitely recommend. Brings the heat, order a beer to cool you off in between bites 

The place is set up like an asian style drinking tent, it has a kind of gaudy, cheap feel to it. I'm not knocking it, it does a lot for the atmosphere, but it probably does get colder in the wintertime. Overall, pretty good food for the price. The wait can be long, so if you want just wings try the whiskey soda lounge across the street.
categories: Restaurants, Asian Fusion, Pan Asian, Thai, Filipino, Chicken Wings, Vietnamese
name: Pok Pok

text: The closest to authentic Thai food I've had in the US! And I've spent a lot of time in Thailand!
categories: Restaurants, Asian Fusion, Pan Asian, Thai, Filipino, Chicken Wings, Vietnamese
name: Pok Pok

text:
I feel kinda bad giving this place a 3 cuz if it weren't for the hype and the wait and perhaps the price, I would have given it a 4 star rating.

Onto the review...

I always feel kinda funny eating at ethnocentric food establishments run by white folks (I shouldn't have judgements but I can't help it.) That said, the food itself is pretty good. The overly hyped wings were way too salty though. The other two mains we ordered tasted ok albeit a tad small. Nothing particularly memorable (I'm writing this a year after we ate here so I don't recall the exact items we ate.) 

Service was pretty good, although for a rickety-shack divey atmosphere with bustling servers moving about in cramped quarters, the prices seem out of line. 

But from a strictly flavor standpoint, the food is pretty good (but nowhere near the title of Best Thai in Portand, much less the U.S....let's not insult the mom and pop Thai restaurants that do an awesome job of pumping out excellent Thai food)

sidenote: those super expensive "drinking vinegars" you see sold at Pok Pok and the Whiskey Soda Lounge? Try the bottles of Korean hongcho concentrate at Asian markets around town. Same, if not better flavor for a fraction of the price.
categories: Restaurants, Asian Fusion, Pan Asian, Thai, Filipino, Chicken Wings, Vietnamese
name: Pok Pok

text: Get the wings and the papaya salad.  It cost us $22/person with eight in our party for everything - if you like that price range, then it's a good spot to go to
categories: Restaurants, Asian Fusion, Pan Asian, Thai, Filipino, Chicken Wings, Vietnamese
name: Pok Pok

text: On a visit from Seattle we were bound to try all of the "it's so popular you wait in line for 2 hours" restaurants. Pok Pok was no exception. Drinks at the Whiskey Soda Lounge across the street were a must. Once seated - the food was very good but the service was really bad. I think we saw our waiter once during the entire meal. It's hard to give a good rating to a place with bad service but I guess the menu and prices made up for it in the end. The flank steak salad, the green papaya salad, and the pork belly were delish! The Hunny cocktail was amazing!
categories: Restaurants, Asian Fusion, Pan Asian, Thai, Filipino, Chicken Wings, Vietnamese
name: Pok Pok

text:
Very good but expensive.

Portions are on the small side.

My favorite was the pork belly.

Also very spicy.
categories: Restaurants, Asian Fusion, Pan Asian, Thai, Filipino, Chicken Wings, Vietnamese
name: Pok Pok
