Pok Pok has an amazing variety that you don't get to see often where I live, and mixed together at that! For Portland, it's on the pricier side but on par with what I would pay here for the quality of food. I have a "to-do" list for my next trip down; let's see how much I can get through.
categories: Restaurants, Asian Fusion, Pan Asian, Thai, Filipino, Chicken Wings, Vietnamese
name: Pok Pok

text: Not worth the hype. 15$ for wings!? Nah fam that's a hard pass. They weren't even that good. I've had better fish wings. The line was ridiculous. The wait was crazy and the food was mediocre at best.
categories: Restaurants, Asian Fusion, Pan Asian, Thai, Filipino, Chicken Wings, Vietnamese
name: Pok Pok

text:
Came here during the July 4th weekend and it was absolutely packed. Wait for a party of four would have been 3 hours so we decided to get togo. 

The ike's vietnamese fish sauce wings are probably the thing they are best known for. It's similar to like korean fried chicken, but with a heavy dose of fish sauce that makes it even more salty. I personally like salty, but mots of my friends felt like it was too salty. 

The papaya pok pok is very spicy, so much so that my gf who loves spicy also had trouble eating it. 

The baby back ribs that we ordered never came. Instead we got some noodle dish that had some pork and shrimp instead. We were craving more meat and received more carbs. This was a HUGE disappointment. 

There isn't any seating nearby for togo. Your best bet is to eat near the benches at Salt & Straw. 

I feel like this place is overrated, but if you enjoy chicken wings then just the wings are worth a try.
categories: Restaurants, Asian Fusion, Pan Asian, Thai, Filipino, Chicken Wings, Vietnamese
name: Pok Pok

text: We went to the SW Barbur location.  We had to walk out. The smells were so bad    Like a chicken death place.  Never will go there.
categories: Restaurants, Asian Fusion, Pan Asian, Thai, Filipino, Chicken Wings, Vietnamese
name: Pok Pok

text:
People love Pok Pok and I am people. The food was really good, although the line was hella long. Waiting an hour and a half would have been really hard had ice cream not been so close.

We got the wings, which were pretty effing delicious. I inhaled those at an embarrassing rate. We also split the Kung Op Wun Sen, which had prawns and noodles on a bed of pork belly which was just. Perfection. So good. The prawns had this nice flavor, the noodles had the tastes of prawn and pork belly, and the pork belly was this oily goodness chilling at the bottom. It was really good.

They also had corn with coconut cream and butter, and despite my inebriation and food drunken-ness, I still managed to eat pretty cleanly. I was very proud of myself. And very full. Very, very full.
categories: Restaurants, Asian Fusion, Pan Asian, Thai, Filipino, Chicken Wings, Vietnamese
name: Pok Pok

text: My wife and I had friends visit from Vegas and we allowed them to pick famous restaurants from Portland to eat at. We ordered some drinks and all sat at the bar. My wife and I spilt the fish sauce chicken wings and the Muu Paa Kham Waan which was a little too spicy but very delicious! Highly suggest everyone to step outside their comfort zone and try some food that you normal wouldn't.
categories: Restaurants, Asian Fusion, Pan Asian, Thai, Filipino, Chicken Wings, Vietnamese
name: Pok Pok

text:
While I didn't have to wait too long for a table at Pok Pok (15 minutes on a Thurs night), I still thought Pok Pok was a solid 3 star place. 

FOOD
Kaeng Hang Leh - This tastes just like my aunt's pork belly dish.  As a kid, this was one of the dishes I most looked forward to having whenever I visited Taiwan.  At Pok Pok, you get a decent sized bowl filled less than halfway with delicious, dark brown, sweet sauce and then 5 pieces of very tender pork belly. It tasted just as good as my aunt's dish, but the main difference is that while hers would have mounds of meat, you only get 5 pieces here.  

Kung Op Wun Sen - Clay pot filled with bean thread noodles, thin slices of pork belly, and shrimp with the shell still on them. This tasted exactly as you'd expect from the description.  I'm not a huge fan of shelling shrimp.


AMBIANCE
The food is served on these steel plates that make these "nails-on-a-chalkboard" screeching sounds with the cutlery, and the lack of ventilation inside the main dining area means your hair will pick up all the smells inside the restaurant.


If you're close by Pok Pok and there's not much of a line, I would check it out. Otherwise, I don't think you should go out of your way to come here.
categories: Restaurants, Asian Fusion, Pan Asian, Thai, Filipino, Chicken Wings, Vietnamese
name: Pok Pok

text: Still my favorite place. Love the wings. The boar collar is amazing. Wash it down with a whiskey sour!
categories: Restaurants, Asian Fusion, Pan Asian, Thai, Filipino, Chicken Wings, Vietnamese
name: Pok Pok

text:
This is NOT your average Pad Thai and yellow curry establishment so if that's the taste youre looking for, go someplace else. Pok Pok specializes in Northern real local flavors of Thailand. 

The SE Portland location is tiny yes, but please realize it's the original location and before Pok Pok became a national celebrity it's was an even smaller food cart essentially - so enjoy the experience! For you out of towners, I do appologize if you've never experienced what is known as a Hipster because the waitstaff is nothing but. Please don't let their lack of customer service (not all are bad) pull you from experiencing some amazing food.

To give my 2 pennies - EAT HERE!!!! Get the chicken wings or forever hate yourself.
categories: Restaurants, Asian Fusion, Pan Asian, Thai, Filipino, Chicken Wings, Vietnamese
name: Pok Pok

text:
Smells like dirty dog mixed with sweaty tennis shoes. Loud and crowded.  Servers are great, but everything tastes like fish sauce.  Over-rated.  The most expensive Thai food I've ever had, and not the best.

ValT.
categories: Restaurants, Asian Fusion, Pan Asian, Thai, Filipino, Chicken Wings, Vietnamese
name: Pok Pok

text:
I came to the original location around an hour before it closed on a Monday and it was still packed. I knew this place was going to be good.  

I only got 2 things as I was by myself for this meal: the Spicy Chicken Wings and the papaya salad. I also got the tamarind drinking vinegar which was actually quite amazing?? But then again, I love sour things which is why I loved this place overall. The sour, sweet, savory flavors were perfectly balanced. The fish sauce was what made these 2 dishes. 

I am still thinking about the wings till this day. I wish I could go back like right now. 
I heard they closed their location in LA and that makes me so sad bc now I have to fly back to Portland to get it. I also didn't know they had one in NYC, otherwise I probably would've gone every week. For the chicken wings alone, I would've given them 5 stars. If you come here, you MUST get chicken wings. I rest my case
categories: Restaurants, Asian Fusion, Pan Asian, Thai, Filipino, Chicken Wings, Vietnamese
name: Pok Pok

text: Warm lobster roll and the fresh seafood tower (I don't remember the name) was so yummy but need to share with at least 3-4 people!!
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: I went in around 2:30-3. Thankfully no line, service was good and fast. Place is pretty small but food and brew was solid. First lobster roll with the hot butter was not disappointed, tons of lobster meat the bread was super fresh and tasty, had to hit this place up.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
The only problem with this place - limited seating and therefore long wait time. They do not take reservations.
Other than, they do everything right. Totally worth a visit, maybe a little rough on your wallet though.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
These oysters cannot do any wrong. They have to be THE BEST OYSTERS I HAVE EVER HAD IN MY LIFE. WE TRIED TWO OF EVERYTHING INCLUDING THE SARDINE SALAD CAPRESE WHICH WAS EXCEPTIONALLY EXCELLENT!!! And the pasta with sea urchins.... well let's just say I have much respect for anyone who enjoys that delicacy. It is all delicious and enjoyable. 

But prepare!!!...........
The place is small. Walk in make a reservation and then walk around for 2 hours until they call you for your table. 
Also the night we were there, the air conditioning was broken. People were sweating their asses off. It was insanely rediculously hot in there. Make sure that the air conditioning is working when you go there for dinner otherwise you will be eating delicious oysters in an extremely hot sauna room. (And eating delicious oysters in a hot sauna room is just torture). trust me.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: The lobster roll is very fresh and yummy while the sea urchin fried noodles has not reached my expectation. We choose the oysters to be less salty and creamy, which are very delicious.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
Plan ahead and arrive early to put yourself on the waitlist for seats. This restaurant is really tiny, and latecomers experience two kinds of disappointment -- being turned away because the restaurant and its waitlist are maxed out, and having some of the more delectable oysters on the menu run out. Book a babysitter too, cos this place has no infant high chairs, nor any spare room for kids to wriggle or run around.

I had a really good experience here, after waiting an hour and a half for my table. What the other reviewers have said about the hot lobster roll and the oysters are right on the mark. I would also add that the Ipswich fried clams I had at Neptune Oyster were better than what I've tried up in Ipswich itself.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: Totally worth the wait time. Best lobster roll ever and speedy, friendly service. I will definitely be back!
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
If I could give Neptune Oyster a hundred stars, I would!  I've been here many times and have been meaning to write a review.

The oysters are the freshest I've ever had!  They have such an amazing selection of east and west coast as well as shrimp cocktail!!  

Today I had the burger.  I know, I know who gets a burger at a fish place?  My friend said it was to die for and she was not joking. It had three fried oysters, their home made tartar (which is full of fresh chopped pickles, yum!) and cheese on top of a huge burger.  Loved it, but I could not finish it.  I tried my best though. 

Wine list is great for a wine geek like myself and the service has never been anything less than outstanding!  This place is a must try!!
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
4.5 stars!

Jon-- 

The wife and I felt like we entering an exclusive club, where only those with the most endurance would win. It was a 1.5 hour wait for this gem, but well worth it! We started with a half-dozen uber-fresh oysters recommended by the waitress from their very descriptive menu. We continued with a mildly spicy and saffron-ny cioppino and the much-vaunted lobster roll. 

The cioppino was excellent. There was a nice variety of meaty mussels, some large and succulent shrimp, and really fresh clams sitting in a very fragrant and slightly thick broth and a pile of risotto. It was both hearty and light and refreshing at the same time. Awesome!

Jenny--

There is very little seating here, but because Neptune Oyster came highly recommended, we roamed the neighborhood to kill the time. 

The lobster roll was the most expensive and best I had on our entire New England tour. We ordered the cold one with mayo. They just piled on the sweet lobster meat. Boy did I love biting into each succulent piece. The bread was nicely toasted too. I also really enjoyed the the cioppino. The mild spiciness really made it stand out from the rest. I had to try to slurp up what little broth the husband left me!

Definitely worth the long wait! You won't be disappointed!
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: So delicious! Got lobster roll, salad and island Greek oysters and everything was great including the fries! One of the best lobster rolls!
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
Maybe we expected too much from all the great reviews...
Went here for a weekend dinner with my partner. Put our names down around 5:30pm, was told it will be about 4 hours wait or shorter, depending on cancellations. We stopped by around 7:15pm to check in and were pleasantly surprised that we were seated right away.

We were not so hungry, as we were expecting longer wait, and had a pretty heavy and late lunch.
So, we decided to do a light meal, just oysters and wine (I mean, the restaurant's name screams oysters, right?).
We each had 4 oysters and 1 glass of wine.
Oysters were good, nothing special or mind-blowing.

Above meal cost us more than $30 each.
Luckily, we did not wait 4 hours for this pricy but average meal.

Good experience, but I am definitely not coming back.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: Delicious!! Must try warm buttered lobster roll. Oysters are fresh. Long wait but definitely worth it.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
Ok everyone knows that their lobster rolls are good. 
But their oysters are like heaven in your mouth! It's smooth, juicy, fresh, the best ive ever had!
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
Very cozy place, located very close to the Quincy.

I'd say probably one of the best seafood restaurant I've been. And here's why.

We went there on the last day of our trip to Boston, we arrived there at about 2 pm, the place was packed full with customers, but I see most of them are tourists and they were only having lobster rolls. 

We were told that there's not gonna be more than couple of minutes until we can get a table. Then we sat down at the very corner of the restaurant.

The server greet us with a big smile and warm welcome, and patiently explained every questions I had on the menu. I have to say they are truly a seafood specialist. The whole menu's got a HUGE variety of seafood you can choose from and we grabbed ourselves some oysters, crab claws, octopus cocktails, crab cocktails. 

The service is quick and professional, and the food came out considerably fast, and the most important thing: they are ridiculously delicious. And the price was fairly fair.

We had a good time and we'd come back Boston just for this restaurant.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
One of the perks of working a night shift is that you get to try the places you love without the usual long wait. With a beer or two on tap, followed by nap. 

I like Neptune oysters for their consistently great oysters and friendly and attentive service despite being always busy in a small space. 
That being said, the last time I went to Neptune was over a year ago, always deterred by the thought of waiting in a long line. 

Luckily we were seated at a bar within 10-15 minutes of checking in around 1pm on a cloudy Tuesday of May. The average wait this time of the day seems to vary widely - we sat at the outer edge of the bar (great seats with the view of the street without getting too crowded with people coming in) and saw locals and tourists coming in in groups of 2-4, with estimated wait quoted as anywhere between 15-60 minutes. A tip from Neptune staffs - the best time to come is between 3-5 pm, almost never a wait, which I guess isn't a surprise. 

Enough about difficulties getting the seats at Neptune, and moving onto the food. 

We started with oysters. They have standard New England oysters from ME and RI (and PEI), and a few selection from the west coast. We went with two ME, one RI, and two West Coast oysters and every single one of them was perfectly fresh and delicious. 

Our hot starter was the Johnny cake - if you haven't had it yet I recommend trying it. It's like a honey buttered pancake with smoked sturgeon and caviar spread on top.  An excellent balance of sweet and salty note in a comforting buttery heaven. 

I was perfectly happy at this point, and while our meal took a significant downhill from here but I still left happy and full. 

After eyeing the PEI mussels, as it's very hard for me not to order mussels in a reputable seafood restaurant, we opted for the Tuesday special, sea urchin ditalini. I love good sea urchin and I would try almost anything with sea urchin. It was described to us as elbow pastas smothered in sea urchin butter with sweet pees which is prepared similar to carbonara sauce. Disappointingly it was a very unremarkable and watery dish. Had I not been sitting in the Neptune oyster bar and happy on oysters and Sam Adams honey IPA, I might have thought this is an acceptable pasta dish for a dinky college or hospital cafeteria. I might be too harsh here, but I could not taste any sea urchin in the dish, overpowered by bacon swimming in watery carbonara-like sauce. 

The last item of the lunch was hot buttered lobster roll. I always feel obligated to try signature lobster rolls in the most popular places in NYC, boston, and other cities I visit, but I admit it's hard for me to feel blown away even with a perfectly fine lobster roll. Here at Neptune they do hot (with butter) and cold (with mayo) versions, and my boyfriend suggested trying the hot lobster roll instead of the usual mayo based cold one. It was okay, a hot buttery bun full of plump lobster meat, but again I wasn't super impressed and next time I'm here I'll order other items on the menu before ordering a lobster roll. But that may be just me not being a fan of lobster rolls in general. 

The service was very friendly, attentive and prompt, which makes it a perfect weekday lunch spot.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
I've been here too many times to count, and I'm on a break from eating their world-class lobster rolls, but still count myself a huge fan. 

Neptune is obviously popular and widely loved. But the reason this place is great is b/c it never rests on its laurels. The service is always down-to-earth, the oysters are always fresh, and the menu always changing to offer creative new takes on dishes. Good wine & beer choices. Just good luck getting a table!
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: While a little bit cramped and pricey, the food is awesome. I've had a variety of oysters from the raw bar and they are always extremely fresh and the menu descriptions are very accurate with regards to salt level. The lobster roll is amazing. Each one comes with what seems like an entire lobster on it and the meat is always tender. This is the most expensive lobster roll I've ever had, but it is the best. Another favorite of mine is the yellowfin crostini. It has a mountain of delicious tuna tartare and the crostini is perfectly crisped.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: This place rocks, if you can get in. One of the few non-italian restaurants in the north end and one of even fewer that is actually good. This place is rivaled only by B&G in the SE in this reviewers opinion. A great place for the oyster lover as they offer a sushi like oyster menu with many local options, and the freshest and best from both coasts of the US (and sometimes Canada too). The oysters are expensive but if you're willing to splurge they are amongst the best prepared in the city of Boston. Menu items that are favorites are the Warm Lobster Roll (incredible) with poached butter and my personal favorite is the Burger... For an oyster place this burger seems to come out of nowhere but it gives ever burger in this fair city a run for its money. The meat is well flavored and cooked to perfection, the fried oysters and tartar sauce toppings are unique but the flavors meld as if they've been together forever. Try and go at a non peak time and have a great night, only negatives i can think of are that its a small restaurant, they only have one oyster shucker which has caused delays in some of my visits and this place is $$$$. Otherwise eat your heart out.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
I absolutely LOVE seafood and am always looking out for local hot spots wherever I go in the world that has great seafood.  I grew up on it and know and crave good seafood.

I must say that this restaurant served probably the best seafood I've ever had in my life.  

My husband got there last night (on a wet October Wednesday night) at 8 pm.  It was an hour wait, so they took down our phone number and we walked over to Mike's to actually have a little dessert first.

Right at about 9 pm when we were gonna get seated, a guy walked in and said he had a group of 3.  The host/server told him that they were full for the night.  Poor guy! He walked away looking so sad.

At the bar, we saw a couple who ordered the grilled lobster, which looked amazing.  It was probably a 10 - 12 inch pan (like a round pizza pan) of grilled lobster in its shell, veggies, and clams.  It looked amazing.  But when we sat down and asked about ordering the $50 treat, they said they were out for the night. :(

So I asked our server what other goodies she recommended.  She said the cioppino is really good - lots of seafood and rice that was spicy like New Orleans cookin'.  So my husband jumped on that, since we love spicy food.

And boy was it amazing!  There were about 3 types of fish on our plate (about 2 inch pieces), 2 big fresh plump shrimp, 2 plump clams, lobster pieces, and rice soaking in really good broth that was actually spicy!  We were in heaven.  I even asked for spoons so that we could drink the broth/sauce with our food.  I was amazed at how plump and juicy both the shrimp and clams were (the shrimp was firm and crunchy, which is a sign of freshness!).  The fish were good too. 

I've had lobster rolls up and down the coast of Maine and even at the famous Red's Eats (supposedly the best lobster roll in Maine).  I liked the roll at Red's, but found that my lobster would've been SO much better had it been hot instead of cold to dip into my warm butter.  The lobster was really good, but cold.  It was a bit disappointing.

So last night, I ordered a hot lobster roll.  It was amazing!  The bun was toasted and buttered on the inside and outside.  I had to eat it with a knife and fork, since it was so buttery.  The lobster was sweet, hot, and evenly buttered.  They were cut up into small pieces that were evenly buttered, though not dripping.  It was so perfect, and the pieces of lobster tasted amazing, even without the bread!

And I forgot to mention that we ordered a few oysters off the check list they gave us before our meal.  The descriptions of the taste of the oysters were right on!  One of the ones I got was the one that was sweet, creamy, and had the honeydew melon aftertaste.  It was by far the best oyster I've ever had!  Very plump, sweet, juicy, and creamy.  They were extremely fresh and tasted clean.

Just a hint, try your oysters with just a squirt of lemon juice instead of putting all that other stuff they give you on it.  I'm bit of a purist about some foods, and I like to taste the food and not cover it in sauces.  A squirt of lemon juice was just enough to let me taste the oyster and all its flavors.  If you're getting great quality oysters, skip the sauces and use just lemon juice to really taste the flavors (which is what you're paying for anyway).  

Our whole meal was about $100 with tax and tip.  But my husband remarked on our way out that it was worth every penny.  When I go back again, I wanna try the lobster grill.  If not, the cioppino would be at the top of my list since it was SO good!
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: Lobster roll was the best I've ever had.  Atmosphere was great: it felt hip, sophisticated and down-to-earth (not an easy combination to pull off).  It's our go-to spot for seafood in the North End.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: I had my first ever oysters here and they were yummy!  They were prepared (cracked open) right in front of us at the "oyster bar" and served with Worcestershire sauce- yum!  This place is pretty touristy and while I usually find that pretty annoying I didn't mind it here!   Great joint to have your first oysters!
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: I went with my boyfriend on a Friday at around 3:30ish and only had to wait in line for 30 minutes! The place is very tiny, but that's typical of North End restaurants. We ordered oysters, clam chowder, and hot lobster rolls. The oysters here are by far the best I've ever had! I forgot which ones we ordered but I highly recommend getting oysters when you go. My boyfriend really liked his clam chowder and we both enjoyed the hot lobster rolls as well, but for me, my favorite part of the meal was still the oysters!
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
The most disappointing part of the dining experience for me was their oyster quality.  It is certainly better than an all you can eat buffet so it wasn't terrible  but at these prices it should be better than Legal Seafood or Mccormick & Schmick in terms of freshness and shucking. Of the 8 varieties I tried, I can only say the pemiquids were good. Rest had very little brine and had shell fragments while some didn't even have the underside cut so I found myself trying to dislodge the meat with my oyster fork. The condiments also did not taste homemade and they looked & tasted off so I stuck with the lemons.

Additional notes: their signature dish, the lobster roll which my two neighbors at the bar ordered looked rubbery and unappetizing. My neighbor on the right actually complained to the waitress it had way too much butter which apparently she had asked them to cut down on. I thought the waitress was pretty dismissive & rude to the customer & I can't help but feel it was due in part to the customer's poor English.

I had planned to go to Island Creek Oyster but came to Neptune instead since they were open for lunch while ICO does not. Next time I'm in Boston for business I'll go to Island Creek Oyster like I had originally intended.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
Great place for fresh seafood!  If you're into oysters my recommendation is still Marliave at happy hour.   But it's the variety and the lobster roll that's puts this place over the top!  
If you like fresh seafood,  just shell out the cash and get the triton plateau, it's worth it
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
love love love the oysters here!

i loved the selection of oysters along with the little descriptions of where they are from, their size and flavor. 

we ordered 6 different oysters, all very fresh and delicious, clam chowder, and of course the maine lobster roll that everyone talks about. 

i have nothing more to say about the oysters. they were fresh and plump. period. 

The clam chowder was surprisingly light for a cream based soup. There were plenty of clams and not alot of fillers like potatoes and veggies. Also, it wasnt thick and starchy like the ones ive had before. it had a nice clammy, lightly creamy, delicious flavor. 

We ordered the lobster roll hot and buttered. They were huge chunks of lobster on a hot buttered roll with a side of fries. each lobster piece was succulent, chewy, and flavorful.
the lobster roll did get a bit heavy towards the end and we were getting pretty full, but no doubt, it was DEEEEElicious!
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: THE BEST! Amazing service and food. I'll let my pictures speak for themselves :) Small interior but worth the wait. We were able to choose our oysters (went with the local oysters recommended from the bartender). Prices were fair. Food was impeccable. Service was great. Love it! :)
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
When we found out that the wait was going to be 2 hours, we had second thoughts. But since they took down our name and phone number and said they would call us when a table was available, we decided to go for it. The good part of this was that we were able to do other things in the area until they called us. 

The Lobster Roll in butter sauce is incredible. They give generous portions of fresh lobster pieces in the roll. The clam chower is good but it is more on the liquidy-side. I usually like it a bit more creamy but not too thick so it was decent. The best part of the chower was the good portions of fresh clams. They have a variety of oysters to choose from, which are very good. It was definitely worth the wait. 

The QIQ quotient (Quality = 9, Inexpensive = 4, Quantity = 8) is a 21.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
We were somehow able to skip the 4-hour wait since it was just two of us. We sat at the bar and shared an order of fried clams and a hot lobster roll. The lobster roll was excellent, but I think I'd still prefer Pauli's next door because of the consistency of the actual roll (Neptune uses brioche instead of a more traditional roll). The fried clams were good, but the real star was the homemade tartar. 

The food is good here, but I'm not sure if I would have waited 3+ hours for a table.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: Worth the wait (they will call you to let you know your table is ready) Staff was very knowlegable, friendly and considerate.  We put our name down, went to Cafe Victoria's for an Irish Coffee and walked back. We sat at the counter and order the Johnnycake which is a must have. It's one of the tastiest dishes I have ever order.   If you don't  eat bacon I recommend the bisque which  was yummy!! I wish we had a Neptune Oysters in LA.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: Tiny, tiny, tiny...but all the fresh seafood you could ask for.  Good portions, well prepared for a reasonable price.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
Got there by 11am and got in on the first round. Seems like you can also call to put your name down. Ordered a few items from the raw bar which were well worth it. The lobster roll was pretty good too. The entrees, however, were disappointing. We ordered the cioppino and the char. Both entrees were pretty bland as they were underseasoned. 
Skip the entrees and splurge on the raw bar.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
The only thing I can say about Neptune Oyster us they have the best lobster roll I've ever eaten.  I was lucky having come early enough (4:30) to be seated quickly. I can understand why people wait but admit I'm glad I did not have to. 

The quality to price ratio is super high. Although not cheap for a lobster roll, the quality far superseded 

If you like rolls and happen to find yourself in Boston I highly recommend you try.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: The lobster roll was fantastic without a question. BUT the seating situation is kind of strange. I came kind of early 5-6pm and I found a space at the bar, so I sat down. The waitress made me aware to talk to the hostess to make sure that there are no reservation for this one seat at the bar. I found that odd especially you cannot even tell where and who the hostess was. Anyways, as I said the lobster roll was great and I would come back for it but for sure in the early afternoon since the place gets super crowed with long waits.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: I cannot say anything other than the Lobster Rolls here are unbelievably out of this world great!!! If you want to enjoy a great seafood meal, than look no further! For those that enjoy oysters and fish, this place is for you as well! I was not amazed by the clam chowder though. But like I said, a trip to Boston without a visit to Neptune Oyster is criminal!!
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: Great all around, good oysters, good lobster roll, good service.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: I had the fish tacos and they were fantastic.  The fish was very fresh and perfectly cooked and seasoned, I would definitely reccomend.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
I came here specifically for the lobster roll! It comes hot or cold. I chose to get it hot per the server's recommendation/multiple yelp reviewers. It's definitely pricey ($27) but they give you plenty of lobster! It's covered in a warm buttery sauce that just soaks into the bread. Ugh this is just soo good! It also comes with a side of fries, which was a nice salty compliment to the sandwich. 

I also chose a lager that paired nicely with this meal. You know this is a perfect combo when the people on both sides of you are ordering the exact same thing!
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
I hate to say it......but this place is badly overrated. 

There. I feel better. 

Yes the food is good; great even. We had a couple of oysters, a lobster roll, johnny cake, a ceviche, and beers. The problem wasn't the food, it was everything else. We went early (4:45pm) in an attempt to avoid the largest crowd. Because the place is incredibly popular, there is always a line of people waiting to get in. It was a hot day, and because the door kept opening and closing it had to be about 90 degrees in the dining room. Also it was extremely noisy. I guess my point is that when I'm putting out that kind of cash (I think our bill was around $130 after tip for 2) I'd like to have an enjoyable dining experience. We did not enjoy ourselves mostly due to the heat but also because of the noise and the eyes of people waiting for our table rushing us to finish our meal. 

Sadly, I can't reccomend this place. That said, if you do go, get the johnnycake.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
We tried to come here before but the wait time was over an hour. Determined to try again, we went on a Monday a little after it opened. Good move on our part. We were seated immediately.

We have heard about the warm lobster roll, and decided to try it. After some oysters and steamed clams that is. For the oysters, we tried: Glidden Point, Summerside, Hog Island, and the bf's favorite: Kumamoto. If only I had a bottomless stomach and wallet, or I would have tried more. I selected the Glidden Point after overhearing the waitress mention to other customers that people raved about them. They were right, those turned out to be the best on the ice. If we didn't already order the steamed clams (which were also amazing) and the lobster roll, I would have ordered a few more of those.

There is so much more to try and I can't wait to come back to Boston, stand in line and get a few more of them oysters!
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
AMAZING!!! I love this place the food it great. The oyster are clean and fresh and high quality. They also have them from difference regions. I love the mussel appetizer.  nice rich not creamy, hint of garlic, seafood heaven. they have them in different taste and after taste. I recommend getting one of all of the oysters they serve on that day because the options changes depending on the season and what is caught that day.
and which ever floats your boat get more of it ^.^

for the entree the lobster roll. I tried the cold with mayo lobster roll, it wasn't my favorite. but that is my opinion. BUT I LOVED THE HOT BUTTER LOBSTER ROLL ^^ 
They also have a very good variety of beer wine and champagne here. it changes with the season as it should with any good bar.

the missing star is for the amount of time it took to get a seat. it varies depending on the day and time. once I had to wait 4 hours to get in. I do wish they would expand. but totally worth the wait!
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
The rare 5 star review! Neptune is everything people say it is. We lucked out and slid in on a Sunday afternoon around 5:00pm, no wait, corner seat away from the traffic and front door. Our location made it possible for us to scope out what others were ordering and while everything looked fantastic, the lobster roll is obviously the star here. I saw some Cioppino and hamburgers coming out of the kitchen as well. The place is small and the servers hustle, but we were VERY well taken care of. 

We started with 6 oysters and ended up ordering another 6. It's surprisingly easy to knock back a dozen oysters and they were all magical. We had a few drinks while waiting for our entrees, lobster roll and the Sunday special fish tacos. The fish tacos, while pricey at $26 are obscenely sized and good! Theres no way to eat them as tacos with the amount of fish they serve, but that didn't bother me. The pico/slaw is the best pico/slaw ever. I make a lot of pico at home and never thought to mix it with slaw but it's brilliant and I'm stealing that idea. The cabbage brings a nice texture to the pico and when paired with the fish it was simply delightful. The lobster roll is every bit as good as it should be with the Yelp reputation Neptune has. We opted for the lobster roll served hot with butter rather than cold. This is a no nonsense lobster roll, it's a pile of lobster on a toasted buttered roll and there aren't many things better. The 2lbs of french fries that accompany the lobster roll were also great. 

Would I have enjoyed this place as much if I had to wait 2 hours? Hard to say for sure, but probably. Like everyone else I would have put my name down, walked across the street for a few drinks and let my anticipation and hunger build. I can only hope to make it back in to Neptune next time I'm in Boston.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
This place does not disappoint! Yes, the hot lobster roll is the best in the city and yes, the Neptune burger with the fried oysters as a topping is fantastic. Yes, to all of that. 

They also have a great raw bar and good beers/wine to wash it all down. Special mention to the Monday night special: lobster spaghettini.

BUT, the secret superstar on the menu is- drum roll please- the Johnny cake! It is flipping fantastic! It is a must have. The combination of savory smoked trout and the sweetness of the honey butter crepe is amazing. Amazing!

So to recap: hot lobster roll, oysters, lobster spaghettini, Neptune oyster burger & Johnny cake. 

All of that is worth the wait for a table. Since they don't take reservations, waits can be as much as 2 hours! Regardless, you won't regret it.

By the way, did a mention the Johnny cakes?...
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: Amazing Place!! Best oyster ever!! not only quality but variety! Great service! Small place so be ready to wait!!
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
Ask the servers for their best raw bar selection of the day.  They know what just came in and what gets the best reviews by their customers, so it makes sense to use them to enhance your dining experience.

Don't be shy about sitting elbow to elbow with your fellow diners here--space is limited, and there's no shame in sharing a table if it's just the two of you.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: Amazing lobster rolls. Don't eat the french fries though, soggy and not nearly as good. The mussels are also great with the roasted cashew broth. Worth the wait!
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
Amazing lobster roll and really good oysters! I thought the clam chowder was okay though. I prefer my chowder to be thick.

Quick service once you're seated.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: They have the best lobster roll in the city! Yes you may have to wait 3 hrs for it on a Saturday night but it is well worth it! You can even go across the street to grab a drink while you wait. The oysters are so fresh and the service is fantastic! I can't say enough good things about this place.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: Best Lobster Roll in MA.  The hot with butter was better than the cold.  The lobster was cooked to perfection and on a genuine new england roll.  It's pricey but worth the indulgence.. and while you're at it.. do yourself a favor and order yourself a dozen oysters.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: I didn't enjoy the lobster roll at all... not one bit. The lobster, and subsequently the roll, were soaked in butter which made my stomach turn. I also ordered the fried clams which I really enjoyed. The clams were fried to perfection and not greasy. The tarter sauce that came with the clams was too sour and mild tasting, but I was fine with eating the clams without a dipping sauce. I should have just stopped at the fried clams! I came for the lobster roll and was extremely bummed that I didn't enjoy it one bit. The bright side is that I didn't have to wait for a table; we came around 3 pm on a weekday.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: Went about 6pm and it was packed. Crowded, energetic and very intimate (aka small) environment. Good energy, good food and good fun. If you're not the social type and "community table" is not your thing, take heed. We had neighbors at our table and couldn't help but be social. It was fun. Started with a variety of oysters - awesome. (Take with a grain, as I'm from AZ and have NO idea what to look for in an oyster!). Moved on to the lobster roll and fries like the other million Yelpers. Let's be honest, the fries are the unsung hero and tried to steal the show. AMAZING! I'll be back!
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
A must stop for when you are in Boston. The wait is a little long but there's stuff to do while you wait, they call your phone when your table is ready. 

We got fresh oysters, fish and chips and lobster roll. They really do stack that lobster roll!! One of the best I've had. The fish and chips were 'succulent' and crunchy, very good. Oysters were fresh! They shuck it right there in the restaurant in view. Only complaint would be the pricing of the fish and chips, they give 3 pieces for $27. Maybe the quality was good? No an expert in that, but overall would def come back and recommend
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: Yes. Everything people are saying. Yes. I went on a recent trip with my boyfriend and we are poor college students. Even so, we knew we had to treat ourselves and decided Neptune was the place to do it. Not disappointed in the slightest. We stopped at the restaurant at 7:45 pm on a Friday night. We were told it would be about 45 minutes which was fine by us as it let us to park our car and check into our hotel. 45 minutes on the dot, we got the call that they were ready for us. The place is small (like knocking elbows with the person next to me small), which might be my only complaint, but good food is good food. We decided to be adventurous and order some oysters because...when in Rome, right? They were delicious! They include a pretty detailed description of every oyster they offer and they also include the place they came from which was a nice touch. Obviously, we both ordered the hot buttered lobster roll, him with fries, me with the salad. Yes. Just yes. There are really no words to describe how good this lobster roll was.The butter soaked up so nicely into the bread - which was soft but not at all soggy. There are literally chunks. of. lobster OVERFLOWING out of the sandwich. I think perfect is the only way to describe this sandwich. Get it. Seriously. The fries, like people said, were not out of this world amazing, but i mean. OVERFLOWING with lobster. One can hardly complain. The salad, on the other hand, had this really fantastic pecan citrus vinaigrette that was a really unexpected treat. All in all, the resounding verdict I have is : yes. If you don't know where to eat, I cannot recommend this place enough.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
If it was acceptable to weigh a million pounds and die of a heart attack, I would do it here with their amazing lobster rolls. I am drooling just thinking about it. I have never had a sandwich so sinfully delicious or seafoood so sinfully delicious. I would have to say their lobster roll almost beats out my mother's famous lobster thermidor.
Oh....how I could just eat that for days.
My husband and I wondered into this restaurant over Memorial Day weekend and luckily were able to be seated within 5 minutes.
We had their oysters to order which were good, and their made to order clam chowder. However, the lobster roll which is a small whooping $25 worth every penny, was by far the star item for us. We chose to have the hot lobster roll on a warm baguette drenched in a seasoned butter. I mean sinfully drenched. The sandwich was perfect, the bread was light, fluffy, and not too dense. The lobster was tender, not over cooked, and cut into nice bite size chunks. 
Needless to say, we had to roll ourselves out of the restaurant after all the wine and food. I am so happy this place is not walking distance to us.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: Absolutely love this place!  The seafood is so fresh and the lobster roll is to die for!  We love coming here---but hate the crowds and wait.  So we def. do not come as much as we would like!
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
Came to Boston to visit a good friend who's studying at Northeastern. We waited for at least 2 hours to get in here, and it was a pretty small place, but it was worth it.

The oysters were excellent! My fave was the Kumamoto, which had a slightly salty, fruity finish. I also had an amazing lobster roll. 

If you happen to be on a really long wait, you can walk around to Mike's Pastry to grab some desserts, or just walk around the area. There are plenty of cute shops!
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: Amazing. One of the best meals I have ever had. Plan ahead to get there early as you will wait, but they take your name and call you when they are ready, giving you time to explore the surrounding area. The chowder is fantastic and the Seared Georges Bank Scallops were divine. Staff is friendly and the small space is surprisingly welcoming. Will definitely return.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
Wow. Wow. Wow. 

I was completely blown away by Neptune Oyster both times I have been there this summer. Its hard to even find what to start with. 

The restaurant itself seats under 50 people, from I saw. There are only a handful of tables and a bar; I sat at the bar both times and was completely comfortable. I absolutely loved how intimate the place was. That being said, be prepared for an hour or two wait at dinner time (and you're in the North End so go get dessert first with your time!). 

The service was great, I had the same bartender both time and he had perfect recommendations for both food and drink. I was not a big oyster person before I stepped foot in Neptune; however I can't say the same anymore. They have an incredible variety of raw bar options. I have discovered that I prefer West Coast oysters. I also tried the hot butter lobster roll (yum!) and the seared scallop. Lets just say that I licked the plate clean. I wish I could get the seared scallop every night for dinner. It was simply that delicious. There is something about a new experience that I love, and Neptune provided that with style and some of the best food I've had in Boston.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
Excellent dishes - the seafood, raw bar, even down the the greens and dressing garnishes, the food is scrumptious.

We aimed for an odd time in hopes of a shorter wait (we also had a party of 5, a large group for this hole in the wall). No luck - even at 3:45pm on Saturday, it's full. We had a 1.5hr wait for 5 people, but ended up getting luck and were called at 4:20pm, seated by 4:30. 

We went family style. Shared everything so that everyone got a taste, $50 per person. Every dish was delicious. 

Buttermilk Jonnycake: Pancake-like bottom with tasty tartare. A mix of slightly sweet and savory. Easy to share.

PEI Mussels: The curry was so yum and spicy that we kept asking for more bread and alternating dips between the curry and the clam chowder

Clam chowder: More like "clam cream soup". I agree with others here, this was no chowder, but it was still ok. Good to share as it comes in more of a bowl size than cup size

Hamachi Ceviche Crudo: Raw fish, fun sauce. Do it.

Flash seared nantucket yellowfin tuna: Tuna melts in your mouth, and the salad and light light dressing and light 'mashed potatoes' complement each other

Greek Whole Fish: Dont' get this if you can't de-bone a fish. We skillfully removed the spine and fins and dug in. Fresh, light, tasty while fish came with some meaty mushrooms and cooked kale greens. It all tasted good together.

Lobster roll: Buttery deliciousness. I barely even like lobster and enjoyed this. I would have found it overwhelming if I'd had to eat it alone, however.

Oysters: Each person ordered 3, all very good, fresh, no sand. They give you a dim sum like card where you mark how many of each you want. 

Service was also good. Waters were full (even though it's hard to gracefully reach some of them), and whenever we asked for bread/a drink/ another dish, they obliged. 
When we ordered, we just said "the Tuna" and at first, we were brought the tuna appetizer. We mentioned that we had ordered the entree, and they kindly took it back and did not charge us, given that the ordering was unclear.

Worth a visit. Make it out to Neptune Oyster.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: My fiancee took me here the night we got engaged and it lived up to all expectations.  We went around 4pm knowing there would be at least a 2 hour wait - which there was, so we ended up going over to Sail Loft for some drinks before dinner.  I will say the staff at Neptune is amazing - they quoted us a 2 hour wait and we went back right at that time and were able to walk right in.  We were able to sit right at the front bar so we had a front row seat of the oyster shucking and could do some people-watching out the front window.  I forget who our server/bartender was but she was amazing and recommended some excellent wine.  The oysters were the best I've ever had in Boston or anywhere else.  Great selection and so fresh and tasty.  We also tried the mussels which were unreal and each had the hot lobster roll.  It was the most amazing, decadent thing I'd ever tried!  I will always remember Neptune as a spot for a special great meal as well as the last meal I had as a "single" lady!
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
Did we have to wait for an hour and half to get a table? Yes
Were we sweating nonstop at the restaurant due to the hot weather and weak A/C? Yes
Did we get every single oyster on the menu as well as the lobster roll and clam chowder (and the bill is close to $200)? Yes

Do I still think it's worth the wait and the $$? ABSOLUTELY!! And I'd do it all over again if I'm in Boston.  

 P.S. If you plan on getting there when it first opens, per our lovely waitress, merely getting there before 11:30am is not enough. Usually line starts forming up before 11am. But she did say the least busy time is probably between 3pm-5pm, with "least busy" being the shortest wait time...
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
I brought my friend from out of town to try her first New England Sea Food dish! I don't think we could have scarfed down the lobster roll any faster.  The fries that came with it were just mediocre though.  We also had the Johnny Cake - ohhh man was that soo good.

I'd without doubt recommend this place to everyone.  I'd also recommend getting there 3 hours before you actually want to eat.  We went on a Wednesday at 2 and still waited 2.5 hours.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
I have been here for New Year's Eve.
I had lobster with linguine (a special type of spaghetti).
I am Italian and I can tell that it was delicious.
So far the best restaurant I tried in Boston.
The only thing Only one waiter could speak Italian!
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
Neptune Oyster isn't much from the streetview, but it's oysters are absolutely delicious.  
You have to go in about 1-2 hours before you want to have dinner and sign up for a reservation.  They take your phone number and kindly call you when the table is ready.  We were seated at the bar and the bartender was very knowledgeable and friendly. It was my first time eating oysters (!!) and he took the time to explain the different varieties for me.  We had 12 diffferent varieties and I have to say the kumamoto are my favorites.  I definitely approved of their wine list!
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
It was my first time to Boston so I took a survey of the best places to eat at and Neptune Oyster kept coming up. I'm not the biggest oyster fan, but I heard this place still had some great options, so I went with the clam chowder and the lobster roll... both were exquisite!

The clam chowder is a light, slightly creamy chowder with really fresh clams and potatoes that don't fall apart. It comes in a relatively large bowl that if you paired it with some smaller items, you'd be just fine.

I thought I was already on their VIP list when they gave me the chowder, but the lobster roll turned out even better!! A lot of lobster on a soft roll, topped off in butter. It really just melts in your mouth. It comes with a side of fries that are a bit on the salty side but they taste good.

The service here is really good. The only thing is you want to put your name down about 2-3 hours before you eat because the wait can be long.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: I was looking for a great oyster back with fresh seafood and Neptewn delivered! There wasnt a lot of seating so I go there early. I started with the fried clams that were outstanding. A new england favorite, but I dont remember them being this good! See my photos for the visuals...I next went for the lobster roll because of all the reviews. I got the hot one with butter...so delicious! The lobster was so fresh...we just cant get it like this on the west coast. They also had a great wine list...I left there a very happy girl.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
Truly amazing and fresh seafood. Even more, the dishes are super flavorful in a way that doesn't over power the freshness of the seafood. We ordered the warm lobster roll, the johnny cake, a series of oysters, cherrystone, and shrimp cocktail. All dishes were phenomenal. 

1. Lobster roll - doesn't look big but is actually a TON of lobster and all the good pieces of meat too. The roll is nice, soft, and buttery and a perfect compliment to the soft lobster. Served with a huge portion of fries

2. Johnny Cake - really well done especially with the crisp outer edges and the bit of caviar at the center. Slightly sweet which works well with the salty fish in the center too.

3. Fresh oysters, cherrystones, and shrimp cocktail - not overly salty and, of course, fresh.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: Very nice restaurant, bit costly but its worth to go there if you are going with guests. Most of the time it is crowded so sometimes you won't get proper service. They decorate the oyster plate very nicely and they also have good selection of oysters. I tried oyster first time in this restaurant After few days, I visited this place again but I didn't got proper service so I started to visit Union Oyster Bar which is cheaper than this place and having a good service.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
Seafood here is awesome! One of the best Lobster rolls I have ever had. I also had a platter of crab legs that were very fresh. 

Be prepared for a long wait to be seated though, the place isn't that big...
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: This place is good but not wait-in-line-for-2-hours good. I really enjoyed their clam chowder. The consistency is different from others I've had. It's not as creamy and thick. Their lobster roll was meaty but I thought that it was bland. I've had better lobster rolls. It was a bit pricey ($29 I think). You can differently find a more flavorful and cheaper roll elsewhere in the city.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: Best oysters I've ever had!  We got there 30 min before opening, so we were seated right away!  We had oysters, lobster roll (warm), and crab bisque.  All were excellent!  Well worth the wait, and every bit as good as people say!!
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
Really, really, really good.  I would give it 4.5.  Docking half a star for the fact that it's pretty much ALWAYS full of people, so you're lucky if you get a seat or have a 15 min wait, and that the waiters/hosts are not very friendly.  I think it's because they're busy all the time, they just don't have time to smile.  But the bartenders are really nice!

Oysters are THE BEST in Boston.  Better than Island Creek, better than B&G.  I am judging based on shucking quality (no shells, no dirt), temperature of the oysters, pricing, selection/variety (they had one from NZ, which is really cool), and overall quality/taste of the oysters.  Hands down the best.

Lobster roll is also the best in Boston - I'm only talking about the hot one.  Never had their cold version, but after I get that I'll rate again.  But ever since I had their hot lobster roll, I want to dump hot clarified butter on EVERY lobster roll I get.  I'm hooked.  Share it with someone; it's so filling.

Fries were so-so (a little too darkly cooked for me) which is a big drawback in a classic seafood place, and fried clams were very good but not mind blowing.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
I had heard great things about this restaurant before actually eating here and I was not disappointed. 

When I went to Neptune Oyster it was for my cousin's b-day and while there are a few complaints about location and spacing the food was better than anywhere else in Boston. 

It is in the North End of Boston so there is no parking and theres so much traffic you shoudlnt even think about driving. The place is also pretty packed so be sure to call for a reservation or be ready for wait for half an hour. 

That being said, the food we had that night was terrific,

1. Fried Clams - delicious and not greasy, full of flavour 
2. Clam Chowder - not your thick tasteless clam chowder but a full body chowder which is light and packed with clams - best chowder Ive ever had
3. Lobster Roll - $27 and worth every dollar, the roll itself is huge, with a whole lobster packed into it. Your choice of butter or mayo (I went with butter) and it was just.... delicious (not like those crappy lobster rolls at fanueil hall and much better quality than Kellys)
4. Fish and Chips - delicious fresh fried fish - you cant go wrong..

Overall my experience was great even though the restaurant was packed... mainly due to how great the food was here. When compared with any other restaurant Ive gone to in Boston, this one definitely comes up top.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
I love love love so many things about this place.

The oyster selection spans way beyond the ubiquitous Wellfleet, Kumamoto, Blue Point, Malpeque repetoire at every other raw bar.  While fresh lemon, mignonette and cocktail sauce are offered, the quality and freshness of these sea gems requires nothing.

The icy cold Peroni on tap (this is the North End, yah?) was a lovely compliment on a hot day.

I had a little sticker shock when I ordered the lobster roll ($25?! For something on a hot dog bun?!), but all was forgiven when I took my 
first bite. There could well have been an entire hot, buttery, perfect lobster unloaded into the oversized bun.  

The decor matched the food, in that it was comfortably casual, but elegant at the same time. It is a small place dominated by a big marble topped bar. (I love eating at the bar and people watching.) The staff is attentive without being pushy. It was just well-executed the whole way around.

The only negatives are that its size makes it a no go for groups and ensures long waits if you don't go at an off peak time. And the price point puts it out of the realm of the every day.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
I've eaten a lot of oysters around the world and a car load in the NY area from Chinese buffet places to fancy schmancy restaurants but the oysters at Neptune were hands down the best I've had.  The clam chowder was also amazing.  It's not thickened with corn starch but it's a clean, flavorful chowder with clams, cream, and potato being the only starch item in the soup.  It's delicious.

I ordered some monkfish entree but honestly I enjoyed the oysters and chowder much more. Next time I might stick to the raw bar, chowder and maybe some other appetizer item.

The real downside to this place is that parking is impossible for an out of towner. The wait is also horrendous. Also this place is always packed with tourists which gets annoying.... yesi'mnotfrombostoneither.

Tip: don't eat the lobster roll here. Have some oysters or the clam chowder instead. You can eat a lobster roll next door at the sandwich shop while you wait.  The lobster roll at the lowly sandwich shop is actually really good. Better than anything I can get in NYC.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: Don't go here if you have a large party. The restaurant was really small. I was visiting Boston and I saw that this place had a really good review for their clam chowder so me and my friends (group of 3) decided to check it out. There was no where to sit at the tables so we settled on sitting at the booth. Even sitting at the booth, it was pretty tight. I had the calm chowder and it was a good size for a soup appetizer. I definitely would recommend it. My friend had the lobster roll, and I personally do not like seafood, but the lobster roll was delicious. It was a big roll he couldn't finish it himself. How small the place was, we thought there wouldn't be a bathroom, but lucky for us, there was a small bathroom if you could squeeze yourself to the end of the bar.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: Best dinner in Boston.   Great oysters and the hot lobster roll was to die for.   Well worth the wait.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
this place is def overrated. the food is impressive, and portion is friendly, but the server is like "we have a really busy place and u guys better hurry"! 

we were told there might be a 45min wait but it turned out to be only 15min. i like the idea that customers signed up w/ their phone numbers and got called when there was available space. 

the hot lobster roll is very very flattering. yum! might go back for the lobster burger and the pan boiled lobster.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
Great place for all kinds of seafood. 

As someone who loves Oysters, this is my favorite place to go. Hands down. They break the oysters down by region and give you a description of what flavor qualities you can expect from each. (Its a good place to get started if you don't know a tremendous amount about oysters). 

The environment is a nice laid back upscale combo. A little loud inside (which I don't mind) as almost half of the place is a bar. 

There is seating for up to 24 at the tables, so the max you'll ever see is 40-50 people in the establishment at any given time. 

I don't know if they take reservations. I just put my name on a list w my cell number and get called when my table was ready. 

Plenty to walk around and see and you more than likely will end up waiting for a table at this local favorite. 

Good service.  The best food. Great atmosphere. The table may take a while to get. Its definitely worth waiting for.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: Easily my favorite restaurant in Boston.  However, brutal wait time to get in.  I recommend you go at 6, put your name in, walk to Bacco and get a drink and they will call you 90 minutes later and you're good.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
We arrived at 10:40 in the morning and there were already some people standing in a line. We waited until it opened around 11am and got seated in the first round. When we sit, there were more people coming and waiting outside. This is the first time I came to Neptune oyster. I had to say that it was rally worth the long wait. Everything here was so good!!!
The lobster roll in Neptune is the best!!! 
The oysters are fresh. We tried five different kinds of oysters and love all of them. We plan to come next time and try more. 
We also order the mussels and tuna tartare. I love tuna tartare, which is a mix of avocado and sauces and also has a piece of fried bread on the bottom. The tuna is fresh and it tastes so good. Honestly, I felt it was better than the sashimi in most of the restaurants in Boston. 
In addition, it is a big portion of mussels and I also like the sauce.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
Uh... WOW! This place is amazing! Definitely makes my list of top places in Boston.

Went here for a going away dinner for someone at work. Started at the bar because we were waiting for one person to show up. I think it may have been a good thing. Ordered up some raw bar goodies and wine. The oysters and raw clams were delicious. You order them on a sushi-style sheet which has accurate descriptions of the distinctive flavors of each oyster. If you need more info, the staff is super knowledgeable about the oysters. We each ordered wine by the glass. They have an extensive "by the glass" list and the staff is also super knowledgeable about the wines. And this was only the beginning...

When seated, we split two apps at the table--the fried clams were light and delicious, but the salt cod salad stole the show. In addition to salt cod, the salad also had some crispy lamb and pancetta, so delicious! The menu here was quite creative--combos of ingredients that you never would think of and may sound a bit weird, but somehow turn out amazing. I picked cod again for my entree. It was cooked up with an artichoke crust, served over whipped potatoes with a berry, smoked mussel and citrus salad. I ate every last bite of this, and would have licked the plate if I wasn't out at a nice restaurant with folks I work with. The other most memorable dish of the night was the sturgeon, which was served up with black currant caviar  jam and a plum graham cracker panzanella--the coworkers couldn't stop raving about it.

The place is small and they don't take reservations, so I recommend that you go early. Also, it is a bit pricey, particularly if you want to sample lots of oysters. Luckily for me, someone else picked up the tab. Unluckily for me, I now want to go back once a week and there is no way I can afford that on my own! Anyone want to buy me dinner?
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
1st time to the Neptune. Iheard so much about there lobster roll that I just had to try it. Great atmoshere, great dishes coming out of the kitchen but for the famous lobster roll, a little bit of a dissappointment.
Great roll, great taste warm and buttery, very tasty, but, $25.00, I dont think so. With live lobsters going at around $5.00 lb in the markets, there was no way there were 5 lobsters in this roll. Maybe 2 lobsters at best. Kellys give you just as much for $16.95. Once again, great taste but not for 25.00
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: I didn't expect to be wowed by the burger here, but it was phenomenal! It's a gigantic hamburger topped with cheddar cheese, fried oysters, garlic mayo, and relish served on a brioche bun with a pile of fries. The raw bar and the wine list are also lovely, I just really can't get over the burger though.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: This place was decadent and well worth the wait in the cold. My scallops were perfectly cooked to the right amount of tenderness, crusted with buttery yumminess. And the greens and corn salad OMG. No room for dessert. My friend had the cioppino stew.  We also had the oysters and stone crab claws as appetizers. Again, sweet, easy to break the shell on the crab. The server was so personable, attentive to our needs and had the locals give me space to eat. You get to know your table mates because you set elbow to elbow. Excellent and fun way to meet new people.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
Hands down the best oysters I have ever had! So much tastier then the oysters I had in Seattle, WA. They had oysters that tasted like melons. The lobster roll was delicious. 

Came here with four Australian students, two from China, and the rest of us from all over the States. We got their right before the rush. After us it was packed and the line was out the door. All of us left incredibly satisfied.  Overall, we ordered everything off the raw bar menu and it was delicious. We went back the following day for dinner.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: Is a lobster roll really worth $25?  Absolutely!  I ordered the cold Maine lobster roll with extra melted butter on the side for dipping and it was AMAZING!  The succulent lobster claws were HUGE and cooked perfectly.  A "must eat" when you're in Boston for sure!
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: Hands down this place is so worth trying. I came to Boston for the weekend just to try this place due to my friend boasting about the pemaquid oysters here. The oysters were indeed really fresh and had the nice hint of citrus. Besides for the pemaquid oysters and all the other ones I ordered, I really liked the Cuttyhunk and Katama Bay oysters. They both were pretty fat and had a buttery taste. If you like the small juicy ones, I'll always recommend the Kumamoto  and Kushi. They're great here as well. OK, enough with the oysters. I also ordered the Uni toast as appetizer. If you like butter and Uni, you'd definitely enjoy this crispy buttery piece of goodness. As for the main course, I got the lobster taco and my friend got the lobster roll. The were very generous with the lobster. It was basically a handful of seasoned lobster meat and some tasty green sauce with some cilantro. It had a side of coleslaw and some  carrots too which was good as well.  The lobster was a bit salty for me but it was still tasty. I don't really write much reviews but this place is so good that I decided to compliment it with a nice review. If you decide to come here, please come early in the morning. The line gets pretty long and they might even sell out by the afternoon.  They open at 11:30 AM.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
Went with my son and was able to get a spot at the bar. Very informal and great food. I like to order offbeat dishes - so I had the Octopus salad and Artic Char entre - both excellent
The waitress made a fresh lemonade for my son which was nice. He had the clam chowder and tuna tartar sandwich with veal - very good - great place if you can find a spot
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: Wellfleet, island creek, wianno oysters..... Littlenecks, fried ipswitch clams and hot lobster rolls that I still dream about. Food and service was perfect.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
Food is delicious. Highly recommended.  Only reason Im not giving it 5 stars is because seating is very cramped, and the wait is very long.  We knew what we were getting into though.
delicious lobster roll and fries. very good oysters.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
Oh so good!  
We went in at ~5 and they still had seats available, but we weren't hungry yet. We were told to come back a little later and put our names down, so that's what we did.
