They'll call you when a table is ready for you! It was one of those freak storms when we went, and we were maybe a 5-10minute walk from the restaurant. It was POURING outside, but the hostess called and told us a table was ready. We braved the rain for it. Totally worth it. 
The hostesses and waitresses are so friendly and welcoming. 
A tried 6 different oysters. We also ordered the buttermilk johnnycake, and I had the monkfish. Monkfish - huge portions and delicious! It was too much though. The first bite was AMAZING! But after a while, I was just forcing it down my throat bc it was too good to waste, which ironically made me enjoy it less and less. The buttermilk johnnycake tasted like comfort food to me-- it reminded me of something from my childhood but I just couldn't place my finger on it. I still cant think of it! 

This seems like a tourist spot, but it's SO GOOD! you must try it!

My only complaint is that we were seated near the entrance, and people were constantly coming in and standing at the door. I felt a little claustrophobic, and it was too crowded.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
Been wanting to come here as soon as I moved to Boston almost 2 years ago. I finally got the chance to check this place out!! The restaurant is tiny... so if you come here during prime time lunch or dinner hours expect to wait at least an hour! Luckily, when we got here we just avoided the line. There was one open table to seat us and after that I kept hearing the waiter say "45min-1hr wait" for the people who came right after us.

So we ordered a bunch of different types of oysters and clams as well as the Hot Lobster Roll. Surprisingly, our raw stuff took so long to come out.... It took about 30 minutes for the oysters and clams to get to our table. Raw food shouldn't take this long to be served!!! Our waiter probably saw our frustrated and hungry faces and noticed that our raw bar food had yet to be served. He quickly gave us a free appetizer. It was Hamachi Sashimi served with avocado spread. It was delicious and made me hungrier!

The raw items were FINALLY served to us and were quickly devoured. Clams were meaty, juicy, and sweet and oysters were sweet and creamy. They were super fresh! Definitely worth trying even though they are super expensive.

The hot lobster rolls were amazing. I did NOT expect SO MUCH LOBSTER. Usually, places skim on the lobster when making a roll by mixing it with a bunch of mayo and completely chopping the lobsters until you cannot tell whether or not its lobster that you're eating. Not this place! There was big ass lobster chunks perfectly placed in between a slightly grilled bun. All of that is coated with melted butter and served with some amazing fries. $25 well spent!.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
One of my overall most enjoyable meals ever--both for atmosphere, company, and of course, phenomenal food. I've been twice, last spring and this past Monday to have an almost identical meal. Sometimes, I revisit the meal mentally--yum. Here's the rundown:

Atmosphere: Tiny--fits about 12 at the bar and maybe 30 more in restaurant, but they do that great thing where they take your cell number and call you when space opens up. There's a cozy coffee shop a few doors down that you can wait at. The restaurant itself has a bit of an at the docks feel decorated with posters of various kinds of fish. 

Oysters: first place I tasted oysters and now hooked. The raw bar has both local and those from father afield. Sitting at the bar you can watch them shuck the oysters and watch passerbys peer into the restaurant to stare at them. Fresh and served with lemon and a cocktail sauce topped with a bit of garlic in truffle oil--yum.

Neptune on Piggyback: fried oysters topping pork belly. The whole meal was so not kosher, but so, so delicious. 

Scallops: delicious scallops-perfectly seared on the outside. They come on a base of potato puree topped with a bed of brussels sprouts, chanterelles, and some more pork belly. 

Lobster Roll: get it hot with butter--it practically melts in your mouth. This is the lobster roll to measure others by. 

The previous time I went, we had the clams as well, brought on accident, which they comped. Also, delicious. 

Only negatives: no dessert (sad) and longish wait times (the 36 hours in Boston NYTimes article may have made it worse, but I did get seated immediately last time--at 6:30 on Monday night).

Otherwise, when in Boston, grab your besties, order a glass of prosecco and dig into some phenomenal seafood.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
Get there early. This joint is small and intimate, and if you don't get there early you'll get sat at the bar in the back by the kitchen doors. 

As far as ambiance goes, it's cozy. The food is good but not the best thing I ate while in Boston. If you're limited on time, this isn't the destination for you. 

I ate the Lobster Roll neet (roll and buttered lobster). My husband has some unmemorable dish.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
Long wait. Tip: just put your name in with number and they'll call you when you are up.
The lobster roll and oysters were very fresh.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
Worth the 3 1/2 hour wait!  Put your name on the list and kick around the neighborhood.  You're near Paul Revere's house, the Old North Church, and the shops at Fanueil Hall.  Or, wander across the street to Vito's for a beer.  

So, back to Neptune... The oysters are so fresh you taste the ocean.  Absolutely spectacular.  My husband and I shared two dozen, then a bowl of fresh, made to order clam chowder, and split a hot lobster roll.  I thought the lobster roll could've been more toasted, my husband loved it, I just have thing about mushy bread.

Excellent wine list!

They don't do dessert.

Great service.  They take it slow and you won't be rushed!  Expect to share a table.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
Really enjoyed the oysters. Like someone said, they really do have great variances in subtle flavors, like a wine. The watermelon flavor of one variety was unmistakable.

Thought the hot lobster roll wasn't all that, though the fries were good. Too much butter and bread overwhelmed the delicate lobster, though there was plenty of it.

Good wine list, Duvel tops the small beer selection. Nice relaxed atmosphere. Pricey. Would go again.

Did go again. I really enjoy the raw seafood, but the fried clams weren't all that imo.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
Ended up waiting an hour and a half for this place, but definitely worth the wait. We also went over to Caffe Vittoria's for their DELICIOUS pistachio gelato so that definitely helped in the meantime.

To be fair, we went on a Saturday for dinner and it was packed. We finally sat down at a table got some water and was looking over the menu. The waiter asks us if we could move to a spot at the bar because he needed our table for another guest. Admittedly I was annoyed because we already sat down and the place at the bar was right in front of the bathroom. We reluctantly agreed and the waiter was really nice about it. After sitting down at the bar, the bartender informs us that the waiter wanted to buy us each a glass of prosecco for moving - sweet...definitely feeling better now.

The rest of the meal was delicious. We ordered some oysters and the shrimp cocktail from the raw bar. Although the shrimp cocktail was actually only one shrimp...it was huge and really meaty. We then split the clam chowder and the dinner special that night (a whole fried bass with mexican style rice and beans, guacamole, and fried plantains). The clam chowder was too thin and not worth the price. I liked my chowders thick and hearty. The fish was cooked perfectly and the accompaniments were surprisingly tasty. 

The waitstaff was really nice and apologized for having to move us - so be nice to them when it's busy...things are hectic there as it is. You might even get lucky and get some free drinks! :)
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
I had dinner at Neptune on Friday, 10/30. There were four people in our party, we showed up around 7:30 to put our name in and they said the wait was about an hour, so we left a cell phone number and went to another place to have a drink. Almost exactly an hour later they called and our table was ready. 

The oyster selection is great, and I think their descriptions of the various oysters were helpful and accurate. The rest of the food was good, not great. I had the hot buttered lobster roll. The meat was perfectly cooked, and nice big chunks. At $25 I thought it was on the high end of reasonable. My complaint was that they actually used too much butter, and the roll was so buttery it was almost inedible. 

The wife got a Caesar salad for $17, which I thought was way overpriced. 

All in all, I liked Neptune Oyster but I think B&G in the South End is hands down the better oyster spot.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
You will LOVE it...... As long as you can get in ha ha ha
My Boston go to for years now!

Clam chowder a must
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: BEST SEAFOOD IN TOWN! LOVE everything about this place. Service is good, can't blame them for the small space and the high demand. Due to it's popularity, there is the occasional line out the door but it's worth the wait.  Fresh oysters, great lobster roll never a dull seafood dish.  Love every dish on the menu.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
Incredibly fresh seafood and the Neptune Burger is one of my favorite burgers in the city. 
The restaurant is a bit small but thats common for the North End eateries, and is well worth the wait if there is one. Need to get my friends together for a hell night which consists of a table paying a flat price as the chef keeps bringing entree after entree to the table until someone taps out. 
If you want seafood and are sick of the classic tourist hangouts of Legal Sea food and Union Oyster house check out Neptune Oyster.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
Amazing and completely worth the hype, but be prepared to wait 45 min to 2 hours depending on when you get there since there aren't any reservations. If you're a tourist then you can blow off some time at the nearby Quincy Market, Boston Harbor, or Aquarium. 

They had a wide selection of oysters, and I tried 5 different kinds. Of them all, I preferred the ones with less salt and with a nutty/ fruity finish. The ones at the top of the list were too salty for my taste and overpowered every other flavor. Overall, I enjoyed them.

The uni toast was very, very good. Two slices of bread with a generous spread of sea urchin butter = party in your mouth. This one was well worth the money.

And the lobster rolls. Everything that could be said about it has already been said by others. Large chunks of lobster drizzled with butter between soft bread. I ordered it hot, and it was easily the best thing by far. My only regret is that it ruined all other lobster rolls for me.

Would and will definitely come back again.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
I think this place might serve more than lobster rolls and burgers, but I couldn't tell you. 

Went in to get the burger with a couple friends today, and wow. They really do it up. To be completely honest, my burger was a little over done, (both my friends were cooked well though) however, it was so juicy, and tasty. The bun was nice a crispy, and buttery, oysters were done well, and the garlic mayo and relish (I'm not a relish person) were amazing. 

If you're in the area, and can find a seat, make sure to stop in. Beware, the burger does sell out from time to time (went the week before and it was out) so try to get there early in the day.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: My wife and I visited on Saturday afternoon and the line up was 45 minutes deep. We hung in there as we had heard the wait was worth it. Unfortunately, we found the food not up to the hype, in fact, it was way over priced and inferior to other familiar restaurants.  The price for the lobster salad was $27.00, comparable to a 2 lb. whole lobster elsewhere but served cold, mayo drenched and weighing less than 1 lb. I ordered fried clams which were undercooked and expensive, as well. I asked for fries thinking they accompanied the clams but they were billed additional at $5.75. Our total bill exceeded $60.00 and this was a tasteless and expensive venture. Dollar for dollar and taste to taste you could do much better elsewhere. The cramped seating and lack of attentive service created an unsatisfactory restaurant experience.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
Visting from out of town and on saturday morning, we waited in line and low and behold- we were put on a wait list. Waited and hour, almost went to another place but luckily we were able to make it in. 

Their selection of oysters and clams were so precise. Fresh and light. Their lobster roll sandwhich is beyond worlds. Mild yet incredibly fresh and incredibly rich. Definitely worth the wait and experience. Never had seafood this fresh up in NYC. 

The staff overall was amazing and precise. If and when I do find myself up in Boston, I am definitely hitting this place up.

Worth the wait, and definitely worth the fresh seafood.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
On my second weekend trip to Boston and I told myself that I couldn't miss out on it again like I did the first time. The wait was not pretty - approximately 1hr on a Sunday afternoon - but there were nearby shops that kept me company for the most part. Once seated, I was a delighted woman!

The fried clams came out first and it was light, crispy and everything you'd expect it to be - AMAZING. Next came the lobster rolls. The fries were very flavorful and unfortunately, horribly soggy but who really cares when you have a mountain of lobster meat drenched in warm butter right next to it? 

Plate was spotless shortly after and yours should be too!
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: One of the worst experience ever. I really don't get all these 5 stars, maybe people don't used to eat properly... 25 minutes to get our name down for a party of 2, then 2 hours and 30 min to get called back, then other 15 mins standing and waiting for our table. Out of 3 dishes 2 were completely tasteless. The shrimps, quite expensive,  were literally tasteless. The scallops were served on a "salad" that I'd define a joke: It seemed that someone puked on the plate, seriously disgusting and we left it there. My biggest suggestion is to avoid this tourist trap: in the same amount of wasting time you can see a part of the city and enjoy other places that are definitely better than this joke.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
Let me start by saying it took us three attempts to successfully dine at Neptune Oyster.   Yes, it is THAT popular.  With that said, it was well worth the wait. 

We started with a combination of a dozen east and west coast oysters.  They were fresh, well prepared and delicious - everything you would expect from a quality oyster bar.  For mains I had the warm (butter) lobster roll, which was probably one of the most delicious things I have ever tasted.  My friend had the North End Ciopinno - lots of fish and seafood, in a very tasty and somewhat spicy broth.  We'd highly recommend all of the dishes.  Neptune has a pretty good drink list, and you'll likely be able to find something that pairs well with whatever you decide to eat. 

So with all of the positive things out of the way, here are a few things to be aware of: 

- Get there early or pick an off-peak time to visit.  The day we were able to successfully get a seat we still waited two hours.  
- The restaurant is tiny and you must be comfortable sitting in close proximity to others.  Do not expect any privacy. It's also reasonably noisy.
- It's not cheap, but you get what you pay for.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: I had the lobster here and my gf had the lobster roll.  Would definitely recommend getting the roll, but if you want to get your hands dirty then the lobster is also a good feed.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
Pretty good, except for the long wait given it's a small yet popular place! They will at least take your number and call you when your table is ready.  Service was OK - not very friendly, but not bad either.  Not a very spacious place, so you will be sitting pretty close to others.

We got sat at the counter, where we ordered a warm lobster roll with butter that came with fries (more than $30), fried ipswich clams, and two cherry stone clams.  The fried clams with the refreshing slaw were delicious.  The clam pieces were nice, tender, and meaty pairing well with the slaw and not too overly battered.  The lobster roll was delicious too but small for the price - i wish it was bigger! (I could probably eat two of them!) The roll the lobster was in was soo soft and yummy!

I really enjoyed the food here, but do keep in mind it's not cheap! The seafood is so very fresh though!
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: Plan to wait, but the wait is worth it. Quality of the raw bar is high, oysters were perfect texture and good and briny. Clam chowder was purposely lighter, so good clammy taste but not creamy heavy to fill you up. You need stomach room if you get the lobster roll. It's on a nicely toasted bun. Very good sized serving of lobster pieces, so much you have eat some lobster first before you can even think about holding the bun to your mouth. Sweet tasting lobster pieces. It comes with fries or salad, both were very good. Just note the salad came with nuts. I try to get here every time I want lobster roll, I've been here 5 times over last three years.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
This place is so busy, it's unbelievable.  Saturday afternoon 4 pm - line out the door and when I had called an hour earlier, was told they don't do take-out at all on Saturdays.  No desire to wait an hour in the pouring rain, so went 45 minutes earlier on Sunday before they opened.  We were the first ones in and of course got the lobster sandwich.  We got it hot with the butter and it was delicious and huge compared to most lobster sandwich places.  We had enough left to take home and share with a friend who is a lobster afficionado and she said it was the best lobster she had ever had.  

However, the best part of the meal was not the lobster roll, it was actually their CHEESEBURGER.  Friend who ordered it couldn't eat seafood at the time, but my eyes were rolling when she ordered it.  When it came out though, we each took one bite and were shocked how a lobster and seafood place could make such a good burger.  Half the price of the lobster sandwich, juicy, plump, delicious, high quality meat -- simply the best burger in Boston that I've had.  

All in all, Neptune Oyster the best lobster sandwich around, however, if you want the best lobster, period, travel to St. Michael's in Maryland and go to Marco's.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: Lives up to the hype and expectations!! This is my second time at Neptune Oyster and I'm blown away by the lobster rolls and the raw bar! I would recommend coming in on a weeknight before 6/630pm because it becomes increasingly difficult to be seated afterwards! Definitely recommend!
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: This place is worth the hype. Once I saw the inside of the restaurant, I saw how 4 hour waits were possible. My family and I were lucky to call ahead the day before so we could plan the next day around the potential wait time. It is in a nice area to explore during the wait and we stopped by a cafe as well. For those despising wait times, this may not be the best choice. However, once we got through the wait, the food was delicious! I love that they have the option of cold and hot lobster rolls (we had both). The clam chowder was not my favorite, but still delicious nonetheless. And of course, their oysters were incredible! I would advise not taking much baggage as there is not much seating room to begin with (we struggled as tourists transitioning between hotels and had to squish, but this problem is surely avoidable).
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: I went on a recommendation from a friend.  By far the freshest oysters I have ever had.  I've been all over New York and these oysters were hand down the best.  I had 6 to start my meal and finished with 6 more for desert.  Mid course I had the muscles which were cooked perfectly.  My main dish was a squid salad.  Overall the service was great (even help give me advice on how to get around Boston) and food was amazing.  I will be heading back to this place on my next trip to Boston
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
This was one of the top ten meals of my life.  

I had the clam chowder and a lobster roll with fries.  The clam chowder was good and tasted really fresh.  The fries were good too.  But the lobster roll....oh my god.  It should be illegal for something to be this delicious.

It was succulent, warm, fresh lobster, dripping with butter on a perfectly toasted brioche roll.  It was nothing short of amazing.  Everyone should eat a lobster roll at Neptune at least once in their life.  It was pricey at $25, but worth every penny.

The service was great, and they have a huge wine list.  I was very happy with my Chardonnay, and it complemented the food really well.  I will definitely be back, and I recommend Neptune to anyone who travels to or near Boston.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: Amazing place. Lobster roll and lobster tacos were unbelievably tasty. Clam chowder hit the spot on a cold day
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: Great lobster rolls and very fresh oysters.  Wait staff was amazing given how crowded it was at the time.   They made our visit with out I'd town guests memorable.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
I would have LOVED to say the food was amazing, but I wouldn't know because the Jerk of a Bartender (short guy, dark hair, obnoxious, inattentive and just a plain ASS HOLE) did not warn us when we arrived at 9:15 that the kitchen closed at 9:30, even though at the time the website said they were opened much later (it looks as thought i has since changed). 

It was one of my first dates with my now boyfriend and he took me out for dinner for my birthday. We started off at the bar at Neptune's, like I said, arriving there around 9:15 after he got out of work, had some champagne and ordered some oysters. YOU WOULD THINK AT THIS POINT AND SMART PERSON IN THE RESTAURANT BUSINESS WOULD SAY "THE KITCHEN CLOSES IN 10 MINUTES, PLACE AN ORDER NOW' So that he would at least if anything, being the seemingly SELFISH prick he was, do that so he could get a better tip, but NO he let us sit there basking in new love and sipping champagne and oysters until 9:35 when we decided to place an order. FIVE MINUTES AFTER THE CLOSED HE WOULD NOT TAKE AN ORDER, yes I understand, it was a Sunday, but there were many other tables there that hadn't gotten their food yet, and the kitchen was still cooking. It isn't like it was dead in there and they all were just watching us to hurry up and go. Not to mention, the raw bar is opened later than the kitchen, so the bartender still would have had to stay there.. 

I was so upset and angered by the fact that all the bartender had to do was warn us as opposed to just prancing around the bar incompetently doing nothing, that i wanted to scream profanities at him, but refrained b.c I didn't want to scare of the new BF. 

So now, on my soap box I am telling the jerk of a bartender "I HATE YOU, I HATE YOU AND I HATE YOU!" I will not ever return to that place, ever. Sadly, for you, I live in the N. End and absolutely love oysters, champagne and food and am more than happy to devote my dining out experiences to a place I enjoy, which will never include you. 

For any of you who care to know, we enjoyed a perfectly romantic dinner at Il Panino in the Garden, under the stars...
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: Whenever I'm in Boston a lobster roll from Neptune ouster is a must.  The warm butter roll is one of the best lobster rolls I've had and sucks I have to wait an entire year to get one since I'm only in Boston for work once a year.   It's best to come around the off hours between 3-5 to avoid the long waits.  Just grab an open seat at the bar and chow down on buttered lobster and fries
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
Neptune Oyster is definitely a nice experience.  Had the most freshest cleanest tasting oysters ever here and the lobster roll was pretty great that they gave you so much meat...  but I also think at 30
dollars a sandwich, they'd better give you that much!  A good one time experience when in Boston but don't think I'd wait on line a second time if in the neighborhood... only if I was in the mood to eat a whole lot of oysters!  But be prepared to spend about $3-$4 for each of them.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: Great food and such a cute space.  We had a 30 min wait but they take your phone number and you can walk around the area till they call.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: Definitely! Positively not worth the 2hr wait..for the food or the price. Tasteless and expensive.  As a foodie from NY, I know good food. Raw bar was the only thing decent, just decent mind you, not anywhere near great like Aqua Grill NYC.   Nothing tastes good and I ordered a variety to taste. Anything cooked was basically disappointing, starting with the simple clam chowder which was watery and no clams. Haven't they heard of a RUE plus its a seafood bar, give me some clams. I can go on with each dish ordered but it ends the same,  BAD. And the famous Lobster roll everyone orderes is $29 and not nearly as great in taste n price as Luke's $16.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
I didn't try much lobster rolls on my first trip to Boston. However I did wait three hours for the lobster roll at Neptune. The lobster roll was soooooooo good and humongous.

Don't let the price scare you from this joint. It's worth every penny.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
We had originally hoped to make this restaurant as a family meal spot as we were in Boston prior to boarding a cruise ship. Since we had a party of 12 it was out of the question. A group of us (6 people) were checking out a highly rated bakery down the street from Neptune. We happened to walk down the street and noticed a growing line of people waiting for a place to open. Seeing that it was Neptune Oyster and the doors opened in 12 minutes we thought it would be a good idea to stand in line along with everyone else.
The best decision we made!
We ended up being the last ones in line to get seated. All the reviews that I had read were spot on.
Three of us got lobster rolls. Two mayoed and one buttered. The buttered lobster roll was insanely great. The mayoed were wonderful. A mountain of different oyster and clams followed. Awesome.
I ordered the tuna sandwich. Terrific. Fresh and tastey.
Do not pass this restaurant up.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: Yum! One of my favorite spots in the North End, it's a tiny place and wait times can get crazy long on weekends so try not to go during peak hours or if you do just expect a long wait and grab a pastry around the corner at Mike's while you wait ;)
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
super long wait on a Sat night. They don't take reservations and for 2 people, we were quoted 4 hour wait when we walked in at 7:45pm. We gave the hostess my number and received a call at 9:40pm.  We were walking on the freedom trail so took us a good 20 min to get back. 

Sat at the bar facing the window and saw lots of people on the streets gawking at raw bar's varied oyster selection. :)  

We ordered to share - clam chowder, lobster roll, and baked little necks with bacon and corn.  

The clam chowder was light but flavorful with huge crackers that stayed very crunchy. We liked the soup very much. The baked little necks were really tasty - white wine and bacon. I wish we had bread to soak up the sauce. It was a bit too salty to drink.  Lobster roll was delicious. Nice big chunks of lobster. I have recently been to Maine and the lobster is definitely up to par. But I wish there were some lettuce or celery. I needed a crunch in the lobster salad. The fries were really nicely done tho. Nice and crispy on the outside and soft on the inside with just the perfect amount of seasoning.  The meal w/o wine was $60 total including tax/tip. :) 

We left with very happy tummies even though it was a late dinner.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: Had oysters, fried tuna balls, and the cold loster roll.  Was yummy!  Paired with the Santorini white wine = perfect.  Friendly service as well!
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
maybe more like 3.5, but i'll give it the extra half for freshness...

i took my girlfriend here last week for her birthday, and we loved it.  it's already one of her favorite places, but now one of mine as well.

the food is AMAZINGLY fresh.  the oysters we had were fantastic, as was the harpoon braised shrimp cocktail!  we got the lobster roll and veal/tuna sandwiches for entree's along with a bottle of white wine.

it is expensive, and it is small.  the staff does know their stuff, but once it's full it's harder for them to get around, and due to the layout, they can't have more than 2-3 people serving.  there's only a handful of tables though, but still...  it took a while to get that wine.  and if you get there once it's filled up, be prepared to either wait an hour or go somewhere else, unless you luck out and find a spot at the raw bar (first come, first serve, no names on a list - only for tables).  pretty good sized portions though, and all-in-all, a nice place.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
Pros: Lobster, Chowder, Oysters- lots and lots of Oysters, ice cold Peroni
Cons: The wait (but hey, you're in the North End- go walk around and enjoy!), The realization the meal will end after your first bite

I hope this 2349827th review has been helpful. But seriously, locals and visitors alike, Neptune Oyster is a great treat.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: I had a horrible first time experience here at Neptune Oysters. The host, waiter and waitress was very friendly, but we were seated in front of the door during a snow storm and had the worse experience with the food. It took them about 30+ min. to bring each dish out. Not only that, when our food came out, it was either burnt or under cooked. From my prospective, I wouldn't come here again. The two hours wait just wasn't worth it.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
lobster roll was really good! clam chowder was close to the divine!!!!! oysters were so incredibly fresh as well!

this place is immensely small - and so avoid coming in big groups. you would be sitting next to strangers.

our wait was around 40 minutes on a Thursday evening. however, they take down the mobile numbers of people on the wait-list ... and they would give you a call when your table is ready. (ie, you won't have to waste your youth away waiting outside of the restaurant ... go check out the nice shops nearby or grab a cuppa further down the street!)

this is a BOSTON-MUST-DO!!!
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: LOVE.  Any place where you can say the escargot was amazing, just has to be great.  Who ever says that about escargot?  No one, until you go to a place that just nails it.  Everything else I had was incredible too.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
We came to Neptune Oyster around 1:00 on a Tuesday.  We  were prepared to wait for a long time after reading all of the reviews.  We surprisingly got seated in five minutes.

We came here specifically for the Maine Lobster Roll.  My husband got the cold (with mayo) and I got the hot (with butter).  I definitely got the better sandwich, even though both were good.

The real surprise was the French Fries!!  They were crispy, but soft on the inside and seasoned perfectly!
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: Very very good, it got better spending a little time there. I had 4 oysters. All had descriptions and were very good. The best was the fish. Cooked whole with head and bone. I navigated like a chainsaw through Brie but otherwise a great experience.  After my Hannibal lector like carving I was very proud and very satisfied especially with the succulent side servings which complimented the fish very nicely!
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: How could anyone be in Boston and not have lobsters? Neptune's lobster roll was phenomenal. Even with a hefty $25 a piece, the chucks of buttered lobster overflew the slightly toasted bun. The generous portion crab and bibb lettuce salad was equally delicious. We also tried its clam chowder where I found one of the largest clams ever put in a chowder. Although the space was small and we practically could pick out extra lobster pieces from next tables. Definitely worth the wait!
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: Worth the wait!!!  Fabulous selection on raw bar as well as entrees and over the top lusciousness!
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
Dear owner: your greeter with red hair just lost you a long standing patron. Feel free to reach out if you would like details.

Great food (which you serve) does not require great arrogance. I shouldn't have to beg to put my name on a list after asking a qualifying question about wait time.

I would suggest taking a lead from Jason Bond @Bondir, who, along with his staff, shows that exceptional food can be served in a humble and respectful manner.

If folks want an equally great lobster roll without the scene, go to Alive and Kickin in Cambridge. We'll be taking our business to B&G this afternoon.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
Neptune Oyster is a very popular spot in North Beach so be prepared to wait awhile for a table. With that said, what's cool about it is they take your phone # and call you when you're table is ready. Since you're in North Beach (Little Italy) it's a nice opportunity to walk around and check out some sites, shops, etc. in order to kill some time. Just a quick side note, North Beach totally blows away the lil 3 block joke of a Little Italy we have here in NYC. 

Anyway, I had my first lobster roll ever here at Neptune along with a nice tall glass of Sam Adams and it was heaven. I would imagine Neptune gets it right since they're all the rage. You know what they say...you never forget your first so Neptune Oyster will always hold a special place in my heart lol :-)
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
As a native Bostonian Neptune Oyster is wicked awesome. If you're going to be in Boston and your craving a lobster roll there is no other place unless you plan on driving to Maine. Now be prepare for a long wait during any hour. When I'm back in town, I try to arrive 10 minutes prior to the 11:30 opening and there is usually a line. Oh FYI, if you put your name in and you have over an hour wait, head south and around the corner there's a Boston public library. There is no admission fee to look around and read a book while you're waiting. 

Now the secret to a great lobster roll (lots of sweet tail and crawl meat stuffed into a New England style toasted bun and soaked in HOT butter).  Besides lobster rolls, I have sampled the oysters, clam chowder, mussels and fish tacos and everything is absolutely phenomenal!!

Again, the only downside about this place is the long lines so get there early.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: One of the best spots in Boston, always worth the wait and can't wait to go again!
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: Shrimp cocktail and hot lobster rolls- amazing!
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: Great place. Seating and parking is a bit tough.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: I just had the lobster roll with butter and a side salad for lunch. It was fabulous and I highly recommend. My companion has the special of the day which was a caprese salad that was also great. Even though the seating is very tight, the atmosphere was great and the wait to get seat was not bad.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: Had my first Lobster Roll ever here yesterday! It was so delicious! Definitely coming back!
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
Another great dining experience.

The warm lobster roll tastes better than the cold one. I think the warm butter enhances the lobster flavor. Also, the blue crab cocktail has a lot of flavor.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: You will have to wait but it is worth the quality food! We were told 45min but ended up being like almost double that, but we understood.  Small place that's really popular, it happens.  We ordered a hot lobster roll and the clam chowder.  The lobster rolls are so delicious and much better served hot instead of cold because to me,  I don't taste much of the lobster and instead mostly mayo.  So I 100% recommend getting a hot butter lobster roll if you are having trouble deciding with which to go with because it gives you a chance to enjoy and savor the luscious lobster meat! The clam chowder was also really good but it was just a bit too runny for me.  When I think of chowder,  I think thick and creamy and although it had great flavor and tender clams, just wasn't the consistency I desired. The reason I gave it 4 Stars was because since it's always packed, the door is constantly being left open with people waiting and It gets freezing while you're eating.  The waitress did her best to accommodate her tables as well as control the amount the door was being opened AND phone calling people to let them know there's a table ready.  She had way too much to do but she did great and had a really positive attitude and never once acted like she was getting overwhelmed. I wish I got her name to give a personal shout out!  But if they got that figured out, it would be 5 Stars because the food is great! Would recommend if you've got the time!
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
This little hideaway at the edge of the North End has the best lobster roll south of the New Hampshire state line.  It is an expensive lobster roll at about 30 dollars, but worth trying atleast once.  Not much of a beer selection, but they do have a lot of wine.  I have to say my Harpoon Octoberfest went well with the lobster roll.  They do give you a lot of fresh, quality lobster meat either with butter or mayonnaise.  I chose mayonnaise because I like it that way, even if it may not be the purist way.  The chunks were huge in this famous lobster roll and the meal with fries was savory.

Why not five stars you ask?  Well, the bartender spent most of her time texting.  I have never seen that in my life.  I have seen texting and driving, texting and walking, but never,ever texting and bartending.  And no other employees said anything to this person.  I guess none of them were managers, or atleast none of them were managers that day. If that bartender was the manager for that day, then that is sad. The service wasn't too bad, but it could have been quicker. Furthermore, the ambiance was not that great and this place is too small.

In closing, lobster roll great, service not so great.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: Delicious hot lobster roll! My first lobster roll, and I think I picked the perfect place. Delicious and very fresh butter. Atmosphere is crowded, but not unpleasant. If you don't mind hanging around north beach for an hour or so while you wait to be called, definitely give it a try!
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: One of the best oysters I ever had since visiting Vancouver. Don't forget the lobster roll!!
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
Went to the Legal Seafood down in South Boston the day before and had about a dozen oysters, and thought they were really good. Now, however, after being to Neptune Oyster I know what a good oyster should taste like!

Friendly, casual service. We dined at the bar, but that was very pleasant. Fast service. 

Like many other we had to wait just over an hour for our table, but it was well worth the wait. Just go to one of the other restaurants on the street and have a drink while your table gets ready!
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: Good place for trying out lobsters if you are a traveler in Boston. But you may wait for a long time during busy hours and holidays.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
If you give this place less than 4 stars, you are clearly whiny and impossible to please. Or you just don't know what the best seafood tastes like. 

My all time favorite meal to eat in Boston is the Seared George's Bank Scallops from Neptune's. They are to-die for. I have had scallop dishes from most of the nice restaurants in Boston and nothing even compares. I also don't eat meat so even if you order this dish without the duck, it is still amazing. I have also had their mussels, raw bar, lobster roll, clam chowder, etc. - all delicious. 

And yes, the wait time is really long. But it's not like you have to stand in line like half of the other restaurants in the North End. Non Issue.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
Put your name down, explore North End for two hours, come back and indulge in everything that is Neptune Oyster.

From their notorious selection of oysters to their decadent clam chowder and infamous Lobster Roll, you will not be disappointed.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
The wait to get in this place is ridiculous but I would do it 1000 times because the $25 lobster roll is so worth it. Yes, it's a $25 sandwich but YES, it is worth it.

First time we were here it was mid-afternoon and it was full but we only had to wait about 10 min to be seated at the bar (bar is not a first come, first serve). Second time we came for dinner around 7:30pm or so. First off, to actually get in the restaurant in order to get your name on the list is a paaaainnn. Everybody is trying to get in; there is only a little corner by the door where everybody tries to squeeze in. You have to wait a long time for one of the servers to free up and come with the list to get your name down and then the wait. So, this second time we actually waited 2.5 hours. Ouch! But the good thing is that this place is next to little Italy and around a few bars. So, we just sat down at bar and had like 25 drinks (more like 6) and waited for the call. 

I like my lobster roll hot with butter. None of that cold with mayo nonsense. It comes with fries but who cares about the fries?! Not me (but they're good). We have been here twice and we always split one roll and both times I've regret it because it's so freaking good. I think I eat half of it in 3-4 bites. They don't skimp on the lobster either. That baby is full top to bottom, left to right. We also tried the hamachi ceviche but we didn't like it. Stick to the roll.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: Great food and a cool spot. It's very small and they don't take reservations so you may need to wait. If you are up for that, it's worth it.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: Love this place.  It is really small, and you have to wait in line to get in most of the time.  Once you are in it is totally worth it.  They have the freshest seafood you are going to find.  Everything is great.  The best lobster rolls I have ever had.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: We visited from out of town and they served us the best oysters we've ever eaten. The place is pretty small so expect to wait for a table but it's completely worth it.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
This place was an amazing stop after a not-so-amazing 4 hour train ride from New York.  So if someone's in the mood for delicious seafood eats, where do they go?  Boston, of course!

The seafood here is amazingly fresh and they have a great variety of oysters.  

It's located in a great shopping district too.  Parking can be challenging, but that goes for most places in Boston.  Highly recommended!
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
This is a lovely, typically small North End restaurant which manages to seem like a 19th-century relic even though it's relatively new. The atmosphere is wonderful -- check out the wall-mounted fans with elaborate cast-iron bases, and the pressed tin ceiling. Someone put a lot of thought into this room. And the oysters are the best I've had in Boston (the wine list is stellar as well). 

Can't speak for most of the entrees, because I can't eat 'em, but my husband enjoyed his yellowtail salad. 

(Also, the prices are quite reasonable, given the quality of food and service.)

Celiacs: the kitchen here is small, and the bartender advised me that he wouldn't recommend chancing a request for a celiac-friendly version of any of their cooked dishes. But the oysters are delicious and safely prepared far away from any breadcrumbs.

P.S. Should Neptune lose points for being tiny? I don't think so -- I enjoy  smaller restaurants, personally. I'd rather go to a small "neighborhood" place than a big scene-y restaurant, especially for oysters. Most North End restaurants are crowded and small, actually, so if you're prone to claustrophobia, you should probably dine in another neighborhood.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: Magical oyster selection, great sides, and a burger as decadent and delicious as anything I've ever eaten.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: Neptune Oyster is, by far, one of my favorite places in the world.  I travel frequently, and am always looking for new places to eat.  However, when I am in Boston, I MUST go to Neptune Oyster for a Lobster Roll.  The best Lobster Rolls I have ever had (and I have eaten many).  I prefer mine "hot with butter," however, I also enjoy the "cold with mayo," as well.  The only downside is the size of the restaurant. It is very small and most seating is at the bar.  The raw bar is outstanding and carries many varieties, as well as perfect explanations of each variety.  A bit pricey, but it is understood as you get about a 1 1/2 poind lobster on each Lobster Roll.  Sweet Potato Fries are great as well, and they have some great wines!  One of my must have's when in Boston as well as my favorite places of all time. I have sent many others here and have never had a negative review after!
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: Have been there a couple of times. Very good American seafood.  Busy and crowed place with mostly tourists. Would give four stars if price is more reasonable.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: Such a great restaurant. The employees were very nice and accommodating.  We sat at the very first table and then moved because of the cold draft. As for the food, the lobster roll in butter was DELICIOUS and more than enough food. The clam chowder, I thought, was the best I had all vacation. It's a neat atmosphere and will be coming back when I visit Boston again.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
This is my first meal in Boston! 
Can't believe we managed to get a table here within 15 minutes! The hostess took our names down and told us there will be a 1 hour wait. Who would have thought that she'd call us to return 15 min later:)

Our orders:
Johnnycake: very interesting flavour profile 
Oysters: we tried out everything on the oyster menu. They were all fresh and shucked very well
Cioppino: this cioppino is very unique in that the soup isn't tomato based and it has rice it
Lobster roll: a lot bigger than Luke's lobster's portion, but a lot pricier as well. The bread roll here is not as crispy. This entree dish comes with fries or salad


All in all, it was a very enjoyable dining experience and we will definitely be back
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
They do not take reservations! 

Come in early to put your name down on their list. They will call you 15-20 min before your table is ready. 

We had the Hot lobster roll & Clam chowder. 

We loved the Hot lobster roll, the clam chowder was really running, if you like your chowder that way.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
For the last dinner of my Boston trip, decided to try this much recommended restaurant.

It's small and ridiculously touristy, so be prepared to come early to line up. As in if you want to eat at 8pm, come at 5pm...because that's what we did for our table of 6.

Memorable Orders:

Clam Chowder ($11) -The chowder is runny, like a slightly reduced cream. But the flavour profile is definitely impressive. Settled on the bottom of the soup are lots of cooked clams, potatoes, and other treasures. It's a good bowl of soup, but not the best chowder in the traditional sense.

Maine Lobster Roll ($25) -This was definitely the best part of the meal. The lobster is served chunky instead of ground up, giving that good succulent seafood texture. Drizzled with warm butter and a soft roll, it is to die for!

Cod ($35) - If you happen to come here on a Saturday, the cod is the special of the day which isn't on the regular menu. My advice? ORDER IT. I don't normally like cod but this was was a pleasant surprise. The fish was flakey and light at the touch of a fork, while still being firm when you bite through it. A nice light entree.

Not-so-memorable Orders:

Dayboat Scallop Crudo ($12) -For $12, this Dayboat Scallop Crudo was definitely underwhelming. Barely sharable, and it wasn't anything to write home about. 

Neptunes on Piggyback ($13) -crispy oysters, Berkshire pig, golden raisin confiture, pistachio aioli. It's a little bit of a confusing dish. You don't really know what you are tasting, but all the flavours and textures do work. Decent, but not my top pick from the menu.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: So I don't like seafood but my friends do, so I went with them and got a plain burger. The burger meat was amazing and they don't even specialize in that. The lobster roll was really good (and keep in mind that I hate seafood). Tourists don't really know about it, so don't tell them.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: Overpriced and ridiculous lines, but I still enjoy the place. Just be sure to put your name in 2 hours before you think you will be hungry.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
Lives up to the hype. My friends and I waited over 2 hours and it was well worth it!  We had oysters and lobster rolls--absolutely delicious.

Plan ahead, give your name to the hostess, and walk around the North End for a few hours. Great service and amazing food!
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: This is my favorite restaurant in Boston, hands down. It is 100% worth the wait! You have to start with the Johnny cake - the flavor is so rich and will keep you wanting more. For your entree - the cioppino is AMAZING, the broth is so flavorful and the seafood is incredibly fresh. You also can go wrong with the lobster roll (hot with butter) served with hand cut fries. The service is attentive, friendly, but fast. Neptune does not disappoint.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: Excellent oyster bar and the lobster roll was to die for. Long waits, go early.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: Very cramped, very crowded and somewhat overrated.  The chowder was good but luke warm and bland.  Salt and pepper helped.The lobster roll was very good -a must try.  Service was good.  There are better restaurants with nicer atmosphere for the price
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: One of my favorite places to eat in Boston. This last time I ordered a few oysters (the descriptions are spot on), clam chowder, lobster roll with butter sauce, and the mackerel veracruz with potatoes, chimichurri, and blood orange and fennel salad. The lobster roll is great, but the mackerel. Holy crap. It was one of the best things I have ever put in my mouth. The skin is perfectly crispy, and the flavor combination of the tomato, olive, chimichurri and acid from the oranges is incredible. I cried when I became full and had to leave some uneaten fish behind.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: I love the oysters and my pals LOVED the burger. The clam chowder not so much. Overall just want to say if you are a party of 3 you get skipped over. They only have 18 spots in the restaurant so party's of 2 only had an hour wait, party's of 3 were a 3 hour wait, and party's for 4 were a 2 hour wait. It's what happens when you are an odd number and there is a limited number of spots I guess.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
Neptune Oyster bar feels more like Brooklyn than Boston. It's as if someone transported Prime Meats in Williamsburg, brought it to Boston's North End and substituted steak for seafood. Needless to say, I'm a big fan.

Covered in subway tiles with a long bar that spans the length of the restaurant, there's always a wait for a table, a buzz in the air, and a scene-y energy that makes me feel like I'm back in New York. I prefer a seat at the bar and a pint of a local brew, while scanning that evening's oyster list. There are plenty of local bivalves and beers on tap, but Neptune also flies in West Coast oysters...my personal fave.

Start with a smattering of oyster selects and then move on to crudo; I tried both the hamachi ceviche with jalapeno-lime vinaigrette and the dayboat scallops with local apple marmalade...equally on point. The plated menu items are generously portioned and genuinely prepared with seasonal ingredients you can feel good about. The fare is "elevated seafood shack" featuring: fried Ipswich clams, buttermilk johnnycakes with smoked trout tartare and caviar, whole fish grilled a la plancha, and their signature dish, your choice of a hot butter or cold mayo Maine lobster roll served with french fries. For me, a hot buttered bun gets my vote every time.

Bonus: there's not a TV playing a Boston sports game in sight! Like I said, elevated.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
A couple of suggestions: 
1. Go on a Monday. 
2. Get there early. 
3. Get the Monday special (Lobster Spaghetti) and a WARM Lobster Roll. 
4. Enjoy.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: LOVE LOVE LOVE. The oysters had so much flavor and the lobster roll (hot) was beyond my expectations....AMAZING. Definitely worth the hype!!!
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: Oh my god, I want to eat at this place everyday. If I lived in Boston I would. We shared a hot lobster roll and a cold, couldn't say which was better, they were both delicious. The highlight of the meal were the fried Ipswich clams. So tender, so delicious. I will be back here again!
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
I've been here multiple times, but have never written a review because I felt like there were already enough reviews that said the same thing. However, I thought I might as well so here I am! My most recent visit here was with my sister and we came on a Thursday evening so it was fairly easy to get a seat compared to the weekend (the time before that I came with my fiance and we waited at least 2 hours to get seated!). So the bottom line with reservations is come early, especially on Friday-Sunday, and at least put your name down so they can call you when a table is ready because they are a small, yet incredibly busy joint. 

So this may come as a shock, but I actually do not like raw oysters. Yes, roll your eyes and be disgusted with me, but I just never got into them. With that, you may ask, "So Kevin what do you order when you're there?" Hot lobster roll that's what. Even the first time I came here I didn't really eat lobster, but slowly but surely my fiance opened my eyes to the deliciousness of these ocean dwellers. The lobster rolls here are the bomb and I've had several other ones in Bar Harbor, Maine. The amount of lobster you get is fantastic and when you throw the flavors in there you just have the perfect combination of quantity and quality. 

It is decently priced, but if you like lobster rolls then you'll like this one. But if you're looking for help with raw oysters then scroll to the next review (although, my fiance absolutely loves the island creek oysters if that's any consolation and she's tried most of them) :)
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
Hubba hubba, hot lobster roll!

All I can say is that if I were on death row, the hot lobster roll here is a top contender for my last meal ever - it's that good! The lobster is generously buttered & piled high on a roll. The roll soaks up all that flavorful goodness & pretty much because butter with a side of bread. But the lobster is the main attraction. The chunks are huge & you get a ton of that tender sweet sweet lobster. Ahh, I'm drooling just thinking about it!! At $25 a pop, it might be offensive to your wallet, but once your taste buds have at it, you will not mind paying a mountain of gold for a lobster roll. 

The oysters here are amazing as well! They have so many varieties & describe each of them based on size, texture, saltiness, and finish. I felt like I learned so much about oysters the two times I came here in two days. That's right, i loved it so much I went twice in two days!

The place is small & can get packed all day long, so I suggest getting there early, putting your name on the wait list (they call you when it's your turn to be seated) & just wander around the North End, even explore some of the Freedom Trial while you wait to work up your appetite. 

A must visit for your trip to Boston!
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
Wow, this place is amazing! When there is a 1.5 hour wait and people are willing to stay, that's a sign of the delicious food that's coming.

We were told a 45 minute wait when we initially got there, but it ended up being closer to a 1.5 hour wait since a group of people at the bar were slow to leave after finishing their meal. We were in a rush to eat since we had tickets to a Celtics game shortly after, so we had already made up our minds and ordered as soon as we sat down.

We both ordered a bowl of the clam chowder and a lobster roll. The clam chowder had great flavor, but the texture was too watery for my liking. The crackers were also way too hard (stale?) and overpowered the chowder. I'm glad I only tried one.

The lobster roll, on the other hand, was so freaking amazing! It's the best lobster roll I had the entire week I was in Boston, hands down. Probably the best lobster roll I've ever had. It was made with butter vs. mayo. The lobster was cooked perfectly and was incredibly juicy. Add to that the buttery, super soft roll and it becomes perfection. YUM.

If I'm ever back in Boston, I'm definitely coming here again!
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
Heidi L. you are my hero.  Good call on this spot as it was one of the local favorites around North End too.  Even though the three of us split only a single lobster roll, 6 oysters, 3 clams, it was good enough to say that this is one of my favorite spots coming to Boston for.  

The people were all very friendly, even the lady who waited in line with us was offering all these great suggestions.  Congrats on the 5 year anniversary, and I'll definitely have to come back for a more intense meal instead of trying to fit 3 dinners in one day.   Which reminds of the great contrast with 3 guys sharing one lobster roll vs 3 grown adults next to us each ordering one for themselves....those fatasses.....how I envy them.

The MA oysters were delicious, and the lobster roll HOT (with butter) is one of the best I've had (instead of the mayo).
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
If I had to choose my last meal right now, it would consist of a Neptune Burger and at least 6 scoops of JP Licks Cookies and Cream ice cream...but that's for another Yelping time.  The Neptune Burger is no ordinary beefalicious experience.  It has cheese (delicious cheese), garlic mayo relish (delightful relish) and to top it all off and make for an unforgettable burger adventure... a fried oyster.  It's genious I tell you and their fries absolutely kickass as well.  It's well worth the $14 bucks and I highly recommend it.

However, something horrible happened to me the last time I visited this quaint, hole-in-the-wall, get to know your neighbor cause you're practically sitting in their lap restaurant....they ran out of oyster burgers.  I went through all the the usual stages of such trama induced grief - denial, "no that can't be.." anger, "how could you??," bargaining, "i know you've got at least one more back there...how much do you want for it?", depression "i can't go on...so..hungry..." and finally acceptance, aided by my boyfriend who helpfully bought me another beer and kindly told me to pull myself together, "you're embarassing me."

And that's how I came to know Neptune's second best dish:  the Maine Lobster Roll...served hot w/ butter.  Delectable...and well worth the $25 bucks because this thing comes LOADED w/ lobster meat.  Another highly satsifying meal...start this off with a dozen of their broad array of oysters and you're in for an excellent dining experience.  The waitstaff is very friendly, helpful and incredibly knowledgeable about the food and drink selections.

Tips:  

- Come for an early dinner or a very later dinner, very limited seating and this place fills up fast!

- Great for a date night but go elsewhere for big groups (you'll be waiting forever to sit down and will have to endure the unpleasant glares of those waiting for a table for the duration of your meal)
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: sat at the bar and ate my heart out. uni toast, clam chowder, lobster roll and of course the OYSTERS. enjoy. the food and flavors here hit the spot.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: I was sadly disappointed. We went here because I have some people that were out of town visiting and because it was my birthday. We tried many of the raw oysters and I wasn't that impressed. The best ones were the ones from Nova Scotia, and the most expensive of course. The cherrystone calms weren't at all sweet, more salty. The waitress kind of messed up our order so we ended up with three fish dishes. I can't remember what they are anymore because it was a while ago but one of them tasted very fishy while the other two were pretty good. Their calm chowder is a lot watery then expected and I feel that they put too much "crunchy stuff" and not enough calms. I'm disappointed that they ran out of vanilla lobster and because the waitress messed up we didn't get to try the lobster roll. I also felt that most of the things were too pricey.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: Damn, I really wanted to NOT like this place because I couldn't bear the thought of not getting in or waiting for 2 hours on a Friday when I really really craved it but it was hands down the best lobster roll I've ever had in Boston / the Boston, cape and islands area. My husband and I ordered the cold and hot and split them in half and shared them. I usually don't like lobster tail and prefer the claw because I find it tender. The lobster was cooked so perfectly that every bite, claw or tail melted in your mouth the way lobster should.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: Overrated. Waited in lined for 2.5 hours for an average lobster roll and crab claw. Fries were good. I would not go back. Better options elsewhere.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
It's small. The wait is forever. And it's really small.

Was it worth it?  Hell yes!

We arrived at 5pm and it was already full with an hour wait. There's no bar to wait at. There's not even room right inside the door to wait. They put you on a list and take your cell number to text/call when it's your turn to enter heaven. It allows you to wander the North End looking at shops, have a cocktail, etc. That's civilized. I've always wondered why most restaurants don't do that. Finally somebody listened to my prayers!

You will be packed in shoulder to shoulder with other patrons. I didn't like that part. The air conditioning couldn't keep the place cooled appropriately.

We were seated at the bar facing the window on the street. That made for some great people watching while we waited for our food. The drawback was that it put us next to the door and folks would stand there for long periods of time holding it open letting out precious air condition. I'd be lying if I didn't say that I enjoyed it just a bit when people wandered in and were told it was two plus hours wait while we already had seats.

They have a great selection of oysters, crab claws, etc. We picked about 14 or so. They were all fresh and prepared perfectly. No broken shells, clean shells, the muscle was fully detached, etc. The guy prepping them was right in front of us and we watched him discard several oysters if he broke the shell or made any minor mistake. My only minor complaint was I asked for horseradish and it was provided floating as a dollop in cocktail sauce.

Our entrees didn't disappoint either.  Cooked and seasoned perfectly. If you can manage to get a seat you should go.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: Well...we finally made it after making multiple attempts this year to unsuccessfully get in. Let's start with the food. I started with a half dozen oysters. Easily the best oysters I have ever had. I love the amount of liquid that they are able to keep in the oyster when they serve it to you, it really adds to the taste. We also shared the clam chowder. The chowder was good, definitely on the peppery side (which isn't a bad thing) and not necessarily as thick as I like it but the taste was very good and I thought the clams were good as well. For our entrees we got the hot lobster roll and the cioppino. The lobster roll was ridiculous. I am definitely sold on connecticut style. My only complaint is that the roll didn't necessarily seem up to the task of holding on to that much buttery lobster. Other than that though, amazing. My cioppino was very good as well and contained quite a bit of seafood. It looks kinda small at first, but in the end it turns out to definitely be enough food. The service was fine for such a fast paced place. I can't say that it was stellar by any means, but it was more than acceptable for a place of this size with epic wait times. Overall, the food was 5 stars and the service was good enough to not drag it down...so that is 5 yelp stars in my book.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
For food, this place gets a 5.. As for service.. Bad. Really bad. The service staff is great! However, the owner was horrible. 

As a chef, I could tell he was the owner.. You just can sense it by their attitude/way they carry themselves. So I thought, great! Well... This is where I was wrong!! He was the worst.. 

I had to beg for water 2x, he let our oysters sit on the counter.. 2 feet from us.. Read the ticket.. And left them there. The waitress came by 5 min later.. Read the ticket and handed it to us. We were siting at the bar.. And if you've been here.. It's not that big!! And he was right in front of us!

We ordered dinner, he took my order, but we had to flag him down to take my co-workers order.. Mind you.. We were both there.. Waiting with menus. 

When it came time to pay the bill.. What a nightmare.. He took forever. 

My co-worker said, "well.. I guess that's why he's the bartender." And I replied, "no, because it didn't look like he cared about tips like most bar staff do.. This guy.. Is the owner." Sure enough.. I was correct.. And he was a major di*khole.

Food was great, some of the most tender octopus I've ever eaten, and I've been to 30% of the world in traveling, cooking, and eating. 

If you wanted people to know you're the owner, wear a shirt or tag.. Don't treat your patrons poorly
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
Loved this place! We got here around 11:15 on a Saturday, luckily the line was short-ish, but it quickly grew as it got closer to opening time. We were lucky to get seated in first seating. We (2ppl) ordered a lobster roll with salad, the Johnny cakes, scallops, some oysters and clams. It was perfect amount and we were stuffed! The lobster roll was out of the world delicious with generous, meaty portions. And what was surprisingly good was the Johnny cakes, which is like a pancake with sugary crusty edges plus a bit of seafood and caviar on top. It was such a unique but balanced blend of flavors - highly recommended!!
The lobster roll is good for 2 people to share, this way you can try other dishes and oysters! Also get the salad instead of fries - your stomach will thank you!
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: Adding to the Neptune love, nothing to add to the already informative reviews.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: Love the johhnnycake! Oysters are great too. I enjoyed the atmosphere of the small oyster bar. The lobster roll ia very decent, but not as good as the one I had at Luke's Lobster in PHilly
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
I've eaten here 5-6 times over the last few years. It's always and hour + wait wait anytime after 4PM. Usually the wife and I buy some wine and drink it out of plastic cups in the nearby graveyard like hobos until the call us for our table. 
The fried clams  are the best when compared to the lousy New England tourist trap/shacks that littler our roads. Lightly battered and cooked in clean oil. 
The lobster sandwiches, wines, raw bar, specials and even the burgers are great.
Expensive!
