categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: hot lobster roll + oysters. perfect.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
We arrived at around 3 PM on a Saturday and were seated right away. Apparently it's tough to get a table at peak hours, so this was perfect.
To start off we tried a dozen different oysters and much like with wines, they all had distinct  flavors and textures. The oysters were so fresh that I didn't have a need for helpings other than lemon, although their shallot vinaigrette is delicious.
As an entree I had the cioppino which was finger licking good, although a little on the salty side - and I don't mind salt. However, the langostinos were very fresh and the rice was perfectly cooked, which is a little tough to pull off with this dish.
The service was prompt and attentive even after it started filling up. Neptune definitely pays attention to detail, you even see this in the pearly gloss surface of their beautifully printed business cards.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
The hot butter lobster roll is the best lobster roll ever.  The mayo version is out of my life forever.  I don't understand why people like to mask the lobster with goopy mayo.  The hot butter is the way to go.  The toasted roll held up well to the lobster and hot butter sauce.  The fries were fresh cut and some of the best fries we've had in a while.  Every fry off the 3 lobster roll plates was eaten. 

The clam chowder was a little disappointing.  Too watery for me.  Not enough cream and richness to the broth even though there were huge clams in the chowder.

The steamed clams with white wine, garlic and parsley was refreshing.  The sauce was tasty.  We could have eaten several orders of these. 

I was a little disappointed with the raw oyster and clams.  They were good no doubt but not as good as Legal Sea Foods.  It was nothing special but I think that is probably due to my preference for the smaller west coast oysters.  We tried some of the local oysters and this just isn't my favorite type.  Too meaty for me.  The clams were good but didn't have the same meaty salty balance.

Go for the hot butter lobster roll.  Don't kid yourself.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: First stop in Boston and it was . Oysters, Lobster Roll. The place is charming just as the street its on in the North End.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: You know those places people hype up to the point where even if it is that great you'll want to find something wrong with it? That is sort of the case here, but I can't find any critique at all. I went here for dinner on a Friday night, after putting my name in and grabbing a coffee down the street. The oysters, as you'd expect, are amazing. But that lobster roll. Yes, it is expensive. Yes you'll get more for your money in other places. No, you won't find a better roll. Mine was hot, served with butter. That first bite made me realize that some things in life can meet the hype. This is one of those.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
Neptune himself must have blessed this tiny oyster bar. 

After indulging in the lobster roll (with hot butter sauce) from Neptune, I feel compelled to update the "My Last Meal on Earth" category in my Yelp profile. Sorry Shake Shack, it was fun while it lasted. 

The amount of lobster they stuff in this sandwich could feed a small village for days. Imagine a volcano erupted on your roll and all that came out was lobster. 

The oyster bar was phenomenal as well. The freshest ones we had in Boston were right here at Neptune.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
Went out to eat for my birthday and all I can say is OMG! Best lobster roll I've ever had in my life!! The food was amazing!! 
The restaurant is tiny so plan on waiting but they do a great thing there- When you put your name down they take your cell phone number and call you when your table is ready, allowing you to explore the area instead of standing there waiting on a table. 
I can't wait to go back and get another delicious lobster roll!
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: Great food, great wine selection, best selection of oysters. Long wait....no longer a hidden gem.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: Great spot for fresh shell fish and seafood dishes in the North End.  Tight quarters and be prepared to wait for a table, they don't take reservations and the place is always busy.  The food is always great.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: Hot lobster roll was awesome. Best in Boston.  Clam chowder a bit watery...not much content. Service a bit slow but that is because everything is made to order.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: As soon I was done with my lobster roll....I was ready for another. Really. It's that damn good. Warm and buttery awesomeness.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
My friends and I wanted to grab lunch here on a Saturday afternoon around 1:30. Unfortunately, the wait was 3 hours! It's kind of a small restaurant. On the right is bar seating and on the left is some tables. They only have one unisex restroom that's very clean. We really wanted to eat here since we had heard so many good things about it. Fun Fact, many celebrities like Mark Walhberg and Justin Timberlake have eaten here! 

The Food: Their oysters are a MUST! We ordered the Island Creek, Katama Bay, Mookie Blue, and Kumamoto Oysters. My favorite was the Island Creek ones, but the others were also really good. Who knew that eating oysters could be so fancy? The menu listed salinity, size, and even a special remark about each oyster!  Also, who knew oysters could taste like fruits? The Kumamoto had an interesting Honeydew aftertaste to it. 

For Appetizers, we ordered the Well Fleet Clam Chowder and Yellowfin Coyne Crostini (Tuna Tartare). The clam chowder is made fresh to order and is very generous with portions of clam. It was definitely one of the best clam chowders I've ever had! Most restaurants made the mistake of adding to much salt, but the one here is perfect. The Tuna Tartare was also very fresh and came with a piece of bruschetta bread.

The Service: Despite being busy the whole time, I liked that our server stopped by frequently to check on us and answer any questions that we had. He was very friendly, fast, and didn't rush us at all

Overall, our experience here was amazing! This is one of my favorite restaurants in Boston now. Yes, it's expensive, but the food here is worth every penny!
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: I have never heard anybody who doesn't like Neptune Oyster. Thanks to the friend who brought me here. They serve lobster roll in warm with butter and cold with mayo(?). Most people like to have the warm version because its one of Neptune's signature dish. I also heard compliments on their crab burger. I will make sure I try it next time I go! The only disadvantage is the restaurant is too small to serve so many fans.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
the lobster roll is amazing. it comes on a the hot buttery toasted roll. thankfully we split it between 2 people - it is so stuffed with lobster chunks, there's no way i could have finished it alone. $25.

the chowder is thin. if you don't like watery (in consistency, not taste) chowder, dont order it.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
I don't think that there is anything I can say about Neptune's that hasn't been said. I went recently while two friends were visiting Boston and it very literally changed my life. The wait is ridiculously long - but it's immediately forgiven when you sit down for a meal there. We got the Neptune plateau to start - so that they large shareable smorgasbord of oyster/sardine/shrimp/clam heaven. Ridiculously fresh and without a grain of sand. 

The entrees were equally amazing. My fiancee and I went into the meal seafood enthusiasts and walked out snobs. Other food just has not stacked up the same since.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: What the shuck? Was I at the same oyster bar you guys are talking about?  After reading these reviews, I'd be scared to go near the place.  Makes it sound like yuppy hell.  Out of town Yelpers -- here is the deal on this place.  Out of this world fresh oysters.  I know.  We have an oyster bed in our backyard and we eat 'em serious fresh every chance we get.  This place is one of the first restaurants I've ever been to that comes close to "just out of the water" fresh.  People wearing jeans slurping 'em down by the dozen.  Ice cold beer on a hot summer night and an awesome place to people watch.  Alot of fun and I will definitely go back
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
thank you yelpers for this amazing find! wanted to find a good seafood joint to hit up on my recent trip to boston and had to try this place based on all the great reviews. 

went in on a friday night for dinner and was surprised at how small the place was. i know, i know if you read the reviews, people mention that it's small and you're rubbing elbows with your neighbors but i didnt know what to really expect. so yes, it's small.. very small. but, it gives it this cute cafe'esque type of feel to it that i really enjoyed. the ambiance is friendly, chatty, people talking, drinking vino and enjoying their meals. we had to wait 30-40 minutes but we gave them our name and number and wandered around the north end and grabbed a cup of joe.

upon being seated, you are presented with a raw bar menu that lists the oysters (or other raw item), its origin, price, and description. it was awesome because you can see the different oysters that are available and know what to expect in terms of taste and size. it was very helpful for us since we are not as familiar with east coast oysters as we are with the west coast ones. we ordered a dozen oysters (6 diff kinds) and also 2 stone crab claws. all were fresh and delicious. then we had to have the lobster roll after reading so much about them and oh my... these things are so yummy!! i dont typically like lobster rolls because im used to the cold lobster with a ton of mayo on a huge piece of cold bread. but, i got a hot lobster roll at neptune oyster and it is the standard that lobster rolls should be held to. there were chunks of huge lobster meat on a warm toasted bun with melted warm butter. SO AMAZING. the $25 price tag is well worth the huge amounts of lobster you get... along with a huge side of warm, crisp seasoned fries. topped with a bottle of prosecco and great service from our bartender, and our dinner was complete.

hehehe... and we had such a great meal that night that i cancelled our lunch the next day before we flew home and went back to neptune oyster to indulge in one last lobster roll.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: A favorite neighborhood spot of ours, Neptune Oyster rarely disappoints.  The oysters are fresh and delicious but expect to be shoulder to shoulder with other diners.  It's not a spot for a quiet, romantic dinner but rather a fun night out spent sitting at the wine bar and enjoying the seafood.  Last night, a rainy Tuesday evening, we sauntered in around 7pm and were fortunate to find a nearly deserted bar.  The bartender quickly took our drink orders - favorites from the beer & wine list that we've discovered on other visits -  a glass of the Pigato white wine for me (a delicious Italian light, dry white) and a Whale's Tale Pale Ale for my husband.  A few oysters followed.  Our tried and true favorite is the Island Creek which we mixed with 2 less familiar names.  Neptune serves what is fresh and in season so there is always a new mollusk  to sample.  After drooling over it on other visits, my husband had the Neptuneburger and was it delicious.  Served on a brioche bun and topped with a fried oyster and garlic aoli, it's filling and I was lucky to have a quarter of it land on my plate!  I had the Crab Louis Salad (over butter lettuce with a nutty vinaigrette) and it was also good.  It must have had over a pound of crab on it.  On other visits, I've ordered the cioppino which is also a good choice and the lobster roll is full of big chunks of meat.  Neptune has certainly been "discovered" since we first dined there but my fingers are crossed that they never expand and stay true to their oyster/wine bar charm!
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: i hate this place for being so good! everytime i go i wait in line for almost an hour. i guess thats the price you pay for eating the best lobster roll EVER!
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: Worth it! The oysters were fresh and delicious. The server behind the bar was friendly and super helpful with any questions we had...the North End Cioppino was amazing and the bread they served with it was delicious,as well. We did wait about an hour and a half...but just walked over to nearby bar and had a couple of drinks.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: The best lobster roll I've ever had. Get the butter. Also amazing oysters and service was outstanding.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: I ordered lobster roll and clam chowder today. Both were great! I like this place.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: I like the food at Neptune, but I am not into touristy places. I think it is a must for visitors, but not for locals.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: Excellent mid day meal on our day 2 of our 8 day vacation to the Boston area.  The food, ALL of it, was worth the hour wait!  The local oysters, fried clams and lobster rolls are outstanding!! We had perfectly paired sparkling wine with our meal.  The small and intimate space is classic North end and service was great!!!
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
Wanting to show my visiting friend some of Boston's best raw seafood offerings, we decided to stop by Neptune for some oysters and clams.  I'd been meaning to finish up sampling all of their oyster varieties, so here we go:

Thatch Island, MA (buttery, light briny taste)
Bluepoint, CT (smooth)
Taylor Bay, MA (overly salty)
Pemaquid, ME (zesty)
Ninigret, RI (lightly salty)
Fanny Bay, BC (melon flavor, cucumber finish)

The Fanny Bay oysters took the cake with their standout, layered flavor that transitioned well from beginning to end.  In fact, I'd say it beats out the lauded Kumamotos for my top pick.  I had some white to go with the midday snack and I continue to be thoroughly impressed with their selections by the glass:

Puiatti, Chardonnay 'Zuccole', Fruili, 2009 (mild butter notes, full body, dry finish)
Gramona, Muscat 'Gessami', Penedes, 2008 (medium body, mild sweetness, honey and lemon notes)

Both were fantastic and I would especially recommend the latter considering that I'm not even a fan of Muscatos in general.  Excellent food as always and I WILL get the Triton platter one of these days! XD
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: This place is absolutely INCREDIBLE! This place is small and there's usually a pretty long wait. I waited about an 1 hour for a table but it was so worth it! The waitress (Tiffany) was so nice to me I thought she was in my family. I ordered a lobster roll and a platter of oysters. The lobster roll came out first steaming hot. Just the smell alone was amazing. And I came to this restaurant AFTER I had already had 3 pieces of pizza. When I took a bite of the lobster roll I suddenly felt hungry for lobster. It was buttered perfectly and the bread was great to. After I thought it couldn't get any better they brought out the oysters. Now I don't particularly eat oysters that much but I thought I would try some. These were by FAR the best oysters I had ever tasted. I gulped down every single one. Overall I thought this was probably the BEST seafood spot in Boston.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: MY FAVORITE OYSTER PLACE IN AMERICA!!!! Not kidding. I always come here when I'm in Boston. The uni toast as an appetizer is super delicious. Lobster rolls, spaghettini, and sea urchin bucatini are all amazing. You can't go wrong with anything here.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
Nothing better. Yea the wait sucks, but oh well, because this place is packed out and tiny. Food is incredible and my mouth waters just thinking of it. 

Luckily, I got there at around 5PM, just in time to get a seat before the swarming dinner rush. 

What to get? LOBSTER ROLL. Ugh so good. Buttery goodness.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: Had a 4hr wait, came back the next day instead.  Clam chowder was tasty but a bit runny for my preference.  Lobster roll was legit.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
Excellent selection of oysters from all over! Very impressive :) Clam chowder was good if you like Manhattan style. Warm buttery lobster roll was in fact excellent.

I got in for lunch on a rainy Monday so the place was slow.. Staff was clearly bored and did not seem to care about its patrons. So the service was a bit of a disappointment.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
Excellent oysters and lobster rolls! The lobster rolls come with a tasty side salad and you can order the lobster cold with mayo or hot with butter (I recommend hot with butter). Also, the restaurant provides you with a card that decribes the taste of each oyster (saltiness, etc.) to help you pick the oysters you want to order, which is super helpful! 

The wait can be absolutely insane, however. We waited 3 hours for a table for 2! Not sure it's worth the wait, given that there are other great seafood places in the area with much shorter wait times.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: I have anxiously waited to go here for a few months and the wait was definitely worth it! I was lucky with only having to wait 30 minutes for a seat. I started off with the clam chowder and a variety of oysters. Everything was delicious! The clam chowder was not as thick and creamy as usual New England clam chowder, so it wasn't the best clam chowder I've had, but it was still extremely flavorful. There were a lot of oyster options and a description of each was provided, which helped in choosing them. For the main dish I got the hot lobster roll and it was the best lobster roll I've ever had! It came with so much fresh lobster meat on a delicious bun. Highly recommend getting the lobster roll - It's big enough to split! Can't wait to come back.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
One of the best things about Neptune is that they are willing to take your name down and let you know when there are seats for you.

My girlfriend and I went in at 5:30pm and received our phone call around 7:30pm (even their estimated wait time was accurate!) So you could do the same and just walk around nearby attractions.

We ordered different oysters for appetizer, and they were amazing. We also shared their Lobster Roll and it was quite different than Luke's Lobster rolls. With the warm butter added in the lobster rolls, we could really taste the lobster meat itself with not too many complicated flavours.

Great experience.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: After coming to Boston several times, I realized I had never eaten a lobster roll so I made it my mission to find the best one I could try. When I arrived around noon on a Saturday, the wait was already about 2hours. You can't call ahead for reservations or get food for take out here. Since I was starving, I decided to come back the next day. The wait was a little bit shorter (1.5hrs). It is a very small restaurant, but it's close to the Sowa market so you can wander around there while you wait. Seats at the bar made it quick to order. I started with the clam chowder which was delicious. Large pieces of clam and potato, but not too thick and creamy that it filled me up. I definitely still had room for the lobster roll. I decided to go with the butter lobster roll (comes with salad or fries) instead of mayo and I wasn't disappointed. There was so much lobster it would fall onto my plate when I bit into it! I savored every bite because they definitely don't skimp on the main ingredient! Although it was a long wait, there's a reason this place has over 3000 reviews.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: First of all, the food is good, oysters are very delicious and reasonably priced. But the service was the very unpleasant. We were told the waiting is going to be two hours and when it is time, they would give a phone call. So we left the phone number and went to wander around. After we get called and came back. We still waited for half an hour by the door while other groups came later than us got seated. Even the food is good, I would not go there again if I keep getting this kind of service.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
Good God Almighty - this place is delicious.

1) Neptune's is a tiny, tiny place that seats about 30 so wait or put you name down to be called back.  If you're smarter, you'd call weeks in advance to get a reservation (if they take them).  We put our name down, walked around, snacked on some cannolis and about 3 hours later, received a call back and were glad we came in.

2) Order the oysters.  Any of them.  All of them. They are fresh and you kind of have to feel sorry for the shucker because of how many they have to shuck, but still, order them.

3) Then order the cioppino.  This is the BEST EVER cioppino I've had in my life.  Good thing they gave us bread to soak up all the soupy goodness.  Not a drop went to waste.

4) The lobster roll was delicious, tenderly cooked lobster perfection.  After taking a bite of my husband's cioppino, it was hard to go back to my lobster roll.  Good thing he doesn't mind sharing.

We ordered a couple of glasses of wine and that was it.  We were stuffed and very happy to walk back to our hotel, which was quite far....

Do not miss place this while in Boston!
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
Finally got a table within 2 hours after almost 2 years in Boston.  Score.  Got a plate of oysters, and their descriptions of the flavors are spot on (cucumber, honeydew, butter, anyone?).  Double score.  Ordered the Johnnycake with smoked trout and caviar.  Amazingly delicious triple score.  We dared some people to order the johnnycake and offered to pay for it if they didn't like it.  They never claimed that one.  Warm lobster roll with Old Bay seasoned crispy french fries.  Icing on the cake quadruple score.  The service is spot on, and the bar is a great place to park yourself.  

Well worth the wait, but get there before 7 pm, as they sometimes shut down the waiting list once it passes a 3 hour wait.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
Made my way here away from my conference to get a meal with my best man.  Multiple citations of having the best lobster roll in town (which they better have, at $25 a roll), so I had to give it a whirl.

Very crowded, so get here early, and then expect to go wander the streets of Boston or hang out at a bar somewhere to wait for them to call you when your seat is ready.  (Excellent choice by the way, instead of forcing people to wait around outside the restaurant).

Sat down and ordered up a slew of oysters to try, two lobsters rolls (one hot, one cold), Neptune's on Piggback, and Clam Chowder.  Here's the word:

Clam Chowder:  Excellent flavor, very fresh tasting ingredients from the clams to the potatoes and herbs.  A bit watery for my tastes (probably because I grew up on thick creamy Campbells like 95% of the US population), but even with the wateriness, there was no lacking in flavor.  

Neptune's on Piggyback - Oh lordy, this was good... perfectly fried oysters on well made pork with golden raisins and pistachio aioli.  This is some fine dining... my only regrets are that I had to share this with my friend, and that there wasn't more when we licked the plate clean.

Oysters and clams:  We ordered up a selection of Katama Bay, Bees River, Kumomoto, Kusshi, Little Necks, and Cherrystones.  All were excellent, fresh and delicious... stand outs were the Kumomoto (large and good flavor), as well as the Katama Bays.  

Lobster Rolls:  The main course... we dove into the cold (mayo based) and hot (garlic oil based) and compared the two.  Maybe it was the slightly chilled rainy day, but I preferred the hot with the warm garlic oil softening the nicely toasted bread.  Both were excellent, the lobsters were cooked perfectly tender, and very enjoyable.  $25 worth?  I'm not fully convinced... you'll have to decide that for yourself... but definitely the best lobster roll I've had to date.

Verdict:  If you've got time in Boston and don't 'mind a little wait, definitely worth checking out for the raw bar, the Neptune on Piggyback, and potentially the lobster roll.  I would love to go back for raw bar and Neptune on Piggyback alone, and still undecided about the lobster roll.  Perhaps trying some more lobster rolls will give me some better perspective...
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
Came here during a weekend trip. I'm a huge fan of lobster rolls and couldn't resist! The wait was over an hour on a late Sat afternoon but lucky for us they called after only about 20minutes to tell us they could seat us. Awesome! 

The lobster roll - had the warm lobster roll with butter, the lobster was the best I've ever had in a lobster roll hands down SO FRESH. Perfectly warm, tons of buttery goodness. BUT I was not a fan of the actual roll at all, almost stale and not a great flavor. I'm still giving 5 stars because the lobster itself was so good and the sampling of oysters were fantastic with the perfect pairing of sauces.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
After going to Neptune Oyster a few times, I've decided it's one of my favorite restaurants in Boston. 

I agree with other reviews that have noted slow service and high prices. But here's the thing--I don't mind long lunches or dinners (in some circumstances) and I definitely don't mind paying high prices for fabulous food. Granted, I won't go regularly since I'm living on a grad school budget, but for a splurge, it's great. 

First tip: if you sit at the bar, things tend to move a little faster. You're right in front of them so there's no ignoring an empty dish or glass.

Second tip: Even if you're not a huge fan of eating an entire meal full of raw seafood (like I do), Neptune Oyster has wonderful alternatives for you--particularly their daily specials in the corner of the menu. I sampled my boyfriend's fish and chips (he's one of those who doesn't live off raw seafood) and it was honestly the best I've ever had. It was an ACTUAL filet of fish instead of those pathetic pieces they normally fry up for fish and chips. It was perfectly battered and the fries were awesome. I was really, really surprised that they did such a good job with it.

I've had a various assortment of the oysters they offer plus the clam chowder, hamachi, and a few other random entrees. I'm allergic to lobster and crab--so I can't attest to that myself. I can only repeat rave reviews from my parents when they last came with me.

The oysters are always amazing. Super fresh, absolutely the best quality and always presented well. I order extra kumamodo (sp??) and kusshi. I'm a huge fan of the small, plump oysters that are less briny than the bigger ones. But I'll eat (and appreciate) any oyster. I could literally eat an entire meal of those two oysters alone with a glass of white wine and be the happiest person in the world.

The clam chowder isn't everything I hoped it would be. It has great quality ingredients and the clams are wonderful but the soup was a little thin for me. But that might just be personal preference.

Whatever fabulous sea bass concoction was offered the second time I was there with my boyfriend....oh my god. Insanely delicious. The fish just melted in your mouth. I believe it also came with a polenta that made my day.

Hamachi--always a winner. Beautifully presented and absolutely delicious.

Triton platter--supposedly incredible. My parents split it during my most recent visit and I, sadly, could not partake...but they talked about it through the night and into the next day. The lobster salad was a huge winner, as were the mussels, clams and oysters. The shrimp were HUGE. Oh dear lord were they big. And supposedly also quite good. Needless to say, I was insanely jealous. 

The trick to Neptune Oyster is to not go during extended peak hours. Go for lunch (same menu, smaller crowd) or around 9ish if you can stand a late dinner. Personally, I love long lunches so I love going (when I can, obviously), in the early afternoon and just eating as much as humanly possible. Maybe that's what made the slower table service more acceptable my last visit. It was also only one waitress for the whole restaurant and she tried to be as attentive as possible so I respect her for that. I've also never, ever had a problem with any of the staff at the restaurant. They have always treated me with respect and have been very friendly through the meal.

Final tip: Put your name in when you're not hungry, wander around the great little shops in the area, then indulge when they call you. Don't expect to immediately get in. It's a tiny, tiny restaurant and it's always crowded. But it's crowded for a reason.... So not a place to go on a whim unless it's some weird hour of the day because you'll face a long wait and get cranky. Just take a breath, relax and enjoy.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: The oyster selections are good. Like to try different oysters for reasonable price. Be sure to arrive early cuz always packed. Kinda like a hidden place.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
Small, crowded, a LONG wait, nearly no parking available, tourist location, and yet - what brings me back? Ah, yes - that's right, it's the FOOD.

Maine Lobster roll - a standard and established item at Neptune Oyster. I prefer the hot over the cold. Something about that hot buttered, toasted bun cushioned with succulent lobster chunks...mmm, and the potato skins fries are perfectly crispy, tender, and salted. Even better with the Fisherman's Brew.

A variety of fresh raw oysters with knowledgeable, friendly waitstaff. A helpful order card with informational taste points highlighted. Served with cocktail sauce and mignonette. Some may find this odd but I personally love dipping my fries into the sauces as well.

Tip: do not come hungry because you will usually need to wait a good amount of time; by the time you're up - you'll be starving. I also noticed that It doesn't help to stare at the patrons eating as you're waiting outside (I'm so SO rude). Sit up at the bar if you can. The best time to come - on a weekday during the afternoon; it's quieter, calmer, and you can have an enjoyable lunch. 

Definitely one of my Boston favorites.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
I braved an HOUR, yes, an hour, of driving around the block to eat at Neptune Oyster...well, the hour I drove around took up approximately 1/2 of the 2 hour wait that we had to eat at Neptune Oyster.  I love eating dinner at 9pm on a Sunday before a 7am flight...yep, I do....sigh.

Anyway, I'm glad I visited, though I think next time, I will try to go for lunch.  

I really was craving a lobster roll.  It's not that they're not tasty in Chicago, it's just that it's a Boston tradition for me to annoy my family until they come with me for lobster rolls (note, it's way easier to convince my sister to do this than some of the family...).

I, of course, ordered the lobster roll, which was all kinds of delicious.  It was meaty, flavorful, not claw meat, and it was mostly just lobster (and a mini bit of mayo).  The fries were ok, but I was there for the lobster, and I was happy.  It's a bit steep at $25, but hey, it's not every day I get one of these.

My sister had the fish tacos (also delicious).

Service was friendly, and he didn't get flustered when the 2 tables of tourists next to us insisted upon asking questions about every item on the menu and tried to share a lobster roll with 4 people....

Bathrooms - 4 (small and hard to get to)
Value - 3 - pricey!
Food - 5
Service - 4 (moderate attempt to upcharge me on the wine...)
Atmosphere - 4 (a bit touristy...)

Worth a stop, though be prepared to wait (and most likely, you'll be waiting at another bar).
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: This place is a go-to for my husband and I whenever we are in Boston. The atmosphere and service are fantastic and the food is utterly phenomenal. The buttered lobster roll is delicious and I had the best oysters I've ever had in my life. There is usually a wait, but it's totally worth it.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
Outstanding service and the Tuna Steak Frites were perfect. 
Small place and very busy but worth the effort.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
Unbelievable HOT Lobster roll - I died!!! I find myself dreaming about these guys.

Also had their fried clams and few Oyster selections, equally amazing - but does not compare to the HOT Lobster roll.

I make sure to take all of my out-of-town guests here... but be prepared to wait for a table, try to go mid-afternoon after and before the main meal rushes.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: Best ambiance in Boston. Oysters were great, beer was a bit expensive though..
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: The lobster roll is a life changing experience. Must have. Eat it in silence and be happy.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: Cioppino is out of this world. No other comments needed. Wait three hours for a spot, and see what the hype is for yourself.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: Wowzers, this place is AMAZING and definitely worth the wait (2hrs). I recommend getting your name on the list and then site seeing, if you're out of towner like we are. We started our experience with some oysters, they were delicious but for me nothing worth writing a  review over. The Lobster Roll ($32) however was EPIC!  The bread was soft and fluffy which absorbed the butter perfectly creating an amazing vessel to stuff your face with. *Warning, be careful not to let the butter drip on your clothes while you indulging yourself. They lobster is soft and moist, cooked to perfection and the portion is generous ensuring that you get your money's worth. The cherry on top for me were their french fries. If you love soft & salted fries you'll enjoy these delights to compliment your very rich and delicious sammy.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: Had an amazing Monkfish at the bar - the oyster selection was great and they were delicious.   The bartender, forgot his name, was informative and friendly and made suggestions that were great.   Totally recommend this place!
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: We came on a Monday night so no 2-3 hrs waiting . This place is quite small . Fit no more than 50 . We had oysters 6 each , yumny . Neptune choice was our favorite. Johnny cake is a must . Sweet and savory . We also shared lobster spaghettini . 35$ but lots of lump delicious lobster. It was quite a big plate . Almost everyone else in the restaurant ordered lobster roll. We just had some for lunch so we opted out. The only negative about this place is seatings are very tight. My elbow kissed the other guy elbow multiple times:/ . This place is a definitely a place to visit when in Boston but not a typical daily dinner unless you filthy rich.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
Had an interesting experience here.  Learned that it's important to check your bill and take photos of your food.

They listed 12 oysters on their order sheet so I just ordered one of each to sample all of them.    It should have been around $36 but when I got the bill it said something like "Dozen Sampler" $39.  I was just curious about the weird pricing strategy and asked the waiter why is it more expensive to order all 12 oysters together than to order 12 individually, he could not give an explanation.  His manager came by and said that dozen meant baker's dozen so they gave me 13 oysters ... ok ... I only ordered 12 on the order sheet and I thought baker's dozen meant that they'd give you one for free, but that's fine.  Was about to pay when I looked at my phone where I took a picture of the plate of oysters when they brought it out, they actually only served 11.  Not impressed with the game they are playing here. 

Service was also slow, but can't blame the waiter, the place was so crowded there's barely room to move.  Don't recommend.  There are so many great seafood places in North End, don't need to come to this specific spot.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
Came here on a snowy day, so we (only) had to wait 30 minutes. Started with the MA oysters which were really fresh with a nice clean finish. Our favorites were the sweet butter and brown butter. 

Next bf ordered the clam chowder and i thought it was surprisingly good (for someone who doesn't eat a whole lot of seafood). The broth itself is so light and buttery, different from the usual goopy clam chowder every other place sells! Almost like it's cooked separately from the clam..

Onto the entrees - Bf loved the lobster roll with the buttery brioche bun! My scallops were decent, and I did enjoy the sweet corn purée with corn and spinach underneath, but overall my entree was mediocre. All in all though, I think the clam chowder would be worth another trek from NYC!
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
Wow, everyone seems to have drunk the Neptune Oyster kool-aid. Now I am not saying the place is bad... in fact, my meal there was actually good, but it wasn't mind-blowing which I would have expected given these reviews.

I don't normally like to eat alone at a restaurant but was alone for this occasion and asked for a seat at the bar (around 6 pm). Hostess said there was a 20 minute wait and that she would call me when a seat was available. Didn't have to wait 10 minutes before I got a call back, so that was a good start. I overheard that the wait was about an hour for a party of 4 at that point.

Ordered three oysters of varying sizes, origins, and tastes to have some variety. They run about $2-3/oyster and all were nice and fresh. I definitely could've eaten a couple more but wanted to save my appetite. BTW, the triton plateau looked tremendous.

Now the clam chowder. I LOVED. Probably my favorite part of the meal. I like my chowder not too heavy and this delivered. Fresh and flavorful with clams you can actually taste. I only wish the bowl were bigger.

And then the Maine lobster roll. Nice, large chunks of lobster meat on a buttered roll with a large heap of fries. It was good but a little too buttery for my taste. Compared to a $15 lobster roll I have had from the Red Hook Lobster Pound, I felt that while you definitely get more bang for your buck the quality was just slightly higher. And the fries were sadly burnt. Maybe if they take that off the order it would be $5 cheaper and then you can leave your stomach room for more oysters...

Service? Ehh. I know I was alone, but the bartender/waitress couldn't really be bothered. I had to wait for her to finish her "line" of customers after attempting to order and then saw my order for oysters sitting in front of me for a good five minutes before she delivered it to me. Also the people next to me who ordered after me got some of their food before mine. Normally not really nitpitcky, but we ordered the same thing. So I guess I'll have to dock a star for service.

Now I would still recommend this place if you're in Boston and looking for a one-stop shop for oysters, clam chowder, and lobster rolls. Hopefully you'll have the same orgasmic experience as everyone else seems to be having!
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
I have no idea why this place get so popular on yelp. Thousands of reviews and four and a half star! 
The place was super tiny. They will take down your number once you came in and call you when there was a table so you don't need to wait outside. I don't recommend this place for large party. A party of six people can be wait as long as two hours unless you arrive there early.
I'm not a fan of oyster so I ordered the lobster roll. It was just a buttered roll stuffed with lobster, nothing tasted extraordinary good. The lobster even wasn't cooked perfectly. The staff was friendly though.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: This place is delicious! We ordered all of the oysters! My top three favorites were the Kumamoto ( has a low in salt taste and a hint of honeydew melon taste!) , kusshi ( low in salt and has a freshing cucumber finish), and katama bay (high in salt but has a buttery finish). We ordered two octopus dishes... octopus cocktail (nothing special...) and the Spanish octopus appetizer (delicious! It was so tender and great favors)! The lobster rolls with butter was  delicious too! The live sea urchin was so and so there... but overall, everything was yummy!
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: This is one of my favorite places in the North End! With an over-saturation of Italian food I love the seafood option here. Great atmosphere, nice but not super fancy and stuffy. The raw bar is amazing and the food is great. I had dinner here for my birthday this year and something took a while (we didn't even notice) and they sent out an entire plate of clams while we waited. The wine selection is fantastic and the service is always very nice. A little pricey but definitely worth it for fresh seafood. It's always busy so go early and you can put your phone number in and head down the street for a cocktail, they'll call you when your table is ready.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: I came here on a random weekday before dinner rush. I got the warm lobster roll with the butter and it was good. I prefer a cold lobster roll, so the five stars is saying if something. The roll was AMAZE. The fries we ordered as an appetizer were also amaze. Best place ever to go. Service was on point.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
Long waiting to get seated. But you will get some of the freshest oysters and lobster roll in town.

Go when the place won't be too busy if you want to avoid long time.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
Came on a Wednesday afternoon with my boyfriend, a little after noon. It was a 20 minute wait, which was over almost as soon as we sat down in a cafe down the street for tea. I've seen a lot of reviews complaining about rude staff, maybe I went on a good day? Everyone was polite, just friendly enough without being overbearing.

To start we got oysters - Kumamoto, Katama Bay, Browne's, Ichabod - 2 of each. Descriptions on the oyster list were spot on. If you're like me, most of your oyster experiences have probably been the large, flat, salty kind. Get the Kumamoto. It's extremely small, low brine, and oh so creamy. The others were more briny, but very clean tasting and great to eat as well. I highly recommend getting the oysters WITHOUT mignonette or cocktail sauce, as both tend to overpower the oysters.

We also got the spanish octopus salad. HUGE chunks of octopus, cooked for a long time till ridiculously tender. The sauce was a bit tart. Vegetables were delightfully sweet.

For entrees, we got the cioppino with lobster and the seared scallops. Cioppino was very tasty, with a pleasant spicy kick and a very generous heap of lobster meat (for only $10 more). No idea what fish they had in the stew but there were 2 kinds, and both were cooked to perfection. The prawns and mussels were nothing special.

Scallops were perfectly cooked with a nice sear. All the other stuff on the plate - duck confit, blue cheese, brussel sprouts - went together very well. The pear butter was slightly sweet and gave everything a nice refreshing lift. The whole dish was extremely well executed.

All in all it came up to roughly $69 each after tip+tax. Well worth every penny. I have to say the oysters set a really high bar and I was worried that the cooked entrees wouldn't measure up, but I'm really happy to say I was worried for nothing!
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: Good but always a long wait. You should try the lobster roll and come at odd hours! seriously
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
This was my one place that I had to try before leaving Boston. It is supposedly one of the best seafood places.
This place is pretty small. It is ALWAYS busy so if you want to eat here, you should come right when it opens or 3 hours before the actual time that you want to get seated and eat. If you plan on having dinner at 6, come at 3. They take your name and number down and call you when they have a table for you so you don't have to stand around waiting. 
I tried to push my luck. How busy can this place actually be right? Boy was I wrong... They quoted my time (party of 2) to be 2-2.5 hour wait. I ended up waiting 3 hours. I waited at peet's coffee around the corner.

We got sat at the bar (really wanted a table but its fine). During the whole duration of my stay, people's butts kept pushing up on me or against mine when they walked past. It was super uncomfortable, especially feeling pushed in the middle of my meal.
My boyfriend and I tried 3 different types of oysters, the clam chowder, and the north end cioppino with lobster (13 extra). Everything was super delicious. They have one of the freshest oysters i've had. I regret not getting more :( 
The clam chowder was also pretty good, but probably not the best clam chowder i've had. It is very watery but it was still packed with flavor and ingredients.
The north end cioppino was delicious. It is a little spicy but not really. The seafood on it complimented the "sauce/soup" along with the rice. 

Waited 3 hours and spent about 45 minutes in there. Deff wouldn't wait around the corner hoping everyone would cancel and that we would get a table faster. If I do come back, I will put my name down and go sightseeing or go back to the hotel and take a nap LOL. 
Needless to say, neptune oysters lived up to their hype! 

PS: they don't do take out or reservations!
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
The Honest Truth:
If you want seafood, come here.  Everything is fresh and cooked well.  They have a buttload of oysters to choose from.  Get the Lobster roll! Tons of juicy and tender Lobster on some bread.  The other menu items were good too. Can't go wrong with anything.

The Details:
This place is really small (as are most places in Boston) so come early! It's got a nice, intimate environment, and the service is attentive and good. We came at 5:30 and there was no wait! Of course, the Lobster Roll is a must order.  They don't skimp on the lobster and its nice and buttery.  We also tried the scallops which were pretty delicious (athough you don't get as many) and some sort of cilantro fish, which was also really good.  The price is a expensive, but definitely a great place for fresh seafood dishes!
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: Great place! We had oysters, appetizers and drinks and loved it all. Fantastic atmosphere and location.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
We were visiting Boston for a few days so I looked up some of the best restaurants to go to. I wanted to get clam chowder and some kind of lobster. The clam chowder here didn't look as good as some other restaurants, but the lobster roll looked really good so we decided to give it a try. I made a reservation because I read that it gets crowded very fast and there's not much seating. 

We arrive and it's already crowded and very noisy. We were squished in a long booth with a whole bunch of other couples around us.  I sat on the side with the booth, and husband sat in a chair across from me. I didn't really have much room to put my jacket as there was people on both sides of me practically on top of me. 

I ordered a glass of wine and my husband ordered a beer. I was disappointed that there was no specialty drinks on the menu. We split a bowl of the Clam Chowder. The description said that it was not as thick and creamy as the traditional New England Clam Chowder. It was thinner and more watery but it still had fresh flavor and the clams tasted good. 

We both ordered the lobster roll sandwich. There was the option to get it either hot or cold. My husband ordered his cold and I got mine hot. I thought mine tasted very good at first, but they put so much butter on it the roll started getting soggy and falling apart. I also stared to feel somewhat sick afterwards from all the butter. My husband's cold lobster roll was a little better, but he really wasn't amazed either. 

We were expecting our meals to be better, especially for the price that they cost. It was better than a lobster roll we could get in Pennsylvania most likely, but for New England I was expecting it to be amazing. I actually got a better lobster roll at a restaurant in Baltimore, and they're known for crabs not lobster. I guess we will have to travel to Maine sometime if we want a great lobster roll.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: Ok!  Can you say FANTASTIC!!!  The seafood here is so fresh I'm assuming it was swimming before it got on my plate!  Very small restaurant, gets very crowded fast!  Get there as soon as it opens to get on the waiting list.  They take your name and number and will call you when a table opens up as there is nowhere to wait in the restaurant.  Use the time to do a little sight seeing.  Hot Lobster Roll, off the charts!!!  Oysters are ridiculous!  We ordered the Triton Plateau for the 2 of us.  OMG!  Wait till you see this thing!  Oysters, Clams, Crab, Shrimp, Lobster, Mussels.  It was amazing.  Service is fast and good!  I would most definitely recommend "attempting" to go to Neptune!  Fantastic!
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: Got lucky and scored a table in the late afternoon. Recd to us by a local and we went in knowing that we wanted the lobster roll, hot with butter. Perfection. Crispy bun piled high with the meat of one entire lobster. A decadent delight. Cocktails were yummy and the energy was vibrant. Am craving it right now!
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
Place was good, had a nice selection of beers & raw bar.  

Kitchen food was well made and presented nicely.  My only complaint is when I asked the owner where else I could enjoy a good meal in Boston he recommended his own restaurant.  Someone should tell him while his food was good, it wasn't worth going back to back nights when I was only in town for a weekend!  Also... who would ever recommend a patron to come back to back nights to their own restaurant?  That's pretty desperate in my opinion...
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: Really, really good- but you're going to wait to get a table. They'll take your number and call when your table is ready so if you are in the North End and plan on visiting put your name in and then explore the neighborhood a bit. There are a number of bars and coffee shops within walking distance to waste time too.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: Best lobster roll I've ever had!  This place is small and there's always a wait but it's well worth it.  Definitely one of the top 5 seafood experiences I've had in New England.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: The lobster roll. Get it. I think that's could be the end of the review and it would be enough. Seriously the lobster roll is sooo good. The lobster filling is juicy and flavorful, and the rolls texture is a perfect complement. The oysters are also very fresh and juicy. I could down these all day, if only my wallet was bottomless. We also tried the Neptune burger which included fried oysters. It was delicious but still second tier to the lobster roll. We filled out our meal with the Scallops, Cioppino, and Lobster Spaghettini. The broth in the Cioppino was so so good with the bread they gave out. The Scallops were so tender (but small portion), and the sauce on the Spaghettini was perfect. This place is a must try if in Boston. The staff is really friendly, as they called us 10 min in advance when we were up in line and squeezed us in at the end of the night. The only reason I couldn't give 5 stars is the price. But it's more than a 4, perhaps a 4.6 star place. Again. Lobster roll.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
Raw oysters were delicious. Lobster role was crunchy, buttery and full of lobster. Scallops were heavenly!! They came with some small greens (I think mini brussel sprouts???) and some shredded meat and garlic..droool...Definitely Recommended.

We went at 2pm on 12/14  and the place was pretty empty (maybe it's a winter thing). If you are going to order from the raw menu, avoid the crab claw, 8-9 bucks isn't really worth it, just get a few more oysters.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
Waited for 2 hours. Get there early because they close early after the wait.
SUPER good oysters.
Was expecting A LOT for the lobster roll. It was really good but a little bit too dry.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
2 of us got in from NYC at 3:30am, slept, woke up and got to Neptune at 12:15pm Monday and  put our name on the list for a 12:45pm seating. Walked around the shops in the area and found a v.cool boutique carrying cool designers, incl AmandaUparichard. Also discovered Polcari'sCoffee where we got some spices. 

When we got back to Neptune, there was a line just to get their name on the list(!). Ordered 1/2 dozen of 3 types of oysters, which were ok but not as tasty as the ones we had at LenoxHotel. Also shared the ButtermilkJohnnyCake which was buttermilk pancakes topped w smoked trout tartare and garnished w sturgeon caviar. Very good and a must order!! And of course, shared the lobster roll as well which was as all other yelpers here will attest, was the best ever!! Total bill was $80 incl tip.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
Had a great experience here.  They do not take reservations so go put your name, then hit a local pub because there is typically a very long wait.  They do take your cell phone number and will call you when you are able to be seated which is great.  The whole restaurant is about the size of a garage so I hope you like to be seated in close proximity to others.  This gives it the North End feel though that I enjoy.  

Now to the food, oysters were outstanding- we essentially sampled all of them and there is a long list.  We all had lobster rolls (cooked) you can also get them cold if that's what you prefer.  They are the best, in my opinion, in Boston.  

Overall great restaurant with a great North End feel...
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
The hype on this place is somewhat overrated but a great seafood meal can still be found here. The restaurant is the size of a walk in closet.......hence the incredibly long wait that many complain about. However, they will take your cell phone number and give you a call when your spot is ready, allowing you to do other things (stroll the North End, have a drink at a bar.......I recommend the rooftop bar at Fiore's) A HUGE plus in my book. The décor is brasserie style with dark wood and white tile walls and lots of mirrors. 
              Service.....adequate. I sat at the bar and the servers/bartenders were nice enough but not overly informative with the menu. Crudo of the day.......they didn't offer, I had to ask.  "Do you have any questions about the menu?".....didn't hear that question, had to bring them up myself. Their work space behind the bar is incredibly cramped and confining so I'm cutting them slack. I would definitely NOT work in that space myself so I give them credit.
              Food....ordered the buttermilk johnnycake with smoked trout tartare and California sturgeon caviar because I had seen it on a CookingChannel episode of Unique Eats. Very tastey. Loved the smoked trout tartare. The proportions were off though. Way to much pancake to fish ratio. The dish would be much more balanced with either less johnnycake or more trout tartare. The entrée was the North End Ciopinno with lobster (lobster is an optional choice but come on.......if you're going to do it, do it right!) Visually appealing and delicious. It could have been just a bit more spicier for my taste but that's a minor caveat.  It comes with saffron rice but I opted not to have the rice since I'm not a fan of saffron and why fill up on all that starchy rice when you have all that amazing seafood and delicious broth?
              Overall a great place, despite the cramped quarters (Be prepared to make friends with your neighbors) Definitely recommended. Oh and please.......no more pics of the lobster roll.........the 850 that are already posted give people an adequate idea of what the dish looks like.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
After reading all the hyped up reviews on Yelp, I knew I had to try this place. An old high school friend and I decided to try to beat the Friday night dinner rush and showed up at the restaurant at 5 PM. As soon as I walked in, I realized why the place is known for its wait - the restaurant is tiny! There were probably a maximum of 30-40 seats in the whole place, and this was with minimal open floor space. Regardless, I had heard too much about the lobster roll to walk away and the waitress was kind enough to take down our cell number so we didn't need to wait in the restaurant. 

About 10-15 minutes later, a surprisingly short wait, we got a call and headed back to be seated at the bar. First we started with a single oyster each - my friend got one from MA and I got one from NB (described as med size, med salt, with a champagne finish). Neither of us are really oyster connoisseurs so I can't say if the oysters were very different from the fresh ones I had just eaten at the Haymarket outside but unless my tastes become much more sophisticated, I probably won't be paying $2.70 for an oyster again. 

I had a small debate over whether I should try the cioppino but ultimately followed through with my original plan to order the hot butter lobster roll with a side of salad rather than fries. The very first bite was DELICIOUS, meaty, buttery, warm, and good. 

However, I have to question the $25 price. I haven't had many lobster rolls so I'm not sure how this one compares but I hardly think that substituting mayo with butter and heating the roll a bit should constitute a doubling in price. Adding butter generally makes everything taste good - so I wonder how difficult this actually is to make with the right ingredients. Also, the butter seeped into the bread and made the bottom half a bit soggy. Perhaps toasting the bread would help with this problem. Finally, the salad that came with it had a pretty presentation of lettuce leaves arranged as a flower but the vinaigrette was overwhelmingly salty.

All that aside, I still really enjoyed my experience at Neptune Oyster and was very sad to come to the end of my lobster roll. For those of you who love fresh seafood cooked well and aren't afraid to pay a premium for it, I have no doubt that Neptune Oyster can provide.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
BEST seafood experience I've ever had! My boyfriend and I arrived around 11:30, thinking we were being smart to bypass the lunch rush but  man were we wrong. Long line, seats full and the restaurant is quite small, fitting 20-25 people. With how crowded it was, we ended up putting our names down for a 1-1.5 hour wait. We've been wanting to come here for a long time, so we waited the full time, and stalled at the Boston Public Market for some coffee just across the street. But if you want to eat here by 12pm, especially on the weekend, definitely come around 11AM to get ahead in line. 

The food here is no doubt incredibly fresh and cooked well. You can even see someone shucking the oysters right in front of the restaurant window. We ordered four different kinds of oysters, fried clams, the scallops and the cioppino. The fried clams came out first were really juicy, breaded really well, and overall tasty. The oysters were SO GOOD. Refreshing and flavorful, those oysters set the standard of how all oysters should dream to be. My absolute favorite part of the meal was the scallops. The combination of the tender scallops, smokey bacon, corn, pea tendrils, and sauce were amazing. It was a wonderfully balanced dish with flavors that worked harmoniously together. My boyfriend had the cioppino which was pretty much the sea itself with lobster, shrimp, salmon, mussels, clams, white fish, and rice in a spicy broth. I wish I could've tried, but since I'm allergic to shrimp, I had to taste it vicariously by how he described it.

If you're in Boston, I would definitely come here at least once! It's worth the long wait, and it was one of the most memorable meals I've ever had.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
The best, damn lobster roll you will have. Their oyster selection is amazing. The staff is very friendly and helpful. I love the tight quarters, you can chat with the other guests. 
The wait is a long one but worth it. Just put your name and mobile down and go for a walk about the North End. If you go there with the expectation that you will be seated immediately, you will be disappointed.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
Over the years, my husband and I have been to nearly every reputable restaurant in Boston. From l'Espalier to Ana's Taqueria, we'll go anywhere for good grub. We were frequenting Neptune before it won the awards and made all the tourist guides. This is the best restaurant in the city in terms of food alone. Seafood in the North End, oh yes.

Start off by getting your name in early - and prepare to grab a drink at Goody's or another nearby bar while you wait for the staff to call. 

Yes, it's crowded bordering on frenzied. Take a seat at the bar if it's a choice between that or no Neptune. 

The staff is always sweating. Running. Crazed. Just plain hardworking. Tip them well. They deserve it. 

For the love of all things holy don't get the Lobster Roll. Although it's quite good, to order it is like asking Van Gogh to draw you a Mickey Mouse. You'll be missing out on some serious culinary genius.

My advice in terms of food: Start off with oysters from the west coast (Kumamoto etc), then get multiple apps, try the specials and ask for off-menu items and recommendations. Then waddle home like the gluttonous mess that you are and fall asleep dreaming of the next time....
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: Tourist trap!!! This place is a joke from the service to the food. I'm not going to give all the details because i dont want to relive this horrible experience ever again but please don't ever stick your finger in a customers mashed potatoes after they tell you its freezing cold (along with the rest of the food) and then just leave it on the table. Ever.

text:
Had the Sea Bass on cream of eggplant (I recall cream of eggplant, hope I'm not getting too old) and it was very very good. Another member of the party had the Lobster.
Can't go wrong with either but they were cooked amazing so it isn't a question of "Playing safe" but just what you fancy from two outstanding dishes.

text: We got lucky and there was no wait.  Woohoooo.  The waiter told me that on Saturdays the wait can be 3 hours long.  Dang!  If you can, go on the weekday!  Spent 25 bucks for a hot, buttery lobster roll and it was goooooooood!  I had to force myself to eat slow bc I could have eaten the whole thing in 60 seconds flat.  (Not because it was small but because of all it's tasty, buttery goodness.)  Note:  If you have kids...it's a small space and they don't have high chairs.  Wish they had at least one high chair but I guess they don't have many families coming to eat here.  Anyway, if you're in Boston and searching on Yelp for the BEST Lobster Roll, just stop...stop reading all the 400 and something reviews Neptune Oyster has.  *EDIT:  Oh my bad, they have 737 reviews.  DAMN! *  Save yourself some time and just goooooooo.  You will not be disappointed.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: Great place to dine. Decent sandwiches but great lobster rolls!!!
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: Had the best dinner and met some of the staff who were eating there too (hey Ann & Julie!).  The raw bar is too notch and the chowder is made to order! I highly suggest the tuna crostini! We will be going back!
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
Good things come in small packages (that's what she said!) 

I decided to cap off a week of good eating with lunch at Neptune Oyster. While tiny, Neptune is a cute space; subway tiles, a large mirrored menu, small tables, and a long wood bar. It reminds me of a Pottery Barn spread; you know the one where you wish you had enough money to replicate it, even the details and accents they're not hawking. It's not ideal for a groups of more than 4, I think there are only 6-8 tables in all. Also, I'm not sure I'd call this a great date place or at least a romantic one, at lunchtime it got quite loud. 

I don't mind dining solo, but this time I regretted it...a little. On the one hand, this place isn't much bigger than a postage stamp and flying solo I was lucky to immediately score a seat at the bar. On the other hand, there were so many menu items I wanted to try but only so much room in my stomach. After perusing the menu and drooling over the plates of those sitting next to me, I decided on the cold lobster roll. 

I had only tried a lobster roll once before, it was served at my conference and had an 80/20 bread-to-lobster ratio - meh. Neptune's lobster roll puts that one to shame. The roll was light and airy, and seemingly dusted with melted butter. The lobster was teeming from the bun; huge hunks of fresh, delicious lobster; writing about it is making me salivate. Hand cut fries accompanied the roll, those were excellent too; perfectly salty and greasy, a nice accompaniment to the roll. I washed it all down with a Whale's Tale Pale Ale, my only misstep; it was recommended by my server, but I wasn't really a fan. 

Service started out a little slow, sandwiched in between two parties at the bar it took a while to get noticed. Once I was, everyone was so attentive and friendly. 

TIP: Try to stop in for an early lunch on a weekday, the lines don't seem so horrendous.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: Best lobster roll in town. Def try to get there early and expect to wait, but the wait is totally worth it.

text: The lobster roll is hands down the best one I've ever had --and I take my out-of-town friends every time they come.  The lobster roll is expensive but a great value for the amount of lobster you get.  I've eaten here at least 10 times. The chowdah is just okay though. Stick with the lobster roll and any of the crudo appetizer options are great.  Grilled octopus salad is also amazing. The piggyback appetizer is not good (do not order). Just go early (line up 20-30 minutes before opening) on a weekend or at an off-peak time to avoid the usual 2-hour wait.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants

text: Best lobster roll I've had, hands down. I love that it comes hot and buttered. My only complaint is the long wait but due to the size and deliciousness of the place, it's no wonder.
