text: Don't bother. So many other good places. Walked in there was 5 empty seats at the bar. Just wanted a few drinks and raw bar. Was told by the RUDE person at the door a 2 hour wait for empty seats at the bar. There was no one waiting. I don't care if you were written up in some fancy magazine. Learn customer service!
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
So from what I heard, you can't really experience Boston without a lobster roll. Supposedly this is the joint to get THE lobster roll. I've had several friends rave about it and I had to come here on my first night in Boston.

I met up with a friend and we were seated not too long after I got there. Just a heads up, parking in the North End is a complete NIGHTMARE! Try not to drive around like a mad person like I did, just find the first parking garage and walk. Everything is close by.

We started off with a couple oysters: Wellfleet, Island Creek, Wianno, Kumamoto, and another that I can't remember the name. All were extremely fresh and juicy. No grit or brine in the ones we ordered. I regret not ordering more.

We each ordered a lobster roll for our meal, one hot (with butter) and one cold (with mayo) to share. It didn't take too long for our food to come out and when it did my eyes completely bugged out and my jaw fell to the floor! Huge mounds of lobster right before my eyes. They don't skimp out at all! We had a discussion on which was better: hot or cold and I'm still debating on which one I liked better. With the hot you get the nice lobster slathered in butter. With the cold you get not just standard mayo, they have some seasoning in there that I can't put my finger on. I think just by ease of eating, the cold one wins by a hair. The roll was a little soggy because of the butter so it was a little harder to eat. You can also order it without the roll but what's the fun in that?! The roll also came with french fries, they were good but a little on the salty side.

The $25 price tag on just the lobster roll may scare people but it was soooo worth it! From now on every trip to Boston will require a mandatory trip here. Damn I want one right now!

As seen on TV: America's Best on Food Network
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: This was my second visit here and thought it would be a good time to start my first review on Yelp.  This place packs them in pretty well and there seems to always be a wait.  Today it was about 45 minutes but it's nice because they call you back whenever something opens up.  I started with three types of oysters.  Forgot their names but they were all fresh and tasted like the ocean, definitely a good way to start off.  Last time I was here, I remember most people ordering the lobster roll so I already knew what I wanted and really didn't need the menu.  This lobster roll blew the previous ones I've had outta the water and I've had a lot.  Maybe because it was warm and all the others I've had were cold and had mayo.  This one is as good as it gets for me.  Nice warm lobster meat with butter on a nice warm soft roll.  So simple yet soooooo good.  It's 25 bucks but totally worth it in my opinion.  I'll be shocked if you don't enjoy it.  Even though it was busy, the servers were always friendly and very attentive.  Can't wait to go back and order another one.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
My third attempt to enjoy a meal at Neptune. I usually arrive at the north end too hungry to wait the quoted three hour wait and find a different (and yummy) place to eat at. Last time, I got called an hour and a half later, but I was already enjoying a meal else where. 

I was prepared this time, had a snack before hand, arrived and had my boyfriend put our names down, parked the car, walked over, waited for cannolis at Mikes, grabbed a drink at a coffee shop, and finally got called for our table. This took about an hour and a half.

I was disappointed in the lobster roll. We ordered it hot, but felt like we got a room temperature lobster roll. I wanted warm, oozing butter dripping down my face! I have had better from Luke's lobster and a the Easton's Beach Snack Bar in RI for half the price.

However, I did fall in love with the Cioppino - such a large variety of fish, shrimp, clams, and mussels cooked to perfection with a hint of herbs and a kick of heat on top of saffron rice. Delicious. I will be back for that!! And maybe a few oysters from the raw bar. Great experience over all - had to try the lobster roll once, right? Enjoy!

Also, kudos to the hostess that worked yesterday and was so pleasant to everyone, including the angry homeless man that decided to sit down when a table cleared out and argued that he had reservations.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: Awesome service and a the perfect place to be introduced to The Boston food scene....the whole Mackerel was out of this world....
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
I had heard so many rave reviews about Neptune Oyster, but sadly I was extremely disappointed. And to top it off I think I got food poisoning!!!!! 

My mom and I arrived at Neputne Oyster on a rainy Friday afternoon around 1:30pm and the place was packed! The restaurant is extremely small that you have to share tables with strangers. The wait staff doesn't even bother separating the tables out a little bit b/c there just isn't any space. And to make the lack of square footage even worse, camera crews were pacing back and forth filming a TV series for the Food Network (which was kind cool if the food was actually up to par). 

Okay....so I'll eliminate the service aspect of Neptune Oyster from this review since it wasn't an ordinary restaurant day b/c Food Network was filming. So..onto the main topic..THE FOOD! 

Between my mom and I we ordered Kumanoto oysters, Littenecks, shrimp cocktail, the hot lobster roll and the Vitello Tonnato sandwich. The Kumanotos were about $2.90 each and they tasted really fresh, however, I had got really sick after we left the restaurant.  I've had my share of raw foods at various restaurants and different parts of the world, and this is the first time I've had this happen to me. So you've all been warned...

I've never seen shrimp cocktail the size of my palm, but unfortunately, in this case bigger isn't better. The cocktail shrimps were overcooked which made the texture of the shrimp way too firm. FAIL! 

And as for the hot lobster roll, I was not impressed whatsoever. For $25 I expected a lot more. I agree with the other reviews that the roll was overflowing with lobster, but the bun was not toasted and our lobster roll was definitely not "hot", at best our roll was lukewarm. I was thoroughly disappointed when I took my first bite. If I'm going to eat a lobster roll dipped in butter I would expect to taste the butter. Our roll lacked everything I expected it to encompass. FAIL! 

I decided to step out of my comfort zone and try something that didn't necessarily sound appetizing. I ordered the Vitello Tonnato sandwich which was served with tuna tartare, roasted veal with a cumber salad inside. I thought I would try to let my palate experience different things, but this sandwich made a statement to my taste buds to never mix fish and veal in sandwich. The textures did not merry well and it was just a weird combination. I think the sandwich would have been better off just the tuna tartare and the cucumber salad. Also, the sandwich had way too much roasted veal and it masked the freshness of the tuna tartare. Again...FAIL! 

I'm sure after reading this review, you know what I'm going to say. Don't waste your time with Neputne Oyster because it's overrated and there's a pretty high chance you might get sick. I'm willing to give this place a second chance, but for now...I won't be coming back to Neptune Oyster anytime soon.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: The food is amazing, but the service is mediocre. Sever didn't know the dishes well and I had to ask for water. It wasn't busy and out waiter disappeared.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: OMG is all I can say! Warm lobster sandwich is to DIE FOR!! Two of us ordered two lobster roll meals - one with fries and one with salad - perfect!! Can't say enough about how good this place is. I will definitely come back here my next trip to Boston. Pete and Ariel, our servers were awesome too!
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
Worth the wait especially since we had none at 2:30 on a Thursday. Neptune really makes you want to live it up. Love the well constructed space with the beautiful bar seating. Space is at a premium and I liked how they tucked the bottles of wine wherever they could. You will be right on top of your neighbors so be prepared for buts in your faces when people get up, and eavesdropping over the interesting conversations next to you. I don't order a lot of wine by the bottle just because I'm mostly a cheapskate and want to spend more of my money on food :-). Still, if I'm back at Neptune I will order a nice bottle of white wine because it really goes well with the experience. We started with briny, fresh raw oysters. The menu gives you good guidance as far as size and salinity. I enjoyed the cocktail sauce more than the mignonette but that's just personal preference and how I've always eaten them. Next was the star of the show:  the johnnycake. Oh yes, probably my favorite thing I ate while in Boston. The corncake had a perfect texture of softness, crispness, stickiness- just wonderful. The smoked trout and sturgeon caviar added saltiness and there was sweetness in the buttery sauce. Delectable. Mains were strong as well. The hot lobster roll was just about ideal - good size, buttery. Bread was fine. I think it barely missed perfection possibly just needing a  whisp of added salt or a splash of lemon. Still very good. Then, against all better judgement at a seafood joint- we ordered a Neptuneburger which will live in infamy as one of my favorite burgers. It's a hot mess with cheese and some fried oysters and I know not what else, but GLORIOUS smoky flavor to the meat, and it was juicy, fatty and fantastic. My son and I traded meals as we each liked the other's selection better so I got to polish off half the burger. Outstanding. 

Highly recommended, and I'll dream of all the possibilities for my next visit whenever that may be.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: Wonderful place... prepare for a line, as it is a small but absolutely happening spot. Try the unusual stuff, it is all good

text: Drop my pants delicious omg do not miss. I had a dozen oysters, the lobster and greens salad, and the special which was hamachi on puréed mini carrots and a green garlicky sauce on top (a bit too much but just swiped it off no problem). (I know I'm not doing the food justice with my description but seriously every bite was worth savoring.) I like milder oyster flavors so the couple low salt ones were buttery and so clean.  The salad was way larger than expected and my friend and I took it home where it was just as good the next day. 5 stars, 100% satisfied.

Well it worked, we didn't stay and you earned every star on this review. Cheers!

text:
Worth every minute of my 1.5 hour wait to get a spot at the bar. At first I was skeptical when my friend said we had to eat here but I was mistaken in my doubt. 

Of course I had to try a few oysters, two local one from Washington state. All were fantastic and the descriptions pretty accurate. Then we tried the ginormous shrimp cocktail, which was pretty great as well. 

My friend had the special, lobster spaghettini, which was good. I went with the good old standby, warm lobster roll. I've had lobster rolls in a lot of places but this was a good amount of lobster and the butter just melted into the roll which became a butter flavored spread to eat with my lobster. This was no hand sandwich. It required a fork. Overall a great quintessential Boston experience in North End.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: I had the pleasure of dinning at Neptune's Friday night. The restaurant was tiny and packed. Wait was surprisingly short. I highly recommend the oysters, Johnny cakes and off course the best lobster roll I have ever eaten. My go to for seafood in Boston hands down!
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
Just a complete utter fabuloucity of all that is bivalve good.

Got there around 6 on a Saturday night.  The place was packed.  Someone came up immediately and took down my number.  We walked around for a bit in the North End, and was called half an hour later when our table was ready.  

We weren't too hungry when we got there, but after the first slurp of the freshest oysters in Boston, we were hooked.  Started off with the Triton Plateau, which contained a good assortment of clams, one type of oysters, shrimps, a great crab salad and lobster salad.

Vinny, our waiter and oyster master, helped us pick the oysters and wine.  After the Triton an half dozen of oysters, we wanted to order more, but Vinny was a good man, telling us to stick with just one entree - the lobster roll.  

Having driven three hours to Maine to get to Red Eat's, we can be picky about lobsters, and didn't think anyone in Boston could come close, until now...

Great meal, great food, great service...  

Just go.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: Oyster is very fresh...but the meat of lobster roll is not that tender and the taste is nothing special..the bread of the roll and the fries are nice.. the soup is salty...i don't think it worth to wait 2 hrs to try actually..but if with no waiting time that would be fine to have a try..the service is good...no rush feeling even in this really busy restaurant...

text: Excellent food, nice place, decent service. I'd give it five stars if the prices were about 25% lower.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
Food Poisoning and poor service!
My sister, her husband and I came to Boston for the weekend. We decided to treat ourselves to a special seafood meal and I recommended Neptune based on your reputation.  My friends all told me to line up early, which we did around 11AM. We put our names down and were told we would get a call 1 to 1.5 hours later. Over 2 hours later we had not been called. We went to the restaurant to enquire and no host was at the door to help so we waited a little longer and were called soon after. 

We were sat down next to a couple. The waitress took our order for oysters and drinks. We asked questions about a wine (but it was clear she didn't know much so we didn't insist). We all ordered our drinks and ordered 12 oysters. The couple next to us did the same thing. They got their oysters shortly afterwards. 

Our waitress then took our order for our meal, we ordered the following :
For apps:
One Johnny cake
One clam chowder

For our entrees
One lobster roll (cold)
One cioppino
One Bottarga Vongole

When my sister enquired about the Bottarga Vongole, she asked the waitress if the dish was linguini based. The waitress looked unsure and said she would check. We googled and it showed up as a clam linguini dish so we ordered it. 

Our drinks arrived but not our oysters. The couple next to us finished their oysters and then got their Johnny cake. After they finished that, they got their lobster rolls. All in a sequence. 

What happened to us was a disaster. Our entrees arrived first. They removed the covers from the hot dishes. We were surprised as we hadn't even been served our oysters or apps yet! When my sister saw her Bottarga Vongole, she was surprised, there was no pasta... just some Israeli style couscous. We asked the waitress. Her reaction was to correct her and say that "that is pasta, it's called pearl pasta". No apology. No offer to swap it. No smile. Nothing. She only ate the clams and didn't touch anything else. She was charged $35 for the dish. 

3 minutes after our entrees were served, our oysters arrived. 2 minutes after that, our clam chowder and Johnny cake arrived. We couldn't believe what was happening. The couple next to us got everything in sequence with a gap between their dishes and we had to make the choice to eat everything at once to avoid things getting cold. The experience was so unpleasant. We were all quiet, no one was talking. I was embarrassed. This was the meal we'd been waiting for all year and it was awful. We couldn't enjoy it.

And this is just half the story! I left the restaurant feeling fine and around 1.5/2 hours later started feeling unwell. We had to rush home after I started getting severe stomach cramps. I was sick all afternoon and all night basically spending all my time in the bathroom and in my bed. My sister and her husband had to go out alone on Saturday night and I had to cancel our plans that night. 

This whole experience was an utter disappointment given the reputation of your restaurant and the $250 bill we paid in full.
PS. I wanted to write this to the restaurant directly and not post on yelp but they don't even have an email address listed on their website.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
Waited for over two hours , which I expected and did not mind because we checked out some local bars during our wait .  What I did not like was the customer service.  We felt very rushed.  After a two and a half hour wait the least Neptune can do is provide us with a comfortable and welcoming dining experience .  Waitress might have said two words to us the entire time.  
 The food in my opinion is  overrated.  Octopus cocktail for 20$ was the size of a shot of whisky swimming in cilantro. Not good.  The oysters were ok but not worth the wait whatsoever.  
Very solid wine list! Had a great glass of white wine from stellenbosch.  
Overall not worth it
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: We had an hour wait, but it was well worth it. The lobster caprese salad was incredible!
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
Ok. I admit: I'm the kind of person who follows the crowd and just HAVE to try that hot restaurant everybody's talking about. On my 3rd visit to Boston, I finally made it to Neptune. I was rather surprised to be quoted a 30min wait despite going solo. But was called 15min later about an open seat at the bar. Solo dining rules!
Ordered 1/2 a dozen oysters and the cioppino.  The oysters were of course so fresh and no broken shells, so I was off to a good start. The cioppino...OMG...makes me want to move to Boston. It was packed with seafood and every single morsel was cooked to perfection: mussels, clams, fish, prawns...you name it. The prawns were so sweet and succulent it almost made me hate living in the Midwest. All of it was paired with a flavorful, spicy broth and toasted bread. I admit I wondered whether it was all hype and hesitated when I saw the prices on the menu. But this place is for real. I'm making this a must-go when I visit Boston again!
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
It is good. Not out of this world awesomely good -- but without argument good quality seafood.  But probably not as good as people seem to think.  I could never get in here during normal hours, so we went for lunch at 11:30am, and got the lost spot at the bar, in front of the door, on a freezing cold rainy day (and thus people constantly stood with the door open trying to get the attention of the waiter, subjecting us to a cold blast air, as we tried to tell them it was already over an hour wait, which the waiter would finally tell them 5 minutes later.)   

The hype and the crowds is over the top. The food is not quite, but still good.   If this was a quite little place near the water on the North Shore, it would be greatest discovery ever.  As a really busy place in the North End, it is pretty good -- but doubt I will ever repeat.  The prices are very high, even by North End standards.  The food again is good but not over the top, the wait staff is attentive but overtaxed dealing with the naive crowds are of people who think they're going to get seated any time soon.  

Boston should have best seafood in the country.  It doesn't, or at least it is hard to find.  And places were it did like Skipjacks and Legal Seafood have seen quality drop precipitously and prices go through the roof.  So there is a void for places like this.  Boston deserves to have an awesome 5-star quality seafood restaurant, but this isn't it.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: Honestly, there is NO OTHER PALCE to get LOBSTER ROLLS.  End of story... Neptune Oyster is the place to be for lobster rolls.  I got the lobster roll hot with butter (that should be the only option) and the buttery roll was absolutely filled with meaty, juicy lobster.  Yes, it really is the BEST.  Brave the wait just to get that lobster roll.  This place is not to be missed!
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: I've been to Boston a few times, and every time when I'm here, I always hear people talking about how Atlantic fish co. and Neptune are the best seafood restaurants in the town. I have to admit that these small talks turned my expectation high, and that's why I only gives a four star, not five ---- Neptune is a very good place to eat, but it's not perfect as it was in my imagination.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
Under an hour wait on a Wednesday night around 7:30pm. I noticed the wait was much shorter as the night went on, so I would recommend coming late on a weekday night!

Food thoughts:
-Clam chowder: very different from the average clam chowder I'm used to in San Francisco. It's not thick and is very light. Still delicious.
-Johnnycake: SOOOO GOOOOD!!! The hype is real. Please order this. It's like a pancake with bluefish and caviar which sounds strange but makes for the most perfect combination of food.
-Lobster roll: tried both the cold roll with mayo and the hot roll with butter. You can't go wrong with either. I preferred the hot one and my boyfriend preferred the cold. Literally the best lobster roll I've ever had in my life!

Our server was also one of the friendliest people we've encountered in the East Coast. Make sure to check out Neptune and walk around North End while you wait!
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: Tried eating here for dinner but the wait was almost 2 hours so we elected to arrive at 11:30 am the next day for lunch. FABULOUS. GO. NOW. Exceeded expectations in regards to the food and ambiance. Service is a tad icy but they know that patrons will return for the A+ oysters and buttery lobster roll.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: The authentic experience of eating fresh oysters at this swanky Boston North End spot can't be beat. However I can't recommend the lobster roll, it might have been just an off day, but my lobster was over-cooked and didn't pair well with the accompanying ndercooked and soggy fries. I will be back to sip/slurp wine/oysters but will leave the full meal for another one of the many great neighborhood restaurants.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
My friends and I waited about an hour. Not that bad as I saw others review. But the waiter was probably not in a good mood today. 
  We order hot lobster roll, lobster spaghetti and some oysters. The hot lobster roll and oysters were absolutely delicious. The lobster spaghetti was good and has a lot of pieces of lobster meat. But I will probably not order it again cause it's a little too salty for me. And compare to the hot lobster roll and oysters that the restaurant provides, I will just go with others instead of lobster spaghetti.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: Friggin' great. Expect a wait. Fun with a group date.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
I dream about the Lobster Roll! It might be because nothing compares in Chicago, but on a recent trip to Boston I tried two highly recommended Lobster Rolls and this place wins by a landslide.
  
MUST get hot and buttery!
Be ready to wait a long time and outside but there are plenty of things to do (we walked to Mike's Pastry (YUM!) to buy cannoli's for dessert afterwards)
The wait is worth it!
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: Good seafood, but overpriced and the lines are way too long - not worth the price and line waiting. There is lots of other better seafood places to go to in Boston.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: After I started a thread a while back searching for the "perfect lobster roll" and almost unanimously was directed to Neptune Lobster.  Well, at long last, I met a friend for lunch and ventured to the "other part of the world" (i.e. the North End) to Neptune and I found THE PERFECT LOBSTER ROLL!!  They offer two variations, regular (w/mayo) and the other served hot w/drawn butter.  At our server's recommendation, I opted for the latter and it was a meal of deliciousness!!!  While somewhat pricey ($25), it was worth every morsel.  While this was my first time to Neptune...I will definitely be back to sample its other offerings or maybe to get another heavenly LR.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: Love. Perfection. The food and service was worth the wait. And it was a loooong wait. We arrived at 8pm on a Sunday and expected the 'dinner rush' to be winding down. Well, the place is small and popular. So I think it is ALWAYS busy. The girl who took our name was a server. There is no 'hostess' stand. no room. But she came over promptly. TOok our name and phone number and said it would be at least a 2 hour wait and she couldn't be sure that we'd even get seated because 2.5 hours would put us right around when the kitchen closed. We decided to go for it. We went around the corner for some wine at a cafe. In the end it maybe wasn't quite a 2 hour wait - but it was close. But we got in. And it was so worth it. The oysters were perfection. And the lobster roll - the meat was cooked so perfectly. And you can have it with mayo or buttered - I chose buttered. It was a huge amount of lobster - and for $25 it should be. But it was so so worth it.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
Imagine the scenario...a romantic walk thru the North End of Boston , quaint historic streets , warmly lit bistros and cafes with delicious seafood and Italian specialties.  Salem street is the home to a gritty romantic ambiance that thrills my soul. 

Neptune Oyster is the perfect high end- hole in the wall, a tiny restaurant full of what appeared to be locals who know their way around an crustacean or two. Could be crowded at times, but on our visit the stars were aligned and we got right in.   And for a moment I felt like a local ,too.  Rat pack music playing ,cozy table ,a giant sampler plate of Oysters with wonderful  names like  Bees River ,Peacock Cove and Well Fleet ( my fave ), as Frank sang we ate well and then shared a luscious fried treat of the best clams ever. I had no clue they could actually taste light and airy.  

I highly recommend Neptune, service was spot on and they gave us not only wonderful food but a beautiful memory as well.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: This is probably my favorite oyster restaurant in Boston. we had to wait about one hour but it worth it. We had some oyster. It was very fresh. There is a lot of choice. And also We had a lobster pasta which is Monday limited. The pasta was very tasty. Definitely I recommend you to try!!
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: This is truly the best oyster place in Boston. Raw bar is the best and great lobster rolls.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
No competition.  Hands down best lobster roll!

Been here a ton of times when I still lived in Boston and although you can't make reservations, it's worth the wait.  The warm lobster roll from here is my favorite food in the entire world.  Just so hot and buttery and amazing.  The oyster selection is also always great and the mussels are also really good.  I've also had the triton platter and that crab salad really was the belle of the ball... so GOOD!!!  

Try not to come in the dead of summer though... their AC never seems to be on full blast...
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
Fresh and fantastic the day I was there...we sat next to a couple from Tokyo who was also impressed with their fish. I was looking for alternatives to our old standard The Union Oyster House and found a new favorite in Neptune. The oyster selection here is better and the 2" Carrara marble bar and tables are impressive! Beer selection was only OK. We had a Hamachi Kama appetizer that was amazing!

Better beer (California IPA anyone?!) would get it up to five stars (for me) real quick
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
This place is expensive. It has an inconveniently long wait in a crowded jammed packed small area. But man is it worth the price, hassle and elbow rubbing quarters.
The food flat out amazing! The staff is so professional and friendly also. A great wine list just adds to the experience.  
No matter where I travel, Neptune Oyster ' s lobster roll is my benchmark bar standard very few places meet.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: Went to Boston to try the lobster roll...... it was great.  My daughter and I made a trip to Boston from NY just  to try their lobster roll.  We really enjoyed the lobster roll and I also recommend trying their fried clams.  It was crispy at the same time it was moist and tender. We've really enjoyed their food.  It was fresh and delicious.  I will make another trip to try other things on their menu.  It was worth 4 hour drive to eat at Neptune Oyster.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
Best selection of oysters I've ever seen, freshest oysters I've ever tasted.  Trying out different oysters really adds spunk to your meal, makes it more memorable...whereas going to other places, you basically get one kind b/c there's only one type and eat for the quantity.  The raw bar here is worth the wait itself.  

As for the lobster roll...hot damn it was tasty.  An entire Maine lobster of meat topped w/ warm butter accompanied w/ fries.  Yeah it's $25, but I'd get it every time I'm in Boston.  Paid about $45 (tip included) for 4 oysters, half a lobster roll and a beer.  That's about the only downside to this place...forking out steakhouse fare.  It looks cramped inside, but ppl don't really get in your way.  Staff is helpful and efficient, you're usually in and out within 45 min.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: The best Lobster Rolls.  The hot lobster roll in butter is a must try
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
What to say about Neptune Oyster?  This place has over a thousand reviews...mostly bragging about the lobster roll.  Well, I have a different perspective...

My friend and I got on the list for the last table for the evening at 8 pm.  We had a 2 hour wait to be seated, which was expected.  It was crazy to see people being turned away for the evening, but I figured it was a good sign.  They take your cell number and call you when your table is ready, which is awesomely convenient.  To me, the wait is not an issue if the food meets expectations.

So, our table was ready and we started to dine.  I ordered the toasted lobster roll, hot and buttered.  My friend ordered the curried mussels and the clam chowder.  Maybe it was the fact that we were the last to arrive for the evening, but my lobster roll was very underwhelming.  There were some tender, delicous pieces of lobster, likely from the claws, but a good deal of the meat was chewy and lackluster.  The roll was soggy and untoasted and the butter did nothing to help.  For $26, I would expect more.  I noticed other patrons with soggy rolls left on their plates as well.

Now, my friend's dishes, the chowder and mussels, were much tastier.  I absolutely loved the mussels, and our server brought bread to dip in the curried sauce.  Very tasty!  Her chowder was just okay to me, it seemed like a "broth" that was mostly cream and not much else.

But there is one most notable character missing from my review and that is...the oysters.  I ordered two Thacher Island oysters based on their description of being plump with a buttery finish.  Talk about amazing!  Those were the best I'd had and very memorable.  They were perfect with a squeeze of lemon.

For the price, the wait and the overall meal, I'd say this place ended up being average.  I'd consider going again, early, but for just the mussels and oysters.  However, if you're in Boston for a short time, like myself, I'd recommend checking out Island Creek Oyster Bar instead for their take on mussels and oysters.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: Holy heavens.  Terrific    Ask the waitstaff for their favorites.   Food was amazing.  Wait worth it.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
Just randomly YELPed.  This place lived up to the reputation.   High marks for the best lobstah roll.  Place was packed with line out the door.

I got the hot lobster roll with butter and it was yummy.  Will def be back.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: Yelped this restaurant before we ever got to Boston, ISO the best lobster roll in the city. While I have nothing to compare it to, it was delicious!! I'm not a fan of the cold lobster roll, this hot buttery version was so good, pricey, but yum! My first $30 sandwich, worth every penny! Now, the downfall... We arrived at 4:00 and waited an hour an a half to get in this TINY establishment.  We were only a party of two, large parties, you can forget eating here, unless you leave your name and number first thing in the morning! When we departed with full bellies and empty wallets, patrons arriving were told their wait would be upwards of three to three and a half hours!  One bowl of soup, two sandwiches, and a bottle of wine later, our bill including tip was $170! Steep prices and super long wait aside, I'd go back! This is a casual place, dress how you want. This is my first Yelp review, felt compelled to warn of the ridiculous wait to eat here! Here's the kicker... We are thinking of going back before we leave! They take your name and phone number and call you when they have a spot for you. If you plan in advance, do what the locals do, leave your name and number, take a nap, go shopping, go somewhere for a couple of cocktails, or all of the above, you'll have plenty of time!
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
I don't really understand the hype of this place. Boston has so many great seafood and oyster restaurants, and this one didn't even tap the top 5 for me. 

Firstly, no matter what, you will probably wait a minimum of 45 minutes to be seated. I think my party of 3 waited a little over an hour - which we used to walk around the neighborhood, glimpse  Paul Revere's house, etc. Once seated, you are subject to hearing every loud conversation around you because of the small space, and a constant line of people at the door, which never seems to close. A woman at a neighboring table was yelling almost constantly at the patrons waiting to "close the door" as the draft of the 50 degree day was quite chilly coming in. 

We only ordered oysters and drinks and although the oysters were delicious, we had no idea what we were eating. All three of us had ordered 9 or more oysters of many different varieties, but the restaurant refused to put them on separate platters, and they are not labeled. They simply told us to start at the lemon slice and work your way around the platter with the oysters in order of top to bottom on the menu. There were multiple circles as we ordered about 18 oysters and with the varying sizes, it was impossible to tell which circle was which. Prices were a little pricey but mostly comparable.

Wine selection seemed decent, beer selection was lacking.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: The food is fantastic. If only the service was. I've caught so much attitude at this place I won't go back. Last time I gave it a try two servers were busy chatting behind the bar. The place was about two/thirds full. After waiting five minutes or so, I walked over to ask if there was a table. I got cold stares and then was told they would be with me in a minute. They resumed their girlfriend chat. I left. Love the food, but it's not so good that I need to put up with being treated like I'm some hobo trying to check into The Ritz.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
SO WORTH THE WAIT!!!

After reading all the reviews, my husband and I decided on a plan of action to get a seat without waiting for hours - go on our run early on a sunday morning and arrive at Neptune within a half hour of their opening at 11:30am.  Mission accomplished as we arrived at 12:00 PM to a full restaurant with people and fish everywhere!!  They took our name and number and said 30-45 min, we will call you.

We walked around and finally 40 min later they called so we practically ran back. Once back we still waited a few minutes, no biggie.  Placed at the bar with a raw bar menu we were ready!  The descriptions offered on that menu were extremely accurate.  We love oysters and were looking forward to some east coast varieties.  So happy to have killer descriptions to keep us in the flavor profiles we prefer while being able to expand to some alternate flavors.

Post oysters, I had the shrimp cocktail and I have NEVER had shrimp like that!  The server was very knowledgeable and when she suggested four shrimp as my "meal" I decided that I could always order more later.  My husband ordered the hot lobster roll with "light" butter.

My shrimp: HUGE - almost the size of a 1.5lb lobster tail.  No joke.  I wasn't sure I could eat all 4!

His Roll: ALSO HUGE - based on the 1.5lb lobster I had today, there had to have been 4lbs worth of whole lobsters meat on that roll that was so soaked with the light butter that he couldn't even eat it but man, was it so fresh and tasty!!

Go.  Whenever you can.  Fresh, clean, tasty and fun.  The hustle and bustle works there.  Phenomenal and I can't wait to go back!
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
the lobster roll is indeed every bit as good as yelpers profess it to be (although, I must admit I asked for an extra side of butter - Im a very decadent girl!) and the oysters are unbelievably fresh - dare I say the best I've had in the city. my only regret is that I wish I skipped the fries - they were good, but I left uncomfortably full in my efforts to eat everything on my plate. what a great complaint to have! at this point, all of this is common knowledge, but to make this review useful, I have one thing to note:
 I did have one failed attempt at dinner here and learned my lesson - if you are going specifically for the lobster rolls, as most people typically do, theres two things you should do:
1. ASK if they are sold out of lobster. on our first attempt to eat here, we went in at 7 pm, with an hour wait, by the time we were called for our table only to be told that they were out of lobster. we were going SPECIFICALLY for a lobster roll, so this was like OMG DEVESTATING news. I left heartbroken, but live and learn.... if you are waiting for a table and give your phone number, they can call you if they run out in the meantime to give you a heads up in case you would like to make other plans.
2. go as EARLY AS POSSIBLE. don't show up at 8 pm and expect them to still have lobster. this place gets BUSY and things do get sold out, despite what the hostess may tell you - when we made our second attempt at dinner here, we were told "that never happens!" well guess what, it happened to us! we knew better to play it safe next time and go directly from work for an early dinner.
do this and you will have no problem.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: Decent lobster roll, but the fries were pretty boring. The fact that it was only a few degrees cooler inside but just as humid was disappointing.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
Never have I waited 2.5 hours for food but I did this time because of the outrageous reviews!!

Small place serving fresh seafood. Beer and wine only.

Great service, had great oysters, some of the best tuna I've ever had and the hot lobster roll!!
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
A friend showed me this place while I was visiting Boston this past weekend. We tried to put our name in around 7 o'clock Friday night but we were too late. They were sold out for the night. We tried again on Saturday and put our name in around 11. It was a 2 1/2 hour wait but you can give them your cell phone number to call you when they are ready for you. They also gave us about a 5 minute window to make it back, which was fine we stayed pretty close by! 

By far the best oysters I've ever had. We also ordered the Maine lobster roll with mayo. Excellent! and finally we ordered the muscles, which were the best muscles I've ever had as well. Highly recommend those three dishes!
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: This is a tough place to get a seat, but well worth it. It's rather small and they don't take reservations, so be prepared to wait for abit. I recommend going at off times, like 2 or 3pm, and asking for a counter seat instead of a table if your one or two people. The food is unmatched. Several kinds of oysters shucked by the fastest shuckers in Boston. The lobster rolls are as good as it gets. Not as big of a fan of the chowda, it's kind of thin, but still tasty. Quaint neighborhood in the North End worth a stroll.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
Food: 5/5
Service: 3/5
Cleanliness: 3/5
Decor & Style: 2/5

Yes, I used Yelp to come here. the Lobster Roll was indeed amazing! I still would not come back because it was WAY too small and crowded. The slowness made the experience real bad. Still, must come here at least once for the Lobster roll. The clams and oysters were so-so.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: The lobster roll is definitely good. The north end seafood stew is so so. Does it worth 3 hour wait? I would say no. This restaurant is way over rated from my opinion. If they tell you to wait 2-3 hours, just go somewhere else.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
If you want a great selection of oysters that are fresh, this is the place. Expect a wait and to eat in close proximity to strangers. The line starts early before they open and is a tourist trap. Service and décor is not a reason to go to this oyster bar. It is very small and, again, very touristy. I have never had an unsatisfying oyster here and am awed by the wide selection.

   I can't give it five stars and my wife is not impressed with me. She loves this place. But, of course, she loves oysters. The service, environment and price is lacking. However, you can't get a range of consistent oysters and variety anywhere in a city atmosphere (in Boston, anyways). I like to think I am gaining an understanding of oysters since I've eaten them all over New England, Nova Scotia, New York and New Orleans... but you be the yelping judge :)
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: The tuna crudo, clams, and johnny cakes were my favorite. We tried the east coast oysters raw bar, uni and shrimp cocktails. Uni was not amazing. Shrimp cocktail was huge! Lobster roll was the highlight of this restaurant, but it was disappointing because very little flavor. I've had a butter lobster roll with no mayo before at martha vineyard and that was super delicious. The lobster roll here was pretty bland maybe get the mayo roll options instead.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: My girlfriend and I had oysters and lobster rolls at the bar (love the white marble). She had buttered and I had mayo - best I've ever had. I love the atmosphere too in this cozy spot. Always worth the wait.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: Awesome lobster rolls, if your there on Monday try the lobster spaghettini with truffles.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: Love the fish tacos and spotting Sports players out for dinner. SO nice to people watch sometimes.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: Good location directly across a bridge from Portsmouth. - do take the beautiful walk across the bridge.  We both had the Lobster & Clam chowder (there's is a local award winner I hear) and it was delicious and not salty, as many of the other venues we tried chowder at.  Very good Bloody Mary's - have the one with the lobster and shrimp garnish.  The place sits just off the river and is very easy and comfortable to get into and out of - good for the aged and ambulatory challenged.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: A North End must. Amazing high quality fresh seafood. There is almost always a wait, but it's well worth it. Get the local oysters, chowder, crudo, ciopinno and some white wine or beer!!!
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
Price is a tad on the high side but so worth it. 
Island Creek oysters are amazing. Lobster rolls are phenominal.  Get there early. They open at 11:30am and people literally camp out waiting for them to open.  

I don't doubt the claims one bit. This is probably the best lobster roll in Boston.  And maybe the best oysters as well. 

I will definitely be coming back everytime I visit Boston.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: lobster roll + johnnycake. just do it. :]
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
Believe the hype, folks.  Believe it.  

I came here specifically to satisfy a crustacean hankering after hearing such overwhelming positive reviews from locals.  We arrived around 5:30ish and the place was busy but not crazy packed.  Magnifique.  We landed primo seats right up front by the raw bar.  Their no reservation policy in conjunction with their stellar reputation should really make you consider coming as early as possible to get a seat in their tiny little restaurant.  Lines were already formed by 6pm and it was only Thursday.  

I started out with several varieties of oysters which were all great -- salty, buttery nibbles of ocean lusciousness.  But that lobster roll.  Wow.  It was served hot with butter in the perfectly toasted, eggy brioche.  It was sublime and arguably one of the best lobster rolls I've ever had.  My friend ordered the mussels which were quite delicious as well.  The only minor gripe is that they didn't serve any good crusty bread to soak up all that yummy broth. 

The service was great.  Since we sat at the bar, we had a very attentive bartender.  They had a great wine selection but I opted for a nice cold beer.  Prices are a bit steep, but the food is truly worth it.  I can't wait to come back again!
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: There was a line before it was open but it was not too bad of a wait. Sat at the bar and ordered the daily special. The lobster taco was loaded, there was a kick with the sauce but good combination.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: Omg, yum! I came by myself on 10/13 and got super lucky and didn't have to wait to get seated. I sat at the bar and ordered a ton of the local oysters and the clam chowder. The little place was packed and the servers were so busy, but I got excellent service and the bartender gave me a great recommendation on wine. I loved it so much that I didn't even care when the guy next to me spilled my whole glass on my shirt! ;) Definitely recommend coming here!!
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: Lobster roll is great but a little soggy.  Local oysters are tasty and the fries might be the best fries I've ever had.  Worth the price once but otherwise out of my price range to return.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: Food was great, atmosphere was cool. Staff was pretty terrible to everyone around us, our waiter was aloof and just blank stared at us every time we asked for something. Wait was extremely long at dinner must put your name in early if you want to eat for dinner.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: This is the best oyster houses in Boston.  My husband and I are oyster addicts.  We love our Friday night oyster night with a couple of beers and a night out.  The oysters here are fabulous.  Fresh and cold which I find makes  a huge difference.  You can taste the difference the minute you bite into one!! The prices are a bit high but it has a great atmosphere for a night out.  Highly recommend getting there early because once 6pm rolls around expect a wait.  A LONG wait.  So plan ahead and make a night of it.  Well worth the time to check in enjoy your oysters!!!
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
I rely on Yelp for great reviews and Neptune Oyster was perhaps one of the best pointers I've received from the site.

Before I had an oyster at Neptune, I didn't even like oysters.  My girlfriend ordered a few and when they were brought out to us, I said something along the lines of, "enjoy, those are all yours".

She convinced me to give one a try and after that we ordered two more rounds.  They were some of the most delicious things I have ever tasted.  We got one of each oyster, each with a beautiful, unique flavor.  My favorites were the ones with the mineral finish.

We also ordered a tomato and oyster soup - fresh, flavorful, and delicious.  Angel got the skate which was stunning.  Even leftover it was fantastic.

Before we left Boston for the weekend, we came back for more.  We still talk about our trip to Neptune and will surely go back.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
Like so many other have written, THIS is the place for oyster opulence. They serve only the the best and they serve them very fresh. But that's not what keeps me coming back. The Lobsta roll does!!!  I've had it both ways and love them both equally. I kinda wish I could get one that was 1/2&1/2....  But I digress!  I guess if I HAD to pick a favorite it would be......  Conn style. Hot and buttered. OMG.. I'm drooling... I take this stuff way too seriously.

And tourists/visitors/people with free time... I have a tip for you. Don't come to Neptune at 7:00PM and ask for a seat. Do like i've done several times. Come between lunch and dinner... on a week day. I have NEVER waited one cotton pickin second for a seat here. I've always walked right in and sat down. Timing is everything!!!
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: This review is for the burger only. Atrocious. I would rather eat a day old McDonalds cheeseburger forgotten in the car than this. Besides the fact that someone seats you at the bar, the place is cool. I've had hundreds of burgers in 34 states and 20 countries and I can definitely say this is the first burger I have not finished in my whole life. Therefore, I personally dub it as the worst burger I have ever had. Bones all over making it impossible to eat the whole thing without the possibility of breaking a tooth. Very bitter and too juicy making it slippery like trying to hold a watermelon in a swimming pool. The only reason for the second star is the fries and the cool bartenders. 100% will never come again.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: This place is stupid good.  Walk in, sit down, no menu needed just order the lobster roll and leave extremely happy.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: The Neptune Oyster hot butter lobster roll is a religious experience. In my opinion, it is hands down the best lobster in proper Boston. Their oysters are great, with an amazing selection of wines and spirits. This is a place you would take an out of towner to impress them. The only con is the wait times, they can be as high as two hours during peak times. It's worth it though.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
No disrespect to Maine and I've been there, but Neptune Oyster has the best lobstah roll I've ever had.  Yea its $25 but its huge and worth every penny.  The roll is huge and stuffed over the top with claw and knuckle lobstah meat.  My wife and I got the cold and hot versions which were both ridiculous but I would have to give the edge to the hot version.  The warm butter spills into the plate and I found myself mopping the butter up with the bread roll.  Money.  Fries were great as well.  well seasoned and fried several times.

The oysters were great.  Wide selection and you order by pencil and paper.  My favorite is usually the kumamoto.  Pair a few oysters with a harpoon ipa and lobstah roll and you've got 5 stars.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: We went for lunch and realized we would have to wait. We were greeted by a rude and obnoxious man inside. He kept yelling close the door, when customers were trying to get in. When we asked how long was the wait, his answer was we don't have any lobster, I don't know when it is coming and I have 2 parties ahead of you so I don't know how long the wait is. I am hoping this is an employee and not the owner. Will not go back no matter how good the lobster roll is.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: Hard to imagine what I can say about this place that wasn't already said.  Heard about Neptune from the Bartender at the Bell in Hand tavern.  It was everything we had hoped for; excellent fresh oysters, great lobster roll.  It gets crowded, so expect to put your name on the list and then wander around North End until it's your turn.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
I'm seriously planning a trip back specifically for a lobster roll! 

Obviously everyone seems to know about this place with all the reviews. If you haven't checked this place out you really need to! 

The (hot) lobster roll is to die for!! Everything we had was amazing!! Oysters, shrimp cocktail...it was all perfect! 

Try and go at off hours for less of a wait. We go between lunch and dinner and that seems to work out best. We've always had great service though no matter how cramped it gets!
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
Oysters were excellent, clam chowder was more "meh". The soup, because it's "made to order", did take a little longer than I would expect to come out, and the style is really thin, rather than a thick, chunk soup.

I'm a little hesitant to go back, only because I KNOW that I can get just as good oysters for cheaper (and a better experience with better service) elsewhere.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
Since this restaurant is the most-reviewed and most highly-reviewed Boston establishment on Yelp, it made the perfect place for a special occasion dinner.

We knew there would be a long wait, but we were pleasantly surprised when asked for our phone number and told the hostess would call us to come back for our table. Mind you, it was a 2 1/2 hr wait, but we've waited over an hour outside of other places we love, so getting a chance to enjoy the city in the meantime was great. Come on a nice night, put your name in, and go grab a drink and an appetizer somewhere else to hold you over. Don't come to put your name in too late or you might get turned away--there was a group who came at 9:30 when we got back and they were told no more names were being taken because the wait was too long and they close at 12.

We got back just over two hours later to check on our wait time, and the hostess actually had spots open at the bar and we were able to sit right away. She and our waiter were both very nice, I noticed some other reviewers thought that the staff had a 'tude but we didn't have that experience. 

Got started with raw oysters, which neither of us had ever tried, and with the help of the bartender decided on a couple East coast, a couple West coast, and some littleneck clams. The East coasters were super salty but good (I believe they were the Kumamoto),  but we both actually liked the West coast ones more. I forget which ones they were but in their description I remember they said "with a melon flavor" or something like that. Still salty but not as briny as the East and the sweetness was a perfect complement. Clams were little but good as well. 

Finally, we both got the hot lobster rolls. Amazing. Buttery, toasted bun just bursting with huge chunks of delicious lobster. Most places will run you $18-25 dollars for a lobster roll, and they're $25 here, but absolutely worth it and definitely have more lobster than any other place I've been. Also worth mentioning, despite their business, we didn't feel rushed at all by our waiter and were able to take our time, which we appreciated.

Overall, worth the wait and the price. We'll be back!
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: Visiting from out of town and it came recommended.  Had the lobster roll and it was awesome!!
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
Q: Shall we sample sometimes staggeringly priced sumptuous sea-sourced selections of the famed Neptuzzy? 
A: Ain't gotta ask me twice.

I've never been here, and it was high time I gave it a go. I'm kind of a picky eater when it comes to creature treats, but I will try anything from the ocean at least once. With such a tiny place and a no reservations policy, I knew coming at peak time on a weekend night was going to be a bit of a challenge. This was not an incorrect assumption. We considered scrapping the whole idea but some time spent at Goody G's took the edge off. We ended up waiting an hour and a half, which was exactly what we were told. 

We were finally seated by a little half cherub, half merbaby statue perched behind our seats who eyed our every movement with his languid, frozen gaze. The table arrangements here are not for those that long for privacy, you will no doubt get dragged into conversation by those around you. Just (lobster) roll with it. After our adult beverages were procured, we launched into our appetizer and raw bar orders. I got the Japanese octopus salad and the rest of the table got a nice sampling of oysters. I enjoyed my salad, though it didn't quite have the wow factor I thought it would. The little bit of citrus flavor that I did get was divine, just need to pump up the volume. Being the incredibly individualistic persons that we are, everyone got the hot lobster roll for our main course. 

Okay.

Can I say, when you're about 2 prosecco glasses deep on a humid summer night a hot roll of rich meat is maybe not the best idea? Despite the awkwardness of eating such a thing in such conditions, it was really pretty good. Very buttery, if I go back and order again I may ask to go easy on it next time. The bread was good, and the portion was massive. And the fries. Oof. I can't even explain how good they were. We did not have to wait long for anything, service was swift but a little barebones. Kind of expected a bit more out of the place in that department.

While it wasn't the religious experience some people like to rave about, I would definitely pay a visit again. Cherub-merbaby needs love.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
GREAT SERVICE & AMAZING FOOD.

5 STAR BREAKDOWN

1. SERVICE WAS AMAXING
2. arrived promptly at 11:30AM which is when they opened and was seated right away.
3. The servers were Both Angels - one was pregnant and she was so considerate and always asking if everything was okay and quickly took our finished dishes away 
4. LET ME TELL YOU --- OYSTERS ARE JUST GEMS... NOT ONLY THAt we had 2 rounds of oysters 

5. lobster roll is where it is at!!! Best in town hands down!
6. The clam chowder tasted like it is water based .. So it's not the thick traditional clam chowder we are all used too - it is more MILkY more watery 

Tip: come in a smaller party ; come early (11:30AM) to be seated right away
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
After much rave reviews, I finally made it to Neptune. 
We got here around 7pm and since it was a spur of the moment thing, we had no reservations. 
As expected, the place was packed so it was not too surprising that when we put our name down for a table for 2- we got a
response of  "it's going be a 40min wait". OK- no problemo.  - gave the digits for a call back when the table was ready. 

Hungry took over so we headed over to a side street pizza joint for a snack. The name escapes me right now but it was good... I guess that's just gonna be a different yelp review.  :)

We did our business at the pizza joint and 45 min later. Still NO call.  I know- I'm a bit impatient and very much an "are we there yet" gal.  We decide to head over to Neptune to see what the hold up was. 

When we got there, the hostess advised that we could look at the menu to see what we wanted to order.  Gladly obliging we looked on as our mouths were salivating.  We waited another 15min to be seated.  Is it 8pm already? 

We got seated at a table and since the place is really tiny, the tables are placed right next to each other.  They pack you in like sardines, elbows to elbows- no personal space.  We were lucky to spot 3 empty stools at the bar instead and were able to move.  Still elbows to elbows, but the thought of the cute guy sitting diagonally right across from me while I wolf down oysters was not going to be pleasant.  I recommend sitting at the bar instead. 

We got 1 1/2 doz of oysters and 1/2 doz. of cherrystones,  hamachi tartare and the roasted wild sea bass.. all to share. 

The oysters and cherrystones were very fresh, but I have to say, they were small.  I've had bigger.  The hamachi tartare had nice presentation, but was unfortunately overly tart with citrus flavor.  The people next to us saw what we were picking at and also ordered it.  Too bad they didn't ask us how it was. They took a few bites and had the barista take it away and ordered a salad instead. No joke. 
The bass entree was very tasty,  except for the pancetta that the fish was sitting ontop of- it was way too hard.

I''m not a fan, but if I feel like spluging and waiting around, I would like to come back again and try their lobster roll.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
Make sure you go early because you may have to wait for over an hour.

They have awkward seatings and you may have to share a table with strangers (small restaurant - I dont think it fits more than 30 people max, including the bar area) and their service is pretty slow, but their fabulous oysters make up for it, so I wont complain :)

I heard their lobster roll is life changing - I will try this next time I go back.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
A very delicious raw bar indeed.  Now, this is a very small space.  Smaller than Taro Sushi even. You're literally squeezing between north and south oriented bars tools and seats just to get to the tables, bathrooms and exit. No reservations are taken and my guess is you'll be playing musical chairs like one plays musical pizzas at DiFara in Brooklyn.  

On to the food.  Each oyster is intense and distinct in flavor.  The kitchen food is a different story, it's not horrible but IMO it's too expensive for what it is.  Creative but certainly way too mellow (ie bland).  Oysters seem to go for an average of a $1.50 a pop no matter where they're from.  Pretty damn good for what you get.  Follow those with a Whale Tail Pale Ale and you're doing well.

So, between the very briny oysters and equally briny beer, the ambiance and antique decor, the lack of bad attitude from the servers, all this more than makes up for the space and kitchen food hassle.  In fact all of this combined has a nice calming effect.  Something very rare in a city where it's nowhere near the population of the Big Apple and yet you have less elbow room and certainly crazier drivers. 

I just may be able to tolerate all you Pepperidge Farm soundin' , Boston Red Sox lovin' bean eaters after all.
.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: The food wasn't the way I think that good, may be it just not fit with Asian's favor. However, the lobster and oysters are fresh.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: A MUST. Incredible quality and the service (despite being super busy) was excellent. Well worth the line out the door.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
It was so busy and popular in there! I got there just in time to grab a 1 seater by the bar. They had local beer! Can't beat that. 

Unfortunately, I was not impressed by the warm lobster roll especially for $25. Yes, it was covered with butter and oh-so-warm chunks of lobster meat. There was something missing. I'm not sure what it is. Should I try it cold next time?

The guy next to me had a nice chunky piece of scrumptious fish. Now that looked good! There are many other things that were good. The OYSTERS were wonderful. I ordered a few to sample that I suspected I would like. I loved them! I liked it so much that I had to order another sample set (even though I couldn't breath anymore). 

The bill I racked up was not to be envious of. Yikes! So juicy though. mmm.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
I'm very glad Jill K. chose this place for us to finish our trip off with Lobster Rolls.  Those things are HUGE!  (and delicious)  I've had my fill of lobster for a while...

In addition to the crazy lobster rolls...Neptune's offers a good list of oysters that you just check off on a list the ones you want (kind of like those papers you get during all you can eat sushi) and yes, they were yummy.

The table next to use was a group of four sharing a couple bottles of wine and various seafood appetizers and dishes - which seemed like a really cool way to go.  The mussels and razor clams looked delicious!

In addition the feel of the place was really mellow and cool.  Great for a group, great for a date.  We were lucky we got there early, it's not a big place so there was a line at the door when we left.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: If there was a way to award 0 stars, I would.  Avoid the hype please. Just because waiting time is long doesn't mean it's good. Sub par and if this place was in NYC, it will undoubtedly go bust within 2 months.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: Neptune needs a better seating system. Came here today at 4:30 and was told the wait was 3-3.5 hours for two people. I put my name in and didn't get a call back for 5 hours without any update. We tried getting an update but it was not effective because of the rude hostess. Either give me a better estimated wait time so I don't plan an entire day around coming here or get a reservation system. Needless to say we didn't end up going. Thanks Neptune.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
I came to Neptune for the lobster roll but what impressed me the most were the oysters. I liked how they gave rather detailed descriptions of the oysters (high salt, medium, plump, butter finish etc) which made choosing the ones I liked much easier. I tried the Wellfleet, Cuttyhunk, Cotuit, and Mottie Blue- they were all very good, my fav was Cuttyhunk... salty, very plump, ah it was so good with just a squeeze of lemon. 

I got the hot lobster roll, it is not the best one I've had, but I was quite satisfied. Good amount of lobster, buttery and cooked just right. I wasn't a fan of the fries though, should have swapped it out with a salad. 

I also had a live uni. I really love uni, but I didn't think there was anything special about it other than being served in the shell. 

Be prepared for the wait though. I was there at 11.20 am, but there was already a line and I had a seat (for one) in about an hour. They do take your number and give you a call, which was great because I could wander around the North End (recommended) and check out the amazing bakeries.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: This one is the best seafood restaurant in Boston! The lobster roll is great! I like the hot lobster meat with warm butter inside. I feel satisfied with each bite. The fresh olyster bar is amazing! There are many choices in their olyster bar Manu, I tried some, and they all taste great! Very fresh! The waiter told me Some are shipped from MA, some from  connecticut. I like them all. A highly recommended place. One tip, avoid the rush hour, they never accept reservation, have to wait for nearly two hrs to get in for dinner. But worth the time!
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
Strike 1:  Requested a cot at the point of the reservation, at the point of check in and then 4 hours later.  Just to be told there wasn't one available and its first come first serve.  I would expect a month advance would be enough.  
Strike 2:  The front desk never called back when I called at 10 PM about the cot, and was hung up on when I called twice after.  
Strike 3:  When I went down to the front desk, Solomon was rude and also called me a liar.  Said i was never hung up on.
Strike 4: I was charged $44 for a bus trip I never took.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: Outstanding all around, only had a lobster roll, huge, and a sam adams dark winter something or other. It was back in March and was 4 degrees out, soooo cold, but the food was stellar and so was the experience. Really really enjoyed it. Top notch!
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
I honestly hate when people on Yelp rate a restaurant based on service over the food, but I can't help it. They have the most amazing lobster rolls I have ever had, but the hostess is the WORST. 

We have been craving this lobster roll for A FULL YEAR. We live in California and were back in town with a band we manage who just sold out the House Of Blues. We called ahead to ask what time they close. I was told the kitchen closes at 10:30. We called at 10 to place an order for 8 lobster rolls for the band, some of the crew and for us and had the hostess tell us it was too bad, they weren't taking any outgoing orders. So we spent $20 for someone to take a taxi over there to place the order and when he got there, she wouldn't let him order either! So we I to call to explain what the deal was, and she was the most unprofessional person I have ever dealt with at a restaurant. Every word I said she would say "nope", "nope", "nope", "nope" until I just lost my temper. 

I really hope other people who have bad experiences with her write reviews and tell management so they get a competent hostess.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: I came here with my buddy on a Tuesday night. The place was absolutely packed but they had a very nice table for us in the back of the restaurant. We started off with some oysters, clams and octopus. I never had octopus before, it was absolutely delicious though. It was fried and topped with some kind of almond sauce and served with rucola. I thought it couldn't get any better but the lobster roll exceeded my expectations. My friend got it cold and with mayo, I decided to order it hot with butter. It definitely is a big portion, the price of 28$ is justified. All in all an excellent experience, so if you decide for a delicious, authentic Boston cuisine you can't go wrong with this place. Don't look at the prices - just enjoy.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
