name: Neptune Oyster

text: This place is AMAZING!!! I just wish it was bigger. You will be turned away if you don't get there early enough. If you have to wait in line just know that the food is worth the wait. Excellent lobster roll. Awesome hamburger with fried oyster inside. Oysters were so fresh and delicious! Clam chowder was a little thin and boring but 3 amazing dishes out of 4 is not bad. I love love love this place if I go back to Boston I would definitely make a pit-stop:)
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
Don't let the claustrophobic diner scare you off, or else you'll be kicking yourself for the rest of your trip. No reservations. Put your name down and by some black magic, Japanese super-ninja style, the punctuality of their wait times are impeccable. 

My group went around the block to a cafe and Bricco to chill. 2 hours later, boom, seated with oysters on the way. Large selection of oysters with very descriptive words. They are all delicious. And of course my taste buds like to toy with me by making me love the more expensive oyster around: KUMAMOTO. Black, tiny, deep shells packed with an atomic flavor profile. I've never had anything like it, not in Washington, not in San Fran, not in New York. Here!

Try the warm lobster roll. It's expensive, $30, but it's good. You should try it at least once.

Try the fried clams basket. I can only shake my head in disbelief how delicious it is. I'm angry at the world that I just discovered this basket.

I can't finish this review, I'm too hungry and my desire to go back is too fervent.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: Oysters are the best. Must get lobster roll (The best in town). Their soup was okay, a little too creamy. Their daily catches are usually cooked to perfection and incredibly filling.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: Love this place. Everyone goes here for the lobster roll (which is amazing), but my favorite dish is the North End Cioppino.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
This is a tiny little restaurant with spectacular food in a popular neighborhood that doesn't take reservations. Luckily they have a great policy of taking your phone number and calling you when your table is ready, so you can walk around and kill time while you are waiting. Brillant!  In the minute's time it took us to get inside when they had our spot available I witnessed 2 customers getting all worked up over the table situation. People really seem to be passionate about getting in there, that is always a great sign.

The food was spectacular. I was a little bummed to find they only served champagne and wine, I am not a huge fan of either. We did get a nice bottle of wine which was almost half  the bill. That was the only negative. 
The fish/shellfish was all very fresh and delicious!
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: Quintessential Boston - ergo - overblown.  But, the food is good.  And, I was already wearing like 50 layers, so the fact every time the door opened you could literally see your breath, well, it still mattered, but, at least the oysters were tasty.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
Went for brunch and had an excellent meal! Showed up at 11:45 AM (they open at 11:30 on Saturdays) and there was already a 1.5 hour wait for a party of 2. Although the food is worth the wait, go 2 hours before when you want to eat, put your name in, and enjoy the streets and shops of the North End while you wait.

Raw oysters and shrimp cocktail were fresh.
Hot lobster roll was on amazing as always!
The seared scallops were very good as well.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
Our first trip to Boston as a family on our 8th grade son's Spring Break and we stopped in for some fresh seafood and they delivered!  The oysters, Ipswich clams, arugula salad, North End Cioppino and Lobster Spaghettini were all delicious.  Highly recommend the food and the guys behind the counter/bar where we were seated provided good service!   

The restaurant is TIGHT/SMALL so that explains the 2 hour wait times I've read about!  We walked in at 4:30pm on a Monday with NO WAIT.  We were thrilled to be seated immediately!  Get there early on a lower peak evening to avoid the wait.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
Based on Yelp reviews, we decided to make this our premiere seafood lunch during our Boston stay.  And we're so glad we did!

We believe in doing our research, and planned our restaurant selection accordingly - we were here on a weekday right at 11:15am (15 min before opening), and we were the second party in a line that grew pretty quickly after us.  It is a bit non-descript before they open, we weren't the only ones to do the walk-by, double-take, walk-back while we were searching for it.  Tip:  look for the name on the awning, since the storefront glass is all covered up by what looks like bullet-proof armour which stays up until they open the doors at 11:30am.

Anyway, the food was just delicious - we started with a selection of oysters and clams from the raw bar, and can totally understand why several other diners looked like that's all they had - they were the freshest we've had anywhere to date.  Next, three of us had to try the Lobster Rolls, of course (hot with butter) - they were wonderful.  I can understand why some people aren't overwhelmed by them - they really are just lobster meat drenched in butter stuffed into top-cut hot dog buns, but boy, when you put that much perfectly-steamed lobster, slather it in butter till it takes on both the flavour and colour of the lobster, and then let it soak into the barely dense-enough to hold together bun, it is heaven!

Another reviewer complained about the fries only being meh, so I wasn't expecting anything great that way, but man, those were perfectly fried and salted (I know there're about as many opinions on what makes a perfect fry as there are people who eat them, but I challenge anyone to say they weren't good).

As for the service, I found it on par with our other Boston experiences.  In one phrase:  no-nonsense.  Pleasant enough, but you can tell they care more about keeping the line moving than making you feel welcome (warm and fuzzy is not on the menu).  As long as you don't do/say something remarkably stupid, you'll be fine.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
This place still gets only one star. Went to "try" for the Neptune burger a few weeks ago and got the last two seats at the bar. JACKPOT! Things are looking up here people!! Then I see him, the horrible horrible bartender. Great, we have a 50/50 chance of success. 

Order up one dozen oyster and waited and waited for him to take our meal order. Finally, I waved him over and said "Maybe we should order now?" Ok great," We will have 2 Neptune burgers." Then out of his mouth, i see his lips moving, but in slow motion and i know we have a problem here... he says "Sorry, we are out of the burger" Mind you, it is 6pm on a Monday night.. how on earth are you out of the burger??? Maybe you should have said something when we sat down "hey we 86-ed the burger, just in case you wanted it..." 

Now, that burger is truly an amazing burger, but i am so fed up with the service at the bar and the fact that they constantly "run out" (i personally think they purposely dont have it because it is the least expensive item on the menu) that i really cant do this anymore. Dining out shouldnt be based on chance and the hopes that you carry something that is always on your menu. 

So, even though you were the place where i fell in love with my now boyfriend Neptune Oyster, you and i are done.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
Everybody knows that Neptune is outstanding and as good as it gets in Boston when it comes to fresh, quality seafood. 

Get the cold lobster roll with a glass of rose and it's impossible to be disappointed. The grilled brioche bun is so tasty and it's loaded with tons of lobster meat, lightly coated in mayo.

The only bad part: be prepared to wait hours to get into this little gem of a restaurant.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: Not a place to go in Boston.  Staff is incredibly rude and not helpful.  Spend your money elsewhere.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: This is as good as it gets for fresh shucked oysters plus the absolute best loaded with mouth watering hot or cold lobster roll anywhere in the city. It gets very crowded and you have to be chummy with the people next to you. Not high dining by any stretch of the imagination but simply great food. It's a special experience but it's certainly worth it.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
We-a party of three-waited on line, to put our name down, next to another who put their name down an hour earlier with no inkling of a check in from staff. A few moments in, a group of two or three white Bostonian men cut in front of us all and put their name down with a staffwoman. She looked around for availability, gave them the pointer finger up asking them to wait, and asked them to close the door that those of us waiting in line were keeping open. Thanks for the diligence and care in the service you offer. 

I love oysters and all forms of seafood, but I will not be supporting Neptune until they #dobetter.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
Seriously?!?!? that is what my fiance and I said to each other as we slurped up our first oyster. This place is so good, it makes you curse, even if you aren't a curser! Totally worth the wait and the hype!

We got a dozen assorted oysters, we just asked our waitress what was the best. ZOMG the BEST oysters I have EVER EVER EVER had in my life. On top of the cocktail horseradish sauce, they also give this oniony vinegary sauce to put on the oyster. This combo along with the freshness of the oysters made me curse like a sailor. Downed with some bubbly goodness I was in heaven. 

We also got 2 lobster rolls, one cold with mayo the other warm with butter. GET THE ONE WITH BUTTER! the mayo was great dont get me wrong, but neptune oyster just does the butter lobster roll SOOO SOO RIGHT!!! Thank you Boston and thank you Neptune Oyster for giving me one of the best meals of my life! I will be back!
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: This is my favorite place for fresh oysters. As others have said, the lobster roll is also AMAZING. If you come for anything else, expect a limited (but yummy!) menu and a cramped (but kinda cozy!) location. I love coming and eating at the bar... my husband and I had a lovely New Year's Eve dinner at the bar one year. Very sweet and memorable. It is a little pricey but not unreasonable for a special occasion. The employees are always pleasant and I have never felt rushed here, despite its popularity and small size.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: Serious about oysters and clams. So good. The crab claws were iced and therefore cold and gross. The steamed clams are awesome! We dipped bread into the broth.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: Impeccable seafood!  I think I was getting teary eyed because of the extended mouth orgasm I was going through when I was indulging in the octopus, oysters, lobster, clams...  It was so well worth the 2 1/2 hr wait!!!
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
The food here is simply amazing! 

We were here for lunch on a Monday afternoon with our family. The place is small & busy. We waited for about 30 minutes for a table. One of us got the lobster roll, cold with mayo. It was seriously good! It has a good amount of large lobster chunks in it. We also got the 2 lbs lobster dish that we can't remember the exact name at the moment. All we remember that it was just really really good. As for the portion, it's huge! 

The service is good but nothing spectacular. Our waitress were polite but she definitely to smile a bit. 

The wait can long but we think it's definitely worth the wait. If you love seafood, you must give this place a try. You won't be disappointed.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
Dateline Boston October 2012.  I sensed that a trip to the area would not be complete without finding a decent batch of raw oysters to consume.  While partaking in bantering with business associates in Seaport, I decided that a little intel gathering here would go a long way toward success.  Neptune... Neptune... Neptune.  That's all I got.  Was there no other choice?  While heading back into my hotel in the North End, a quick conversation with the doorman confirmed everything... Neptune.

I got there as early as I could which meant about 6:00 and for a party of one, a twenty minute wait was nothing (though by the time I left, a party of four would have to wait two hours!).  The place is quite small, but well worth any wait.  I left my cell phone number and ventured around and magically enough, the rang me up when things were ready to go.

It can be as daunting as ordering wine or sushi when presented with a list of oysters with different merroir.  I went with simplistic descriptions such as buttery, briny, and champagne which landed me with Moon shoal, Tatamagouche, and Beausoleil respectively.  Fantastic.  Fresh and clean.  It was just the quality and presentation that I was looking for.  I followed that up with a recommendation from the afore-mentioned doorman which was the Neptune Burger.  It was a complete pleasure in and of itself with carefully prepared fried oysters and properly cooked burger.  Even though it's an oyster place - I would highly suggest it.

My advice.... put your name on the list and simply be prepared to walk around the block... check into a bakery or something... make it a real experience... enjoy life!
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: Delicious. Expect to wait in line, even for lunch on a weekday. Lobster rolls are perfect!
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: I would say the male waiter taking names on the waitlist was rude.  The hot lobster roll was not as good as I had for the past two years.  The bread was cold.  I was there in September.  The waiters often said two hours wait but I never actually had more than half an hour wait.  I am not sure if I would ever want to go back again.  The couple who sat next to us had a seafood platter but they left more than half of the food there and people were asking if they thought food was not good.  They said the seafood had a weird smell.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
only a place this good can use tuna tartare as a damn condiment for a veal sandwich.

holy mother of god, this place is just intensely amazing and unprententious.

for a city so steeped in fishing history, I always find it difficult to recommend a seafood restaurant in the city without forcing a schlep to Inman Square (Legal's doesn't cut it, sorry).  Now I have an awesome option for the BOS side of the river.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: Does not take reservations but there was a 2.5 hour wait at 3:30pm. The place had open tables and the hostess said people put their names on the wait list and were coming back. Not that serious, when you can get oysters anywhere in Boston.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
Second time here and must say food is amazing 5 stars!!! 
however, service from the hostess/waitress was SO BAD!!!!! It was a rainy Sunday 12PM when my friend and I arrived and she asked the hostess/waitress if I could wait the 30 min in a chair that was empty From one of the tables not using it since I'm 8 months pregnant. And this woman was so rude to say "no you can't. Actually I'm being very nice to let you stay on the door but if you want to go to a cafe I can call you when your table is ready". She could have been more polite and understanding. After 45 min wait in a cafe nearby they called us and to my surprise there were like 5 people waiting on the door entrance where she said we could NOT have been. 
She was all the time giving weird answers and also didn't make us comfortable asking if she could get our plates to take out when we were still eating. Or if we wanted something else WHILE STILL EATING. 
Then when we asked if they have dessert, the answer was "we are very small to have desserts or coffee". WTF?! 

FOOD: 
Johnny cake with honey butter smoked fish and caviar is amazing. 
Veal and tuna tartare sandwich was a very interesting combination. 
Lobster tacos were very tasty a bit spicy with the right acidity and herbs. 
Lobster roll is one of my favorites, with warm butter and an amazing brioche grilled bun.

AMBIANCE: very small and we had to share a table with strangers. After 45 min waiting.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
This, is the greatest place in Boston. Writing this review because now that i've moved back across the country to my CA home, i find myself crying at night for Neptunes. I first discovered this place when i was checking out colleges in the area and asked the hotel concierge where he recommended for lobster rolls. i double checked his recommendation on the place he kept singing praises about (Neptunes) and decided it was a valid option. after all YELP IS LIFE. 

YES the place is small, get over it.
YES you'll probably have to wait
(but hey be smart, don't go prime time on a weekend or overly starving. you are in the north end after all, walk around and enjoy the scenery.
also you are about to have the best meal of your life in one of the most beautiful places in the US you must be a real hard person to please if this is what irks you. stop complaining )

but will you be disappointed?


HELL NO


Yes its pricey, but its seafood. If you want cheap go to the boston chowder co. 

Whenever ppl would visit me in Boston i'd take them here and watch them as they ate a lobster roll. They should have a scrapbook of everyones first lobster roll face because its kinda unexplainable, like the food here. No words or pictures can do it justice. Do yourself a favor, go here.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: This place has the best lobster roll (with hot butter) I have ever had. If you're in Boston, it should be on the top of your list of places to visit.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
Ya, definitely lives up to the hype! 
We came here around 4:45ish, just as we had finished a tour (Hub Town tours by Ted, best tour guide EVER) and were told we had a 30 minute wait, so we walked around and within 10 minutes were told that our table was ready. HAZAA. 
Boyfriend had the oysters, I had clam chowder, and we shared the fish and chips. He said his oysters were phenomenal. My clam chowder was perfect. Certainly it was also massive, we ended up sharing some of it. 

The fish and chips had mixed reviews. BF liked it, and it's not that they weren't good, but I felt the batter was a bit tasteless so had to be supplemented with salt and lemon. It could have been just a tad better, but not enough that I thought it warranted a reduced star or anything... just that I guess I had higher expectations. 

The woman next to us ordered the scallops and not only did I have food envy, I also had food regret, I wished immediately I had ordered that instead of the fish and chips. By the way the fries were awesome. 
I would certainly recommend this place and certainly come back in a heartbeat!!!!
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: Small hole in the way but the reputation is definetly here.  Lobster roll and oysters really satisfied me.  I felt like I ate a whole lobster.  This is a must stop if you're in Boston.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: Visited this spot awhile back while I was in town for a Lakers / Celtics game and loved the Maine Lobster Roll and Seared Scallops - both items were flavory and delish. As a Los Angeles foodie, this place is really really good. I'll definitely come back!
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
These oysters come from the god Neptune himself. They are that good! So we were there in a large group and we virtually ordered every oyster on the menu along with crawls and something else which was obviously not very memorable. 

The oysters were amazing! The medium size oysters were the best in my opinion while my friends seemed to enjoy them all for different reasons. The one from Maryland seemed salty and that's all the flavor they had. 

Now the sea bass?! Best freaking sea bass I have ever had! The fish was cooked perfectly. It was the right texture and the right temperature. When I go back this is my dish. 

Some friends had the lobster roll and they said it was amazing and according to the waiter that is one of their signature dish. 

Service was great. The decor was relax and unique. The wait was long but worth it. I suggest get on the list and go across the street for drinks, they'll call you when a table is ready. 

There is one bathroom, I guess to meet code or something. 

Fantastic place.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: I come here every time I am in Boston.  It is absolutely AMAZINGLY!  The hot lobster roll is to die for.  It is always crowded so get there right when they open at 11:30 to make sure you get a table.  I will definitely be back next time!
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: Very nice restaurant. They don't take reservations so you have to put your name on the list ahead of time if you want to get a table on the weekends. This is a good place to go with friends, family or on a date. They have a small bar area and the tables are very close to each other. Great service and delicious seafood dishes. $$$
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
If you love oysters and lobster, Neptune Oyster is the place to go.  The place is small, with bar seating and a few communal tables, so it gets packed fast.  There's usually a wait for a seat and they don't take reservations, but they'll take down your name and give you a call once your seats are ready.  On my visit, a 1.5 hr wait turned into 45 minutes, which was just enough time to explore the area and pick up some cannolis for dessert.

You order the oysters off a menu card you fill out, which includes oysters from various parts of the east coast as well as other items such as clams.  All the oysters we ordered were very fresh and delicious, but my favorite part of the meal was the Hot Lobster Roll.  Freakin amazing!  They do it different than the cold mayo based lobster rolls you find at other places.  There's starts off with a toasted buttered roll, filled with huge chunks of fresh sweet lobster, served hot and doused in butter.  So simple, but totally worth the wait.

Boston has plenty of good choices for oysters and lobster rolls, but go to Neptune Oyster and you won't regret it!
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
One of Boston's best, but be careful if you're on a budget. It's easy to rack up a bill here! Not that you'll care...

Order a bottle of wine, a variety of oysters, 2 crab legs, a lobster roll with butter and entree to share. You'll leave full and happy.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: Long wait because the place is small but very worthwhile. The staff are very friendly and the food portions are big and delicious.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: I've heard that there is usually a wait at Neptune Oyster. Luckily, when I visited, we only endured a mere ten minute wait on a Sunday afternoon. The staff was very friendly when we asked questions regarding items on the menu and thoroughly explained how the oyster menu worked and the difference amongst the variety of oysters offered. We ended up ordering Maine Lobster Roll - hot with butter on a toasted roll (highly recommend), Buttermilk Johnnycake, and a dozen oysters. The lobster roll was huge and delicious, hands down one of the best lobster rolls I've ever had and they don't skimp out on the lobster. The Johnnycake was good, but once was enough for me. I would recommend it to try, but probably would not order again. Overall, Neptune Oyster is on the pricier end since our total came up to ~$87, but the experience, the quality of the food, and most importantly, the company of my partner made up for it.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: Went to Neptune on a Thursday night. No tables were available so we sat at the bar. My wife gave the Oysters 3 stars, not as good as B&G in the south end. My clam chowder was just OK. Nice crowd. Bartenders were OK, but nothing special. We won't go back, but I could see how others may like it.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
Well the lobster rolls are good here, and the staff is usually very friendly.... But I guess something's changed?

Per their usual 1 hr wait(also what was quoted to me) I went to put my name down, and about an hour later I called Jerry the hostess to see if I should start walking back as I was a 15 minute walk away. She told me to start heading back, so I did.

When I got there I checked in,  Jerry told me to go wait outside..and about 15 minutes later I nicely asked her how much longer does she think the wait will be. She snapped at me and asked me if she should take me off the list...  I understand that they are busy and it can get hectic, but when I asked there was no one else checking in, and I asked very politely. 

No matter how good the food is in a place, hospitality is always important!! And this is why this place is successful... not only because the food is good, because of the customer service as well.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
Cheers to oysters! I'd say this place lived up to its hype. 

Luckily enough I was traveling so I managed to come during the weekday when they open for lunch. I arrived around 11:35 and was immediately seated. I shared a platter of 20 oysters and clams. 

On average they come out to about $3 a pop. Not too shabby but not cheap either, I like their variety of oysters from the East and West Coast. None of the oysters were briny, I preferred the oysters over clams. I like that the server tells you which oysters you are eating so you can train to become an oyster connoisseur and develop a certain preference in mind. With that said my favorites are Kumamoto, kushi and cotuit. 

I'd say this place is pretty up there with Old Ebbitt Grill in DC, worth checking out for locals and tourists.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
Tip: Come early - the line can be ridiculous. 

Neptune proved to me that Raw Oysters are aphrodisiacs because I came out of Neptunes even more in love with oysters than I thought possible.

We tried this delightful medium-sized oyster with a champagne aftertaste and a meaty texture. Wow! Neptune added just the right sauces to add to the experience without distracting from the flavour of the oyster.

For a main, we had the lobster roll. After all, what is a trip to the Northeast without lobster? And Neptune makes a good lobster roll. They certainly did not skimp on the lobster with meaty chunks of lobster stuffed in a soft and buttery brioche bread. Tastes amazing warm, although I imagine it's a very different, equally mouthwatering experience cold. 

We also tried the North End Cioppino. To be completely honest, I found he shrimp slightly over cooked. The stew was delicious, however, and the saffron in the rice was a fantastic call. 

Good, fresh seafood selection. Definitely would recommend - even if the wait is 2+ hours.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
The service staff at this restaurant is either incompetent or mentally inept or both.  I was visiting over Memorial Day weekend and attempted to put my name in for two people on a Saturday. The place does not take reservations and only takes walk-ins. The hostess was plain and extremely bitchy, I am assuming she compensated for her less than desirable appearance by treating customers like they were beneath her. We came in around 4pm and tried to put our name on for later that night. She said they weren't taking any more reservations and we could try coming back later because spaces would open up. We came back around 9 and talked to customers who were being seated. They said they put their name in at 5pm (after we had been told they weren't taking anymore customers). A separate hostess said there were no seats left for the night. We came back the next day, around 3pm. The same plain hostess was there and said the exact same story as the night before. I told her about the previous night and how customers put their name in an hour after us and got seated. She had no explanation for this. She could not explain how we could eat there and basically said she wouldn't serve us.  

I had eaten there on a previous occasion and the food was good. With the quality of the food the place will have no problem even with the bad service from the hostess, but she is definitely having a negative impact on the place.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: Forgot to review this place when I was here last.  Their lobster roll is amaaaaaaaaazing!!! If you are by yourself or are with one other, sit by the oyster bar.  Awesome.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
This restaurant is small, but it packs in the crowds and the flavors.  When coming to Boston, I knew that this place was on my list.  We planned accordingly and came for an early dinner at about 5 pm.  The place was slammed but we were lucky enough to get a bar seat.  This place is small - maybe they can fit 40 people in at a time between the tables and the bar.  It is not a place for large parties and I would say 2 people is ideal to avoid an even longer wait. 

Neptune oyster certainly held up to the hype.  We tried three different kinds of Oysters and I the local oysters were amazing and packed with flavor.  We also split the clam chowder.  It was good, but not your traditional chowder - it is much thinner.  It is probably the only thing I would skip the next time, but that is in part to make more room for the delicious food. 

We had to have the lobster roll. You had a choice of hot or cold and we went with the cold.  The lobster roll comes out and the lobster is just falling off of the roll - it is that packed with lobster.  The roll was nicely toasted with a little bit of butter.  It was meaty enough to support the lobster, but still light so it didn't feel heavy or dominate the lobster.  The lobster came with fries that were freshly cut and nicely salted.  

Neptune also has a very nice wine list.  We had a pinot grigio that paired great with the seafood.  Our waiter was very helpful in picking the perfect bottle for our tastes.  They certainly know their wine and seafood.  The only complaint about the service is that it was sometimes slow.  I can only guess it is slow because they are always busy and can only pack so many people behind the bar.

And dessert? I have no idea because  I didn't get that far.  Instead, I choose to have another round of oysters for dessert.  This is very important for someone who loves sweets and chocolate.  So yummy!  Now that I finished writing this, I am hungry and want oysters.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
Lobster roll - hot buttered... delicious and pure.

Side arugula salad was good. 

The Johnng cake with smoked fish n caviar was a nice side.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
If you're looking for a meal unique to Boston that you might want to bring out of town guests to, Neptune's is a great option.  The selection of oysters is diverse, the lobster roll is a classic and overflowing with lobster, the Johnny cake is a nice sweet and savory option, the clam chowder is not dense and thick like other places. While not the cheapest place to dine, the pricing is reasonable for the quality of food served. 

The ambience is quite nice with the dimmed lights yet casual friendly atmosphere of the servers. It is quite small so you can feel a bit cramped inside, especially if you sit near the front door and there is a crowd of people standing nearby waiting to get seated. 

On our last visit, we got to sit at the bar right by the front window where we got to watch the designated oyster shucker work non-stop. We chose a variety of oyster (including my favorite kumamoto), the mussels which were perfect, and of course the lobster roll. 

The one thing I always struggle with this place is the wait.  The first time I went a few years ago was on a Saturday mid-afternoon where we waited about an hour and a half for a table for 2. This most recent visit was on a Tuesday evening and we ended waiting about two hours for a table for 2. (There's a great dive bar across the street where you can hang until you get a call letting you know your table is ready.) While the food is great, I think that a place like Island Creek Oyster is very comparable (lots of oyster selection, great lobster roll, nice ambience, much more spacious) and they take reservations, a big plus. 

Overall the place is great, and even though there's always a long wait, you won't feel disappointed when you leave.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
Came in on a cold weeknight and got a table for 3 right of the bat. I guess that the plus side of having all these snowstorms is not that much people going out. Anyways, the menu is simple and straight forward enough with good descriptions on each item. 

Food: Northend Cioppino - Spicy stew with saffron rice and seafood. The grilled salmon on top of stew was done perfectly. It had the right level of pinkness and firmness that always surprises me since it takes careful timing to pull it off. Well, the slices of salmon were thin so I guess that helped. Included in the contents were mussels, clams and shrimp still in their shells. The spicy soup (too watery to be called stew really) really hit the spot on a cold night. Overall, a good dish but could give more based on the price imho. 

Oysters: I forgot where each oyster came from since we ordered a variety off the menu. Definitely tastes fresh and liked the sauces that came with it. 

Service: Great waitress, came by often and check up on us plenty.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
My friend and I was in town and wanted to try out this place since it's well known. 

Ambiance: We sat at the bar since there weren't any tables available for two. It's a nice place to chill with your friends or family and just enjoy some oysters or just good seafood. It's quite hip. 

Food: The oysters that we order was good, but it wasn't phenomenally good compare to the oysters at Portland, Maine. I had high expectations and this place just didn't meet it. The lobster roll was okay as well.

text: After 5 business trip attempts to make it in here, I finally made it. This is by far the best freshest seafood I have ever had. The Divine oysters, delicious yellow fin crudo, and yummy Spanish octopus. Multiple attempts to get in here have been well worth it. I felt really lucky today of getting in

text:
Oysters are arguably the best in town but get there early or not at peak hours. Wait can be easily 2-3 hours on a fri-sun night and no online reservations can be made. Service is great but food can be slow at time (not often though!) Hot lobster roll is a signature and the clam chowder is good, though not the best in Boston. Personally didn't like the mussels as much here. The shrimp and grit special was very tasty the first few bites but became too salty before even getting g half way. North end cioppino was decent but not outstanding. Been here for several years and personally feel like it use to be better. Cash or card accepted

IG: moodforfoodeatery
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
Went here for lunch with my mother since she was craving a lobster roll--per the usual. We arrived around 1pm and were able to be seated right away.

To start my meal, I decided to go with the clam chowder. The clam chowder was good--but definitely not one of the best I've had. There were quite a bit of clams in it and they weren't too chewy, but I thought that it lacked flavor overall.

For my meal, I decided to go with the monkfish. The monkfish was slightly overcooked, but the meat was still flaky and went well, especially when paired with the lentils. The lentils may have been some of the best I've ever had--a great pairing with the beef tongue.

Overall, this place served up some quality dishes, but I can't say I was overly impressed, with exception to the lentils. The food took about 20 minutes to come out and the service was friendly enough. Despite this, the charm and small size of this restaurant will always have it on the short-list of must-eat seafood places in Boston.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
When I got to Neptune at 7:15pm, on a Monday night, the place was full, with the exception of a seat at the bar. Since I was solo, I looked around for the hostess, hoping to get that empty seat. After 15 minutes, with no clue as to who the hostess was, I asked the bartender if it would be ok to take the seat. 

"No, the hostess will seat you"

One of the people waiting told me that a woman who was bussing the tables was the hostess. 

After 10 more minutes of her studiously avoiding eye contact, I went to her, to let her know I was a single diner, and gestured towards the empty seat, and I asked if it was ok if I sat there. 

"No, I will put you on the list. should be about a half hour. I will call you. " I was then dispatched to the outside of the restaurant. Because it was only going to be a half hour, I waited outside the door on the sidewalk. 

The seat remained empty for 50 minutes. Would have been plenty of time for me to order and eat. 

By 8:45, I watched as multiple parties who had been signed to the list after me were seated. At 9, she finally said she would have a seat for me. 

Then she made me wait again, inside, 
as I watched three more groups being seated. Two of those groups were 2 tops who arrived at the restaurant and got on her list over hour after I did. 

There had been several groups of three, and she was ok with empty seats, but apparently leaving an empty seat with a single was a problem for her. Some of the twos seated before me were at the bar. 

I was finally seated at 9:30. 

Since I have worked in restaurants, I am a big over tipper. The bias against single female diners is unfortunate. I travel frequently for work, and am sadly, accustomed to the occasional shitty service as a single diner. This experience is the new benchmark for shitty service. Her behavior made me want to leave zero tip. 

Yes, the food is great. The guy who waited on me at the bar was nice, knowledgeable about the oysters. I was even ok with being served French fries instead of the salad I ordered, which arrived when I was pretty much done eating the lobster roll, because he was a good dude. 

The hostess went above and beyond to be an asshole though, and that was unnecessary. 

That the restaurant is successful it's in spite of the hostess. 

If Neptune had the last oysters on the planet, I would not go there solely because of her. 

I hope that one day, the tables are turned, that she's a solo female diner in a strange town and that the hostess treats her the way she treated me, and apparently numerous other diners.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
Tourist trap scam! 
First off they make you stand in line to leave your name for a reservation. Our wait to eat was 3 hours after our 30 minute reservation line. 
We decided to comeback. 
Can you not afford to hire a decent host/hostess with iPad to speed up something in an attempt to care? 
After our wait we were seated at the bar.

Price vs size vs quality vs service it doesn't add up.

text:
Small, cramped, and more than an hour wait on Sunday at 2pm..

It's still a 5-star just for their hot butter lobster roll and their freshly/expertly shucked oysters/shrimp cocktails

10/10 - hot butter lobster roll ($32). I was skeptical that it was more chopped up version but I was wrong. It's so juicy, flavorful, and buttery that my whole experience with the wait and cramped space was blown away. (It's that good.) 
I thought the Hot lobster roll from Yankee yesterday was great  and Neptune's knocked it off my list. Luke's doesn't even compare.

5/10 - Clam Chowder ($13). Generous portion of fresh clam meat and soft potatoes. Taste is good but, it's light and watery like a soup. I want a nice hearty thick chowder... (Yankee has them beat 2x)

10/10 - Oysters (check pic for individual prices). I had the server pick out a 1/2 and none of them disappointed! 

8/10 - Fried Ipswich Clams ($23). Generous portions, good batter, succulent long clams. I'd order this for a table for 3/4. The tartar that comes with it seems homemade relish type.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: One of the best meals of my life, honestly. Oyster sample is a must... with chilled, crisp Savingnon Blanc... Stuff dreams are made of!
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
I feel like Neptune Oyster is the Franklin BBQ of Austin,TX except they are seafood and in Boston, MA.  If you don't know Austin or Franklin let me explain.  Both places are one the top places to eat their respective genre of food according to many food bloggers and yelp.  At both places you will wait in line for about 3-4 hours.  Ok so now you get it a little better hopefully. 

I do think good things are worth waiting for and in the case of Neptune it definitely paid off!  We arrived a little after 7:00 pm.  Here is how it works - you stand outside in a short line to talk to the lady that sticks her head out the door every now and then.  She asks you how many are in your party and then takes your phone number.  They will call you when it is about 15-10 minutes before you are going to get seated.  I love this method personally because you are required to just stand in one spot for a long period of time!  During this process we got to know the people in front of and behind us in line.  My husband and I then made our way down the street strolling for a bit.  We stopped in the pub across the way to burn some time and have some drinks.

Finally slightly after 10pm we were called.  When we arrived it was interesting to see the people who lasted and the ones that did not.  We were all super excited to indulge in a dining experience we have been anticipating for some time. We were seated by our friends from line and some people that were at the end of their meal.  All the seating in the restaurant is super close and tight, so you can talk to the table next to you easily.

We ordered a round of rose wine for the two of us and then the big order.  If you come here you must try the Lobster roll - it is a must for sure!  We got it warm and it was so buttery and delicious. The lobster literally melted in my mouth!  We also go the North End Cioppino, which was a fish stew.  It was so creamy.  We also ordered the Neptune Plateau, which is was a nice sample of oysters, clams, mussels, shrimp, lobster and crab.  Everything was super fresh!  I loved the crab salad that came with it too.  We even ended up sharing some things with the table next to us - our line friends.  

So if you are going to come to Neptune and really do it up - then do it up! Order everything you would want.  Make the best of the line and enjoy every minute of the culinary experience that it is.  Yes - to me it was worth the money and the wait to dine here and I would absolutely do it again!
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: This place has absolutely amazing food! We ordered the Spanish octopus and clam chowder as an appetizer. The clam chowder is less thick and more of a flavorful, creamy, broth. text:
First time here and I wanted to stop by on National Oyster Day!

What better place to be than in New England on this festive holiday? (Actually, who makes these daily national holidays?? haha) 

I see all these people waiting, I ain't got time for that! I walk up to the hostess and say, I'm soooo hungry! Can I grab that seat by the bar? Not a problem I'm told. I skip the mind numbing line and grab a seat. High fives to the hostess with the mostest.

I'm given a piece of paper with all the Oyster choices. Choices?? I quickly order a beer on tap. (Singing to the song: One bourbon, one scotch, one beer) I want Oysters, I want Cocktail Sauce, I want beer....
Man, I checked off one of every Oyster on the list! They're all fresh, I have no Oyster preference. I tried a bunch of different Oysters, everything was great so no complaints from this guy. I started talking to the woman next to me, she too was a tourist and we compared some of the areas cool places to hit up.

Neptune Oyster, It was a pleasure to dine here. Very tight on space, so be prepared for a long wait.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: Place is very small. There is no where to wait. You put your name on a list and they will call you when a table is ready. Went for a late lunch at around 2:30 and the wait was 2 hours. A bit pricey for the quality of food. I wouldn't return.

text:
Arrivés à 14h, nous n'avons pas attendu plus de 5 minutes avant d'être installés. Le lieu n'est pas très grand, parfaite ambiance de bistrot/bar.

Nous avons commencé par deux huîtres provenant de l'île du prince édouard, très charnues. La sauce en accompagnement est bonne mais masque le goût de l'huître. 
La salade aux sardines, tomates et burrata sauce pesto était fraîche, les tomates un peu mûres à mon goût.
Le roulé à l'homard était bon et très abordable et vient avec des frites (32 $ prix du marché, donc est amené à varier). Il y a possibilité de demander de la salade à la place des frites.
La soupe de palourde est très bonne, avec des morceaux de pommes de terre.

Les serveuses sont très agréables et n'hésitent pas à vous renseigner sur des boissons non mentionnés dans le menu (bière!).

text:
Long lines for seating.

Luckily for me, I got seated right away because I was by myself.

Others with a party of 2 or more had to wait 1 hour and 30 mins+.

I asked the waitress for her recommendations and she got me started with 4 different oysters, which were delicious.

categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
I stopped by here a couple of Monday's ago with a coworker for dinner.  We were in Boston for the night whenever I consulted Yelp for a place to eat.  Neptune Oyster had the most reviews in the city along with a great score and so we headed on over.  Upon arriving I have to say that it wasn't what I expected as it was a little restaurant that was crammed to the gills with people.  There was a bar on one side and some seating on the other and that was it.  At most I bet it could hold around 40 people.  We asked the hostess if they had room for 2 and we were told there would be a 20 minute wait.  So we agreed to that and went elsewhere to wait since there was literally no place inside to wait.  Right around 20 minutes later we got a call and headed back and were seated at the bar.

For dinner on this evening I decided to go with a mix of things from the raw bar as well as regular menu.  So to start out with I went with 4 oysters in order to try the differences between them.  The ones that I chose were a Katama Bay (MA), Beach Point (MA), Savage Blonde (PEI) and Beausoleil (NB).  Some of them had exotic tasting notes with things like popcorn, brown butter of champagne finishes.  I would be fooling myself if I said I tasted anything similar to that.  Yes they tasted different but not in a way I can describe.  Since I am newish to tasting different oysters that shouldn't be surprising.  In any case, they all were briny and I thought they tasted quite good.  After those were finished my appetizer came out which was a bowl of clam chowder.  It was large and quite good as the broth was creamy and there were a number of clams inside of it.  Once that was finished my entree came out.  I had ordered the Acadian Redfish & Chips which the menu describes as fish and chips which came with malt vinegar aoili, pickles and MV sea salt.  Honestly, this was probably the best fish and chips that I have ever had.  I am sure that was helped along by having a good fish inside and that malt vinegar aoili to dip it in.  Heck that stuff was really good and I would love to have a jar of it to take home.

The bottom line for me is that I would head back here again in the future.  While Neptune Oyster isn't for the claustrophobic, their food was really good and I am glad we went.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: This was the second time I visited Boston and I had to return to this restaurant! Food was delicious, service was great and the setting was very intimate. Our wait time was about 45 minutes which was great. We ordered raw oysters, Uni toast, Johnny cake and lobster rolls. All was amazing but the Johnny cake and lobster roll were my fave! The lobster roll had a generous portion of lobster and just melted in your mouth. The server was very helpful with the wine selection. Overall great experience!!

text: 6 words. Delicious, Fresh & Worth the wait. We got two of each raw oysters, one of each raw clams, fried clams, lobster roll (hot), the yellowfin tartar and piggy back oysters. It was pricey but that's the price you pay for quality. 5,000th review!!!!
