text: This is the most amazing restaurant I've ever been to. The food is exceptional, the atmosphere is incredible! Servers are super friendly and helpful. My fiancé and I went two days in a row because we couldn't get enough. Two words. LOBSTER ROLL! Best one in Boston. If you come here, it's a must. The oysters are exceptional and from different parts of the east coast- we love sampling a bunch of different ones! Now I'm getting hungry....
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
When you have to get in line 40 minutes before the restaurant opens it's either two things.. a yuppie trend or really damn good food. Proud to say this was just really damn good food. The menu is simple with a sea minded theme. I had the clam chowder and it was absolutely one of the best chowders I've ever had! It was light, creamy and fresh. Tons of fresh clams you want to keep eating it all day. Actually while waiting in line we saw the guy dragging in two creates full of fresh seafood that probably came from the farmers Mary down the street. The place is small but it's prefect for a beautiful lunch.. 

Now let's talk about Lobster roll.. the roll is beautifully toasted and loaded with tons of buttery lobster a mix of claw and tail prefectly cooked. Every bite was a pillow of buttery goodness. Then the best part is once you get down to the bottom there's a pool of butter waiting for you.. again it was one of the best lobster rolls I've had in my life. 

I highly recommend Neptune Oyster to anyone and everyone who plans on traveling to Boston in near future. Hats off to the chef, you have a beautiful thing going on. Thank you for such an amazing experience. You truly understand and have a passion of seafood and that passion comes through in your food.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: The lobster roll fell apart immediately, for the amount of hype and waiting in line I was surprised how disappointing it was. I would maybe try one of the specials but doesnt it seem worth the amount of effort to go.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
This is one of the best places I've ever been for Oysters. They have such a large variety, and I really like the presentation. It makes it really easy to identify what you are eating.

Here are some of my favorites besides the Oysters:

The Clam Chowder was amazing- not as thick and creamy as I am use to, but still super tasty.

The Lobster Roll was delicious! It was packed with lobster meat (more than usual). I'm use to eating lobster rolls where I always wish there was more lobster meat and this one had a lot!

The Neptune Johnnycake is so yummy and something everyone needs to try! I loved it.

This place is always packed so be prepared to go at an odd time like 4pm on a Monday or you will be waiting for at least an hour. I live in the North End and it's pretty standard to see a line out the door even in the rain.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: This is a must visit if 1) you really love lobster and 2) you don't mind spending $30+ on a lobster roll. The lobster fiend that I am, I happily dropped the money, and it was so worth it! The roll was buttered and toasted perfectly. They serve you so much lobster. Even the fries are deliciously crisp. Uni toast wasn't anything special, so don't bother. Our party of 2 didn't have to wait long for seats at the bar mid-afternoon, but I imagine the wait can get pretty long sometimes. Will definitely re-visit the next time I'm in Boston and want to treat myself!
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: HUGE lobster roll.....itty bitty restaurant! We walked up to eat just before 11:30 to see a line formed outside the door. Is the food really that good? Um yeah...holy lobster roll Batman! That thing was insanely good! I also had clam chowder which was equally tasty and warmed me up on a cold spring day. I like that the base wasn't thick as glue! I will for sure be back here for the best lobster roll on the planet, but will be first in line next time!
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: One of the best place to go for oysters or seafood in general, the swordfish was de-li-cious!!! Would recommend go early and reserve a seat because they are always packing!
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: Neptune is crazy busy all the time. But you have to make time to go! What we did was put our name in around 11:00 AM and then they give you a call about 15 minutes before the table was ready so you can make your way back - and we got called back around 6:45 PM. We got lobster rolls, lobster tacos, and oysters. I loved it all! It's 100% worth the wait and the small restaurant.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
What can I say that you don't already know about Neptune Oyster? This place is great and is worth a visit for all travelers. 

The store opens at 1130am and we got online around 11am. There were already 20 ppl in front of us. We got seated in the first rush, but if we came 5-10 minutes later, we wouldn't have gotten a seat with the first rush. 

The restaurant gets a bit chilly because people keep coming in and opening door to put their names down for the waiting list. So wear a sweater and maybe plan on keeping your jacket on. 

The oysters are amazing. Great appetizer for your meal. The clam chowder was delicious and super fresh. Although I am more use to a creamier chowder, their more water version is quite good as well. I've never had clams so fresh in my clam chowder before. 

Everybody always recommend the hot lobster roll with the butter. Thats the one we got and I kind of wish I got to try to mayo one instead. No knock against the hot one, but I think I just don't like things with too much butter. Tip: Swap out the fries for the salad or else you'll be quite full for the rest of the day.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
You need to get here early or you will not have a spot. The oysters in this restaurant were incredible. My girlfriend and I went 40 minutes before it opened and there was already a line. Luckily for us, we were the second to last people to get seated before having to sign up and come back an hour later. 

There were a variety of oysters to choose from and also a sit down menu. This place is definitely a place you need to go to when in Boston. 

We got about 7 oysters each, and gobbled it up easily. My favorite was the Neptune Oyster. I highly recommend that one!
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: Had dinner Monday evening, sat outside. The waitress was stellar, great recommendations! We had a dozen oysters and a lobster roll - to die for.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: Waited at the door for 10 minutes but plenty of empty tables available. Waitress passed by several times and just ignore us. We have 3 people so needed to share a table with others. 20% gratuity were added on the bill automatically and we were told it's the standard tip in Boston???
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
I came on a weekend morning with my mom. We made sure to come half an hour early to get in front of everyone else in line. After 10 minutes, the line was already extending down the street!

We both ordered the Maine lobster roll (warm with butter) and a side of fries. This is hands down the best lobster roll I've ever eaten! There was so much meat inside the bun, and it was super buttery and flavorful! The lobster was really tender and juicy. 

The waitress was really nice and attentive, especially given that she had so many customers to attend to. There was literally no space in the restraint - we were all packed in like sardines.

Overall, we had a great experience! I'm not sure if I'll come back, especially since it's insanely crowded all the time and their food is quite expensive. But, I'm really glad I got to experience their famous lobster roll!
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
I was super excited to try this place since it was recommended to us by someone; he warned us about the price but well worth the hype. 

We came around 12pm and there was a 1-2.5 hour wait, sure - we already expected this, she put the name down, time arrived, phone number and the 2.5 hour wait. They literally do not seat you until the 2.5 hours has gone by. 

Finally getting seated hours later, we ordered some oysters - Katama bay and Thatch Island, these set the bar pretty high because the oysters were so fresh and cleaned well and tasted awesome. 

Yellowfin crostini appetizer - $18-19. This is a must order, it's worth it. Although this is only an appetizer, I enjoyed eating this more than the lobster roll! 

Lobster roll w/butter - $28, 6/10. They do fill the lobster roll with a lot of big chins of lobster but it was pretty tasteless and was not even warm. The fries that came along with the roll was even hotter than the bun itself. 

Highly disappointed - I had to go to the place next door for another lobster roll and I only waited less than 10 minutes, the roll came out hot, and on top of that - it was cheaper and it tasted a lot better.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: Thank you for the great food, amazing selection of fresh oysters and wonderful service
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
HO.LY. SHIT.

Get the hot lobster roll. It's unlike anything I've had before. The perfectly soft roll. the flavor depth from the lobster being warm vs cold, the BUTTER......YUMMMMMMM. You will not get a lobster roll like this anywhere else. 

It also had the option of a delicious side salad.

Be prepared to wait...but once you get in it's worth every minute of waiting!! Food service is fast so they keep things moving! Our waitress behind the bar was also a delight! 

There's a nice casual bar across the street as you wait for a table, too :)
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: We waited for over 2 hours for a table, which after talking to others, was not uncommon.  The service was great, and the staff was very friendly.  Our party of 3 was seated in a six top with three other people, but we didn't mind.  We ordered an assortment of raw oysters, and we appreciated that they gave us the card which named and described each oyster that we ordered.  The clam chowder was excellent.  Of course, I had to order the lobster roll, which the waitress recommended to get hot with butter.  It's a pretty substantial serving, and can probably be shared by two people.  My daughter ordered the mackerel, and for someone who claims she doesn't like seafood, she sure did enjoy it! My husband says it's one of the best fish dishes he's tried in a while! My husband ordered the Spanish Octopus, and he said it was one of the best octopus dishes he's ever had.  So, after our dinner, we all decided that it was worth the 2 hour wait!
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
Haymarketで大人気店のひとつで、夕方五時過ぎには満卓で、順番待ちが必要。待った時間は約一時間。電話番号を伝え、どこかで１杯やりながら待てます。

オイスターとロブスターサンドが美味しいですね。
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
Decent but not worth the long wait!

Was recommended by a friend to try their lobster roll. Got there around 530PM and been told that it was 1.5hrs wait. We came back at 7 and still had to wait. Finally got seated at the bar at 8pm. 

My friend and I ordered the triton platter and thought would order the lobster roll after if we were still hungry cos we ate a bit before going there.

The seafood from the triton platter was fresh, had a mixed of oysters, claims, mussel, shrimp, lobster and blue crab salad. Must say that the crab was AMAZING!

We were full after the seafood platter so didn't order the lobster roll. Came back the next day for lobster roll...nothing special. ..I totally feel like I make better lobster roll. Also ordered the uni toast and it was way too salty and too much butter.

On the pricey side, long wait (they don't take reservations), small restaurant...I feel like it's a bit overated and I think I can get better elsewhere so a more affordable price.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
Last year I flew quite often to Boston just to stop at Neptune for lunch and have a delicious lobster roll ($25)! I order it hot with butter! :) Every bite I took was filled with buttery goodness. Is your mouth salivating yet? Can you smell the salty butter on the warm toasted bread? I can! :P

They do make the best lobster rolls, even my NYC and Philly friends would agree! I've always wanted to try other things on their menu, but I'm usually too full after consuming the roll. The clam chowder, oysters, cioppino, etc. all look very good! I love coming here again and again. I've never had to wait in line because I think I come at the odd hours (2pm/3pm). It's a small restaurant and I can see how it can get packed since it's so popular!

Maybe when it gets warmer, I'll fly to Boston for another lobster roll at Neptune! :)
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: I think this is over rated, compare the price and the food, the one in long beach called john's raw bar (as I remember) which I reviewed is a lot better than this one, and need to wait for an hour for a table. I don't see any freshness or special here!
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
Best lobster roll I had during this holiday. Not a local, visited friends in Boston.. we were supposed to go to Pauli's next door for lobster rolls and then we saw this cute little place next door and I wanted oysters too.

Ambiance: busy.. smalll small place. Not good for kids. You'll end up sharing a table but that's just how this place is. Tiny, cozy and cute. Be aware that you might have to end up waiting outside for a table. 

Ordered a few oysters, personal favorites was the Neptune pearl, island creek Duxbury and for west coast: the Kumamoto.. I highly Recommend the kumatomo! Big and creamy.. delicious! 

We had a total of 3 lobster rolls during this trip and by far this was the best one!!! I ordered it cold with mayo (Boyfriend ordered hot with butter) it was soooooo full of lobster, very meaty and worth the 32$ (market price) the hot was good too (I personally like hot lobster rolls) but it does fall apart cuz of the hot butter. The cold is easier to hold as a sandwich

Other dishes: 
Clam chowder is fresh and made to order 
Fried clams were yummy too! Tbh everything was absolutely great! 

Highly recommend!!!!!!
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: Favorite all time place in Boston. Best lobster roll I've ever had. The oysters are incredible.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: My favorite restaurant in Boston.  When I travel to Boston, I eat here as many times as possible.  The service is great.  The team is professional and knowledgeable but still friendly.  The food is spectacular and at a level that is that is not matched at many places in the country.  My favorites: fried clams , raw oysters and lobster roll.  Also, the wine list has a good range of options both in terms of type of wine and prices.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
This was our third time visiting Neptune Oyster and we finally got a table! We came in early at about 10:30 before they open but the waiting line was already long and we waited for another 1 hour to be seated but it's totally worth to wait. 
We were here with 8 people in our group and we ordered most of food on their menu. Their seafood was so fresh and they cooked without any additional spice. Their food is so delicious in a simple way. 
Our favorite were their Johnnycake with soft, wet and melting texture dipping in creamy sauce and raw clam, we thought it was better than oysters, without sticky raw smelling but only sweet taste. 
We paid about $75 each person and we didn't finish all what we ordered and boxed some lobster home for dinner so we though their price was reasonable.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
My only gripe about this place is that it is both too small and too popular-especially on Saturday! The service is great, but you can tell that those folks are worked hard due to the long lines, too.

We started with 16 oysters (Pleas Bay, Mookies, Irish Point and Kumomoto). Since I heard rave reviews, I got both the hot and the cold lobster rolls. (We shared.) My spouse tried the Clam Bake entrée special. All of the food was excellent.

Recommended, just go there early and expect to place your name on the waitlist and then go shopping for a few hours.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: Yesterday I went on Bobbys Bike Hike Tour, that focused on lakefront and the neighborhoods.  Chris was our guide and he was amazing, funny, informative and it is a healthy way to see the city.  Go and have a great time.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: Best seafood in town, and not just the lobster roll... they have great muscles, fish and a really nice tuna ceviche on a bed of sprouts and guacamole... it may take a little to get in bits it's always great front he food to the people serving you.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: This is the largest and most savory lobster roll I have ever had. The salad on the side was also delicious. I've eaten lobster rolls all of the United States, and this place definitely takes the cake for the best!
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: Do not get whatever is the special of the day! I got Tuesday's special -- the sea urchin ditalini-- and it had NO sea urchin. It consisted of pasta, cheese, and BACON. I overheard the bartender talk to the waitress about how there was no sea urchin left( I was sitting at the bar). He responded that "SOMETIMES YOU NEED TO GET CREATIVE." Perhaps that's how the bacon in my "sea urchin" dish appeared. As I was leaving, he crossed the sea urchin ditalini off the daily specials board. I was hoodwinked. If you get anything, stick with the lobster roll. If you're reading this neptunes oyster, please contact me at nirvana200082@gmail.com on how you can refund me $24.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
Showed up for lunch at 1:15pm...  and had a 45 min wait :(

We actually went to another restaurant to get something to tide us over...  

Because there's no place to wait so we had to leave our number and they called us when seats at the bar opened up.  And the server was just short of rude.

Ordinarily we'd have just eaten at the other restaurant but we really wanted seafood soooooo...

We eventually got to eat here...

We got some oysters and shrimp to start with.  The shrimp were good but not exceptional, a little chewy... which for the price I'd expect them to be sweeter and not so tough.  The oysters were super fresh and the mookies in particular were amazing.

The cocktail and mignonette were both freshly made.

We then ordered fried clams and the plate was HUGE and piled high with freshly fried clams.  They were salty, crispy, and delicious.

We also tried the chowder, but it was too thin- it was almost watery.  The flavor was there but it was unappetizing because it was kind of like clam flavored milk.

My friend also got the lobster roll which was wicked expensive and did have a good bit of lobster in it, but was nothing exceptional.  In fact the bread was a little soggy- the butter missed the lobster a little...

Sitting shoulder to shoulder at the bar, waiting 45 mins at lunch, the entire experience was ok but the food was a bit hit or miss.  I definitely wouldn't wait again to go here, unless I seriously find I cannot love without those clams... but there are other places in the city that can fry a clam...
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: love it good restaurant best in town
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
The first restaurant I had to try when coming to Boston was Neptune Oyster, especially after hearing countless rave reviews about their oysters. My friend and I came at around 12:30pm, and the expected wait time was around 1.5-2 hours on a weekday! I have heard from others that it is best to wait in line before the restaurant opens in the morning to ensure a spot. 

Even though the estimated wait time was very long, we ended up getting a call from the hostess around 45 minutes after putting our name down. Also, the time goes by very quickly, since there's the Boston public market around the corner and a lot of bakeries, in case you want to try Boston's cannoli to hold you over in line. The restaurant is also very small, with only a few tables and only some bar seating. That day, we were seated at the bar, which we were more than happy to take, given the long wait at the restaurant. 

Between the two of us, we shared a warmed lobster roll with butter and a half a dozen of oysters. The lobster roll was around $30, but it's plenty for two people. It comes with either fries or a salad, but I would definitely recommend the fries if you're not ordering anything else that's too heavy. The fries were thick cut, crispy, and seasoned with just the right amount of salt. The lobster rolls come in either the cold-mayo form or the hot butter form. We opted for the hot butter recipe and it was delicious! It was piled high with thick pieces of tender lobster, and not over dressed with butter. The oysters were also as good as hyped to be--super fresh, sweet and buttery!

If you are looking for the ultimate, Boston-seafood experience, Neptune's Oyster is a bucket list item that needs to be checked off. The wait can be a little long, but it is more than worth it.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
This is one of the most hyped seafood/lobster restaurants in Boston. It's so popular that I've tried at least 3 times to get a seat already, but the lines were just too ridiculously long. We only had to wait an hour for my 4th try (maybe because of coronavirus fears or something). It is a pretty small restaurant with limited seating for how popular it is.

The oysters are about $3 each, which is quite expensive. The selection of oysters probably changes daily, but we selected the Neptune Oyster and two others from East Coast locations. They were silky smooth and glided comfortably down my esophagus. They are super well-marinated and fresh.

We got both cold and hot Maine Lobster rolls with the arugula salad and the fries. The arugula salad was too sour and the fries were too salty, but I guess I'll let it slide because it's all about the seafood here... the lobster rolls were fantastic and decently filling. Cold and hot are both good choices. The only thing is... the lobster rolls were $33 each. The average lobster roll in Boston is about $20, and I don't feel that these were $13 better than the other ones. (Pauli's next door has comparably delicious lobster rolls for $20).

Very good seafood, but be prepared for extremely long waits and high prices.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: They charged us for 6 oysters that we never received. We tried to explain to them that the people sitting next to us had oysters but we never received ours. The server was also the manager and she proceeded to tell us that we were lying. ‍ We usually give a very good tip (the bill was over $250) but for 6 oysters they were willing to compromise their tip. It was such odd behavior. We were truly disappointed by their actions.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: Neptune's oyster is the crem de la crem of lobster rolls. Yes, the line is horrific. Yes, you have to go 2 hours prior to eating and put your name on the list. YES, they call you when your table is ready. YES, it's worth it. I went in on a Saturday around 4:30pm to put my name on the list hoping for a 7:00 seat time & I was told they'd call me 15 mins before. They delivered, and I ran to the North End the minute I got the call. The only point of confusion is not knowing who to tell when you arrive after the phone call. There really is no hostess, so just let someone know you're their for your reservation. We ordered 2 delicious hot buttered lobster rolls and shared clam chowder. Both were ridiculously delicious. Best lobster roll this Floridian has ever had. I can't wait for the day I get to have another one. I will absolutely be back.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
I came on a weekday so there was no wait! Ordered a glass of Chardonnay and a dozen oysters wellfleets, katama bay, kumamamoto, and kusshi. My favorites are kumamamotos and my new fav is the kusshi! So sweet and all the oysters super fresh that I had to get 6 more. 

I was disappointed about the clam chowder though. It's not your average chowder..I wouldn't even call it a chowder. It was more of like a watery soup...
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
The hype is real!!! We went to Boston for our anniversary and had to stop in for a lobster roll (by stop in, I mean wait 1.5 hours) lol - but it was worth it!!! Service was decent - you could tell the workers were running around. Bit of a confusing check in process, as it's tiny inside and there wasn't a host stand. We sort of stood around and waited for someone to come by. Word of advice, don't go starving because you will wait. No biggie, you're in little Italy and there's lots to walk around and see while you wait.

We had a clam chowder and a lobster roll. The chowder was good - but the star of the show was the lobster roll. Buttery, lobster cooked perfectly and the roll was lightly toasted. We opted for salad instead of fries and the salad was also delish!! Loved the dressing and the little nuts that were in the salad. Great palate cleanser since the lobster is so rich. 100% check this place out!
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
A veritable Boston institution, I knew that I had to at least try to get in when I visited. My boyfriend and I were originally planning to line up at ~11:15 for an 11:30 opening, but seeing a small line having already formed at 10:45, we decided to get in line at that time. Lucky we did, as the line quickly grew to stretch down the block and round the corner.

We were probably the 10th in line (thanks to a large group of people that cut in front) and in the first wave to be seated. The restaurant is pretty tiny - probably seating 20-30 people - so it's definitely a good idea to get here early and just wait.

From the raw bar, we ordered several oysters, clams, and fresh uni. The seafood was the freshest I'd ever tasted. The Maine uni that I had was so good that it tasted like it wasn't from Maine - unfortunately, my boyfriend's was a bit unpleasant due to a strong ammonia flavor, but they quickly replaced it with another one.

We also ordered the lobster roll (of course), johnny cake, and scallop crudo to share. Everything was fantastic, but the scallop was incredible - probably the best thing I ate all weekend, and maybe the best scallop I've ever had. It was prepared simply, chopped and served in-shell with sea salt and a pesto sauce. Second favorite was the johnny cake, which was a perfect combo of sweet and savory. 

The meal was expensive, but definitely worth it given the quality of ingredients and care that goes into the preparation.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
Honestly, the poor service ruined the entire experience. I didn't enjoy my hot lobster roll. 

I got there 30 minutes before opening. 
Was second to be seated at the bar. 
Didn't need a menu and had my order taken. One hot lobster roll with fries. Water only. 
Waited 30 minutes after everyone else in the room was served. 
Asked for the check and told the waitress we were in a hurry. 

Got my lobster roll 5 minutes later. 
When the waitress bartender noticed I wasn't signing the check yet, she started acting friendly. I tipped her well. 

Possible explanations:
1. My husband didn't order anything
2. I'm Asian and she is racist
3. Waitress forgot to put in my order...but she was standing in front of us for 30 minutes and didn't ask why I didn't get my food?

Everyone else in the room was friendly but I won't come back here again. Wasted $40 here because the roll wasn't that great.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: Absolutely the best, ate here three days in a row. Had lobster rolls both ways and a ton of oysters
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
Best oysters. Great knowledgeable service from guy behind named Tuna

Loved the wine too
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
It took me two years of trips to Boston to finally make it inside, on a freezing cold day.

A phone call to the place tells you they do NOT take reservations, so coming here you must either be prepared to wait or give up altogether. 
We lucked out, walked in & got a place at the bar. I noticed, however that just minutes after our party of 3  were seated, a group of 6 diners came in and THEY had a table reserved! So what gives, Neptune?

But I digress from the most important part/s: the food! the oysters! The service!

Service: Glad I got one of the gentlemen (Mako) behind the counter. His female counterpart seemed just too exasperated to repeat the menu offering (NOT described on the printed menu other than Triton Plateau or Neptune Plateau). Yes, I was happy to leave him a substantial tip too!

Favorites:
Lobster cocktail : your are served the meat of an entire lobster, at the very least, dressed lightly with olive oi, spare seasoning and pinch of some parsley - absolutely satisfying, tender and briny, fresh. No Mayonnaise or cocktail sauce at all - PERFECT!
Crudo of tilefish : served in a ring, chopped pieces of white fleshed fish, reminiscent of Hawaiian Poke but without any added seaweed or chilies - fresh, clean, buttery, RAW!
Lobster roll, in butter, served on very yummy bread and french fries on the side. 

Oysters! Oysters! Oysters!
there were so many varieties offered, mostly from Massachusetts, Rhode Island, some from Washington state and even Vancouver BC. 
Had a sample from a dozen different varieties: best for me  Island Creek and Basket Island.
Had them raw, sprinkled with a little bit of lemon and horseradish (served on the side). Also available is a vinegar/diced shallot dip (Mignonette) . 

Splurge: got a bottle of Prosecco to go with it!

Shout out to the lady behind the counter who actually shucks ALL the oyster orders: She did such an excellent job, not a single bad oyster, or piece of shell in any that I ate. 

Hope I get as lucky next time I'm in Bostonia!
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
I'm not sure what my review will say that 3600 others haven't already. This place really is the best and it really is worth the wait. 

My husband and I were in town for a conference and had Neptune Oyster recommended by a number of locals. I read all the reviews about the wait, but decided that since we hadn't visited this part of Boston yet, it was the perfect opportunity to do so.

We went on a Monday night around 5 pm and were quoted a two hour wait. They took our phone number and we went on our merry way to try cannolis and walk parts of the Freedom Trail. Lo and behold, we received a call after only 45 minutes that we had a table.

We started with a delicious basket of fried clams. I had the scallops for my entree which were AMAZING. Perfectly seared on one side, buttery and melted in your mouth. 

Looking around, there were a couple of people who ordered the lobster roll and seemed disappointed. Not to say that it wasn't a good lobster roll - but unless it's your favorite thing in the world, I feel you would be better served by ordering something else here.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: Decided to check this place out because of the great reviews. Oysters were good but other than that, everything was decent and not that great. The clam chowder was extremely watery and soup like not like a chowder. Lobster tacos were good but the tortillas itself were dry and crumbly. Would probably just recommend the oysters if you go!
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
Amazing place! 
Very small but service was really good. Very friendly staff! 
The food was amazing! Such good quality and fresh seafood!!! 
We tried a lot of things on the menu and everything was delicious!! 
The triton plateau is definitely worth it! 
Will go back next time We are in town!
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants

text: Big Ups to my fellow Yelpers with all the reviews to Neptune. Hubbie an I wanted the scoop on best hot Lobsta Roll in Boston and this place was beyond expectations. Appreciated the pre salt & pepper on the fries. Local Oysters were out of this world as well. This place doesn't do reservations so get there a bit early. It's also a cozy joint so if you have a large party I suggest being there all on time and prepare for a bit of a wait. Believe me though The wait is worth the mouthwatering journey that awaits you.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: OMG this place is AWESOME!!! I can't get enough of this place. All the seafood is fresh. Everything here is just flat out the best. You can't get anything better!!! It's sooooo good. I'm raving about this place to everyone. The lobster roll is the bomb. The oysters and all other seafood just beyond words. Just try this place trust me it won't disappoint!!!
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: It's like the song - SIMPLY THE BEST AND BETTER THAN ALL THE REST!!! You will not be disappointed in anything you try. Put your name in and then go and explore Boston. No reservations but again, read what's in the capital letters.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: Wife and I finally made it back here after several years going for the first time, even being local Bostonians with the long lines/wait times we found it hard to make it back sooner until we finally did and was looking forward to the amazing Oysters and SERVICE I remembered having at this restaurant.  Unfortunately this time the customer service especially from the male bartender that was working that day was the worst.  The guy made a disgusted face and made it known to me the customer that he was dissatisfied with my decision not to have another beer when I asked to have a taste of some of the local draft beers on tap.  Just because you are well know restaurant with heaps of tourists lining up to get in, shouldn't give your bartenders any right to treat your paying customers the way this bartender did that day.  Lost a local customer for life and I'll be sure to steer any tourists that rave about this place away, not worth the wait to receive absolutely disrespectful service.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: This cake is the best combination of savory and sweet flavor. The marriage of the honey pancake and soft smoked-fish is marvelous. Bonus point if you can put some lobster meat on it
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
BEST WARM LOBSTER ROLL IN BOSTON.

Dear all friends who are visiting Boston, there may be a long wait, but please try Neptune's warm lobster roll. Good news! They take down your name and number and will call you when your table is ready.

Lobster roll here is impressive. The buttered roll is literally STUFFED with lobster meat. The toasted bun is so good. I like that the bun does not get soggy and stick to your lobster meat. 
Also tried their mussels and cioppino. Mussels are amazing and is a great starter. Cioppino unfortunately was not the greatest, but not bad! I've just had better ones elsewhere. 

Tight seating, so parties of 6 or greater may have to wait longer.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
The two times that I've come here this place has lived up to its name and reputation. The lobster rolls are super fresh and have none of that "fishy aftertaste" that you might get from cheaper places. They do NOT skimp out on the amount of lobster that they give. The clam chowder is also a classic, and is a great appetizer.
Now, their lobster spaghettini is other-worldly amazing. It is a MUST. When I brought my friends to try this place, they described the lobster spaghettini as "one of the foods you'll remember for the rest of your life". It is pricey, but the proportions and the high quality taste alone make up for it. You'll want to visit Boston just for the lobster spaghettini alone.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: A 2.5 hour wait that was TOTALLY worth it.  Don't come to Neptune hungry and expecting to be seated right away, because apparently that just doesn't happen (at least not on a weekend).  We came through expecting to wait a bit, but when we were quoted a possible 2.5 hour wait, we opted to go grab a snack in the meantime.  You can leave your name with the girl at the door, and she'll call you when your table is ready.  We were called back right around 6 pm, and chose a seat at the bar instead of a table.  I think our bar seats were a good idea.  The restaurant is very small, and the tables are very close together.  I had a glass of the Riesling which was a great choice to pair with my Oysters.  We tasted 6 different oysters, all of which were delicious.  They all taste like they've come straight from the ocean onto your plate.  The real bell of the ball, however, was the lobster roll.  Hot with butter.  The Good Lord Himself must've been in the kitchen cooking up that lobster roll, because there is no other explanation.  My suggestion - come during the week if you can, I hear the wait is shorter.... and have the lobster roll.... hot with butter..... even the bread was out of this world!
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
Neptune Oyster is def. one of my fave restaurants in Boston. I came here on a rainy night with my sissy & two friends. Despite the weather, people were still willing to wait outside for ~30-60 minutes.

The restaurant itself is really small. There are about 8 tables, cramped together, and a bar area. I am seriously not a fan of seafood but my opinions may have changed because of the awesomeness of the food here. The lobster roll (warm), oysters, and fried clams were exceptional. Nothing gave me the impression that I was eating something straight out of seawater (a main reason i dont enjoy the taste of most seafood lol). My only complaint would be the salad we had. There were chunks of what I think is cured meat, and it was way too salty. 

If you're in town, Neptune Oyster is a must try indeed.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
If this were colonial Boston, pilgrims would very likely accuse Neptune Oyster of witchcraft for bewitching the masses with their wickedly good food. Maybe they would claim link to pagan superpowers with Neptune himself? Okay that's taking the metaphor too far, but in any case, Neptune Oyster lives up to the hype. 

We each started off with a clam chowder, and it's not what I expected--it was better. I'm used to creamy, chunky clam chowder that's heavy on potatoes, and Neptune's version was lighter and with a consistency halfway to that of a soup. It's a surprise after mentally preparing yourself for something indulgent, but you can actually appreciate the subtle flavors of the clams instead of a Campbell's cream of potato. They were also very generous on the portion of fresh whole clams. 

Similarly, the hot butter lobster roll was no less than epic, even though it was again different from the mayo-based lobster salad rolls I had pictured. Neptune's embraces lobsta rolls in its purest form: an overwhelming serving of pure lobster, minimally dressed with a thin layer of butter, sandwiched in a fluffy brioche bun with just enough carbiness to complement the lobster which stole the show. The fries completed the feast.

Tip: The food was delicious and the portions were big. I split with a friend where we each got a clam chowder and shared the lobster roll, and it was the perfect amount of food (with just enough space for a cannoli afterwards). The other seafood looked amazing as well, and I don't think you could go wrong with anything.

Tip #2: The space is fall and this place is infamously popular, so I suggest getting here early (i.e. by 5pm on weekdays, and even then expect a wait). They do have a nice system where you can leave your cell phone number and they will alert you when the table is almost ready, so you can wander around the quaint neighborhood and soak in the rustic Italian ambiance while waiting.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
What a popular place! Be prepared to wait several hours. I was a party of 1 and still had to wait 2 hours for a seat at the bar. People were being turned away by 8pm and told to come back after 10pm to try their luck for a table. 
The food is delicious. I had a hot lobster roll with a garden salad. So much lobster! And my salad had this wonderful citrus vinaigrette. I wanted crab claws from the raw bar but they'd run out by the time I was seated. I had half-dozen oysters, lobster roll and white wine. Everything was delicious!
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
Hands down the best Lobster Roll I've had yet! Pricey? Yes it is. Worth it? Absolutely!

So I actually found out about this place through a recommendation of one of my boyfriend's friends. Seeing how this place has been recommended highly on Yelp and articles/blogs, I couldn't leave Boston without checking this place out. 

Now I was prepare for the wait. I've read everywhere that you should expect to wait a couple of hrs to be seated since the place isn't that big, and there's tons of people that line up to eat here. We came mid-December and I expected the weather to be much colder, so I actually brought some body heat packs with me to keep me warm while waiting out in the cold. My boyfriend and I arrived at Neptune Oyster around 6PM, to our surprise, there was no line! We got seated once we came in! Keep in mind that we got seated at the bar area (they told us if we wanted a table seat, we would have to wait approx. 10 minutes which is not bad, but we didn't mind the bar seating and took that option instead.) It was also pouring down rain that day so I'm assuming the weather played a role for why the place wasn't packed.

Okay so onto the food, we ordered the Lobster Roll. Market price at the time was $31. Definitely the most I've ever paid for a lobster roll, but you're getting a good amount of fries with that as well (even though it doesn't seem like it in the photo, it's a lot!) Normally for that amount of fries in NYC, it would cost possibly $6-7 as a side add-on. So I'd like to think I paid $24-25 for the lobster roll, which I feel is pretty avg for lobster roll in Boston. Whatever excuse I can think of to justify spending $31 on a lobster roll LOL. This lobster roll was amazinggggggg. An overflowing amount of lobster meat on the hot roll, so juicy and delicious..

We also ordered oysters: Wellfleet, Island Creek, Mookie Blue & Kumamoto (2 of each). My boyfriend and I could definitely agree that we preferred the Wellfleet out of them all. Super plump and juicy (plus the biggest one out of the ones we ordered)! It was actually my first time having oysters, so I wasn't sure what to expect! But Neptune Oyster has definitely set the bar high for me. 

Since we were still somewhat full from lunch earlier, this was all we ordered. I do regret not trying their famous Neptune Johnny Cake & Clam Chowder. Will definitely order those next time! If I'm ever back in Boston, Neptune Oyster..I'm coming back for you!
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
It's been a while since I enjoyed a restaurant this much. It's the most famous restaurant in Boston and definitely touristy, but in a good way because they actually serve good food. 

Due to crazy long waits, we got there at 10:30AM but there no one in line so we stopped right next door at Pauli's for lobster roll. We also walked to Mike's for some cannoli before getting in line around 11:00AM. There were 3 parties ahead of us which wasn't too bad. Like most restaurants in Boston, seats are limited but since we got there early we got seated and the wait was 30mins. People who came later had to wait 45mins to an hr. 

Everything we got was so good but my favorite was definitely the scallop crudo. It was so fresh and soft. The chili sauce was perfect. We also got a dozen of oysters-6 different kinds. The Neptune was my favorite and you can't get that anywhere else since it's special for this restaurant only. The Maine sea urchin was also so creamy and a must. I love love the octopus. It's hard for most places to make this dish right but Neptune just know how. Their famous Johnny's pancake was a good compliment to all the raw seafood we consumed. 

I really enjoyed this place and want to go back for more already.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
I must have missed something, because it was good, but not great (especially for the price). The hostess was super sweet and did a great job of handling the door. I arrived right before 8p on a Tuesday evening and she started turning people away by 8:30p. As a solo diner, I was seated at the bar. The bartender didn't provide the best service. As a former server, I'm very sensitive to these things and I don't even remember him doing the two minute check and asking, "how is everything?" but he did ask the solo, white male diner (I'm a black woman) sitting next to me who was seated at the exact same time I was and the two of us conversed for the entire meal. I came for the lobster roll and that's what I got, plus a variety of half a dozen raw oysters. Honestly, I've had better oysters in Houston for cheaper. The bartender suggested the hot LR with butter instead of cold with mayo (like I'm used to), but I wouldn't do that again. 

Great atmosphere, but I'm big on service and am willing to pay for it and a great experience. I wouldn't return.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
As everyone will tell you, be prepared to wait a long time to get a seat. However, they are pretty accurate with the estimated wait times, and you can always go grab a beer or other pre-dinner drink before coming back after you've put your name on the waiting list.

The wait is worth it though as the seafood here is great. Lots of oysters to choose from, and their entrees are all well done. If you're in the mood for a nice seafood meal, I don't think you can do better in the North End.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: Why didn't anyone ever tell me about Lobster rolls before this?!
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: Got really lucky and got there when there was an empty table outside. No one was waiting yet. Had the best Lobster Roll of my life. Oysters were also delicious!! Had the 1st three types of oysters on the menu and they were all great. Thinking about coming back with my sister. We're from out of town and this was the main thing I looked forward to and it did not disappoint.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
I thought I was leaving Boston Tuesday night. JetBlue cackled and cancelled my flight. Politely. So there I was, trudging back to the T with my duffel, another evening free to dabble in the dark arts of stuffing my face. Where to go on my (second) last night in the city?

Duh. 

Everyone had told me I needed to try a lobster roll, and everyone had told me where to find the best one in Boston. So I grabbed a stool at the bar of Neptune and ordered one (cold, with mayo). In the meantime, at Damien S (my hostest with the mostest)'s behest, I tried a Kumamoto oyster, and it was a zesty summer tonic. So was the sauvignon the bartender suggested.

When my roll arrived, it was bulging with lobster meat and flanked by a frisson of fries. Seriously, I couldn't decide which part of my plate to turn my attention to. I had been warned that lobster rolls could be bread-heavy, but this one was overflowing with tasty morsels. So I inelegantly dove in. So. freaking. good. (and for $25, it better be).

After that it was hard to stay disappointed my flight had been moved back. Ohhh wellllll.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: Sure sure, the lobster roll is great, but nobody gives the Neptune Burger its credit. It's succulent, made my nipples hard, and hit the g-spot... I'm a dude.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
Definitely a must-visit restaurant! Of all the seafood my friend and I had in Boston, this place really took the cake. The wait is no joke since the place is tiny but SO worth it. We just put our name down and did a little sightseeing - no big deal.

The oysters... were fantastic. Not sure who their suppliers are but wherever they're getting their oysters from deserves an award! We got one of the sampler dishes with different oysters, clams, and some lobster/crab concoctions. The weakest performer out of the four was definitely the crab but it didn't affect the quality of the meal at all.

Service was great - all the bartenders and wait staff were friendly and welcoming.

If anyone ever asks me what to do when visiting Boston, Neptune Oysters will be high on that list.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
This place was GREAT! 

My fiancé and I had to wait about 1 and a half hour but it was well worth it wait!

They quoted us 2 hours but we went back at the 1 hour mark and they sat us at the bar. 

The service was great and the oysters were VERY good! 

Hats off to the oyster shucker! 

The lobster with out the butter didn't really have much flavor, given some lobster has that delicious sweet yummyness.

Thank you guys!
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
When I think of the perfect lobster roll, I think Neptune

While the wait is notoriously long, you can put your name on the list and go have a drink at a bar down the street (or get in line at Modern pastry for a pre-dinner snack).

ORDER: 
+ The hot lobster roll -  hate a mayo-based lobster roll that overpowers the delicate flavors of lobster. If I'm eating lobster, I want to taste it in all it's glory. And the hot buttered lobster roll at Neptune is just that.
+ Buttermilk Johnnycake = cornbread meets buttermilk pancake soaking in honey butter (!) and topped with smoked trout and caviar, in a bizarre sweet + salty combination that might be my favorite thing on the menu.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: I get it...  you are a popular very small place!  I was a party of one, and the hostess was so unaccommodating she practically shooed me out the door.  No bueno!  I do still want to check the place out because I hear really good things, and the popularity speaks volume, but I am not going out of my way next time I am in Boston.  All the best!
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
This review is based solely on the service. Arrived on a busy Friday night and understanding that there is a list you need to put your name on to get a seat in a highly sought after restaurant-I get it. I also get that there is a point where the restaurant cannot take any more names for the night.

What I don't get is the complete lack of organization and basic customer service by the staff. I walked in waited 5 minutes, couldn't identify who was taking names. I went to the server behind the counter and asked who we put our name in with? I get a shrug and she then states she doesn't know where she is and she is not sure they are taking anymore names-busy night, got it. After waiting another 10 plus minutes, not seeing anyone other than servers, I ask one of them (had to politely ask excuse me several times before I could get them to look up) where I was  weren't taking any more names...

I get a popular restaurant on a busy Friday night is full... I do not get why a place can't simply have a sign indicating they aren't taking anymore names tonight and not putting their staff and customers in a spot where one cant deliver customer service and the other can't get basic information.

Maybe small places that are in such high demand don't feel like they need to have basic customer service as people will just flock there anyway based on reviews on Yelp? I ended up with an excellent experience down the street at Union Oyster where they had a simple system in place for names and a staff that seemed genuinely interested in providing good service.

Maybe the food at Neptune is better than Union but I know for sure the service isn't and I dine based on food, service, experience.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: Undoubtably some of the best seafood I've ever had. My girlfriend and I split 10 or so oysters and a giant Mackerel. Worth every penny!
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
Wow. I am glad I did not miss out on this experience while I was visiting Boston. 
Around the Freedom Trial, not too far from Paul Revere's statue is this little restaurant tucked away. The wait might be long, but it is very much worth it, and there's plenty around to visit and sight see, weather it's the Little Italy neighborhood, or the park. Our wait was about an hour. 
We did a late lunch here, and we didn't want to spoil our appetites for the NYE dinner we had later that night, so me and my girlfriend just got the Lobster Roll. They prepare it two ways; cold with mayo, or hot with butter. We both opted for the hot one, and DAMN they were good. So succulent and buttery, the lobster was perfect. The roll it came on was perfect too, toasted but just enough that the bread was still fluffy (I don't know if that's the right word, but it wasn't stiff). 
Highly recommend for anyone visiting the area.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
Overpriced and overrated. Be warned before you go here. This place is tiny. You'll be sitting literally right next to a complete stranger and having to share a table with them. On to the food and service.

Our waitress, the one with the neck tattoos was very rude and her service was bad. We asked for her to take some bread off our table and she refused. 

Clam chowder was very watery. Overpriced. Didn't even finish it. Ordered the anchovy cocktail and it tasted like it came out of a jar with vinegar. Didn't even order alcohol and price of the bill was over $100 for 2 appetizers and 2 entrees.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: I have to admit, Neptune Oyster was definitely wonderful. Place is great. My friend ordered East Coast, that I tried and also loved. It was so flavourful. The team was very welcoming and service is terrific. We loved Neptune Oyster.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
I went in with high expectations (I've witnessed the long waiting lines when walking past this place before) and those expectations were stepped on, slapped in the face and beaten to a pulp.  Neptune Oyster is the greatest restaurant that I have eaten at.  Reagan could have given the Russians a lobster roll from this place and the Cold War would have been over in one delectable bite!

We arrived about 25 minutes prior to it opening and luckily were about 4 people away from NOT making the first wave.  We sat at the bar (I recommend you do the same) and enjoyed the hell out of our meal.  The lobster roll was delicious, but who knew that the bread used for that roll would be so amazing?  The fries were impressive too.  We also had the Triton Plateau; an amazing collection of crab and lobster salad, muscles, clams and oysters.  All of the items were fresh and fantastically flavorful.

N.O. has an extensive wine list and draught beer to boot.  Yes, this place is expensive, but seafood typically is and it's certainly worth setting aside some vacation money to treat yourself to the best seafood in Boston (and possibly the world!)

**Tip 1**  Try to get to N.O. 30 minutes before it opens.  Yes, you can always wait for 2 hours for dinner, but stuffing your gullet at lunch allows you the rest of the day to walk around Boston, to burn off some of that buttered lobster

**Tip 2**  I think waiting in line sucks.  Vitos is right across the street.  Have your friend/partner hold your spot in line and grab a quick beer or shot at VItos and then get back in line and let your friend do the same!
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: Amazing!  I went to this place on a whim and am so happy.  It really exceeded expectations and I would recommend to anyone in the area...10/10.

text:
This place is just as good as all the Yelp reviewers said. When I knew I was going to visit Boston, I knew this was a place I had to try. I came on an off time around 2pm and was able to get seated almost immediately. Even if you wait, there are a lot of shops and bakeries nearby that you can explore. 

I went for the hot lobster roll with the salad. Both were delicious and so filling! I can't imagine eating the entire lobster roll with the fries as they give a lot of fries, but the salad was the perfect side to the rich lobster roll. They do not skimp on the lobster meat. The sandwich was overflowing with it and I had some meat spill out, which I of course ate. It is the best lobster I have ever had. 

Definitely believe the hype and try this place if you're in town.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text: Excellent food! Recommend the lobster roll. Plan ahead as they are known for long wait times. Recommend checking in at least one hour before, and then grab a drink or appetizer next door while you wait.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
This was a major change. 
My usual bring the bratty "GIMMIE SEAFOOD I'M IN BOSTON! WHINE WHINE LOBSTER ROLL. C'MON LET ME GET SOME CHOW-DA IN A BREAD BOWL" out of town guests place has always been Union Oyster House or some dingy place like No Name Restaurant/Summer Shack.. or pasta seafood places like The Daily Catch. Those places aren't bad.. they just don't do it for me personally. In fact.. I don;t really hear running excitement of the mouth from the tourists either. They just turn silent and kind of let me take them to neighborhood hole in wall's after that.. which is good for me.. but sort of saddening.

Neptune Oysters gon' dit it and killed it... in a living sense way.

I've got to tell you.. Yelp did a good job placing this as one of the top Seafood in Boston places. I've also got to tell you how pissed off I was when we sat in this tiny place and looked at the prices. I felt uncomfortable for bringing two other people with me here.. but blah blah blah..
as soon as we started eating and the glasses of wine followed..it was all monopoly money and Rich Millionaire was back in business. The mood in there made me feel like cash too. Jazz, that white tile against the dim yellow brown-ish sexy lighting in large leather booth night time clean 40's diner ---oh baby.

Liked the easy to order check off oyster list with simple descriptions.  
I recommend going hobo style and splitting half's of the oyster burger and HOT lobster roll's with another.. try both. SOOOOOOO GOOOOODDDD.
So stuffed. So going back with every single one of the losers who come to visit.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
Everything I dreamed of and more!

This was our first stop in Boston, but when we arrived there was a 2 hour wait time. We put our names down and went to Bricco to kill some time. We received a call within 1.5 hours from Neptune. NOTE: You have 10mins to make it back to the restaurant or they will give up your seat!

Ordered:
x Spanish Octopus - this was probably one of the best octopus I've ever had. It was so tender and juicy. All the ingredients complimented each other so well. My boyfie's sister had octopus for the first time here and really liked it! Do not be scared to try octopus here!!! It's SOOOOO GOOOD!! 
x Clam Chowder - great clam chowder. Little to no heavy cream so it was lighter than what I'm used to. Generous amounts of clam :)
x Hot Lobster Roll - WOW, such good lobster on this roll. I think I may like the lobster at Jame Hook better, but this was SOOO good because it was bathed it butter. I didn't get to try the bread part because I was so full, but the lobster portion was very, very good. Get the hot one, not cold!
x Variety of oysters - Tried some medium oysters and small oyster. Obviously, enjoyed the small ones better, but all were super good and fresh. No fishiness at Neptune :)

This place is worth the hype IMO. Fresh seafood and a great variety to choose from. If I'm ever back, I will definitely try the ciopinno.
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
This is our first time visiting Boston.  Touring little Italy was on my go to places.  We wanted to have lunch here. There was a short line and as I approached the host, they would take down your name and number and call you whwn your table is about ready.  I really appreciated this system because we didn't have to line up outside and wait for 2 hrs..which is when we were told we would get served.   2 hrs of wait....it was okay. While waiting for our call, we toured the area.

Fast forward 2 hrs later, we got to be seated and I knew already what I wanted! We had to have their fresh oysters, the lobster roll and local beer. Then, we added mussels.  

Since we aren't locals, we had to try their local oysters. We got to try 4 varieties. Ask your server for suggestions if you want local ones which we did.  They were all delicious and superbly fresh!  Next, we got the lobster roll with salad. You can have it with fries too if you prefer.  The lobster roll is amazing! Fresh, sweet and juicy. Cooked perfectly.  We also ordered the mussels with spicy chorizo which gave the dish a nice kick to it.  It comes with grilled bread to dip into the flavorful broth.  Simply heaven! I was so happy like a little kid enjoying this seafood treat while on vacation. Everything we ate was a perfect match with the beer we drank.

I am glad that 2 hours of wait time didn't steer me from not trying out this place.  Our server was also superb! Definitely worth it!
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
Adding a review to this place is like tossing a penny in fountain and hoping it be noticed. SO! I offer this review as a gratuity. 
  A thank you to our hostess who said "it's going to be an hour, but give me your cell and we will give you a call five minutes out" We got our call while nibbling dessert at Mikes.
   A thank you to our server, who had the answers for every question and more so, said 'just let me take care of it', and he did.
   A thank you to our Swedish table mates, a joy to share love of seafood. 
  And a thank you to the kitchen, it must be hard in that small space but you deliver awesomeness. 
  Finally a Thank you Neptune's and while we come for the creative fresh seafood, and enjoyed it! Your fries BTW totally ROCK! 

P.S Please ask for malt vinegar for the fries"
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster

text:
GO TO ATLANTIC FISH CO INSTEAD! 

This place was beyond disappointing! Trust me, you're not missing out on anything by skipping this place. My significant other and I waited OVER AN HOUR for a seat only to be told that we weren't on the waitlist and then after further research discovered we were on the "old list" and supposedly contacted with no answer. Absolutely ridiculous and incompetent service. A wrinkled up piece of paper was obviously not a sophisticated enough system for the hostess to keep track of the waitlist and actually contact the appropriate numbers. 

Upon review, the phone number was correct, she just never bothered to actually contact us as promised. We met several people outside complaining about similar experiences. I'd rather be at Pearl Oyster bar in New York than this knockoff. At least when I wait an hour there, I know I'll actually be seated and enjoy an amazing clam chowder and lobster roll. 

After being told we would be seated next, we waited outside again for another twenty minutes and realized this hostess was obviously not going to seat us unless we waited inside where there was no way for her to avoid us. Amazingly, we were then called.

We were finally seated in the middle of an empty six person table and served water... only to be asked to MOVE a few minutes later. At this point the service was laughable and we had put up with such incompetence we figured the food must be their saving grace. We were wrong. 

We were served a bowl of milk as the clam chowder, shots of overpowering salty brine as oysters, and a basic mediocre lobster roll with butter. The arugula salad was the best thing they served. 

I have to mention that our waitress was actually lovely and accommodating, but there's nothing she could say or do that would redeem the unpleasant experience we had. NOT WORTH THE HYPE! Would NOT recommend. If you want delicious seafood and a perfect bowl of clam chowder, go to Atlantic Fish Co. instead!!
categories: Arabian, Thai, American (Traditional), Live/Raw Food, Bars, Soup, Nightlife, Seafood, Restaurants
name: Neptune Oyster
